good length outside off, tried to loft over the off side, gets a thick inside edge onto pad, and it rolls into the off side for one

driven magnificently wide of mid off! 117kph slower ball floated up outside off, he picked it, held his shape, and eased his hands through it, it was hit in the air but right in the gap between cover and mid off and flew to the rope
angled down leg and he tucks this with the angle down to fine leg
144kph, he defends a good length and pushes this to cover-point and they pinch a tight one, there is a shy from Krunal at the non-strikers but he was home
full on middle, and comfortably nudged off his pads to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
back of a length on off, and Finch works it off the back foot to the leg side. Quick single
full outside off, and Finch goes down on one knee to meet this ball. Thumps it over the non-striker and the ball soars over the fielder at long on as well!

good length on middle, and worked off his pads to the leg side. Nobody's there in the infield so both keeper and bowler go running after it. With no one manning the stumps, Finch has no trouble coming back for the second run
short of a length, outside off, Finch looks to flick it to leg. Is beaten on the outside edge
sets himself up outside leg stump to drill the tossed up delivery on off stump, but finds mid-off
stays leg side and cuts the flatter ball off middle and leg. Can't beat point
round the wicket, a wide yorker outside off, calmly steered down to third man

it's all going badly wrong. Finds deep midwicket where it's taken, is it another no-ball for height?! They are checking it...this will be called again, over waist height. Wheeler is out of the attack after those two full tosses
that's costly! A huge full toss, takes a big top edge as Finch swings across the line and it flies down to fine leg
oh dear, a full toss wide outside off, a free swing for Finch and he gets a thick edge past a diving wicketkeeper
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket...good over for New Zealand
driven down the ground to long-on
beaten first ball, trying to angle a length delivery down to third man...there is a huge appeal for caught behind by Southee. Seifert less excited. No review
wide down the leg side again. Short of a length and headed down. Bowled at 136ks
short of a length, drops it towards midwicket for one
Finch manhandles Pandya. Down the wicket and cuts him in front of square for a flat six. Short square boundary at play
length ball, on off, goes back to cut it in front of deep cover again, but this time the batsmen nearly run into each other, which means they get just the one
cut in front of deep cover for two
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, but he has defended it well
Finch makes room and sends a length ball over mid-off for four. Timed perfectly
short of a length, slower ball, punched to mid-on for one
lovely shot by Finch, Boult came round the wicket, was angling into the pads just a touch and it was flicked past short fine leg
short of a length, not much room, punched to point
that's just a nudge down the ground, full outside off and help over long-on with barely any fuss...a lot happened in that over
excellent placement, back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man...the fielder was inside the circle
length ball outside off, and the delivery stays slightly low. Takes Finch by surprise as he check punches off the back foot. Mistimed to mid on
full on off, and Finch blocks it with soft hands. Plays it to short cover and calls early for the single. He'll keep strike

back of a length outside off, but angling into Finch. He tries to whip it to the leg-side, but the ball hits the top of his pads and races away to the third-man boundary. The bowler wouldn't mind that, despite the free runs
back of a length outside off, and Finch backs away to the leg side to free his arms. Stands tall and thumps this with the flat bat over mid off. Muscled, really

the umpire didn't get to watch the previous delivery so Finch gives him an action replay sans the inside edge. He moves well across the stumps to try to sweep an offbreak, and is beaten again. Pitches within, straightens to hit middle. Dead plumb. Not so sure about the replay that is showing it pitched outside leg. That shake right at the last moment makes it look not right

not given out because Ashwin came in the way. This looks pretty straight as Finch is beaten on the big sweep, but the umpire says I can't give this because you are in my way. Turns out Finch has got a bottom edge
on a length, on the pads, worked to deep square leg
full outside off, and he holes out! Spinning away from Finch, but he looks to clear long on. Off the bat's toe end, and taken at long on. Australia at 31/3
stays back to a wide length ball, gets a single to deep cover
not the best timing but good placement. Makes room to slug this length ball in the air but wide of long-off
short of a length, on off, punched to point
that's the match! Finished, aptly, with another six...a full toss is drilled way back into the crowd at long-on
a slower short ball, allows it to loop through to the keeper and gets the wide call
goes full, driven in the air into the leg side, lands between long-on and deep midwicket
beaten this time as he tries to ramp a short ball to third man
paddles another short delivery down to fine leg
cheeky! But doesn't come off. Full on off, and Finch tries to ramp it over the keeper's head. Misses out
down the wicket, works a length ball wide of mid-on for a single
wide on the crease again, Finch looks to play him to leg, but has his inside edge beaten. Not getting used to the pace of Bumrah
appeal for lbw but this is pitched outside leg and beats Finch's attempt to work it to leg
Finch looks to pull, but the ball is not short enough, and hits him on the thigh pad
short of a length, on the pads, some swing back in, hits him on the pad as he looks to work it across the line
a whistling bouncer, goes through the batsman and the keeper too! They jog the single as Buttler turns to collect
on the pads, nudged firmly to the leg side
tapped to the leg side, and another single is the upshot
makes room and slices a fat edge through third man! Any boundary will do
a thumping drive into the covers, Jordan fumbles and the batsmen cross
bouncer, that's brisk and well-directed. Finch swings into the pull but can't make contact
well bowled, an outswinging yorker, jammed down late, and that's a fine over
slog sweep across the line fetches the first wicket. Samuels persists with flighting it and invites Finch to go for the heave over the leg side. Misses completely and has his off stump pegged back
slow on middle, Finch waits for it and plays with soft hands and an angled bat. The single though does not present itself

and again, this time in front of point. Australia take the first round against spin! Badree hasn't cooked up a counter to Finch moving leg side and offers a quicker ball on middle. Finch slaps it away off the back foot
flatter ball on middle and leg, Finch makes room and cuts him behind point. Gorgeous stroke

this sails over long-off! They've definitely made a gameplan for Badree and it seems it's already beginning to bear fruit. Tossed up on middle and leg, but Finch was waiting outside leg and swung cleanly
Finch makes room and chips a flat ball from outside leg over mid-off
length ball, angling in towards top, pushed to the right of mid-off for one
fired in, moves from leg to off, not sure if it is a carrom ball. Punched to mid-off
well bowled by Ashwin. Slows it down with Finch making room. His chip shot goes towards vacant long-off, Jadeja from long-on can't quite make it
short of a length, wide on the crease, seam movement in, beats the inside edge, goes through to Dhoni. Good start from Bumrah
big big appeal Short of a length, from wide on the crease, Finch plays across the line is beaten, but is hit on the top of the pad
tossed up, a low full toss, eased down to wide long-on, that's a fine over to open his spell
cracked back down the pitch, on the back foot
back of a length, a slower legbreak, and Finch can't pierce the field this time. 47mph ... barely enough legs to reach the other end
decent line from Abbott, 137kph, blocked back to the bowler
a low full toss, and pinged behind square with excellent timing. Jordan can't cut that off, and Finch signs off the Powerplay in some style
round the wicket, Finch slaps a cut out to cover. Finch has only faced ten deliveries in the Powerplay, which isn't ideal
well bowled, a sharp bouncer, into the body as Finch gave himself room. At 86mph. Good wheels
short, slow, picked. Boshed through the covers! On the up and ferociously timed
short of a length, slower, punched away to deep square leg
short of a length, on off, punched away to extra cover

and Finch has got stuck into Ashwin. This is just a touch too full, allowing Finch the confidence to go ahead with the shot over the off side even though he has backed away a long way. Finally he makes a sweet connection too. Six over wide mid-off
swiped across the line for couple wide of long-on
this time he doesn't back away, but Ashwin keeps firing down leg. Goes for a wide. Well done by Dhoni with the collection
Finch is backing away, Ashwin is following him, and this time Finch gets all of it and sends it flying over cover for four
back of a length on the fourth-stump line outside off. Finch rides the bounce and punches to cover
moves on to 98! Full on leg, but Finch shuffles across to the leg side. Lifts it over long off thereafter. Too easy for the man
full outside off, and spinning slightly away. Finch frees his arms, and crunches a square drive to the fielder in the deep
tapped to point as this is length on middle
full and targeting leg stump, Finch is stuck on the back foot and goes for the cut. Misses
makes room outside leg and slashes. Gets a thick outside edge that was in the vicinity of short third man. Gul had to motor back but he doesn't make it and it runs away to the boundary too
it's the one that goes straight on and Finch hasn't picked it. Goes for a slog sweep and misses. Struck on the body
keeps it full outside off, not much footwork as he drives and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
slows it up and flights it on leg stump, Finch reaches forward and defends into the covers for a single
that's trademark Finch, a punchy, lofted straight drive to a pretty good delivery - at 146kph and just back of a length - and it goes a couple of bounces over the rope
goes down the pitch and across the pitch, Abbott is back of a length and Finch pulls into the leg side without any timing
this time he clears the boundary! Takes this delivery, which is full outside off, over wide mid-on as the bottom hand comes into play and the bat face closes. Good connection
back of a length, Finch adjusts and taps into the covers
short at the body, he pulls sweetly off his hip but Tahir does well at short fine-leg to cut off what would have been a certain boundary
flicked away from outside off behind square on the leg side
driven on the up to cover
good comeback, a yorker, dug out back to the bowler
low full toss on leg stump, swept well past the short fine leg fielder. Easy boundary
sees the batsman making room very early and fires it full and wide outside off. Finch wouldn't have reached it had he tried
fired in on leg stump, Finch looks for a flick but is slow on the shot
played back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, Finch makes room and tries to flay it through the covers. Doesn't connect. Quite close to that inside edge
lovely bowling this. Slowed his pace and cramped the batsman on off stump. Not enough turn to envisage that back cut
flighted on off stump, he stays leg side of it and lofts towards the extra cover boundary. Long-off runs around to keep it to one
looking for a gap here, nicely fielded at covers
full toss on off stump, lofted and goes on the bounce to long-off
pushed gently with a straight bat, fielded by the mid off
bit of turn as this is pitched on a good length. Finch cuts it from leg stump to the man in the deep
smashed it hard, but straight to the fielder at mid off
straight delivery, batsman missed it completely, went into the keeper's gloves
short delivery, nicked it high in the air, Shaiman Anwar took an easy catch, Australia lost it's first wicket

another doosra and I cannot understand how that has missed off stump! Tentative push from Finch, who had not picked it and is lucky to survive as the ball bounces right over the off bail and thuds into the keeper's gloves and promptly falls out. There was an outside edge too Ajmal throws a forlorn look back as Pakistan drop a crucial catch
shortish on and around off stump, cuts away to deep third man
clears his front leg and punts this length ball down the ground for a single
back of a length outside off, Finch stands tall and punches to the left of mid-off
round the wicket and that's deposited over deep midwicket, Finch goes down on his back knee and slog sweeps with terrific power which overcame the fact it came high off the bat
that's huge again! The spectators at deep midwicket in danger. It's a quicker, shorter, delivery which Finch rocks back to and pulls high and handsome
three in a row! Hold on, folks. This is an awful full toss which Finch dispatches into the stands over deep midwicket again
126kph, he's fired that in on middle and off. Bunted to long-on
flighted on off stump, keeps the batsman to a forward defensive
full on off stump, Finch swings wildy and gets a thick inside edge to long-on
almost a yorker on off stump, Finch stays beside it and creams through towards the extra cover boundary. The man in the deep is quick enough to stop it
full on middle, Finch has smashed this to the deep midwicket boundary. Didn't get it off the middle and the bat turns on impact, but he's found the gap
yorker outside off, Finch tries to dig it out but is beaten
he goes to the off side now and Ajmal fires it even further wide. Goes for a pull and he cannot connect. The keeper does extremely well to get behind it

full and wide outside off stump, and Finch tries to cut it past point. He's overbalanced and falls over, and ends up hitting his bat onto his off stump. The ball's dislodged, and Finch has to go! Take a bow, sir! The highest T20I score ever by a batsman, having broken his own world record.
yorker uproots leg stump! Finch is gone! What a crucial blow! He was struggling to get the big hits and Ajmal fires in just about the perfect ball. Finch swings but cannot get under it
short of a length outside off, pulled straight to mid-on
banged in short again, this time Finch goes squarer with his pull, gets it over midwicket without perfectly timing it...comes off more top edge than middle
fuller, on middle and off, straightens a touch on Finch and squares him up...the ball squirts into the off side
fantastic bowling! That's a textbook yorker, lock the replay of that one away for your career, Kagiso. Dead-eye accurate on middle and off, squeezes under the toe end of Finch's bat. Done for pace.
short ball again but this time Finch nails the pull, smashing it in front of deep backward square leg to bring up the 100 for Australia

short again, pulls again and this Pandya wins the contest! Finch seemed to be hurried for time as he swung across the line and mis-timed it to Dhawan at deep midwicket, that was taken well inside the boundary
tossed up on off stump, pushed into the covers
he's lofted this straight to mid-on. Looked to clear the infield but got this low on the bat, Hafeez moved low to his right to complete the catch.
powered to the square leg boundary. Fires it in on leg stump to make sure he doesn't give the batsman any room, but Finch has swept him away with complete authority
fired in outside off, gets it off the bottom of the bat as he cuts into the covers
almost six, just a few meters short...Duminy fired it miles outside off, Finch did very well to even reach the ball and someone manages to flat-bat it over cover
quick and slung in towards leg stump, he goes for the sweep and gets taken on the pad. A dot ball.

wide outside off again, Finch giving himself room to the leg side but again manages to reach the ball with the toe end of the bat. Gets enough on it to clear mid-off. That might be Duminy done for the day
driven on the up to the cover sweeper...South Africa able to spread the field now
would you believe it! Starts with a filthy full toss outside off which Finch plants straight to deep midwicket. The mood is with Tahir in recent weeks
full and wide outside off, but Finch drags this from outside off to deposit it into the cow corner boundary. He's playing with the bowlers now. First double-hundred partnership in T20I cricket!
full and wide outside off. Finch opens his bat's face and runs it down to deep point. Finch gets to 150!
fullon off, and he goes for the big shot over midwicket. Top edges it, as the ball flies over the keeper for four
short and wide outside off, Finch punches it over deep extra cover, and there's the world record! Highest individual score in T20I cricket! Take a bow
full on leg stump, and Finch is only dealing in boundaries! Gets his front leg out of the way and thumps it over the long-on boundary! A feast for sore eyes
full outside off, and he drills a drive to the outfielder at deep extra cover. Gives short the final ball
full on off, and all Finch can do is drive it straight to long off
short outside off, and Finch flat-bats it past cover to the man in the deep. Comfortable two for Finch. Moves to 170
full outside off, and he lifts this over Maxwell. Falls just short of long on, but Finch manages to get back on strike
flat and full on leg stump, nudged away for a single behind square leg
jumped outside leg and Ajmal looked to dupe him by firing it full and outside off. Throws his bat and it and gets a handy bottom edge that evades the keeper and short third man
this is slightly slower and comes up as full toss on off stump, swiped through to deep midwicket
full on middle and leg, Finch plants his front leg down the pitch and has lofted him wide of long-on. Clean and crisp hitting this
tapped to long-off as this is fired in on a length just outside off.
backs away outside leg, but Masakadza follows him with a quicker delivery. Finch flicks through midwicket
full and drifting into the pads, Finch tries to dab it fine, but he can't make contact with the bat.
good length on leg stump, and Finch backs away to the leg side. Drags the shot to cow corner, but still wants two. Could be trouble, but the throw isn't great. Finch survives
short on middle, and Finch adjusts late to cut it over cover. Manages to chip it over the infield, and there's no one at deep extra cover either
overpitched outside off, and Finch drills this to cover once again. <B>A rare dot ball<b>
yorker on off, and that's an excellent delivery from Mpofu! Finch has no choice but to dig it back to the bowler
low full toss outside off, Finch muscles this down the ground to long on. He'll keep strike
short outside off, and Finch attempts the pull. A rare missed shot from the batsman, as the keeper appeals for caught behind. The umpire isn't interested
length ball outside off, but angling into Finch. He pulls it over the square-leg umpire, and goes to the fielder in the deep on the bounce. Falls just short of the fielder

length ball but wide outside off. Finch has to reach out because of how far it is, but he still manages to flat bat it over the bowler. Looks like it's going for a six, but Chisoro manages to palm the ball back! Excellent effort at long on to stop the boundary

has he got him? Yes. Afridi leaps in celebration, Finch gets a thick inside edge on the way through to Sarfraz. He was looking to punch this away but the ball deviated a long way back in off the seam to cut him into two halves.
steps out and carves him over cover point. Lovely touch, lovely timing. Young man put under pressure immediately
hits the deck hard, gets some extra bounce off the deck, defended into the leg side
makes room to go over the off side, the bowler follows him. Finch bunts this past the bowler as they jog the single.
hops back and punches this into the covers for a quick single
flicks another back of a length delivery from off stump away to deep square leg
whips this length ball on middle towards square leg, looks like there was a thick inside edge.
tries to pull a short and wide delivery - perhaps off pace as well - and gets an inside edge to deep square leg

taken at deep midwicket! It's a long hop from a spinner and it's absolutely smacked away. Problem is it zeroes in on Musakanda on the boundary. The in-form Finch is back in the hut and the chase is only two overs old. How will Australia respond?
full just outside off, and Finch shuffles across to work this to the leg side. There's his hundred!
back of a length outside off, but spinning into Finch. Too short for the tall man, and he backs away and pulls it to the wide long-on boundary. Making things look too easy
he's just toying with the Zimbabwe bowlers. Full outside off, and Finch goes down on one knee to attempt another big shot. Mistimes it to long on though
toe ends it over long off! That's how strong Aaron Finch is. Overpitched outside off, and Finch loses his balance as he tries to lift it over the bowler. Somehow manages to earn six runs
good length outside off, and Finch shuffles across to the off side to cut. Mistimes it to cover
good length outside off, and Finch has all the time to drag this pull to the leg side. The bowler tried to bowl this from the back of his hand, but Finch wasn't troubled at all. One-bounce four
there's the record! Full toss on off, and that's been smacked into the cow corner boundary! Too easy for Finch. In the slot and punished
good length on middle, and Finch waits for the ball to come to him. Rolls his wrists over this delivery and places this shot between short fine leg and square leg
short on middle, and once again Finch dispatches this over short fine leg. Finch just walked across to the off side to get inside the line of the ball before depositing it into the boundary
full outside off, and Finch leans into the cover drive. Lifts it over the infield, but Burl drops it in the deep! Tough chance, and he was diving forward, but the ball popped out of his hand
back to back sixes to win it! Width outside off, carved high over third man...Finch finishes it on his home ground
that's a monster down the ground...gets right underneath a full delivery and swings it into the first tier. That would do well on the golf course
full outside off, heaved through the leg side wide of mid-on...nowhere nearly cleanly timed, but's a solid thick inside edge which runs away
short again, down the leg side, this time Finch catches it up with it and sends it very fine...actually glove rather than bat
short of a length, angled into the pads, goes for a pull but it takes the thigh pad
tries to glance the ball, sliding down leg, to the boundary but he can't touch it
quicker ball to end the over. Length ball on middle, and spinning into Finch's body. Misses out on the leg-side flick
straighter and more classier. One bounce to the long-off boundary. This was right in the slot, Finch got to the pitch and belted this away.
clean strike, one bounce over long-off. Stood his ground and lofted this length ball through the line

short of a length outside off, Finch drags it to wide long-on, where Kohli fumbles. Maxwell pounces on the mistake and races back for the second. Kohli's throw is good but Maxwell is safe by the time Pandya breaks the stumps
Finch tries to pull again but fails to make contact
drags the length down as he sees the batsman charging him. Dabbed to short fine leg
full toss outside off, Finch drags it to midwicket on the circle
full and outside off, Finch essays a charming cover drive. Lovely timing but he hasn't placed it well. Straight to the fielder
shortish delivery on off stump, Finch makes room, waits for it and slaps it to the man at cover again

he is hitting them like a dream but this time he has smacked the bowler on the shin. That's going to form a big purple bruise later, but for now Gul has stopped a certain boundary. Full and straight and a thumping straight drive
fired in on leg stump and Finch is slow on the flick. Strikes him on the pads
leading edge into the covers. Doosra dupes Finch, who was looking for a tame flick towards midwicket
he has nailed this! This was tossed up on off stump and Finch gets down on one-knee and slog sweeps him over midwicket. Don't need to place the ball when you hit it out of the park
cut against the turn and what makes this even better was it was flatter, quicker and it was honing on leg stump. Finch was waiting on it and slaps behind point.
goes straight on with the arm as Finch pokes at it with an open face. Single to short third
jumps outside leg and cuts the length ball from the stumps. Sweeper comes in handy
short and just outside off, Finch backs away and slaps to point
flat and length on middle, Finch follows his partner's example and sweeps him over the square leg boundary. Concern on the face of Kamran behind the stumps
makes a bit of room outside off and he slaps it in front of point for a quick single
works this off his hip towards the man coming in from deep square, lazy fielding, alert running
100 kph, fired in just outside off. Finch looks for a swipe through midwicket but he's a little late on it

top edged sweep caught at short fine! Krunal hangs on to this simple chance! This was a leg break on leg stump, he tries to sweep, a bit of extra bounce catches the top edge, it balloons to short fine and straight to Krunal, no chance he could drop that
stands tall and punches back, the bowler does well to put his right hand out on the followthrough to stop that
stands tall and punches this length delivery on the up to point
tries to sweep hit on the pad, huge appeal, not out. It was outside the line, not much turn
floated up, leg break, he skips down to the pinch and whips with the turn to deep midwicket
dropped at long on! Toss up outside off, he launches this high and gets under it, it goes miles up, Rohit camps under it and drops it. He dropped with his hands below his waist
shorter on middle and leg, 96kph, he's back and tucking this through square leg
pushed into the gap between cover and point

steps out but the bowler shortens his length and gets it to nip back. The ball deflects off the body towards the man coming in from third man. Excellent running to pinch two leg byes. Lazy effort from Usman Khan Shinwari
pushed through on a length down the leg side and misses with the flick
goes back and punches into the off side
flighted on and around off stump as he gets forward and picks up a single through the covers
backs away, it's darted into leg, but short enough, he cuts past point and it beats the man at deep cover running around!
he was waiting abound four feet outside leg stump and pounds this flatter delivery that follows him through to deep midwicket
flighted outside off and this is slog swept to the man on the boundary in front of square
this is spinning down leg, Pant can't glove it and they run another extra
short of a length again and the ball isn't coming on to the bat, Finch pulls but gets beaten on the bottom edge
there's the first six! Full on middle, and Finch takes a big stride forward to meet the ball on the full. Proper follow through of the bat as he tonks an on-drive over the wide long-on boundary
makes room outside leg and carves straight to cover
length ball outside off, and spinning into Finch. He makes some room and mistimes the cut to point
this was slightly more ungainly (less gainly?), as Finch makes room and swings wildly at a short ball that bounces over the stumps
short and at the batsman, pulled flat through midwicket, there's a fielder out there now
full, attempted yorker, nearly catches Finch out, he swipes an inside edge to deep square leg
good length on the stumps, blocked watchfully
pulled, not out of the middle, straight to midwicket but dropped by Jordan! Maybe I spoke too soon... It flew fairly quickly, such is Finch's power, but should have been taken, around head height
opens the face and runs a single to short third man
Jordan tries the chin music on Finch, whose swats it away at chest height, loopy pull shot but it bounces away to the rope
starts well, length ball on off stump, tapped into the off side
on leg stump, worked through square leg for a couple more
good pace, around off stump, Finch has a big old ballyhoo and fails to connect
six more, into the crowd at long-on! Overptiched from Stokes and he's taken downtown by the little big man again, crrrrrrrrrrrrunched back over his head
shortens his length wisely, outside off, guides the ball straight to short third man

here goes Finch again - he loves playing against England - carting a slightly fill ball out towards wide long-on, Hales gets round to it but appeared uncertain where the boundary was and compounds his drop but sending it beyond the rope. Tough but takeable
on the stumps, played respectfully back this time

clubbed over deep backward square, that's a monstrous flick from Finch, the first six of the innings! He came forward out of the crease, made the delivery a half-volley on his pads, but the nonchalance with which he launched the ball over the rope was astounding
punches a length ball down the ground, just one as mid-on and mid-off converge
Finch backs away and Jordan follows him, sends a length ball zipping through past a swing and a miss - decent first over from Jordan
length ball, nips back a touch and rattles into the pads, might have been some bat involved, height an issue too
short, pulled, four more, not a clean strike but enough bat backward of square
gets the line back on off stump and Finch just blocks
another roundarm delivery. This is shortish, quick and outside off, Finch makes room, and then leaves it alone. Perhaps not short enough to be cutting
low full toss, driven hard to long-off for one
full, middle and leg, bunted into the leg side for a two. Jadeja is quick and surprises them a little, but the batsmen make it eventually
tries the big drive down the ground, gets a thick inside edge to long-on
forward on off stump and pressed into the covers
another dot ball, blocked into the covers
tight off stump line and blocked again

full delivery, Finch tries to play to leg and it hurries onto him slightly, struck on the pad and given out lbw! Seemed to strike him relatively high on the pad, but, no, knee roll and it was pretty straight too so a fair call on first look. I think Finch might have been forward, caught on the crease somewhat. But Hawk Eye has the ball going over the top so the batsman a little unlucky
no pace, no room, Finch cuts this from in front of the stumps, but gets no timing. Finds the man at point
on the stumps, worked back past the bowler, mid-on moves across to his left
good length, outside the line and Finch guides it into the covers
short of a length, middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket for one
on a length, on off, pushed to point
full just outside off, and too close for Finch to cut. He tries the shot anyway, and should be lucky that the ball didn't take the bat's outside edge
back of a length wide of off, he opens the face and works it wide of third man for a couple
nicely off the mark, short of a length outside off, Finch gets on his toes and drives backward of square to third man
full and straight, hint of inswing, driven to cover
142kph, beats him. Beaten for pace. Feet were anchored, he pushed at it and it zipped past the edge
long half volley and he caresses a square drive through point. Finch had no trouble here. Just placed the gift through the gap
142kph, good length, top of off, he is forced to defend back to the bowler
139kph, back of a length, middle and off, he punches off the back foot but drags it to mid on
short and fractionally wide, Finch cuts with authority, placing it through point. He got on top of the bounce and it raced through the infield
135kph, good length, shaping back into the thigh pad, he can't whip it away
back of a length, climbing outside off, and it comes off the stickers as he defends. He was surprised at 137kph
134kph, swinging down the leg side. A long way down, Rizwan dives to take it
135kph, good length, but swinging down the leg side again
147kph, very full on off, Finch is hanging back, left leg out of the way, he mistimes a drive to mid off
143kph, full on off, he swings hard trying to hit down the ground, gets a thick inside edge that runs behind square
hooked for six off the top edge. 143kph, bouncer right at the helmet, but fine leg is up, Finch swivelled and was hurried but the top edge goes all the way
short and wide and cracked forward of point! It was in the air at a catchable height but wide of the man. Just a bad ball and met with a flashing blade
140kph, chest high short ball, he ropes a pull at speed flat but short of the deep square on the fence
back of a length outside off, he's back and punching this to wide mid off and running sharply for an easy one
length ball angling in, and Finch tries to tickle this fine. Takes a feather off his body, and runs past Sarfraz to the fine-leg boundary

is that run-out? Straight drive, ricochets into the non-striker's stumps. Did Imad get his fingertips to it? Yes for the fingertips, but Short's bat is in the air despite it being over the line! Australia 11 for 1
full on leg stump, and tickled fine to short fine leg. They jog across for one
a yorker outside off, Finch plays over the top of it
poor delivery, short outside off, a beautifully timed square drive through point
tightens the line to off stump, pushed to the covers
a touch of shape on this one, Finch stays on leg stump and pushes a good-length delivery into the covers
round the wicket, full and straight, driven to mid-off
mistimes a drive into the off side
full and straight, pushed carefully to the on side straight of midwicket
flatter outside off and that's a perfect piece of timing as he threads it through point with a square drive...spoils a good over
back of a length, straight, pushed to cover for a tight single
short of a length outside off, 120kph, angled across and Finch doesn't make contact as he aims to drag a pull
taken at mid-off! Revenge for Irfan. He changed the angle, came round the wicket, was a length ball that Finch tried to carve over the off side and the bat twisted as he sliced across the shot
almost a yorker on middle stump. Wedged away to mid off for a quick run. Off the mark straightaway
full outside off, and he drives away from his body. Finds Babar at mid off this time
full on middle, and skidding into leg. Defended off the front foot, back to the bowler
full outside leg stump, and Finch backs away to slog towards the leg side. Hits his boot, then beats Sarfraz, and finally runs into the third-man boundary
short outside off, sits up nicely and it's square driven through the covers
136kph, full on leg, he drives back to the bowler who misfields and they pinched one

139kph, half volley, he's hanging back but slapped a drive straight of mid off, didn't time it perfectly but beat the man, Wahab has a long chase, he slides to save but as he went over the rope he touched the ball again before jumping back! Four runs
138kph, half volley on off, he hangs back and miscues a punch to mid off
dropped at cover this time! Another shot with power, Finch driving a full delivery, and Oshada Fernando can't hold on to his right
a strangled appeal for lbw as Finch aims to work away a straight delivery
another huge appeal for lbw, this time it's Finch missing a swinging yorker but it's sliding down the leg side
driven off the back foot to cover
round the wicket, stand and deliver from Finch as he hoicks this over wide midwicket
short on off stump, cut to deep cover
full ball outside off, throws his hands through a square drive, places it between cover and backward point
very round-arm action, on the pads, worked to square leg
full, he uses his feet and drives to long-off
dabs this to short third man, more good running
steps back and pushes into the covers
what a stroke! That's a cracker from Finch. A full ball on off stump, it's a perfect lofted off-drive through the line over the rope
142kph, back of a length, tucked to midwicket
a bouncer angled down the leg side, it's sharp at 143kph but called wide
tucked off the pads to short fine leg
full and straight, 141kph, can't beat mid-on as he drives
pulls a pretty full delivery, gets a bottom edge towards short fine leg
back of a length outside off, Finch nicely into position and drives square through the covers. Hauled in just before the rope as three fielders chase it
overpitched, slightly wide and battered over wide long-off for six! Set the base and launched that beyond the boundary
shuffles across and whips a couple through the leg side
length ball in the channel, Finch rocks back to crash a cut shot.. straight to point. That was smoked
too full again from Parnell, crunched hiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiigh into the crowd at long-on! That's the sort of stroke that makes Finch-hitting such a wonderful sight
fullish, 138kph and Finch heaves again, inside-edges on to his front pad, they pinch one
fullish and on the stumps, Finch clubs this to the leg side for a couple
length, this is played a bit more delicately, into a vacant space and they come back for two
cutter from Wiese, rolls the fingers over it, Finch defends

caught down the leg side! A strangle! This is a bonus. Half volley fired down leg, Finch glanced it straight off the face and Perera moves well to take the catch! Easy decision. Finch walks off a bit in shock
nice start, full at middle, pushed firmly to mid-on
back of a length, straight, worked to midwicket
a slower ball on a good length, tucked into midwicket

big appeal first ball! Nips back from a good length, takes Finch on the back leg...a familiar-style of issue for Finch. Caught on the crease with the ball coming back and the review has been called. It has struck him quite high, above the roll on his back leg and he's on his toes. Do we have the tracker this time? Yes we do, and it's umpire's call on hitting
over mid-on! Full at off stump, Finch swings through the line and sends it handsomely down the ground. In the end the over goes for 11
back of a length at off stump, defended to cover
back of a length outside off, driven from the back foot to deep cover
taken at long-on! Finch trying to clear long-on again. It was a full slower ball, 105kph, and Finch couldn't quite get the distance
full length on the stumps, tucked to midwicket

oh, gone, shovelled to backward square leg! Finch knew what he'd done as soon as he hit it, pulling a genuine short ball straight to the fielder. The stump mic picked up his "Oh no!" as South Africa celebrated gleefully. That might change things
tighter line and just blocked coming forward
similar delivery, nudged back up to the bowler
fuller and a full swing of the blade brings four down the ground, beats the dive of mid-on
good length, hint of shape in, he pushes forward and punches to cover
another high full toss at 138kph wide of off, but it does drop under waist high as he misses on the drive
136kph, short and wide and he cuts neatly up and over point! Good shot. Using the pace and going up with the bounce
nearly a run out! Finch pushes a length ball towards mid off and called yes but then yelled "no, no get back get back!". Warner slipped slightly but his dive just beat the throw back
cracking back foot drive! Superb from Finch. Just a length ball, fourth stump line, he hung back and punched it powerfully through cover-point. No need to run
124kph, good length, nipping away a touch, he's squared up as he defends to cover but they pinch a run
138kph, back of a length on off, he's back and mistiming a punch back to the bowler
124kph, back of a length on off, he defends with soft hands to cover and they take an easy one
boom over square leg! 136kph, back of a length, he cleared the left leg and swung it high up and over square and into the crowd! Towering stroke
half-volley leg stump slower ball, 117kph, he clips this beautifully between midwicket and mid on. Lovely timing
tees off over square leg again! Set his feet early, cleared the left leg, got a length ball in the slot and smashed it high over square leg into the crowd again!
over-steps and delivers a 122kph short wide throw down and Finch slaps it over cover-point with ease!
forward just outside off and ran down to third man, they consider a second but it's not on, Hales in quickly off the rope
141kph, good length, angled into the thigh pad, it comes off the thigh and runs to short fine
gets a short one outside off that he dabs in the air but well short of third man
full length at the stumps, forced down to long-on
back foot firm punch wide enough of point for a single
full toss on the stumps, clipped past short long leg, poor ball
very full at the off stumps, played firmly to extra cover who can only fumble
length just outside off, guided to short third man and there's no run available
back and crashed from off stump through point, beats the sweeper to the rope
fuller length and Finch smashes this up and over extra cover, nailed
full length at middle and leg, tucked through square leg, they push for two but it's not on
slower ball outside off, called wide but it was inside the guideline outside off and Finch was simply done in the flight
shorter length, chopped from off stump to short third man
slower ball, forward on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, chopped wide of deep cover, they get back for two and Finch gets fifty
fuller at the stumps, driven back to the bowler off high on the bat
length delivery, worked out to deep-square leg
leg side delivery, Finch tries to slog sweep and misses
full length wide of off stump, Finch had stepped to leg and was well away from it
but this carries to long-on as Finch swung hard at a length ball, aiming at the leg side and didn't get it anywhere near the middle, straight to Hales who took a solid catch
146kph, outswinger outside off, back of a length, he's beaten fending away from his body

on the attack, doesn't get hold of a pull and plops the ball to mid-on! England have got their aggressor, Bresnan winkles him out with a half-tracker, miscalculation from Finch, who tried to pull from outside off, maybe wasn't quite short enough either and spooned to the fielder
pulled over square leg! Cracking shot. Finch at his best. Shoulder high short ball outside off, he was back set up to hammer it, got it out of the screws and cleared the man on the rope easily!
length ball, angling in, dabbed away for a single
mid-on is wide, and Finch loves this length ball. He drives on the up, and between the legs of the non-striker Marsh
short of a length, outside off, hits the bottom half on the punch
short of a length, middle and leg, straightens a touch, beats the inside edge, goes for a leg-bye
short of a length, wide, punched away to square third man for one
full and angling across off, scoops a drive to mid-off
down the wicket, Nehra drags the length back, and Finch gets a single off the soft pull
144kph, angled into leg stump, full, he clips this neatly through square midwicket, the man in the deep is backward of square, they take on the throw for two and beat him
on a length and slanting away outside off, tip and run to mid-on
full and angling into middle and leg, whipped in the air to deep square leg
Finch tees off and launches this full ball angling into his pads into the stands beyond long-on. Such a smooth swing
another arm ball from Nawaz, finishes on the pads of Finch, who, having backed away outside leg, nails another six over long-on to close out the over with back-to-back sixes
back of a length and angling across off stump, Finch stands up tall and elegantly punches through the covers. Australia have already shaved 35 runs off the target
full and angling into middle, forward and played back to Hasan
back of a length and angling away outside off, swish and a miss from Finch. Off-side wide
shortish and slides on outside off, punched through the line to mid-off
cramps him up on the punch, goes to cover
short ball, outside off, Finch has short-armed this wide wide of mid-on for four all along the ground
nice and slow, middle and leg, defended back to Jadeja
short of a length, angling in, worked past short fine leg for one
half-volley outside off, a foot short of being a yorker, muscled away past mid-off, to his left, for four
short and wide, just a touch too quick and he cuts this straight into the ground
slower ball, a touch too full, Finch likes it, holds the shot back to adjust and chips this over mid-on for four
gets the width. Might have sold Nehra the dummy. He backs away early, Nehra pushes this one wide, and then Finch cuts it between short third man and point for four
poor ball by T20 standards. Short of a length, on the pads, and tickled away for four. This is pitched well outside leg
slower short ball, but Finch has played around with the field again. Tucks this around the corner, past short fine leg, for a couple
short of a length, tucked away off the hips, to the right of deep square leg
slower ball, on a length, around off, hits the inside half of his bat
short of a length, hits him high on the bat, but they have stolen a single under their nose
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover-point
it is a cruel game this. Finch makes room, Bumrah bounces him, Finch has been beaten comprehensively, but the top edge goes fine for four. back over the keeper's head
Finch plays around with the field. The fine leg is up in the circle and he moves across to flick a length ball from outside off past that man at short fine leg
slight seam back in from around middle and leg, and they still sneak in a leg-bye even though Nehra has had the better of this delivery
makes room, Jadeja shortens the length, cut in front of deep point for two
Finch backs away outside leg, Shadab darts in a short ball on middle, flaps a pull to long-on's right
back of a length and angling into the hips, worked away between square leg and midwicket for one
back of a length, pitches outside leg, skids off the pitch to catch the thigh. The ball rolls away to the third-man boundary
clipped off the pads to deep square's right
wrong'un to right-hander, spins back in, squeezed away for one
tossed up outside off, right in Finch's swinging arc. He ventures outside leg and clubs a six over long-off

Shadab tosses a legbreak wide outside off, Finch muscles it away in the air against the turn. Asif Ali at long-on makes a mess of it and drops the catch. The ball plinks away to the boundary for four. Sums up Pakistan's day
flat ball on off, and spinning into Finch. He taps it off the front foot to midwicket to get off the mark. Nobody there so the bowler has to go running after it
can't bowl down the leg side when you have fine leg inside the circle. Banged down leg, helped away fine of that fielder. Easy peasy
flat on off once again. Finch rocks back and pushes at it to the fielder at long on. He's content with a single
length ball outside off, and that's been drilled through cover! Stands tall and punches it through the infield. Hits it from right under his eyes. Looking good already!
full just outside off, and Finch chooses to block with soft hands. The ball hits his bat and flies away to backward point
back of a length outside off, and Finch is rather surprised by the lack of bounce. Turns it off his hips to midwicket and calls early for the single. Short wants two, but Finch says no
length ball outside off, but Finch backs away to make some extra room. Flat-bats it over the bowler's head, like a gentle lob over Nyumbu, and the ball races into the long-off boundary
full on middle, but Finch simply steps forward and uses his wrists to whip it over the square-leg umpire. Well timed, not too hard, not too soft
back of a length on middle, and Finch backs away once more. Cuts it inside out past the diving cover fielder for a hat-trick of fours!
full outside off, and flicked away to the vacant midwicket region. Nice, early call for the single from Finch
shorter googly, spins back in, cramps Finch for room, stabbed back to Shadab
short and angling into the body, pulled away to long leg for three. Finch celebrates his fifty
short and spins away outside off, lashed to sweeper again
dug in short and outside off, Finch picks up the length swiftly. He rocks back and launches a pull beyond the square-leg boundary. Cracking hit from Finch
slower offcutter outside off, Finch reaches out for the ball and forces it away to point
short and skidding into the body, cramps the batsman for room, pulls it weakly as the ball pops over midwicket
back of a length and spins away outside off, Finch searches for the googly and plays the legbreak back to Shadab
wrong'un this time, full and spins in outside off, drags it with the turn over midwicket. Slog-swept away, splitting the two men in the deep on leg side
tossed outside off, breaks back in, picks another wrong'un and hoists it with the turn over the long-on boundary like a boss
another short legbreak, forced to the covers
Finch clears long-off now and fetches another six. This is a legbreak, full and spins away outside off, Finch gets under the length and smokes it away
full and holds its line outside off, forward and laced to the covers, where the fielder makes a diving stop to keep it to one
darted in on off, worked away to the leg side for one
Finch steps away outside leg, Nawaz fires it down leg side, the ball bursts out of Sarfraz's gloves
back of a length on middle, backs away and clubs a cut to backward point
clips an arm ball off his pads to square leg
short, wide, cracked to sweeper cover off the back foot
Shadab holds this legbreak back. It dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. Finch has a loose waft at it and is beaten on the outside edge
makes room again, cuts from in front of the stumps, gets a single to deep point
risky run to get off the mark! Finch pushes towards mid-on and takes on Pandya rushing in, he misses at the non-striker's end. He might have just made it even with a direct hit
full toss slips out! It is sprayed way down leg and Rizwan produces some great acrobatics to knock it down
136kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and mistiming a back foot drive wide of mid off
141kph, good length top of off, he's back and pushing it to the gap at cover-point

Rishi Dhawan is well inside the fence. Finch is down the wicket, beaten in the flight, and drop-kicks it towards deep square leg. Dhawan is getting lobbed and he is running back but can't get to the ball
and now Shikhar Dhawan drops one. This has been slog-swept straight into the lap of Shikhar Dhawan at deep midwicket. He has let this drop out of his hands. A real sitter
short, slower outside off, tucked away past short fine leg for two
nearly a run-out. Finch cuts this straight to Jadeja at point, takes off the single, and then gives up because Jadeja has got to this quickly. He fails with the direct hit, though
good length, top of middle, he pushes this to mid on for one
short of a length, outside off, beats him on the cut with a skiddy delivery
full, really full, in the block hole, dug out back to him
full, middle and leg, Finch looks to go to cover, the ball doesn't turn, and goes to long-on off the inside half of the bat
142kph, short outside off, he's back and punching to deep point
141kph, good length, he's back and jabbing a cut to backward point

and that brings it to an end! 50 for Finch, a series win for Australia. This is a blinding performance from the hosts against the world's number one team. They've made them look astonishingly pedestrian, and should do their confidence the world of good before the Test series. There's no sugar-coating this; Pakistan have been humbled here.
driven through the offside
stroked to mid-off
brilliant stop at backward point from Shadab. He's an excellent fielder in that position, one of the best in the world, in truth
attempted pull by Finch, and the inside edge clips it onto his pads. He keeps the strike. Into the 12th over we go now
Finch thought about walloping this, but realised just in time he was getting a free run. 5 away from his half-century
misfield allows the Australian openers to come back for two. Four away from as eries win, each batsman three away from 50
142kph, good length on middle, he pushes this neatly straight of mid on
good length on off, he pushes to mid off, he calls yes but then sends Warner back quickly
fuller outside off, he skips down and crushes a drive straight to long off. That was lasered
141kph, fuller on off, he's back and hanging outside leg, he punches straight to cover
short and wide, he smokes a cut shot and it hits Shadab's wrist on the half volley. That stung. it bounces away for one
low full toss, Finch drives through the air to long-on on the bounce. Right, three to win. Will Warner get his half-century instead, then?
good length, he clears the left leg, and smears it across the line, but he mistimes this to midwicket
Finch backs away, Ashwin follows him, cramps him up, draws a dot
makes room to cut away for a single again
full outside off, and driven with the bat's open face to cover. They aren't taking chances with Shadab. Says no to the single
length ball outside off, and steered to point. Shaheen hits the stumps at the batsman's ends, but the batsman is in
launched over square leg again! This has gone nearly 100m! Chest high short ball outside off, he's camped back and ready to swing hard. Again he flushed it
Finch takes Ashwin on first ball. A big slog sweep that has gone more up than far. Manages to clear deep midwicket by inches
flat, short of a length, punched to cover
Ashwin predicts Finch will back away and fires one down the leg side. Concedes a leg-side wide as Finch stands his ground, and Dhoni concedes the bye
short of a length but not short enough to be pulled as Finch discovers. The mis-hit goes straight to midwicket but bounces three times before reaching the man
Finch backs away this time, gets a bottom edge on the cut, takes a single to short fine leg
swept away from outside off for a single to deep midwicket
flat length ball, Finch looks for the cut, gets a bottom edge as the cut is not on

Yadav has nearly taken a blinder but this will count as a drop in this age. Finch has mis-hit this pull towards deep midwicket. Yadav is running not just to his left but also back. He goes airborne, gets both hands to the ball but ends up parrying it over the rope
goes the other way. Back of a length and turns away outside off, punched through cover
just short of a good length on off, dinked to the right of the keeper

short ball in the corridor, allows it to come on and runs it to third man's left. The fielder there, Rance, makes the ground and puts in a slide. But his knee gets jammed in and he loses his alignment as a result. Parries it into the boundary
full and straight on middle, knocked down to long-on
sliding into the pads, tickled away wide of short fine leg for one
dropped short and wide outside off, Babar reads the length early. He goes deep in the crease and cracks it off the back foot to the right of cover
short of a length just outside off, run down to third man
just short of a good length and outside off, stands tall and punches crisply to long-on
full and floated down leg, wide
full, but not a driveable length, on off, worked to midwicket
really full on off, Babar responds with a front-foot drive to long-on
yorker at middle stump, watches it on and gets the flick in front of deep square
full slower ball on off stump, flicked to midwicket's right
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Allows it to come on and opens the face to run it past short third man
slower ball at leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
short ball, an offcutter at middle stump. He opens up his stance and slaps this wide of midwicket
full on middle stump, driven down to long-on
short at middle, pulled to long-on's right
flighted length-ball, turns in, paddled fine
Holder ventures wide of the crease and angles a short ball into the right-hander, blocked to square leg
just short of a good length on off, stands up tall and whips it away with the wrists to the right of mid-on
Babar rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and helps it down to deep third man for a single
keeps it shortish on off, short-armed away to midwicket
on a length and outside off, run down to third man
half-volley on the pads, Narine gets away, turned straight to deep square leg
slower through the air on middle and leg, this is driven down to long-on
down the track and laced to the covers
legbreak, spins away outside off. The length is short, allowing the batsman to punch a single to long-off
back of a length on off, shuffles across off and neatly clips to deep square leg

Carlos strikes in his first over. No collision between Carlos and Walton this time. Short and wide outside off, Babar throws his hands at the ball, flashes and sends an outside edge flying to the right of the keeper. Watling springs to his right and completes a two-handed catch
some extra bounce, shortish delivery outside off, just bunted to cover
starts with a slower ball on off, defended into the covers
full on middle and leg, 134 kph, nudged away to midwicket. Bad timing allows them the run
some flight outside off, 84 kph, driven to long-off
shortish and a tad wide outside off, pulled to long-on from the back foot
90 kph, quick and wide, slashed to deep point
91 kph, comes down and drives to deep cover. Very tidy bowling

fantastic stuff from Santner, flat on middle and leg, worked to midwicket. Santner runs after it, picks up and throws to the bowler's end, where Southee takes off the bails, but Hasan has just made it. Reckon Azam was in worse trouble, but that's good quite from Santner
short at the body, hangs back and clips a single to the square-leg region
Narine errs short and wide outside off, Babar latches onto it, cutting it between short third man and point
short on middle, no turn, stands tall and punches to mid-on
length-ball offbreak, inside-edged onto the pad
excellent line, full around off, defended back
shorter on off, guided behind point off the back foot for one
tossed up on middle, Babar now shimmies out and pushes a single down to long-on
just short of a good length and angled in on off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
short of a length and Williams gets it to skid off the surface and ping the front thigh. Babar plays across the line. This wasn't threatening the stumps, though
wide of the crease, angled in, Williams hits the splice of the bat. Blocked to midwicket
Williams goes wide of the crease again, this one holds its line against the angle. Back of a length and outside off, punched on the up to cover
back of a length on off, Babar does now have any room to work with. He drops the ball in front of point and decides  against the single rather belatedly
just short of a good length on off, punched up to mid-on off the back foot
yes, he starts with a maiden. This is gold. Just short of a good length on off, the ball isn't coming onto the bat. Babar aims a pull and ends up splicing the ball to mid-on
chest-high short ball on middle, but Holder does not have enough pace to test the batsman. Babar picks it up and pulls it to the right of deep square leg. First runs for Babar after eight balls
errant leg-side ball, Babar attempts a pull, flicks the thigh pad en route to the keeper
just short of a good length and outside off, sits up in the surface, Babar fetches it from there and muscles a pull over wide long-on. One-bounce four
too straight in line, picked off square of short fine leg
really full on the pads, nudged behind square
good length delivery outside off, 121 kph, sliced to third man for one
131 kph, full delivery outside off, shovelled to midwicket from the crease.
short ball in the corridor, lets it come on and guides it to third man again
tossed up on middle stump, driven inside-out to short extra
wide of the crease, and angled in on off, but the length is full. Babar gets under it and lofts it to the right of Rovman at long-on. Rovman was left wrong-footed and the ball winds the race
short of a length and cuts back in, Babar slogs across the line and does not make contact. Williams' front foot strays. No-ball
full, angling into middle and leg, and it's the slower one too. Looks to swipe it down to long-on but can't get any timing on it, and ends up inside-edging into his front pad
full, close to off stump. Looks to clear his front leg and slog down the ground, can't make contact
down the track now, makes a bit of room against the stump-to-stump length ball and chops it away into the point region. Again, no timing
in the blockhole on off and middle, whipped down to long-on
no trouble this time, though. Gets one full from Munro and he clears his front leg to hit it clean and flat, back down the ground for six

ooh, nearly. Bangs it in short this time, angling into the batsman to cramp him for room. Uppercuts to the left of third man, and Rance, sprinting round quickly, can't quite reach the ball with his tumbling effort. Drops short of him and spins past him to the boundary
wide yorker now, good response. Babar tries to steer it away through point but can't put bat to ball
shorter on middle and leg, another non-turner, this is punched to long-on
clipped off the pads to deep midwicket
short and outside off, Babar uses his feet and punches to long-off
tossed on middle, eased down to long-on
back of a length and angled in on off, neatly clipped around the corner to deep square leg
shot, what a way to get off the mark. This is a regal shot. A touch too full and outside off, Babar leans into it and crunches a drive through the covers. Nobody moved
short and speared outside off, chopped to backward point, where Finch, I think, fumbles and gives up a single

slashed into the hands of short third man. Unlikely line, unlikely dismissal with both fine leg and third man in. But Azam hits it into the lap of Rovman. Very full and wide outside off, Babar throws his bat at the ball and skews it
length and outside off, steered to deep backward point
on the pads, worked away to short fine leg, who dives to his left to save three
glanced off the pads to long leg
on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
down the track now, goes a little early and Munro bowls it into his legs. Clipped in the air, on the bounce to deep midwicket
full on middle stump, clipped to long-on
back of a length now, makes room and slaps to deep point

slower ball, but that's a terrible lapse in line. Ends up bowling a short offcutter than turns down the leg side. A no-no with fine leg inside the circle. Babar puts it away with a one-handed pull to the right of the fielder
back of a length, angling into leg stump to cramp Babar, who jabs it softly into the point region and picks up the single that gets him to 50
short on leg stump, cramps the batsman for room, diverted down to long leg
shuffles across off, gets inside the line of a back of a length ball. Picks it up and pulls it beautifully over short fine leg
short on off, fends in in front of square and sets off
short and outside off, uses his wrists and swats it into the vacant spaces at midwicket. They hustle back for the second
banged in short and outside off, hops and quells to cover
hip-high short ball outside off, slower offcutter, Babar rocks back, picks it, and swats it away to the midwicket fence. That was stylish as well
short, angled in, bursts off the surface, homing in on the chest. Babar throws his bat in front of his chest and fends it off
slower cutter, drifts down leg, wide
sprayed very wide outside off, past the guideline, wide
back of a length on middle stump, flat-batted past midwicket's left hand to the fielder at long-on
fuller now, outside off, driven to extra-cover, who's deep enough to allow a single
the free-hit is a wide yorker, this is inside the guideline. Azam can't carve it through square. Beaten
hip-high short ball outside off, Babar sits back and swats it straight to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, forced to mid-off
this one goes the other away. Short and swerves away outside off, punched through cover
hard-spinning offbreak, short in length, he goes back and blocks back to the bowler
quicker offbreak on off, played back
hip-high short ball on off, swatted away to deep square
drifts in on off, nudged to square leg, pressing forward
fired on off, whipped away straight to square leg on the back foot
fuller around middle and leg, flicked towards square leg for a single
bouncer this time, Babar looks to cut it over the wicketkeeper, misses
quicker slider on off, defended on the front foot
full and straight on middle, picked off to backward square leg
back of a length and angled in on off stump, hangs back and turns a single through square leg
full on off, driven smoothly, more work for long-on

flatter and this one slides on with the angle towards leg stump. Makes room, but is cramped by the lack of turn, and he just knocks it gently into the cover region and calls his partner through for a single
slower one again, comes down the track and drags it towards long-on
dragged down on middle, pulled away to wide long-on's right
shortish, angling into off stump and cramping Babar up as he steps back and across. Tucks it quietly to midwicket
full and floated on leg or just outside, dinked to short fine leg

shortish outside off, stops on him slightly as he shapes to cut. Ends up dragging it straighter than he'd like, in front of point, but it's far enough to the fielder's right to enable him to scurry across to the other end and bring up 1000 T20I runs in a mere 26 innings. He's the quickest to the mark, ahead of Virat Kohli by one innings
full and straight, driven away between midwicket and mid-on
short on off, opens the face and secures a single down to third man
full on middle stump, clipped firmly back to the bowler
slower yorker, clipped to deep square leg
arrowed in to hit the pad, but going down the leg side
pitched up, outside off, squeezes it out to backward point
big legbreak, pitching quite short and turning from middle and leg to outside off. Uses his wrists to whip it down to long-on
full now, whipped down to long-on

slower ball, and he strikes first ball. Saw Babar looking to make a bit of room and followed him with a full, slow offcutter. Looks to hit it down the ground, but he has to manufacture all the power himself. Difficult to do with an outfield as big as this, and Tim Southee sprints in from the long-on boundary and takes a good, low catch
length ball, just outside off, Babar waits for it before dabbing it just past the wicketkeeper, beats the diving short third man as the ball races towards the fence
full and sliding in, the batsman uses his feet and tickles it to the covers
and another! Shorter this time, but still in his hitting arc. Clears his front leg again and launches it over the leaping long-on fielder

taken low to his right! Kumara's persistence and consistency has paid off. He's been very disciplined today. Slams this back of a length and just outside off. Babar backs away, makes room, and tries to chop this down to third man. The outside edge dips to Sadeera's right and he hangs on cleanly
a tad short around middle and leg, swatted away to long-on
hit on the pad as he looks to flick. Rolls to short fine leg
swept but the top-edge just trickles to the deep backward square leg boundary.
turns this gently behind square into the leg side.
pulled in front of square, splits the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Touch short, he got it high on the bat but it still had enough.
back of length on middle and leg, tucked off his hip to deep square
rides the bounce and then upper cuts this short ball to clear third man. So very nicely executed ramp. Used the pace superbly. Not sure why NCN is suddenly going short.
unfurls his wrists to hit this behind point, two to square third man.
wrists this short of length delivery to deep square.
clean hitting right out of the top drawer. Steps out and lofts this tossed up delivery over mid-off. Didn't get to the pitch but it didn't matter.
shortens his length, worked off his hip to deep square.
slower and fuller outside off, squeezed to point.
shortens his length, pulled straight to midwicket
dabs this behind point for a single
steered behind point for an easy single
so clever, uses the bowler's pace and then literally deflects this off the keeper's glove to beat short third man
turns this gently into the leg side
gentle tuck into the leg side, behind square for a single
sharp turn from length on off, worked to the legside
gets right to the pitch as he eases to long-off
slider which he bunts into the off side behind point. Excellent start.
mistimes an attempted slap to cover. Looked to hit the gap at point.
worked with the spin towards deep midwicket, Maxwell had some work to do in getting to his left from the ropes.
leading edge that rolls back to the bowler.
drills this down to long-off
bowled full outside off, driven hard to cover.
driven inside-out with the spin to wide long-off.
works this off length to midwicket
overpitched on leg stump, and he meets the ball on the front foot. Nudged to cover
overpitched on leg, and clipped past midwicket to the man in the deep. Enough time to jog back for the second
drifts away from a length on off, deadbats it away.
length ball on off, and nudged off his pads to square leg. They scamper across for one
looks to whip this square, beaten. But there's too much turn.
steps out and belts this back over the bowler's head. Got very close to the pitch of the ball and went through with the stroke. Excellent timing.
short ball that skids through. Lands on off, and pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
full on middle, and nudged off his pads to square leg for a jogging single
tossed up on middle, and he skips down the ground to tap the ball away to deep midwicket. They jog across for one
chipped! But nobody's there at mid off. Full outside off, and uppishly driven to long off
good length outside off again. No turn this time, cut into the ground to deep point
good length on middle, and pulled to deep midwicket
down the track, but just chips it down to long-off

run out chance some air, and pitched up on the stumps, he goes deep into his crease to work it away towards midwicket. Maxwell was very quick there, the batsmen thought it was an easy two, but had he hit direct, the batsman would have been a goner
goes aerial wide long-on runs around and slides to block it - can't really call that a chance
patted down to long-on
slower ball, back of a length on off. He had to wait for it and paddle-pull it to deep midwicket
comes down the track to this back of length delivery on off and slaps it past cover. Sweeper cleans up on the boundary.
comes down the track, but can't get any timing on his drive. Just goes off the toe end to extra cover
close call perfect length, dips and turns, he misses the cut and the ball misses the stumps
he just can't work Zampa out. Comes down the track but can't quite get to the pitch of the ball, ends up patting it tamely back
worked away to deep midwicket off the front foot
slower ball, nearly inside edged on to the stumps. Tries to come on the front foot and slap it to midwicket, but almost misses it. The ball almost hits leg stump
better timing there, steered to third man
length ball on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
past the outside edge, sharp turn finds the ideal length and it whizzes past the edge and down to third man
tossed up, comes down the track and converts to a full toss but can only stroke it to the man on the cover fence
he's hitting a great length. Ideal for getting the batsman just enough forward but not able to drive with authority. This is tapped into the offside
tossed up, he goes for the big booming drive, but only manages a thin outside edge that goes to short third man
lets it go, not a wide it was there for the cut, but he just let it go. Inside the white line, so poor call by the batsman

Finch holds a smart catch on the long-off boundary He knew he had to accelerate, and tried to go big, Got hold of the ball, but not quite well enough. Finch kept calm right on the ropes and held the ball over his head without disbalancing.
spins in from round the stumps, defended.
deceived in flight as he steps out to flick, played too early. Hit on the pad.
sharp turn from middle and leg, looks to tickle fine but misses. Excellent take down leg, given wide though.
lobs off the inside edge to where a backward short leg would be. At the moment, he isn't reading the turn properly.
defended from the crease into the leg side
slower ball, but spinning after hitting the deck. Babar misses the flick
full on off, and smothered off his pads with the angled bat to the leg side
back of a length outside off, and turning inwards. Nudged off his pads to square leg to a ball that bounced extra
full and wide outside off, it goes through from inside the tramlines but the umpire calls it wide anyway. Third wide of the over. Oooo, close call
slower ball, full on off stump. Driven straight but takes the outside edge through to third man
full on middle and leg, worked off his pads behind square on the leg side. Man in the deep, though
full and wide outside off, but once again beyond the tramlines

b>full toss, and dispatched! On off stump as Rance misses his line and Babar muscles this over the bowler's head. Perfect timing off the bat's middle, and it lands just beyond the long-off boundary. The fielder was interested in the deep, but eventually gave up as the ball came towards him
full and wide outside off, goes beyond the wide line on the off side. Seventh wide of the innings
fuller ball on middle and off, driven towards the leg side off the front foot. Played towards cow corner
full on leg stump and it's gently tapped off the front foot towards Bruce in the deep on the leg side. Rotates the strike
back of a length on middle stump, uses his wrists to whip this off the back foot to midwicket. Calls for the single, and they take Santner's arm on
overpitched outside off, eventually it's a low full toss. Tries to drive but takes a thick outside edge. Runs down to third man
short on leg stump, challenges Babar with that delivery. Forces the batsman to duck, and get under the line of the ball. First bouncer of the over

back of a length on leg stump, and it's flicked beautifully off his pads! Flies over square leg and threads the gap between fine leg and deep midwicket. Superb placement, and ends the over with a boundary
good length on middle and leg, turns across the batsman's body. Tapped towards midwicket with soft hands. No fielder there, forcing the bowler to race behind it
tossed up full outside off, it's a low full toss and it's driven past cover off the front foot. Beats the infielder, but Santner races across from long off to intercept that shot. Stops the boundary
full outside off, tapped off the front foot with the bat's open face. Played to deep point
good length on middle stump, tentatively turned off the back foot to square leg for a single
full on off stump, tries to smack it straight once more but dropped by Sodhi. Stuck his left hand out, but the ball hits his hand and lands nearby. Saves three for certain
tossed up, and punished! Full on off stump, and Babar comes down the ground and bunts it over Sodhi. Hit dead straight. No chance for either long on or long off
short of a length from round the wicket, slapped off the backfoot through point. Take that, Ajaz, and welcome to international cricket

full on off stump, and it's hit straight down the ground! Boult dives to his left but can't stop it. And neither can the diving mid-off fielder. Quick outfield and that crashes into the long-off boundary. There's the fifty partnership!
full on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket off his pads for the single and there's the team 150!
back of a length on off, punched to mid-off
too short again and spinning away to give him width, slapped away but cover dives to his right to make a good stop
guides a length ball to mid-on for a quick one
gets some movement inwards off the seam and Babar chops onto the back pad off the inside edge
drives a fuller ball straight down the ground, mid-on and mid-off team up to stop it
leg-side length ball, tries to tuck and rolls away to square leg off the pad
short ball, has the batsman arching out and stabbing towards point
swings at a short and wide ball, fails to get on top of the bounce which is more than he would've liked. Gets an outside edge for his troubles and settles straight into the gloves of the keeper
full on off stump, driven down the ground but straight to the bowler
short on middle stump, pulled into the deck and goes through to wide mid on

glorious straight drive! Full on off stump, and that's driven off the front foot past the bowler. Mid off races to his right, but his slide ain't good enough either. Races away to the long-off boundary

terrific attempt from Rance, but dropped! Short on off and pulled off the back foot. Top edged again, and Rance races in from fine leg and dives forward with his left hand stretched out, but the ball pops out. Great effort nonetheless
full on off, and driven down the ground to long off. They skip across for the single, and that's Babar's half-century!
another one! Chops on. Fuller outside off, and he drives away from his body. The ball zips in, and takes the inside of his bat. Massive wicket

sliced, but straight to point! Earns the wicket by cramping Babar for room. Floater on a good length outside off, and Babar is enticed to cut. Played with the sliced bat, and goes straight to KW. Simple take for the NZ captain
short on off stump but spinning into the batsman, cut square off the back foot and Babar calls for the second once again. Direct hit from Santer in the deep, but Babar was in by then
short of a length just outside off, pulled off the front foot to long-on's right

good length on middle stump, backs away towards the leg side and pulls along the ground to deep midwicket once again. Kitchen's been excellent in that region, another sliding effort in the deep limits it to only a single
fuller ball but outside off, carved square off the back foot with the bat's open face. But can't go past the infield
tossed up full outside off, straightens after pitching. Punched off the back foot to cover

good length wide outside off, turned off the back foot with soft hands to midwicket. Nobody there inside the circle, and Babar calls nice and early for the second. Boult's throw in is great though, and forces Babar to dive into his crease
full outside off, no real spin on offer and it's driven past the bowler's right to mid off
good length on off stump, backs away and carves towards point for a single
good length outside off, and it's lifted straight. Doesn't have the distance, and it's taken by Southee at long off! But it's not out since the previous delivery was erroneously called a no ball
short ball first up, no real spin this time. Gets away with the loose ball. Pulled along the ground off the back foot to the man in the deep on the leg side
full on off stump, gently turned off his toes towards midwicket for a quick run. Loud and early call for the run from Babar
good length on off, and pulled off the back foot to midwicket. Skiddy delivery, not timed perfectly
