good length outside off, rocks onto his back foot and carves this past point! Muscles it away, taking full advantage of the room offered
good length on off stump, stays tall and punches this back to the bowler
good length on middle stump, and its pulled by the new batsman towards cow corner. Work for Kitchen in the deep once again, but his sliding stop ensures the ball does not go to the boundary
full on off stump, driven off the front foot but mistimed. To cover once again
full and wide outside off, slashes hard at it and lifts this up and over point. Work for Ish Sodhi at third man, who has to race across the boundary line to intercept
back of a length outside off, stays in his crease and punched back past the non-striker to long on

There's Babar's fifty and the team 200! Short on leg stump and pulled away towards cow corner. Two men in the deep but neither can stop it. Strong end from Pakistan to their innings. They finish on 201 for 4
good length on off stump but angling into the right hander, flicked off his pads to deep midwicket. Calls early for the second run
full just outside off, tapped past the non-striker to long on once again
good length wide outside off, waits for it before cutting square off the back foot. Straight to Munro at deep cover
short on off stump, muscles his pull down the ground to long on. Comes off the bat's top half. Quicker ball this time
floated on a good length but pitches wide outside off, turns past the wide line. Got to bowl that again
quicker ball, darted full on middle stump but going down the leg side. Sharp take from the keeper
full ball on middle stump, squeezed past the bowler's left to long off. Keeping it tight
good length but wide outside off, angling across the batsman's body. Driven over cover but takes the top edge instead. Through to third man. Brings Hasan Ali back on strike
full on middle and off, shuffles across to the off side and taps this to mid on. They want a quick single, but none on offer
slower ball, full on off stump. Scrambled seam, and defended towards the non-striker to see the over out
length ball on off stump. Wicket-to-wicket line, and defended off the back foot
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, angled down to deep third man for one
full and on leg stump, deflected to the keeper as he looks to flick
full inswinger at off stump, brings the bat down with the full face and opens it at the last moment to guide this to short third man
short of a length just outside off, jabbed off the back foot to cover's left. Phillips puts in a leap to parry that to his left
there goes James the Score's prediction, a single to backward point takes Pakistan to 79
full ball from Santokie, defended towards point

taken at mid-off! It's the change of pace again, with Babar looking to hit drive on the up and clear the infield. Not enough on the ball to take it that far though. New Zealand have a sniff. Just a tiny sniff
backs away - but he's done in by Southee's cleverness. He takes all the pace off and keeps the ball wide of off stump and that leaves Babar too far away from the ball to make any connection
this is at top pace, which Babar pulls to deep midwicket
slower ball - it's the leg cutter - on middle and leg, Babar tries to sweep it away but he's beaten
steers the length ball on off stump to the sweeper
walks down the pitch, de Grandhomme responds with a slower ball on middle, but he still manages to dab it to third man. Unruffled.
full on middle, knocks it down to long-on
slips down leg

99 kph, chaos. Full on middle and leg, driven to long-on. Just one available. The throw is bad, way over the keeper's head, the keeper runs back and flops his throw to allow another run. Munro is displeased
a full delivery on middle and leg, heaved away over long-on for a valuable six. Wild cheers again as Pakistan get 100
six and out, and Pakistan are all out for 105! Another slower delivery on middle and leg, Azam cannot time his lofted drive and can only chip the catch to long-on
missed stumping! A massive gallop down the pitch, Babar does a double pirouette as the ball bursts through him, but it bursts through Buttler's gloves as well
swished out to cover
tight line, turning from middle and leg, and worked off the pads
shorter length, Babar leans back but can't carve through the infield
a bit of turn again and they settle for another single
outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
tossed up, tonked down the ground, Jordan slips as he fields on the half-volley
turning outside off, chopped hard and fast through backward point. They are a single hit away from an absolutely pounding victory
pulled firmly, but straight to short midwicket. Not this time ...
banged in short again, pulled around the corner, and the scores are level!
smashed off the back foot, into the gap in the covers, and Pakistan have romped to a crushing victory!
a tad fuller just outside off, pushed towards backward point for a quick single
length outside off, mistimed drive on the up to extra cover

just past cover's hand and it's through the infield. Length ball with some shape away, he taps it on the up with minimal feet. The fielder was diving to his right and it seems like his knee got stuck in the ground and impeded his movement. Nearly got to that one
whacks the stumps after picking it up in his follow through. Slower ball from Southee, lobbed up at off stump and it's driven back at him with the batsman outside the crease
nicely timed. But finds mid-on. It's full on middle stump and he drives sweetly to find the fielder
good length outside off, 132 kph, hit away to cover
good length outside off, 131 kph, swatted to long-on for a run
shortish, on middle and off, hit back to the bowler
full delivery on off, 138 kph, forced to the sweeper cover. Just nothing happening for Pakistan, other than Hasan's cameo
good length outside off, carved behind point. There are two runs available by the time Munro gets around to his right
a low full toss on the pads, worked to midwicket to retain strike. Should have put that away for six too
slashed for four. Full and wide from Munro, carved away to deep point, no one there. Well played

nicely done in the deep. Chapman runs to his right at long-on, dives full length and slaps at the ball. It ramps up and goes behind him and to his left. He immediately tuns around and pulls it back in inches from the rope. That was a short ball at middle stump, pulled hard to long-on's right
length on middle stump, clipped through midwicket off the back foot
slower ball at a length on off stump, dabbed into the covers with soft hands
slower ball at a length on middle stump, shuffles across and whips off the back foot to deep square
length ball in at middle and leg, flicked to deep square off the back foot
length around off, pushed towards extra cover
fuller on middle and leg, worked away towards square leg
length ball, worked gently towards midwicket for a couple and brings up his fifty
full ball on off stump, driven into the off side towards mid-off
gives himself some room and smashes it down the ground for four
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right
fuller on the pads, clipped away for a single
length on off stump, dabs it into the off side with soft hands

gets it past short third this time. Another attempted yorker, but this time he overdoes the length. It's swinging away and he uses that trajectory to make the decision to open his face and carve this behind square
slower ball floated up at off stump. Gets behind it and turns it to midwicket with soft hands
short and just outside off, chops it to sweeper cover's left
hoicked to mid-on's right. Length ball outside off and it's an impatient heave with little connection
starts with a short one, pulled away towards midwicket
down the track, Babar this time, but hits it straight back towards the bowler
fuller on stumps, driven inside out towards long-off
shot but straight to midwicket. Short ball rising up generously for Babar, who pulled off the front foot with full balance
length ball, around middle and leg, worked away towards midwicket for an easy single
yorker length outswinger just outside off. Opens the face and uses the pace, but he can't get this past Sodhi at short third man. The legspinner slides to his right
length on leg stump, flicked out to deep square leg
137 kph, full and straight, driven to long-on
worked towards short fine leg for a quick single
short of length and Babar cheekily opens the face of the bat to run it towards third man
slower one, Babar was looking to make some room and hit it on the off side, but ends up hitting it towards long-on
bouncer from Tye as well, pulled away towards deep backward square leg
shuffles across off and picks off a single to square leg does Azam
back of a length and largely holds its line outside off, Azam throws his bat at the ball and inside-edges a four past the left of the diving NZ keeper
short of length and pulled away nicely towards square leg, McDermott slides to his left to keep it to one
length outside off, steered away once again towards the third man
length outside off, looks to run it down towards the third man, misses
on a length and angling in on middle, Azam dances out and plays it back to Patel
length ball, Babar was looking to work it on the leg side, gets a leading edge towards sweeper cover, Hasan Ali was looking to come back for a second, a loud no from Babar sends him back
length ball, around middle and leg, worked away towards deep midwicket for a couple which leaves Hasan Ali on the strike for the last over
wide yorker, Babar squeezes it towards point for a single
tossed on middle stump, pushed past the bowler, straight of KW at mid-on
overpitched on off stump, and Babar mistimes a drive to wide mid on to get Pakistan off the mark
pushed off the front foot towards cover
length ball on leg, and clipped away to square leg for a quick single
length ball outside leg, and Carey takes a sharp collection behind the stumps
full outside off, and swinging away slightly. Babar meets this ball on the front foot, and caresses a drive through to the extra-cover boundary!
full, but closer to off stump. Pushed away with a small backlift to cover for a quick single
good length  just outside off, and confidently punched off the back foot to the fielder at cover
length ball on off, and worked off his pads to deep backward square. A simple flick to rotate the strike
length ball on off, angling in. Pushed with the angled bat to cover point for a jogging single
pulled with disdain! Short on off, and he rides the bounce to use his wrists and place a perfectly hit pull shot behind square for four more. Another boundary to start off an NCN over
length ball angling in, and nudged off his pads to deep square leg
full on his pads, and worked off his pads to deep backward square once again for a walking single
good length on middle, and tapped off the back foot past the non-striker. A confident call early for a run from Babar
length ball outside off, and Babar exposes two stumps and then opens the bat's face to steer a perfect shot past the fielder at backward point! Excellent wristwork
ramped! But goes to third man on the bounce. Played this length ball with the angled bat. Slightly uppishly
length ball angling in, and nudged off his hips to deep square leg. Five more balls remain in this Powerplay
good length on off, and he tiptoes to nudge a flick to midwicket. Maxwell has an aim at the stumps with Hafeez halfway down the wicket, but he can't get the direct hit
slightly fuller this time, outside off, hit straight to the point fielder
another short one, Babar goes for a pull, gets a top edge towards the right of the third man fielder, Stanlake there runs towards his right to pull it just inside the fence
back of a length and angling in towards the hops, worked away square of short fine leg by Azam. Sodhi chases and jams his left knee into the turf. He seems okay, though
short on the hips, a whirl of those wrists sends the ball to deep square leg
flicks off the pad and is set to run away to the fine leg boundary, but Seifert dives to his left and stops it
waits on the shot and that extra second helps him carve the shortish delivery well behind point
too wide outside off.

leans forward and thumps it to the cover boundary. This is splendid batting from Babar. He's looking so comfortable on this slow pitch. He knows the target in front of him. He knows New Zealand's spinners will give him chances to hit out. And all that calm is making his game all the better
keeps the front leg away as he slices the good length ball on middle to cover
steps out but Sodhi pulls his length back, keeps his line straight and ensures Babar can only knock it back down the pitch
run-out chance but Babar just about makes it. Mistimes the drive to cover and then comes a misunderstsanding between the two batsmen. Eventually, all is well for Pakistan
slower short cutter outside off, lashed away to deep backward point of the back foot
slower short ball on middle, drags a pull to deep square leg off the back foot
down the track and hacked off the inside half to long-on
fires it short on leg stump, Azam ventures deep in the crease and pulls the ball between deep midwicket and wide long-on
slower offcutter, just a shade outside off, played back to the bowler
flicked off the pads to deep square leg
slower cutter finishes on the pads, knocked fine of Patel at short fine leg for one
length ball and Babar clears his front leg and smashes it over midwicket for an 85-meter six
tip and run to the covers, KW swoops down the ball but the throw is wild - over the keeper's head
darted down leg, left alone, wide
short and fizzes through outside off, rocks back and chops the ball through the covers
full and straight, knocked down to long-on
slower ball, nurdled to Patel at short fine leg again. Pakistan steal another single from right under his nose
nudged off the pads wide of short fine
short one outside off, sits up to be smacked. Azam obliges and nails it through the covers off the back foot. And welcome, de Grandhomme
back of a length and skidding in at off, chopped behind to the diving keeper
back of a length and too straight, flicked away to deep backward square leg
on a length and outside off, nearly 150ks, Azam uses the pace of Mile to his advantage and clatters it on the up. Through the covers
slower cutter outside off, chopped to short third man for one
shortish and outside off, carved to the covers
back of a length and angling into off, Azam shuffles across and clips it with the angle to mid-on

slower short ball outside off, 129ks, Azam is waaaaay too early into his pull and does not make contact.... or may have under-edged it in front of the keeper. Yes, Ultra Edge detects a spike. The keeper should have dived forward and attacked the ball. This'll go down as a missed chance. Replays suggest it was the offcutter from Southee
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, Azam punches on the up to cover
slid through on middle, pushed to cover
dug in short on middle, sits up again, Babar latches onto it and middles a pull over midwicket. Lovely timing
shorter length, worked off the pads
strays on the pads again, this inswinger is neatly picked off to fine leg
low full toss outside off, driven to mid-off
slower and fuller on middle, Babar looks to clear cover but can't clear the infield. Simple catch to the fielder at the edge of the ring.
good length outside off and angling inwards. Chopped down to short third man
good length on off, stands tall and punches down the ground to mid on
good length on middle, and pulled well. Played along the ground to deep midwicket
back of a length, but wide outside off again. Waits for the ball to get to him, and pokes it over point's head. Fletcher chases behind it, but his effort is futile in the end
punched past cover! Exquisite from Babar. Good length outside off, and Babar takes a step forward to punch it away from him. Had to tip-toe slightly, but placed the shot extremely well
full on middle and leg, flicked off his pads to midwicket. Stopped by the man there, which forces Babar to not take the second
full on middle and leg, flicked off his toes to square leg for a walking single
full on middle and leg, tries to whip it fine, but played to short fine leg
full on leg stump, this time it's clipped square to the man in the deep. Calls early for the second, and they jog back comfortably
good length on middle stump, goes onto the back foot and flicked to the deep once again. Another comfortable double
full on leg stump, shimmies down the wicket and taps it to mid on. Straight to the fielder
back of a length outside off, and Babar misses the square punch. Tried to ride the bounce and play towards cover, but the ball goes over his bat
flat and short outside off. Cut off the back foot to deep extra cover. They walk across for the single
full on off stump, takes a step forward and drives down the ground to long off
half-tracker outside off. Goes deep into his crease and pulls this vehemently past midwicket. Perfectly placed between long on and deep midwicket. Too short on this occasion from the part-time bowler
another short ball outside off. Babar waits for it before cutting square. Hit to point though
full on off stump, drags a leg-side shot towards deep backward square
good length on middle and leg, takes a step to the leg side and punches this down the ground to long on
tossed up on middle, turning away from Babar and he drives with the turn. Smacked to long off
good length just outside off, mistimes his cut shot to cover point. Hard for Badree to grip this ball. It's quite dewy
back of a length on middle, flicked off his pads to deep midwicket on this occasion. Easy runs on offer
pulled but straight to deep square leg
full on middle stump, takes a step down the ground and taps it to long off. He'll keep strike once again

misses his line, and slips in a wide down leg but they have a wicket anyway. Shehzad has to walk back and does so to a huge round of applause. This has been a stunning knock. Coming back to the wicket, they tried to chance a bye but the keeper did well to run quickly to his left and hurl the throw at the bowler's end. Shehzad wasn't even in the frame. Tiredness consuming him but he can be very proud of that knock.
skiddy short ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
slips in a short of length ball on middle, punched to long-on

excellent improvisation. Walks across the stumps just a touch to convert this into a half-volley on the pads and simply flicks this using those powerful wrists, finds the gap at deep midwicket region with ease
veering in towards the pads again, this time it's a gentle push to the leg side
slower off-cutter on middle and leg, turned to Morne Morkel at fine leg
slider outside off, whipped across the line to deep midwicket
looks to slap this short ball through cover but gets a thick edge that races past the keeper and short third man. Not where he intended, but he'll take them anyway
wrists this slider from outside off towards square leg
slower ball, much fuller in length, on middle and leg, turned to deep square leg
slower and fuller on leg stump, worked to deep midwicket. Babar was looking to make room and go over the off side
length ball on middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket

dropped by Tahir at fine leg. Not easy, but you expect those to be taken at this level. This was short and sliding into middle and leg, Babar uses the pace to simply help this towards fine leg. Tahir wasn't far from the ball but he was on the move, trying to dive low. How costly will that prove to be?
whips this incoming length ball to deep midwicket. Miller is lightning quick, Shehzad is tiring, so they didn't chance the second
punched on the up to Amla at the edge of the ring at cover. Looked to get the elevation but it seemed a tired stroke. Humidity getting to the batsmen?
looks to muscle this straight, ends up dragging it from way outside off towards wide long-on
too short, way outside off, pulled to Thisara at deep midwicket. That's the half-century stand off just 37 deliveries

straight as a dye this time. Too full, he got underneath the flight, cleared his front leg and blasted this down the ground. Too much power, long-on had no chance despite being no more than five metres away from the ball
gets to the pitch of the ball and caresses this full delivery to deep cover
slapped. Too short, he makes room and wallops this to the cover boundary. Friendly pace, was sitting up nicely for him to put that away
attempted leg-cutter, turns out to be a full toss outside off, driven to deep cover
slower delivery sliding down leg, he looks to shuffle across to paddle but it wasn't a good choice since there was no pace to work with. Missed it completely. Rolled to keeper Bailey
low full toss angling into the pads, flicked to Tahir at fine leg
stand and deliver. Friendly length ball, a loose ball first up, and Babar made room and used the room and slap this over cover. Wow

slower bouncer, helps it to short third man, one bounce to the fielder. Babar is livid as he's missed out on a genuine boundary opportunity. He timed it well despite there not being much pace to work with
works this length ball from off stump to deep square
starts off with a loose one, but Babar doesn't punish it. Good length outside off, and cut straight to point
good length on off, punched down the ground - past the non-striker's left - to long on. Easy pickings
short just outside off, swivels and pulls down the ground to long on. They jog across for the single
shorter length, punched hard to deep cover
fuller on middle, he pushes towards long on but Agar cuts it off
90kph, shorter ball on middle, he's back and pulling wide of long on for an easy two
looped up leg break, he pushes this to the gap at cover
quicker leg break, he skips out but doesn't get to the pitch and knocks it away with his pad
pushed through on middle and leg, Babar drops down to one knee and pings a slog-sweep between deep square and deep midwicket. Pakistan find some respite
shorter and breaks away outside off, lashed to point
tip and run to cover as Babar turns the strike to new man Asif
shorter and outside off, Babar rides the bounce and pulls with the wrists to deep square
short, slow, 119ks, pulled with control through midwicket
dropped short and spins away outside off, there's the release for Babar. He jumps back and middles a cut to the right of backward point
wrong'un, faster and flatter, nurdled away to the leg side
Babar uses his feet, Zampa skids one in and hits the pads of the moving batsman
looped up on leg stump, slog-swept away to deep square leg on the fence
short and holds its line outside off, lashed to sweeper cover off the back foot
full on the stumps, shovelled away to deep square leg

edged and Carey throws himself to his right, but can't touch the ball. On a length and wide outside off, Babar throws his hands at the ball and slashes it away from Carey's reach. The ball rolls away to the boundary and Babar marks his T20I captaincy debut with a fifty

full inswinger from wide of the crease, Babar has a bigger swing at it and misses. The sharp angle from Starc means it's heading down the leg side as Babar crosses over for a leg bye. Starc challenges the on-field not-out decision. It will stay as not out, missing leg comfortably enough
banged in short and outside off, Babar jumps back, gets on top of the bounce and crunnnnnnches a pull in front of square for six
Starc hits a hard length on middle, does not come onto the bat, though. Babar is early into his shot and splices it over Starc's head
140ks yorker, tails in at middle, jabbed away to the leg side for one
starts with a full toss! It's straight, pushed to the on side
short, some width outside off, he drives off the back foot and it flies in the air wide of backward point to third man
lofted just over Smith at long off! he didn't get all of it but he just got enough of it! Went inside out over long off, Smith was jumping on the rope but it just cleared him!
118kph, short slower ball, he mistimes a pull behind square for a single
drifting into leg, he skips out and whips this neatly to deep midwicket
slower at 85kph, he is forced to check the drive back to the bowler
good length on off, and angling away from Talat. He goes onto the back foot, and cuts this late. Beats the diving short third-man fielder!
full on off stump, came down the wicket to meet this on the full. Tapped to long on
overpitched just outside off, tries to drive square but manages to toe-end it instead. Squeezed away past backward point this time and Pakistan start the over with a boundary

full on middle stump, takes a step forward and drives to Emrit at long on. Misfield, though, as the ball goes through his hands. Manages to pull it back before the ball hit the ropes though. Sloppy stuff and Emrit apologises to the bowler
good length just outside off, grips and turns inwards this time. The late cut goes straight to short third man
tossed up, and overpitched on off stump. Dug away with the bat's open face to deep point
full on off stump. Babar takes a few steps down the group and whips it off his toes to deep midwicket

good length just outside off. Angling into Babar as he punches inside the line of the ball. Hit straight back to Smith, who almost took a one-handed catch low to his right. Eventually goes past him to mid off
back of a length outside off, leans into a punch off the back foot, but straight to point
full and wide outside off. Takes a big step forward and drives exquisitely past cover. It's crunched through the cordon and Babar brings up another T20 fifty
holes out next ball! Good length on middle, and he tries to pull behind square. Flicked it, really, but flicked way too well. Taken by Walton near the boundary
full on off, whipped wide of long-on for a comfortable single
138kph, back of a length wide of off, he stands tall and opens the blade to guide it through gully to third man
edged through the slips! Back of a length, he tried to punch off the back foot but got a thick edge that flew through where Finch was and races away!
on the hip and flicked away neatly with control to deep backward square
143kph, back of a length wide of off, he tries to cut but misses
edged through a vacant second slip! 145kph rocket, good length angling across, gets the edge as he drives but there is only one slip in and he gets four more
142kph, shorter length outside off, he leans back and runs a late cut to third man
134kph, back of a length, he's back and punching off the back foot but gets a thick edge to third man
141kph, fuller into the pads, he clips this through midwicket forward of the sweeper and he gets a couple
138kph, good length, top of off, he defends with soft hands into the off side and pinches one
120kph, slower ball, Babar checks his cut shot, dragging it in the air but safely to wide mid off
138kph, back of a length, punched square to backward point, Smith knocks it down but they run straight away to get there easily
94kph, darted into middle, he's pushing this toward long on and wants two but it's not there
131kph, back of a length on off, he stands tall and defends with the full face
pitched up outside off, driven firmly and crisply through extra cover. Long-off sprints to his left and picks it up
width offered outside off, and Babar continues right where he left off from. Crunches a cut short away from his body, and races away past point!

fullish ball, nudged into the square leg region, and is that another run out? Shehzad a little casual in coming back for the second. No, he has made his way back comfortably. Definitely needed to show more urgency, though
quick and straight, pushed to long-on
that's five runs. Bowls this intentionally wide outside off, but it's too wide. Azam lets it go, Paine should have done a lot more with that, should have stopped it, he may not have read it either

easily taken at deep midwicket. Tahir strikes! A flat legbreak outside off, Azam gets low, looking to slog-sweep this over deep midwicket but fatigue crept in, disallowing him from getting enough power behind his heave. Deep midwicket settles underneath, no dropping that. Fine knock from Azam, all timing, save the last few balls
on a length and on off, patted to the covers
slower delivery on off stump, defended
bunted gently to the cover region for a 30-ball 50. NSK stands up and applauds. This has been a half-century like no other in the format for Babar
slower and fuller on middle, flicked to deep midwicket
down on one knee, clears the front leg and clobbers this length ball wide of long-on. This is magnificent batting. Picking gaps effortlessly.
swings this full toss down to long-on again
cracked away into the gap at point, Fletcher with the cleaning up in the deep
right into the blockhole on off stump, somehow he manages to get his bat down in time to keep that out
opens the bat face to squeeze this yorker, but can't pick the gap. Straight to short third man
slices this length delivery down to third man
uses the width to flay this behind point. Opened up those wrists nicely to find the gap. Lovely
into the blockhole on middle from wide of the crease, dug out towards midwicket
goes over cover, gets enough for this to race away. Made room, used width and belted it away
muscles the pull but doesn't get the gap, down to deep midwicket
turned towards square leg to get off the mark
floats a length ball just around off, defended
stands tall and punches this length ball straight to cover
forced off the backfoot to mid-off, they scamper a quick single. Morkel varied his pace so he had to force the pace on this on
gentle length ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
another short of length ball outside off, this one moves away in the air as it passes the batsman, through to the keeper as Azam offers no stroke
quick on leg, hit away to long-on.
shortish on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
on the pads, flicked to deep square leg for a run
a slower delivery on off, worked away towards midwicket for a couple. Shehzad is struggling, it's rather humid. Good running
a slower ball outside off, guided towards short third man for a run
on the pads, nudged down to fine leg for another run. Azam in control. Shehzad struggling for fluency, trying to hit everything too hard
good length outside off, punched to long-on
a slower delivery and straight, clipped to deep midwicket. A screechy no from Azam
on the pads again, Azam, this time, finds the fielder at short fine leg.
the googly, Azam picks the variation, closes the gap between bat and pad, blocks towards cover for a tight run. Excellent batting
what happened there? A legbreak outside off, tapped towards the keeper. Azam is unaware of the ball's location, steps out for a run, but returns in time as Paine whips off the bails. He's safe.
another dart on middle and leg, the slider, punched to long-on
flies past Amla at short third man. Short and wide outside off, Azam flays and gets another thick outside edge. Amla dives, but can't get around to his left. Just flies away
a slower straight delivery on middle, nudged to deep midwicket
there's Azam's fifty. On a length on middle and off, hit to long-on from the crease. Not one shot in the air, all timing
crashes this drive straight to mid-off. Another gentle floater from Colly
the legcutter outside off, drilled to long-on from the back foot, Perera gets around. At least a run off every ball in that over
runs down at the bowler, skews a drive to long-on for one more.
the slider on off, terrific bowling, the flipper maybe. Hit to cover
gets down, gets to the pitch and executes a lovely lofted drive over the bowler. Clean swing, pulled-in boundaries, decent timing, no doubting the result of that
a slower ball outside off, hit away to cover from the crease
short down leg, pulled past short fine leg for four. The other side of short fine leg, to his left. Easy

dropped by Miller! Should have been taken actually. May have misjudged it slightly. Full delivery outside off, chipped away over mid-off. Miller keeps his eyes on the ball through its trajectory, heads back and his reverse-cupped effort just spills out.
short down leg, pulled behind square for a couple. Good stop from Tahir
just over cover. So badly timed, wanted to clear mid-off, but the ball skews off the outside half and just evades cover. Once it clears the fielder, it's four
a short delivery on middle, pulled down to short fine leg. Wanted to play that down, hitting that from bottom to  up may have been the better option
shot delivery outside off, a mis-timed heave to the sweeper cover. Just struggling for timing
clears the boundary over deep backward square leg. A slower delivery down leg, a mis-timed heave that would have been gobbled up on most grounds, but the ball just clears the boundary.
dragged that down, should have been put into the stands. A long-hop on middle and leg, pulled to deep midwicket
lovely shot, full outside off, into position and drives elegantly wide of mid-off...perfect timing
uppish but just past mid-off, down to the man at deep cover
thick edge and it flies just past the outstretched hands of Paine, who flung himself like a goalkeeper, to his right.

no timing whatsoever, looked to hit it over long-on irrespective but simply lobbed this cross-batted hit to Miller, who did wonderfully well to come in, keep his composure and catch that with his palms facing the sky. This swirled in the air for a long time but he looked at no stage as if he'd drop it.
looks to pull, gets it really high on the bat, down to long-on
full toss that he swings from outside off towards deep square
slower and fuller on middle, he stands his ground, lines himself up and swings this over long-on. Held his shape to belt this one. Solid base, superb power
top-edge but Badree has made a right royal mess at square leg. This was a full toss, he looked to flick behind square, got this off the toe end
makes room and drills this full delivery into the gap at deep extra cover
angles in a yorker-length delivery on middle and leg, squeezed to deep square leg

appeal for lbw as this angles back in from wide of the crease to crash into the pad. May have been been sliding down leg? Babar looked to flick but missed it completely. Mohammed went up for a referral, a very optimistic one. Can't overturn that because more than half the delivery should've hit the stumps. Hawkeye shows this would've clipped. On-field call stays, but they won't lose the review
slash and a miss. Kept coming back in to cramp him for room
slips this full toss down leg, the batsman misses, keeper misses. Races to the fine leg fence. Easy pickings, gift of a delivery. Emrit having a poor night with the ball. How can he redeem himself?
cut away, superb stop at point by Mohammed
right into the blockhole on middle, he backs away and then squeezes this point. Beats third man too
swings this full toss to deep square leg
backs away and drills this full delivery to deep extra cover
yorker-length on middle, drilled towards wide long-on to get him into the 90s
pulled and this is handsomely done. Skids through the turf and into the wide long-on fence. This is a cross-seam slower ball, Babar waited, waited and gave it an almighty thwack
squeezes this yorker to short third man, disappointed that he couldn't pick the gap
cuts straight to point on the bounce. Refuses the single.
ugly hoick, rolls off a thick inside edge to deep square. Won't get a hundred but a sparkling innings nonetheless.
angles a full delivery on the stumps from wide of the crease, pushed to mid on
leans right forward and defends this full delivery to extra cover
angles this length ball back in, cramps Babar for room as he defends back down the pitch
chips a length ball with the straightest of bats towards long-on
eased into the gap off the frontfoot as they jog through
whipped across the line towards long-on, too short from Badree
steps out and drives with the spin to long-off, easy single
short, wide and he belts this straight to sweeper cover
punched back to the bowler, who puts his right hand on the followthrough to stop it
eased wide of Amla at cover as they stroll for a single
back of length angling into middle and leg, worked towards long-on
walks across the stumps and works this full delivery on middle toward midwicket
helps this away down to deep square. Amla was on the move as he got to the ball, somehow managed to retain his balance and composure as he stopped that
straight as a dye. This was short of length, Babar punched this down the ground. So much power. Wow, that just kept gaining speed. Not much flourish of the blade too. Simply wow
thick inside edge this time towards mid-on, they scamper a quick single
off the inner half of the bat again as this attempted punch rolls down to long-on
starts off with a short ball, pulled to Cutting at deep square leg
cleverly done. Uses the bowler's pace to get across the stumps slightly and paddle this away. No chance for the fine leg fielder.
good comeback, the googly this time, Babar reads this off the pitch and turns this wide of square leg
can't pick the gap, plants forward and pushes this straight to Amla at cover
flipper on middle, Babar late on the cut, cramped for room as well. Somehow gets bat on it, down to deep point
back of length on middle and leg, whipped to deep square leg
forces this slower length ball straight to cover
steps out and flat-bats this short delivery to wide long-on
gets the direction of this bouncer wrong, down leg as the batsman lets it go. This one goes on the bounce to Paine. Wide called
driven wide of cover as they amble through for a single
floats this full on off, defended

touch short, this spins away a bit and Babar connects the cut superbly. Waited for it and played it late. Watched it slide onto the bat and then opened his wrists late to pick the gap. Poor Tamim, couldn't get there despite a dive at deep point
forcefully driven to long-off as he jogs the single
too short and sliding down leg, Babar uses the pace to simply help this into the gap at deep backward square leg. Easy pickings. No chance for fine leg
another pull, except this wasn't timed all that well. Fine leg was a lot squarer, and so was able to get to that
excellent delivery. Right into the blockhole on middle, squeezed to long-on
slower length ball on off, worked towards Tamim, who had a lot of ground to cover, coming in from deep midwicket. He was a touch late to start
gets down nicely this time. Short on middle and leg, pulled into the same area. Perera gets around and cuts it off this time. Good effort from Perera
that's even better! Richardson dragged the length back, Azam punches it through the covers off the back foot. The outfield is rapid!
short of a length, straight, whipped through midwicket
101ks short offcutter on middle, waits patiently and pulls to deep square leg
overpitched just a shade outside off, 134ks, creams a front-foot drive through extra cover

Azam holes out to long-on. Short and outside off, Azam looks to drag a pull from there. Does not summon enough strength into the hit. Ends up skying it. KP runs to his right from long-on and snaps it up. Carlos brings out a little jig and celebrates his first-ball success. Dab dance? Usain Bolt like gesture, says Sir Viv Richards on TV comms
nicely played. Back of a length outside off, Azam rides the bounce and guide to third man to get off the mark
drifts down leg. 144 kph, hits a good length but the line isn't good. Nice idea.
a nice slower ball on off, 116 kph. Blocked
good single. Back of a length outside off, chopped away towards cover, and the pair respond to each other's telepathic thoughts
flight outside off, a bit of turn. Pushed to long-off
slow and straight, Azam goes right back in his crease to work to square leg. Miss that and he was plumb
a rather dangerous stroke. Flat outside off, Azam goes deep in his crease to cut towards point
another slower delivery, at 111 kph outside off. Pushed towards point
too straight, clipped to long-on. 143 ks, quick
nicely played. Back of a length outside off, dabbed just past the keeper for a run to third man
ooh, fuller than a good length and straight. May have come back in too. Azam takes it off the stumps and dabs to third man
bouncer, well-directed. 130 kph, Azam plays his pull to fine leg awkwardly
full and straight, angled to point
strays down leg, worked down to fine leg. Pooran gets across quickly but fumbles while picking up
nicely played. Short, too short on off. Punched past cover for an easy couple
fired in on off, carved to point
back of a length outside off, Azam waits for the bounce before deflecting it down to third man
great running. Pushes a full and straight delivery towards deep cover. Knew he wanted two straightaway, easy
got outside the line of the delivery and helped it away. A short delivery from around the wicket, down leg. Azam didn't bother keeping it down, quite fine too
too straight this time, an easy flick down to fine leg
back of a length and outside off, leans back and unfurls a serene late-cut between backward point and short third man. A+ for both timing and placement
tossed up outside off, 87 kph. Pushed towards cover. An easy single
100ks, darted wide outside off, too wide, rare wayward delivery from Badree. Not able to grip the ball properly?
touch short on off, goes back and cuts to backward point
flatter one on middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket
slower and fuller on off stump, pushed to the off side for an easy single
delivers this from way behind the stumps, too full on off, driven hard to sweeper cover
thumped off the back foot into the gap at sweeper cover, excellent work there. Was two for most parts but the throw was strong
there's no dip on the full toss this time, Azam was waiting for it and then muscled it over midwicket. Too easy
too full on the pads, tucked to short fine for an easy single
cross-court forehand from Azam. Slaps that from outside off towards deep midwicket. Both feet were in the air or nearly, when he made contact
looks to hit it too hard, didn't have the room to drive, rolls off the inner half of the bat back to the bowler
makes a bit of room and cuts the short ball to deep point
slashes one into the third man region where Bravo misfields to palm the ball into the boundary. Maiden T20I fifty for the impressive Babar Azam

short, wide outside off and he's slapped that in front of square. The cover fielder had no chance, for that's how hard it was hit. Back-to-back T20I wins for Pakistan, and Azam has hit the winning boundaries in both of them. This has been a roughshod for Sarfraz's men
looped up, beats the inside edge, takes the pad
pushed through wide outside off, wrong'un. Azam waits, waits, and late-cuts it superbly wide of backward point
pitched up on middle and leg, calmly driven down to long-on
very full awayswinger outside off, beats him on the drive. Lovely bowling from Taylor
length and wide outside off, slashed down to third man
straight delivery on middle, pushed down to long-on for one
speared into the leg stump, 93ks, no room at all, forced down the ground
flat on middle, camps back and punches it to Narine
straight ball on middle, no turn, backs away, and aims to drive inside-out over extra cover. Ends up carving it, teases the chasing Lewis and Samuels, and runs away to the fence
flat offbreak, flicked through midwicket
nearly chopped on! Hurls it flat and just a shade outside off, he does not have enough room for the cut. Yet, attempts the shot and just escapes
looked like a googly, comes in from outside off. He picks it off the pitch and chops to sweeper cover
full on the stumps, drilled down to long-on
another good run. Narine has his hands on his hips. Flight on off, dabbed to cover.
tossed up on off, 92 kph. Azam goes back and drives to cover
two more. Flight outside off, driven down to long-off. Malik comes back easily for the second.
length ball on the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
the first boundary for Pakistan. A touch wider this time and Babar goes over extra cover this time, utilising the angle
length ball, Babar skips down the track before whipping it towards midwicket
length ball outside off, punched but straight to the cover
length outside off, goes for the cut but it doesn't bounces as much as Babar was expects, sneaks under the bat. The keeper collects it on the volley
fuller outside off, driven from the crease but mid-off to cut it off to his left
fuller around off, looks to drive but the ball hits the inner half, a quick single to mid-on
backs away, showing the bowler his stumps, the bowler follows Babar with a low full toss on the pads, flicked behind square leg
a slower one, fuller on the stumps, flicked away towards the left of deep square leg
length ball around off, stands tall and punches it towards long-on
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards deep square leg
short of length outside off, opens the face of the bat to guide it down to third man
fuller on the stumps, digs it out towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, looks to force it towards wide long-on, misses and is hit on the pads
fuller outside off, comes forward and drives it towards long-off
fuller on the pads, flicked towards deep midwicket
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards deep point
a googly, length outside off, skips down the ground and looks to push, misses and gets hit on the pad. Outside the line of the off stump though
fuller around off, clears his front leg and looks to smash down the ground. Not from the middle of the bat though, a single to long-on
a googly, length outside off, goes for the cut but a good stop there by the point fielder
tossed up outside off, steps out and drives against the turn to long-off
run-out chance at the non-striker's end. But the throw just a bit too wayward for the bowler to hold on. He was struggling to get back there. This pinged into the leg side off his pad
nicely bowled. Yorker length just outside off, backs away, exposes the stumps and is forced to steer this down to third man
length ball outside off, swats it towards extra cover
length ball outside off, punched towards the right of mid-off on the up
length ball angling in towards the batsman, tucked away towards square leg
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards square leg
102 kph, flat on middle. Blocked
...and he finds some swing right away. Full and swerving away outside off, no shot
back of a length and holds its line outside off, punched up to extra-cover
short, wide, cracked away in front of square on the off side for four. Babar reaches out for the ball and cuts it strongly between point and covers
back of a length and straight, tucked straight to short fine leg

dipping full-toss outside off, Babar waits for it to arrive and picks it away through the vacant spaces at midwicket. Sandakan runs across to his left and boots the ball into play. Snazzy footwork in the outfield from Sandakan
on a length and outside off, run away to point
shorter and outside off, Babar is early into his back-foot punch winds up chipping it over point
back of a length and holds its line outside off, tapped down to mid-off off the front foot
Babar! Babar! Babar! Just short of a good length and just a shade outside off, Babar steps across, punches it on the up to the right of mid-on. Shot of the night for me

there's the riposte from Pradeep! Good length, angling in and straightening away outside off, Babar looks to drive on the up, but Pradeep finds some extra bounce and movement to foil Babar's plans. Nicked off to Banuka the debutant
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it down to long-off
shortish and moves away outside off, Babar gets on top of it and punches crisply to point
short and seaming into the hips, skids off the pitch, keeps gathering pace and pings the thigh
pitched up and outside off, slower variation, creamed to extra-cover
dipping full-toss on middle, whisked away to mid-on
short and hits the bat hard, spliced to cover
short and seaming back in, inside-edged onto the pad, rolls away to cover
back of a length and zips through outside off, Babar aims to run it down to third man, but can't touch it
short and homing in on off, Babar closes the face and leading-edges it back to the bowler

Pradeep knocks over Pakistan's best batsman! Fuller and angling into middle from over the wicket, a crease-bound Babar swings for the hills and only drags it back onto the stumps via a thick inside edge
length ball around off, comes forward and punches it towards mid-on, right from the middle of the bat but straight towards the fielder
length ball outside off, goes for the pull but doesn't middle it, gets a couple to deep square leg
length ball outside off, stands tall and taps it towards covers
pitched up and outside off, drilled through the line to mid-off, where Udana fumbles, allowing the ball to burst through his hands
pulled, but straight to Powell at long-on. Flat hit
wrists a full delivery on middle and leg towards square leg
full delivery on off stump, squeezed back to the bowler. Pollard hurls the ball back at the striker's end in frustration
95kph, flighted higher outside off, he square drives to deep point
he skips out early, Agar goes round arm, 93kph, sliding it into the pads, it bounces away for a leg bye
charges early again, dropped in shorter, he stands up and drives to long on

run out by a direct hit going for two! Warner unbelievable from deep midwicket! Babar just knocked this outside the circle at midwicket, he ran one to reach his 12th T20I fifty, he called for two, Warner raced in off the rope, picked up one hand and whipped the throw in off balance, and hit the base of the striker's stumps! Babar dived but was inches short. Unreal from Warner
138kph, yorker, right on the money, he just digs it out. Brilliant delivery and equally well played
137kph, length ball across him, he flashes and misses trying to square drive
138kph, fuller outside off, he mistimes a drive slowly to mid off and runs with the stroke
138kph, fuller outside off, he reaches away from his body and miscues a drive to mid off
134kph, good length outside off, he tries to drive but drags it off the thick inside half off the bat through square leg to the sweeper
thumping square drive straight through Turner at point. It was a length ball and wide, he stands tall and crunches past Turner at point
swinging way down the leg side and rightly called wide again. Carey has to dive a long way
140kph, fired down the leg side and called wide

Given out LBW. He's been given and Babar reviews. This was full and shaping into the pad late. There was a big appeal and it carried to slip. There's no bat involved. Nothing on hot spot. RTS appears to say pad only. Daylight between bat and ball. Ball tracking is a little slow. We have to wait 30 seconds for ball tracking. Ball tracking says umpire's call! Clipping leg. It stays out LBW. It was just pitching in line and just clipping the outside of leg.
full delivery around off, worked away into the leg side
128 kph, good length outside off, nice lines, defended back
strays well down leg for a wide.
on a length around off, flicked away to mid-on. Fine, fine over. But would like to see SL attack more.
steps down, gets to the flight and drills a drive to extra cover. Terrific over from Pathirana
good length outside off, punched towards extra cover. Azam on the charge
full and wide outside off, skewed towards cover from the crease. Lovely lines
short and wide outside off, slashed down to third man

Sri Lanka are in raptures. And they should be. Pathirana has done Azam in with a lovely display of flight and loop. Tosses this one up outside off, Azam sees that flight and wants to go over cover, but doesn't account for turn, which there is. The ball rips past the outside edge and the wicketkeeper quickly takes off the bails in one motion. That's a proper, proper wicket, the man in form too
shortish on off stump, Babar gets in line with it and drills it through mid-on
shorter length, he's back and pulling to deep midwicket
137kph, shorter length, he's back and pulling with a short arm jab to deep midwicket
shorter, he's back and working this to deep midwicket
skips down and drives straight of long, Babar wants two but Asif sends him back. Babar yells at him. Easy two there
short outside off, he crunches a pull but picks out short midwicket who parries it away
and again! That's a cracker. Short of a length outside off, stand and deliver from Azam as he stands tall and drives through the covers
that's timed nicely as well, driven square but this time picks out cover
short outside off, driven from the back foot and finds short cover who has just been moved into position
that's another brilliant stroke, he's flying, as Starc drops short on his hip and it's a whip-pull to deep square leg
there's the yorker, at off stump, dug out to point and that just shaped back a fraction
short of a length outside off, square drives to point and Azam lets out a scream that he didn't find the gap. It's coming off the middle so far
back of a length outside off, opens the face and pushes into point
full at off stump, push and run towards mid-on...tight, but think he was safe. Takes him off strike again
full and straight, pushed into the covers
starts with a reasonably flat delivery, driven to deep cover

gives him lbw! Udana is the man with the golden arm, whether it is throwing from the deep, or bowling it to one of Pakistan's best batsmen. This is a fuller delivery, pitching on off stump, and starting to shape back into Babar. The right-hander flicks across the line, and doesn't connect with the ball. Huge appeal comes, and the umpire Shahab cedes to it. HawkEye says it would be missing off stump by several inches.
a googly, driven to long-off
tucked round the corner to short fine leg
touch shorter outside off, pushed to deep cover
some power in that! Swift footwork, skips down the pitch, and plays a stinging straight drive that almost takes Zampa's foot with it
taken from outside off through mid-on, Zampa chases himself and that's a well-worked two
a googly, he comes forward and it takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
short on the pads, paddles this wide of short fine leg...doesn't quite get hauled back in by McDermott running from deep square. He actually got there, but flicked it into himself
inside edge into the pads as he aims to leg
short of a length, worked to long-on
96kph, slid into leg, he glances it wide of short fine
93kph, looped full, he skips out and drives to long on, he pushes for two but hit it too well
drifting into middle, 93kph, he skips down and clips it to long on
nearly through him! Plays back to a skidding googly, manages to get the bat down in time and finds point...that was heading for middle stump
banged in back of a length, nips back and takes an inside edge into the pads
flight outside off, Babar straides forward and drives to long-off
short on leg, worked to deep midwicket for one.
a low full toss down leg, worked away to deep square leg. This has been a momentum-sucking innings from Babar
gets to the pitch of the ball and drives it to cover
dipping full toss outside off, punched to deep midwicket
turns it from middle and off towards midwicket, once again it was bowled just a touch too full
quality stroke from young Azam. Badree overpitches and he simply leans into the drive and caresses it past cover. Super timing
the wrong'un on leg stump, worked with the spin to midwicket
low full toss on the pads, flicked toward deep midwicket
starts off with a back of length delivery on middle, defended back down the pitch
punched into the gap at cover, the boundary rider comes in to stop that
beaten on the drive, peach of a delivery. The ball straightens after pitching on length around the fifth stump
lovely square drive, but straight to backward point
looks to squeeze that past cover, but didn't get underneath the flight, ball rolls back to the bowler
rocks back to play the pull, gets it into the gap, only to see Pollard slide and dive from nowhere to effect a super stop. He was airborne when he stopped that
skids across from off stump, pushed to cover
punched into the gap at cover for an easy single
backs away to punch a length ball straight to cover
opens the face of the bat late to run it down to third man
Taylor has made a mess of it at fine leg. Looked like it was straight down his throat, but he misjudged it completely. Short ball on middle and leg, Azam pulled and got away with it. Lucky runs
cuts and misses, it was too full outside off for him to attempt that stroke
he's clobbered that into the deep midwicket boundary. Angles a length ball back in, Azam picked the length early and swung across the line to get enough wood on it. Delightful stroke

looks like it slipped out of his hand to become a waist-high full toss, helped into the gap at deep square leg. <b> Called a free-hit <b>. Have to admit that was the right call. Clearly dew is playing its part.
full and angling into the pads, worked to wide long-on
cleverly done. It was fractionally short, he made room and then used the pace to beat short third man. Too cute!
another low full toss, Azam shovels one down to long-on. This hasn't been a great innings from Azam
full and straight, another fine yorker, all Azam can do is drive to long-on
superb yorker, on middle, carved down to third man for one. Not much Azam could do with that
full and wide again, this is just outside the tramline for a wide
shortish and wide outside off, carved past point for a couple
drifts on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
short and straight, worked away to deep midwicket
a low full toss is drilled down to long-on
short around off, sits up for Azam to pull to deep midwicket. Should have hit a gap there
full outside off, skids on. Azam stays back and drives to the sweeper cover
driven down the ground for another run
full outside off, driven to deep cover for one
a low full toss on middle, worked to deep midwicket
and that's four to finish. Full and wide outside off, Azam opens the bat face and carves the ball past point for four.
full and straight, worked to deep square leg for one
too much flight, overpitched outside off stump, drilled to long-off
short on middle and leg, well directed bouncer. Azam gets underneath the length and lets it go
good length outside off, punched away to long-on
short on leg, another single to deep square leg. This is just not good enough from Babar, 20 off 18. Maybe Miller fever
superb from Prasanna. Full and wide outside off, Azam runs down and carves the ball towards cover, Prasanna dives to his left to save some runs
full and straight, Azam flicks towards long-on. Another single.
another yorker on leg, nudged to deep midwicket for another single. Just five off it
full and straight, jammed back to the bowler. 22 off 22 now for Azam
full and straight, out comes the slog, inside-edged towards square leg for one
a high full toss on middle, shovelled to deep midwicket, another couple. Struggling for timing is Azam
full and very wide outside off, but inside the tramline. Terrific defensive bowling
full and wide outside off, slashed towards backward point for one
a thick outside edge races down to the third man boundary. Full and wide, Babar looks to go over cover but gets just the right amount of bat
short outside off, dabbed back to the bowler. That's fine bowling from Thisara, the lines are pretty good

Perera not having the greatest evening. A short delivery and straight, Azam jabs this through midwicket. The outfield ensures Perera can't get down, has to try and boot it into the field of play. Can't
helped to fine leg. Length ball angling down leg, he uses the pace to ease this towards the boundary. As a batsman, you can't ask for an easier delivery than that
the dart on the pads, nudged to square leg
flighted, Babar comes down again and punches through mid-on
bat and pad together as the batsman gallops down the pitch to negate the spin, a bit of an appeal but he was so far down
once again, way down the pitch at the point of impact ... Morgan thinks of the review as the ball deflects to the off side, but no
dragged down, hauled out to the leg side, that's a loose one from Rashid, and punished with a rollicking pull
nurdled to wide long-on, a decent finish to a previously tight over
banged in short, Babar ducks
tip and run, into the off side, sharp single as mid-off swoops
pushed through and whipped to leg
a slow-turning pie! Like a tin of Fray Bentos in the microwave, pongo-ed up and over midwicket!
better length, tucked to the leg side, and up comes a 31-ball fifty for the world's No.1 T20I batsman
fuller, straighter, pressed to cover
tossed up on a better length, Denly clawed that back well, as Babar settles for a measured push to cover
banged into the ribs, pulled calmly round the corner
short again, well directed, thudding into a mistimed pull as Babar loses sight of it
chopped into the covers
slammed on the up, and over the covers! It's an outswinging half-volley, picked early and panned to the rope, with an open face to beat the field. Lovely tonking
oops, another half-tracking honker, absolutely leathered over cow corner! Get those fingers warm, Joe!
yawned into the leg side, Jordan pounces with intent on the boundary's edge
Babar's on dance floor, raising the roof with a lofted drive into the stands! Sweetly struck and they're taking cover in the crowd at long-on!
flicks the googly away behind square for one more
length ball, around middle and off, blocked back to the bowler

what's this, chance of a run-out... Foakes misses from five yards away with Babar sprawling! It was a controlled punch into the covers, comfortable two but they then started for a third, Fakhar changed his mind and left Babar having to do a U-turn. But Foakes collected the throw in front of the wicket and somehow missed the stumps!
good length and prodded watchfully into the covers
over the wicket to Babar, no slip in and he drops back to angle the ball wide of the keeper, just a cheeky late dab and it runs to the rope! First four for Babar
straighter line, worked off the hip towards square leg
pitched up, 83mph and driven crisply but straight to extra cover
length, and he taps it down towards midwicket. Wants two, but will have to settle for one, as Miller was quick to attack the ball
bit of width, 85mph and Babar uses that to his advantage to larrup a cut through backward point for four more - 15 off the over and that's a timely bump for the Pakistan run rate
full on the pads and this is clipped in front of the sweeper at square leg for two
too full, in the slot, belted through the covers for four! That's a strong area for Babar - and he's not No. 1 in the world for nothing
slower ball from Curran, who then races down the wicket to field as Babar looks to his partner retreating to his ground at the non-striker's
length ball angling in on off, taking the pace off this time, 76mph and Babar waits for it to dab one to third man
fired in straight, drifting leg side as it deflects off the pads... Jordan goes up in appeal, but umpire Gough isn't interested
tossed up nice and full on middle and off, Babar drives it back to the bowler
wide of off stump, possible a googly and it's whipped through midwicket coming forwards
floated up and tapped to leg
just a hint of wobble outside off, Babar dabs at it late and is beaten
slower ball, looped onto a good length, well played but more or less picked, rolling out to no-man's land at deep midwicket
back of a length, cutter, chopped to cover
slower ball, angled into the top of the stumps, calmly deflected through third man
full and straight, 137 kph, pushed back. An untidy start from Pakistan
outswing, full and wide outside off, 123 kph, driven to mid-off
good single. 123 kph, around off, worked to wide mid-on for one
a high full toss on middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket. Should have been put away for six. Won't get a better ball all innings
worked away into the gap at midwicket. A disastrous Powerplay for Pakistan, 22 for 4!
just wide of Taylor at slip. Short and wide outside off, Azam cuts, extra bounce, takes the outside edge and flies past Rosco at slip. No chance for him at all
pushed through, full delivery outside off, patted to point.
short, and he takes it off his helmet visor, and hooks it away towards long leg for four. TOP SHOT!
nicely bowled, much slower through the air, and wider outside off, dabbed in front of point for a run
the googly around off, worked to midwicket for one. Maybe New Zealand need to tighten up because this is exactly what Pakistan want right now
full just outside off, driven early, but falls short of cover. Good recovery from Keemo
good length outside off, and pulled along the ground. Straight to deep midwicket. First runs
back of a length on middle, and turned off his hips to midwicket. Misfield by the infielder, that allows Babar two free runs. Went through Samuels' hands there
short and wide! Gets on top of this delivery, and cuts past backward point! No stopping that
lots of bounce on the legbreak again, full and wide outside off, beats Azam on the drive. Even the keeper can't collect cleanly
full and straight, 82 kph, defended. Pakistan 39 for 6 after 10 overs.
very quick on middle and leg, worked to square leg
length, and he plays it towards point and picks up a single
width on offer, and Azam lays into it, forcing it through the covers
fuller ball, and he defends a ball angling into him at 132 kph
short, and angles across Azam. Slower through the air, and it is called wide for starting from outside off and moving further away
length, angled across him, and he pokes it down towards point and takes a quick single. Close, had the fielder hit there, but he would have been home
short in length, angles across him, and he flogs it down towards short midwicket
looks for a slower ball, full, but cooks it down the leg side, and wide
length ball, and he drives it straight back down the wicket. Mid on does well to get a hand to it and stop it from running down for four. Uppish when it went past the bowler, though
length ball, angles into him, and he plays it towards short midwicket and takes on Reeza Hendricks. Just makes it in the end, as the shy at the stumps misses. Would have been out, in fact!

two wickets in the over! And though this won't count as Archer's wicket, he's made it happen. Chasing down the leg-side flick in his followthrough, gathering well, with two stumps to aim at, and pinging down Babar's timbers as he strove to make his ground!
slower full toss, and he is able to maneouvre it away towards midwicket. They look for two...and get it again!
short, and fast, but too short. Called a wide, as Azam ducked inside a ball bowled at 142kph
outside off, and he runs it down towards third man with the open face of the bat. Top shot!
length, outside off, bowled at 142kph, and he runs it down towards point and takes a quick single
length, angling across him, and he drops it down towards point
short, and down the leg side, and he swings it away towards long leg, and PICKS UP SIX! That was so well timed...he just used the pace of the ball
great ball! Pitches on a length, and then bounces awkwardly back into him. He was looking to get the ball away on the on side, and the ball rose enough to beat the bat and hit his right forearm
short, and he has tried to whip it away towards long leg. Misses, as it goes through towards Cloete. Bowler and keeper look convinced about it, but they haven't referred it in the end
goes back to a length ball, and cuts it towards point
short, and along the pads this time, and he whips it away towards long leg
sliding across from over the wicket, towards the tramlines, again no movement and Babar accepts the freebie
goes fuller, 79mph on off and Babar slices one down to third man
length, and he advances a step down the pitch before whipping him away towards long leg

presses forward and flicks a length ball towards midwicket. They have gone through for two, and the ball is returned to Cloete, who whips the bails off. The ball was a bit high for the keeper, and that allows Azam to just make it. Referred, but given not out
short, and he gets up on his toes and steers it towards third man
short, and he rolls his wrists as he guides it off the back foot towards long leg
shimmies down the pitch, and tries a hoick down the ground. Miscues it and gets it over towards long leg
length ball, turns in from middle, and he goes back and drops it down towards long leg
drops a length ball towards midwicket, and they run through for two. Extremely good running between the wickets!
length ball, and he flicks it towards midwicket. Has to be content with one this time
chips down the wicket, and goes inside out to a length ball. BOOM!
flicks a length ball turning into him, and guides it to the left of short fine leg
makes the bowler go full, and he can nudge a straight ball down towards long leg
length, outisde off, and he pushes it towards covers and picks up a single

full ball, and he looks to launch it down the ground, inside-edges it on between his legs towards the keeper. Klaasen has a go at the non-striker's end. It would have been the end of Azam again! Survives a second time in two overs!
short, wide, and he latches on to it with a vicious off drive, but there's a man at the extra cover fence to clean this up
length, outside off, and he looks to steer it towards third man, but Hendricks dives away to his left with a dive and saves his team three runs!
tries a fuller ball, but gets it wide of the tramlines. Attempted a fast off cutter, but began way outside the off stump
full, fast, at 139kph, and he is able to squirt it away towards short third man. Sipamla shapes to throw, but then lets it be, lest it run away for overthrows

short, and he has latched on to it...but it has carried to midwicket! Slower ball, that grips, and he looks for the release shot, but is effectively going against the turn, and ends up lobbing it up in the air. Is that the ballgame gone for Pakistan?
full ball, and he chips it over the bowler, and fielded by the man at long off
DELICATE! Allows the ball to turn back into him, and then just late cuts it fine enough to tease the fielder at short third man. Morris tries his best, but cannot pull it back
down the wicket, and goes inside out to a length ball outside off. Sublime! All the way through covers
goes for a big slog, and is able to get an inside edge towards long leg. Beats van der Dussen down there, though he intended to send this ball towards midwicket
tossed up outside off, and he whips it away towards midwicket
floated up around the offstump, but quicker at 92kph, and he has to defend
chips down the wicket, and Shamsi drops it shorter and straighter. He plays it with the turn towards long leg
tossed up, outside off, bowled at 89kph, and he presses forward to defend
tossed up, and he drives, but gets it straight to short midwicket
short, and he pulls it towards midwicket
fuller, outside off, and he drives it out towards extra cover
leg-cutter, delivered at 127kph, on a good length outside off, and beats Azam's outside edge as he looks to steer it towards third man
driven towards covers. Taken the pace off this completely, bowled at 126kph
full and straight, and he plays it back towards the bowler. Two dots on the bounce against Azam!
clubbed with plenty of bottom hand down to long on
length, and he tucks it away off the legs towards midwicket
slower ball, appeared to have been bowled off the side of the hand, and Azam plays it late by nurdling it away towards midwicket
length, outside off, and he cuts it, but the man at point stops it comfortably. Great work by Reeza Hendricks, diving away to his right
comes down the wicket, and deposits a length ball over long on for SIX! Perhaps the bowler paying the price for overdoing the slower ball a bit?
length, outisde off, and he gets it off the top end of the bat as he shapes to cut. Gets it fine down to third man
plays a length ball with the turn, back towards the bowler
length ball, just wide outside off, and Babar looks to drive. Misses
80 kph, flight outside off, driven to cover
length ball angling into his body, and tucked off his waist to square leg
back of a length, wide outside off, and he stands tall, before pulling over mid-wicket for the game's first four!
eased down the ground! This was so well placed as Babar had mid on to beat, and mid off charging around as he stepped forward to drive
turned around the corner for four! Babar is on the charge here, and he swivels into a pull to a short ball, easing the ball down to long leg
beautifully steered by Babar, who opens the face of the bat very late to run the ball down past a diving short third man. Not the worst delivery, but it's excellently played
full and wobbling around on off stump at 134km/h, Babar driving to mid off
very full on off stump, and Babar drives. Miller runs around from mid on and puts in a dive to stop what could have been another boundary. He's electric in the field
width again, but this time Babar cuts over the top of it, a bottom edge bouncing towards gully
BOOM! Three in a row from Babar. And this is the best of the lot. Full, but again it's wide from Beuran and Babar leans into a cracking cover drive
yeaaah! Full and wide outside off, a swingy half-volley outside off. Pace off the ball. Driven through the gap between mid-off and cover. Yummy
thumped out of the middle this time! It's another length ball from Beuran, and he offers Babar width outside off. Again he frees his arms, this time lacing the ball over point
short, and he whips it away towards long leg
short, outside off, and he nurdles it down to third man
he uses his feet to get closer to a length ball, and whips it towards long leg
length ball, turning back into Azam, who chips it down towards short fine leg
short, and he uses his feet to advance to the ball and then plays a forehand down the line almost. The ball lands just short of du Plessis at mid off
length, and he taps it down towards third man
full, and he plays it towards midwicket with the turn. They look for two, but hte fielder attacks the ball and ensures they can only stay with one
edged over the top of slip! Babar through his hands at the first delivery, which was angled across him, and sliced an edge over the top of a leaping slip fielder
turned into the leg side now, and they rush back for a second
Babar is up on his toes to ride the bounce on a rising delivery outside off, angling the ball through the gully
some seam movement in to the right hander for Sipamla, and Babar uses the angle to find a single behind square on the leg side
length ball, wide outside off again, and drilled through point! Stays on the back foot, and hammers a back-foot punch for back-to-back boundaries
full, just outside off stump, and defended with soft hands. Ball rolls back to Dala
big appeal from Shamsi as he finds some purchase and spins the ball in to hit Babar's front pad, but it's high and the umpire says no
a hint of spin in to the right hander, and he works with it to collect a single into the leg side
slower ball from Dala, but Babar spots it and nudges the ball into the leg side
and again! Babar is unstoppable. Dala tries to correct his line, but instead offers a short, wide ball outside off, Babar clubbing his cut - again well in front of square
full on off stump, and worked off his toes past the fielder at midwicket! Excellent timing, and the ball sprints away to the cow-corner boundary
plays an upper cut over short third man! Short ball, just outside off, and Babar backs away... waits for the ball to get to him... and then steers a cheeky shot over the infield
length ball angling in, and pulled along the ground to deep backward square. Seventeen off that over
length ball, wide outside off, and the cut has been edged past first slip! Diving effort not good enough from the cordon, and that's another boundary added to Babar's account
back of a length just outside off, and he rides the bounce to steer a shot to third man
length ball, wide outside off, and Babar can't help himself. Tries to smoke a cut through the off-side, but he's toe-ended the shot, and point dives to his right to take a smart catch
Dala slips his line down the leg side, and Babar just needed to help the ball on its way down to fine leg to bring up the team fifty
and Babar welcomes him to the crease with a crunching pull, well in front of square and past a diving midwicket fielder
and the change-up is a full one on off stump, Babar nudging a single to mid off
beaten on the cut. Beuran has possibly got away with one here, offering width outside off but beating Babar's cut. Just ran his fingers over the ball
and an excellent finish to the over for Sipamla, who keeps Babar quiet with a tight line
Babar skips out to drive, but pings mid off
another googly outside off, back of the hand, nudged to long-on. A batsman has got to 10
full outside off, driven away from his body, but mistimed. Only to cover
shortish and wide, carved to point
angled in on middle and leg, flicked away to short fine leg
risky pull shot, just wide of mid-on. Too short and Babar pulls but does not find the middle of the bat, Pollard dives to his left but the ball just about gets away from him
tries to flick and wears it on the pad. Too high and the appeal is turned down
good length, just outside off, waits for it before tapping it with soft hands. Opens the face of his bat late as the ball goes to the right of the keeper
too full and on the stumps, drilled straight back to the bowler
short, this time it is sitting up nicely and Azam lays into a pull shot. Clobbers it through midwicket
back of a length and angling in, tucked away to the left of deep square leg
sprays this attemped yorker down leg, batsman misses a neat little tickle for runs.
full and angling in, clipped off the toes through square for one
googly, not picked by the batsman. Slides straight through and misses the inside edge and goes just over leg stump
gets down for a scoop and guides it over the short fine leg region for two
fuller, driven off the front foot to long-off
fuller and outside off, knocks it very hard down to long-off
flat, on a length, spinning in on the pads, tucked away to deep backward square leg for one. That brings up the fifty of the partnership
another full toss on off stump, punched to long-off

on a length, tucked off the pads through square leg. And, guess what! There is a misunderstanding between the two fielders converging on it. Deep midwicket to his right and deep backward square leg running to his left. Nobody calls and they end up looking at each other as the ball goes to the boundary
a fumble from Taylor at point, short and wide, slashed to point. Taylor misfields and allows one
drifts in a full delivery on middle, squeezed to long-on
picks the gap. Lovely. Too short, he made the room and then crashed this cut behind point. No chance for the boundary rider
works this length ball on middle towards long-on
very full and does not give the batsman any room by angling it in, driven down to long-on for one
full, on the pads, pushed down to wide long-on for one
fullish, outside off, dabs it to the left of the midwicket region They think of the second but decide against it
good length, outside off, punched away to covers off the front foot
pulls from outside off, hit really hard but straight to the fielder
loses control of it, seems like it slipped out of his hands and bowls a full toss, flicked away to midwicket
good length, waits for it to come on before nudging it in front of the pads to square leg for one
tries to flick and closes the face of his bat very early, gets a leading edge to backward point
drilled but straight to cover
