flat, back of a length and spinning away, cut hard but straight to cover
width and he crashes this on the up to deep point
good length, outside off, punched crisply to covers off the front foot
short of a length, angled in, tucked off the hips to deep midwicket
too full on leg, squeezes it out to mid-off for one
better comeback, a drifty delivery back in, a slower ball, punched to mid-off. "No, no, no, no" yells Azam
delectable. But have to check the other requisite of boundary-scoring, placement. Full outside off, Azam leans into a drive and finds cover
a bit straight and Azam nudges Morkel through square leg. There is fine leg in place, probably because of Morkel's pace, the ball is likely to go behind square as opposed to in front of it
a slower delivery outside off, chipped to mid-off. Really quick outfield
full and straight again, pushed away towards mid-on. Tight bowling from Morkel
a short slow delivery outside off, Azam can't get bat on his drag-pull. Clever bowling
the other side of short fine leg. Tripe from Perera. Full on the pads, and Azam flicks him to short fine leg's left. Simple batting basics
full and straight, attacking the pads, driven to mid-on with some inward seam movement
good stop. A slower ball outside off, sliced to point for a run. Elliott dives to his left to save three
on the pads from cutting to start, doesn't want to give width, nudged to deep square leg
fullish delivery outside off, dabbed down towards backward point for a run. Nicely played
superb stroke. Finding the gap is all that is required on this outfield. A googly outside off, Azam runs down and drives through cover
flat and wide outside off, punched to cover from the crease
on the pads from Tahir, Azam clips this nicely through square leg for a couple. A big gap in front of midwicket
edged and flies away for four. Short outside off, not as much width, but Azam goes through with a cut anyway. Gets a thick outside edge. No slip in place
short outside off, sitting up nicely for him to punch that away. Lovely timing.
too straight, poor delivery. Azam gets a bit of bat on that, flicks him through fine leg for four. Too easy for Azam, two good shots, two boundaries.
full-toss on middle, bunted to mid-on
flat, on a length, lets it spin away before punching it from the crease to covers
tossed up on leg, eased down to long-on
short of good length ball, angling in, tucked away with the angle
sliding in with the arm, too full on leg, pushed down to long-on for one
punches this length delivery to long-on
clever! Opened the bat face at the last moment to play this delicate late cut to the third man boundary
half-volley on the pads, a whirl of the wrists sends the ball away to the midwicket boundary - first of the night
lets this through his legs at long-on. Oh, Rovman Powell. That's very poor. This was too short, he rocked back and flat-batted. Should've been stopped
slower length ball angling in, worked to deep square leg

superb shot. Can hardly hear myself think. It's short outside off, Babar gets on top of the bounce and pulls through square leg, terrific shot, intentionally all along the ground. The crowd goes wild, and then music is blaring on top of that. Fantastic
good length delivery outside off, left alone from Azam
su-weeeet from Babar, but the ball plugs in the outfield. Back of a length and outside off, hits on the up and hits through the line. The ball skips away to the right of the covers
hip-high short ball outside off, sits up, but Babar simply flaps a pull to mid-on's right
pitched up and outside off, Babar tips forward and scoops it to mid-off
slaps this length ball to deep point
length ball angling into middle and leg, works this towards deep midwicket
on a length, tucked away to backward square leg
steps out and turns this indrifter towards midwicket
good length on off and angling right in. Punched off the back foot to mid on
punches this length delivery to cover
good length, but slower. Tapped to the off side with soft hands, and Babar calls for the quick single
tossed up at leg stump, inside edge onto pad as he stays in his crease and tries to flick this to deep midwicket. Gets a single to short third man instead
good length, uses the angle to flick it to deep square
good length just outside off, but coming into Babar. Tries to cut it square but too close to his body. Past his outside edge
back of a length at off stump, stands tall and punches it past the diving extra cover fielder. Sweeper puts in a slide after running to his right
good length on off, stands tall and smacks this past midwicket! Muscled, and sent to the deep mid-wicket boundary
good length on middle, and going down leg. Babar shuffles across to the off side and drags this behind square on the leg side. Easily turned off his pads past deep backward square
slower ball, tossed up wide outside off stump, driven to point who puts in a dive and quickly throws it back to the bowler....who has a shy at the striker's end and misses

appeal for lbw, and given! The umpire took his time, but finally raised his finger. It was a yorker on leg stump, and Babar missed the leg-side flick. It hit his boot, and the only doubt was whether it was going down the leg side. Babar's not reviewing.
gets a good stride forward as he eases this length ball to cover
floats this full on the stumps from wide of the crease, flicked into the gap at midwicket
good length at off stump, tucks it behind square on the leg side
good length just outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
good length, pithches on middle stump and beats his glance down the leg side as he walks across the stumps
good length at middle stump, whipped off the back foot to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off stump, cut straight to sweeper cover
dropped. Good length, wide outside off. He wants to drive this on the up. Thick outside edge that hits Walton on the chest as he fumbles this chance
back of a length outside off, mistimed punch, just evades extra cover's left to bring up the fifty partnership
lovely. Good length, flat at middle stump, he's down on one knee and slaps this off the middle, full balance, over the midwicket boundary
back of a length at middle stump, driven off the back foot to long-on
full at the pads, uses his wrists to work it to short fine
good length, tossed up at middle stump, forward defence

slower ball, full outside off, throws his hands at it and gets a thick outside edge that runs past Narine at short third man...who goes around the ball rather than towards it, chases it and awkwardly keeps it in
good length at middle stump, doesn't get to the pitch after stepping out, pushes straight to midwicket
good length at off stump, slices it to point
handsome. Shuffles across, stands tall and slams this pull shot past long-on from outside off stump. Superb.
good length on middle, turned off his pads to deep backward square. Man there
shuffles across and whips this full ball to deep midwicket
full at off stump, driven to long-off
good length at off stump, back foot punch to find sweeper cover
short at middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, flicked to deep square
good length at off stump, inside half on the forward push, straight to midwicket
good length at middle stump, deep in the crease, tucked behind square
driven firmly towards wide mid-off
gets down to sweep and the ball goes down the leg side as he misses
fuller ball, launches it with the inward drift over deep midwicket with a straight bat
tries to pull but it is not short enough, does not sit up too well and the ball goes on the bounce in front of deep midwicket
comes down the track and flicks with the spin to deep square leg
on the pads, flicked away to deep square leg
on the pads, misses and wears it on the pads
backs away and cuts to cover point. Can't pick the gap
drifting into middle and leg, eased down to long-on
width and put away. Too short outside off, Azam punches this away through the frontfoot. Lovely. Opened the bat face late to pick the gap
slash and a miss. Looked for a repeat of the previous delivery - another cut - this time off the backfoot, but played a touch too late.
goes for the same delivery again but not quite there. Low full toss, pushed along the ground wide of long-on for one
slants a length ball into the pads and Babar uses the pace to pick this behind square leg. Just helped it along
stunning drive, shot of the day. All class, all grace, pure timing. Not all that full, but he planted forward and simply laced this on the up between cover and mid-off.
dabs this gently into the leg side as they scamper a run. Risky

tries to improvise and pays the price for it. Gets down to paddle it but the ball is not full enough for him to be able to do that. It is on a length, he fails to make the late adjustment and cannot deal with the bounce from one knee down. Misses and the ball crashes into middle stump
short and wide, slapped to sweeper cover off the back foot
full at middle stump, puts a stride across the stumps and dangerously tucks it fine
doesn't finish the job. Back of a length at off stump, stands up and goes for that trademark pull on the up. Gets it off the bottom and finds substitute Rovman Powell at midwicket
good length at leg stump, tucked behind square on the leg side
quick on middle and leg, flicked to deep midwicket
length on middle, he uses his wrists to work this nicely into the gap at deep midwicket
tossed up at off stump, driven to sweeper cover
good length at off stump, wants to push this through the off side, but the googly gets him on the inside half and it rolls back to the bowler
good length at middle stump, back foot punch to long-on
back of a length, spins in sharply at leg stump, bat turns and it rolls to long-on as he tries to punch it through the off side
good length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
tossed up slowly at off stump, driven to long-of
slow through the air outside off, chipped to long-off
tossed up at middle stump, steps out and whips it off the inside half to beat midwicket. Not middled, allows Holder to run across from deep square and put in a long dive to save two
pitched up outside off, flicked to wide long-on
short of a length, angled across, punched to cover
slower ball angling into middle and leg stump, and Munro, who is in an open position, can only poke it back to the bowler
back of a length on middle, whipped away to deep midwicket

ooh, that's a stunning effort from Chakabva. Munro went for the reverse-slap to the back-of-a-length ball from Mpofu, and ended up top-edging it. It looped over the keeper, to his right, and he ran backwards, threw himself full length, and got one glove to the ball but couldn't hold on to it
this time it isn't as full as the previous ball, and he can get some elevation on that smack down the ground, hits it hard over the umpire
flicks a length ball between deep midwicket and long-on

full on off stump, and there's that power from Munro again, his front leg isn't too close to the pitch of the ball, which gives him room to swing through the line, with a lot of bottom hand, and smack that hard between the stumps and non-striker
short of good length, extra bounce as it nips away past the flashing outside edge
full and angled across, opens up and mistimes his slap to cover
tasty line from Willey, shaping in and then whizzing through past the outside edge as Munro pokes gingerly from the crease
slides across off with the arm, pushes forward and gets an outside edge to third man
quick first ball for Munro to deal with, 146kph, he's not sure how to deal with it, back of length and over the stumps, he looks to jab it to the off side, beaten
a reverse-sweep for four from Munro, what a way to get off the mark, powerfully hit past the man at deep point,  four more
slower one, full and outside off, nudged towards deep square leg
full ball on the pads, clipped towards deep square leg for one more
full ball following the batsman, inside-edges it away behind square leg
short ball, too high, over Munro's head and that's a wide
goes for the reverse once more, can't connect this time
that stayed quite low, Munro does well to get bat on it outside off, defended to the off

length ball is swiped towards deep midwicket, he picks out the man in the deep, and this is turning out to be a superb over from Tahir, three dot balls and a wicket, Tahir is off on his usual extravagant celebrations
full and wide outside off, slogged towards the leg side but not off the middle of the bat. Oh, no. He's overstepped. Free hit
traps him! Full on off stump, and Munro misses the leg-side flick after walking across to the off side. Hits him full in front of off stump, and the umpire raises his finger for the lbw
on the charge straight away, down the pitch and whips in the air over square leg, there's a man out there
tally ho! Munro launches himself down the track again and this time he takes a fair chunk out of Willey, hitting him off his length over mid-on and away for his first boundary
drags his length down as Munro mounts his charger again, this time a cross-batted swipe bobbles to mid-off
back of a length, Munro stays in the crease and nudges to leg
pitched up on the pads, Jordan appeals as Munro swishes across the line and misses... landed outside leg before thumping the front pad
skidding on and hitting the thigh pad, I think, as he played back, drops into a gap

he's absolutely blootered this! Straight back down the ground for four! Plunkett grimaces, feeling the pain again, he went full and straight but Munro made room and creamed an agricultural drive past the bowler, all along the floor
steps away and shovels to leg, this has come off the inside edge but it flies past the man on the edge of the ring for four
there he goes again, three in a row! Genuine pick-up off the body, coming forward and whipping the hands through, arcing the ball over backward square leg, one-bounce four - and that's the NZ 50 up
slower ball, Munro waits for it and attempts to dab fine... doesn't connect
back of a length, comes down the pitch and miscues a whack into the covers
pushed through on the stumps, stands back and punches to long-on
checks a flick against the spin and chips it in the air, through the vacant spaces at mid-on
length ball outside off, slower ball, swiped down the ground to long-on
moves back and across and whips the ball along the ground off his pads to deep square leg
down the track and he bowls it flat on middle stump. Gets his front leg out of the way again but hits it straighter this time, right out of the screws and over the wide long-on boundary
not quite short enough for the pull, plays it down quietly to midwicket
down the track comes Munro and the length isn't full enough for the drive over cover. Hits high on the bat and runs down to third man
fullish close to off stump, doesn't quite come on for the off-drive, and he plays it into the leg side off the inner half of his bat
the googly spins away from the left-hander and beats Munro's poke off the back foot
driven back to the bowler, a chance for SL to string together some dots to Munro?
played back to the bowler once again

and he's done it! That is amazing from Munro, he's hit seven sixes in 14 balls. Guptill's 19-ball record for fastest NZ fifty has lasted all of 20 minutes. Munro ends the game by mowing the ball off the front foot over deep square. The slaughter of Sri Lanka is over. Munro's 14-ball fifty is the second fastest 50 in T20 internationals, behind Yuvraj Singh's 12-ball innings
a full toss outside off stump, Munro hits it flat over the infield at cover for a four
a full ball outside off stump, chopped into the ground and towards the keeper
sprayed wide outside the off stump from over the wicket ...
catch it in the stands beyond long off! Munro gets under a full ball and slams it high and far, and it has been caught in the crowd
tries to hit on the leg side but gets an inside edge on the pad towards the off side
Munro charges again, and dispatches the slower ball from wide outside the off stump over the cow corner boundary, incredible hitting
bowled quick into the left-hander from around the wicket, worked off the pads through midwicket
got him! Top, top class from Marsh - he's frustrated Munro for an over and an impetuous, angry, ill-advised front-footed pull picks out deep midwicket who clings on
this is class from Marsh, a slower-ball off-cutter. Munro's all at sea and mis-reads it, stepping to leg and missing it completely
again, very good length from Marsh - full, but not a half-volley, leaving Munro in two minds whether to go forward or back. All he can do is defend back to Marsh
good line and length. Munro looks annoyed with himself as he picks out cover
this spins past Munro's ugly heave, beating him and the keeper for four.
switch-hit podcast! Munro switches to become a right-hander and, staying low, pulls this for four. Remarkable power
tossed up - really gave this a lot of air - but Munro picks out a very short mid-off
shot! That's a flat, golf drive. Full on off stump and he just stood there, cleared his front leg a touch, and flat-batted that back over the bowler's head
pulled off his hip for a single
pulls his length ball just a touch, and sends in a quick one that jags in a touch - 145kph. Munro looks to slog into the leg side and it ricochets off his pad into the off side
flat, quick, back of a length, angling into leg stump, punched to long-on
full on middle, Anwar pulls pace off it. Worked through midwicket
bowled him! That was very full outside off, almost a yorker, and he jabbed at it with an angled bat looking to squeeze it through point, and all he could do was inside-edge it into his stumps
full-toss outside off, plays a checked push to sweeper cover

bam. Follows up with a short ball, sits up at a nice height outside off and Munro swivels to pull it away over the square leg boundary. Follows up his 14-ball half-century against Sri Lanka with a 25-ball fifty here, against a better bowling attack. Well played!
full, follows Munro's movement away from leg stump, and he misses the flick and the ball hits him low on the pads
length ball on leg stump, reverse-sweeps firmly to the deep point fielder
tossed up on off stump and he gets down on one knee for the slog-sweep, hits it to the right of the fielder at deep midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
full on middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler
slower ball on off stump, clears his front leg, adjusts to let it come on, and whips it away towards deep backward square leg
length ball on middle stump, opens up and clubs it away through backward square leg
quick short ball, gets big on Munro, who's late on the hook, and he top-edges it all the way over the fine leg boundary
quick length ball angling down leg. Looks to walk across and whip over short fine leg, can't connect. Rolls off the pad to short fine leg
length ball sliding on towards leg stump, misses the sweep and it runs off the pad into the off side. Big appeal, but it pitched outside leg
A full ball on the pads, Munro continues to take the pressure off, slog-sweeping flat and far over deep square leg

follows up with the short ball and Munro plays it cleverly, late, just letting it rise over his back shoulder and leaning away to ramp it to the short boundary at third man, almost right behind the keeper
full on off stump and it's right in the slot for Munro's big, free swing to launch that down the ground and into the sightscreen
down the track and Gul looks to slant it wide of Munro, but he gets down low and reaches it with his hands, flat-bats powerfully over the extra cover fielder
another slower ball but this one is short, and it sits up at waist height for Munro to clear his front leg and club away high over the midwicket boundary
slower ball, angling away from off stump from a fullish length. Munro clears his front leg, slogs, and misses
back of a length on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
quick bouncer outside off, rises steeply, over the bat as Munro leans back looking to ramp over the keeper
low full toss outside off, crunched to deep cover
switch, reverse, paddle! Remarkable stroke really - switched to a right-hander before dabbing it to fine leg (or third man) for four
ooooh that's a naughty single, very naughty. Coulter Nile picks it up at mid-off and under-arms a return while on the move, but misses
fired in flat and fast. Munro punches out to cover
Munro opens his shoulders and smacks it to long-off with disparaging intent
another single to poor old Agar, though this time he collects it and wings back in a throw. Can't prevent the single
solidly punched to mid-off and Agar's asleep - his fumble bringing a single
the slower ball, Munro is beaten by the change of pace and the ball bounces over his stumps
poor Vandersay, he disappears again, Munro getting under a full ball and mowing it over deep square leg with a slog sweep
goes over long off this time, stepping out to a full ball and driving it hard and flat over the boundary
beaten outside the off stump this time
New Zealand blaze past 100, Munro takes them there by clearing his front foot and slogging the ball with the turn high and far over deep midwicket
bowled flat and shorter, Munro goes back and pulls the ball from outside off towards cow corner
that's a huge hit second ball! Steps out of his crease to a full ball and carts it over long on with a full swing of the bat
gets on the front foot and swings across the line, makes no contact and is hit on the pad
caught and bowled! Kulasekara sends down another clever slower ball on a  good length outside off, Munro charged and played too early, he ended up popped it tamely back to the bowler
the slower ball goes between the batsman and leg stump, that was 103 kph, Munro had a swing at it but swung too early
driven hard into the covers, he's gone if there's a direct hit at the bowler's end but the throw misses
short ball and it disappears in a blur over deep midwicket, clears his front foot and pulls hard, hitting it flat and powerfully
in the blockhole, Munro tries to work it on the leg side but is beaten past leg stump
oh my word! There was a long off in place and he had to move only a little to his left to get to that ball but Munro's lofted drive was so powerful that the fielder had no chance

he's dropped a sitter! Jayasuriya will want the ground to open up and disappear. Munro reverse swept the ball towards deep point and that ball hung in the air for a while, giving Jayasuriya plenty of time to get under it
goes back and towards leg to work the ball off the pads towards deep midwicket, a fumble allows the second to be run easily
driven to long off for a single
too short and flicked through midwicket for a jogged single
fuller from Watson and timed, nicely, for a single past mid-on
Munro stands tall and with long levers powers this to long-off
comes forward but there's more bounce than he realises, and it's pushed out just short of a diving cover! Coulter-Nile so nearly dives forward to cling on but grasses it
cut off the back foot to point, only four off that over
a bouncer. Munro's not interested
down the pitch and Munro, sporting chewing gum and an active jaw motion, smacks it into the ground back to Watto. Shane leaps, collects, then shies a throw at the stumps, as is his wont
short of a length, Munro is in an awful position really - tries to slap this to mid-off? I'm not even sure  what he was trying, but the ball is wellied out to cover with no power
hit hard off the back foot through cover
down the pitch to a fuller, but leg-side, delivery and clumped out to long-on
goes back to drive through cover but gets an edge towards short third man, Williamson races through for the single
reverse-hit to deep extra cover
pushed off the front foot to long on for one more
worked off the pads with the angle into him through square leg
hit to long on for one more
once again he can't get under the ball to give it any power, driven to long on
opens the face and smacks it to point
ooh, Munro's down the pitch but can't get more than a single - crashed to long-off
and another single, pushed off the back foot through point, NZ are getting stuck here
slog swept to deep midwicket for ... another single
finally for NZ! Munro gives the bowler the charge and lofts the ball cleanly straight down the ground, this time he managed to get under the full ball. 22 singles before that six
edged! An ugly cross-batted swipe from Munro and he gets an under-edge to the keeper. Or in fact, through the keeper's legs for a single
and now he pulls out the reverse hit, smashing the ball behind point for consecutive boundaries. NZ up and running again
driven hard back at the bowler, who takes the pace off it as it travels to long off
driven hard off the front foot, a low full toss that was, he finds the man at cover though
piffle. Wide, wide, wide of off
short on middle, controlled pull to deep midwicket

slung down well outside off, Munro gives chase... and slices it h-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-g-h straight to third man! Another key breakthrough for England, Munro was flying but Plunkett has lassoed him to the ground, clearly a plan to try and frustrate him and a wild hack went straight to Moeen walking a few yards in from the fence
fired across the bows from over the wicket, too much width, one to the extra column
gets on the front foot and drives a length ball to long on, Munro's boundary drought is now 23 balls long
Munro steps out and uses a bit more power than he has all innings to chip the ball towards long on, gets to the fielder on the first bounce
driven off the front foot along the ground to long off for a single
pushed from the crease, gently, through point for a single, don't think Munro has hit a shot in anger today
short of a length outside off, Munro drags it to deep midwicket with the pull
goes back and works the ball through midwicket for a single
stays back and hits the ball through square leg
played from the crease to midwicket
defended on the leg side
defended on the front foot towards midwicket, awkwardly

a big appeal for lbw as Munro comes forward to defend and gets hit by one that pitches around off and turns into the left-hander to hit low on the front pad, that looked plumb. Hitting middle. The middle of middle. Shakib cannot believe it.
Munro moves forward and outside off, almost to the pitch of the ball to smother the cut, and taps the ball towards mid-on for a single

he's cut him up with the cutter but Munro survives! It pitches on a good length outside off and nips into the left-hander, Munro tried to drive off the front foot and got an inside edge on to the pad, could have so easily been bowleed
banged in halfway down, 137kph/85mph and rising towards the armpit, swatted away to deep square leg on the pull
back of a length outside off, England thudding away on the middle of the deck, slapped through the off side to the sweeper
goes back and gently taps the ball off his pads through the leg side
that was quite short and Munro has tried to hit better balls than that previously in the tournament, this time he gently tucks it through midwicket for a single
a full toss, driven along the ground to long on, looks like Munro is going to try and build his innings today. Haven't seen a switch yet
stays back and punches the ball to long on for one more
shot! Munro brings out the reverse-mullered-sweep-cum-pull and sends it high over point for six! That's the opposite to Williamson, totally ungainly but equally effective
dragged down a little in response and flicked off the legs
a length ball angling across the left-hander, Munro presses forward and slogs, hitting it along the ground to deep midwicket, I think he's trying now
Munro gets on the front foot and forces a length ball through midwicket, past the diving infielder
finally! Munro steps out of his crease and lofts cleanly through the line back over the bowler's head, one-bounce four
Munro goes back and hacks at the ball, bottom edges it into the pitch towards the bowler
flat length ball on leg stump, and that is powerful from Munro, just clears his front leg and smashes that hard over midwicket. Bounces just short of the boundary cushions
reverse-sweep, takes this slowish length ball from outside leg and slaps it towards deep point
fullish on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
very full on middle and off, stabbed back to the bowler

AB de Villiers comes into the action, makes a tough catch look pretty easy. Banged in short and attacking the body of Munro, who was crouching low. He looks to pull and drags it over long-on. AB turns, runs back, gets into a side-on position and pulls it off calmly
Abbott seeks a yorker, fires it too full on middle and leg, squeezed away behind square on the leg side
full and wide outside off, right in the hitting zone, as Munro bends his knee and marmalises it over mid-off for a six
bumper, flies over a ducking Munro to keeper. Loads of height on it. Wide
picked away off the pads, beats a diving long-leg fielder
fractionally short and tucks up Munro, fended back to the bowler
back of a length and slanting away outside off, beaten on the cut
pitched up and outside off, driven crisply past the covers, beats sweeper cover to his left. Superb strike.. Crunched
AB pulls off a cracker of a catch! Munro bags a golden duck. Wiese is pumped. Munro nips down the track first ball, Wiese dug it shorter. Dragged towards mid-on. AB flies to his left and snaps it up
length on off stump, swings and misses - shiver-me-timbers, bowled! Ill-considered swipe from Munro, hanging back to a delivery that wasn't short enough to pull, ugly shot and off popped the bails
flat legbreak on off stump, tucked firmly out to deep midwicket, thinks about a second but Williamson declines
Was that what you meant?! Middle stump has taken a pounding. He cleared his front foot towards leg to make room to free those arms and swung hard, he missed and Al-Amin was bang on target
tries to play the ball through square but gets hit on the thigh for leg byes to short third man
in the stands beyond long on again! Short of a length this time and quicker, Munro stays in his crease and smashes the ball off the front foot using all his muscle
Munro lines up and tees off, aiming to slog the ball out of the ground, he gets beaten by the slower ball slanting across him though
moves back and hits the ball towards wide long on for a single
massive! Munro comes forward, makes room by moving towards leg and carts the ball into the stands beyond long on

what's happened there? Taylor and Munro have collided in the middle of the pitch. Taylor's helmet comes off as he completed the run. Both batsmen stayed on their feet though. Munro had cut that to point and called, the fielder was too deep to capitalise on the impact between the batsmen.
gets on the front foot to a length ball outside off and pushes towards point for his first run
full on the stumps, Munro swings across the line... and nutmegs himself with an inside edge that races to the fine-leg boundary. Stokes puffs out his cheeks and does a teapot
leans forward to a fuller ball and drives to mid-off
edged for four. More luck. Straighter outside off, Munro drives but gets a faint nick to the third man boundary
an offcutter or a googly to start, on middle, pushed back to the bowler
full on off, driven to long-on, keeps the strike
135 kph, good length outside off, squirted down to third man for a run
and is off the mark straightaway with a punch off the back foot to the off side
nudges this off the back foot down to mid-on for one
driven straight to long-off for another easy single
on the back foot as this is nudged down to midwicket for a single
leg side delivery which is turned away by Munro for one

and you can add one more to his wicket tally as he gets Munro to lob this straight to Miller, stationed at backward point, who takes the easiest of catches. Russell does a little homage to Brett Lee with that trademark jump after a dismissal
pitched full on off stump, Munro can't get under it and levers a brawny slap to mid-off
Stokes counters by going even more leg side - too leg side
round the wicket to Munro, angled in and punched to long-on from the crease
round the wicket, angled in and punched down the ground by Munro
...and Munro switches his sights again, another reverse sweep and he clobbers it flat through backward point for four
pushed through flatter on the stumps, worked into the leg side
tossed up, dipping on middle and leg, reaches forward and calmly pushes a drive through mid-on to keep the strike
darted in on the stumps, grips a touch and beats the bat
flat on middle and leg and worked away through square
tossed up, Munro aims a punchy drive back past the bowler for one more to finish the over
again Plunkett goes full and wide, aiming for the tramlines... Munro doesn't pull the trigger but neither is this called wide. Maybe a touch lucky
shapes for a massive switch hit, but improvises beautifully to play a right-handed cut to point/square leg for one. Similar to the previous game

gone, the switch hit doesn't work on this occasion. A flat delivery on middle, enough flight for Munro to get under it though. Times it pretty well but not enough power. Straight down the throat of the sweeper cover. Afridi strikes again
this one rushes onto Munro as he is forced into an early pull shot which goes straight up. Fletcher, the wicketkeeper, calls this one straightaway, and is able to hold on to the chance
goes high over the infield as this one lands safely in the deep on the leg side before stuttering to a sto p
defended from the crease on the leg side
good length sliding across the left-hander, he lets it go
on the pads again, full and deflecting away, having beaten the inside of the bat... Pitched outside leg, so a free swing for Munro
good bouncer from Stokes, swerving away from Munro late as he stayed back, decided not to chase it
done him again, pitched up on the stumps and Munro brings out the Chinese cut for four
backs away and carves one away to cover
gets on the front foot and defends watchfully.
oh my word! This is high octane! Munro gets on the front foot and reverse smashes the ball far over the point boundary, that's in the stands!
driven hard off the front foot but Pandya moves to his right at mid-off and dives to cut it off
Munro moves forward and outside off to hoick a good length ball towards the leg side, but he misses and gets hit on the pad
length ball on middle and leg, swiped away towards deep square leg
stays in his crease this time and pulls, the ball isn't short enough and it keeps a bit low outside off, Nehra beats the bottom edge
solidly played down the ground to long-off for a single
pushed to the off side by Munro for a single
Munro switches to a right hander position and gets deep in his crease to whack this over midwicket for a boundary
plays this one back to the bowler

Munro grossly mishits this next one from Miller, but fortune goes with the brave as this one just gets over the rope from quite a height. Kept the fielder interested till almost the last moment. Simmons attempts a dive, but this one was definitely going over
once again opts for the switch hit as this time he hits it a bit more squarer

goes for the knuckeball as this one misses everything, and I mean everything. This one just bounces over the stumps, past the keepers, all the way to the boundary behind. Called four wides by the umpire
free hit full from Narine as Munro chooses to stay in his customary left-hander position to club this over square leg to the orange brigade, who fail to get a catch
darts in a quicker one on middle as Munro uses the switch hit to get this away to the off side (or is leg side). Called a no-ball by the umpire, but the pair are unable to go for the single
this one played to the off side for a single

mis-hit straight to mid-off! Munro is six and out as well. He steps out of his crease and tries to smash the ball down the ground. Pandya takes an easy catch. New Zealand are coming out hard and going down swinging.
big slog attempted across the line, finds the toe end and drops into the off side
struck on the pad down leg trying to flick, Taylor scampers through to beat the direct hit by fine leg
sees the batsman advancing and drags the length back and Munro manages to pull it away to deep midwicket
strays a little straight, Munro looks to tuck this past fine leg but Parkinson makes a good tumbling stop. Both debutants involved in the first over
comes down the track to the first ball, hacks into the legside and finds the sweeper Banton
leg-sided full toss, and Curran gets away with that one, a scuffed attempt at a pull skims off the thighpad through to the keeper
gallops to the pitch, Scurran sees him coming and drags his length back, but the ball swings extravagantly from the hand

nailed him! Sucker ball from Curran, right up to the pads, taking advantage of Munro's premeditated movement to the pitch of the ball, and though he was a long way down, the yorker length left the umpire in little doubt as he wafted futilely across the line
slapped out to the square boundary again, same shot as the Saqib six, but dragged along the ground to the sweeper this time

spoke too soon! Munro's turn this time to monster a mow over the ropes! Down on one knee, and smoking a pull off an indeterminate length, played on line as much as length, climbing into the width with aplomb
one hand comes off the bat as Munro flinches a leg-sided clip out to square leg
slams the pads on a full length, but sliding down as it is deflected square
chipped to midwicket! Morgan pouches a lollipop off a low full toss, and Munro cuts a frustrated figure as he troops off... he was just beginning to enjoy himself out there
back of a length, hits the seam and jags into a defensive block on the back foot
drags his length back a touch, Munro unconvincingly drops this into the off side and they scramble a single
slower ball, hard to pick up as Munro baseball-biffs another big wind-up across the line
shorter ball, and a cunning flick up and over fine leg! Just helped on its way over the shoulder, and now New Zealand are motoring!
here comes Munro! Curran's third over, and he's starting to pick him now, another gallop to the pitch and battered hard over the ropes at long-on!
chiselled off the toes, a mirror-image of Archer's World-Cup-winning delivery, and tucked in a similar direction, albeit left-handed. No danger of a desperate run-out this time though!
good injection of pace as Munro can't pick it in time to connect on a wild hoick to leg
a low full toss is bunted to long-on. The first batsman to hit three T20I hundreds, and two at the same venue. Loud applause from the crowd, a fistpump from Munro. He's owning this format
flat and wide outside off, sliced away past point for a couple. Onto 99 now
132 kph, full and straight, hit down to long-on for a single
full and straight, pushed to long-on for a run
hits another gap in the field. Good length outside off, he lofts the ball intentionally over cover this time for a couple
looking for the wide yorker again, carved away to deep point
not called a wide, fair enough, consistent umpiring. On the tramline outside off, a wide yorker, but fair call
angled delivery across the left-hander's bows Just inside the tramlines
92 now! Two on the bounce. On the pads, and in Munro's wheelhouse. The trajectory is different, much flatter but that power again, over deep square leg, to Emrit's left, who couldn't get a hand on it
slower ball to start, nurdled to mid-on
this is flat and quick, smeared away to deep midwicket. He has scored 42 runs in that area
worked away square but there's a man there to meet it
turned away square and Munro sets off
fullish delivery, he presses towards mid off
worked away towards cover
guided nicely down towards third man and they'll go for a run ... or three. It's cut off before reaching the rope.
whistles past his ear, that's a wide
driven straight back down the ground. There's a fielder there but they'll take a couple, cheers
oh lovely. A half volley. Lofted over midwicket and it's a one-bounce boundary
nothing to be had there
length on the pads, worked to straight midwicket in the circle
worked away nicely
pitched up, Munro gets this away with a whip in front of square, into the corner of the ground and they pick up three

lost some momentum and timing over the last few overs. A low full toss around off, Munro picks his favourite midwicket area but mis-times his checked drive and finds long-on. Another stunning assault from Munro
full outside off, mis-timed to long-on. Losing his shape, understandable with fatigue creeping in
a low full toss in the gap at deep midwicket for one. Cottrell runs around to his left to stop one. Losing a bit of momentum
slides on to the pads and this is skimmed away past short fine leg, that'll be four
full and wide outside off, sliced to deep point

good catch and England have another! Slower ball - offcutter from Curran, fullish on leg stump, but he doesn't pick it trying to hack it over square leg... outside edge skews up in the air and Saqib Mahmood snaffles the catch diving forward at third man
length ball on the pads, inside-edged out into the leg side for a single
slower ball on the pads, Parkinson fumbles it slightly at fine leg but recovers in time to avoid a second

Kitchen is sacrificed. That's the first I've seen of that shot. It's a charging scoop, runs at the bowler, looking to generate momentum and take the ball on the full but Munro misses the ball, the ball misses the off stump. Kitchen runs down for one, Fletcher's throw misses at the batsman's end but straight to Emrit who runs back and finds Kitchen half a pitch short
Munro finds a fine gap and it's away

goes over the boundary again. Not timed again but Munro has exceptional bottom-handed power. He picked up a slower delivery on leg and clipped it over deep midwicket. Had to generate his own power but too easy
well bowled, a wide yorker, carved away to deep point
flat on the pads again, worked to mid-on. Brathwaite runs forward but fumbles, no extras
the googly, flat outside off, swatted to mid-on
100 kph, full down leg, inside-edged into the pad. A fantastic comeback from Nurse, not only because of the results but because of his adjustment
nice comeback. Full, and on the pads. Jammed out to long-on
103 kph, better bowling, to the field. A straight yorker is hit back to Guptill, who deflects it to long-on, so they don't run
more tripe. Short and wide outside off, Munro knows his areas, stays on the back foot and pummels a swat over mid-off.
flashed to the leg side
a mad hack at a length ball, inside-edged onto the pad and away to the keeper. Interesting... no timing to be found anywhere
a waft off the legs, out to midwicket. Slip comes out to short cover in response
a hack across the line, that was aimed into the covers but hauled out to midwicket with a distinct lack of timing. Curran proving hard to line up in that over
tucked off the legs, an easy single to open the account
93 kph, he has given himself so much room with the intent to open up the off side. Badree is straight as he always is. But Munro badly mis-times a drive past cover.
good length outside off, chopped away towards short leg. Moves to 99
whipped away for a couple towards square leg. Good length on the pads, flicked to deep square leg, Rohit runs to his right and stops the boundary
he won't be the fastest New Zealander to a T20I century. Shortish and wide, the ball takes the under-edge to the keeper
short and tucks up Munro for room, fended away to midwicket off the back foot
121ks slower ball from Bhuvneshwar, sticks in the pitch. Munro waits for the ball to arrive, then turns it away to the leg side
short and wide outside off, it was in the slot to be put away, but Munro slashes straight to extra-cover
Munro goes over the top. He shimmies out, Khaleel shortens his length and puts it outside off, skewered over extra-cover, but enough bat on it to trickle away to the boundary, teasing Rohit Sharma
pumped over mid-off! Munro is back in his happy place. Fuller and just a shade outside off, hoisted over the infield. Munro did not over-hit this
short and keeps low outside off, beating Munro's big swish in the channel
Munro shimmies out, but Khaleel slips in a slower cutter, and beats his wild swing to the leg side. Offcutter from Khaleel
Munro rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and glides it away to deep third man
back of a length and on the hips, deflected away to long leg
full around off, drilled to long-on. Terrific over from Bumrah
135 kph, full and straight, shovelled away to deep midwicket
89 kph, shortish and wide, slapped to cover.
96 kph, so much power from Munro. Flat and straight again, Munro gets underneath the length and stabs a heave over long-on with nonchalant ease
too wide, fired away well outside off
full and wide outside off, Munro stays in his crease and slog sweeps it this time, waaaay over midwicket. Munro not holding back
sits back for the googly, it's short too, so Munro hangs back and forehand-pulls over midwicket for six more
134 kph, a wide yorker, well bowled, just inside the tramline
pace right off the ball this time, out of the back of the hand, and dribbles to the keeper on the fifth bounce
fired down the leg side, Billings does well to break off his off-field mic'ed up commentary to gather with a dive
this one's in the slot! The first of the innings, a touch too full on the offcutter, and Munro kneels into a powerful slog-sweep, so square, too square for fine leg
full and wide outside off, hammered away to cover, on the bounce
well bowled, a straight yorker has been jammed away to point
101 kph, six more. Without the best of timing either. Full around off, Munro clears his front leg and lofts the ball over long-off. So much power
falls in no-man's land again. A high full toss around off, heaved with such bad timing that it lands in front of long-off, running in
overpitched but straight, nicely drive to long-off
poor delivery. A high full toss outside off, carved away to deep point
punched on the up, but once more the ball's not quite there to be driven
back of a length again, pitches outside leg but slams the pad as Munro swings into another flaccid mow across the line. A maiden! Gold dust!
keeping the ball on a string again, sensing Munro advancing to the pitch, and just moving that point of contact out of his arc. Prodded to the leg side
inches back of a length, pace off the ball, just not quite there for ... anything. Cunning bowling as Munro drills hard to no avail
sliced away for one. Full and wide outside off, carved away past point for a run. Deep point cleans up
in the slot again and outta here. Full and straight, shovelled away over midwicket. Too easy. Can't keep bowling there
fifty for Munro again! Flicked for six to get to a 26-ball 50. On the pads, and Munro extends his clip over square leg
looking for the scoop over fine leg but it's too full, chipped away to deep square leg
short outside off, back of a length, can't hit the ball to the boundary so he dabs a shot to cover for one. Simple, effective batting
full and straight, hammered down to long-on. Just past the stumps. Great timing
looking for one more. Full and straight, but the ball squeezes away to midwicket via the inside edge
galloping to the pitch, but ends up yorking himself a touch with a bottom-handed bunt to Jordan inside the rope at long-on
here comes Munro: down the track, meets a short ball and mows it over the top of Rohit at mid-on
worked to mid-on the scamper through for a single. Oh dear, Munro and Jordan collide as the batsman runs through and Jordan has copped a bit of a blow to the ribs by the looks.
that's gone way outside the off stump
but there's a boundary, comes down the pitch and smashes a flat six over wide long off...now he has to follow it up
short of a length, Munro goes for the pull and gets beaten again. The ball passes over middle stump
worked out to midwicket
some invention from Munro as he goes for an expansive reverse sweep, almost gets himself in a tangle as the ball is fired in full and just a single to short third man
that boosts the over for Munro and New Zealand, Wright drops it short and Munro latches on to send it over deep midwicket
beats the infield this time, driving in front of square, and the sweeper slides around the boundary
make that four dots, excellent over from Wright. Munro tries to open the face but can't beat backward point
three dot balls in a row, pressure grows on Munro as he cuts to backward point
another fresh-air shot, and this time it just misses off stump
down the pitch swinging to leg and doesn't make contact
flat on leg stump, tucked wide of midwicket to keep strike

Well, what's happened here? Wright is appealing for a catch as Munro drives the ball into his boot. Wright followed through and took it. The umpires send it upstairs but it is ruled to be ground then boot. Good yorker, though.
worked down the on side, Patel dives over this one as he skips across in his follow through. Should have stopped it

fantastic. When a batsman is as tired as he is, I reckon captains should have third man and fine leg back, because the shots in front of the wicket are tougher. That's what McCullum and Sangakkara do very very well. On a length, Munro shuffles across and scoops the ball past short fine leg

intentional over cover for a couple. A wide slower delivery, Munro lifts the ball over cover, a chip for two. 4-0-29-0, fantastic from Bhuvneshwar, some of the best defensive bowling you will see, even in the Powerplay
short and wide outside off, swatted to long-off. Really struggling for timing now, fatigue having its impact
there it is. Munro's second international T20 hundred, take a bow. Short and wide outside off, slapped past cover for a couple. Takes off his helmet with a big, beaming smile. Superb
short ball, forces him to go square of the wicket - holes out into the deep! Munro departs in pretty much the same fashion as Guptill and de Grandhomme, picking out James Vince once again
decent yorker to finish, 139kph and dug out through backward point for one more
speared in on the pads and clipped for one
hammered down the ground! Picks the slower ball, Munro makes room and extends the arms to pepper the stands once again
comes down and swipes across the line, just a single to deep square
back of a length and swatted leg side for one
short ball, pulled without great timing to deep midwicket
over the wicket, full on middle, worked past a diving midwicket
pushed into the off side for one
Wright going full, aiming for the yorkers, clubbed down the ground
another rather ugly attempt at a reverse sweep, or slog, by Munro and only gets him a single through the covers
executes it well in the end as he camps deep in his crease, without really moving his feet, then crouches in response to a short ball meant to cramp him for room and jabs it through midwicket

hoicks it out towards the vacant areas at midwicket. The back of a length delivery sits in this pitch and just does not behave the way the batsman wants it to. Here, it bounces a bit more and goes off nearly the splice of the bat
looks for the blockhole at 146 kph, and it tails in as well. Vicious delivery, but Munro is once again up to it. Plays late, plays straight

on the hips and Munro, by allowing the ball to come to him, is able to time it through midwicket. This isn't a pitch where the batsman can go searching for the ball; go at it and hit through the line. Leave those shots in the bin
full delivery around off, shovelled towards wide mid-on for a run.
another short delivery, hurries Munro who pulls to deep square leg. Three singles in three balls in that region for Munro
137 kph, on middle and leg, worked to deep square leg
143 kph, good length on middle, worked to deep square leg

short ball works again, ordinary from Munro. Well-directed on middle and leg, Munro plays an ugly attempt to pull over the leg side and a top edge loops gently to Root trotting to his left from backward point
full on middle and off, Munro punches it back to Dernbach in his follow through. Tight, and successful, comeback over
full on off stump, he opens the face and runs it down to third man
down the pitch, ends up yorking himself, driven to long-off

this time he goes, slogging a slower ball to YJB at deep midwicket again! Dernbach took the pace off and Munro was slightly through the shot, trying to muller the ball over the ropes but picking out the man
another out the back of the hand, cut off the back foot and Alex Hales does superbly to prevent four with a slide on the boundary
goes back and manages to shovel the ball into the leg side, possibly off pad
down the leg side, that's a wide
good response from Dernbach, quicker ball angled across and beating the bat
touch back of a length, goes back and pulls flat through mid-on to the man on the fence
full and straight and Munro opens the face to drive, picks out point
on the stumps, played back
but this one does, Munro hammers into the crowd again, raises his half-century with a six, taken him just 18 balls to get there!
full delivery outside off, driven towards long-off

and another...Broad making a mark on his international return. Pretty ugly heave from Munro to a length delivery, an off-cutter that he didn't pick, and the stumps get splattered. Clever from Broad, subtle changes of pace
poor ball, low full toss, and it's dispatched straight down the ground. Good over for New Zealand
another outside edge brings four, Munro beaten for pace outside off but he got enough bat on it to get it a few yards wide of Buttler
pitching just outside off, he prods that away towards point.
flighted, on middle and leg, Munro sweeps hard but picks out deep backwards square
length on off stump, punched to long-off from the crease
very full, nearly in the blockhole, inside-edged into the pads, they take on the point fielder with a sharp single
they continue to go for their strokes, charges out, and smashes a length ball high over extra cover, almost went all the way
short, wide and going away with the angle, cut-and-a-miss
starts with a cutter, full outside off, smoked back over the rope at long-off! Munro is in the zone, moves to 18 off FOUR balls!!
pitched up and angled across the left-hander, driven away from the body, to extra cover
gets to the pitch of a tossed up ball and drives to long off
makes room and cuts it from off stump wide of third man
way down the pads, and worked away to fine leg
pitched up, in the slot and crunched down the ground for six! First one of the day, just a lofted drive from Munro and it carries easily beyond the rope at long-on. Might see a few more of those...
third four of the over, slower short ball now, he waits and pulls it past square leg, and beats the man in the deep too
short and wide, maybe a slower delivery... splatted over the infield for four more! Almost carries all the way to the cover boundary, as Munro tucked in
shortish on the hip, settles for a punch through square on the leg side
drops a little short again, Munro charges down and whips a pull past midwicket, not completely timed and Tom Curran runs gingerly after it
and another! Munro shapes to sweep, he sends it high and it's swallowed by midwicket.
a little dance down the wicket there, a push to mid off and it's collected off the ground
nudges a back of a length ball close to the pitch on the leg side and goes for the single
neat punch off the back foot, but a neat diving stop at cover by Behardien, threw himself at the ball
alternating between boundaries and misses, shortish once more, width, and he swats it through midwicket
wanders out after chopping a shortish one, backward point advances, and he has to rush back, throw misses
back to swinging and missing outside off stump
not a bad way to score your first international runs, down the track, takes on a back of a length ball and swings it to the deep square leg rope
another one going across him, he decides to pull it, cannot connect
slanting across the left-hander, left alone
worked away on the off side
length ball defended to the leg side, bowler fields
short of a length and in at middle stump, tapped back to the bowler hurriedly
that's better from Rashid, pushes through the googly and it spins through as Munro goes back and gropes at it
tossed up, Munro sweeps and gets it away past backward square leg
short of a length and skidding into middle stump. Punched to long-off
full at middle stump, hurriedly turned to midwicket off the inside half

top of middle stump! 140kph and through Munro's ungainly swipe. It's a length ball, there for a leg side hit, but it needs a straighter bat than that. Munro has looked to go over midwicket and missed comprehensively

New Zealand falling apart here, nothing shot from Munro, he stepped out this time, McLaren kept it short of a good length, Munro stopped, and was in no position to play an aggressive stroke, cramped for room, and ends up edging it to the keeper
shuffles across, and goes for the pull again, timed better, but midwicket in the way again
pulls, but does not time it well, to midwicket
pushed down the pitch, did that carry, no it did not, Phangiso dives, but the ball slips away towards long on
again on the crease, manages to nudge it in front of square leg
remains on the back foot to a tossed up ball that hurries on, defended late
pitched up, angled in, driven solidly to long on
thick inside edge onto pad as he looks to punch to the off side
sigh^infinity, they refuse to learn, opens up and swings at a slowish good length ball, vertical top edge comes down to the bowler
into the pads from round the stumps, hits them down the leg side
short slower delivery outside off, the batsman chops it without any timing to point.
fuller ball outside off, and another 100m Olympic medal winning sprint from the two as this was straight to long-on
fuller ball, Munro drives it over the bowler's head and the batsman run for their lives and take a couple
length ball on the pads, Munro drives it to deep midwicket
slower full toss, Munro mishits it, on to himself, but manages a single
dug in, 136kph/84mph and swung all the way over deep backward square! More pain for the England bowlers as these two make hay
short outside off, Munro attempts to ramp but doesn't connect
manages a single as he pushes this down the ground for a single

hits a length, Munro swings hard across the line... did he get an inside edge? Mahmood seemed to be celebrating as Billings collected the ball, but the keeper was focused on shying at the stumps as Guptill ran through
banged in, 134kph/83mph and top-edged over the keeper for four! Not where Munro was aiming, but they all count
short of length on off, punched to cover, who makes a good stop
picked up and smacked over the midwicket fence! This is Munro at his best. Offcutter, short and sits up, launched over the leg side
scythed flat and hard over backward point for six! Shortish and outside off, smeared away into the bigger boundary
mighty full and slanting in at leg stump, jabbed down the ground for one
the googly outside off, pushed into the off side. Better length off that last ball. But a poor first four deliveries from Chahal, especially if the plan was to be defensive
and again. Munro looks to open up the off side by clearing his front leg but it's a well delivered slower ball on leg. All Munro can do is defend into the off side for one, well batted too
good length around middle and leg, skewed into the midwicket region. The fact that New Zealand are trying to attack, but are just not able to get it away says how good this bowling has been
superb shot. It's another bouncer on leg, Munro watches the ball till as late as he can and pulls past square leg. Dhawan at long leg runs to his right but can't haul it in. Super quick outfield.
excellent change in length. Hasan Ali does this very very well. Digs the bouncer in on middle, Munro gets underneath
the slower ball, offcutter down leg, Munro comes charging at him and flicks to deep square leg.
not a great start. Shortish and wide outside off, a hint of width, but Munro lays into a cut and finds the gap behind short point. Not a bad ball, but at this level, the batsmen are superb

yorker. That's an inch-perfect delivery. Good pace, that's an 87-miles-per-hour missile. Munro is late in bringing the bat down and gets a bit of an inside edge before the ball crashes into the stumps
looks for a big heave over the leg side and inside-edges it into the thigh pad

shortish, comes on awkwardly at helmet-height and beats the batsman on the pull. Nehra once again with an affable smile to the batsman. But it doesn't last long as the umpire has deemed it a wide. Harsh call, just over the shoulder

dropped. So we have learned that Pandya is human and capable of dropping catches. Munro comes down the ground to this short ball and finds the toe-end of his bat as he slashes over the off side. Pandya runs back from cover and gets more or less under it but ends up shelling it. Tough, tough chance, but he's set the bar so high. Had to reach back slightly and that left him in an awkward position
he's swept this into the stands at deep midwicket. Right in his swinging arc, too much flight, got right underneath the length.
short of a length on top of off, punched solidly off the backfoot to the covers. Nehra has overstepped. Ah, no. Not the bowler's mistake. They had an extra fielder outside the circle

was that a drop? Dhoni with a full-length dive this time. Back of a length, Munro walks across and tries to swat it away behind square and there is a noise as the ball goes towards the right of Dhoni who leaps up and gets a glove to it. Nah, off the thigh pad, seems like. But the keeper saved four nonetheless
good length on middle, nudged through midwicket
fullish on the pads, clipped along the ground for one
slashed firmly past point for four! Full outside off, 145kph but he opens the shoulders and carves it to the rope again
short, at the body and above 145kph/90mph, pulled without timing to short fine leg

slogged across the line but it goes straight up, Rashid gets him! Tosses up the googly and it spun away from him as he heaved to leg, flew off the toe of the bat, straight to deep backward square where Willey clung on as he went to ground
fullish, 142kph outside off, driven without timing to point
fired into the pads, Munro looks for his favoured leg-side pick up but doesn't connect... pitched outside, I think

full, heaved to leg... and into the crowd! Munro clears the pickets for the first time, looked a bit of a mishit as the ball ballooned into the sky, but it had the legs to go all the way. And one of the orangemen in the crowd missed his chance of $50,000, too! Completely misjudged it
pitched up and driven, they take on Warner's arm at mid-off... but the throw is wide
short, slightly leg side, wide again

short, wide, opens up and carves it over the in-field on the off side. It's a free-hit, so he can afford to take the chance. Chahal now with a full-speed chase and slides in front of the boundary to pull it back
length, 134kph and shaping a touch on middle and leg, Munro dabs wide of mid-on
dug in short on leg stump, Munro ducks
flicks this low full toss into the gap between deep midwicket and wide long-on
another big heave, but Axar got that underneath Munro's slog, full down leg, hit to deep midwicket
another slower ball, smashed for six. Maaaaasssssive. A predictable slower ball on leg, Munro stays in his crease and hammers the ball over midwicket. Superb timing
well-executed yorker down leg, the quick delivery, Munro very late on it. Gets some bat and some boot on it down to fine leg for two
picks the slower ball and deposits it over the boundary at long-on. Lovely batting. Sees the slower offcutter on off early, Munro nails a lofted drive right back over his head
a bouncer on leg, pulled down to fine leg for one. Good bowling
length ball, again comes on with the arm. Munro tries to back away and force a cut but chops it into the ground
steps out and wallops this length ball over long-on. Absolutely disdainful on the charge. Premeditated, super contact though.
slower length ball on middle and leg, tucked towards short midwicket
full toss, doesn't quite lean into the drive and gets it off a thick inside edge towards mid-on again.
full, angling into the stumps, squeezed to wide mid-on
an appeal, but definitely not out. Short and slow down leg, Munro misses a flick, off the pad towards the keeper
nearly dragged on! Yorker-length on off, no room to drive, gets a thick inside edge that rolls to Dhoni
the switch hit, Munro plays that shot very well, a very productive area for him, the quick one and straight, hit away to deep point or deep square leg
loads of flight but very wide outside off, good line with that trajectory, swept away to deep midwicket
shortish outside off, Munro under-edges this towards the keeper. Good end from Bumrah, a good over
right into the blockhole, cutting off Munro's big swing, kept out somehow. Superb from Bhuvneshwar
full and straight on the stumps, gets it to curl away a wee bit, squeezed to midwicket. Immediately calls for a new bat. The face turned in his hand as he made contact.
that's in the gap. Shortish around off, Munro arches his back and nails a cut past point, past backward point. Superbly played
banged in short but this is way down leg, well over Munro as well. One bouncer for the over
right into the blockhole again, jammed down past the bowler to Kuldeep at mid-off
good length delivery outside off, outside-edged towards Siraj at short third man, who nervously fumbles. No damage done
full toss that slides into the pads nicely, whipped to deep midwicket where Hardik covers good ground to keep it to a single
chipped into the midwicket region, excellent off-cutter to start

magnificent! Picks the length early and whips this up and over the infield as it bounces past Vijay Shankar at deep midwicket. Vijay covered good ground again but the ball spun away and he ended up crashing into the advertising hoardings. Seems fine though
pushed through, quick around middle and leg, punched to midwicket. Can he finish well?
short and wide, too wide, slashed to the deep point fielder for one
goes over the off side this time! One bounce over wide long-off. Goes full, fires it outside off, he has the room to reach out and carve it over
length around middle and leg, Munro stays leg side of the ball and drives it wide of long-off, beating Kuldeep at mid-on
short of length outside off, keeps a bit low as well, cuts it towards sweeper cover
length around off, looks to push it on the off side, gets an inside edge towards short midwicket
dropped by Kahleel! Slower short one, spinning away from the batsman who plays half a pull, skies it towards backward square leg where Khaleel goes reverse cups but drops
pitched up and cracked over cover this time! Three fours in a row for Munro, stepping out to carve a lofted drive
another fumble, this time by Vijay near deep midwicket, it was a low full toss on the stumps and Munro helped it towards deep midwicket, along the ground
fuller on the stumps and this time Munro goes aerial, clears the front leg and smokes it over long-on
a bouncer on middle and leg, goes for the pull, gets an edge that goes just over the short third man fielder, another boundary for Munro. Signalled leg-byes, might have just hit the elbow
length outside off, flat-bats it towards long-off
length but spinning away, think that was very close to a wide

finally India grabs one. Munro departs for a 40-ball 72. It was tossed up outside off, Munro went for a slog sweep, trying to hit it over deep midwicket against the spin, doesn't get the distance and Pandya competes the catch, coming in a few paces from deep midwicket
outside off, maybe taking the pace off, punched to cover
short of length outside off, Munro stays back and hammers it over extra cover for four
full, 104kph wide of leg stump, Munro chops it through midwicket
back of a length, Munro pulls powerfully but flat, just one to deep square leg
skips out, clumped down the ground - sails over long-on! Didn't quite get hold of it but on this ground, that's six

straight up this time, and taken at mid-on! Munro holes out, Agar pouching it safely as Richardson gives it the double-fist pump. Maybe a bit of pace off there... NZ momentum well and truly checked now

short of length and goes for a pull, the extra pace this time works against him, was just outside off and he ended up slicing it towards extra cover, an easy catch for Shanaka there. New Zealand in deep trouble at 27 for 4

short of length outside off, stands tall and punches it past the backward point and it races away towards the boundary, Munro using the pace and the bounce there, just opened the face of the bat, 16 off 6
short of length, in the rib cage this time, tucked away behind square
pitched up on the pads and flicked past the short fine leg for a boundary
fuller again, almost yorker length but wide outside off, Munro looks to hit it through covers but fails to put bat on the ball
fuller, aiming for the inswinging yorker but down the leg side
slower one around 109 kph, full outside off and Munro goes with the shot, doesn't get the timing right and ends up skying it towards long-on but the short boundary means it sails over quite easily
fuller outside off and slashed away, a good diving stop by Sandakan at covers, throwing himself to his left
darted outside leg stump again and this time Munro tries to reverse-slog over cover, gets an inside edge into his pads
thumps this to deep point, lucky to get away with that
short ball on the hip, Munro twocks it in front of square, superb timing and it races to the rope, beating the dive of man running up from deep square
spins into middle from a length, Munro gets a bat-pad as he jabs at it from the confines of the crease
slower one, length on middle and leg, drops it on the leg side for a single
slower length ball but down the leg side, pulls it towards deep backward square leg
and beats the bat straightaway, length outside off, sharp turn as Munro pushes at it
slider this time, around off and middle, Munro goes back and works it towards square leg

too full, too wide. Badree is not learning from his mistakes here. Loops another one up with lots of room and Munro slaps it down the ground. Not easy conditions to bowl on, granted, but the line could certainly be tighter
flat, back of a length, and coming on with the angle outside off, punched into the covers
full and pushed across outside off, driven tightly to point
flatter but short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
that's a poor delivery. Slants across a fuller delivery with too much room again and Munro slashes it over the extra cover region
flatter again, length outside off, cuts it towards extra cover, Rohit there
short of length, just around off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
angled across, 133kph and Munro swaps power for placement, a deft guide past gully for four
fuller ball and clipped off the pads through square leg

same shot, same region. This one's fuller still and Munro dispatches it with a clean swing over long-on. Dropped in the crowd for a second time. They're missing out on some good money to celebrate the New Year
and now a full toss on middle and leg that is flicked to the right of deep midwicket for a brace
a touch fuller once again, around off and Munro sweeps it over square leg for his third six
quicker one on the stumps, 110kph, pushed towards deep midwicket
length ball in his swinging arc. Munro swipes and launches it over long-on. Bang off the middle
length around off, and this has been tonked over deep midwicket via a slog sweep
fuller around off, pushes it towards extra cover to get to the other end

dares to go against the turn and lofts him over mid-off. It was slanted across and quite wide of him. Doesn't make an effort to move towards the line. Simply stands in the crease and opens up his arms. Not middled but good enough connection to comfortably carry a couple of bounces over the long-off boundary
fuller on the pads and Munro looks to go big again, doesn't middle it and the ball goes towards deep backward square leg
moves away from leg stump to try and force a clip but the ball follows him and tucks him up to hit the pad
a New Yea's gift for Colin Munro, a harmless full toss sprayed with all the room he needs to send it crashing through the covers
a googly on a length around off, goes back and cuts it towards extra cover
terrific shot again, short and wide, nailed past cover. The fielder runs across and cuts the ball in, Dhawan the fielder
good length, angled across off, whipped against the line through deep midwicket, off the inside of the bat

good stop from Bhuvi, saved five. Short down leg, Munro goes back and pulls over midwicket. Bhuvneshwar sets himself up for the catch, sees he can't catch the ball without going over the boundary so just taps the ball back in, with no intention to catch as he falls over the boundary. Good stuff
just strays down leg. Off the pad towards the keeper but the umpire calls it a wide. Why can't teams review these? I know India don't have one, but if they did ...
skiddy delivery on middle and leg, Munro blocks
sharp, skiddy delivery that pitches outside leg and spins in further to cut him into two halves. Beaten as he had no clue
hint of width and Munro carves this over cover. He was waiting for this and when this arrived at the correct length to swing, he did so with all his might.
belts this full delivery straight to mid-off
thick inside edge to short fine leg as he looks to squeeze this behind point
mistimes this low, incoming full toss from around the stumps to mid-on
slower length ball gone wrong, Munro slaps this into the gap between cover and mid-off. Held his shape and then threw his hands through the line of the ball to put that away
slices this full delivery over short third man. Looked to go over point, ended up getting a thick edge. Too much width
works this full delivery angling in towards deep midwicket, called for two and managed to complete it without much stress

drills this full delivery into the gap at extra cover. Brathwaite with the chase, but don't think he managed to pull it back. The elbow was in contact with the rope as he dived full stretch to prevent it from going over. Given four upon confirmation of the replays. Full marks for the effort though
well finished, full down leg, flicked to deep midwicket. Not the greatest returns, but not many bowlers have good figures. He can only get better, I suppose. 4-0-53-1

dropped! This busts through Carlos Brathwaite's hands at mid-off. This was full, Munro backed away and hit this really hard. Despite getting hands on it, the ball still had enough to parry towards the boundary
strong bottom hands as he pulls this in front of square, on the bounce to deep midwicket
beaten by the slower ball, has a big swipe at this off-cutter, but played too early. Clever variation in pace
slower and fuller on middle and leg, turned into the gap in the leg side, deep midwicket and square leg converge, as does the bowler.
looks to clear the boundary but gets this on the top part of the bat, on the bounce to the fielder.
slower length ball outside off, he looks to back away and go over cover but is defeated by the slowness of the wicket, gets a thick inside edge past the bowler on the leg side. Bowled at 109kph
belts this down the ground, on the bounce to wide long-on
driven away to long-off. Just struggling for timing
well bowled, quick on the pads, flicked towards square leg for a couple. Munro races back
drifting into his swinging arc, but the length is too full. Squeezed to long-on

just over long-on. A 118 kph slower delivery around off, Munro watches the ball onto his bat and lifts the ball over long-on. The ball skews off the outside half, not timed very well. But even Kohli can't haul it in. Into the 90s
good length around off, Munro backs away and the ball hits the pad towards square leg. An appeal, not much chance. A leg bye
mistimes an attempted cut to cover.

nicely placed. A slower wide delivery outside off, Munro backs away, looks to carve the ball over cover but gets a thick outside edge which is right down second slip's throat. Don't think second slip is there at this stage
good length delivery around off, defended back
rocks back and cuts this slider straight to point. Outstanding first over
shorter on middle and leg, Munro sits back and punches the ball down to long-on
hip-high short ball on the leg stump, swatted away to the left of the leg-side sweeper. Dhawan tidies up in the deep
bouncer, slanting away outside off, sails through to Dhoni. Too short, wide
full-toss on off, jabbed to wide mid-on off the inside half. NZ 66 for 0 in 6 overs
short and wide, lashed to sweeper
short on middle, Munro stands tall and punches the ball away to the right of short cover
short and angling across off, Munro inside-edges a pull onto the pad
Munro holes out to Shankar at long-on. Looped up on off stump, Munro swings. He gets more height as opposed to distance. Krunal provides India with the breakthrough
full and flat outside off, Munro opens his stance and drills a drive past cover
shortish around off, pulled away towards midwicket for one. Tiring, slowing down is Munro
a dot ball to finish. Very quick around middle and leg, driven to mid-on
full toss which he bunts to mid-on for a quick single
over deep midwicket. That area is so strong for him that he hardly cares that the man is on the boundary. Full on middle and leg, smeared away over the boundary with immense bottom-handed power
there is deep midwicket in place but falls in front. Full and straight, Munro shovels a flick to that man.
another terrific single. Just one bad ball but 11 off the over already. Slightly short on the pads, Munro misses a flick, struck on the pad, one to short third man
flat and straight, pushed to mid-off. Another very good single

ooh, over point. In the air but falls in no-man's land. It was full outside off, Munro clears his front leg, looking to go straight but the ball skews off the outside half, sliced. Gets enough bat to clear the infield
that's tripe. Short and well down leg, would have been wide but Munro wants six. Smashes the filthy long-hop way over backward square leg. Easy pickings
a slower ball, pace off the ball, hit away, punched past cover for a run. Looks like West Indies have a plan for Munro
full delivery outside off, Munro lets his hands through the line but finds mid-off for nothing
length ball that drifts across, defended back to the bowler
mistimes a pull to Gayle at short fine leg. This skid back in faster than he expected
pulled but can't find the gap at midwicket, cramped for room
catch? Dropped. Decent chance, thick edge as he shaped to cut, Walton didn't get up in time. Half a chance, really.
the free hit is smeared to deep midwicket, a short offcutter around off.
not a bad option, it's a productive area and he is tiring so behind the wicket works. A slower wide yorker, Munro makes no contact

dropped by Chahal. Can't do that India. Full and wide outside off, stabbed in the air at deep cover. Chahal runs back, gets right there and the ball bursts out of Chahal's hands. India's fielding struggling under pressure.
and the wild slog to end, a slower ball around off, Munro's big heave results in an under-edge towards point
deflects off the thigh pad to fine leg as he looks to whip this square. Late inward movement off a length for Bhuvi
