bowls this full, gets it to move away from off stump, Munro looks to blast this over cover but gets a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket
you give them so much width and they'll close their eyes and collect boundaries. Another full toss, seems to have slipped out, shovelled through the covers
whips this down to deep square, Khaleel the man in the deep.
a loose fuller delivery on the pads. This is all too easy for New Zealand. Munro heaves it over deep backward square leg. Another clean hit
swipes one through the leg side, Karthik hares around from deep midwicket to cut that off. Krunal with the mopping up
short around off, punched to long-on
how did he get so much power behind that? Not good bowling, right in the slot, full down leg, heaved away well over midwicket for six. Too easy
looks to swing this length ball over long-on but is beaten
gets this to skid back in on a length at 141kph, Munro hurried into this gentle tuck into the leg side
in his swinging arc and Munro has belted this over long-off, just besides the sight screen. As sweet as a hit can get. Stood his ground and deposited this length ball. Didn't move an inch there
on a length outside off, he walks outside the crease and bunts this to point
superb comeback, ripper of a yorker on his toe, Munro somehow manages to jam his bat down to keep that out as they squeeze in a single
right into the blockhole, squeezed back
this has been hit straight to cover. Backed away, got underneath the length, hit it really well but didn't get the elevation. Good catch, must have surely stung Rohit.
full and slow down leg, swept down to short fine leg
very wide outside off, but just inside the tramline, maybe not. Wide says the umpire.
the googly around middle, worked to deep midwicket
the switch hit again, fired in wide outside off. Munro fails to make contact

dropped! Shreyas Iyer pushes the ball over the boundary. And that's Munro's fifty. Short around off, Munro stays back and pulls towards long-on. Iyer is aware of the boundary behind him and lets that get in his head, doesn't use the few inches behind him and palms it over
six more. Quick and straight, Munro gets underneath the length and swats the ball easily over midwicket for six. Too easy
there's five extras. Full and well down leg, Munro misses a flick, Dhoni misses too, and there are five runs
full outside off, Munro winds up and swings, one to deep midwicket
bunts this gently into the off side for a quick single
overcompensates now and sends down a short delivery. Bangs it in halfway down but it comes on at waist-height. Munro swats a pull ferociously through midwicket

this is the only way West Indies could make it worse for themselves. A misfield in the deep. Powell gets down but cannot pick it up, lets it go through the legs. Ran to his right as Munto shovelled another pull wide of him at midwicket
short again, much-better directed as he tucks up Munro on the hook but wrong line. Down the leg side
works this shortish length ball down to deep midwicket

take that Eoin Morgan, or Nat Sciver. The non-intended nutmeg right through his legs. Clearly beaten for pace, but he improvises really well. The yorker down leg, Munro somehow gets some bat on it, through his legs, to the fine leg boundary. French cut.
a low full toss around middle, punched away to long-on
flat-batted swat across the line to long-on, not much power on this though
new bat and he's managed to wallop this whip to deep square leg. Swivelled back and simply worked this off his wrists into the gap. This was too short and he got on top of the bounce nicely

can even hear myself think now. A short slow offcutter down leg, Munro watches the ball right onto his heave. Lots more elevation than distance, but with pulled-in boundaries, it doesn't really matter, does it? Just over deep midwicket

fetches this pull from way outside off, manages to hit this deep into the stands at deep midwicket. Friendly length ball angling away at 125 clicks, and he manages to get enough power on that. Dropped in the stands
a low full toss outside off, driven to wide long-off for a couple. Nice running from Williamson, forced Munro back.
better delivery, Change in pace, the short offcutter outside off, goes past the outside edge
his bottom hand has some exceptional power in that. It's a low full toss around off, Munro gets underneath that and just lifts the ball back, sooo much power, four past long-off
strong bottom-handed whip and boy, he's cleared wide long-on with ease. He sprayed this too full, Munro manufactured the length by staying deep inside the crease as he swung through
shortish outside off, carved towards point for one
swung behind square, on the bounce to deep backward square leg. 4th T20I fifty
shapes to cut but is cramped for room, chopped towards cover
backs away and belts this full toss straight to the man at the edge of the ring at cover
squeezes this full ball back to the bowler, hit really hard but Carlos is a big man
excellent stop at short fine leg, saved three runs. This was whipped behind square with the angle
he's shoveled this over the non-striker's head, down to long-on where Carlos throws himself full stretch at long-on to save a certain boundary

this is an outstanding catch at long-on. Flat hit, so much power on that but he got down low to pull off a stunner as it was descending on him. Munro looked to clear long-on but got a little too close to the pitch of this full and flat delivery.

finally some respite for West Indies. Munro tries to heave a length ball over long-on. This time the room isn't as much and he gets slightly tucked up. Sends a catch into the hands of the fielder in the deep. Powerplay done, but Munro has inflicted some serious damage already
slower full ball. The lack of pace doesn't help as he picks it really early. Waits for it before shovelling it over mid-off
same delivery, same line, same length. It's all turning into a horrific template for West Indies now. Short, wide, thumped over backward of point
a long hop with an awful lot of room. Opens up and slaps it over the backward point region

through the hands of short third man. Munro slashes at a wide shortish delivery and loses slight shape. Gets a thickish outside edge and Cotterell moves to his right at short third man but the ball bursts through

brings up his fifty, off 18 deliveries. Second-fastest fifty for New Zealand in T20Is. Munro had already got a 14-ball fifty against Sri Lanka last year. A yorker on leg stump that is clipped out, turns it away behind square as he does so
punches a shortish delivery to mid-on

uses a straight bat and punches to mid-off. Munro wants the single, he's quite right in his call, but Bruce isn't all that convinced. He hesitates. He's not sure. Eventulaly, he commits to his partner's call. Zaman is the fielder, flings the throw, and it absolutely nails Munro's left wrist (or thereabouts) as he stretches out to make his ground. He's in agony, throwing his head back and wringing his hand desperately to ward off the pain
nicely flighted, dipping on middle and off, Munro can't get under it and a single into the covers ends a good over of damage limitation for England
quick around off, defended
slower delivery at 110kmh around off stump, Munro carefully defends into the covers
another bouncer to Munro and he ducks under it easily

there comes Malinga's 100th T20I wicket and he has bowled Munro again! Little similar to how he got Munro in the first T20I but this wasn't a yorker. It was swinging in, in pitched on middle stump and it found the gap between Munro's bat and pad to rattle the leg stump. What a sight that is for a fast bowler
what have you done, Colin? Tossed up, he couldn't believe it and went after it. Didn't get it off the middle as the bat face turned and he ended up chipping it straight to long-on.

superb switch hit! This time he made his intention clear even before the bowler delivered. Shadab bowled this full and wide, he still managed to get underneath the length and hit this behind point. Superb
length, sliding onto leg, reverse-scoops it over backward point. Picks the gap well
makes the stumps visible as he backs away and cuts to cover
chips this one in the air and down to long on for one
comes forward but it's short and he plays late through backward point for his fifty
full and drifting in, drilled to long-off
goes on with the arm outside off, tapped to cover
full on middle, driven to extra cover
floated up on middle, drive to mid-off
chops a cut to cover as he gets tucked up
slider outside off, goes on with the arm and Munro swipes at it and gets an outside edge to third man
goes the other way, a googly, blocked towards mid-off
backs away and finds cover with the cut
comes on full and straight at middle and it's pushed out on the front foot
bit too short and angling in, he pivots on the back foot and swats it away through the square leg region for four more! Munro doesn't want to leave things late for the lower order
falls just short of mid-off. Munro wanted to hit that one hard and he did, but it was in the air dangerously and not too far from Malinga
full on the pads, whipped fine for one
starts with a leg side delivery, on the pads, swept towards deep backward square leg, the fielder dives to his left to save two
vintage Malinga and the stumps knocked out! He pushed those fielders back on the leg side and let the old yorker rip, swinging back in from around off, and crashes into middle
full and swinging back, not quite a yorker but a pretty ominous start. Munro jams his bat down on it. Just
full and swinging back in again, Munro nearly overbalances as he tries to squeeze it away, gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
full again and angled in, but started outside off, allowing Munro room, he just opens the face and gets it through point for four
slower ball, overpitched and Munro is away, hammers it through the covers
the flatter one goes down the leg side
tossed up around off, pushed into the covers
and he throws it away! Flatter and angled in, Munro stepped out, was cramped for room but went through the shot anyway and found long-on
130kmh, hint of inswing around off stump and Munro middles a drive straight to cover with a nice forward lean
pulls the length shorter this time and swings it in towards middle stump, Munro called for a quick single straightaway and a fumble at mid-on makes it easier for him
a bouncer at 141kmh, nicely bowled around off stump line and Munro ducks to keep away from it
fuller delivery swinging in this time from length, a bit too much towards leg and Munro gets a leg bye towards square leg
not too flighted around off, he defends on the off side

that's gone really high and it's gone all the way! He saw a lot of flight on the off stump, there was enough time for him to make bit of room and swing hard at that one, it went a bit square of the wicket and just over the boundary line
shortens his length a little but it's still full enough and moreover wider outside off, Munro goes inside out, clears the infield and gets another four
spins in from a short of length, tucked to deep midwicket
desperately throws his hands at a short one without getting room and finds an outside edge to short third man
short of length on leg stump, backs away and punches back to Hafeez
one more! This was shorter and outside off, he just had to stay back and cut it on the other side of the point fielder to beat the sweeper cover for four
pushed through and worked back down the ground for one
tossed up and smeared over long-off! Munro goes to fifty with a six, too! Clean drive through the line, almost into the second tier - never mind the small boundaries!
flat and sliding on with the arm, Munro swivels and slaps it past deep backward square for four!
punched down the ground, respite for Aus
into the crowd again! Munro stays still in the crease and creams it over long-on
length ball on the pads, Munro hits a flat six over backward square leg! This one does only just clear the rope...
yorker outside leg, clipped to deep midwicket for one
on the stumps, Munro plays it cleverly by cutting it late and finding the gap between point and short third man for four
three in a row!!! This one is massive! Swung over midwicket, goes about 15 rows back into the crowd, Tye being collared here
length ball on leg, Munro goes to the back foot and punches it long-off
full outside off, driven down the ground to long-off
short of length around off, pushed down to long-on
slower one outside off, cuts it late to point
quicker one outside off, chopped to the off side
full outside off, pushed back to the bowler
full outside off, Munro goes for the big heave on the leg side and misses
goes back at the crease and punches him down to long-on
wide outside off and he dabs this one down to deep point
short ball outside off is cut straight to point
gets down and across and guides a sweep behind square where the big Shaheen Afridi flings himself to his right to make a save
full on leg, driven wide of mid-off
length on leg stump, punched to mid-off
skids onto leg at pace, misses the flick
full outside off, drilled to mid-off

superb catch from Rohit this time. Good length around off and middle, Munro comes at Bumrah, looking to go over mid-on, but the ball skews off the outside half. Rohit runs back, keeps his eyes on the ball even as his body is trailing behind the trajectory. He sticks out both hands, and don't ask me how, but holds on, the ball in his fingertips almost
back of a length on off, more seam movement, defended back to the bowler. Not much Munro can do
seam. 138 kph, good length outside off, and Munro's half prod makes contact with nothing but air. Away movement
full and wide outside off, 134 kph, good delivery, jammed back to the bowler. Yorker almost
a cutter on leg, Munro comes charging at Bhuvneshwar and like he has done so many times on this tour already, he wallops a swat over midwicket. Massive hit
wicket-to-wicket stuff, chopped through the leg side
fired in flat outside leg stump, swung away fine for one
tossed up and crrrrrrrrrrruuuuuuuuuuuunched into the crowd over long-on! This was fast, almost looked like a medium-pace delivery, Munro just whacked it back in the direction whence it came
pushed back to the bowler
pushed through and heaved leg side, into a gap at deep midwicket for a couple
floated up and swiped down the ground for one to long-on

short ball gets the wicket but on the off side. It was just outside off and Munro put his bat in the way and the ball went high towards third man with the bounce, good catch by Kula and NZ are stuttering here
slower ball, pushed across the bows, Munro slashes like Freddy Krueger and it comes off the toe, beats the diving Carey and Stanlake can't reel it in in front of third man
speared in full, 135kph and Munro can only dig it out towards midwicket
pushed through quickly outside leg stump, Munro looks to give it some more pongo over midwicket, but is hit on the pad
tossed up outside off, bludgeoned down the ground to long-off for one
full-toss on middle, sliced away to the covers, another front-foot no-ball from Hasan. Sarfraz walks up to his bowler and has a polite little word with him
Munro steps out, manufactures his own length - half-volley - and belts the ball to mid-off. Hasan's front foot had strayed
short and keeps coming into Munro, he backs away and jabs a single to the covers
slower ball outside off, Munro adjusts and carves it away square through the off side for four - hit to the right of cover and left of backward point
leg-stump yorker, Munro jams it out to long-on and keeps strike
very full and swings back in, inside-edged away through midwicket. Movement in the air for Afridi
full delivery outside off, Munro comes down and hits the ball to long-on
short and nipping in on middle, punched up to mid-off
flat on middle and off, Munro backs away and swats the ball to wide long-off, but just the one
in the slot and outttta here, on middle and leg with some flight, full. Munro stays low and slog-sweeps the ball with so much ease over square leg
90 kph, shortish and wide, carved to deep point for one
six more. 132 kph, good length down leg, Munro picks it up and then shovels a heave over square leg. So easy
full and wide outside off, 132 kph, Munro drills a drive to mid-off. Absolutely hammered
short and wide, 132 kph, slashed to deep point. All over by the silence at the Westpac
full and quick, 133 kph, on off, worked to deep midwicket
short down leg, worked to short fine leg
89 kph, knows Nawaz will bowl it shorter, outside off, swatted away over cover

Miscued to long-on, Hafeez runs in and drops it. Should've been taken. Slower offcutter, short and outside off, spliced away in the air and Munro gets away. The ball pops out when Hafeez's elbow hits the ground

Oh my WHAT.A.SHOT from Colin Munro. He races down the track, Ashraf sees the advancing batsman and digs it short and outside off. Munro goes airbone, this rises over his hip, he adjusts and launches it over mid-off for six. Outrageous hitting from Munro
back of a length and nipping away outside off, looks like the slower offcutter. Munro is early into a pull... and misses
92 kph, the googly on middle, hit back to the bowler from the crease
a shortish delivery down leg, 88 kph, hits Munro on the back pad
pushed through outside off, angling away from Munro further. He sizes it up and slog-sweeps it high and far over midwicket. Bam! What a start for Munro and NZ
shorter and outside off, Munro leans back and chops it away in the gap through the covers. Babar Azam chases hard and hunts the ball down
tossed up slower on middle, sticks in the pitch, Munro checks his drive and instead chips it to Imad's left. In the air but safe in the end
short and darted on off and middle, Munro sits back and shovels a single down to long-on to round out the over
dug in short and outside off - Ashraf bowls a heavy ball - more a short-arm flap than a short-arm pull to short midwicket off the back foot
banged in shorter and outside off, Munro loads up for a pull, does not middle it, spliced over wide mid-on for four
short and wide outside off, enough leeway for Munro to free his arms and utterly batter it through the covers. Fetch that
slower offcutter outside off, short as well, Munro does not pick the change-up. He swings early and collects a whole lot of fresh air
overpitched on the pads, picked away to deep square leg
Munro backs away outside leg, exposes all three stumps, inside-edged away, hits the keeper's pad and rolls away
sliding through outside off, down the track and hacked to the leg side off the inside half
tossed outside off, not much turn with the new ball for Hafeez, Munro clears his front leg and hoists it up and over mid-off, who's inside the circle
short down leg, flicked away to deep square leg for a run
131 kph, good length outside off, slashed to point for a run
back of a length and zips back in to cramp Munro for room. He chops an inside edge onto the pad as the ball trickles away to the off side
on the pads, clipped to midwicket
low full toss outside leg, pushed down to long-on
strays down leg, Munro looks to hit the ball over midwicket but fails to make contact, one leg bye to third man

dropped on the boundary! A googly on off, Munro slog-sweeps the ball to deep midwicket. Umar Amin jumps very late and drops an absolute sitter at this level. He got up late and made it look harder than it was. Just one
shaping in, good pace on a length, Munro takes it through midwicket this time, picks up three from his first ball
another boundary! Bit of luck this time, Munro forcing at the ball away from his body and thick-edging past his stumps
slower ball, Munro skips down and flails at it without connecting

Munro follows Phillips. Two in two overs for Pakistan. Munro ventures down the track, Hafeez shortens his length and keeps following the moving batsman. Munro swings and inside-edges it behind, he's too far down. Sarfraz collects the ball this time and whips the bails off. Munro gone for 44 off 28. It was good fun while it lasted
short ball, 133kph, sits up to be thwacked on the pull, one to deep square leg
short ball, Munro swipes at it - and nearly plays on again! Edged a whisker past off stump, Carey does well to prevent it slipping past him for another streaky four
full and POW! Munro now spanks Stanlake down the ground, looked like it might go straight to mid-off but there was enough biff on the shot to clear the man, one-bounce four!
this one reaches long leg! A short-of-a-length ball, Munro goes for the pull, goes from down to up, gets a big top edge which is comfortably held
angled across and spiked into the covers, Stoinis takes the pace off it
length, wobbly around off, Munro dinks it down the ground
pitched up and lashed towards wide long-off, almost goes for six! Skidding on cross-seam, Munro just bullies through the line, towards the longest part of the ground
shortish, dabbed down behind square
length, on the pads, Munro brings out his axe and lumberjacks four more to deep backward square leg
short of a length, 135kph and jabbed into the midwicket area for one
banged in, climbing through well over the batsman's head
flat on the stumps, into Munro's arc and mowed over wide long-on! Flat-batted whack and it sails over the ropes!
was that a drop? Munro rather chipped a drive back towards the bowler, Tye looked frustrated to have missed it... went straight through the hands
gets a bottom end as he swings across the line of a back-of-a-length delivery...ah, no he doesn't, straight off his stomach
a slower ball, dragged down outside leg stump, Munro plays a front-foot pull which nearly carries to deep square
short ball around leg stump, he pulls and gets enough bat to clear short fine leg...off the shoulder of the bat
on a length and outside off, Munro stays leg-side of the ball and scythes it away to backward point

short and outside off, Munro stays leg-side of the ball again, and flat-bats it away to mid-off's right. 50 partnership up for NZ, Phillips has only contributed 5 off 10. Remember, Sanath and little Kalu?
131 kph, good length outside off, punched to deep cover to move to 49

back of a length and angling into catch the pad, but this is slipping down leg. Off the pad and rolls behind, Sarfraz gets to the ball. There's a mix-up between the wickets! Sarfraz isn't quick enough and NZ recover
Munro ventures outside leg and slaps one from the stumps to long-off
good length at off stump, no width, defended to the on side
nearly cleans him up! Munro comes down the pitch, aims to go through the leg side, this grips off the surface - was a cutter - and skims past off stump
gets solidly forward into a good-length ball, timed nicely into the covers but a diving save keeps it to a single
cracking shot, gets forward to a full ball outside off and drives it straight down the ground...just has the legs to reach the rope

strikes first ball! The short one. Munro goes for the pull, onto him too quickly, takes a big top edge and Carey moves around to the short fine-leg position to gather a simple chance. Probably not short enough for the stroke
full outside off, sliced square over the off side, skids across the outfield towards deep point. Tye chases and makes a good attempt to flick it back. He's done very well there
big appeal for lbw that looked to have pitched outside leg, Munro aiming to flick into the leg side
an appeal for lbw as he whips across the line, but pitched well outside leg stump
swings across the line of a back-of-a-length delivery, doesn't make contact, taken on the pad and it loops to the leg side
outside leg stump, clipped firmly but straight to deep square leg
a short delivery pushed across outside off, carries over the top edge as Munro tries to go through point
Jordan does well here, gets his right hand down to intercept a firm straight drive as Munro latches onto a full delivery
short and wide, the googly maybe, 90 kph, Munro misses a cut
on length on middle and leg, defends on the leg side and scoots away for a quick single as Dilshan tries a direct hit at non-striker's but misses
the knuckle ball, full down leg, swerved in the air, a thick inside edge onto the pad for one
turning away after pitching outside off on length, goes past the outside edge
fuller ball, pushed to the right of extra cover
full and on the pads, picks it up off the toes and lofts it straight down the ground as the ball goes one bounce over the boundary
short ball, heading down leg, Munro swivels around and pulls and the ball goes over the fine leg fielder who is inside the circle
half-volley, smashes it down the ground as he crunches it off the front foot
turned around to backward square leg
short of a length on the leg stump, tucked off the pads to deep square leg
bowls it on the leg stump channel, dabbed away into the off side
short of a length ball outside off, punches it off the backfoot towards the point region
fuller ball, gets it to tail away from the left-hander, swing and a miss from the batsman as he throws his hands at it form outside the crease
length ball, kicks up more than he anticipates and skews it off the outside part of the bat to the off side. It was the off-cutter, actually, one that hit the seam
fuller ball, flicked away off the toes and he lofts it over deep midwicket. Too predictable from Mashrafe; that was the fourth consecutive slower ball
fuller ball outside off, has to really reach out for it but still goes after it and gets a thick outside edge as the ball goes uppishly and on the bounce over the third man boundary
short of a length outside off, knocks off the backfoot to point
defended off the backfoot back to the bowler
length ball, tucked away into the leg side, to the square leg region
short of a length, punched off the backfoot wide of mid-off who runs across and gathers it
length, skidding in to hit the pads as Munro swings and misses
wide full toss, Munro slaps it hard past backward point, that's four!
quicker ball, goes for a cut and misses. The wicketkeeper takes the bails off and makes an appeal. They go upstairs to check but the feet were grounded
turned away wide of deep midwicket
length ball outside off, gets leg side of it and steers it to point
fuller outside off, driven along the ground square of the wicket on the off-side but awkwardly so and away from the body
Mustafiz has Munro nicking behind. Full and holds its line outside off, Munro chases the ball with a drive with no feet and offers a regulation catch to Nurul. Dolly catch
back of a length and angled in, played back to the bowler
thrashes a cut aerially past backward point out into the deep

unbelievable switch hit! Outside off and Munro inverts in a flash and slogs powerfully over the cover boundary (what has become midwicket for the leftie), difficult to fathom the power and execution of that stroke
goes back and slaps to long-off
is able to extend the arms with a full swing of the blade on middle and leg and the ball arcs through over the long-on fence
Pow, right in the kisser! Munro sets himself and launches over deep square leg! A brutal thwump for six
worked with the turn out to deep midwicket
short jabby pull to a shortish ball on middle and leg sends it sailing well over the midwicket boundary
goes back and has to stand square on to punch to long-on
flicked nonchalantly for six more! Length on the pads, 138kph from Curran but it disappears on to the roof of the marquee at deep backward square once again!
slower ball, picks it - FETCH THAT!! Munro hits his fourth six and his fourth scoring shot, smoked like a kipper down the ground, into the camera gantry... They might have lost the ball, here
full, taking the pace off, Munro swings malevolently to leg again, hit on the pads
stopped for nearly a second before bowling that and the batsman reverse swept it to deep cover
Munro is beaten first ball by one which slides across him outside off
fired full, 136kph but straying down the leg side and Munro only needs to get a tickle on it to skim the ball fine for four more. Munro up and running (figuratively speaking)
slower ball, full outside off and Munro checks his shot to pull one down through the leg side
lovely start from Jordan, completely foxes Munro with a cutter which dips and spins past the bat as he swings across the line, misses leg stump by an inch or two
speared in fast, 141kph on the pads, Munro likes it there but doesn't connect with his favoured donkey kick over deep backward square
goes full outside off, dragged into the leg side
slower delivery, this time Munro cottons on, picks it up on the half-volley and Rory Calhouns it over long-on for his fifth six!
pitched up in the slot, Munro cleans him out over wide long-on! Clean, ruthless, into the grass banks - that's the NZ 50 up, in no time
short ball, rocks back and lays into a pull shot as the ball screams over the deep midwicket boundary
short and wide ball, slapped away to sweeper cover
opens himself up to get in position before smacking this ball over long-on and it goes a long way into the stands
slower offcutter, grips in the surface, forced to long-on
there it is. Munro brings up a century off 52 balls. He drills Mashrafe down the ground and reaches the landmark
very full on the pads, picked up and scooped to square leg
Munro shows his ace early. He backs a long way outside the leg stump. Rubel follows him with a very full ball. Munro swings and only sends an outside edge behind to Nurul
short of a length ball, down the leg side, tries to glance it away but makes an awkward attempt as he tries to go hard at it and gets it off the pad to short fine leg

swipes hard and shovels it hard into the leg side off a length ball. It's the slower off-cutter and he does not pick it. Timing goes awry because of the lack of pace and he skews it in the air to deep square leg who dives forward and snaffles it

bowled 'im. First up. Full and straight from Morris, Munro looks to send his first ball over long-on but is undone by some inswing. The ball creeps in between a big gap between bat and pad to knock back off stump.
charges down but Shadab slows it down on leg, nudged to midwicket
shortish on middle, defended back
short delivery around off, 138 kph, pulled to deep midwicket for a run
on the pads, around middle, nudged to deep square leg
oh yes, they're now racing, shortish outside off, Munro runs down, gets a shortish delivery and pushes the ball over mid-off, an extension of the arms
139 kph, full on middle and leg, Munro stays low and swivels into a flick, behind square leg for four. Just those wrists and meeting it earlier to get it finer

Sarfraz is not happy, flat down leg, swept away to deep backward square leg in the air. He didn't pick the trajectory and that decisive moment costs Pakistan a wicket as the ball lands a few inches in front of him.
a top-edged sweep into the helmet. Googly down leg, extra bounce again, thick leading edge into the grille
shortish around middle, slashed to cover from the crease

big appeal, Munro switched his stance and misses a switch hit. Flat delivery on middle and leg, Munro misses. Sarfraz reviews. it may have pitched in line just to negate the debate of whether it pitched outside leg (for the leftie) or outside off (for the rightie). He is struck in front of middle and off. But the ball is bouncing over middle stump, the googly it was and what happens with that ball is the ball bounces extra. The review is lost.
short on middle and off, 90 kph, too short. Munro stands back and punches to cover
the googly outside off, picks it from the hand and slices a drive to deep point
fuller ball, whips it wide of long-on
gives some room and punches to the extra cover area, Taylor urges Munro through for a second
fuller on off, pushed on the up to the right of the bowler. Mid-on collects it and they have enough time to get the single which raises the 100 of the partnership
full and angling in, flicked away off the pads to deep midwicket
short of a length, punched off the backfoot to short extra cover
length ball, punched off the front foot straight back to the bowler
fuller ball, crunches it down the ground and long-off runs across and cuts it off. Does well as that was travelling and he had to get across at some speed
length ball outside off, drops it into the off side for a quick single and that is the fifty for Munro
length ball, angling in from off, comes forward a step or two as he blocks it into the off side off the front foot
goes for a pull shot and misses it. The ball hits him on the rib before going to the off side
flatter short of a length ball outside off, slapped away to extra cover
quicker ball down the leg side. Turned away into the gap between deep midwicket and deep square leg
flat, loopy delivery that slides across with the arm. Munro flays it with a flat bat and slaps it uppishly over the covers. It's six as flat as you'll see
fuller ball on the stumps, adjusts well to the length and lofts it straight as the ball goes on the bounce over long-on
length ball, makes room by backing away and lofts it with a flat bat over long-off

pitched up outside off, Munro creams it over extra cover as he lofts it clean and the ball sails well over the boundary and to the crowd. End of the 13th over and Munro is in the 90s. Isn't that some knock
backs away and the bowler follows him with a fuller ball. Munro knocks it to deep midwicket off the pads
the pause in the delivery stride doesn't help the bowler as Munro advances and lofts well over the rope at long-off with a firmly struck blow
goes back and punches to long-on
full toss worked to long-on
strays on the pads and Munro clips behind square for another four

this is actually not a bad delivery at all. On a length, and not even giving him that much room. Just how the bats are these days. Munro just thumps it over long-on even though he can't free up entirely
length, on leg stump, gets down and crunches a reverse sweep through point. Massive over
full toss outside off is lumped to long-off
length around off, punched into the covers
full outside off and dragged to long-on
drifts straight, no swing and... and boshed high over backward square leg! Six from his first ball, Munro sounds the horn, tally-ho!

slogged down the ground... but this is pouched at long-on! Australia finally get their breakthrough, Maxwell running around to bag it safely. Didn't quite get hold of this one, Tye back off the canvas, bloodied but not beaten
bottom edges a chop to the keeper as he tried to cut, reached out to a ball similarly within the normal lines to the previous one
beaten outside off (or is that leg?) as he misses out with the switch hit, but amazingly that is wided by the umpire, it looked well inside
full toss down leg, gets bat on it and flicks it fine past the fielder on the ring
Munro stands tall and delivers by planting his front foot and blasting the ball back over the bowler's head nonchalantly
cutter outside off is slapped high out to the cover sweeper who does well to run around and haul it in
brings up another quickfire half-century with a heave into the gaps on the leg side
mistimes a pull into the leg side
well struck cover drive to a full toss outside off and the long-off running around can't catch up with it
rolls the fingers on a back of a length delivery and Munro struggles to force this down to long-off
short outside off but again the fingers rolled mean it doesn't come on, reaches to chop it from head height to third man
short and a bit of width, cut to point
picks the angle and clears the front leg before thumping this over long-on. Too full again and just mowed over
another big heave attempted over the leg side, hit outside the line of leg stump
slants it across full outside his off-stump, Munro gets down and shovels it over long-off
goes back and works it down to long-on
mistimes the slower ball on leg into his pad and it dribbles away to leg, Taylor rushes through and Munro beats the keeper easily as Mushfiqur ran around to collect
full toss is slapped in the vicinity of a diving cover fielder
Mashrafe returns after some early punishment and rolls his fingers on this one which Munro hacks to the cover sweeper
shortish on leg and pulled out to deep square
beaten outside off by a full ball in the blockhole as Al-Amin returns
full outside off and dug out to the bowler
now this does go for Willey, full but curling away as Munro skips out, 135kph and beaten aiming down the ground
shaping a fraction, 131kph around off stump, defended
smashed to cover and he sets off but had given up making his ground as the throw sails wide of the non-striker's stumps
quicker one rushing towards off stump form length, Munro defends
fullish outside off and digs it out to mid-off who fumbles to allow Munro to collect a second
rolls the fingers but drags it short from around the wicket and Munro can pull it with the angle to the backward square fence
gives himself room to carve a full ball outside off into the covers
full toss as he charges down and skews it to long-off
full outside off and drives to cover
digs out a yorker into the covers, ball is flung at the non-striker's end and an overthrow results
full on middle, backs away and smears it to extra cover, where Wildermuth fumbles
good length on middle stump, and it's defended off the back foot to the bowler. Emrit throws at the stumps, and hits it, but why?! Fakhar was always in. Frustration showing, slightly
slower short ball outside off, Zaman cuts and misses in the corridor, throwing his hands at the ball
short, wide, reaches out for the ball with his hands and carves it away behind point. The ball thuds into the boundary. Zaman loves it there
short and wide outside off, looks like another slower ball, but it's well past the tramline
backs away to loft, bowler fires full and wide. Left alone
works this off his hip towards deep midwicket
back of a length and angling away close to off, punched up to backward point. The fielder has a shy at the non-striker's end and concedes an overthrow
back of a length and angling away outside past the tramline. Yet another off-side wide
pulled all along the ground to deep square.
good length just outside off, tapped off his pads to the leg side this time
back of length on middle and leg, clipped to long leg
very full and very wide outside off, Zaman flits around in the crease, throwing the bowler off
darted short and too wide outside off, another off-side wide from Wildermuth
short on middle and Fakhar comes down the wicket to pull to the cow-corner boundary. Flat-batted this with some ferocity to the leg side. What strength!
swings wildly without getting close to it. Full and angled across, beaten
slides across outside off, opens the face and pats it away to short third man
cramped for room, sharp turn back in as he plays this back to the bowler. Looked to punch through extra cover
driven through the line to long-off
back of length on off, bunted to cover

high in the air, and mid-off runs across to his left to take the steepler. Big wicket, one brought out of frustration. Is there hope still for Zimbabwe? Not a sparkling Fakhar knock. He was looking to clear his front leg and wallop this over long-on, toe-ended it.
good morning, Mr Stanlake. Starts with a nice, juicy leg-stump half-volley that has been flicked neatly to the square leg boundary. Easy
slants a length ball across the left-hander, left alone
slash and a miss. Beaten for pace, extra bounce as well that time for big Billy
ripper of a bouncer, late on the pull. Got big on him as well.
looks to pull this into the bleachers, misses. Pace from Stanlake again
too much width this time, Fakhar has blasted that through cover and point. Cracking stroke!
lofted, but not well timed. Just short of mid-on
good length and angling away just a shade outside off, Fakhar inches forward and defensively drops the ball to the leg side
slightly overpitched and outside off, Fakhar gets well forward and stabs it away through the gap at the covers
back of a length and a hint of width outside off, enough for Fakhar to stand tall and punch it through extra cover
short on off stump, stands tall and pulls over square leg. Chase for Walton in the deep, but manages to pull it back
backs away early and the bowler follows him and flights it up, Zaman pushes it out through covers
slower full ball on leg stump, pushed out to long-on
slow turn from middle, worked to square leg again

big wind up from Fakhar, and sent over long on! Full on off, but Fakhar's seeing this ball like a watermelon. Got his front leg out of the way and hit it clean as a whistle. Shows his followthrough off after playing that shot
width offered once again, and slapped past point with ease. Stays on the back foot and plays this late. Played between the two infielders on the off side
punched into the gap between cover and cover point. Delightful timing and placement. Mire may have got some hand on it at extra cover, the timing so good however
backs away and belts this full delivery on the bounce to mid-off
looks to help this along, misses. Too short and angling in, right there for him to lend direction to this.
worked off his hip to deep square leg
backs away to cut, realises this is angled in and way too steep so bails out.
gets on top of the bounce and bunts this towards backward point
backs away and eases this tossed up delivery wide of cover for a quick single
down on one knee as he swings this across to bisect the gap at deep midwicket.
squeezes this full delivery to cover, looked to initially work this through midwicket
helps this pull along, on the bounce to fine leg. Looked to hit it a lot square though
short and angling in, pulled all along the ground to deep square
slower ball, bunted into the off side for a quick single
steps out to pull, the ball gets big on him. Hits him closer to the helmet.
steps out and wallops this into the bar, housed in the club house, at wide long-on. Massive hit. Right to the pitch, swung away with all his might.
backs away and pulls, not entirely in control. Down to deep midwicket, but they scamper back for the second
shapes to pull, ball gets big on him so he merely bunts this into the leg side and scampers a quick single
steep bounce from short of length on middle, defended back
mistimes a pull wide of midwicket. Hit the top part of the bat
swept from outside off, bounces into the ropes at deep backward square leg. Premeditated, very effective. At the moment, he's bowling full and flat. Predictable stuff
drifting away, he slices this drive to the point boundary. Lazy effort from Mire, gave it chase but somehow couldn't cleanly pull it back in
scooped behind square, short fine gives it chase and just manages to pull it back in. Used the bowler's pace as he backed away to execute
flatter from around the stumps, played back to the bowler
mighty full and wide outside off, scythed to deep third man
pulled all along the ground to deep square leg
back of a length and on middle, Fakhar clears his front leg and hacks it away to the left of mid-on for the first boundary of Pakistan's chase
slower ball, finishes outside leg, tucked around the corner

What have you done, Fakhar? This wicket hushes Lahore. Fakhar pre-meditates, jumps across off even before Rajitha delivers. He searches for a scoop, the seamer darts it outside off, the ball kisses the pad and rolls back onto the stumps. Rajitha produces the breakthrough for SL
eased to point, super stop. Dot ball.
steps out, sees this short and wide, so reaches out and steers that towards deep point
good length on off stump, and angling into Fakhar. Attempts a leg-side slog, but not off the bat's middle. Doesn't matter though - it soars over long on for a maximum
shapes to cut, misses. Too full for him to attempt that
short outside off, and once again Fakhar uses the width to cut this square. Played finer than the cut played two balls earlier, and this time third man's chase is futile
waist-high full toss just outside off. Tapped to cover for a quick single. Could be dangerous, but Walton misses the direct hit
slider on off, punched wide of point
full just outside off. Fakhar takes a step forward and mistimes a drive to mid on

full on middle stump, and Fakhar's expecting that length. Goes deep into his crease to find that extra second and then swings hard at it. Clanked towards the cow-corner boundary this time. Also the team fifty
full on off stump, and Fakhar comes down the wicket. Muscles this drive past Badree's left to long on
shot, what a shot! Zaman sees width and cracks the whip at this short ball. Tremendous slap over point
slower-ball yorker on off, dug out to the right of the bowler for a quick single
nudged behind square on the leg side for an easy single
makes room and eases this past point
one handed stop by the bowler
steers this full delivery straight to short third man
feather edge! and Fakhar goes. Good length on off, and the batsman comes down the wicket. Tries to flat-bat towards the leg side, but the extra bounce takes the top edge. Through to Ramdin
back of a length, tucking him up by angling it in, Zaman works it unconvincingly to midwicket
gentle little dab into the off side as they scamper a quick single
Zaman throws his hands a wide one and smears it to sweeper cover to round out the 10-ball over
full just outside off. Spinning into Fakhar, and he swipes at it across the line. Thumped to long on
straight as an arrow! Full outside off, and he comes dancing down the wicket before drilling it over Agar's head! Enough width for him to smack this flat-batted for a maximum. Fifty too
slash and a miss. This short of length delivery cut back in to beat the inside edge
what a start, what a delivery. Length ball on the stumps, shapes back in to beat the bat, hits the batsman on the thigh before crashing on to the stumps
good length on middle, and the batsman shuffles to the leg side. Makes that extra room, and then muscles this inside out past mid off's right. Not hit well, but well enough to beat the infielder
imperious! Picks the length early, swivels and pulls over square leg. Lovely use of his wrists to pick the gap.
slingy action, full on middle, almost a yorker. Skewed to point
savage blow, this time in front of square. Disdainfully slapped through midwicket. Once again Stanlake pays the price for being too short.
off-stump yorker, jammed down to long-on
tossed up at off, dips, skewed in the air over extra cover
darted outside off, drilled down the ground past the left of Maxwell for a powerful four
slower, short ball on middle, swivel-pulled to short fine leg. Another offcutter from Stoinis
slower offcutter, punched up to backward point
back of a length and breaks away outside off, Zaman skips away outside leg, creates additional room and carts it up and over extra cover
slower ball, beaten outside off
back of a length on leg stump, Zaman gets behind the line and pushes a single to the covers
back of a length on the hips, Zaman flicks his wrists and sends the ball to the square-leg boundary
Zaman runs down the track and hacks a short ball from middle down to long-on
Zaman leans back and chops a short ball from outside off to backward point
Zaman steps away outside leg, this is on a length and outside off, the batsman stays leg-side of the ball and pumps it over the covers. Pakistan's chase is on
Zaman backs away outside leg and stabs a shortish ball to point
yorker, tailing into the left-hander, Zaman is able to squeezes it out to the left of mid-on

looking to hit everything too hard. And Zaman's gone. A fistpump from Sanjaya. A full delivery swinging in, Zaman comes charging at the bowler, looking to hit the ball through the off side, but he yorked himself instead. The ball swings in between bat and pad and knocks back leg stump. First strike, fight SL, fight.
flat and straight, around off, defended back. Riskless five off that. Sri Lanka got to do better than that.
Zaman jumps away outside leg, takes a length ball and plants it into the stands beyond wide long-on. Muscled away
runs down does Zaman and looks to hit through the line but the ball skews off the inside half, towards deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, this hip-high ball is merrily swatted away over backward square leg for a one-bounce four. Bam!
lifter on leg stump, gets big on Zaman, and beats the hook
good single. Full on leg, worked away towards midwicket for one
fantastic fielding. Full down leg, worked down to short fine leg, who dives to his right to save four
a big wind-up and swing but no connection. Full, swinging in, hits Zaman on the pad, one leg bye to short fine leg
good comeback. On a length on leg, worked away towards square leg for one. Some definite inswing to the left-hander
four to start. Short and wide from Sanjaya, and that's one area you don't want to bowl to Zaman. A thick slash over slip for four. Margin of error reduces to almost nothing when it's short and wide

excellent throw in from deep midwicket and Udana catches Zaman short of his ground. Tough on the batsman, after timing the short ball beautifully out into the vacant area. Zaman thinks there is a third on offer, Shehzad agrees to it at first but then sells his partner down the creek.
premeditates to make room down leg, but Munaweera loops the ball outside off stump and in trying to reach the ball and carve it over cover, Zaman falls off his feet
Zaman backs away outside leg, the bowler follows him with a bouncer, the opener carefully ducks under it
shortish and outside off, chops it to cover

full on leg stump, but it's been speared to the long-on boundary. Pure bottom-hand power, ensuring a ball swinging quite late into the leg stump - essentially a pretty good ball - is absolutely punished
heaves a length ball on leg stump out to deep midwicket
full on middle and leg, Zaman defends
loops it up on off stump, drives to long-off
flatter delivery on leg stump, Zaman punches it to long-on
flighted on off from round the wicket, driven down to long-off off the front foot
dropped short and outside off, Zaman reaches out for the ball and flashes to point
full and outside off, Zaman clears his front leg and slices the ball to cover
quick and straight, on leg, worked to midwicket
a slower ball to finish, 84 kph, skewed back to the bowler
banged short and outside off, chops a cut to the covers

Dropped by Jarvis diving to his right from wide long-on. Talking about adding injury to insult. Jarvis collapses in pain. Pushed through outside off, Fakhar Zaman clears his front leg and hoicks it over the leg side. The physio is out to tend to Jarvis and now he leaves the field. Hit flat and hard, and Jarvis has injured his bowling hand. Zimbabwe can't afford any more losses. They've already lost as many as five frontline players, including Raza and Cremer
full-toss outside off, swatted away to deep midwicket
another full-toss, on off, stabbed away only as far as the bowler

Chisoro floors the leg stump and pumps his fist. Back of a length and fizzes off the pitch - quicker dart from the left-arm spinner - Fakhar looks to muscle it over the leg side but loses his shape in the process. Chisoro sends the leg stump cartwheeling. What a sight for a bowler!
full and angling away outside off, drags an inside edge behind square on the leg side
very full and wide outside off, Zaman stays leg-side of the ball and flashes it straight to mid-off
dragged short on off, Zaman camps on the back foot and swats it straight to midwicket
really full on middle, not much turn either way, smoothly driven down to long-off for one
good length and tucks up the batsman for room, jabbed to the covers for a speedy single
short and on middle, no room for the batsman to free his arms, jabbed back to the bowler
back of a length on middle and leg, punched back to Richardson again
full and angling away outside off, Zaman likes it there. He stays leg-side of the ball and blazes it through the covers. He doesn't move his feet much muscles it away
short on middle, backs away and stabs it straight to backward point
Zaman ventures outside leg and aims to cut it on the up over backward point. But this short ball beats him for pace and bounce

Has Zaman been strangled down the leg side? Umpire Jeremiah Matibiri raises his finger. Zaman doesn't seem pleased but no DRS in this series to challenge the on-field out decision. Dug in down the leg side, rushes Zaman into a hook. There's a deflection - not sure if it was off the glove or bat - but Zaman has to exit. Three wickets in three overs for Stanlake
full outside off, and once again Fakhar comes down the wicket. Mistimes a thump over the non-striker's head, but still has enough legs to crash into the boundary. Ten off two balls
back of a length and outside off, punched through the line to mid-off
good length and simply zips through outside off with extra bounce, Fakhar top-edges a cut fine of short third man for four

another slower ball, but it's short, and Zaman makes himself the room he needs to hammer it to the left of the sweeper cover. It's about to skip away to the boundary but Musakanda throws himself headfirst at the ball and flicks it back, much like McCullum used to do in the 2015 World Cup. Superb cricket!

slower ball on leg stump, he ticks it through square leg to bring up his second T20I fifty. But even as he celebrates, he gets a warning from umpire Tiffin for running down the danger area of the pitch

when he chooses timing over power, he looks so much better. Anyone does, honestly. A slower delivery outside off, a languid drive looks destined for the cover boundary before short cover leaps to his right and gets a hand on it. Saved two
I like this strategy from Zaman, just going after it. A low full toss outside off, driven to extra cover

just wide of mid-on. Zaman wants to finish this chase in the Powerplay. Full and moving back in, Zaman clears his front leg and gives it everything, the ball skews off the inside half and just evades mid-on to his right. May have even got a hand on it.
a low full toss around middle and leg, some shape in the air, coming back in, driven to mid-on
a full swinging delivery outside off, inswing. Nice line, the length a tad too full, jammed back to the bowler
dipping full-toss on leg stump, dug out
short on leg stump, flapped away to short fine leg
back of a length and slanting away outside off, jabbed through the line to sweeper cover
wide yorker, squirted fine of deep third man now
another excellent wide yorker, sneaks under the swinging bat
stands still against a very full delivery on off stump - no feet really - and plonks it to mid-off

run-out chance! And it comes off a low full toss, which Zaman steers to the left of cover and hares out for a single. He's more than halfway down, not realising Malik has no interest in the run at all. Eventually he stops, turns, sprints for dear life and makes his crease. Poor throw in from the captain Masakadza
knocks it square on the off side, into a much more vacant spot around point, to secure a single
full and outside off, Zaman launches it to the sweeper cover

mis-hits it over the top of the bowler! And it carries all the way - despite his being a bit off-balance. The bowler sees him coming down the pitch and shifts the line wide outside off, to possibly stump the left-hander. But Zaman reaches out and smashes it over long-off. It was shots like these that won the Champions Trophy for Pakistan
good length ball on off stump, cuts behind point
full on middle and leg, squeezes it out to deep midwicket
picked off the pads to fine leg
overpitched on leg, another simple nudge towards midwicket. Good defensive Powerplay bowling
good length outside off, punched away to mid-off
full around off, Zaman lets his hands loose, right through the line, looking to hit the ball too hard. Some swing takes the ball towards the inside half of the bat, one to deep square leg
back of length angling away, he makes room and slaps this straight to cover point.
works this length ball on middle and leg towards midwicket
dabs this gently into the off side, behind square, for a quick single.
squeezes this full yorker-length delivery back to the bowler
steps out and belts this back on the bounce to Agar
swept towards deep backward square leg, Tye can't get there.
huge, huge! This is stunning batting. Picked his slot, got to the pitch and swung this with the spin and breeze, cleared the ropes comfortably. They aren't small boundaries, mind you
swung away but not cleanly, off a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
swung away, deep midwicket and long-on converge to keep that to two
works this into the leg side as they scamper a single
makes room and eases this wide of point
beauty! Angling away but too close to the off stump channel, looks to run it down but is beaten
jags away off a length to square him up as this whizzes past that tentative push
pulled, all along the ground to deep square leg
steps out and smashes the cover off this, excellent stop by Agar at extra cover, just a half-stop mind you but he took the pace off to save three runs
clobbered deep into the stands at deep midwicket, out onto the roof. That is the shortest boundary at the ground, fifty for Fakhar. Super knock.
fired flat on middle and leg, tucked towards square leg
cut away but straight to point
looks to whip this behind square, misses. Angle was taking it way down leg, wide again.
pulled, but there's protection at deep square leg, down to just a single.
cracking stroke, belted on the bounce over the point fielder. Hit that hard into the turf, so the fielder at the edge of the ring stood no chance. Too much width this time
clears his front leg and wallops this length ball to deep square leg this time
shorter and angling across off stump, Fakhar hangs back and jabs the ball straight to short cover
too much leg side. Too short, he rolls his wrists over the pull to pick this behind square. Raced away
short, attacking off, Fakhar makes some room and chops to point

Fakhar stays leg-side of this short ball outside off and lashes it to extra cover, where Chigumbura throws himself to his left and intercepts the ball but he can't throw the stumps down. Fakhar nicks a risky single
Fakhar looks to drag one against the angle. Instead, he squirts an outside edge past lone slip to deep third man
on a length and slides on outside off from round the wicket, slapped to point
makes room, bowler follows him with the short ball on the body, tucked into the leg side as they scamper a run
here comes Fakhar: down the track and hoicks it to mid-on off the inside half
here comes Fakhar again: he steps out, makes some room, this is a turning offbreak from Nyumbu. He is nowhere close to the pitch but manages to slice it over long-off for six
Fakhar forays down the track, gets too close to the pitch of this offbreak now, and hoicks it away straight of mid-on for back-to-back boundaries
flat dart, turns and bounces past the outside edge
Fakhar stays leg-side of this full ball outside off and crunches it straight to extra cover
shorter and outside off, slashes a cut to backward point
Fakhar moves away outside leg, Muzarabani still targets his head with a nasty short ball. Fakhar gets a big top edge on the hook. It flies over long leg for six
another top-edge, this one evades Muzarabani at short fine leg. Short, aimed at the body, miscues a hook and gets away as the ball sails over Muzarabani
drills this down to long-on
hip-high short ball on middle stump, Fakhar picks up the length swiftly. Rocks back and swats a pull to Mire at deep backward square leg
beaten as he looks to back away and crash this over point
backs away and flat-bats this length ball to long off

caught at backward point! Some early shape forces a mistake! 144kph, full but it swung late away from the left hander, he only got half a stride in but lashed at a drive and sliced it off the outer half of the bat straight to Smith at backward point. Easy catch. Golden duck for Fakhar
just short of a good length and angling away outside off, slashed away to sweeper cover off the back foot
on a length and angling away too wide outside off, past the tramline, off-side wide
very full and angling across off stump, smeared away to the right of short cover and left of sweeper cover
overpitched and outside off, smashed away to mid-off, where Burl lets the ball burst through his hands. The force of the shot ensured the ball burst out
looped up slower, higher, and wider, Fakhar throws his bat at the ball and carves it up and over backward point
on a length and turning into the pads, nudged gently enough through midwicket for a couple of runs
bad timing. Full on leg, Zaman's wild swing clears midwicket for a couple. Square leg runs around. Zaman has to rely on timing much more than his power
almost a run out! Was full and straight, off the pad into the leg side, Azam wanted the run and has to turn around quickly. The dive would have just saved him
back of a length outside off, angled wide of backward point to third man and there's good running to make the second
a strangled appeal for a catch down the leg side, was speared in at leg stump, just glances the pad through to Carey. Starc searching for early swing
full outside off, not much footwork as he drives square to point
over the wicket, full at the stumps, 137kph, defended to the bowler
finds mid-off! So another failure for Zaman as he tries to get going. Stayed leg-side of a full delivery, sliced across the delivery, sends a pretty straightforward catch to Warner
full and wide outside off, just inside the wide tramline. Well bowled, I love that delivery, such a good defensive option, a free dot ball
wide of midwicket. Zaman looking to hit these balls coming into him through the off side. Definitely wrong options. Full on middle and leg, the ball skews past midwicket for a couple
tucked off the pads to square leg
too quick again, darted in on the pads, Zaman runs down, misses the ball, hits the pads back to the bowler
makes room, looking to open the off side, but it's fast and straight. Pushed towards cover for one

good option from Zaman, better stop from the fielder running back from square leg. Flat and straight, Zaman stays low and sweeps the ball over square leg. Always just wanted to get the ball over the fielder. Pulled back just inside, think that was Shanaka
this is a typical Fakhar special. This is length on leg stump, he stays inside the crease and just whips it over deep backward square leg with minimal feet movement.
too short, he helps this on its way to the deep backward square leg boundary. Walked across to pick his spot and when the ball arrived, just signed it with love and sent it on its way
steps out and works this down to long on
looks to swing over long-on but gets a thick outside edge that bounces towards the third man boundary. The fielder there tried to stop, but ended up parrying it over the ropes.
the party is over, he can only toe-end this pull as far as the edge of the ring at midwicket. Went for a biff across the line, ended up having to fetch it from too far outside.

and is that the wicket? Sri Lanka think so, the umpires confer. Think he's gone. Flat outside off, the ball sliding on with the arm. Zaman sees some width, and tries to cut, but is beaten for pace again. The ball misses the outside edge but doesn't miss the outside of off stump. That's Sri Lanka's first wicket. A big "not out" flashes on the big screen, but that was clearly a mistake. Zaman walks off eventually.
darted in on the pads, a clip to deep midwicket. Four singles off four balls
again looking to hit the ball too hard. Full on leg, Zaman comes charging and hits the ball down to long-on. Just focus on timing, if you're strong, the power will do the rest
another good bouncer. Pings Zaman on the helmet, hits him and ricochets down to third man for a leg bye. Harried for pace.
shortish around off, dabbed towards backward point for a quick single.
hammered! Sees Zaman coming and shortens the length, but Zaman doesn't mind slapping the ball through the line with a cross bat. Smashed past mid-on for four
comes charging at Gunathilaka, full down leg, hammered to long-off for one
powerful hit, but not great timing. Full around leg, smashed to deep midwicket. Deep square leg gets around
full around off, pushed to mid-off where Thisara can't prevent one. Another good single
oh no, that's tripe. Rubbish. Short slow delivery well down leg, Zaman goes after it and pulls past short fine leg's right. Would have been short and wide to the right-hander. Help yourself
good length on off, pushed back to the bowler. The perfect delivery to Zaman. Sri Lanka have been excellent so far
drilled down to long-on, who scoops it to long-off, can't prevent the second though
this is a half-volley on off stump, Fakhar leans forward and caresses this between extra cover and mid-off.
back of a length outside off and that's too easy for the tall man. Cuts it past point, a very fluent shot
backs away a long way and the bowler follows him with a short of a length ball. Tries to pull but does not middle it, on the bounce to short fine
keeps it short to Fakhar, he is a touch late onto the pull as the ball rolls to the covers after hitting him on the midriff
short on the thigh pad, Fakhar falls over the flick and sneaks across for a leg bye
he hits a hard length - neither driveable nor pullable - stabbed back to the bowler
banged short on middle, 91ks, punched to midwicket
tossed outside off, paddled away through backward square leg. First runs for Zzaman in internationals
slower cutter on the leg stump, grips in the track, bounces, catches the outside edge and sneaks away towards third man
short and outside off, cracked away to deep cover
some flight on off, Zaman presses forward to defend
advances, but the wily Badree fires it short and wide. Guided to point who fires unnecessarily and concedes an overthrow to long-on

taken at deep midwicket. Zaman's stuttering debut ends. Wanted to get on top of Badree. But flawed execution. Plenty of flight from Badree, tosses that up towards off. Zaman gets low and top-edges his sweep all the way to the man at deep midwicket who takes a reverse-cupped catch at the boundary
short ball, tries to pull but gets through with the shot early, wears it on the helmet
full, outside off, pushes it off the front foot in front of mid-off, who is slightly deeper and wider and sets off for a quick single
fullish, pushed across outside off, carves it through covers for one and sweeper runs to his left to cut it off
too full, wide outside off and Fakhar gets down to slog. does it against the turn and he has got that bang off the middle. Clears long-on with ease
opens the bat face late and pinches a single through the backward point region
goes for the same slog again but this time the ball drifts away outside off and turns also, taking it out of his reach. He misses
flicked away to backward square leg
flat, on a length, tries to flick across the line and gets an inside edge that misses the stumps
width on offer outside off, slapped to the left of backward point who gets a hand to it
back of a length and veering into the pads, clips a single between midwicket and mid-on
very full and wide outside off, driven down to long-off
the plan to Fakhar is clear: deny him room and target the body. Short and pings him on the midriff again as Fakhar swings and misses
can't pitch it up and offer room to Fakhar. He frees his arms, checks his drive and hits it straight of mid-off. He picked the offcutter and adjusted to the change of pace
leading edge down to third man. It's a full toss swinging away outside off, closes the face early on it
length ball on the pads, looks to flick but can't get bat on it. Pings down the pitch
length on the pads again, and once again  he can't get enough bat on it. Just an inside edge. Runs into the covers off the pad, and they steal a single
misses another one on the pads! Third full ball on the pads that he's missed out on. This one swings in and makes connection with him before he can get the bat down
slower ball ball met on the full at leg stump, leans into it and flicks to deep midwicket
full toss outside a leg stump line. Zaman is backing away to make room but ends up cramping himself. It's a mistimed chop into the covers
full toss outside leg and he drags it to mid-on. It's not easy living for Zaman who has been jumping around and giving himself little chance. Down the pitch and trying to make room again
inside edge past the stumps and down to the fine leg boundary. Another yorker from Southee, in the corridor. Zaman wants to carve this with his front leg down leg side.
attempted yorker met on the full outside off, punched straight to mid-off
slower ball at a length on leg stump. Flicked with soft hands through the open square leg area
follows him down leg side with a full ball and cramps him. He finds mid-on
length ball follows him into the leg side. He can only jab it towards mid-on. That was 147.4 kph

gets him at cover! Superb setting up of this wicket from New Zealand. It's a short ball in at his chest, rising sharply. He wants to pummel it over midwicket with a pull but he gets under it and slices into the off side instead. They gave him no room at all for any of his favourite strokes and after a bunch of yorkers, they get him with the first short ball

Big Billy has bounced out Fakhar. The plan has worked. Banged in short and angling away outside off at 148.4ks - pace like fire - the opener is hurried into a hook against the angle. He skies it to short cover off a top edge
Fakhar races down the track, back of a length on middle, he hacks it up and over the covers
short at the chest, spliced in the air but evades Lynn running back and across to his right from short fine leg
slower cutter on middle, hangs back and glides to point. Can't take on Maxwell's arm
almost a wicket for Narine. Short of a length and spins in - goes the other way - Zaman nearly drags it back onto the stumps
back of a length and on middle, tip and run to the covers

short and angling away outside off, Fakhar aims to pull it over midwicket. Instead, he loses his shape and top-edges it to the left of the keeper and right of slip. The ball races away to the third man fence. Replays suggest Carey dived but the ball burst through his gloves That'll go down as a dropped chance
length ball shaping away outside off, blocked on the front foot
too full, whipped away from the pads between midwicket and square leg

run out chance, missed. Or, is it? Tries to squeeze out this fuller ball and chops it into the turf as the ball misses the stumps. The non-striker takes off for the run but Zaman is busy looking at where the ball has gone. The keeper fires a throw to the bowler's end and it seems initially that Holder has taken the stumps out with his hand and let the ball go. He did let the ball go, but as replays show, he still had the ball in his hand when the bails come off. Holder does not even make the appeal as he assumes he has lost grip of the ball. But seems like Carlos Brathwaite thought otherwise and made a belated appeal. Ball very much in hand when bails come off and that's a wicket
it's a slower ball from Beuran, a cutter, but Fakhar spots it and waits on his cut to thread the gap between backward point and gully. They're missing a trick, having moved third man out of position

against the run of play, Beuran has struck! Fakhar sized up a bouncer and aimed for the bleachers, but he got underneath it and could only get the ball as far as Janneman Malan at deep square leg. South Africa really needed this strike
full on off, and angling into leg stump. Fakhar tries to nudge it to square leg, but the ball hits his knee-roll and dribbles away to the off side
full on middle, and he prods forward to drive. Mistimed past the bowler's right to mid off this time
length ball, wide outside off, and the drive away from his body is sliced only to cover
length ball, wide outside off, and the punch whizzes past the outside edge to the keeper
back of a length, cramping Fakhar. Mistimes a whip to the leg side, and they sneak across for a single
back of a length on leg stump, and he tucks this fine past the keeper's left for four! Gloves it, replays suggest
length ball on leg stump, and he defends with soft hands off the back foot
smoked! Length ball, not fast enough (130kph) and he swivels to smack a pull over deep midwicket! Into the crowd
length ball on middle, and Fakhar waits for that to get to him, before pulling behind square - past the square-leg umpire - for another leg-side boundary
length ball, but again outside leg stump. Fakhar swivels to pull once more, but misses
slightly fuller, but still pretty short. Fakhar looks to muscle a shot over square leg, but the ball hits his thigh-guard and rolls past the man at short fine leg!
length ball on leg, and worked off his hips to deep midwicket. Rassie runs across from deep square leg to cut the ball off. Another skyscraper of an over from Pakistan
full on middle, and the inswinger is muscled towards the leg side. Hits the bat's inside half and rolls away to short fine leg
length ball on middle, and angling away from Fakhar. Shapes up to cut, but can't beat the infield
back of a length on leg stump, and he tries to pull but misses. The ball hits his body and rolls away to short fine leg
full on middle, and angling away from Fakhar. But he had backed away to make some extra room anyway, and therefore the ball is too far from him. Through to the keeper
full on middle, and drilled down the ground - past the non-striker - to mid on
Beuran pulls his length back, Fakhar cutting the ball down to third man
low full toss, backs away and carves it through covers. Throw from the deep is off target as they take on the fielder
Fakhar clears his front leg and has an almighty heave at a full ball from Beuran, slugging it back over his head and down the ground for four. He didn't get all of it, but got enough
Fakhar shovels one down the ground with plenty of bottom hand, Morris running over the ball at mid on and allowing a run
low full toss, pushed out to mid-off for one
well-bowled. Wide yorker, Zaman tries to squeeze it out and can't make contact
full and wide, gets down for a half-sweep and works it to backward square leg
tries to flick across the line and gets a leading edge. Fullish length ball, wants to heave it over the leg side and the ball lobs to third man region. Lands in a no man's region
slower ball, tries to slog and misses. Wears it on the stomach and pinches a leg bye. Bowler has a shy at his end and misses the stumps
short of a length and not much pace, pulled away wide of deep midwicket
tries to pull without making an effort to get behind the line. It is angling across and he does not make contact
dug in, very short and very high, over the head

134 kph, that's the way Zaman plays, I Guess. A full delivery on off, Zaman clears his front leg, looking to swat another wild drive over mid-off, but the ball skews off the outside half to cover. Just popped up. Undone by extra bounce, that's the first batsman to fail to adapt to extra bounce despite a chance

just over Phillips. A shortish delivery on middle and leg, Zaman pulls but gets a leading edge which plonks over the keeper. Both Taylor and Phillips run back, neither can get very close. There is extra bounce in this surface, how quickly can Pakistan adapt?
a full delivery outside off, angled across. Zaman wafts, thick outside edge to third man
length, and he whips it away through midwicket for four!
has an almighty swing at the second ball, outside off, and misses! That was delivered at 136kph, and moving away from him

GOT HIM! Length, outside off, and he gets caught in no man's land. Looks to half-cut, half-drive, and ends up just guiding the ball down to first slip. Held by Hendricks, to help another Hendricks draw first blood. Poor shot, though!
Fakhar's off the mark straight away, turning a full ball into the leg side and sprinting through for one. 14 runs off the first over!
tapped into the covers, and they steal a quick single
and he finds some swing straight away, but it hoops down the leg side
and his first ball in international cricket is full and turned into the leg side for a single
nicely bowled by Sipamla, giving Fakhar no width on either side of the wicket, just the one to midwicket
outswinging yorker just outside off, jammed into the pitch

is that dropped? Sound when the ball goes past Fakhar's drive, but Seifert hasn't taken that simple grab. The sound could have been the bat jamming down into the pitch. Zaman stepped out and was beaten by angle

Kane Williamson, you beauty! He throws himself to his left from mid-off and completes a one-hander, inches from the ground. What a play. Milne fires it very full on middle, 147ks, Zaman backs away outside leg, does not get underneath the length. The bat twists in his hands as he scoops a low catch. That it was a catch was down to Williamson's athletic intervention at mid-off. The NZ skip barely celebrates Cool cat. Zaman is stunned
This should be out. Zaman edges to second slip but MacLeod lets the ball slip through his hands and it goes for four.
Two dot balls now, slightly quicker from Sole and goes over the stumps
Chris Sole begins the game with a dot ball.
Second wicket for Evans and Scotland! Top edged high in the air, and Matthew Cross waits, and takes the catch.
Evans continues from the Nursery End, flicked off the pads past the keeper for four leg byes.
short, and pulled, but straight to the deep square leg fielder.
driven to mid on but no run.
flicked off the legs for two quick runs.
This should be out, hit high in the air, but Leask drops!
Zaman smashes this over the fielder at long on for six.
Smashed past the bowler for four runs.
there's a delay whilst the field is adjusted, and there is a loud LBW appeal. Turned down.
played onto the pads.
driven past the bowler for four runs.
guided up to long on for a single.
a lovely pull shot, the crowd roar in approval, but it is just a single.
flicked into the leg side for a single.
Sharif to open the bowling, and the first ball is called a wide.
next delivery is better, and Zaman defends back to the bowler.
pulled to the leg side and they run twice.

Taken? Yes! full and wide outside off, forces the batsman to reach at it once more, but Fakhar slaps it over point anyway. Man in the deep though, and it's an excellent catch from the outfielder. Dives forward and completes a tough low catch. Those dismissals are always difficult for the fielder to execute. Full marks. Small delay as the umpire wants to check if the catch was completed. Looks like Bruce's palms, ball in hand, hit the ground while trying to complete that catch. Were his fingers under the ball? Nothing conclusive on the replays. The on-field umpire's decision stands. Fakhar falls for 46.
guided to the leg side and quick running between the stumps sees Zaman pick up another two runs.
fuller, defended to the off-side.
defended back to the bowler
flicked down to fine leg for four runs.
guided to the leg side, but no run.
cut to the fielder at midwicket.
fuller from Sole, and that is dispatched for four with a lovely on drive
bouncer, and a huge swing and a miss.
hits the pads of Zaman and they run a quick leg bye single
Sharif comes on from the Pavilion End. Cut for four runs
pulled, this is going for four. No, its fielded on the boundary and it is just a single.
cut, and he splits the field at gully for four runs.
driven to long on for one
better length from Evans, dug out and they pick up a quick single.
bouncer from Evans, and that is a height wide.
driven to long off for a single
spin from both ends as Leask enters the attack. Single to long off
huge over from Leask, and he ends the over with another dot.
