reverse sweep, caught by Coetzer at backward point.
Lovely ball from Sharif, nearly finds the edge.
Inside edge, past the keeper and four runs.
full outside leg stump, comes down the wicket and smacked past the bowler to long on. Couldn't get under that ball
sees the batsman come down the ground and darted full and wide outside off. The tall batsman manages to stretch out and get some bat to ball. Bunted to cover
full on leg stump, tries to slog this towards the leg side but can't get the connection. Played from near the bat's sticker area as it goes away to deep backward square
through to the keeper! Just past Fakhar's outside edge there. Length ball on middle, and too close to his body for the cut. Beaten by the pace too
length ball on middle, and angling away. Carved off the back foot past point. Stanlake cleans up in the deep
uses his feet! Full outside off, and Fakhar's danced down the wicket. Slashes hard at this, and manages to clear mid off. A couple more for Pakistan. What an entertaining first over
short and sliding across off, Zaman marks his return with a four. He skips back and cracks it away behind point
flat and pushed through outside off again, Zaman latches onto it again, sends it behind point for back-to-back fours
Zaman uses his feet, sort of yorks himself, and squeezes a single

chance of a run out! But he can't get the direct hit. Carey has a shy at it, but alas for Australia. Full on leg, and Fakhar missed a sweep. The ball went towards the leg side and Fakhar was looking for the single. Miscommunication in the middle means Fakhar must run back, but lucky him. They eventually take a single anyway after the overthrow
full outside off, and spinning away from Fakhar. Tries to drive away from his body, and splices the shot to point
sliding through outside off, Zaman reaches out for the ball and jams it to the covers
good length, catches the pad, and rolls away behind square on the leg side
short and keeps rising on Zaman, he looks to upper-cut the ball over short third man. No dice
back of a length and angling away outside off., Naaah, can't offer so much room to Zaman. He stays leg-side of the ball and cracks it between point and covers
slower offcutter outside off, Zaman does not read the pace variation, tips it to the off side and hares across for one
overpitched and outside off, drilled through the line to cover
hip-high short ball on middle, Zaman launches it into the top tier. He has Sarfraz clapping in the dug out. He swivels on the back foot and dispatches it into he oblivion. Soars up and over midwicket
full at the stumps, driven to mid-on for one
leg-stump yorker, 140ks, Zaman, having jumped outside leg, somehow digs it out
slower, short ball, on middle, swatted off the back foot to deep midwicket
Zaman backs away outside off, this is the slower one from the back of the hand, this legcutter is jabbed through the covers
back of a length outside leg stump, and he misses the pull shot. Hits the bottom of his bat and rolls back to the bowler
length ball on leg stump, and Fakhar wedges a shot towards square leg off his pads. They pinch a single
how did that miss leg stump?! Full on middle, and Fakhar looks to swing across the line. Takes the bat's inside-edge, and flies through to the fine-leg boundary
overpitched on off stump, and he mistimes a drive to cover off the front foot. Better calling from the two batsmen now, a firm 'yes' to take the single
short on leg stump, and the tall batsman ducks out of the ball's line. One for the over, says the umpire
back of a length on middle stump, muscled off the back foot to deep midwicket once again. Not timed well enough, which fortunately for the batting team, allows them to take the second run as well

back of a length on middle stump, comes down the wicket and slapped to cover. They're racing across for the quick single. Dangerous, but CDG misses the direct hit at the non-striker's. Oh dear, overthrows, with no one backing up
full and wide outside leg stump. Fakhar, though, was premeditated. Plays a reverse sweep towards the left-hander's off side
full outside leg stump after seeing the batsman back away to the leg side. Bunted down the ground to long on
full on middle stump, turned off his hips to midwicket and Sarfraz strugges to complete the run.
floated outside off, and Zaman takes Sodhi on! Smacked so hard down the ground, and despite it being in the air, the bowler goes for self-preservation. Gets out of the ball's way just in time
back of a length on middle stump, muscles his pull along the ground to midwicket
full toss outside off, and met by the batsman while charging down. Slapped while shimming towards the bowler, and beats mid off. Sends the loose ball away

full and wide outside off, but Fakhar tries to smack this over cover. Walks down the ground to smash a six, but he's lost his balance, and the shot has been sliced to third man. Shamsi gets under the ball and times his dive well to take a catch falling forward
good length outside off, nips away after pitching. Tries to cut but misses
good length on middle stump, cramped for room once again but he attempts the cut anyway. Top edged, but falls just short of the diving fielder at short third man. Nice change of pace
good length on leg stump, slower ball too, and the batsman is deceived sligthly. Muscled towards the leg side but the bat turns in his hands. Falls just short of the bowler on his followthrough
good length on middle stump, mistimed pull to mid on
full and wide, and crunched past cover! Played off the front foot and beats the infield
full on middle and leg, nudged off the back foot to midwicket with soft hands

backs away, but misses! Coulter-Nile thinks there's an edge. The bowler is convinced, Carey not so much, but Finch reviews anyway. Fakhar had backed away, and Coulter-Nile had followed him with a short ball aimed at his body. Extra bounce forced Fakhar to miss, and the ball went just above his bat. Did he get a feather touch? That's the question. And yes, it's an edge! Fakhar must go.
Coulter-Nile from round the wicket, and that's full but wide outside off. Fakhar reaches out, and mistimes a drive to cover. Tye intercepts

big appeal for lbw but not given. Full on leg, and Fakhar misses another leg-side swipe. Hits his front leg, but replays suggest it pitched outside the stumps. The ball, by the way, whizzes away to point for a leg-bye
moves away and walks down early again, it's short of a length and he manages to pull it away to backward square leg. Not middled again

overpitched full on leg stump, eventually a yorker as the batsman walks down the ground. Hits his bat, then his boot, and then lands up near his feet. But the batsman has no idea where the ball is, and he attempts to run. The bowler notices, and races down the wicket and kicks the ball onto the stumps. But the batsman was in by then
fullish length around off stump, no swing and Fakhar punches in front of mid-off, pinches a single to get going
full delivery on middle and leg, Zaman swats a wild slog to short midwicket
back of a length outside off. Angling into Fakhar again, and punched to cover
full outside off, swinging away from the batsman. Slapped off the front foot, but straight to cover. Misses out on a wide ball
good length just outside off, muscled down the ground to long on. They walk across for a run
short outside off, and the extra bounce takes it over the batsman's cut shot. Came charging down the ground but the zip off the surface forces him to miss that shot
full outside leg stump, tries to clip this fine down the leg side but can't get bat to ball. Hits his pads but impact's outside leg. They scamper across for the single
full on off stump, carves it past cover and chase for the infielder. Manages to retrieve it from inside the ropes
good length outside off, punched to mid on for a walking single. Misfield by the fielder, but the batsmen aren't interested to take another run

good length on off stump, but Fakhar smacks this through the off-side field! Managed to carve it into the gap between point and cover point. Shifted his weight by walking down the wicket before playing that shot
back of a length on middle, clipped off his pads to deep midwicket. Chase for the infielder, allowing Fakhar to come back for the second
a good length delivery outside off seams back in prodigiously, takes the inside edge and flies past Paine for four.

another slower ball fetches a wicket! Short on leg stump, and Fakhar attempts to pull this behind square. But there's no pace behind that delivery for the pull shot. Plus, he's through his shot too early. Top edged to fine leg, who composes himself and completes the catch
slower cutter on middle, run away to point
steps out and wallops this length ball back over the bowler's head. What power in his swing. Supreme confidence
short and wide outside off, Zaman jumps outside leg and flays it up and over backward point. Thumped into the deserted stands
Fakhar moves away outside leg, Stanlake chases him with a full ball that grazes the pad and squirts away to fine leg

Zaman holes out to deep backward point. No hundred for him. Zaman shows his cards early and steps away outside leg. The bowler goes shorter and wider outside off. Zaman still reaches out for the ball and slices underneath the ball in the air but straight down the throat of Maddinson, the sub
short and sliding into middle and leg, he's worked this off his hip into the square leg boundary
low full toss on off, and that's been driven to long off for one. Malik wanted two, but Fakhar says no
yorker outside off, and Fakhar digs this down the ground to long off for a quick single
cheeky! Slower ball outside off again, and Fakhar shuffles across to the leg side, and scoops a pull over square leg for more runs
full outside off, but it's the slower ball from Tye. Waits for the ball to get to him, before slapping a late cut past the keeper's left
full and fast outside off stump. Fakhar lets it go, and the ball hits the keeper's pads. The ball trickles away to point for extras
tucks him up for room as Zaman charges down the pitch, turned wide of midwicket
dabs this incoming short of length delivery towards point for a quick single
good length on off stump, tapped off the back foot to point
good length on middle, and coming into his pads. Tries to flick it towards square leg, but misses. Hits his front leg, and trickles away to the off side
'help yourself' delivery. Short of length and angling into the pads, Zaman whips this away off his hip. Beats short fine easily.
back of a length on off stump and defended off the back foot. But that's a huge front-foot no ball! Free hit
low full toss on middle stump, big wind up from Fakhar, but he mistimes it. Smacked back to the bowler. The leg-side slog does not come off
typical Fakhar whip, on the bounce to the man at deep fine leg
flatter ball on a good length. Pitches on middle stump. Turned off his hips to midwicket with soft hands. Nice call early for the single
short outside off, but coming into Fakhar. Pokes his bat out and places this fine behind square. It's walloped past third man
tossed up full outside off, swept hard after getting down on one knee. Man in the deep there
good length on off stump, pulled towards midwicket but not off the meat of the bat. Dribbles away to the fiielder
slower, short ball outside off, crunched away. Agar overruns the ball and gives up four. Nothing going Australia's way
sees Zaman walking outside leg and follows him. But he still manages to use the pace and angle to whip this wide of short fine leg. Super hand-eye coordination, excellent awareness.
Zaman gets on top of a short ball outside off and firmly cuts it away to sweeper cover
Jumps away outside leg and stabs it to the leg side
full on leg stump, tries to clip it off his pads but misses. Hits his thigh instead. They scamper across for the single
short on middle stump, stays tall and pulls along the carpet to deep midwicket. There's his maiden fifty!
good length on off stump, extra bounce this time that surprises the batsman. Stays deep in his crease as he pokes at the ball. Takes a thick edge and lands near mid off. Excellent over from Sodhi
overpitched full on middle stump, squeezed back to the bowler

this time it's over deep midwicket! Full on middle stump, and he comes down the wicket once more. Slogged square to the leg side, and it's off the middle of the bat. Into the stands once more. Did really well to get to the length of the ball

there's the big wicket. The short ball has done the trick. Banged one in, Fakhar is surprised as this angles into the body, he swivels to pull but is surprised by the pace and the ball flicks the glove on the way through to wicketkeeper Ramdin
length on middle, tucked towards the man coming in from deep midwicket
whips this incoming length ball on middle and leg to deep square leg. Straight to the boundary rider. Confusion. Babar didn't want the run but Fakhar turned and was three steps into it
cracking drive. This is overpitched outside off and Fakhar creams that through cover point.
nice shape back in again, full-length delivery, eased to mid-on
full and swinging back into middle, worked to midwicket. Good stop
full on off and spins away from Fakhar. Tries to prod at it, but the ball goes past his outside edge. Good recovery from Badree

lucky this time! Full and wide outside off with the batsman charging down the ground. The wide line forces the batsman to reach at it. Wild slog takes the top edge over the keeper's head. Work for third man running back
another maximum! Over cow corner this time. Uses his feet once again to get to the length of this full ball on leg stump, slogged over to the leg side, and it lands in the stands
all the way! Flat-batted maximum! Full on off stump, and Fakhar comes down the ground and bunts it over the bowler's head. Lands straight into the sightscreen
full on middle stump, prods forward and drives through the line of the ball. Goes past the non-striker's right and beats mid on as well. A simple punch earns him a boundary. Off the mark
first six! Muscled over long on. Full on off, and Fakhar takes a big stride forward to lean into that shot. Gives it a big swipe, and the ball lands in the stands
tossed up on middle, but Fakhar's happy to not fall for the trap. Driven down the ground to wide long off
good length just outside off, opens his bat's face and glances it to point. Calls for the single early
full outside off, and driven to cover. The length was there for an expansive slog, but Fakhar couldn't get under it
full on middle, clipped off his toes towards the man in the deep on the leg side
back of a length on middle stump, cramps Zaman for room. Chopped off the back foot towards point
full on middle stump but angling across his body, slapped with minimal footwork past point once again. Got his front foot out of the ball's way and smacked in front of square
full on leg stump, misses the leg-side slog. Inside edges the shot onto his body
full on middle stump, nudged off the front foot towards the off side
full on leg stump, tries to sweep but misses the shot. Raps his pads instead as the ball trickles down to short fine leg
full on off stump, angling into Fakhar. Defended off the front foot to mid on
good length on middle stump, punched off the back foot to mid on. They walk across for the run
third four in a row! Good length on leg stump, but going down leg. Fakhar does well to swivel and flick this fine past short third man. Badree's line has been awry
full and wide, moving away, struggling for timing, hit away towards mid-off
fullish length on middle, defended back
pre-meditates a sweep and gets down early. The ball is much shorter than he would have liked. Pitches in line but height could have been the issue as the umpire turns down the appeal

gottim, plucked above his head at cover! Maybe that was Curran's plan all along, just feed the drive... Fakhar was trying to hit that into the pavilion but mistimed the shot, still could have picked up four had Morgan not timed the jump right; had to go one-handed in the end but took it supremely well!
pitched up again, 84mph and there's a sweeper out for the drive now
fullish, room the free the hands again, this time he picks out cover
flayed through the covers for Pakistan first boundary! Sweet connection as Fakhar scythes through a full ball outside off
pitched up in the corridor outside off, 82mph and Fakhar steps out to drill to the right of mid-off, just a single again
wider outside off, opens the bat face and chops it down to third man
good length on middle stump, chopped down to third man off the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, legspin. Tries to pull this behind square but mistimed to short fine leg. The batsman's in two minds, and can't play the intended shot
full on middle stump, tapped to midwicket with soft hands
tossed up on off stump, and this time he picks the wrong'un up. Got his front foot out of the ball's way and it's smacked over the non-striker's head. No chance for long on to race across
fuller ball, slid across the left-hander and Zaman advances down, gives himself room and hammers it over covers
works it into the leg side
back of a length, angled in at middle and leg, nudged towards mid-on
length ball on leg stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length around off, drops it in front of point for a quick single
short of good length on off, gets on top of the bounce and punches to mid-off
length ball on off, Zaman gets the front foot out and swings hard across the line, thumps it straight to mid-on
drilled! Full on leg stump, but Fakhar expected that. Backs away to the leg side, and then slaps this past Malik for a boundary. Almost took the non-striker out

edged and gone! It's an all-South African strike. Good length delivery outside off, that typical Morkel length. Zaman doesn't have as much width as the previous deliveries and flirts with a waft, gets a thick outside edge which flies to a wide slip. Amla takes it by his face. Exceptional carry in this surface
short and wide outside off, Zaman stays leg-side of the ball again, and pummels it away to the cover fence. Flat-bats this offcutter into oblivion
full-toss outside off, driven sweetly to sweeper cover
and again, this time straight to the fielder. Short and wide again, cut to the extra cover fielder
width! Zaman says shukriya. Short and wide, slashed through point for four. A very productive area for Zaman, poor delivery
good length, and outside off. Cut off the back foot by Fakhar, but only to point
full just outside off, the batsman lunges forward and defends. Played towards the off side
length ball, drifts into him and the ball finds the inside part of the bat as it goes to midwicket
short of a length, hammered with a flat bat to mid-off
back of a length, but wide outside off. Rocks back onto the back foot, and caresses the cut shot. Placed between point and the square-umpire with perfection
good length on middle stump, angling into the left hander, and Fakhar simply pulls this behind square by dragging this behind. Too short, and sent for a boundary with fine leg inside the circle
that's his wheelhouse. Short and wide, Zaman gets underneath the length and carves a cut with so much ease over backward point
well played, shortish around off, guides the ball to third man off the open face
smashed. Full around off, can't bowl that length at Eden Park. It's full and straight, Fakhar clears his front leg and bludgeons it straight, past mid-off

short ball on middle and it's pulled! Thwacked so hard and off the sweet spot of the bat that the flat-shot goes for a six. Lands just beyond the ropes at deep backward square. First maximum of the evening
good length on middle, the batsman backs away and cuts but can't breach the infield
full around middle and leg, Fakhar comes down and inside-edges it down to short fine leg.
good length delivery outside off, 137 kph, moves away. Zaman's feet don't move, the ball moves away and beats the bat
good length on leg stump, spins into the left-hander, pulled over midwicket, but the umpire calls it a no ball! Replays suggest that Sodhi's delivery was a completely legal ball. Free hit
slashed, full and wide with plenty of width. Fakhar opens the bat face and carves it away with the open face past point. Lovely timing on that from Zaman, can't bowl there to him
short of good length, cuts into him, Zaman brings the bat down and gets an inside edge. He is fortunate that has missed the stumps
tossed up on middle stump, and Fakhar attempts a slog sweep! Misses the shot completely, but very lucky that the ball doesn't break off stump. Didn't pick the wrong'un at all
full on middle stump, played with soft hands towards short cover for a quick single
good length on middle stump, turns away from the batsman. Cut off the back foot, but there's the man at point for that shot
that will be the length on this stadium, shortish around middle, pulled away to deep square leg for a single

in the air and bounces in front of the fielder running back. Advances down the track but does not cover for the drift. Gets the loft off the toe end of the bat and it does not carry to the boundary as a result
shot. Gaddafi roars in appreciation. Shortish from Badree again and Zaman rocks back and pulls through cow corner
flat ball first up, on a good length on middle and leg, bunted towards cow corner off the back foot

another swipe, another miss.  Zaman was hit on the back leg to a delivery that would've crashed into middle stump. But hey, did this pitch in line? May have been just around leg if not outside. He went for an ugly across-the-line slog, injudicious shot selection, you must say.
went for a huge slog across the line, mistimed it to square leg. Got it off the bottom part of the bat
full on leg stump, Zaman presses forward and pushes it out to long-on for one
driven on the up, but good work by Faf at mid-off
gets on top of the bounce and eases this short of length delivery towards point
tossed up wide outside off, and Fakhar goes chasing after it. Manages to slice an expansive drive over point and the ball lands just inside the boundary. Could've easily gone for six too
good length on leg stump, and the batsman backs away towards the leg side to make some extra room. Slapped past cover point thereafter
wonder if the breeze has any role to play in Morne being completely off rhythm. Delivers another length delivery down the leg side, Zaman misses the tickle.
angles a length ball on off from wide of the crease, bunted gently towards short cover for a quick single

super comeback from Cutting. Skiddy bouncer that catches Zaman off guard. He's beaten for pace in his attempt to pull, this deflected off the glove and onto the helmet. Lobbed high but just fell short of wicketkeeper Tim Paine even as he ran in to catch that.
crunched into the off side, can't beat the circle
beats him outside off, the ball scoots past the outside edge as Maxwell drives...a precious dot ball
length ball outside off, opens the face and dabbed into the covers
a moment of relative calm as he tucks a single through midwicket
cut firmly into the covers, straight to du Plessis but still a single which brings up the hundred stand off 44 balls
striding forward, thumped to cover
manages to get this full and straight, was still a free hit, clubbed towards long-on and the pace of this pair between the wickets makes it into a brace
now it's wide outside off! Maxwell moving around his crease, Morris trying to out think him but it's too wide
whipped from off stump through midwicket
full and straight, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, 139kph, defended to the covers
back of a length and defended on off
shortish, sliding down the leg side, but Maxwell had hopped across and doesn't get the benefit from the umpire as he swishes and misses
length outside off, sliced through backward point and third man has to run around
that's well bowled, full at off stump, squirted into the off side
a flat, straight delivery to start. Drift in the air, maybe swing? No spin, blocked
goes for another reverse hit and this time doesn't make contact
84 kph, wide, quick. Maxwell goes down to reverse sweep but fails to connect. Lots of movement in the air
gets this reverse sweep away, over the men at backward point and short third man, but doesn't have the legs to reach the rope as deep point scurries around
the googly, not sure he read that one, gets an inside edge to short fine leg
moves outside leg stump to open the off side, carves it through the covers but the sweeper can get across
brings out the reverse sweep, the ball is outside off, picks out short third man
sweeps a good length delivery well in front of square
he's forward this time and pushes a length delivery to the leg side
well bowled, this is fuller and nearly does Maxwell for length as he plays back
round the wicket, touch short to start with, driven off the back foot to deep cover
gives himself some room outside leg, drives into the covers without much timing
full and wide from around the wicket, another terrible delivery. Maxwell creams his drive but finds cover. Missed out on four more.
oh my, the worst delivery of the tour. A slower legcutter way down leg, may have been five wides had Maxwell not gone after his heave and got it over short fine leg. Runs, runs, runs
he saw Maxwell starting to move and fired this down the leg side
flicked to deep midwicket
and he gets launched into the stands over long on...Maxwell swings at a full delivery, a slower ball, outside off and even though it comes off close to the bottom of the bat it has the legs
that's just a little bit bonkers, but then it's Maxwell after all...reverse ramp or scoop at a low full toss which he gets almost over the keeper's head
that's a big full and it's out of the ground! Swung over deep square leg. Horrid delivery, really. And that's his fifty off 26 deliveries
that's better, a yorker just outside off, jabbed into the off side...a mundane single
the conventional sweep this time, flat on off, Maxwell gets low and crunches his sweep to deep square leg. All along the ground
good length delivery outside off, mid 130s, 135 kph. Solidly blocked to cover point
strays down leg immediately at 134 kph. No swing, Maxwell was beaten for pace. Maybe skidding off the pitch. Played around his pad
wild swing, full and wide outside off, Maxwell stays in his crease and looks to hammer the length down the ground but is beaten on the inside edge. No swing
gets a hold of this. Length again on middle, Maxwell connects with his heave, sends the ball whistling to deep square leg
all power. Overpitched on middle, Maxwell backs away, gives himself room and gets a delivery right in his arc - full and straight. Muscles his drive past cover, races away.
flight outside off, nice loop. Still no turn. Moves away in the air but Maxwell blocks
four more. Same spot in the ground. Backed away before the bowler was in his delivery stride, Lakmal just lands it full and straight, Maxwell bludgeons his cover drive through cover
went across again, but came back into the line late. The bowler follows him and is made to pay the price with a free run. Drifts down leg

the reverse sweep for six! That;s 50 too for Australia, yikes. Just a full delivery on leg, no drift, no spin. Maxwell knows his spots in the field and lifts it over the infield. Gets enough to clear the point boundary
four more. Seam-up from SS. Maxwell gets down low and lofts it over point again with his reverse sweep, superb
just enough to clear point this time. Maybe the worst of all, a full toss on off. Maxwell is hurried and spoons it over point who backtracks but can't get across
awful delivery. Slower delivery outside off with everyone in the circle on the off side. Maxwell opens up his stance and scythes it over cover, four more
comes round the wicket, pushed across wide outside off and he doesn't get away with that
great timing. Maxwell gives himself loads of room, but Lakmal spears in a yorker down leg. Maxwell drills his drive to cover, who is deep in the circle
bouncer, over Maxwell as he steps away, called wide on height
he just can't pitch it at the moment, that's a big full toss and called a no-ball this time...swung into the on side
short of a length, 135kph outside off, jabbed to backward point
punched to mid-off
that's tremendous, an open-faced glide through third man, pure placement, and England look bereft of answers right now
another low full toss, on the pads and tapped to midwicket
slower ball, back of a length, thumped to cover with a loud "grr" as Maxwell feels he missed out there
back of a length and beats the outside edge
length outside off, cracked to cover
low full toss, and dropped at deep square leg! Flicked off the toes, and Hales is the culprit, a bit of a goober if truth be told. Is that England's opportunity gone?
drilled along the ground to complete another brisk over. And England need a breakthrough rather urgently
backs away, slaps on the up, and high over the covers! That is tremendous batting
googly, but picked early and battered into the stands! Fractionally too short as well, plenty room to swing the arms
big spin! Maxwell leans forward but is beaten by late dip
decent line and length, tapped to the leg side
low full toss, on the pads, flipped to the leg side
backs away again, and slices a slap over the covers! Unconventional but highly effective, clearing the ring and racing to the rope
no qualms about this one! Back of a length, picks the slower ball, eases onto the back foot and slams an uppercut of a pull out into the midwicket stands!
retreats to leg and attempts a mow, but straight to point
whipped off the hip and just out of the reach of short backward square! It was timed and placed to perfection in the end...
another swing of the bat, inside-edged out through square leg this time
a massive yahoo from Maxwell as he retreats to leg and attempts to pound a drive high over the covers
another slower ball, arriving with the momentum of a powder-puff, and tapped into the leg side
another slower ball, inswinging into the right-hander, and tucked into the leg side. A fine over, applying a bit of a handbrake to Australia's progress
a cracking slap over the covers. Clears the front leg and pounds the bat through the line, and up comes his half-century from a decidedly brisk 30 balls
back of a length, thumped hard through midwicket where Malan does brilliantly with a full-length dive to save the four
tossed up again, luring Maxwell down the pitch but he can't beat short cover on the drive
whittled to the leg side from back of a length
thumped down to long-off
a sliced drive into the covers, utterly nailed, head over the ball and flinging his hands through the line. But straight to the sweeper
eased down to long-on
slower ball, thumped down to long-off
another slower ball, squeezed out to deep point
slow again, back of a length, pinged with intent to deep square leg, but Willey's tumbling stop cuts off the four. England are taking this deep
battered high and hard over long-off, there's the precious boundary, but Roy nearly puts his head straight through the boundary hoarding in his eagerness to intercept!
pounded through the leg side once again, to Roy's right this time, and now Australia are cooking again!
deflects off the legs, well gathered by Willey in his followthrough, and his shy pings the stumps! Safely home though ...
inside-out drive through point, a full-length delivery outside off, and that's tremendous
clipped into the leg side, just back of a length, quick call for the single
Maxwell is turning on the Big Show now! Battered on the up, an arrow-straight blade, and that's an excellent intercept from Billings at long-on
full length once again, flicks the pads and worked to leg
a slashed slog high over point, plugs in the deep and the sweeper slides round to gather
another slower ball, and pounded through midwicket! He hangs on the back foot, waiting for the ball to arrive, then slaps it, tennis-style into the gap
tucked to leg, and a frantic sprint to make it back for two, keeping the strike and hustling into the 90s ... it's On!
clears the front dog, slams the bat through the line, another slower ball is dispatched over the covers...
low full toss, crunched up and over the covers, just out of the reach of the back-pedalling fielder, and they come back for two ... He's probably blown his hundred now!

misjudged from Maxwell, a weak front-foot biff over the covers, and almost misjudged by Roy at long-off as well! The umpires are checking, as Roy had to lean forward at the last minute to scoop it off the turf, and well, this looks short of his fingers, but the soft signal is out... this is a huge call. And it is NOT OUT! Such a tight call either way. Roy looks utterly nonplussed.
outside off, reverse sweep, well placed behind point
wide on the crease, and cramping Maxwell on the back foot
short and sharp, and just about within the margins for an above-the-shoulder wide. Barely, in fact...
smashed in the air ... is this the chance England need? No, Billings bales out of the catch and opts to defend the boundary instead
bouncer, leg side and Maxwell gets some glove on it, just tickled past the diving Blundell for a couple
short outside off, and Maxwell can't put this away. Tries to cut but the ball goes over his bat. Australia finish on 229 for 2!
short outside off, flat-batted to the off side
full, gets the yorker up towards the blockhole, dug out towards mid-off
short, 142kph over leg stump, Maxwell shows it a straight bat
full outside off, driven straight to point. They scamper the run and there's no throw due to a lack of backing up
another big full toss, sliced away off a thick outer part of the bat down to third man
backs away to leg against a length delivery, driven through mid-off where du Plessis dives and gets a hand on it...comes up holding his shoulder
and it's a filthy full toss, Maxwell swings with his full force and it takes a top edge to third man...and it's a no-ball! Oh dear.
tossed up and Maxwell bludgeons another four straight down the ground, slugged hard and it beats long-on
flat legbreak in the channel, Maxwell rocks back and slaps one through point
on the charge, ugly slash from Maxwell, smeared over cover for one to the sweeper
fizzed down on off, 94kph and stabbed square off the back foot, another quick single there
crunched through the covers, Maxwell plants the front foot and nails the drive
dragged down, a touch wide and cut into the cover region, Williamson does well to get a hand on it and then nearly come a cropper sliding after the rebound as the turf digs up. Seems okay, though
slips in the googly, Maxwell drops back this time and nurdles a couple into the leg side
tight lines, tossed up and blocked coming forwards
full, angled down the leg side, it's a wide so the free hit carries over...and the over has gone very pear-shaped
ooh, nicely bowled, loops up the legbreak on off and it grips to scuttle past the outside edge and into the keeper's gloves
slower ball, cutter outside off and Maxwell plays a cute back-foot slice towards short third man, they scamper through
fired in, worked to the leg side
woof, sixer down the ground! Maxwell holds the pose, all classical high elbow... as he whumps a full ball over the long-off rope! That's the Australia 50, too
floated up on the stumps, maybe the wrong'un, worked through backward square leg
cheekily done and Maxwell gets four! Short outside off, he sits back and ramps just clear of the keeper, bit of a thick edge, could have gone wrong... but he gets the reward
length, think that was a cutter from Southee, Maxwell skitters across his stumps like a seaman in a gale and swats four more past the dive of fine leg
short and down the leg side
dug in short, leg side and Maxwell ignores
downtown, finished with a straight hit for four! Australia win by seven wickets and take first blood in the tri-series
what sort of a shot is that?! Well, it's probably a matchwinner. Pure Maxwell. Moving to the leg side, swings across the line and the ball flies off over deep point
another dot ball! Maxwell losing his shape as he moves to leg and heaves across the line. Another slower ball
another slower short delivery, Maxwell giving himself room to the leg side and has to stretch for it
full this time, over the the off side, not quite timed on this occasion
backs away to leg away and hammers a back-of-a-length delivery straight of mid-off who is inside the circle
another dot ball, short again, a slower ball this time, Maxwell tries to ramp it away and can't make contact
short outside off, Maxwell walking all over his crease, then lets the ball pass through to the keeper
drilled on the up out through backward point
backs away and carves a length delivery wide of third man...Maxwell up and running straight away
and he's gone! Doesn't connect cleanly as he swings at a length delivery, skews off the face of the bat and reaches deep cover
carves a length delivery over point to the sweeper
oh, Maxwell! We've seen it so many times, but it's still brilliant. Under pressure he was reverse swept a full delivery outside off fine of short third man
short of a length, swing and a miss! Dot ball
whoops. A big legbreak but starts wide and goes wider
inside-edged drive to deep backward square
stand and deliver, and battered out through cow corner. Willey's length has gone walkabout in this over
back of a length, a bit of late swing, and an inside-edge cannons off the midriff and down into the crease
good riposte, a sharp lifter outside off, induces a flinch
outside off, takes the edge, and nudged down to third man
swing again, but down the leg side
up on the toes, punched into the covers
ooh, well bowled, rolled the fingers, and just nibbled past the edge
full, angled into the pads, he doesn't make contact and it's just a leg bye towards midwicket. The tension mounts
and now Maxwell finds the crowd...stand-and-deliver blow over long-on, stayed in his crease, that's a massive over

two men flung themselves after the ball, but Kapugedera and Mendis have muffed up. Maxwell went for the reverse sweep again, got under the ball, honestly a little too far under the ball to time it well. Still he gets it away
blasted down the ground, a fierce straight drive which splits the deep fielders. He's not hanging around
Maxi unleashes the reverse sweep to a fourth-stump ball. He probably top edged it over the keeper
full, on the pads, watchfully deflected away for a single
on a length, middle and off, defended back
low full toss, 96ks, dug out into the leg side for a single
roundarm again, slower in the air, bunted into the leg side for one

and Yuvraj has found a new bunny after KP. First ball Maxwell looks to will a shot over extra cover, but the thing with Yuvraj is, he gives you no pace to work with. Maxwell gets no power behind this shot, and finds the man at extra cover
blockhole ball on middle and leg, turned towards midwicket
drifts in full on middle, nudged to leg for a quick one
slides on outside off, Maxi wristily shovels it to short cover. Smith drifts off in search of a quick, risky single. Umar does not throw the stumps down
guided to deep cover
quick and fast outside off, stroked to the right of short cover, diving save
length ball on off, this is punched down to long-off n the front foot
tossed around off, stops a bit on the batsman, chipped in front of long-on
flat and straight, shovelled to long-on
that was the cutter on leg stump, Maxwell goes for the pull and gets it off the toe end of the bat
but when it is at normal pace, it keeps sitting up! Maxwell presents a straight bat and extends his elbows so it carries over long-on
returns to the cutter and rips Maxwell open. Gripped into the pitch on a good length outside leg and sashayed past the outside edge
phew! That's a top stroke from Maxwell. It seems to be the one at his normal pace, and it was on leg stump too, Maxwell flicks it away
and that completes a terrible over. A loopy old full toss has been crashed to the cover boundary
sliced away to the man sweeping on the off side boundary
simple batting. it's a poor ball - short and wide - so Maxwell backed away and cut it. The next thing he concentrated on was placing the ball through the cap at extra cover.
got too close to the ball as he charged out to meet it. Dot into the covers
hit all along the ground to long-off. If he can keep a sensible head, this should be Australia's
flighted on middle, Maxwell nudges it towards midwicket
a whip of the wrists secures a couple behind square leg, but that ball kept low. Maxwell had to crouch a little midway into his shot
opens the face against a shortish delivery outside off and slices it to third man

there was no reason for such ballistics. Maxwell had already pushed Australia ahead in the contest in the last over. Now he charges out at Shakib's first ball, goes for a wild heave and is stumped. Kicks the turf as he walks off
Afridi attacks the pads again with a full ball, Maxi whirls his wrists and hits it to deep midwicket
full and slides on middle at 93ks, Maxi goes low and spanks it away to the midwicket boundary with a sweep
Maxi comes out and punches to long-on
Maxwell pokes from his crease and gets an outside edge on the off side
gets on the front foot, down on one knee, and sweeps hard, "Bowler's end!!!" is the yell to the fielder in the deep but Watson makes it back easily
drifts down legside from around the wicket
defends on the front foot towards the leg side, Yuvraj races to his right to field
swipes at the short of a length ball and cross bats it long off for a single
the reverse sweep for a single
102 kph, faster ball, Maxwell gets down low and sweeps

a really slow ball on off and middle, Maxwell lofts clean over the bowler's head and Raina makes a great save! He comes running hard from long off and slaps the ball back into play as it was bouncing over the boundary
gets down on one knee and sweeps to deep square leg for two more
short of a length and that keeps low too, Maxwell stays back and swats behind square
short of a length around off, played back to the bowler
chipped in the air towards deep square leg, Raina's throw from the deep sails over Dhoni's head and concedes an overthrow
that ball keeps really low from short of a length, Maxwell was shaping to ramp to third man again but then had to jam his bat down on it, the ball hit him near the waist
tennis ball bounce for that short of a length ball around off, Maxwell sways away and tries to ramp it over the keeper, he is beaten
dabbed off the back foot through midwicket for a single. That was Yuvraj's first over in this World T20. Can't say it was uneventful.
goes back and tucks the ball off the pads through square leg
a fast ball at 105 kph! Maxwell tries to slog too hard and misses it
dabbed off the pads through midwicket for a single
Maxi holes out to long-on now. Pushed through flat, Maxi slogs, and miscues it to Shehzad, who completes a good overhead catch

and this is even better! Right out of the top draw. Overpitches this outside off, Maxi extends his arms, loft-drives it, sends it skimming over long-on. Off-side side, leg-side wide, a few boundaries - typical Sami over. Those two extra balls cost 10
dug in shortish and outside off, Maxi gets on top of the bounce and pulls it in front of square. Nailed that!
short of a length, on off, pushed to extra cover for one
Maxi shuffles outside leg and puts Sami off. This is sprayed wide outside off, almost in line with a first slip (if there was one)
short and outside off, Maxi gets on top of the bounce and rides it to backward point

MCG has gone mad. Yuvraj has got a wicket. Maxwell is gone. The quick Dhoni stumping is back. Clever bowling from Yuvraj. Maxwell gives him the charge, Yuvraj slips in the quicker wider one. Maxwell can't reach it, and the lightning quick work from Dhoni sends him back
back of a length on off, keeps Maxi quiet, defended back
full and slides on leg, fired in, Maxi misses the reverse sweep. Off the pad for one leg bye
plays an uppish drive into the covers

great ball first up! It may have only been 126 kph, but Maxwell was set up for a back of a length ball. He was inching forward, then went back to try and defend but the ball kept climbing. Eventually he did well to drop his wrists
shifts across onto off stump to clip a length ball to midwicket
opens the face, and steers it to third man. Which is an anti-climax because while the bowler was running up, he had cleared his front leg and his backlift was way over his head
another failed reverse-paddle-cum-sweep
driven behind square and is this another run-out? No. But their running is shambolic
drops this square for a quick single. They'll have to be quick! And they are - fair play. Well run.
a slightly daft reverse-sweep attempt - Santner sees him coming and fires it down the leg side
beauty, a corker - beat him with the spin, which turned past Maxwell, but actually he was done by the pace. Much quicker ball
another very good ball tossed up on middle-and-off, and defended
less caution this time, slapping it neatly to long-off
excellent leggie's line, just outside off and drifting further into middle. Maxwell is cautiously forward
leg-side stray
a fast, flat legbreak, Maxwell can't capitalise
crushed into the off side, just short of cover... New Zealand are sensing something here
punched to cover, looking for the single but no way through
squirted into the gap in the covers
sliding into the legs, can't flick it square
worked down to long on

another unhinged swipe through the line, spirals off the toe of the bat, three men circling at backward point, who wants it? No-one gets there! Plugs just out of reach of the diving Ross Taylor ... well now...
worked to the leg side
pulled around the corner to backward square leg
stabbed down the ground, beats the stretching bowler
back of a length, a bottom-handed bunt out to the leg side
that's a sublime strike, an angled drive into the gap in the covers, timed to perfection, but Southee slides well to intercept just inside the rope
yorker! Well bowled, well dug out
a big smear into the leg side from outside off, almost swings himself off his feet in alacrity
more brilliance on the boundary! De Grandhomme at full stretch saves the four at deep midwicket. New Zealand are brawling...
tossed up outside off, Maxwell picks the legbreak, gives himself room, and slams it into the stands at long-off!
back of a length, slapped hard and low past the bowler
touch too straight. Maxwell walks into a nurdle
fired in at 104 kph, Maxwell gets hit on the pad
Maxwell's having a shocker so far - what's he done here? Mistimed pull-cum-flick, ala Ponting actually but without the timing. Skies it short of deep midwicket
down the leg side. A waste.
stands on leg and looks to whip a back of a length ball outside off over midwicket and only just avoids being bowled. Maxwell, high-risk, for the moment, low reward
blocks a good length ball to mid-on
almost bowled again, this time clearing his front leg and aiming to smash the ball past the bowler. Knuckle ball messes with his timing again
tries to flick a fuller ball cramping him on middle and leg, makes contact only with the inside edge
pushes towards mid-on for a single. Midwicket intervenes to keep the game moving
back of a length on off stump, Maxwell pats it to mid-on
steps out, way too early, and as a result, Bumrah hits the deck and slows his pace. Maxwell struggles to get on top of the ball and then has no power in the shot. Has to settle for a single to mid-on
pushes to mid-on for a quick single
short ball, sliding into the right-hander, Maxwell tries to pull it over fine leg, but doesn't connect. Umpire calls wide for the line straying down leg
finally he gets one away. Meets a fuller ball sliding into his pads with a flick and gets enough bat on it to beat Dhawan running to his right at deep square leg
clears the front leg to carve the ball away, but Pandya keeps it at leg stump and denies Maxwell any leverage. Hammers it - literally, the bat coming down on the ball from 90 degrees - to point
moves away to the leg side, Pandya follows him, Maxwell punches it to mid-off
quicker delivery outside off, Maxwell, having done away with his helmet, cuts to deep point
loads up the cut again, but Chahal gets the ball to kick up off the pitch just enough for the top edge to fly past Dhoni's right

that's the fourth time in four games that Chahal has toppled Maxwell, but he hides his face in his hands and flashes an embarrassed little grin. He knows this ball didn't deserve a wicket. Rank long hop. Destined to be smoked. Instead Maxwell pulls it straight to short midwicket
Maxwell's on the drive, lofting it, but he's skied it to Williamson at deep extra cover! No chance he'll drop that and he doesn't
tossed up nicely but his line's off since that six. A single.
another reverse hit, a full-toss, to leg
oops - switches to left-handed mode and, er, well, defends it. He's all of a muddle
turned off his toes for two - placed that nicely
reverse-swept, with some power, but not the placement.
down the pitch - it had to happen! - but can't get hold of it, flogging this to leg
lovely drift, and grip - he's getting decent spin. Pushed out to the offside
down the leg side and Maxwell, on the walk, shuffling to leg, shovels it further to leg
down the leg side for another wide
stands tall to push this out to cover for a single
and another! Love it from Maxwell. Completely mistimes it (or is this on purpose), trying to pull it but gets a huge inside edge
big, floppy, ill-fitting wellington-boots! He's given them some welly and got a humungous inside-edge past the stumps and keeper.
another reverse, to a back-of-a-length ball, gets it find of short third man...placement perfect
really slow now, 82 kph, Maxwell steps out and flicks the ball through midwicket
good length and the ball stops on Maxwell as he pushes towards the bowler, the ball goes past the stumps at the bowler's end for a sngle
well bowled. Short delivery well outside off, Maxwell had given himself so much room that there was no chance of him getting bat
a slower bouncer outside off, Maxwell was waiting, he was hunting, with his knees bent. But doesn;t make contact on his upper cut
a sprint. Hares back for two. Superb. Comes down and works to deep midwicket who is quick on the ball. But Maxwell, who turned when the fielder had the ball in his hands, makes the second
whipped to long-on from off stump
full, flat and wide. Hammered to long-off
oh no, rubbish. A slow full toss on leg to Maxwell who backs away and deposits into the stands over midwicket with a simple swing across the line
more flight, well bowled. Tossed up on leg, Maxwell sweeps to deep square leg
96 kph, may have been the seam-up variation on middle, Maxwell is happy with the single to long-on. Great batting from Maxwell, unseen for some time now
dances down to the pitch of the flight on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
four more. Flat, full and quick. Maxwell drills it in the gap at midwicket. Didn't get under that enough but got enough power behind it, just inside the boundary
slog swept to deep backward square leg

the switch hit. Slower delivery on middle from Thisara. Maxwell gets down and inside-edges his witch hit to short third man who fires an accurate throw at the strikers end, the ball ricochets away for an overthrow

high full toss on middle and leg, Maxwell just whips it away. Hangs in the air for quite a while but just over the deep square leg fielder. Maxwell wants the no-ball, but that was under the waist. How did he get that power on that shot?

another slower delivery on middle, Maxwell slogs it away in the air to deep midwicket. Kapugedara settled underneath it, took a lovely catch with his back arched. Throws it back in as his momentum was taking him over, but he stepped on the boundary cushions while taking the catch.
shot! Four more. Premeditated reverse sweep. Saw the full delivery, got into position and smashed his reverse sweep over point and to the boundary
dances down and pushes to long-on
tripe from Thisara. Low and slow full toss on leg, Maxwell premediated the reverse sweep and hit it to deep point. If he held his position, another area would have been easier to pepper
shot, another one. Maxwell hustles into the 90s. Slow legcutter outside off, Maxwell backs away and slaps the length over cover. One bounce and into the boundary

very sloppy stuff from SL. Excessively full on off, full enough to prevent Maxwell from getting underneath it. He hammers it to cover, Chandimal fields and misses the stumps at the bowler's end. The bowler can't field and allows an overthrow
beautiful, elegant, unorthodox. Gets a full, quick delivery on middle and off, he backs away and just scoops the length over point with a reverse paddle. Made use of the pace
full and wide, Maxwell whips it away to long-on

high full toss, dropped. Maxwell gets 100. Called as a no-ball. Maxwell is pumped, what an innings. His maiden T20I hundred. A fist pump. A very high full toss outside off, Maxwell is taken aback and scoops a full toss in the air. Backward square leg backtracks and Dilshan spills it.
poor bowling. Maxwell got into position by shuffling across but was abetted by a full toss on leg, a simple flick goes straight to short fine leg who gets an awkward bounce, the ball goes through

over deep cover for six. The boundaries have been brought in, but to clear that boundary from that position is remarkable. A low full toss outside off, Maxwell carves the ball but finds enough timing and power to clear the fielder
oh my, how has he missed that? A slower delivery on middle and leg, Maxwell misses his flick and is struck on the pad. They scamper a leg bye
another reverse sweep. A poor delivery, low full toss on off. Easy enough as Maxwell helps it to the backward point boundary
very slow legcutter down leg, Maxwell gets low for another switch hit. Misses and is struck on the thigh. An optimistic appeal

humongous from Maxwell. Brings up his fifty as well, a thumbs up to the balcony. Wow, what an innings. A slower delivery on middle and leg, Maxwell backs away and nonchalantly sends it sailing over long-on with a clean swing of the bat
good delivery, slow variation on off, offcutter. Maxwell defends back
this time, he nails it. Gets down and hammers it to deep midwicket, on the bounce
over long-on! This isn't going to last long...stays in his crease this time, it's a full delivery, times it over the fence
a touch more of a heave about this one, gets it through midwicket but the placement is good again
held back a fraction outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
a straight full toss is knocked through the leg side
a short ball over off stump, Maxwell tries to ramp it over the keeper
takes a short-of-a-length ball into square leg and it's placed perfectly for the second
a slower ball dragged down the leg side
big full toss, follows Maxwell, pushed to deep midwicket...just okay for height
full and straight, swung down to long-on
full toss, fired in quickly, says 118kph! Whipped to long-on
pushed down the leg side, neat take but that's a wide
and he gets Maxwell...short of a length, a slower delivery, goes for a big mow over the leg side, like Lynn gets a big top edge and it's a simple catch

much much better from Thisara but that's the response from Maxwell after the previous delivery. Almost a yorker on middle but Maxwell has opened his stance and just caresses his drive through cover, and past mid-off
much better comeback from Perera. Almost a yorker again, but Maxwell inside-edges the delivery to short fine leg who fumbles and allows the second
reaches for the wide yorker and squirts a drive down to third man
poked to point
full toss at 92 kph on middle, smashed to long-off. Decent batting
tighter line from Jordan, back of a length, and there's a fine shy from the deep! Nah, the batsman is home, but that got his skates on!
pummelled high and mightily out towards deep extra cover... two men gallop back but the ball just eludes them!
tanked over long-on! A stand-and-deliver wallop. Lovely
a sharp bouncer, but it's been called for an over-step, rather than on height. A free hit coming up
beaten all ends up by the slower ball! Maxwell lined up a chancy waft, and played all round a gently curling outswinger! Oh Glenn ...
good stop. Fired in on middle, Maxwell wants one to long-off but skews it to the bowler who dives to his left to stop the run
oh great batting. Gives himself room this time and lofts the ball easily over cover. How pleasing does Maxwell look when he is hitting straight?
a yorker on off, Maxwell wants to paddle his reverse lap but only gets some bat on it towards point
nicely bowled, flat on middle from a round-arm action. Skids on, clipped to deep midwicket
looking for the big sweep but improvised well when he realised it was too full, drives to cover
excellent comeback. Sees Maxwell coming and fires it very quick and wide down leg. Maxwell gets across and gets his boot on it to prevent the ball from going through
another full toss on middle, slapped into the crowd. Maxwell gives himself room and whacks it over long-on with nonchalant ease

six more. Maxwell gets down and slogs it easily over long-on, six more. Easy for Maxwell. Not a bad delivery actually, full and wide outside off but Maxwell stretches out and drags his slog. Not much the bowler could do
and another. Oh my, yet another full toss on middle, Maxwell steps down and heaves it easily over long-on. Three in a row, all in the same area. Clears the fielder with ease. Sublime timing
swings as hard as he could when he sees a flighted delivery outside off. So, obviously, there was no timing. inside edge to midwicket
set up for the ramp against a full toss outside off - premeditated, because that should have been pulverized. Ends up with an edge to fine leg
pushes it quicker and flatter having seen Maxwell coming down the pitch, the batsman adjusts and clips it to the right of long-on
Prasanna lobs a legbreak outside off, leaves Maxi. He goes low, and targets a slog-sweep against the turn. Maxi misses one for a change

Chopped onto the middle stump. Prasanna sends Maxi off and shows him the way out. Maxi is quite peeved. Slower legbreak outside off, Maxi looks to cut it away. He plays a bit early and bottom-edges it onto the middle stump. End of another pulsating innings
full and straight, clipped off the toes into midwicket
and is sent into the stands, a length ball, Maxwell clears the front leg and deposits it over long-on
moves outside leg again, short of a length, goes over cover this time, wide of the sweeper and just in front of the rope
what happened there?! Somehow it's got to third. A sharp bouncer, Maxwell is actually trying to let it go by ducking, leaves the bat up and it glances off the face
short at off stump, pulled to deep square leg
round the wicket, full and straight, pushed to long-on
what a shot, brilliant from Maxwell...a slower short ball, he stands tall in the crease and ramps it down to third man
full at the stumps, they've worked in the over, driven to long-off
goes deep in the crease outside leg stump, dragged down short, pulled over deep midwicket
short again, this time it's not timed as well, pulled straighter down the ground off the toe end
well bowled! Beaten by a sharp leg-break which bounces as well, good take for Seifert but Maxwell keeps his foot behind the line as they check for the stumping
pulls a short delivery straight down the ground, one bounce to long-on
full, straight, drilled...and he almost holds the pose
chopped on! Southee rolls his fingers across this, Maxwell giving himself some room to open up the off side, into off stump
nearly cleans him up with a short ball which scoots through a touch low and defeats Maxwell's pull

bowled him with the slower ball! Maxwell heaved across the line so, so early that he was almost through the shot before the ball arrived. He had backed away towards leg to make a bit of room too. Bumrah clipped the top of off stump.
Maxwell tries to switch hit behind point this time but is beaten by Bumrah's slower ball
he's smashed it! Maxwell unfurls the reverse pull, blitzing the full toss far over the cover boundary. Might have been the switch. Will have to see replays. It was the switch-hit.
that's Maxwell's first boundary! Gets down on one knee and lofts the ball with the angle into him from around the wicket, slog sweeping to the long leg boundary
has Watson been run out backing up too far? Jadeja appeals after Maxwell's fierce drive rebounds off the stumps at the bowler's end towards long on. Jadeja did not get a hand on it
closes the face of the bat against the turn and the leading edge goes behind point
backs away and slogs at a length ball that does not come on to the bat, he's timed it so badly that the ball falls well short of the man at long off
shuffles across and clips a short one off his hips to deep square leg
short of a length outside off, the ball grips the pitch and does not come on to the bat, Maxwell backs away and hits it to long off
moves across to a short ball outside off and tries to cut, ends up getting a bit too close to the ball to have fun with it. Inside edges and retains strike
flatter and quicker outside off, Maxwell sweeps hard to midwicket. Didn't even get down on bent knee that time
yorker on off, pushed towards cover to keep strike
slower delivery outside off, Maxwell drags it to deep midwicket. Ah, not the right shot, gets off strike.
a low full toss outside off, Maxwell looks to whip-drive through the off side but may have got there late because of fatigue, squeezes it to midwicket and scampers back for two
great shot. But poor ball. Looking for the yorker and there is no margin of error here. Low full toss and Maxwell simply whips it over square leg. Lands just inside the boundary, magnificent batting.
nice shot. Full on off, maxwell gives himself room and slices the ball to deep point for two. Misses the yorker but ends up as a decent delivery
full outside off, Maxwell looks to reverse sweep/switch hit but is beaten for pace. Went too hard at that, instead of making use of the pace
hammered to deep cover. Full and wide outside off from Thisara, Maxwell bludgeons it away to deep cover. Maxwell wants two, but Head doesn't this time

skids on outside off, no turn, Maxi plays for it, plays across the line, and is beaten past the outside edge. Appeal for stumping sent to the TV umpire. The keeper takes the bails off quickly but Maxi's back foot went nowhere
Sena lobs this up full on middle, mid-on is up, and Maxi brings the bottom hand into play, shovelling over the top of the fielder
pushed through outside the line of off, misses the reverse-sweep and wears it on the thigh
length-ball offbreak, clipped out to midwicket
whipped off the hips through square leg
leg-side wide
hurries off the surface, Maxi plays back and takes it on the thigh, heading down
That's one of those Maxi trick shots. It goes all the way for the first six of the match. Pushed through full on middle, he reverses it and swats it over backward point
reverse-slapped from outside off to cover-point
overpitched and outside off, bottom-hand dominated drive square through the off side, whistles away
good length on middle, clubbed to deep midwicket
flighted outside off, a helmet-less Maxi surges down the track and lifts it over mid-on, though it was not middled
He has hit the pants off this! Pushed through, full outside off, not much turn, Maxi sinks his teeth into it and golf-swings it over long-on. The seam-up ball has been dispatched
darted onto the leg stump, hoicked to deep midwicket off the inside half
Maxi is purring away. Maxi pre-meditates a switch-hit and places it from outside leg (or outside off if you'd like) over backward point
skids into the leg stump, Maxi goes low and slog-sweeps it viciously over the backward square leg fence

bye-bye legcutter. The square boundaries are fairly big, but Maxwell has plenty of power. The bat speed is incredible. Though he had fooled Warner with a short ball, this one is well within the Maxwell's reach
shovelled over mid-off. Miss the yorker at your peril. The strength he puts into the shot through his bottom hand and forearms is amazing.

and again, through mid-off. Thisara is looking for the blockhole at leg stump. Maxi steps away and drills it through.. That's the record for the fastest fifty by an Australian. Got to it off 19 balls the other day when he scored 146. This one off 18 balls
short, angled into the stumps, Maxwell backs away and slaps it. Not entirely timed, but it has enough to lob over and to the right of the diving short third man fielder
pushed through down leg, Maxwell goes for a pull and finds short fine leg
so he opts for something more conventional and it's more productive...pumps a full delivery straight down the ground. Stand and deliver.
Yorkshire to Yorkshire, straighter delivery which is eased down the ground
low full toss outside off, driven to cover
yorker from around the wicket, it looped up off the toe-end. Hung in the air for a while, but mid-on didn't dive for it. He perhaps thought it was a bump ball
he gets enough bat on it to pull it fine. Wasn't entirely in control, back of a length on off and not rising much, but he got it fine enough to run to the boundary

dropped Maxwell toe-ended a drive off a slower one that went sky-high. Imad at mid-off was moving backwards and had time to settle under the catch but it ends up popping out of his hands while he was still moving back. Didn't get in good position for the catch
steered to cover's left for a couple
loses his line and goes too far down leg. Wide
deceived by the slower bouncer. It passes close to his body at chest high, tries to steer it down, but misses
back of a length, clubbed to long-on. Maxwell wanted two, but was rightly sent back. Even then he had to scramble to get back
almighty slog-sweep, connects with air
gets hold of it this time dragged the length short, allowing Maxwell to rock back and swat it over long-on
goes again, but doesn't get it off the middle, it just goes off the end of the bat to long-on
gives himself room and slashes hard, sending the thick edge fine. Third man had no chance of cutting it off
dropped by Hafeez on the cover fence slower bouncer, he stepped away and slapped it high and wide. Hafeez got there, but shelled it
Maxwell's adding salt to Hasan's wounds That went like a rocket to the point fence, cut powerfully and into the gap
misfield by Imad clubbed to cover, and Pakistan just getting a bit ragged. That went through him and Hafeez cleaned up
bouncer on leg stump, he tries to get inside the line and hoick it to fine leg but misses. No wide called. Marginal that.
through him quick ball that time, angling in off a length and he tried to go for the big heave. connected with air
what an over this is turning out to be keeps it outside off that time, just wide enough and taking the pace off. Maxwell tries to drag it across to the legside, misses again
Maxwell connects! Went for the yorker, didn't quite get it. Maxwell went back straight over the bowler's head, full face of the bat and the ball lands beyond the fence
that is a bigger wide. loses his line completely and goes even more wide down leg. Maxwell tried to hit a six again and missed
just misses his line slightly and it's a wide. Still a victory of sorts for the youngster, because Maxwell wanted to send it over fine leg but missed
back of a length on off, he tucks it away to long-on to bring up a fifty. He's been the only one who has given Australia a semblance of hope
clubbed into the offside, but only a single to the man on the point fence
fell short of the man on the point fence Shadab Khan ran in from the boundary and dived forward, but couldn't hold on. Maxwell had slashed it hard
slower bouncer, beautifully bowled. Maxwell made room, but bailed out of the clubbed pull

is that the match for Pakistan? Maxwell got it off the toe-end and it went miles in the air. Shoaib Malik at long-on kept calm, settled in under it and clutched it to his chest. No chance of the ball popping out. Maxwell's entertaining knock ends. And you'd think so do Australia's chances

picks up the length ball and swings it to deep midwicket, where Bravo runs forward and secures an important catch! It's to the longer part of the ground he goes for and was backing himself to clear the boundary. And in current form, I'm not too sure too many people could blame him
reverse sweep, but he's hit it straight to short third man
on middle and turning, clipped to deep square leg off the back foot

he had to reach for this and it seemed like Badree had fooled him. Maxi was making room outside leg and so the bowler tossed it up wide of off stump. But somehow he connects and has hit it well enough to clear extra cover
comes forward to drive it without timing to cover. Only two runs from the over and a wicket
tossed up on off, guided to backward point again
fullish on the pads and he clips it to deep midwicket
works it away to deep midwicket
this was high and over the rope! Raina pitched this on a good length but it was on the pads, that's Maxwell's hitting area - promptly slogs it over fine leg
flat! This was tossed up on the pads and he gets on his knee quickly and bludgeons it over deep midwicket
gets down for the slog early and forces it to deep midwiket
he stays back and punches it to the covers
slower ball nudged to the on side
this was a short one and he decided rather late to upper cut but missed
on a length and outside off, patted to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Maxwell gets off the mark with a tap to mid-on's right
tossed on middle, Maxwell presses forward and pushes to mid-off
arm ball, flat and skids back into a defensive push back to Imad
driven with the incoming angle to long-on for a jogged single
back of a length and seams back in, Maxwell aims square leg but has to settle with a thick inside edge onto the pad

What have you done, Maxwell? No show from the Big Show. He jumps away outside leg, exposes all his stumps. Faheem angles a full ball in and pegs back the middle stump as the batsman does not lay bat onto it. Australia three down inside four overs
full just outside off, and nudged away to deep point with soft hands
full on off stump, and pushed to mid off with soft hands. They take off for a quick run
length ball outside off, but cramping Maxwell up. He misses the pull, hits his body and rolls away to the leg side
overpitched outside leg stump, and the ball goes down the leg side. Sarfraz collects
full on middle, and defended towards the leg side. Leading edge takes it towards cover instead, and they take off for a dangerous single
tossed up, extra flight. Lands on leg, and nudged off his toes to wide long on. Big shout of 'no' for the second run
full outside off, and driven to extra cover. Another single. Required run-rate approaching 10 now
full outside off, and turning away from the batsman. Punched off the front foot to extra cover for a single
full on middle, and drilled to long on for a single. Fakhar intercepts
good length just outside off, and he tiptoes to pull in front of square. Crunched to the deep midwicket boundary

good length just outside off. Maxwell looks to work it towards the leg side, but the ball hits his legs and rolls away to point. Shadab dives and throws towards the keeper's stumps, but he  can't get the direct hit
length ball on off, steered to point
tossed up on the stumps, turning. Worked away to midwicket
he goes back at the crease and thumps it just wide of cover
low full toss on off stump, whipped to long-on
full on off stump, pushed into the covers
pushed to covers, there was a chance for a run out, but ball went far away from the stumps
played gently towards the mid wicket
pushed to mid off
played back to the bowler

slog off the front foot again, but this time he's picked out deep midwicket! He picked it off a length and it looked good for another six, but the man steadied himself on the boundary and clings on. End of a match-changing innings from Maxwell and Pakistan will breathe a giant sigh of relief. Star man does the trick

flighted on leg stump and he goes for a sweep. Lobs off the pad towards short third man. Gul sends the throw at the bowler's end for the run-out, but Afridi can't collect it cleanly and they sneak a second
thumped to the left of deep midwicket and Shehzad is the man who dives and pulls it back. Short ball to start
full toss outside off, slapped to long-on
another low full toss outside off and he carts it over to deep mdiwicket
dropped by the sweeper! This was a low full toss which he had sliced to Ajmal. He runs in from the boundary and has a couple of grabs at it, but grasses it. Second drop in two overs
full and wide outside off, he looks to slice it down to third man but doesn't stretch far enough
worked away off the pads and behind square leg
there's the doosra. Maxi was looking to flay it over cover, but the turn defeats him
flighted on middle and leg, swept away to the man in the deep
flat, hard and six over midwicket. That's the 100 off 51 balls between these two. Ajmal offers a quick length ball which has been mauled
goes for a sweep, has been an incredibly productive stroke for him in this innings, but this time he wears it on the body
100kph, skips down the track as this is flatter on middle and leg. Struck to long-on
beamer! And it continues on it's merry way to the fine leg boundary. Searching for the yorker but it was well over waist high. Maxwell ducks and sways and gets out of the way.
low full toss outside off and he's creamed it to the extra cover boundary. That's 30 off the over!
that's his fifty!. Fourth-fastest overall in T20 cricket. Length again just outside off and Maxi's swung this over long-on
way wide of off stump, but Maxi's tap to point prevents the ump from calling it a wide
fullish delivery, in the slot to be slogged over midwicket and that's what he wants to do. Doesn't connect
slower ball well outside off, but Maxi's decided that side of the ground is of no use. Swipes it wide of long-on and his power is more than enough.
slog swept way into the stands behind midwicket. Took it from off stump and a full-blooded swing has massacred this
Shortish and just outside off, Maxi makes room outside leg and cuts well in front of point. Santokie is the man partolling the boundary and he's too slow to stop it.
pitches it short and Maxi shuffles across and pulls to deep square leg
fullish and angled in at him, Maxi was targeting midwicket again and gets an inside edge onto his back pad
swats the fuller ball outside off to deep midwicket. Slower ball from Sammy again
another cart to the boundary. This is fuller and just outside off, but Maxi doesn't care. Plonks his front foot forward and swipes him to the square leg boundary
length ball with considerable room outside off and Maxi's slammed this over long-on. The short boundaries on the leg side are working their magic
his efforts to outsmart the batsmen backfires spectacularly. Slower ball pitched too far up and outside off, Maxi leans into a solid crunch through the covers
flighted on middle, worked away through square leg

slip dives to his left and fails to net this. Narine slowed it down and gets a little bit more bounce and turn than Maxi expected. Pushes at it after setting himself up outside leg stump and gets a genuine edge.
worked away to deep midwicket as he reads the one turning in off the pitch
big inside edge onto the back pad stifles the appeal midway. Slog sweep to no avail
this one drifts in on middle and is clipped away through midwicket

big lbw appeal against Maxi the new batsman! That was very close as Badree tosses it up on middle and the batsman was looking to hit across the line through midwicket. Gets hit low on the front pad, but the umpire thinks this was going down leg
tries to reverse sweep a wide delivery outside off, defeated by the slower delivery
cut away to sweeper cover, off the mark.
makes room and bunts this towards point.
beaten by sharp turn as he tries to drive, superb from Imad. Rarely beats a batsman in flight.
slider that cramps him for room as he tries to work this to the leg side, hit on the body.
makes room and slices this over cover for a single
looks to work this square, deflects off the pad int the leg side.
oversteps with a length ball that has been pushed to mid-on. First free-hit of the series coming up
straight to long on! Backs away and tries to thump a full-pitched ball into the stands, but it's come off the bat's toe-end, and it doesn't have the power to go beyond the boundary
Maxwell and deep midwicket - inseparable, Jadeja errs by tossing it on the pads and he sends it several rows over the rope
it's in the air but over the off side and lands short of deep point

freak dismissal for Maxwell! Ashwin comes round the wicket, Maxwell gets cheeky and looks to play the reverse sweep, he gets in position but the execution was all haywire, exposed all three stumps and it was the carrom ball that shaved the leg stu,p, he was on the floor after losing balance
full outside off, drilled down the ground
a big full toss is clubbed down to long-on, the umpires say it's fine for height so it all ends with a wicket
tossed up outside off, driven hard straight of deep cover-point for an easy two
wrong un, he prods it into the off side, not sure he picked it, but they pinch a single
92kph, full on off, he defends into the off side
tossed up, on off, defended to cover
shorter into leg stump, he tucks this to square leg
length. A googly at off stump. Nudged to extra cover on the up
short outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
full and pushed quickly down leg side
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
length ball in at leg stump. Backs away and heaves at it to get it out to deep midwicket off the inside half
length outside off, dropped into the covers with soft hands
length at leg stump, dragged wide of long-on with the slog
second tier. Krunal drops it short at a leg stump line and Maxwell gets deep in the crease and pumps it high over deep midwicket!
and another! This is too easy for Maxwell. Flat, fast, length, no turn. Skids on nicely for him to swing from under it and clear long-on
three in three! Another length ball pushed in fast and yet again, he gets the front leg out of the way and swipes at it. Wider of long-on this time
fires in a yorker at leg stump and he stands tall to tickle this behind square with soft hands
full at leg stump, tapped to long-on
length at middle stump, backs away and carves it wide of sweeper cover
front-of-the-hand faster one from Kuldeep. Signs of nerves? It's short and down leg side and he sways away from it
length at leg stump, gets out the reverse-sweep and swats it along the floor to sweeper
length ball pushed flat at off stump, punched to extra cover
length ball down leg side, past the attempted flick
quicker one at a length on leg stump. Stays back and hurriedly jabs it wide of the bowler to steal a second from long-on
the railings of the second-tier. Krunal is coming apart. Goes seam up and gets a full toss up at thigh height for Maxwell. Pummels it over midwicket
that's sweetly struck, stands much stiller, it's a length delivery and it's lofted well over long-on
full and into the pads. Skewed wide of long-on off the toe-end
follows him with a yorker well outside leg, clipped to deep square
a shorter delivery, moves across outside off stump, misses the pull but gets the wide call
