length, fast, on leg stump. Maxi made room and swung free. But this outfield is quite sluggish. It was so in the first innings as well. Three runs
another top edge. He keeps making room to Irfan and for a third time he isn't able to hit where he intended. This short ball hurries onto him and takes the top edge to sail away
waits on this shortish delivery and steers it behind point. Raza at deep third man is not quite quick enough to stop two. That's ordinary work
moves away and flings down a yorker at 145 kph, Maxi tries to slice it to third man but isn't able to connect
runs at Irfan, makes room and slashes at the slower ball. Fools Maxwell as he slashes a little too early and gets a thick outside edge. It flies over the lone slip fielder
he's switched it! When the orthodox strokes don't work, pull out a left-handed sweep and send the length ball sailing away to the square leg/ third man boundary
a hint of turn off a fuller ball on off stump, Maxi defends with an open face at the last minute
pushes it through again and Maxi goes back to push into the covers
short of a length, good delivery, nips back at Maxwell who pushes it towards mid-off without much conviction
starts on leg stump and gets tickled away fine, Ngidi makes excellent ground around the rope to flick it back. Brilliant from a fast bowler
a slower ball, at the stumps, flicked through midwicket
short of a length, reverse swept but straight to backward point
goes back in the crease and pulls a flat delivery to deep midwicket
steps outside leg stump and swings a length ball to long-on
driven through the off side, wide of long-off which allows him back for a second
picks up this slower ball! Maxwell connects well, a full delivery angling in towards leg stump, he brings out the golf swing and clears deep midwicket
full, can't get underneath it, dragged through midwicket
gets the yorker in but isn't backed up in the field, sliced towards backward point who dives over it
back of a length, follows Maxwell, carved over point. Keeps the strike
full outside off, a slower ball, he's through the shot...perhaps moving around the crease too much
another dot ball, this time a swing to leg against a short-of-a-length delivery
this is superb from Morris, follows him with a short ball which Maxwell tries to ramp down to third man. Crowd want the wide, as does Maxwell. Probably a fair shout, actually

it's all happening! Goes for the yorker, it's a low full toss which is driven to mid-off, almost carries for the catch, du Plessis collects on the half volley and goes for the run out by NCN makes it with a dive
tries for the yorker, just gets it wrong and slips down the leg side
follows him with a back-of-a-length delivery, deflects off the hip to third man
and now the follow-up is a dot as he moves outside leg, swings and misses
another short one, makes a connection this time and pulls to fine leg off the glove
gets a top edge and this hoick to leg and it flies to fine leg

drags it straight to square leg. It's possible he's picked the offcutter here, but it's at such an awkward length that he has no control. Hands a long way out as he goes after this and finds the only fielder in the circle

walks across his stumps to whip this away fine and is struck in line of middle. De Kock screams an appeal and the bowler joins in as an afterthought which I thought was strange, because this was pretty adjacent. Minor hiccup, or the start of a collapse?
fires in a leg-stump yorker, Maxi moves outside leg and looks to slog it. Gets a thick inside edge to deep square leg
worked off the pads through midwicket for a couple of runs into the large open spaces
Maxwell stays back in his crease, moves towards the off side and scoops a straight ball right over the keeper's head for another two runs
that's almost like a straight drive for four to the fine leg boundary! Krunal was full and down leg side and Maxwell waited for the ball to pass him and gave it a whack
defended on the offside
a huge roar and several yelps for lbw but the umpire is unmoved, was there bat on that?

bowled him! A quicker ball, one that beat Maxwell in the length and had him thrusting forward in defence. The ball spun away a fraction and had the right-hander playing inside the line. It brushed the outside edge and crashed into off stump
shorter on middle and leg, he tries to give room but bunts it back to the bowler
pitching outside leg, spinning way down leg for a wide
wrong un, he drives and times this so well past cover! What a shot. It beats the man at deep long off

given out LBW! Maxwell reviews after a long discussion with Short. It pitches on middle, he tries to whip to leg, it beats the inside edge. Definitely no bat. Ball tracking says it pitched in line, and spinning down leg! Missing leg. Maxwell survives. Great review.
tossed up outside off, he pushes off the front foot to cover
beaten this spins sharply past the edge as he drives
loops it up onto off stump, Maxwell drives to extra cover
seems like a top spinner, going through flat on off stump and not spinning a great deal. Maxwell goes back, perhaps wondering if he can cut it, but then has to block down the pitch
good length, spinning into him, Maxwell tries to pull, but it doesn't rise as much as he wants
hits to long off. Probably picks the googly

top-edge! It can happen, with the left-armer's bouncer going across the right-hander, and him going hard at a ball rising above his shoulder. Not easy to get on top of it to muscle it through leg. But you do have every chance of pinging a boundary right behind you
goes for the pull, but here, Khaleel is able to sneak under the bat and through to the keeper
shortish and outside off, dabs it in front of point
seam-up delivery, I think, on a good length on off stump. And Maxwell knocks it back to long-on
tries to make room to crash the ball through the covers, but Kuldeep follows him, and bowls so very slow too, refusing an antsy batsman any pace to work with
doesn't pick the googly this time as a good length ball on middle and leg spins away and takes the leading edge as he tries to flick it

taken at long-on! Maxwell clears his front leg and tries to launch the ball into orbit. And really, this ball is there to be hit, pitched short of a length and not even pretending as if it'd turn. The batsman makes room, hits as hard as he can, but he can't clear the straight field. Simple catch to Rohit, who makes up for the earlier drop

misses a full toss and has his stumps in disarray. First T20 wicket for Taskin. Looked to hit across the line towards midwicket and the bat face closed a little too early. Consolation wicket, but Australia are already on the cusp of a... uh, consolation victory
slower ball, came out of the back of his hand. Maxi though was waiting for it and he has laced this through midwicket.
full and outside off, Maxi nudges it all along the ground to long-on
he tosses this one wide down the leg side
flipper, 104kph, slid through on middle, he drives to long on on the front foot
top spinner, shorter on middle, punched back to the bowler
flighted on middle, he drives straight to midwicket
slides this through on middle, he drives to long off
short and outside off, mauled to deep midwicket. That's 18 off the over
short and wide and Maxi's getting into the act! Cut behind point for an easy boundary. Kept it down, and placed it well. Slower ball gone awry there
flighted on leg and turning away towards middle, Maxi is forward and nudges towards a vacant mid-on and they scamper through for a wonderfully crafted couple
good length ball on leg, worked to midwicket
swept away even as this was turning away on middle. Played in front of square and struck so powerfully. Was always in control of that shot as he came down on it
googly again from Tahir and the batman's wasn't too comfy with it. Just about manages to nudge it in front of point
141kph, loud appeal for caught behind, but the ump's spreading his arms for the wide. This was short and down leg. Goes for the hook this time and doesn't connect
slower length ball on off stump, he goes for a heave over midwicket and gets a leading edge to deep third man
136kph,lovely bouncer and Maxi prefers not to play. Great height just over shoulder and if the batsman wanted to hook, he had to fetch it from just outside off.
short ball outside off, Maxi pulls from outside off towards midwicket. Came off the bottom of the blade there
flighted on leg stump at 95kph, worked away to deep midwicket
turning out to be an inspired bowling change! Duminy continues round the wicket to the right-hander, fired that full and quick outside off, Maxwell ends up driving it hard to Faf at point
comes round the wicket to the right-hander and he sprays it too wide, Maxwell doesn't play at it
no point with posting a deep midwicket. This sails clean over his head. Took it up off a length and deposits it for an 83m six
drags it short and he pulls him down to Amla at deep midwicket
good length, angled into off, he turns this from off behind square to the man in the deep
138kph, beats him, this climbs off a length and zips past the outside edge that flies to the keeper
139kph, good length on off, he pushes slowly to mid on and they pinch one
130kph, back of a length on leg, he tucks this off his hip down to fine leg
139kph, good length, wide of off, he drives on the up to deep point
play and miss! 145kph, good length outside off, he just wafts at it from the crease and it flies to the keeper
144kph, back of a length outside off, he defends off the back foot to cover
beaten again! What a delivery. Back of a length, 143kph, angled in and nips away, Maxwell completely squared up
stock leg break, outside off, he defends to cover on the front foot
shorter wrong un, stops in the surface he drags it to midwicket
full toss, driven hard past cover into the outfield and it's a big boundary so they get three as Dhawan comes around from long off
tossed up on middle and off, worked slowly to long on, they look for two but it's not on
fired way down leg
Maxwell looks to clip that to the on side the ball skids and clips the pad
goes for a reverse swat, but it was slid too quickly down the leg side for Maxi.

he is just hitting every gap in the field! This has a bit of room outside off and Maxi's cut him to the point boundary. Sliced to the right of the man inside the circle and to the left of the one in the deep
flighted on middle and Maxi's swept him all along the ground to deep midwicket.
full on the legs again and Maxwell repeats the previous shot

tossed up outside off and Maxwell has holed out to long-off. Made him reach for it, there was a hint of turn as well as he ended up slicing it in the air and that ends what should be a match-winning innings, unless Australia blow it
full outside off, but Maxwell shuffles towards the ball's line, before punching to mid-off for a quick single
top-edged, but goes all the way! Short ball that's soaring over Maxwell's head, but he attempts to pull, and gets enough connection to clear the boundary behind Dhoni
back of a length on off, and he works this - off his hips - to the gap near square leg. Just a single on offer though
length ball on middle, and paddled over square leg! Delivery angling in, and he helps the ball over the infielder
another slower ball, length delivery outside off. He mistimes a square cut to the off side
length ball, wide outside off, and he tries to steer this shot between point and gully. Krunal runs to his left, and dives sideways to stop the ball from sneaking through

shot! That wasn't all that short, and it was pitcing on middle stump and turning away a reasonable deal, but Maxwell rocks back and puts his bottom wrist to full use for a whip-pull that easily beats deep midwicket to his left
fuller, on the pads. Misses the flick, or maybe gets an edge on it, and the ball rolls towards short fine leg off the outside of his front pad
back of a length on the pads, nudged away through square leg, and doesn't put too much weight on the shot, so they can scamper two
looks to bowl that wide line he's bowled with success to Maxwell, but ends up bowling it too wide. Left alone
wide length ball, rocks back to slap it to sweeper cover
flat, back of a length, angling into the stumps, makes room and punches to extra-cover
not that short, angling into middle stump, rocks back and pulls to the left of deep midwicket. Kept slightly low but he watched it well and crouched a little while playing the shot
fired into the pads, clipped into the backward square leg region
fairly full, on the pads, clipped down to long-on
shot! A bit of flight outside off, and Maxwell has lofted that effortlessly over the wide long-off boundary
looks to clip this through the leg side, closes his face early and sends a leading edge rolling into the point region
fired into the pads, clipped away through midwicket
flat, back of a length, keeps going with the angle towards the batsman. Clears his front leg to pull but it isn't short enough and sneaks under to hit thigh pad
fuller now, clipped quietly to long-on

and Maxwell still finds the boundary. Floats this full and wide, seemingly secure with long-off and extra-cover back, but Maxwell is able to flat-bat this much straighter, bringing his bottom hand into play, and find the gap to the right of long-off
slower this time, on leg stump. Looks to flick and pops a leading edge just out of reach of Krunal, leaping to his left with left arm outstretched
short outside off, stops on the batsman a little and he chops it down to point
slower ball, but it's misdirected, on the pads, and Maxwell still finds enough pace to use and glance it away fine, a long way to the right of long leg who's stationed quite square
another slower ball, loopy and descending onto Maxwell's front foot. Clipped to long leg
full down the leg side and he taps it on its head, reminiscent of Tendulkar

wham. He's bowled a lot of slower balls, and Maxwell was well prepared. Back of a length, on off stump, and he's back and across in a flash and has all the time in the world to swat this away over the midwicket boundary. That makes it 13 off this over, and 38 off Shankar's four. I guess India will take it, especially since he got the wicket of Short.
full outside off and brings up a brilliant fifty with a push to long-on
quicker, flatter one on middle, cut away  but straight to cover-point
full on middle, pushed to long-on to finish a good over for Australia
length on off, sticks in the surface, defended
length outside off, Maxwell drags it to midwicket despite the lack of bounce
quicker one on middle, pushed back to the bowler
length on middle, pushed to long-on
length outside off, slapped to long-off
length on off, pushed to cover
slow and wide outside off, Maxwell slaps it to cover
length outside off, Maxwell backs away and punches it to deep cover
length, angled in, pushed to midwicket and they turn for an an easy couple
length outside off, pushed back to the bowler
direct hit and do we have another run-out? Maxwell chopped it to point and ran straight away, had to stretch at the non striker's end but made it easily
length outside off, defended to point
full on the pads, tucked away to deep squareleg
slog sweep and just short of the diving Rohit Sharma at deep midwicket
full outside off, enticing Maxwell to go big and Maxwell obliges with a massive hit over long-on
quicker one on middle, Maxwell goes back and punches it to long-off
quicker one outside off, slapped to deep cover
length, angled in, Maxwell waits for it to arrive and pushes it to squareleg
length on middle, quicker one, defended to cover
length on off, pushed to long-off
full and angled in, tucked away to deep squareleg
full outside off, Maxwell lunges forward to blast it through the covers but can't get a decent amount of bat on it
short ball, Maxwell attempts to pull, is too early into hit and takes it on the grille of the helmet
full on middle, swatted to long-on
length on middle, Maxwell makes room and swings wildly but misses
length on the pads and he has picked that up over midwicket, somehow managing to time it on this surface when everyone around him is struggling
slower ball gone wrong, ends up whanging it waaay outside off stump

flat length ball on off stump. Goes back almost by rote, and he doesn't have the room to actually punch it where he wants - to long-on. Ends up playing a defensive push into the on side and Krunal cuts off the single
now it's Maxwell's turn to bring out the reverse sweep as he picks up a delivery full outside and sends it to deep point
that's a magnificent shot as he dances down on the line of leg stump, opens the off side, then drives inside out over extra cover
another reverse, this time it's not off the middle, comes off the bottom edge to short third man
gets a top edge as he sweeps conventionally, loops short of deep square leg
cut to deep cover
sent through the leg side, flicked back near the rope by Gunathilaka but it appears his foot may be touching the boundary
that's HUGE as Maxwell slog-sweeps with immense power over (well over) deep midwicket and into the second tier of the stands
short outside off, stays in his crease and drives off the back foot to deep cover
that's a mighty swing from Maxwell, a slower ball on the pads, sends it off the top edge miles over the keeper
leg stump yorker at 133kph, clipped to deep square
oh dear! That's gone wrong from Malinga. A massive full toss down the leg side, slower ball goes wrong...he may have seen Maxwell starting to move around the crease
starts with a full delivery which Maxwell times crisply out to deep midwicket
oh, that's brilliant from Maxi as he plays the reverse scoop to what was almost an off-stump yorker. Outstanding
a slower ball, 111kph, dug in short outside off, flat-batted to deep cover
gets the yorker in at off stump, dug out straight down the ground and it's good hustle to make the second
full outside off, Maxwell almost swings himself off his feet as he laces this through the covers
tries to reverse sweep a 135kph delivery speared in at off stump! It scoots under his bat
full at the stumps, that is crunched again as he drives, but couldn't have picked out deep cover better
well bowled! Gets a yorker under his bat, and it goes through his legs. Beats leg stump
aims for a repeat, it's a low full toss but costs just the single as Maxwell mistimes backward of square on the leg side
into the crowd over midwicket as he connects with a low full toss, that takes him to a 22-ball fifty. Follows his superb series in India back in February
that's extraordinary as he brings out the helicopter shot over deep square leg, was a full delivery at the stumps, he stays deep in the crease and whips through it with vast power in the wrists
a rare dot ball as he drives straight to mid-off, tried to give himself room
I've no idea how to describe this really, but Maxwell has ended up on his backside and with a boundary as he reverse scoops a full toss down to third man. Bonkers innings
a short ball, zips through to the keeper as Maxwell tries to upper cut...they haven't tried enough short stuff
back of a length outside off, sliced over backward point to bring up the hundred stand off 51 balls and an overthrow gifts a second, which means Warner has the strike

given caught behind off an inside edge as he looks to flick away a full delivery and Maxwell has called the review. Yep, he's inside-edge this between his legs to the keeper! A very Maxwell way to get out, the end of a brilliant innings.
full at middle and leg, pushed along the ground through midwicket
back of a length, cramping Maxwell with the angle from round the wicket. Worked off the hip into the backward square leg region
full at the stumps, flicked to deep midwickdt

make that one off three. What a sensational shot. Attempted yorker misses the length marginally, and the wide-ish full-toss is launched straight back over the bowler's head with an incredible bottom-handed shovel
back of a length again, worked to deep midwicket to bring up his second fifty of the series. Excellent innings
flat slider on leg stump. Makes a lot of room and opens his bat face to squeeze a single to the right of backward point
back of a length slider on leg stump, makes room to punch to deep extra cover
nice change of pace. He usually goes quick, quick, quick, and Maxwell is too early on his slog-sweep, misses and the ball hits him high on the thigh
back of a length on middle and leg, pulled to deep midwicket
wide outside off, back of a length, Maxwell reaches out to cut and misses
flat length ball angling into off stump, and too quick for the reverse-swat. Bit of an lbw shout, but India don't review. May have straightened just enough to miss off stump

whoa, that's the biggest hit of this innings. A big front-foot stride to a back-of-a-length ball close to off stump, and he generates incredible power through his hips to wallop that waaay over long-off
flat and back of a length again, and Maxwell goes too early into the pull, drags it along the ground to deep backward square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, nudged into the vacant midwicket region and they scamper two while the fielder sprints in off the boundary

full, just outside leg. Was looking to cramp him by attacking his pads, but he's marginally missed his line, and Maxwell gets down on one knee at great speed and swivels through a sweep that easily clears the backward square leg boundary

Chahal goes to his wide-outside-off line, and Maxwell's response is emphatic, a reverse-sweep off incredible power and bat-speed, whacked over the point boundary. The key was how quickly he created a wide base with his footwork
full on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
flat, fairly wide outside off. Hurries through to beat Maxwell's attempted cut
full, plenty of width, a rare free hit from Bumrah, and you don't bowl those to Maxwell in this mood. Drives it up and over cover, finishing with a high left elbow
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed down to long-off

that's a great shot. Not the most attractive shot he's played, and it's muscled rather than timed, but he's gone so deep in his crease to convert a slightly back-of-a-length slower delivery into a short ball and he swivels to beat the diving square leg fielder
very full outside off, Maxwell slices it flat and hard towards deep point
short ball just outside off, maybe the knuckle ball, and Maxwell swivels too early into his pull and gets hit on his back
dismissive. That's smacked the top corner of the sightscreen, on the full. Length ball outside off, and he just clears his front leg and smacks it through the line
in the blockhole on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg
another full-toss - seemed close to waist height but perhaps just below - outside off. Maxwell flat-bats it on the full to long-off, but this, of course, is a free hit

waist-high full-toss. We'll have to check for no-ball here. Yup, it is, but it doesn't matter to Maxwell, who opens up at the hips and simply wallops this over wide long-on. Sensational hitting, moves to 98

yorker just outside off, jams his bat down and squeezes it past the right of the diving keeper. Off the cue end of the bat, and he'll only get a single, but that's all he needed to bring up his third T20I hundred. First Australian to the mark. What a player.
off-stump yorker. Gets his front foot out of the way and fashions a one-legged flick to square leg
full on off stump, Laxmaned down to long-on
back of a length close to off stump, slapped to point, can't beat the diving fielder

and there's the win, Australia seal a 2-0 series victory. Back of a length on off stump, and Maxwell makes a bit of room and flat-bats it to the right of extra-cover. He's been simply unstoppable today
short, he rocks back and Maxwell is in a dangerous mood, Silences the crowd with a massive six over deep midwicket
fuller and on middle this time but the same result as Maxwell clears his back leg and goes over the bowler's head
length, angled in and Maxwell is toying with the field here, as he shuffles across and tucks it away to short fine-leg's right for four
conventional sweep this time and finds the gap backward of square
leg side wide
full on leg stump, clipped to deep-midwicket, they take on Bopara for the second and get home comfortably
goes again and this is nailed over cover for six! Pietersen-esque! Nails the reverse slog sweep into the stands, amazing shot
reverse sweep from outside leg and gets enough bat to clear point
length on the stumps, tried to be swung to leg and gets a toe end into the leg side for a single
down the leg side for a wide, sharp take from Buttler
goes for the slog sweep and it hits the pad and runs not far enough away from Buttler for a leg bye
forward and gets hit on the pad flicking to leg
goes for the reverse sweep first ball and was lucky to get some glove on that in front of all three, it rebounds to point and they get a quick single

he's gone now. Maxwell was aiming for yet another six, but Jadeja does him in the flight, and he mistimes this to Ishant Sharma at long on, who takes it just inside the rope, I think. Umpires check it and replays show that Sharma didn't touch the boundary. Good catch, and a decent ball from Jadeja. Took the bottom edge I think,
makes room and tries to force it through the off side, but Jadeja yorks him and he can't do much with it
a big shot on the off side from Maxwell, but Jadeja turns it away from the bat and he misses
driven down the ground to long off
it keeps raining sixes, and it's in that cow corner area again. Shortish on the stumps, and Maxwell slams that just over the deep midwicket boundary for another biggie
length on the stumps, pushed into the off side
worst ball of the over, and that's saying something. Thigh-high full toss on off stump, Maxwell eats this up. Launched over cow corner again
a breather for Ashwin, flatter faster, pitching on a length, Maxwell can't get that beyond the bowler
straighter but the result is the same, slog swept powerfully over cow corner. This one's even bigger
over the wicket now, and the result is even worse. Fullish on off stump, Maxwell gets a hold of that and deposits it in the stand behind wide long on
wide and slightly short, Maxwell chops it in front of square to the sweeper on the off side
fullish on the stumps, straightening, turned into the leg side for a single

swing and a miss! Sri Lanka sneak through! The ball was there for Maxwell. Wide again, and slightly overpitched, but he makes room and misses it this time. Chandimal collects cleanly and runs forward jubilantly.
another one. Full toss outside off stump again, and that's carved over point for a second time. The crowd is going nuts at the MCG. What a super hand from Maxwell.
full outside off stump, Maxwell gets low and slices it over point for four. Australia are still in it. Great shot first up.
that's the end of his fun. He flicks a low full toss straight down the throat of deep square-leg who barely had to take a step either way
full length wide of off stump, tried to be carved off the back foot but misses
beaten first up, basically he missed his drive at a length delivery
straighter and dabbed into square leg for a quick single
length ball on off stump, dabbed into the covers for a single
good length ball on the stumps, Maxi slogs and it goes on the bounce to the man at deep midwicket
full toss on off stump and Maxi accepts gleefully with a punch over point. A couple of bounces and into the boundary. Opened the face to find the placement again
slower ball just outside off and Maxi's tapped it beyond the reach of short third man. Gorgeous stroke, showcases the value of placement
terrible line from Hafeez. He wants to cramp the batsman, but he's playing into Maxi's strength. That sweep shot has sailed over the boundary behind square leg. That's 15 off the over
full and just outside off, but he stays back and heaves this along the ground to deep midwicket
length on the stumps and Maxi's mauled it into the stands behind midwicket, right beside the Pakistan dug out
another reverse sweep and still no luck. Quick and flat and angled in at him. Another lbw appeal to no avail
held this one back and he went for the sweep again. Big appeal from Babar as he is struck on the front pad. Would have gone down leg though
and he one-ups himself with a gorgeous lofted cover drive. Tossed up on off stump and he strode forward and launched it. Lovely timing
the conventional sweep this time and he's picked the perfect ball for it. Drifting onto the pads and he's smacked it right off the middle
much slower this time as he flights it on off stump. Maxi defends with a closed face and gets a leading edge that goes to ground
pushed down to long-on for a single
reverse sweep now from the new batsman, Maxi. First ball in the match for him and he is lucky to have his leg stump still intact

swings again but Maxwell has holed out to long-on! The ball was back of a length, Maxwell tried to cross-batter it again, came high off the bat and straight to the man running in from the fence. Another frenzied failure from Maxwell
boom, six more! Broad goes short and follows Maxwell, who simply roundhouses it on its way over deep backward square
back of a length, outside off, smacked down the ground with a baseball slug but straight to long-on
takes the pace off and the ball bounces over the stumps as Maxwell walks across and attempts a cute dab behind square
spears this down the leg side - wide
brutal, Maxwell smears a flat six over wide long-off! Maybe a touch full from Stokes and Maxwell backed away to smoke it into the crowd
pitched up wide of the wicket, Maxwell fiddles at it and fails to connect
full and down the leg side, squirts it through square leg to get off the mark

length ball, Maxwell steps inside it and swings into the leg side, Bresnan is out at deep-backward square and takes the catch running to his right. More mindless batting from Maxwell, nowhere near the elevation needed on that stroke and he holes out in the deep
step to leg and punched to extra cover where Bopara gets down and saves very well with a dive
down the track and clipped through midwicket for an easy run
short and pulled, total miscue, off the toe of the bat, it loops into midwicket but lands between two fielders
forward, dabbing into the covers, point is up quickly and saves the single

full on the stumps, goes to reverse slog sweep and chips it to point easy catch for Bresnan. Horrible shot really, he never gets his head down enough does Maxwell. Back of the hand delivery from Bopara does the trick, Maxwell never got under the full delivery
full at the off stump, a huge heave to leg brings an inside edge that doesn't carry through to Buttler
low full toss, Bopara lucky it only costs a single as Maxwell pings it to deep square leg
this time Finn gets beaten, good over for Australia, Maxwell picks up a length delivery and lofts it straight down the ground
now he flat-bat pulls this straight down the ground, Finn does well to get around from long-on and hands the ball to Morgan who hurls it back
shuffles across and works from middle to midwicket
driven off the front foot to sweeper cover
Maxwell falls too, now, he had looked very comfortable against Ajmal in the third ODI, has to go for it now, slog-sweeps hard, but only hits it high in the air to deep square leg
goes for the yorker, into the pads, he misses the flick and the ball rolls towards point
down the track and swats a length ball to mid off
opens up and gives the pull everything, drags it just wide of midwicket, long on slides across and throws it back quickly
hit on the thigh pad with a pacy back of a length ball
pushed to point for a single
beaten by the turn, quick, angled in from wide of the crease, he tries to defend, beaten

Australia are crumbling here and even 112 looks a long way off! Maxwell gives Hasan the charge and aims to loft it over the off side, hits the splice of the bat and lobs to Hafeez running to his right at backward point
this was much quicker and he worked it down to deep square leg
flatter delivery and clipped to deep square leg
fitting end to the match. Zaheer at cover dives on this like London Bridge falling down, and lets it through for four
slower now, flighted on off, defended to leg
carrom ball, wide outside off, punched to sweeper-cover
offbreak now, off and middle, defended back
Ashwin finally gets an edge with a carrom ball, but it falls short of slip
flighted, full toss, driven to long-on
length outside off and through him, beaten on the inside edge as he lunges forward to drive
length, angled in, kept a tad low but Maxwell adjusted well and also did well to defend it with a straight bat
length outside off and beaten again, this time on the outside edge as he pushed at it with his feet rooted to the crease
length, angled in, hurries on to Maxwell, who brings his bat down in time and defends to point
length outside off and Maxwell punches this through the covers, finding sublime timing out of nowhere to break the shackles
length outside off, Maxwell slaps it over mid-off
length, angled in, pushed to midwicket
moves across again quite calmly, and runs it to short third man
comes down the pitch, pushes to midwicket
low loopy full toss, patted back to the bowler
cannot get it away again, moves across and pushes to extra cover
that is plastered through the off side, short of a length and it sat up for Maxwell who moved to leg and slammed it over cover
this is a touch fuller, but Maxwell still pulls - and almost swings himself off his feet - this time through midwicket
dropped in short and Maxwell helps himself to a full count over deep square-leg
steps to leg and hammers this through the off side...finds long off
slower ball to end the over, 66mph, and Maxwell is through his shot, getting a bottom edge into his pads
gets a bit more behind this pull through midwicket
short, wide and fairly slow...the lack of pace means it's hard work for the batsman to swing it through midwicket
back of a length, Maxwell aims to the leg side but the ball ends up down at long-off
uses his feet and crunches this down to long-off...reached the fielder in a split second. Still only worth one, mind
goes for the reverse sweep, it's a straight delivery, gets a bottom edge to short third-man
full at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler

full and straight, Maxwell misses and Dernbach takes out his off stump, Dernback picking up a few late wickets here. Simple modus operandi there, quick delivery from slightly wide on the crease angled into the stumps and I did warn the Aussies about missing straight balls
another slower ball, really nice again, Maxwell almost swings himself off his feet and misses by a mile
another 15-run over! Just drifting on the pads and Maxi has been brutal with that sweep shot. Absolutely no intention to keep it down. Australia have smashed 39 runs in the last three
full outside off, dabbed into the covers
tries to slog sweep, beaten by the slight turn and bounce outside off
thumps a reverse-switch hit past short third man now
straightens as he bowls slow on middle, worked through midwicket, the throw hits direct from the deep at the non-striker's, but Hussey has made it
skips out, fetches it from wide outside off, does not get hold of it, dragged on the bounce to wide long on
drills a very full one to long on
he's given it everything, he really has, swivelled violently to the full ball and shovelled it high over deep square leg
low full toss swung away to deep square leg
yorker moves in full for the middle stump, jammed away to off, bowler fields
another one, Maxwell continuing the attack, heaves a length ball from off through midwicket
that has been scythed through extra cover, pitched up, width outside off, and he creams it off the front foot
wobbly full one, outside off, swings and mistimes it down the pitch
down the track, beaten in the flight, but takes two off a thick outside edge behind point
connects with the slog sweep now, but finds deep midwicket who runs in and manages to hold on

Welcome back, Star Man. Although this one isn't quite stationary. This time the quicker ball does the batsman. It came in off the deck to catch Maxi, who was possibly hoping to cut a length ball away, napping. The adjustment to hit down the ground isn't quick enough. Struck on the knee-roll and in front of off stump.
swung mightily over the leg side, and it plops over the rope for the century! Stunning batting from the Big Show who, frankly, was the only show in town today.
drags the length back, 84mph, on middle and off, defended
drives straight to short cover! With Australia almost to the finish line, their top-scorer hits a length ball off the bottom of the bat straight to Chigumbura
spears a quick delivery in at leg stump, Maxwell inside edges it
short and wide, Maxwell pummels it straight down the ground. Another powerful hit for six
good length on middle stump, defends

length ball - offering Maxwell room to free the arms too - and he takes full toll of it. Winds up and launches the bad ball over long-on to bring up his half-century. Points at both of his eyes in celebration, while the umpires bring out a new ball.
makes room outside leg to open up the covers, but because he goes hard at the ball, he mistimes it back at the bowler
sliding into the pads, clipped away to leg
googly on off stump, Maxwell defends, reading the variation just about well enough
poor delivery, angled onto leg stump and that's neatly tickled away to fine leg
dragged down a touch short, he rocks back and pulls strong to bisect deep midwicket and long on
nudged into the leg side, plenty of space at midwicket and Tahir chases it himself
has a mighty swipe at this delivery outside off, doesn't make contact and it beats de Kock to escape for byes towards third man
clips a low full toss along the ground to long on
taken from outside off into the leg side towards long on
tighter to the body, flicked through square leg

huge wicket! Short of a length works again. Maxwell standing on leg stump, tries to give himself room to go over the off side but ends up carving high into the air and du Plessis snaffles the catch just outside the fielding circle
Horrid fielding from Pakistan. Afridi is the culprit off his own bowling. Full on middle, played back, the bowler lazily lets it sneak through his hands
full-toss angling across off, Maxi carves it away to the right of deep third man. 100 up for Australia

Maxwell swings one straight into the lap of Ali at long-on. Pushed through on middle stump, Maxwell winds up and golf-swings it straight to the man in the deep. Two wickets in three overs for Pakistan
can't get this one away, nudges into the leg side
flicks a straight delivery through midwicket
another low full toss, straighter this time, swung to long on
heaves a length delivery through straight midwicket, a skimming shot from Maxwell which bisects deep midwicket and long on
that slips out as a big full toss, gets heaved to deep square where there's bad misfield by Tahir which gifts a boundary...didn't quite anticipate the spin on the ball
worked into the leg side
on off stump, tight line, pushed to cover
goes for the reverse sweep to a straight full toss and gets it fine of short third man
good response from Wiese as he gets this one past Maxwell's outside edge as he drives
top shot! The best of Maxwell. Holds his shape and drives on the up through the line of a length delivery outside off and sends it over long off
slashes again at some width outside off, Morris gets more work at third man and can't stop the second
back outside off stump, Maxwell drives and it comes off the toe of the bat towards third man
nicely played, moving across to off stump and whips a straight delivery off his pads wide of short fine leg
defends a full delivery on off stump towards point. Another straightforward single
shoved down the leg side, called wide
angled down to third man from outside off
full and nipping into the pads, inside-edged away to square leg as Maxwell does not get enough bat onto the leg-side flick
that's wonderful batting, it was a short delivery outside off stump but the timing and placement was top class from Maxwell as he goes onto his toes and opens the face through backward point
fuller, shovelled into the leg side towards midwicket where, with a clean piece of fielding, it could have been tight
is that a chance?! A lovely delivery, grips from middle and leg, spins to take the edge and, yes, that is a drop by de Kock behind the stumps
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends
full on off stump, Maxwell pushes it to mid-off and pinches a single
flights it on off stump, Maxwell plays for turn, but the drift into the right-hander secures an inside edge
drives through the covers for a couple. Australia almost solely concentrating on singles and twos to recover lost ground
short and wide, Maxwell cuts to deep point
shapes to pick a short ball off middle stump over square leg. But he's into the shot too early and ends up hitting it off a leading edge to point
dipping slower ball on middle, Maxwell presents the full face for a single to long-on
flicks a short one from middle and off stump to deep midwicket
shovels it all the way over the extra cover boundary! Maxwell is reaching out - it would have been a wide had he missed it - but Maxwell still manages to hit it with monstrous power
pushes it through on off stump, Maxwell is waiting for the change in length as he calmly flicks through midwicket
skids through past the pads of Maxwell even as he tries to flick it away. Deflection off the pad puts the keeper off from collecting it
smashes it over long-on! Simply done by Maxwell as he meets a half volley with the full face and ensures it has enough of his strength to take it all the way
rank delivery - short and down leg - Maxwell pulls it away to the left of long leg. Muzarabani saves a boundary
quicker delivery outside off, Maxwell pushes it to long-off
flatter delivery on middle, Maxwell clears his front leg and punches to midwicket
shapes to slog a legbreak over long-on but hitting against the turn - especially when the ball is way outside off - is rarely helpful. Maxwell is beaten
googly on off stump, Maxwell swings it around to short fine leg
quicker delivery on middle, Maxwell goes back to block and gets an outside edge through point
prepares a flick shot, but the ball not coming onto the bat puts him off. It eventually ends up deflecting off the pads to short fine leg
stays back in the crease and flicks it carefully into midwicket
full and outside off, he drives to point
tucks a good length ball outside off through square leg
cuts the flatter delivery to point
on leg stump, goes for the sweep, gets it very fine and Finn is just able to catch up with it
loops the googly up so very wide outside off. Maxwell thinks about it, but settles for the wide
pulls a short ball away to deep midwicket
just eludes midwicket. Uppishly whipped by Maxwell., in the air because he jabbed at this.
clipped nicely to the fine leg boundary. Lovely use of his wrists. Hopped back and then used the angle of this length ball on leg to put that away
short and outside off, Maxwell cuts to the sweeper
short now, and Maxwell pulls it away to the left of deep midwicket
length ball, asking to be hit and Maxwell doesn't disappoint. Presses forward and launches it over midwicket.
full on middle, Maxwell turns it to long-on
good length on off stump, defends
shortish on middle, Maxwell taps it to the empty spaces at mid-on and midwicket to take a couple
beaten as he looks to flay this on the up over cover
walked across just a touch to pull, didn't have room so he adjusted well and whipped this behind square to the fine leg boundary
beauty! Cut him into two halves again. Maxwell is uncertain as he pushes at a length ball that holds its line. Bites off the deck as well to whizz past the inside edge
works this off the pad to midwicket
full, straight and gone. First he gets Finch, now Maxwell. Late inswing has done the trick. Maxwell looks to flick, misses and is trapped plumb in front. Shaheen Shah Afridi on fire
strays down the pads, Maxwell misses out on the flick
full outside off, on the popping crease, squeezed to backward point
tucks a length delivery gently into square leg...Australia just trying to settle for a few moments

goes for a booming drive to a full delivery, gets an inside edge into the pads...starts off for a run, would have been tight with a direct hit, then he gets an overthrow as Stokes pings his shy to deep square
on the stumps and nudged through the leg side
angled in and defended with a straight bat pressing forwards
short and Maxwell swings himself off his little feet, top-edging to backward point! Rabada has his first international wicket, Maxwell caught slogging high to the edge of the circle second ball
good length on off stump, White opens the face and dabs in front of square but quickly nips back to his crease as the fielder homes in
short of a length, Maxwell goes for a pull but just gets taken on the pad
a clean piece of work this time from Roy at cover as Smith drives with his bottom hand coming off the bat
can't get through the off side, drives a back-of-a-length delivery to cover...good start from Topley
gives himself room to the leg side and then gets beaten by a very full delivery which he tries to drive
short ball at the body, pulled straight to midwicket...seemed to hurry on a little
nips back off a length and takes the thigh pad behind square on the off side
that's a wild mow across the line, gets an inside edge past the stumps to fine leg
back of a length outside off, driven to deep cover
gets this past deep cover, could Hales have done better? Driven square through point. Yes, Hales made a bit of a mess of that
short of a length at middle and leg, worked to midwicket
that's a sweet pull, Maxwell is up and running, Topley drops it short and it gets dispatched in front of square
banged in short, battered hard into the covers, but can't beat the field
waits for this outside off and cuts to deep cover
gets across onto off stump and tucks through midwicket
tucked off the hip...ah, again no bat involved

watch a catch! He's struck first ball. But it's all down to Ben Stokes. It was a short ball, Maxwell fluffed his pull but it was still travelling wide of long on before Stokes ran around, diving to his right and pulled off a blinder
blocked from off stump into the covers...more sensible batting
pushed gently through midwicket and the soft placement gives them the chance to come back for a second
gets this fuller, on leg stump, calmly pushed down the ground...mature batting
short ball is costly, a freebie to Maxwell as he rocks back and pulls it high into the stands over deep square leg
deft batting this time, short outside off and Maxwell late cuts to third man
flicks a straight delivery into the leg side
back of a length, flying through outside off as Maxwell dangles his bat a little aimlessly
continues to drop short, Maxwell runs this through backward point and gets back for two
backs away and smears a full delivery on leg stump over to the extra cover boundary. Brutal strike, one that showcases his bottom-hand strength

Maxwell whirls the arms but this is a huge top edge... superbly taken on the run by deep midwicket! Just as the match seemed to be back in Australia's court, the required rate only a run-a-ball, Maxwell has exploded all over himself. Third wicket for Peterson, equalling his T20I best
shuffles around in the crease and pulls to midwicket
ho ho, here we go, that's a beaut of a strike down the ground, many a row into the stand! Skipped out and smashed down the ground, such a clean strike
tries to get cute now, attempting a sort of reverse paddle, loops an edge into the leg side but gets away with it
on the stumps, taps this into the leg side
tossed up, reverse-sweep from Maxwell and the ball cannons off the bat, racing through backward point and away for four
flat and wide, Maxwell clubs it through the covers, long-off runs around the boundary to cut it off
length outside off, maybe a slower ball and Maxwell is perilously close to playing on, inside-edges on to his pad
impudent, super flicked four from Maxwell, waiting to play the pull shot really late and directing it fine of the boundary rider
"catch!" screams Peterson as Maxwell chips down the ground, Wiese throws himself full length, trying to get his fingers under it but can't quite cling on
another cutter, worked away through the leg side
full and straight, drilled down the ground with plenty of bottom hand...didn't try to over-hit, just slotted it back past the bowler
clipped off the pads to deep square
swivels on a pull which goes backward of square...a very well-controlled stroke, not brute force

plenty going on here! A good ball from Willey, short of a length, which nips back at Maxwell who fends it towards slip. Smith races up for a single but Maxwell isn't moving and Smith has to sprint back. The throw is wild in any event
width outside off and it's hammered through square cover as Maxwell frees his arms
defended to the off side
uses his feet and dead-bats this very full ball
hip-high short ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
short, slid in with the arm, punched to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, pulled in the air, deep midwicket mops up
back of a length and outside off, 140.5ks, steered down to third man
full and angling away outside off, late-cut away towards deep point
tossed outside off, shovelled away to midwicket. They hare across for the second
back of a length and angled in, the ball sticks in the surface, Williamson shuffles across and inside-edges the ball to the leg side
full and outside off, run down to third man for one
very full and outside off, opens the face, and steers the ball deftly to third man
goes for the slog, seeing a length delivery on leg stump, but the lack of pace on the pitch doesn't allow him the benefit of any timing. Single to deep square leg

takes it from well outside off and scoops it over fine leg. And it's a very tall fine leg too. Shaheen Afridi is running back after the ball and stops it at the edge of the boundary. Williamson wants three, but Anderson says no
steers a wide yorker down to third man

splendid batting! It's all in the placement here and he works so hard to get it just right. Makes a little room on leg stump. Waits for the tossed up delivery to arrive - which is a big deal on slow pitches - and carves it to the cover boundary
pulls the short ball out to deep midwicket
there's more evidence of how hard it is to hit out against a short of a length delivery. Williamson spots the length. He waits too. But when he finally pulls, he still gets an inside edge to long-on
backs away and gets a shortish slower ball to deal with. Williamson slaps it to point for a single

oooh, he's clipped a leg-stump half-volley straight to deep backward square leg. The intention is to get a couple of runs, but Williamson ends up timing the ball too well. Oh the irony. He's had to struggle to connect with the ball all innings, but persevered ever so well until now, only to get out to a shot he ends up hitting better than he even wanted to
goes across the line and targets the cow-corner boundary, but Russell, from long-on, cuts it off
fractionally short on off, moves back and pulls it to the right of mid-on
looped up and outside off, Williamson twinkles down the track, meets the pitch, and majestically lofts the ball over mid-on, who is inside the circle
darted in short on off, Williamson hangs back, expecting it. Whipped to deep midwicket
Williamson welcomes his opposite number with a four. Full and angled in on off and middle, clipped away serenely to the right of midwicket
too full and straight, placed to the right of the leg umpire and to the left of short fine leg
length ball outside off, Williamson plays at the last possible moment. Angling his bat and dinking it down to third man with ultra-soft hands
fractionally short and wide outside off, steps back and square-cuts away to deep point
very full on middle and leg, Williamson eases it through midwicket. Flicked away
full and angled in from over the wicket, worked gently to midwicket
slightly short and wide outside off, moves back and laces a cut straight to point
full and angled in on middle, worked to midwicket
full on off, clipped to mid-on. Williamson and de Grandhomme see off Mustafizur
full and angling away outside off, driven down to long-off
back of a length, picked off the pads to deep square leg on the back foot
full on off, opens the face and drives towards point
full on middle, Williamson backs away outside leg and drives it inside out over Kayes at deep extra cover. Skims over the boundary. Kayes like Sarkar was standing inside the boundary too
shortish and outside off, stylishly late-cut to third man
and Williamson takes advantage of it. Full around off, Williamson shuffles across and flicks it away fine of the diving short fine leg fielder
full and angling away outside off, driven on the front foot to long-off
full again, outside off, driven through extra cover now
rank half-tracker on middle. Williamson duly skips back and nails a pull over square leg. Brings up his fifty in style
full at at off stump, driven back to the bowler
shimmies out and works the ball towards midwicket

tossed up outside off, Williamson unleashes a slog-sweep in the air. Deep midwicket (Sarkar) is so far inside the boundary; at least 10 yards in. Could have been a regulation catch had he stayed near the edge of the boundary. He back-tracks, but the ball goes over him and plonks for a one-bounce four
slightly short and outside off, late-cut down to third man
near yorker on off, whipped to long-on
length ball outside off, stays in the crease and opens the face of his bat late to dab it down to third man
angling down leg, Williamson tries to tuck it away and gets an inside edge as the ball goes away to square leg
slid in with the arm from around the stumps, bunted down to long-on now
slightly short and outside off, moves back, cuts and finds point
Williamson steps away and down the track, driving this inside-out over extra cover for a double
low full-toss on off, whipped to the right of the leg umpire
clipped away through square leg. Sliding into the pads
good length and angled in on off, wristily flicked through square leg
slightly short and outside off, Williamson employs the latest of late cuts and sends the ball down to third man
pushed outside off, guided wide of short third man
tossed up on leg stump, goes low and paddles the ball very fine on the leg side
Williamson shimmies out, dug short and outside off, swatted away to deep midwicket
short of a length ball, angling away from leg and middle, blocked off the backfoot. And the bowler has overstepped. Free-hit coming up, no change in field allowed

tries to make room for himself and backs away a long way. Mustafizur fires it full and wide outside off. Williamson slashes and gets an outside edge as the ball flies away to the third man boundary. Falls over as he completes that shot as he had to really reach out for it
defended back to the bowler
flighted on off, played back to the bowler
flatter on middle, swept away to deep square leg. Firm hit. Williamson reaches 1000 runs in T20Is
played into the covers region
slower ball, Williamson completes the tuck to the leg side early and gets rapped on the pads. But it pitched outside leg so an optimistic appeal is turned down
near yorker-length ball on middle, Williamson makes room and jabs it to the covers
back of a length and on middle and leg, patted towards midwicket
Good length and on middle and leg, Williamson flits away outside leg and lofts it. Better connection as he sends it away to the cow-corner boundary

Impressive effort from AB. Good length and on middle, Williamson steps away outside leg and punts it or rather mis-hits it over the covers. AB runs back from mid-off, dives but can't quite pull off that stunning take
Morne errs too full and straight, Williamson twirls his wrists and picks it over midwicket with a flick
veering onto the pads, flicked through midwicket
pitched up and on off, Williamson transfers his weight forward and eases it to the right of mid-off. Sweet timing
dropped short and outside off, Williamson loads up for a hook and top-edges it over the cordon to third man, one-bounce four..
low full toss on off, bunted gently between the bowler and non-striker, beats mid-on to his left. AB runs across from mid-off and has it covered
swerving onto the pads, Williamson can't glance it away. Off the pad and wanders behind to Van Wyk
back of a length, top-of-off line, punched towards mid-on, where Morne fumbles and allows too
137ks, bumpy short ball, rises outside off. Williamson has a jittery waft at it and is beaten
sliding onto the pads, fine leg is up in the circle and Williamson dispatches it with a pretty flick over backward square leg

picks out the fielder. Big wicket. A short delivery on leg, sits up for Williamson. Doesn't go all into the pull or keep it down or find the gap. All he does is picks out the square leg fielder to perfection. An easy reverse-cupped catch
there is the boundary for the over. Back of a length down leg, Williamson nails his pull through backward square leg. Good shot selection
Williamson gets low for a scoop, misses. Parnell strays down leg and is punished. No way Williamson could have scored of that, good call
good length on leg, worked to square leg
swung away, on the bounce to deep square leg. Good length delivery on leg, Williamson doesn't time his swat
back of a length outside off, carved to third man from the crease
short of a length outside off, Williamson bails out of a pull because of the line. A cut would have been a safer option but played the next best shot with the position he was in
on the pads, Williamson misses a flick, struck on the thigh pad. A leg bye to square leg
back of a length delivery, sees Williamson coming. Strays down leg and Williamson misses a pull, but that was close enough to leg stump to be legal
shimmies down, and dabs one to third man from the crease. Well bowled.
on a length on off, Williamson blocks. Good lines
good length on off, inside-edged to square leg
shot! Full and wide from Morris, Williamson lets his hands go through with a drive. Races away through cover point. Sublime timing. Class right from the outset
back of a length outside off, Williamson comes down the pitch but can only stab a ball to cover
Rabada retorts with a 144.9ks lifter on off, Williamson seeks to turn to the leg side. Nearly spooned it back to the bowler off a leading edge
length ball just outside off, defended into the off side
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
banged in short, Williamson rolls his wrists on the pull. Controlled hit to deep midwicket
pulls pace of this one outside off. 114.7ks. Williamson looks to run it down to third man and is beaten
back of a length and on off, rolls his fingers across a cutter, which is manipulated past midwicket
beats mid-off to his right. Top timing and equally good placement. Pitched up and on off, Williamson punchily drives it away and presents a high elbow
back of a length and outside off at sheesh 147.6, punched towards wide mid-off
Williamson larrups it. Shortish and on off and middle, Williamson, having made room, smashes it over the bowler's head, beats mid-off to his right, tennis style. Flat-batted thump!
Rabada veers towards the leg stump again as Williamson picks it up and gives it marching orders over midwicket. Just sweet timing..
loads of extra bounce. 142.7ks, lifts outside off and curves away past the jittery waft
Rabada errs too full and straight, Williamson uses his wrists and glances it to the right of a diving long-leg fielder. Beating him to his right
length and holds its line outside off, Williamson forces a drive and finds wide mid-off
pitched up and comes in a touch as Williamson attempts a drive. He mis-hits it as the ball dribbles to mid-on
looped up on middle, Williamson blunts it onto the pitch
Phangiso tosses it up outside off, which is driven to mid-off
sliding onto the leg stump and raps him on the pad but this was slipping down leg

Phangison has his man now. Phangiso hangs it in the air, gets it to dip and turn after seeing Williamson dance down the track. He goes for a big swoosh and does not connect. Van Wyk does the rest. Phangiso strikes in his first over.. He does break the opening stand
back of a length and outside off, slapped to backward point, where the fielder, Phangiso, I guess, winces
Williamson rides the bounce of this shortish ball outside off as he dinks it to third man
Williamson makes room outside leg, this is fired full and outside off. Squeezed to backward point, where Rossouw makes a sprawling save. Smart work..
and again! Back of a length and comes in, picked up over backward square leg with the wrists
parcelled up and dispatched. Dragged short and outside off, no sting on it as Williamson ventures deep in the crease and slams a pull over midwicket
too full and straight now, Williamson brings his dexterous wrists into play again, clipping it between midwicket and mid-on. Third four of the over; New Zealand are off to a racy start..
length on off stump, tapped to mid-off and a single stolen
length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket's left
full on middle stump, steps out and pushes to long-on
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
overpitched on the pads, stays tall and plays late to get this flick fine
length on leg stump, rapped on the pad as he looks to flick

cleans him up with a full toss. Williamson shuffles across a long way and exposes all three stumps. Tries to sweep it away but Rubel angled that into leg-stump. He misses and Rubel hits as the ball crashes into leg-stump
very full ball, squeezed out to short third man

gets down to slog this ball and misses it altogether. The ball goes off the thigh guard and down to the third man boundary. It is pulled back before the boundary but the fielder's knee seems to have brushed the rope as he was pulling it back

dropped. Mashrafe the bowler again and this time it's Tamim the fielder at deep backward square leg. Williamson moved across the stumps and got down before whipping it uppishly and Tamim puts it down as he moves to his left
length ball, whipped away off the backfoot just wide of long-on. They think of the second but it goes to the fielder a tad wide and they decide against it
short of a length, whipped away with a half-angled bat from outside off to long-on
slashes hard outside off as he looks to cut this length ball away. No turn on that one as it goes straight on and he is beaten
full and on the pads, flicked to midwicket
fuller ball outside off, driven into covers
beats the outside edge with a fullish length ball that holds its line outside off. Good pace on that one, Williamson sticks his bat out and cannot make contact
fuller ball, angling in, dabs it to mid-on and takes off for a single
short of a length ball on the stumps, tucked off the pads wide of the midwicket region
short ball, wide outside off, cuts square of the wicket and beats the fielder diving at point
loopy fuller ball, sliding in with the arm, Williamson comes down the track and makes room for himself before carving it inside-out through extra cover
loopy delivery, spinning away around off, Williamson makes room and cuts but cannot find the gap at covers
short ball, Williamson tries to back away and slap it away through the off side but the ball gets big on him and he gets beaten
short of a length outside off, stays in the crease and opens the face of his bat before steering it to backward point
fuller and angling in on off at pace, stays leg side of it and drills it hard to covers
opens the face of his bat to this length ball and steers it down to third man
fires it outside off, defended to backward point
non-turning full ball on middle and leg, Soumya leans across and whips it, splitting midwicket and mid-on. Flowing whip
backs away, trying to go inside-out over the off-side and he ends up skewing it off the inside part of the bat as the ball goes in the air to long-on where Tamim settles under it
short of a length ball, loopy and drifting in, Williamson backs away and tries to carve it through the off side but it is a very packed field there and he cannot find the gap
leans forward and pushes it back to the bowler
short of a length ball, turned away off the backfoot into the leg side
comes forward and caresses it to mid-off
good length ball, punches uppishly past the right of the bowler off the backfoot and the ball races away to the long-on boundary
loopy fuller ball, sliding in with the arm, swept away to deep backward square leg
shuffles across and blocks into the off side
comes down the track to meet this length ball and pushes it with a straight bat to covers where the fielder makes a diving save
fires a low full toss that slides in quickly, pushed back to the bowler
slower length ball on the stumps, Williamson backs away and flat-bats it to long-on

comes down the track and drills this fuller ball between deep midwicket and long-on. The deep midwicket fielder runs across and Williamson puts pressure on him again but he fields it cleanly this time
gets down for a slog sweep and cannot make contact
low full toss outside off, Williamson moves across and whips it away to deep midwicket where the fielder fumbles as he picks it up and they steal the second

dropped. By Shakib Al Hasan at deep midwicket. Tries to slog a fuller ball and gets it off the splice. Does not middle it too well and skews it to the fielder and shakib spills a rather straightforward chance

good length ball, angling in, tries to get leg side of it and dispatch it over the leg side but wears it on the ribs instead and the ball rolls away to the fine leg fence. The fielder gives it a chase but the ball beats him
fuller ball, slog-swept to deep backward square leg

moves across early and Taskin drags the length back. Williamson tries to make a late adjustment and makes an awkward attempt at a pull shot. He is in no position to play that shot and falls over as he completes the bat swing
fuller ball outside off, jams the bat down but cannot make contact as he tries to squeeze it out

tries to do the same thing again and does not quite get hold of it this time. Cannot get the required elevation but he finds the gap as the ball goes on the bounce through the deep square leg boundary. Got it slightly off the inside part of the bat

moves across the stumps early before slogging this fuller ball over deep backward square leg. Uses the pace and his wrists to loft that clean. That's on the roof. It's a monster hit. That was 103 metres. Biggest hit in the series so far
has a swing at this short of a length ball outside off but the ball does not bounce as much as he would have liked and he gets beaten on the cut
fuller ball outside off, drills it with a half-angled bat to deep backward point
short ball, fetches the pull and gives it all his power as the ball screams away wide of the deep midwicket boundary
fuller ball, flicks it out to deep midwicket
backs away and sends this crashing through mid-off, beats the fielder running to his right
walks across the stumps and slogs and the ball goes off the inside edge to backward square leg who dives to make the stop
moves across the stumps and slogs this full toss off the inside part of the bat to deep midwicket
comes down the track and drags the ball to the bowler who gets his right hand to it and deflects it away to long-on
comes down the track and works this full toss wide of long-on who this time makes a slight fumble as the batsmen put pressure on him and they end up taking two
tossed up and pitched up on the stumps. Williamson slogs it between long-on and deep midwicket
comes down the track and pushes this full ball straight back to the bowler
fuller outside off, squeezed out to covers for a quick single
wide outside off. Williamson was shaping up for a big shot through the off-side but lets it go upon seeing the width. He was expecting a wide call but it is not to be so
backs away to make room and drills it with an angled bat to long-on
comes down the track and pushes it just wide of long-on. They run hard and look for the second but the fielder is equal to the task
worked away between long-on and deep midwicket. They think of the second but the fielder at deep midwicket is on to it in a flash
tucked off the backfoot to midwicket
backs away and chops the ball to the right of point
shorter and quicker, KW looks to pull it across the line but gets an under edge to short fine leg
pulls through square leg
full on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, slower ball this time and KW is deceived. Tries to defend it towards cover but inside edge hits his body instead
full on leg stump, flicked off his hips past short fine leg. The fielder's giving it a chase, but there's no way he can catch up
back of a length on middle and leg, stands tall and defends back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, punched off the back foot to mid off. Came down the wicket on this occasion
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to cover. Can't pierce the infield
back of a length on leg stump, tries to pull but can't make the contact. Hits his body instead

good length on middle and off, tapped to point for a quick run but it's a dangerous run! Direct hit and Williamson was gone, but the throw goes just over the top of the stumps. Amir could've been quicker to get back to the stumps, though
innovative, but doesn't pay off! Good length on leg stump, tries to walk across and lap it over the keeper with the ramp shot, but can't pull it off
back of a length outside off, pulled off the back foot to deep midwicket
slower ball full outside leg stump, deceives KW. Misses the front-foot defense
excellent yorker on off stump, opens the bat's face and runs it down to third man. No other option for the batsmen

strikes first ball! Good length and wide outside off, and it's been cut really hard. But, oh no, straight to Babar at cover. There's the first wicket! Quite a stinger that Babar took, but he managed to hold on to that. Taken from in front of his face
back of a length, Williamson hops into line and nudges one through square leg
goes full and straight, worked off the toes through midwicket for one to get going
teases him outside off as he gives this a little bit more air. Williamson strides out to drive through the covers and is beaten
back of a length and outside off, he stands up tall and thumps to cover
skips down the track and punches it back to the bowler. Shortened the length as he saw the batsman advancing, but that didn't hurt Williamson's timing. Just his placement
slower, good length ball just outside off, dabbed towards point
carted it over wide long-on. Another attempted slower ball, but Williamson has picked it, waited for it and smoked it over the infield
fullish on off stump, nudged wide of mid-on
full on middle stump, flicked off his toes to midwicket. No run

Steyn, to nobody's surprise, gets the breakthrough, this was pulled towards midwicket by Williamson, Ab de Villiers throws himself to his right in the deep to take a low catch, Steyn's made an impact but is it too late? end of a top innings from Williamson
short of length ball outside off, 146kph, Williamson beaten outside off
flighted full ball, is driven to mid-on for a single
Williamson walks away from leg  to make room, Morkel follows him but Williamson can't still free his arms, launches this over cover, a one-handed shot that
tapped away for a single
Williamson walks across the stumps this time, don't think he's played too many from a conventional position, looks to scoop that towards fine leg, no contact
this time he backs away from leg, a shortish ball outside off, Williamson connects well enough to send that over cover for four more, not a powerful hit
lovely from Williamson, he moves a touch towards off, gets on his knee and whips that down to fine leg
Duminy drops it a bit short, scythe towards sweeper cover
down the leg side, clipped towards square leg for a single
on middle and leg, Williamson moves away to make room, slams this past point for another boundary
defended to the leg side
length ball is eased towards extra cover for a single
nice tight line on middle, Williamson is on the back foot and tucks it away to midwicket
slow wide full ball, steered down to third man
dropped. pushed back towards Tahir by Williamson, came at shoulder height for Tahir, not at too much pace, Tahir gets both hands to it, should have taken it
drops it short again, helped to midwicket
full and well wide of off stump, the batsman can barely get bat on that, still gets it over the bowler's head for a single
length ball well outside off, Williamson has moved across a long way, guides it behind backward point
short again from Tahir, pushed towards wide mid-on
full toss from Tahir now, he's bowling it everywhere, this is put away beyond the midwicket boundary by Williamson
full ball is driven towards long-on for a single
spinning away after pitching on off, guided towards backward point for a single
fifty for Williamson, taps the ball towards backward point for a single, gets a handshake from Ross Taylor, no fist bumps for these guys
length ball is defended back towards Morkel, 2-0-36-0
loopy one, outside off on a length, Williamson is struck on the pads by that googly
cramps up the batsman by following him as Williamson moved away from leg
offcutter on middle, Williamson races down the track and slices to point
use of the feet again and he peppers the straight boundary. Beats a leaping Bukhari and the long-on fielder as well
back of a length on middle, turned through midwicket

Superb, sharp work from Rizwan. Low full toss, which is flicked to short midwicket. Munro drifts out in search of a single. Rizwan's release was lightning quick from a side-on, low position. He nails the stumps down with a rocket over-arm throw. Rizwan had only one stump to aim at. He sets off on a celebratory run, leaps, and takes a high-five from Anwar
back of a length on middle and leg, knocked solidly down the ground
skiddy ball on middle, clipped to square leg
hint of turn outside off, dabbed behind square on off
KW steps out, Afridi hurls it at 96ks, quietly played back
full on off, flicked towards cow corner for a couple. Lovely running
this is no serene dab to third man. Shorter and outside off, KW shuffles outside leg and slashes it down to third man
pitched further up on a fourth-stump line, defended
full and straight, KW whirls his wrists and flicks it away. Wahab was lazy, late to dive to his right at mid-on. KW gets his first four. Guptill already has five fours and two sixes
length ball on off, blocked to cover
full on the stumps, tapped back to the bowler
Amir hurls another full toss, 146ks, pushed down to deepish mid-off
full toss, angled away. KW shapes to drive, but can't lay bat on it. That should have been put away
slides on off, driven smoothly to long-off
drifts in full, pushed to mid-on for a single. Good urgency from NZ
back of a length, hint of away swing, as KW shuffles across and steers it to third man again
full and keeps going away with the angle outside off, guided late down to third man
back of a length and angling away from over the wicket, tapped to point
length and outside off, KW has that extra second to play the shot late. Dabbed down to third man with soft hands
bowled wide outside leg, Williamson reaches for it and sweeps, hits it straight to short fine leg through
nudged to point
the batsman steps out, Afridi shortens his length, and pings the thigh pad
googly, turns in, kept out
tickled to short fine leg
lovely placement from Williamson. The bowler strays on his pads and he picks him away square of short fine leg. Neat little tuck fetches the second boundary of the over
slower ball fosters the outside edge as Williamson was stuck in his crease. Scurries away to the third man boundary, but the bowler takes points on that
skips down the track to push to mid-off, who misfields. Ben Cooper, after a horrid little innings, fumbles a straight forward chance to prevent the couple
fullish and wide outside off, Williamson cuts to point and the butter fingers bug has infected him as well
fullish and outside off, dabbed behind to third man
keeps it nice and tight on middle and off, turned away towards midwicket
floats it up outside off and he's drilled it down to long-off
short and flat on middle as he backs away and thumps through extra cover. Long-off was running around to pull it back, but his dive ends up useless. Ben Cooper is the man again, today is not his day
slows it up and tosses it up just outside off, Williamson was hanging back and dabs towards backward point
slices this away to the sweeper in the deep
back of a length on leg stump, worked off his hips into the midwicket region. Soft hands allows the single
his flight and dip dupes Williamson again! Chasing down the track to smite it over extra, but ends up inside edging towards midwicket

Williamson holes out to Malik at long-on! Full and outside off, slants away with the angle, KW shuffles across for the lofted hit. The bat twisted in his hands as he skews it off the lower part of the part
short and outside off, KW pulls and may have got a bottom-edge behind to the left of Sarfraz
tossed up on middle, KW stretches forward and slog-sweeps over midwicket. Clean strike
darted flat and fizzes off the surface to beat the batsman
KW dances out, Afridi held this back. This sticks in the pitch and foils the attempted lofted hit. Chipped to where mid-off may have been
back of a length and outside off, slapped straight to backward point
128ks cross-seam leg-breakish slower ball outside off, KW reaches forward, extends his hands, and lifts it over the covers
KW moved away outside leg, this is dragged short and outside off. Chopped to cover
juicy full toss, KW does not miss out this time. He whips it away to the midwicket boundary
straying onto the pads, KW misses the flick

the ump takes his time and then nods. Slower ball fetches the outside edge and Williamson walks back. Sees a bit of width and looks to steer it down to third man, but the change in pace has done him over
pulls the shortish delivery on off stump through midwicket
full and straight, timed on the drive but finds mid-on
brilliant from Steyn to close out his first over, Williamson wanted to steer that towards third man but doesn't get bat on ball, it was pretty close to off stump as well
steps to leg and drives hard into the off side and it goes straight through point, a complete miss from Chris Jordan at point, awful fielding, ruins a good first over
off stump line, forward and guided down to third man
good length on off stump, Williamson forward to block it carefully
similar delivery, this time Williamson opens the face and guides it down to third man
length ball, Williamson went to tuck it to leg and got struck on the pad
steps to leg and slaps a length ball past extra cover, lovely stroke, created the room to swing his arms and timed it very well
four more, this is too wide and Williamson cuts hard past point, poor ball
fuller length, pushed through midwicket and they get back for a couple
good length on the stumps, blocked in the crease
touch fuller, worked to square leg
slower ball, a low full toss, just blocked
length and touched through square leg for an easy couple
length delivery just outside off, punched firmly to cover
