full on the stumps and flicked out wide of midwicket, poor loosener
forward just outside off, blocked to point
short, lifting ball, angled in. He manages to glove a single in front of midwicket
tighter line, this is clipped out to deep square this time
length ball wide of off stump, this is cut out wide of deep cover
back of a length around off, Williamson stays leg side of this and dabs down to third man
length ball around off stump, Williamson whips this out through square leg
a very very late cut out of Bairstow's gloves, short third man does really well diving to his left to save four
more off stump line, blocked into point
down the track and clipped with the turn through square leg for a single

chipped back to Imad. Williamson looked to nudge this into the leg side, but this ball dipped and spun to take the leading edge. Imad was slightly distracted by the non-striker but he got out of the way to make this an easy catch. Imad is pumped, this could be a big moment in the match. Is that the moment for Pakistan?
fuller on middle, Williamson hangs back and defends it back

risky second run, and Taylor's already walking off the field. Great work from Pakistan again. At the start of this sequence, it seems like Williamson has done well with his flick, playing it softly enough to take the extra run. But Asif Ali sprints from the boundary, picks the ball up and flings a hard and flat throw right next to the stumps at the bowler's end. Shadab does the rest and Pakistan are now properly belting out their age-old UAE tunes. Squeeeeeeeeeze through spin.

gorgeous strike! Strides forward - getting to the pitch of the ball and launches it over extra cover, looking graceful as ever. This shot - extending the defence and picking that gap to the left of mid-off - has added so much to Williamson's T20 game
hammers the short and wide delivery to the sweeper
cuts to the sweeper
backs away and cuts the flatter delivery off the stumps to the sweeper
whips the full delivery on middle to the left of deep midwicket
premeditates a sweep, taking a length ball from outside off and sending it to square leg
a bit of turn as he holds the length back - only slightly though - which is why Williamson is forward with an open-faced block
reaches out and drives to cover as Shadab bowls slow and teases the batsman forward
tosses it up on middle, Williamson gets forward to block
reaches out to a low full toss well outside off and drags this down to long-on
chopped from the stumps towards sweeper cover
Shadab holds this back, KW adjusts to the slow turn and jabs the ball back to the bowler
drops a legbreak short and outside off, pulled to wide long-on for a couple of runs
darted short and outside off, chopped back to the bowler off the inside half
floated up on middle, blocked away to the leg side
full and spins away outside off, eased to sweeper
full on middle, presses forward and laces a single down to long-off
back of a length and turns away outside off, punched to sweeper
picked off the pads through midwicket
looped up outside off, Williamson dances out and chips it with the break over midwicket. You don't need these muscular slogs in T20s, just need to clear the infield
back of a length and spins in a bit, punched with the break down to long-on
short and turns away outside off, leans back and cuts firmly to sweeper cover
well executed by Williamson, he moves well across and paddles that ball from way outside off past short fine leg for four
back in the crease pushing this through midwicket and Williamson brings up fifty, written that a few times this tour too, 31 balls
back on off stump, this is calmly blocked back to the bowler
fullish, outside off, bunted into the covers coming forwards

back-of-the-hand slower ball and Williamson watches it on to the bat, chips over mid-off with that easy grace we're accustomed to seeing, it teases Morgan all the way and reaches the rope moments before the diving fielder
that's a decent nut, seams away from Williamson off a length as he hung the bat out
full on the stumps, leans into a clip down the ground to long-on
good length in the corridor, goes back and glides one down to third man
good length on middle and leg, flicked off his hips to midwicket and it's been lobbed to the fielder! Diving catch, jumping across to his right, and it's a superb take from Haris. KW falls cheaply
rolls his fingers over the ball, this was drifting towards leg stump and all Williamson had to do was help it on its way past short fine leg
short on the stumps and flicked away through square leg
pushed through outside off, Williamson goes back and dabs towards short third man... a direct hit would have had Taylor struggling
floated up and flicked through midwicket into an open space
flat legbreak on off stump, it's actually a bit short and Williamson slaps four more in front of square
tossed up - maybe the offbreak to start with? - Williamson dances forward and slices through the covers, shouts of "catch!" but it was into a gap
length outside off, Williamson waits and dabs to third man with soft hands
dragged down on leg stump and Williamson whips a pull behind square, Rashid does really well to stop it diving to his left on the edge of the circle, prevents four
good length, pushed across the right-hander, driven square off the back foot for a couple
keeps it around leg stump, pitching outside and strikes the pad, a muted lbw appeal
backs away and drives this inside-out towards extra cover
Williamson going for a big drive through cover, a thick bottom edge and the ball bounces through to the keeper
a poor ball to end the over, a full toss down the leg side, swatted away behind square leg for four
slugs this towards midwicket for one more
short of length ball is guided down to third man, should have been a single, but a fumble from Steyn allows a second
length in the channel, drops into the crease and runs one to third man
tossed up outside off, straightening a touch and cut through backward point
short and a touch wide, cut behind backward point - who actually moved forward in anticipation - and Billings can't reel it in despite a terrific dive on the boundary
pushed through outside off, can't get this cut through
forces this through the line to cover, no timing. This one was toe-ended as well.
driven down to long-off for an easy single
worked into the gap towards the man coming in from deep midwicket, the call was for two originally.
a misfield at cover by Babar gives New Zealand and Williamson a single.
short, spinning in, pulled to deep midwicket
pulls a short one with the spin to square leg. Can't middle it because of the sharp turn
short, spinning away, cut to the left of sweeper cover
pushes a fuller one back to the bowler
fullish, spinning in, pushed back and Hafeez dives to his right to stop it
flicks against the line, from outside off towards mid-on
back of a length at the body, this is steered away backward of square, four more
spins in from a length, punched past a diving cover, much to the dismay of Sarfraz
length, spins in, tucked to deep midwicket
short of length and spinning away, cut to sweeper cover
good length around off, blocked
fuller length on a similar line and this is driven away up and over backward point, well timed away from third man
cutter wide of off stump, inside the guideline, Williamson misses with a cut
full and a gorgeous drive races past mid-off, perfect timing and placement on that
length ball at the off stump, this is defended back to the bowler
dragged down but Williamson falls over pulling it and only finds deep square
tight line, 85mph on off stump, KW plays it late through third man for one
drops short, on the stumps, Williamson nearly falls over heaving a pull through midwicket
full outside off, clipped to midwicket
Williamson brings up the fifty with another wristy hit. Veering onto the pads, picked up and over backward square leg for a flattish six
length ball angling into off stump, defended off the back foot, back to the bowler
gets forward on middle and, not without a hint of risk, wristily whips it through square leg
goes back and plays it down towards mid-on
they almost had Kane there, he pulled on the front foot and sliced it high towards midwicket where Botha was late in spotting it and dived forward to collect it on the bounce
punches off the front foot to long-on to bring up the 100 for New Zealand
rocks back and pulls a short ball outside off out to cow corner where he bisects the fielders in the deep
fuller outside off and he works it back to the bowler with a wristy flick
comes down the track and launches it towards cow corner where it bounces millimetres short of the rope, South Africa slipping now
full on middle and worked away through midwicket
gets forward and chips in the air to long-on
short and pulled away into the leg side
plays into the covers
goes back and punches to mid-on

dropped down at his feet from a short length, rolls behind the stumps where AB quickly throws the stumps down with Kane stretching back after stepping out to think of a run, there is a frame in it but he seems to be safe by a very small margin
skied high in the air beyond the edge of the circle at mid-off and Tsotsobe running back can't get a hand to it
misses the pull and hits the protective equipment, drops on the pitch and Guptill runs through and puts in a full-length dive to get home
backs away and uppercuts a short ball outside off over the ring to the backward point boundary

poor call by Kane there, flicked straight to short midwicket and he sets off, Albie Morkel charges in and picks up before swivelling and throwing down the stumps at the bowler's end with Kane having already given up
gets down on his knees to paddle sweep a ball from outside off to fine leg
full toss outside off, Kane completely mistimes whatever stroke he was attempting and skews it towards long-on
Kane opens up to a full ball on off and smears it away to deep midwicket
tucks his first ball off the pads through square leg

timber! Tossed up by Agar, gets him trying to come down the ground, nowhere near the pitch and an ugly swipe leaves Williamson stranded, the ball thudding into off stump! Nicely bowled, this wasn't a dart - gave it some air and duped the batsman
floated up full and Williamson works it into the gap this time, Warner has to run across from long-on and they hustle back for two
lobbed up from round the wicket, nurdled towards wide long-on, just a single there
length ball, lets it come on and opens the face of his bat to run it down to third man for a single
similar. Flat and full on middle and leg, Williamson quietly pushes it out off the front foot
flat and full, sliding on middle and leg, pushed down the pitch to the bowler
flighted, gets him reaching for it, squired through cover point on the drive
floated up on off, Williamson punches down the ground
fired in flat and Williamson just pokes it to extra cover
varies his line as Williamson looks to come down, pushed into the pads and defended back down the track
flighted, prodded into the off side
flighted, around off stump, can't get this away
floats up the googly and Williamson plays with the turn through midwicket
slower ball outside off and Kane bottom-edges the pull back to the bowler
flat on the stumps and worked through midwicket
pushed through and Williamson can only tap to extra cover
shouts of "catch!" as Williamson comes down and gets a leading edge, safely through mid-off for one down the ground
pushed through, dabbed towards short third man and they steal one, to Rashid's irritation

bowled 'im! Dawson punches the air, Williamson missed and the ball hit middle and leg! He was attempting to make some room, cramped by Dawson's line and it dipped under his flailing swipe, rattled the timbers
comes across and pokes into the covers
attempted yorker, 146kph and squirming past the pads, nearly had Williamson off his feet - a touch leg side, though, a called wide
short of a length, slapped through cover point, that'll get him going... NZ raise 50 in the fifth over
full in the channel, 142kph and Williamson leans into a classy-looking cover drive, picks out the fielder
full, fourth-stump line, driven to cover on the bounce
dabbed into the covers, the throw to the non-striker's end flies away, but there's a man backing up eventually
short, 125kph and Williamson whirls on a pull, gets it past the dive of midwicket
drops a little short and Williamson rocks back to pull, just one towards wide long-on
drives down to long-on
goes back and punches to a fielder in the circle on the off side
worked off the pads through square leg

punched straight to mid-off and Kane sets off, the throw hits direct and Kane looks to be struggling but replays show he has done amazingly well to run around the bowler and beat the throw by one frame, good fielding from Zimbabwe goes unrewarded
played to midwicket
nicely strikes the short ball outside off through backward point, the fielders fumble on the rope several times to allow the Kiwis a third
goes back and pulls out to deep square
comes down and tries to sing to leg but is hit on the back pad
comes down again and inside edges a ball fired into the pads past the keeper

oh no Zimbabwe's fielding still not standing up to scrutiny, Kane pulled off the back foot out to cow corner and under pressure to fire in the throw quickly, the fielder lets it go staight through his legs
goes back and cuts into the deep on the off-side
goes back and punches to cover
waits for the short ball outside off to turn away and cuts through backward point
gets this outside off and swinging away, Kane decides to leave it, we've seen more of those today than would have been expected
eases an on-drive straight down the ground
outside off and he pushes out at it and plays into the point area
nicely crunched pull from Kane to a short ball outside off, sends it packing to the midwicket fence
punched off the back foot gracefully and it beats mid-off who chases after it in vain and ends up escorting it to the fence
short and slow outside off and pulls with all his might to long-on

short ball on middle and leg and pulled backward of square, looks to be heading for four but Chigumbura puts in a committed dive on the rope to save the boundary, Zimbabwe's fielding has improved tonight, although not as much as required
tucked off the pads towards midwicket
goes back and punches to the right of mid-on who dives to cut it off
played into the off side
short ball is sent sailing way down leg, the wides inch towards double-figures
full on the pads and worked to long-on to bring up the 100 partnership, these two have steadied New Zealand with poise after Nicol and Brendon McCullum departed early on with negligible impact
walks across and exposes the stumps to pull it over the head of backward square leg
gets forward and placed into the covers
short of a length on off, punched back
swings into the pads and Kane plays it wide of mid-on for his first T20I run, as he wasn't required to bat in his debut T20I in Harare
that is too wide outside off and Kane's swing and miss is of little consequence as his team earns an extra run
misses the pull on leg, hit on the thigh pad, the batsmen race through as bowler and nearby fielder converge
bangs in a bouncer on leg, Kane quickly gets under it but he is wided for height
this is full outside off and Kane slapped it flat towards long-on who ran in to try and take the catch but ended up fielding it awkwardly on the bounce
waist high full toss outside off is slugged to deep midwicket
fantastic stroke from Kane, gets down on one knee and slog sweeps a full ball on off with nonchalance into the stands at square leg
Kane goes all Vettori on Morne, walks miles outside off stump and flicks a full ball following him through fine leg with pinpoint placement
half-volley outside off is driven firmly to the left of cover who partially stops it, but that can't stop the batsmen from sneaking a second
full toss outside off is smacked to the right of mid-off who slides and parries it towards long-on running in as the scoring is limited to a single
Kane slaps a full ball away out to deep midwicket
this is fired in down leg to follow Kane, who is hit on the pad trying to sweep, they scamper a leg bye but that is the end of an excellent over from Parnell at the death
fired into middle and off as it tails back in, squeezed out into the leg side
defends to midwicket
swings a ball from outside off straight to midwicket on the edge and Kane barely gets home
this is full outside off, Kane tries to swing to leg and misses, they manage to rush through for a bye
goes back and Kane heaves his first ball to leg
Kane drives a full ball outside off into the deep on the off side
full toss on middle is worked to long-on
gets forward and plays back to the bowler
leans forward and works it to deep midwicket
Kane works a short ball on off into the leg side off the back foot
tucked into the deep on the leg side
this is short again but down leg and Kane raises his bat high to let it go and take th extra run and ball on offer
and zips a short ball outside off past Kane's attempted defensive shot

and all of a sudden Kane completely misjudges the short ball on middle, it got way too big on him and he skied it high up to midwicket in close, Albie Morkel, who held on to give his brother the wicket
New Zealand finally connect with one, Kane swings a full ball on off over his favourite boundary at square leg, not well timed but it didn't need to be with the short boundary
short, wide, slapped hard off the backfoot and Pandya makes a sharp save at covers
short of good length, comes into Williamson who closes the face of his bat and chips it over the midwicket region
very full, angling in on middle and leg, nearly a yorker, squeezed out through midwicket
dragged down short, he pulls, in the air for a while but goes one bounce to Hales at deep square
that's a drag down but only costs a single as Williamson pulls to deep midwicket
full outside off, driven to mid-off
good length outside off, 137kph, angled down to third man
comes down the pitch, Plunkett drags the length back, heaved out to deep midwicket
full outside off, drives down the ground...signs it's becoming harder to time the ball
full outside off, works it behind square on the leg side with a bottom-handed flick...a touch of uncertainty in the running
short of a length outside off, he'll feel he missed out as the square drive finds point
a slower ball outside off, driven firmly into the covers where the fielder dives over the ball - the sub, Curran - and it beats the sweeper
another slower one outside off, not much timing as he drives into the covers but that lack of pace on the ball actually helps him get back for a second
goes short this time and it costs him, Williamson sets a firm base and pulls behind square
flicked off the stumps down to long-on
back outside off stump, full, steered into the covers...New Zealand skipping along again
full at off stump, slog sweeps to deep midwicket
gets the yorker in at off stump, jabbed out
moves around the crease, Jordan fires it full outside off, Williamson connects sweetly with his drive and cover does well to cut it off
gets across the crease and attempts a scoop at a very full delivery outside off, gets it along the ground to short fine leg
that's gone wrong, drags down a slower short ball and it slips way down the leg side
back of a length, a mighty swing across the line and doesn't make contact
gives himself room to the leg side then drives a full delivery to mid-off
and that's a big full toss, he does very well to shovel it away behind square...and gets it well enough for six!
short, wide outside off, slashes and misses but gets the wide call
gets the yorker in at the end, and it's a dot ball
dropped, but a tough one! Drilled straight down the pitch, Rashid sticks out his right hand and can't cling on
uses his feet, makes it into a full toss, drives to long-off
tucked through the leg side
gets this through the off side, it's chased hard and flicked back...but was it before touching the rope? No, hand touching ball and rope together. Good effort, though, by Willey
touch more width, he comes forward and drives between cover and mid-off

huge wicket! Tye strikes second ball. Short of a length at off stump, Williamson looking to work into the leg side, closes the face and the ball takes a leading edge. Loops over cover, Warner turns and takes it comfortably over his shoulder
short of a length at off stump, flicked to midwicket
can't get to the pitch as he uses his feet so resorts to nudging to the deep leg-side field
full, outside off, driven to cover
round the wicket, pushed into the pads, flicked to deep square leg
short of a length outside off, dropped square to the off side with soft hands and that's a good run
through the slips again, although Williamson was in control of this...a slower ball, short of a length, steered wide of the keeper but third man can get across
short of a length, a bottom-handed flick to the leg side
gets this one away, but just for a single, flicked from outside off behind square on the leg side
a touch fuller, angles back and takes an inside edge...lining up the dot balls to Williamson
and another dot to the captain, short of a length outside off, played to the leg side
back of a length outside off, uses his wrists and whips it towards mid-on
back of a length outside off, 149kph, defended to backward point
short of a length outside off, opens the face a touch and finds point
more seam movement, jags back at Williamson from back of a length and takes him near a very delicate area
full and straight, 138kph, clipped to midwicket
that's a good one! Back of a length outside off, angles back, beats the inside edge...extra bounce
pushed down the leg side, another wide, Richardson hasn't settled yet
outside off this time, on a good length, defended on the front foot to cover
a touch fuller, Williamson gets himself forward and pushes to the left of mid-off
good length outside off, 145kph, defended to backward point
another top delivery! Full outside off, shapes away from Williamson who is feeling for it away from his body

out with hit! Williamson pushes a full ball to the on-side, sets off for a single, Wood springs across from his followthrough, collects and is only a few yards from the stumps with three to aim at...but misses!
full outside off, defended towards point
excellent stuff, short of a length again at off stump, Williamson tries to work it to the leg side but can only push it back towards the bowler...six dots after the wide
moves way outside off again and drives towards cover who throws and would have put Kane under pressure if he had hit
no hat-trick as KW works a short-of-a-length ball into the leg side
short outside off, pulled to deep square
four more. This is touch batting, not power. Full and wide outside off, Williamson knows exactly which is his boundary option and executes, gets underneath the delivery and lifts the ball over cover
keeps a touch low, short around off, pulled down to fine leg for one
lovely batting. Short around off, sits up for Williamson to stay low and lay into a pull. Picks the gap perfectly at deep midwicket
quick and straight, flicked to deep midwicket
short around off, punched to long-on

terrible throw from Rohit. Had so much more time that he thought. Full around off, driven to cover. Hesitation between Williamson and Munro. Munro finally decides to go, it's too late. Rohit side-arms a throw very wide of the keeper. Dhoni dives to his right and tries to palm it back towards the stumps. Unsuccessful
flight around off, driven back

not out says the umpire. But Kohli reviews right away. Flight around middle and off, Williamson misses a paddle sweep, the ball lobs off the arm and into Dhoni's hands. Is there a nick as the ball passes bat? It definitely hit the arm, but there seems to be a tiny tiny spike on UltraEdge. No, thinks the third umpire. Guess there was too much doubt. But why did the umpires not check for the lbw if there was no edge? If there was no bat, then surely they should have checked for lbw?

edged and taken. Short and wide, just gets a bit of extra bounce that results in Williamson getting the outside edge as he slashes hard. Brilliant seam position on that delivery which enabled him to generate that extra bounce. Simple catch for MS Dhoni. New Zealand plunge further
driven straight to Chahal again who this time is on to it in a flash and has a shy at the stumps. They take off for the single and make it as Chahal's throw doesn't hit anything
short of a length, backs away and cuts to extra cover where Chahal lets one go through his legs. But sweeper tidies up

Siraj's maiden international wicket, that of Williamson, he'll take that. Full down leg, a poor ball I must say. Williamson flicks uppishly towards square leg, but doesn't get enough power behind that, Rohit runs to his left, and takes a reverse-cupped catch by his shoulder. A stronger player and that would have been six.
backs away to this short of a length ball, not much turn, flays it through backward point

in the aiiiir and put down. Kohli puts down a tough chance. Would have been a blinder had he got it. Pedals back slightly and leaps up to get his right hand to it but the ball slips past him. Nehra has to further wait for a wicket in his final game
short ball, too short, that's a poor delivery. Williamson swivel-pulls and swats it away behind square. Axar runs across and dives to his right but can't get his hands to the pull
short of a length on off, gets on top of the bounce and punches down to long-on
fullish slider on middle, pushed out to covers for a quick single
back of a length, not much turn again outside off, cuts to sweeper cover for one
non-turning back of a length ball on off, makes some room and punches through the covers
back of a length, cut late to point
length, outside off, opens the face for a single to third man
charges down the ground and is forced to make a late adjustment by opening the face of his bat for a single down to third man
shot! That's a fine piece of timing. Walks across towards off and gets down on one knee before scooping it very fine. Carries all the way
short of good length, punched off the backfoot to covers
goes straight down the ground, all the way! A lovely strike through a good-length delivery. The captain has found his touch
full outside off, Williamson chips it to long-off running in! Completely mistimed, think it was a slower ball again from Richardson, floated up and plopped down the ground, Tye taking it well
a slower cutter outside off, dabbed down towards third man for one. Good from Williamson, he won't play too many dots
gets right across the crease and plays a sweep, gets a bottom edge which saves him from lbw
that's big over deep midwicket! A length ball outside off, fetches it high and handsome over the leg side...half-century for the captain. That's a decent response
into the crowd again! Poor line from Wood, a full toss angled into the pads, a free swing from Williamson sends it way over fine leg
that's better from Wood, hits back of a length at 141kph and beats the outside edge

full outside off, clubbed through the leg side...has it found the gap? Long-on, Vince, gets around to flick it back but can the second man keep it inside the boundary...Billings just does it. Good work
what a shot! That's a gem from Williamson. A thunderous bottom-handed whip to a very full ball outside off, sends it whistling between deep midwicket and long-on. Quite an innings from the skipper
round the wicket, full and straight, driven sweetly through the covers and more good work on the boundary, Malan this time
full toss, heaved through midwicket, not timed as sweetly
tries to sweep a low full toss, finds short fine leg
a yorker outside off, he plays over the top of it
gets well across the crease and tries to work a delivery which is almost passing by the wide-line marker through the leg side
slower ball again, dabbed square for one
full, wide, driven out to deep cover off the bottom of the bat
another excellent yorker outside off, Williamson can't make contact...Buttler cops a painful one
played on! Jordan deserved that for this over. Full outside off, Williamson walking across his crease, tries to work to the leg side, misses, the ball takes the pad into the off stump

a direct hit from Pandya and Williamson is gone. Lots of flight, Williamson comes down, can't quite muscle a heave over the infield. Hits it to Pandya at midwicket, who picks up and hits the stumps down at the bowler's end. Williamson had given up.
full delivery on off, very quick, driven to long-off. Wants two, won't get it Williamson
good length outside off, slapped to long-off for one
good length around off and middle, Williamson swats the ball over square leg, he races back for two, but he is one short, Williamson in a hurry to go back doesn't complete the run
Williamson gets lucky, was struggling there, full outside off, driven back to Chahal who parries it away to long-on. Pandya hunts it down to prevent two
another short delivery outside off, keeps low too, under-edged into the pads. No timing
short and wide outside off, carved away towards deep point for a couple. Would have been wide had he left it.
darted in, short outside off, Williamson under-edges this towards slip
another slower delivery outside off, Williamson dabs it away towards short third man for one.
that's very wide outside off, barely lands on the pitch

Rabada breaks the opening stand. On a length and around off, Williamson aimed to launch it over the covers; he went too hard at it. Williamson ends up slices it to deep third man, where Abbott runs to his right and snaps it up
pulled through deep midwicket
full toss is played straight to cover
more good fielding from Smith in the deep running round at backward point, fires a throw towards the bowler's end and stops the batsmen from going for a second
full outside off and Williamson waiting in the crease bottom-edges it behind the stumps to the right of Ramdin, allowing them to sneak a single
worked away to deep midwicket
gets forward and driven into the covers
rocks back and cuts it behind backward point, slows up near the rope and is dragged back
full outside off and Williamson waits but bottom-edges the cut
comes down the track and gives a bit of room to drive handsomely through extra cover but only for a single
Sammy gets Williamson with a full toss, he timed it nicely and looked to have got it over Sammy's head but Sammy plucked it out of the air with both hands
backs away and drives attractively with the spin through the covers to open his account
that could have been three down, Williamson defended softly to short leg, Ramdin ran around from behind after seeing Southee set off, he had him struggling had the throw at the bowler's end hit
goes back and cuts a short ball outside off through backward point into the deep where there is no protection

oh dear, terrible running there, they don't even need the third umpire, the West Indians have fielded well again, he late-cut a ball from off stump to third man, hesitated and then set off on seeing Southee coming through, Simmons fired the throw to Badree at the bowler's end who did the needful with Williamson comfortably out
a good yorker, around off, nudged to long-on. Wonder if New Zealand should be going from both ends, with Munro now slightly fatigued.
out if he hit. Midwicket misses at the batsman's end, and New Zealand get an overthrow. Full outside off, squeezed to midwicket, who runs in and misses
badly timed away past midwicket for a couple more. Off the inside half
108 kph, an offcutter on middle and leg, Williamson misses a slog sweep, hit on the arm
what a shot. Full and straight from Taylor, Williamson does the Rohit Sharma, just extends his on-drive. And then gets the right follow-through, way over long-on with incredible timing
another terrific shot. Full around off, nailed over the bowler. Fine place to hit the ball, good timing too. New Zealand's highest T20I score
that's a poor ball. Short down leg and Williamson swivels on a pull, big gap behind square for four

chopped on, a much better delivery, it's a slower delivery on a good length outside off. Williamson tries to force the ball through the leg side, but the ball takes the inside edge and onto leg stump. A more-than-handy cameo
and he is away with a serene boundary, wide length ball alright, but KW does well to put it away through a packed off side infield, past cover
punches solidly off the back foot, to covers

rocks back and cuts through the covers, they decide to rush back for a second and Dwayne Smith fires a flat, fast throw in which leaves Nicol gasping, but Samuels doesn't collect cleanly to let Nicol off the hook with the batsman well short even after a despairing dive
short down leg and flicked away through square leg
slower and fuller on off stump. Williamson takes a step out of his crease and lifts it over extra cover once again, one bounce and over the rope

another man was brought into the cover region before this ball, but no one on the boundary - all the boundary fielders are on the leg side. Again Utseya serves one up on an off-stump line, and Williamson gets under it and lofts it over the covers
really full on off, driven down to long-on
another throat-botherer, Williamson sees it early but his hook comes off the splice and loops through square leg
bounced ... and called wide on height
flighted and outside off, patted back down the pitch
worked from off stump into the leg side

has he gone through him? Williamson loses complete balance as he pushes into a stroke. Walton whips the bails off. Was Williamson's foot outside the line? An extremely pacy length ball at 100kmph. Pushes it outside off and gets no turn. Williamson plays for the turn and keeps the bat inside the line. Loses shape but the backfoot has been grounded in time
pitched up outside off, driven out to sweeper cover
shortish, outside off, Williamson shapes up for a pull and the backfoot slips. Still manages good control on the shot
fuller on middle and leg, a lot tighter with the lines now, pushed back

that's not been picked up in the deep. And Nurse can't be any less amused. Williamson pulled this short delivery past midwicket and Fletcher in the deep took off in the wrong direction. Too late by the time he realises and sprints the right way
tossed up on middle and leg, Williamson knocks it away to deep midwicket off the front foot
moves in from a length, he pushes from the crease, thick inside edge onto pad
touch shorter and Williamson steps back in his crease to cut through the off side
lack of pace causing problems for the batsman as Williamson tries to pull this and ends up flat-batting it down to long on
googly, breaks back in, takes the inside edge and rolls to short fine leg
shortish and spins away outside off, Williamson uses the depth of the crease and pulls the ball away to deep midwicket
short and cut away out to deep cover
on a length and breaks away outside off, guided off the back foot to point
edged! Touch short from Briggs, Williamson eyed the chance to cut, but the ball skidded through and took the top edge
leans back and punches to sweeper cover

arm ball, slides in from wide of the crease, sticks in the pitch. Chipped away in the air. Krunal dives to his right from his followthrough, Seifert is at the non-striker's end to his right. Krunal isn't pleased. Seifert did not come in the way of the ball, he was simply standing to Pandya's right

back of a length, angled into middle and off, Williamson opens up and works the ball towards mid-on. They run a quick single, and Williamson has to stretch to beat the throw in. It's a direct hit at the bowler's end, and the umpire doesn't go to the third umpire. Replays show he may have been out by a millimeter or so.
back of a length, fourth-stump line, punched to backward point
shortish outside off and Williamson gets on his toes to force it away to the right of the diving backward point fielder. Super shot, and that's his fourth boundary already
skids on just a shade outside off, Williamson goes on the back foot and cracks it to sweeper cover
Zaheer is bowling superbly, some move in, some carry across, like this one, he drives inside the line, a sound as ball passes him, did not carry anyway, could have been bat hitting pad or ground
Yuvraj dives to stop the ball at point as KW pushes a length ball
dismissed through covers, enough width from Irfan again, good length, he reaches out and dispatches it gracefully

whoa, that's huuuuge! Down the track to Shadab's flighted ball pitching around off stump and turning away. Not quite to the pitch of it, but he still goes through with it and sends it sailing high into the night sky and over the sightscreen to bring up his fifty
yorker length just outside off, driven to long-off

clears deep midwicket! Another top shot. He steps out and hopes for Imad's natural angle in, but this is lobbed slowly and is turning away outside off. But Williamson still manages to get under it and launches it high to clear the boundary
full and angled in at leg stump, inside edge to short fine as he looks to sweep
glorious. Length ball outside off, doesn't step out but gets a lot of power on this drive. From the crease and drilled wide of deep cover
short ball on off stump, gets back and down low as he looks to get power on this pull. Long-on cleans up to his right
length on off stump, gets forward and opens the face late to get this to short third man's left. Zaman thinks he has this as he runs to his left but it has enough pace to beat him and run away
short of a length just outside off, finds short third with the cut
length on off stump, pushed through cover off the front foot
137kph, short and wide. Stays leg side of it and slices it between backward point and short third man
length ball on leg stump, back and across and deep in the crease as a result. From there, he flicks aerially to bisect fine leg and deep square
flatter and straighter, clipped away through square leg
length ball on off stump, steps out and mistimes it as he tries to lift it over mid-off. Manages to clear the infield
short of a length on off stump, steps out and cramps himself. Can't punch it past point
short of a length skidder. He mistimes his pull as a result. That kept low as well
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short of a length on middle, flicked to deep midwicket
short of a length on off stump, tapped down the pitch
short of a length on middle stump, inside edge onto pad and into the third man region as he tries to flick
clears short finewith some ease. Plants his front leg across into the off side to get behind the line and watches it off the face as he ramps this
length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side
short ball on middle stump, pulled uppishly towards deep square
length ball, a lot of width outside off, and Williamson thanks him and flat-bats the ball over extra cover
a bit slower now, and Williamson has time to rock back and smack it hard into the covers. Sean Williams dives to his right at cover and stops the ball. Could have been four otherwise
stays put this time, gets low against the short of a length ball and drags it fine with crouched knees
short on middle and leg, swatted to the right of deep midwicket
flatter and shorter again, works this legbreak against the turn, from outside off, to long-on
shortish, angling in and looking to tuck up Williamson. Whipped off the hip towards deep square leg
goes straighter and closer to off now, pushed wide of mid on, Balaji hits the non-striker's stumps direct, but KW is well in by then
even more width this time, but it is hit hard on the bounce to Tiwary at cover, he leaps to take it
straightening close to off, tentatively pushed down to mid on
looked a decent shout for lbw, good length ball straightening on the stumps, could have been height, could have been headed down leg, need to wait for replays
pushes at one leaving him with the angle, thick edge down to third man
loopy full one lofted gently over extra cover
straightens outside off, staying a bit low, slapped away to sweeper cover
tossed up offbreak spin in, defended off the front foot
straight length ball outside off now, slapped wide of sweeper cover
charges out, does not quite get hold of one outside off, drags it along the ground to long on
pulls a shortish one to deep midwicket

Shot! Not that short, not that wide, and he doesn't make himself extra room or anything. Just lets it come on and times it perfectly, with a roll of the wrists on top of the cut, to easily beat third man to his right
stays back this time to a short of a length ball outside off and cuts behind point
slower ball outside the off stump and he punches it to sweeper cover
tries to cut but he's beaten, kept a bit low maybe
fetches that from middle, gets on his knee and mows it over midwicket, Tiwary dives and fumbles in front of the rope
mows him across the line to midwicket
slower delivery and he he chips it in the air down to long-off

Ashwin judges it well running backwards, Williamson moved a long way across the stumps to fetch that one, tries to scoop it down to fine leg, he skies it and Ashwin runs backwards from short fine leg and takes it well, these catches are quite tricky

gone! Big boundaries make limited-overs cricket so much more interesting. They allowed Shadab to bowl another over after his previous, expensive one, and they allowed him to flight this ball enticingly outside off stump. Williamson takes it on, but he can't clear the man at long-on. Hits it straight to the fielder
steps out a touch early and Shadab pulls his length back a touch. Waits and dabs towards backward point
back of a length on off stump, pulled away to deep square leg
fuller now, angling into a fourth-stump line. Swipes hard with a flat bat and inside-edges it along the floor to Sarfraz, who tumbles to his left to stop the ball
takes it on the half volley and eases it to long on
short offcutter outside off, slapped away off the back foot to extra-cover
hip-high short ball outside off, Williamson sizes it up and pulls it with the angle flat and hard over midwicket
Williamson comes down the track, this is a slower ball outside off, jabbed down to long-on with one hand
back in the crease, tucked to mid on, a scurried single
back of a length, blocked from just outside off wide of the keeper for a quick single
back of a length, pulled to mid on
saying that, he steps to leg and times one over mid off for a one-bounce four
move across the stumps but only a flick to short long leg where there's a good diving save
pulled to midwicket, not timed
back cut for four off a bit of a bottom edge, slipped it past the 45 this time
short of a length around off, jumps back to get on top of the bounce and bunts it down the pitch
full, outside off, leans into a drive to the left of mid-on to get off the mark. Good, tight start from Cotterell
pushes away from the body and eases a fuller offering through the gap at covers
sliding fuller delivery on leg stump, pushed down to long-on
drive off a length outside off, comes off an inside edge to short fine leg, they run through for a single, direct hit could have been gone
little shorter, dragged to long on, on the pull
length outside off, punched towards extra cover but a tumbling stop by Pant keeps it to one
fuller on the leg stump, drives it towards long-on
back of a length, tuns it through backward point with an open face
length around off, beats the bat with the googly and Dhoni is once again quick to break the stumps, but Williamson's foot was always grounded behind the crease
another wrong'un, fuller on the pads, sweeps it squarer
length around off, Williamson was looking to go back and cut it but doesn't pick the googly and in the end can only watch it go in to the keeper's gloves
length outside off, drops it towards point and looks to sneak in a single but realises the fielder was quick to the ball and decides against
gets on top of the bounce of this short of a length delivery and drops it into the leg side for a single
full and flat on middle, eases it down to long-on for one
short of length outside off, punched towards deep extra cover
length around off, tucks it away towards midwicket
hangs back trying to cut, what are you doing man! Gets beaten with one that skids through
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and takes it on the full, drives it towards long-off
leg stump half volley, tucked out to the deep square leg fielder along the ground
step back and slapped back to the bowler
again full and worked away through the leg side
goes back and pulls into the leg side where the fielder on the circle messes up and Jarvis on the boundary saves his blushes with a brave dive on the boundary
goes back and plays into the deep on the off side
drives a full toss to long-off
flicked off the pads and into the midwicket fence
he defends into the off side and sets off, Shingi picks up and hurls down the stumps at the bowler's end with Kane short by a few inches
gets down a knee first ball does Kane, a brave stroke gets the reward as he swings it to the cow corner fence past the diving fielder
fired into middle and he squeezes it through midwicket, they rush back for a risky second and Kane puts in a dive which saves him from being run out, 14 needed from the last over

another full toss outside off and Shingi isn't so fortunate this time, even though Kane had backed away he stretched for it and took a hand off the bat as he managed to time it perfectly and bisect the fielders in the deep on the cover boundary
back of a length, angled across the batsman, cut and missed
New Zealand should win this now after a superb strike from Williamson, half-volley in the slot and he swings it high over the long-on boundary, run a ball from here
slower bouncer does the trick, it was short outside off, Williamson moved towards the off side and looks to hit it for a six, gets a top edge and Kuldeep at short fine leg makes no mistake
fuller outside off and crunched through covers, simply smashed it, the sweeper cover had no chance at all
short of length outside off, pulls it towards deep midwicket, scampers back for the second
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it hard through covers, beats the diving sweeper cover in the deep
short of length around off, another wrong'un, goes back and pulls it towards deep square leg
length around middle, goes back and tucks it towards square leg
Williamson works it towards sweeper cover for one
beauty! Length around middle and off this time and spinning away to beat the bat, Williamson once again fails to pick the wrong'un
another googly, length outside off, Williamson looks to punch it away, gets an outside edge past short third man, the fielder puts in the chase but cannot stop the boundary
fuller on the stumps, backs away and digs it out towards cover
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-on for a single

Kane Williamson has belied his small stature to play a 'big' innings here, he came in at number 7 with 21 needed off 9 balls and has scored 20 from just 5 balls, the final boundary was a full ball which was sliced away over point and to the fence
fired in down leg after he backed away and he squeezes it backward of square
fuller around off, goes down and paddles it fine, off the mark with a brace

it's the fizz off the pitch that has done Williamson in. Shapes to pull but this skids on, keeps a tad low, and hits him flush on the right thigh as he swiveled back. As plumb as an lbw call can get, no doubts whatsoever this time around. India in total control now.
back of a length, angling into the body, looks to get on his toes and work it leg side, and is a little early into his shot. Leading edge pops up into the off side, to the left of the bowler
length ball around the line of off, Williamson watchfully pushed back to the bowler
pitched up and pushed to mid-on coming forward
short and angled in towards the ribs, tucked into the leg side for a single
back of a length and coming back in at the batsman, turned short on the leg side
short ball outside the line of off, Williamson blocks short on the off side from deep in the crease
touch fuller, in the corridor and tailing in, Williamson tries to drive but mistimes the ball back to the bowler - another dot
short and straight, at the man but the man backs away and smartly cuts through gully for a well-timed four
short ball pulled through square leg for one
flighted on off, turned through the leg side to the fielder in the deep
flighted, dipping towards middle and leg as Williamson dances out and taps through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up outside off and spinning in, defended
flatter on middle and leg, slog-swept away towards deep midwicket, Pandya slaps the ball back into play. Good work in the outfield
dug in outside the line of off, Williamson mistimes a pull shot
pitched on a good length in the corridor, opens the face for one to third man
back of a length on middle and leg, whipped away to long-on
slider, on off, cramps the batsman for room, chopped fine of short third man
big offbreak from Swann, kicking and spitting at Williamson off the surface, the batsman manages to chop it back down on to the pitch
more turn, this one ripping back from outside off and taking the inside edge, missing the wicket and running to short fine leg
short and skids on, chopped to point
full and flighted, on middle and off, Williamson comes out and jams it back down the pitch
length ball, spinning towards leg stump, Williamson nearly misses with a clip to leg but just manages to tickle it fine
googly, skids back in, Williamson hangs back and punches to deep midwicket
short and just a shade outside off, all of these short balls are sitting up. This is at his chest, Williamson swivels on the back foot and nails a pull over square leg
short of a length, punched behind point to square third man for a single
shortish outside off, slapped into the covers
fuller ball, driven down to long-off
slow turn off a length, dabbed to short third man as they scamper a single
drifts in to draw him forward, bunted back
cuts to square short third man for a quick single
rocks back and cuts to deep point
gets right to the pitch as he laces this to long-off
pulled to deep midwicket
fired full on the stumps, defends into the leg side as it rolls off an inside edge
cuts but straight to Dhawan at the edge of the ring at cover point
fires this length ball into middle, tucks this wide of midwicket
whips this down to deep square
steps out and creams this through extra cover. Excellent use of the feet to convert this length ball into a near half-volley. Laced it away. Pure timing.

short ball angled into the body, and Williamson has holed out. Opened up at the hips to pull it, and ended up hitting it in the air. Ervine, the fielder at deep square leg took it well, diving to his right and getting both hands to the ball
floats this full on the pads, check-flicks this to midwicket

what placement! Uncorks his wrists as he opens the face of the bat to pick the gap between point and short third man. Just a hint of width and he picked the gap beautifully, supple wrists, superb timing. Class
Williamson makes room by moving toward leg and then manages to squirt a full ball on middle stump towards point, Dilshan fumbles
a slower ball, which Williamson edges on to his pad after charging down the pitch and having a swing
played off the pads to square leg
in the blockhole outside off stump, Williamson drives the ball towards deep point but gets run out while attempting a desperate second. Sangakkara had plenty of time to remove the bails

huge shout for lbw as he gets this to jag back in to beat Williamson's inside edge. They decide against reviewing it, height may have been in question as the length was on the shorter side. Replays confirm a thin inside edge too
works this wide of midwicket to get off the mark
googly, spinning into the hips, Williamson picks it up and flicks it straight into the lap of Hardik Pandya at deep midwicket. NZ have lost two wickets in two balls
really full and outside off, driven to mid-off
Williamson jumps across off again, hip-high ball outside off, picked up and slugged in front of square for another six
shortish, some width on offer and Williamson cuts to third man. Williams has overstepped
deft touch, superb awareness. Waits and waits, then deflects this ever-so-late, almost as it passed him to beat MS Dhoni. No chance for square third man
Williamson moves towards the off side to meet a fuller ball and drives the ball so smoothly to the wide long off boundary, I can watch him back all day and night
this time Williamson goes for a conventional T20 slog, looking to thrash the ball through the off after charging down the pitch, doesn't connect
shot! steps out of his crease and flicks the ball off his pads to the deep midwicket boundary
comes down the pitch again and chips it beautifully, goes straight on and beats the man at long off
comes down the pitch again, but defends it towards cover
he comes out of the crease, pushes it softly to deep midwicket for a couple of runs
looks to make room, he chops it to short third man and asked by the non-striker to come for a single. It's Taylor who is in trouble as the stumps are taken down, but he has just made it in in time

tossed up, Willamson takes it on... and sends a skier to mid-off... where it's taken by Moeen Ali, the very same! Nerveless catch from Mo, who's taken one look at Kane and said "My beard's bigger than yours, son". Huge top edge on this attempted slog-sweep and it was the bowler who tracked it back towards the edge of the circle to make sure of the dismissal
goes down on his knee early to paddle this fine, but only manages to parry it to deep backward square leg
another slower ball, Williamson chips it down to long-on and takes the single
over the wicket, pushed through on the stumps, Williamson keeps things ticking with a tickle down the ground
yorker goes wrong, when was the last time you saw that from Malinga. This is way down leg and Williamson glances it away to the fine-leg boundary
139kph, fires a yorker in on middle this time and Williamson is almost pushed off his feet. Still manages to nudge to deep square leg
bowled flat on off and middle, spins into the right-hander, Williamson defends on the off side

a direct hit has nailed Guptill! Williamson played the ball straight to point and called for the single. Guptill responded but hesitated a bit. Kapugedera was good enough to hit the stumps direct and catch Guptill a yard short. There was no run there and Williamson was unhappy with himself
slower ball and he gets forward and angles it to the off side
slower ball yorker on the pads and he just about manages to clip it away
length ball on the pads and tucked away behind square
short ball, picked up and deposited to the midwicket boundary. Saw it early, went deep in his crease and pummeled it over the top.
makes room and cuts the ball with the angle across him through point
fullish and outside off, Williamson comes forward to block
solid drive to mid-off as this was full and swinging into off stump. He needs to drop anchor and he seems to know it
flat and slightly short on leg stump, pulled behind square leg for a single
rampant inswing from Kula and Williamson is a little slow on the forward defensive. Gets an inside edge onto the top flap of the pad
full and straight, driven to long on for a single
full and a little too wide outside off, easily left alone
steps out to try and hit inside out over cover, Dilshan follows Williamson and cramps him for room, ends up mis-timing it to long off
hit firmly through square leg for a single
played to long on for a single
slower yorker on off stump, kept out quite nicely
he stays on the back foot and pushes it to deep cover for a single
low full toss, leading edge, we have seen enough of these today, KW is safe though as this is in the gap at cover
played off the back foot towards third man for a single
bowled flat from around the wicket, driven through covers but there is protection in the deep
shot! Williamson skips down the pitch and lofts the ball so cleanly, just a smooth swing of the arms and it's enough the send the ball towards the sightscreen
played back to the bowler
late cut from in front of middle stump and fairly straight to short third man, Guptill was off in a flash though, he wants the strike!
steps out of his crease and cuts to point, where the fielder dives to make the save
slower ball from Kulasekara, played into the off side
full outside off, driven into the covers
pushed into the covers for a tight single, Guptill was a long way out when Siriwardana's throw missed
played back to the bowler
Williamson breaks the lull by lapping a flat and fast delivery behind square leg for four
backs away outside leg and cuts the short ball hard over point, two boundaries to end the over
cut late off the back foot but the fielder at backward point dives to his right to save runs
steps out of his crease to get to the pitch of the ball and drives through extra cover
backs away outside leg, Lakmal follows him, cramping Williamson for room, Williamson adjusts by opening the face and steering the ball through point
a rare mis-hit from Williamson, he was looking to play to cover but got an inside edge towards midwicket, the running is sharp

that's so unlucky for the bowler, he bowled a good ball on a tight length, nipping into Williamson from outside off, the batsman prodded from the crease and got an inside edge that ran past the keeper to the fine leg boundary. That was so close to off stump. TV commentators think it grazed the stumps but the bail did not fall
reaches out to cut the ball as it spins away from him and is beaten
Williamson's riposte is to skip out to the pitch of the ball and loft it with the turn away from him over cover, sublime timing
clipped off the pads through midwicket
a full and slower ball outside off stump, Williamson drives it off the front foot past the bowler
creates room by moving outside leg and plays the ball through cover point
steps out of his crease to take the ball on the full and drives through cover, New Zealand get to 100
waits on it and pushes down the ground, past the non-striker
slower delivery again, but it's not full enough, he chops it to short third man for a single
Kane's gone! Williamson stepped to leg and tried to smash it for six over the top, but miscues a skier to Agar - Agar! - who takes it comfortably
slower delivery, KW spots it early and drives it over the extra cover fielder to pick the gap, four more
full and cuts back in at him, Williamson essays the perfect forward defensive
punched off the back foot into the covers
driven to long on for a single, that's his fifty, off 38 balls. He needs to shift up gears now though
full and straight again, in the blockhole, the batsman can only hit it along the ground through midwicket
worked off the pads behind square for two more
moves outside leg but the bowler follows him and cramps him for room, Williamson adjusts and dabs the ball towards third man
good length on off and middle, Williamson stays in his crease and whips the ball through square leg
played from the crease towards midwicket
stays back and pulls the short of a length ball through midwicket
short of a length outside off, Williamson dabs one more to third man
flicked off the front foot towards square leg
gives it some air, Williamson punches through mid-on for one to finish a tidy enough over for England's legspinner

pushed down the leg side, Williamson sweeps and misses... and Buttler whips off the bails, which means even though it is a wide they will check the stumping. Neat glovework by Buttler but Williamson whirled his bat all the way round in his follow through and got it down in time
floated up on the stumps, nudged to leg, can't get it away
tossed up on the stumps, hitting the pads as Willamson came down the pitch - stifled appeal
short and wide outside off, angling across the right-hander, Williamson stands in his crease and cuts over point
short of a length outside off, steered to short third man, Guptill rushes through for the single
a length ball with lots of width outside off, Wiliamson reaches for it and hits the ball through cover
over the wicket, tosses the ball up on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length ball, pulled through square leg
fuller ball on the pads, played through square leg for a single, Williamson slipped as he turned for the second so they did not run it
he has found his timing tonight, comes down to the pitch of the ball and lifts Hafeez over midwicket. Couple collected
full toss, Williamson drives past the bowler for a single
pushed down to long-on after nipping down the pitch again. Hafeez tries flattening his trajectory, but can't keep him quiet
good length ball, which he turns shortish by moving back and clipping to deep midwicket
full, a bit of swing into middle stump. Williamson gets his front foot out of the way and clips neatly through midwicket
length ball on middle stump, blocked towards midwicket
fairly full on middle stump. Williamson stays on the back foot, plays late to defend towards backward point
back of a length, a bit of inward movement to cramp Williamson, who looks to stay leg-side of the ball and dab behind point. Can only chop it down behind the wicket, towards the keeper
back of a length, the line is just a touch too leg-stumpish, and Williamson misses the leg glance but it runs off the thigh pad to the fine leg boundary
flighted, the legbreak drifting on to the pads, Williamson nudges fine of the man on the edge of the circle and they trot one
Williamson you beauty! He moves outside leg stump so smoothly and plays the lofted drive inside out over extra cover, so balanced while playing that shot
played off the back foot into the covers
flicked off the back foot, sending the ball through midwicket for two more
bit of extra bounce as this back of a length ball thuds into the shoulder of Williamson's bat as he looks to block. Good soft hands there
another indipper from Kula and this one is met with a full face of the bat. Still the movement is enough to hit the inside edge again
the lap-sweep to short fine leg, Munro hares down for the single and collides with the keeper Chandimal

ugly hack from Williamson and it becomes an ugly boundary as the inside edge runs away to fine leg. Fuller ball on middle and leg, he backs away for a slog, lucky as that was quite close to the stumps
steps out of his crease and lofts over the infield, can't find the gap at deep midwicket
Dar stretches his arms wide as this shortish delivery is angled down the leg side. Williamson looks to glance it and doesn't connect
swerves back in off this fulller length ball on off stump, Williamson was looking to clip through midwicket and gets an inside edge onto pad. Makes Sri lanka's appeal useless
Williamson's been caught by Lakmal running in from deep midwicket. He made room by moving outside leg and clips the ball in the air, the timing was not right and that's a straightforward catch
that's where he should not have bowled. Drifts a length ball down the leg side and Williamson has paddled it well past the lone man in the region - short fine leg
shortish ball just outside off, he nudges it into the vacant midwicket region and he's placed it perfectly for a couple
short ball just outside off and Williamson pulls to deep square leg

comes down the track, while ensuring he has room to try and flay through through the covers. It was the offcutter from Mathews and it fetches the inside edge which misses off stump on the way to the keeper
finds the outside edge but it goes wide of the lone slip in place. Williamson was pressing forward and driving away from the body. Single to deep third man
short ball, pull in the air from off stump, lands safely square on the leg side
fullish and kept just wide of off stump, left alone
flighted, straightening outside off, Williamson deftly dabs it straight to short third man
tighter lines, skidding on and pushed into the off side
late cut, that's running away behind point, silkily done by KW! Dropped back and waited for the ball, spinning away and sent scuttling to the rope
tossed up and driven back past the bowler for one more
full and straight, dug out back down the ground to long-on
shortish at the body, flicked fine off the thigh pad

beautiful stroke, caressed for six over long-off! That is quite majestic from Williamson, set himself in the crease and lofted Stokes back down the ground for the first maximum of the innings... Fire meets ice
nudged off the pads in front of square leg for a single
short of a length, Williamson pulls behind square
shot! steps out of his crease towards leg and punches a short of a length ball through cover point
shot! The delivery was full and straight, and Williamson drove it along the ground with a perfectly straight bat, hitting the ball between Guptill and the stumps at the other end
strays on to the pads this time and Williamson glances it to the fine leg boundary, just a deft touch this time
back of a length and just outside off, defended into hte covers
where Guptill uses a axe, Williamson uses a scalpel, dabbing the ball late, opening the face to steer it past the wicketkeeper to the third man boundary
Williamson does it again, dabbing the ball efficiently behind point to watch from the non-striker's end
punched off the back foot to point, a bit of hesitation between the wickets but the batsmen make it, no direct hit at the batsman's end either
slow on middle, KW cleverly clips to midwicket
not a bad ball again. On middle, on a good length. Williamson shuffles across to flick to square leg. A manufactured run
good length on middle and off, comes off a tad slower but that is atleast a better line. KW makes but is quick through the cut, taps back to the bowler
sees KW coming and darts it in on off, another drive to long-off finds one
nice again. Slowed up just enough on off, KW looks to go through the off side but can't
skips down the track to clip to deep midwicket. Good stroke
flat on off, no turn. 103 kph, very quick. Williamson defends
too straight from Sami. Erring on leg again and Williamson nurdles to deep square leg.
that is the problem, Goes too straight and Williamson misses a nudge but the ball pings off the thigh pad to the fine leg fence. Easy runs
better. A nice length from Sami - fullish than a good length. Off the inside half towards square leg, wanted one all along
KW misses out on some runs. Good length, swinging into Williamson's hips who misses an easy flick by his standards. Struck on the body
a good length delivery on off and middle, blocked from the crease. Decent end but an expensive over
full and wide outside off, a decent line. Smashed to cover, a fine foil he has proved to be
what a shot that is. KW at his very best. Gets on top of the bounce from a seven-foot bowler. And then laces a cut in the gap at point. Races away to the fence, awesome to watch.
great over this. Full on off, not much swing but enough for KW to defend watchfully and solidly under his eyes
length delivery outside off, the batsman steers it to third man for a single
shorter this time and Kane's on the back foot, defending with his usual imperviousness
a waste from Watson and Williamson just tucks this leg-side stray off his toes for four. Easy
Watson yelps an appeal as Williamson's rapped on the pads via an inside edge. Watson retracts his yelp and the umpire doesn't even bother looking at the outrageous appeal
tucked off his pads to wide fine leg for a single
rides the bounce and punchily defended to mid-off...and they steal a single thanks to a mishap. Bit careless from mid-off there
starts well, on middle, and it's blocked
short of a length allowing Williamson to rock back, but it cuts back on him marginally and Kane defends
very good deliver, tempting him outside off. Williamson is so solid in defence, though, that he comes forward with solidarity to block it out
sweetly struck - just a touch fuller from Faulkner and Williamson chips it over mid-on for four. Not timed as well as he might, perhaps, but elegantly dispatched
this is the doosra and I think Williamson picked it and punched to cover.
too straight from Irfan and KW is a master of that stroke. Just whips the ball in the gap at square leg for a couple. Poor line
shortish delivery outside off, too slow, too short. Cracked away to extra cover for a couple
tight on off, no turn. Darted in. Pushed to cover
flat on off, very quick, 96 kph. Clipped to long-on. One more
goes back and tries to drill a shortish delivery through cover, but has played too early. Gets an inside edge to mid-on
goes on with the angle and gets a touch more bounce than Williamson thought. Beaten on the defence and is struck on the thighs
shuffles across outside off and drives a fuller delivery down to mid-on
made a little too much room there as he ran at Gul, who beats him with a back of a length ball outside off
sends down a bouncer right over off stump, Williamson looks for a pull but this has too much heat for him. Whistles over his shoulder
charges down and realises the bowler has opted to go slower. He's already made room for himself, which means he just had to wait a second more and then slap it through the covers
shortish and a shade outside off, Williamson looks to drag it to midwicket and mistimes it
what a shot! Nimble footwork to get himself closer to the length ball which has been lifted quite serenly to the long-off boundary
lines up a slower bouncer and pulls it down to deep square leg. Conscious roll of the wrists there from Williamson
on the pads, and a touch short which allows Williamson to shift his balance back and pull to deep square leg
a shimmy down the pitch towards a fuller ball and drives to Shehzad at point, who makes sure Devcich is on his toes at the bowler's end
gets in line with the stumps and manages an inside edge to a good length ball on middle. Single taken as it wanders away towards point
length ball, picked up and launched over deep fine leg. Only the crowd needs to worry about that. How quickly did he get into position - got inside the line and swung it away
beats the off-side ring with a little assistance from his feet. Charges at the bowler, affords himself a little room and drills the ball through the gap
crisply struck as he stays balanced on his back foot and used the full face of the bat to hit a shortish ball to cover
gets off the mark with a back-foot clip through midwicket
unveils a checked drive to mid-off after stepping forward to a fuller ball outside off. Wonderfully controlled from Williamson
pushes him back this time with a shortish ball on off stump. Williamson stays in line and punches to the right of short cover
tests him with a fuller delivery a shade outside off, but there isn't any movement though. Williamson is forward and pushes to mid-off
first baller for Kane Williamson! It's fuller and it's heading towards the middle stump, Williamson looked to flick it but he knew he was a gonner once he missed it. No chance there at all.

this one has gone through! Big offcutter that darts in sharply into the batsman, surprises Williamson, it hits the thigh pad and drops on to his stumps. Pollard sets off on a celebratory run, keeping his finger firmly on his lips.. Big breakthrough
he starts off with an offcutter, KW looks to cut it but misses
he stays deep in the crease and tucks the other one to midwicket for a single
this one is short and wide, KW punches it to deep cover for another easy single
short of length delivery outside off, KW latches on to it and whacks it over midwicket for a much-needed boundary

gone this time. Looks to go down the ground again, but that may have been the offcutter. That variation may have solely been responsible for the wicket. Williamson hits the drive to cover after skewing it off the outer half of the bat. Good chnage-up. Williamson has done his job, though. Onto the power.
picked his pot pretty well, knew what he was doing all along. Gets a full delivery on middle, Williamson lofts it over mid-on for a few runs.
keeps to a good length just outside off and it's punched back to the bowler
slower ball, lobbed up full on middle. Willliamson pushes to long-on
chips it over mid-on! Charges him and though it was short to throw him off, Williamson flat-bats it away and gets enough power on it
full on off stump, he comes forward to block again

shot! Steps out of his crease and makes room too, he then slaps the ball over the infield, hitting with the angle away from him and towards wide long-off, Tamim doesn't get to it quickly enough and once the ball reaches the practice pitches it just races away
The Fizz responds with a great slower cutter, beating Williamson's attempt at hitting down the ground
the faster cutter this time! It surprises Williamson, who had tried to make room and then had to hurry and jab his bat down on it outside off, Williamson was beaten and nearly bowled

and this time he is bowled! The Fizz is a special, special bowler. The batsmen know what he is going to do but they still can't play him. Williamson went right across his crease to lap the ball behind square but was beaten by the slower one again. Off stump takes a beating. That ball cut off the pitch as well.
flicks this off his pads. Good length but too straight
oh, this is sweet - the game's first classy shot. It's a loose stray outside off from NCN and Williamson comes forward before opening the face, timing it beautifully to a wide third man for four
better line, on middle-and-leg, muscled past Zampa who looks peeved that he couldn't stop it
turns him round a bit there - Williamson's neither forward or back, defending this full, leg-side ball and it squirts out to cover
pushed out off the back foot for a single. Think about two but, no. Two would be silly.
loads more flight on this one as it drifts in, Williamson pushes forward and blocks
orthodox offie this time and it turns and bounces to take the inside edge of Williamson's bat. No close-in fielders though
this was flatter on middle and he goes back and clips to midwicket
skips down the track and was making a bit of room as well, had to reach for it which hurts his timing. Whacked down the ground ofr a single
good line, tucked off his toes but no run on offer
poor ball from Mathews, can't bowl short at his pace and Williamson punishes him with a solid pull shot. Beats square leg comfortably
back of a length just outside off, punched to mid-off
backs away as this was fired a lot fuller on middle. Got his bat between the ball and his stumps and the bottom edge saves him.
wanted to chop this away behind point, but it skids on from the pitch a little too quickly
short of a length. Williamson moves to leg before punching it out to cover
back of a length and on that off stump corridor, Williamson plants an angled bat and finds point
neatly nudged through midwicket for a single
grips into the pitch and foils his timing. Lobs uppishly towards the vacant midwicket region
steered behind point as this was shortish with a bit of room on offer. Everything riding on Williamson now
goes wide of the crease and pushes a flatter delivery on middle and leg, Williamson picks it away through midwicket. That's the first run he's conceded in 14 balls
gorgeous flight and drift, but Williamson has come forward and calmly blocked it
a length ball outside off, Williamson dabs the ball late towards backward point to give the strike to Guptill
good length on middle and off, Williamson stays in his crease and defends on the leg side
short of a length outside off, the ball hasn't spun much at all, Williamson goes back and cuts through cover point
down the track first ball, but he can't get to the pitch of this arm ball on off stump, can only chop it down towards short third man
another short ball but Williamson just flicks it along the ground to deep square leg, New Zealand get to 50
played through midwicket for a single
Williamson moves forward and across to try and turn a ball on the leg side but misses and is hit on the thigh
stays in his crease this time and dabs the length ball from outside off, but there's a fielder at slip and it rolls to him
lovely placement and timing, Williamson presses forward and drives a length ball on the up past Shakib's right hand at extra cover, no one will chase that down
and again, this time to the left of cover, Williamson laces another drive through the gap in the infield, all timing and precision
in the air but there's no one at midwicket, Williamson went back and flicks the flat ball off his pads flat through the airspace in the infield
drifts on to the pads, Williamson gets down low on one knee and sweeps the ball along the ground to the long leg boundary
tossed up on off stump, Williamson defends on the front foot
superb timing from Williamson, getting on to the front foot and driving the ball gently along the ground through midwicket
leans forward and across to turn the ball on the leg side but is hit on the pad, that was sliding down leg
comes out of his crease again and flicks the ball off his pads towards deep square leg, a tandem effort on the boundary saves the four
stays back and defends a straight ball on the off side
Williamson leans forward and across to a slower ball angling across him and pushes it towards point
pitches outside leg and cuts across the right-hander from over the wicket, Williamson stays back and tucks the short of a length ball off his hips behind square
so close to a midwicket-stunning-catch! Didn't see who. Williamson clipped it powerfully off his toes and it only just evaded midwicket's dive
a turn of the wrists brings Williamson a single to square leg
shorter ball, rides up on him and he turns it off his hip
defended on the front foot
shot! Comes forward, moves towards leg to go inside out, and then lofts cleanly over the infield at cover to pick out the gap in the deep
a quicker dart sliding down leg side hits Williamson on the pad as he stays back in his crease
strides forward and defends again
is Williamson finally finding his stride? He steps out again and lofts sweetly over long-on, good enough to just clear the boundary considering he just put timing into it, no power
steps out and gets a bit of a leading edge towards point
he moves outside off so early and then reaches for a fuller and wider delivery to dab towards third man, more of a thick edge but that's where he wanted it to go
goes back and hits the ball off the pads to midwicket
comes forward a little and then halts as the bowler darts one across the right-hander from around the wicket, Williamson waits and dabs to backward point
leans forward slowly and flicks the full ball off his toes through square leg
driven on the front foot along the ground to long on for another single
short ball outside off, Williamson rocks back and pulls along the ground through midwicket
uses his wrists to tuck a shortish delivery through the vacant midwicket region
short of a length and straight, Williamson plays a whippy swat to midwicket
length ball on off stump, turns in, and he tucks it neatly to short fine leg
bowled flat, short and wide outside off, Williamson steps out and then reaches for the ball and slaps it through cover for four more. The ground dimensions are messing with Wasim's plans
looks to cut this hard but can't beat short third man
looks to pull the flatter delivery but that hurries on to him, pushed to midwicket
