he almost lets this run between the bat and the pad.. KW was out of the crease and is beaten by the slider, but inside edges to his pads

Williamson's been stumped! Such fast hands from Dhoni and superb change of pace from Raina. He saw the batsman stepping out of his crease and fired the ball flat and quick outside off. Williamson stopped his advance and tried to reach the ball with the cut. He missed and Dhoni did the rest
short ball, he swivels on the back foot and pulls to deep square leg
Williamson drives the ball on the front foot but hits it to the fielder at cover
Bumrah is giving Williamson no room, played from the crease onto the covers again

through him, star man shines! Williamson has been very adept in picking his shots and which foot to play off of. But this time he is stuck in the crease and is beaten for pace as Afridi skittles through his defences

a direct hit would have run out Anderson at the bowler's end! Williamson hit the ball firmly to point and Anderson took a few steps out of his crease, Jadeja swooped on the ball and let it rip, Anderson hurried back and dived, but he might have been just short
big offspin now, the batsman misses his flick
full outside off, driven away to the right of deep point
yorker on off and middle, jabbed back to the bowler
fullish ball on the stumps, and it's driven down towards mid-on
slides on with the angle, might have even been the googly, and he chops this attempted cut down onto the pitch
straight roller on off and middle, and he defends down the ground
down the pitch, and that's a nice-looking pick-up shot over midwicket and to the right of long-on
down the pitch, makes some room to go over the off side, but he gets too close to the pitch of the ball and hits it hard but straight to mid-off
gets outside off and down low to paddle the ball over short fine leg but he misses and gets hit on the pad

full on middle stump, not quite yorker length, and Williamson puts it away cool as a cucumber. Walks across his stumps, and picks it up with his bat pointing skywards, lifts it up and over the fine leg boundary
slants a quicker and flatter delivery way down the leg side. Dew already? Afridi lifts his hand in apology to his keeper, who did really well moving miles to his left
shortish and outside off, Williamson cuts to short third man
worked off the back foot through midwicket gently for a single
bowled flat on middle and leg, turned off the pads through square leg, long boundary there so plenty of space to come back for the second
short of a length outside off, Williamson pulls and the fielder at midwicket dives and takes some pace off the ball, it is the short boundary behind him
good length angling across the right-hander, came back at him a touch, Williamson tries to steer to third man but edges on to the pad
a full ball angling across the right-hander, driven on the front foot to deep cover, so smooth is Williamson
steps out and works the legbreak spinning away from him towards mid on
bowled on a good length with drift into the right-hander, defended on the front foot to the bowler
shot again! Moves across to a fuller ball and drills it through the gap at midwicket to the short boundary. Pakistan were 30 after five overs, New Zealand are 53.
he's beaten by the slow nature of this pitch. Williamson had strode down the pitch and was going through with a loft when the length was not yet on him. Chips it over the bowler, lucky.
shot! Williamson moves across his crease to a length ball outside off and paddles it over the head of the man at short fine leg
good length angling across the right-hander, Williamson moves in his crease towards the off side and dabs to short third man
starts with a leg-stump half-volley, flicked to short fine leg... and is that a drop? Think it carried to Rashid, on the edge of the circle, who couldn't grasp it diving forwards
flighted outside off, Williamson almost yorks himself as he lunges forward to drive into the covers
flatter on middle, Williamson clips it to deep midwicket
fired in on leg stump, Williamson works it through to deep midwicket
goes across on off stump and taps gently down behind square, they nick a single
gorgeous chip from Williamson as he ventures down the pitch and lifts a flighted delivery towards long-off
slightly shorter, 81mph and holding its line on the body, Williamson tucks to the leg side
a full ball on the pads, Williamson moves across to flicks but misses, the ball goes off his pad and flies wide of the keeper for leg byes, that pitched outside leg so Amir won't get his lbw

wide yorker, and Williamson loves that bit of width, just jams down with an angled bat and steers it into the gap to the left of backward point. No way third man was getting to that. What a way to bring up his half-century
back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
full and wide, can't beat extra cover with his drive
tucked off the pads to square leg, Anderson calls for the single and Williamson is in trouble at the non-striker's end! Rohit's throw misses
short ball and Williamson misses out, pulls it to Rohit at square leg

shot! The ball was short of a length and wide outside off, but on this pitch it came on to the bat slowly, Williamson was patient enough not to rush at the ball, but wait for it and then slap it late, bisecting the gap between extra cover and mid off
good length angling across the right-hander from over the wicket, a bit of shape into the batsman, Williamson stays in his crease and plays behind point
goes back and towards leg and taps the ball to long on
tossed up on off stump, Williamson leans forward and across and clips the ball to midwicket
short of a length with width outside off, Williamson stays in his crease and tries to cut but the ball is too far away to time it well, he plays it to point
beaten outside the off stump, phew, what a start, what an over
goes back and towards leg to punch the ball to long on for a single
down the pitch and gets inside the line to play the inside-out lofted drive but long-off cuts it off at the boundary, running to his left
another shortish ball on off, another slap to deep cover
Williamson gives himself room this time, and once again he foils the batsman's plans by bowling it nice and wide of off, close to the tramlines but just inside them
shortish ball outside off, and he drags this pull down to wide long-on
back of a length this time, and he goes back and works it towards midwicket
and starts with a short ball outside off. Williamson pulls and Pollard runs to his right from deep midwicket to stop it on the boundary
shortish ball once again, outside off, and Pollard has to run to his left this time to cut off that pull

shot! that was a length  ball, angled in towards off stump, and he gave himself a tiny bit of room to free his arms and punched it with a straight bat back over the bowler's head, and they're checking if it landed inside the boundary rope or on it... I think it's landed on the rope, but they've given four

And Sammy's done the trick! It was the slower ball, and Williamson closed his face early, and the ball looped high over Sammy, who leapt up in his follow-through and took a super overhead catch with his left hand.
slower this time, and he fetches this sweep from wide outside off stump, down towards deep backward square leg
good length angling into the right-hander, Williamson stays in his crease and taps it towards mid on
good bounce from a good length from Bumrah, hitting high on the bat as Williamson stays in his crease and square drives to point
turns in this time, and he goes back and defends into the off side
full on middle stump and Williamson clips it away so easily. Pick-up shot, up and over and into the straight midwicket boundary
shot! Looks for the yorker and gives him too much width with a low full-toss, and Williamson steers it with an open face into the big gap to the left of the backward point fielder
back of a length on off stump, jabbed into the point region
sees him coming down the track and bowls a full ball wide of off stump. Reaches out and can't put bat to ball
shot! This time he stays in his crease and Gul's attempted yorker ends up as a wide half-volley. Gets under it, slices it beautifully over point
yorker, angling down leg, clipped to fine leg
walks across his stumps and Amir follows with the full ball. Clipped away through midwicket
back of a length outside off, beats Williamson's attempt to stab that through point
in the blockhole outside off, stabbed away towards cover, where Afridi stops it falling to his left
gone! Williamson's long fight ends. Full on leg stump, looks to flick it over the backward square leg region, is a little too early into the shot, and he picks out the fielder at deep square leg
jumps back and across and dabs a good length ball through square leg
good length and straight, Williamson stays in his crease and plays to point
short of a length on the pads, Williamson moves towards the off to get inside the line and whips the ball to the backward square leg boundary
good length on the pads again, Amir staying away from the off side because that's where the short boundary is, Williamson tries to glance but does not make proper contact
short of a length on the hips, Williamson goes back and works the ball along the ground behind square leg
bowled full and outside off, quite quick too, Williamson goes back and cuts in the air but just fine of the diving fielder at short third man

flat, fast and wide outside off, Williamson uses the width and cuts late, piercing the gap between the fielders at backward point and short third man. Wasim is clearly trying to stay away from the short leg side boundary
good length and straight, nudged off the back foot on the leg side
length ball, a touch too straight, and he gets nicely across and laps it to the fine leg boundary
worked off the pads through midwicket again for a single
moves back and towards the off side and steers the ball going across him to third man
comes down the track and looks to close the face a touch too soon. Afridi's leggies get a bit of purchase but Shehzad at point is impregnable
stays back and flicks the ball through midwicket where Hafeez dives over the ball
down the track, gets too close to the full ball outside off, whips to long-on
good length outside off and that is edged but short of slip! pace was up at 88mph from Plunkett, Williamson playing with an open face, looking to run one to third man, Fairy soft hands saved him
back of a length outside off, punched straight to extra cover, stationed right on the edge of the circle
back of a length on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
whoops! Dropped. Williamson steps out and chips the ball tamely towards Malik's right at knee height, should have really caught that
Malik from around the wicket, bowled flat and straight, Williamson stays in his crease and dabs behind point
back of a length outside off, uses his wrists to whip towards deep midwicket
quickish length ball outside off, dabbed to short third man
flat and quick, angles it down the leg side. Was looking to follow the batsman's movement and ended up overdoing it
back of a length on off stump, worked aeway through square leg
tossed up, pushed through the point region
worked off the pads towards square leg
width outside off stump, delicate from Williamson to complement Guptill's power, he goes back and cuts late, beating backward point to his left
steps out but is not to the pitch of the ball, drives on the up through the line to long off
pushed through midwicket for a single
played back to the bowler
flat, angling down leg, tucked away towards long leg
backs away towards leg this time and drives the ball hard to  long off
full and sliding down the leg side again, this time it's put away. Williamson using Plunkett's pace and glancing it wide of Rashid this time
comes across and defends down into the offf side
in the channel, drops back and runs it off the face for one to third man

short and wide and Williamson slashes hard, gets hold of his cut but Jason Roy makes a magnificent effort to cut it off at backward point - not taken cleanly on the bounce but almost certainly saved four
hits the pitch hard, back of a length, at the body, nudged to midwicket
dug in short and angling to leg, swatted away with aplomb by the Kiwi captain for his second boundary through backward square leg
flat, angling into the pads, clipped to square leg

back of a length, no turn, and he punches straight to the man at cover. Williamson calls for the single, Guptill responds a little late, and then he's sent back. Too late, and the throw at the bowler's end leaves plenty of time to complete the run-out with both batsmen near the middle of the pitch. Williamson even made a late, desperate attempt to run past Guptill and sacrifice his wicket, but he couldn't manage it
flat, angling into the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
shot! Williamson jumps back and a little towards leg to punch a good length ball through the covers, he is so well balanced as he makes contact
length ball, starting wide and swinging further... Kane can't reach that with a broomstick
back of a length in the channel, cross seam at 144kph/89mph and Williamson swings and misses, done by the low bounce
sees him making room and bowls a shortish ball on leg stump. Still manages to punch it firmly but can't beat cover point
shortish on off stump, doesn't time his pull, drags it slowly to the left of deep square leg
slower ball angling across Williamson, who leaves his crease and is beaten playing a half-hearted poke, looking to run it down to third man
length ball on leg stump, tucked away to the left of short fine leg, and Gul stops it with a desperate, slow-motion slide
angling in on the stumps, 133kph/83mph and he leans on a clip through midwicket for a couple

slower ball. Williamson backs away, looking to make room, and Amir slides it wider, forcing him to reach for it. Goes through with the shot, toe-ends it high in the air. Drops down to Afridi at cover, and he drops a sitter.
back of a length on off stump, goes deep in his crease to whip it away through square leg

it's going poorly for Amir tonight, Williamson moves towards the off side in his crease to counter the angle across him from over the wicket and whips the ball off his pads to bring up a fifty, second of the series and far more fluent than the one in Auckland

down the track and Imad fires it in full, into the batsman to deny width, and the attempted cover drive goes off the inside half of the bat through midwicket. A bit of drift in as well, and it kept going with the arm
full, looks to make room to jab through the off side, ends up inside-edging into the leg side
defended from the crease into the off side, Wasim moves across and fields
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and whips it away through backward square leg
full-toss on middle and leg, whipped away through square leg
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to dab towards backward point
length ball on middle and leg, cramping the batsman for room, blocked towards point
shortish googly, turning into the pads, tucked away through square leg
low full-toss wide of off stump, sliced away to deep point
very full outside off, Williamson skips across to clip to long-on
shortish outside off, drags the pull around to wide long-on
full and quick wide of off and it beats Williamson as he reaches out to jab
down the track to the wide flighted ball and flat-bats it to the extra cover boundary. First really fluent shot from him in a long time
back of a length outside off, mistimes the back foot punch and jabs to mid-off
sees him coming down the track and shortens his length a touch. Pushed at the drive and edged it past the keeper, runs away quickly to the third man boundary
comes down the track and can't reach the pitch of a slower, tossed-up ball, poked back to the bowler
not short enough to cut, chopped away to point
full, angling in, worked away through midwicket
full, cramps him for room, pokes it into the mid-on region and the bowler moves across to field

that is quick work from Ramdin if he has managed that stumping! The batsman marginally shuffles away and gets beaten by this quicker delivery, he misses and the keeper takes the bails off in a flash.. KW was out of the crease when Ramdin takes it, but has slid the back foot in? very difficult to say. Looks like it's going to go in favour of KW. Safe by a whisker
goes down on his knees early and sweeps this one from off stump to pick the gap between short fine leg and backward square leg. Superb placement
quicker delivery on the stumps, the batsman nudges it to short fine leg for a single
flighted ball, comes down the track and clips to long-on
this goes the other way and KW almost chops it on. Sammy, at first slip, dives to stop the runs
a fuller length on the pads, driven through midwicket for two more
short ball, Williamson moves towards the off side, staying deep in his crease, and is so well balanced as he pulls that to the deep backward square leg boundary
gets some bounce from length, the batsman dabs it to square leg for a single
short ball again, this time Williamson backs away towards leg and tries to upper cut, this time he misses
moves across in his crease to flick the ball hard but gets an inside edge on to his pad, the ball goes towards short third man

good length outside off, Williamson nudges it close on the leg side, Guptill runs, Williamson sends him back, Sarfraz gets to the ball quickly but Guptill makes it back in time, Afridi had also broken the stumps with his body as he moved to get behind the stumps
played to mid on for a single
flatter and shorter outside off, Williamson mis-times the ball off the front foot, not often that happens
steps out and punches the ball into the covers
loses his line, bowls it on leg stump.. KW goes down on his knees and spoils the over with a swat to fine leg
full on leg stump, clipped through midwicket
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man

a huge appeal for caught behind! Pakistan think they have Williamson caught down the leg side but the umpire signals legbye. Williamson tried to glance the short of a length ball off his hips and that came off his thigh pad. Sarfraz flew to his left to catch that with one hand, superb take. Guptill was alert to call for the run while Pakistan were appealing.
should get two here - and they do, as de Kock places this smartly through midwicket
on middle and turned to leg
solidly defended on middle
what a stop! I didn't catch who. de Kock flogged this square of the wicket, just behind square actually, and Fletcher dived to his right to save a certain four
de Kock's on a roll, here - he's really trying to inject some momentum into the innings, and some energy. A swivel pull for two
drew him outside off with a length ball. De Kock shuffled across to cut but misses. Cry of anguish from the bowler.
good bowling, this one hurries in with the angle, de Kock trying to cut, cannot place it past point
sitting up from back of a length, pulled in the air over the infield, man in the deep at square leg somehow manages to cut it off with a tumble
tossed up and he sees it early enough. Charges to reach the pitch and nudge towards midwicket
one of Bravo's slower balls but it's outside leg
another slowie on his legs and tucked for a single
slow length ball spinning away a bit, hit to extra cover
stroked out to cover
angled in full, he gets around it to drive to extra cover
slower ball - defended
got him! No? Big noise outside off as de Kock attempted a flourishing drive - definitely a noise there. Perhaps bat/pad or bat on turf
crashed out to a diving Sammy at mid-off - well done! Dived to his left to save four
that turned, sharply, bounced too, almost hit it straight to extra cover
clipped off his legs to long-on and good running yields two
well, at last, a boundary. And a very rare stray from Bravo down the leg side. De Kock capitalises with a pull around the corner
wrong line, on his legs, tucked for a single
finds the fielder once again with the cut
tossed up on middle, a touch of turn - but only a touch
swatted away, but cannot get it past extra cover who runs to his left to field
short and wide outside off, the batsman punches it hard towards cover where Guptill makes a diving save and prevents a certain boundary
again short, and again de Kock can't do much with it - defending
shorter ball and good pace - just shy of 90mph. Defended off the back foot
delicious little late-cut. My favourite shot.
the power of de Kock as he steps to leg a touch, and thrashes this through cover! Super stroke
short, wide, cut. But only for one...
faster and fuller, and cracked to cover
flighted delivery outside off, de Kock tries to drive it to the off side, gets an inside edge that rolls towards the leg side
false stroke now through midwicket
tossed up but driven fluently out through cover
guided straight to backward point
nothing more than a defensive push from de Kock. Slick running brings two to wide long-off
intentionally cut in the air over backward point and short third man, top placement
this time he beats the dive at point, and will get another boundary
lovely stroke, de Kock has played a few, strides forward and lofts powerfully over extra cover, a bounce before it goes over the ropes

short of a length and clubbed off the back foot to cover - and they take a quick single but they will have to be quick. And the throw comes in to Ramdin who whips off the bails and celebrates immediately - he's short of his ground!
flicked powerfully off his toes and Benn tumbles to save two - brilliant
whipped off the pads, and it almost beats the man running across from deep square leg, parries it away almost off the ropes
ooh, hello - that turns. De Kock swings and misses
steps across his stumps and attempts a sweep
he has repeatedly kept going for the cut, this time he under-edges it, but it was too low for McCullum, he can't get down to it, chance anyway
into the pads, and eased through midwicket
de Kock clamps down on this, smothering the spin
makes some room but cannot place it past the off side infield
more impatience, backs away to leg but Hira follows him and he finds no timing at all on the swing
getting a bit impatient, moves away and cuts to short third man
tasty! He's so quick on his feet. Badree gave it more flight but de Kock came skipping down the pitch and flogged him over the top
he's not quite timed this pull but it's enough for a couple

a slower ball. One of the slowest of slower balls. The type of slower ball I would deliver, except it would be my quicker ball and I'd rupture my shoulder. De Kock picks it, cracks it, and steals a single
and ends with a dot ball! Funny old over, de Kock went down the pitch looking to smash it straight, completely beaten
more powerfully struck but the placement's not there. Just a single to deep extra cover
backs away and thumps the fuller delivery on middle to mid-off
gives it a bit more air and de Kock slogs too early and can't connect, the ball hits his pad and rolls away
down the track and he lofts this one down to long-on, falls short
drops it short and de Kock goes back and pulls him down to long-on, the bat slips out of de Kock's hand while taking the second run
he goes back and punches it to the off side
this was on the pads and de Kock moved across and played a one legged pull down to deep square leg
this was pitched up and de Kock bashed it down the track and straight to the bowler

soft dismissal! Length ball on leg, and de Kock goes for a reverse paddle. He gloves the ball, and it's lobbed in the air. Dickwella stays at his spot and takes the easiest of catches behind the stumps
full outside leg, and skidding into him. He makes room to tap this down to mid-on, but the ball hits his thigh guard and rolls down to third man
charges him again as this is fullish on middle and the heave-ho misses completely. Bounces comfortably over the stumps. This pitch is quite fresh, folks
full on off, and he tries to play the reverse sweep again. Misses the shot altogether, and it hits Dickwella's gloves
low full toss on leg, and de Kock makes room before slogging over mid-on. One-bounce four
length ball on off, and de Kock makes room to cut. Mistimed to point
full on leg, from around the wicket. Ball straightens after pitching, and QdK misses an expansive sweep
full just outside off, and the slower ball is gently tapped away to cover for a jogging single
full on off, and he drives with the bat's closed face to midwicket
full just outside off, and de Kock goes for the reverse sweep. Misses, and they appeal for lbw but there was a nick
another jaffa to end the over. Slower ball on off, and angling away from de Kock. Mistimes his drive as the ball whizzes past his outside edge

slower ball, full outside off and jagging away from de Kock. He's through his attempted drive too early and the outside edge falls just short of Vandersay at short third man! Vandersay's left hand is bleeding

top-edged over square leg! Lands safely beyond the two infielders, but de Kock wants the third run and this could be trouble. Is Reeza short? Looks like it! South Africa get two runs, but Dickwella has run Hendricks out at the batsman's end
can't get that one away, he tries to force it to the leg side and mistimes it
this one's even better! Coulter-Nile strays a bit too full and that's where he's strong. Whipped away over the midwicket boundary. That's as clean as any you would see
137 kph, shortish on and around off stump. De Kock is fancying giving himself some room. Doesn't succeed as much as he would like as he dabs this to point
now he tries the short one and pays for it, de Kock walks down the pitch and smashed it over deep square leg, the fielder had no chance
swing straight away. Angles the good length ball in at the stumps, but after pitching it swerves away. De Kock is mindful of it and lets it go
142kph, spears this in at the base of off stump and this time the batsman has to play. Digs it out well enough
extra bounce too! This one is pitched shortish and just outside off, De Kock went for a little waft square through the off side. Beaten by the seam away. All that rain is making it's presence felt
that six spoils a good over by Starc, didn't get his length right, pitched up and de Kock lofts him down to the sight screen
full and on middle and leg, De Kock keeps to the crease and nudges to mid-on
this was fired in quick, the yorker a bit too good for de Kock, he fails to dig it out
makes some room and drills this into the covers. Starc goes full around middle and off. De Kock pushes to White at short cover. Nice timing
heads up over long-on! Low full toss, the wet ball the culprit again, de Kock stays there and gives it a whack, high in the air and far too
fires that full outside off and he smashes it to deep cover
length ball with room outside off, he's trying to make him stretch and so De Kock does and pulls through towards the midwicket boundary. There's a man there
god slower ball, foxed the batsman as he looked to slog and missed
De Kock bisects the gap to perfection! From round the wicket and it's a low full  toss and he chips it with power down to deep midwicket, the two deep fielders had no chance
pitched up again and he makes room and scoops it square, over backward point

has to take it on the chin, literally! Was advancing and Starc did not like that at all. Dug this in short at 139 kph and it followed him. Bounced a little more as well and he had to cop it while trying to take evasive action. End of a fiery over
goes for the yorker and de Kock makes room and drives but can't beat backward point
brave enough to pitch it up again, this was drilled down the ground to long-off, fielder's back
138kph, walks at him and mauls this through midwicket. It was length and it was smashed
139 kph, looks like De Kock is all fine but Australia continue the short-ball barrage. This one is too far down leg though. Lets it go and takes a wide
take that! Another one pitched up on the slot, de Kock goes well forward and scoops it over the sightscreen, Watto's bleeding runs
at last a boundary, this was pitched up outside off, mid-off was up, de Kock went well forward and slammed it over that fielder
full on off, and he tries to muscle a shot to the leg side. Muscled to mid-on
tamely chipped to mid-on
length ball on leg, and worked off his pads to square leg. No chance of a single
full toss, very wide outside off, and de Kock stretches towards the ball to tap it away
full on off stump and his bat made a lovely sound as he smacked that over midwicket, but it bounced well short of the rope and the man at deep midwicket stopped it running to his left.
short and wide and he slaps it towards deep backward point
tossed up outside off, driven down to long-off
yet another misfield from NZ, at extra cover, as de Kock slaps a length ball away
very full, almost in the blockhole, eased down the pitch, mid off gets to it
NZ favoured the pull, SA going for the lofted stroke down the ground, de Kock this time, taking a step out and sending a length ball over mid off
short, pulled, without much timing, Franklin scrambles to his left at mid on to stop ot
he looked playing this one, some width outside off, and he instantly slams it past short cover
bowled him! Went for an injudicious sweep to a full ball and was bowled around his legs
fullish outside off, worked away with the turn to deep midwicket
a full toss which, inevitably, he mistimes for a single. Often hard to get full-bungers away
slog-swept but only for one
down the pitch flicking to leg
full toss - that'll be four. No! He's mistimed a pull to mid-on
quicker from Benn this time and he walks into a flick to leg - and again, for two. Well placed. But it's another fumble from Fletcher in the deep
comes down the pitch to crack it square
works this off his pads for a single - no, two, as Russell has for once made a fielding faux pas running around from square leg
much too short but he escapes punishment
creamed out through cover for another single
pushed off the back foot
oh, yes - superb. Picked that up so quickly, pulling it in front of square for four. Wonderful timing
back of a length on off stump, dabbed away towards short third man
full outside off. De Kock shuffles across and swings that  over the mat at deep midwicket. Cummins is the fielder and he leaps in the air but there was no chance he was catching that
slanted across fairly full and he drives to the man at cover
short ball, and that's a confident, swivelling pull from de Kock, but he can't beat the man at square leg
back of a length, a bit of width outside off, and he stands tall and slaps this to cover
a touch too straight, and he whips it off his hips to deep backward square leg
full outside off, driven to mid-off
that's the yorker outside off. De Kock looks to walk across his stumps and play that to fine leg, but he only gets a bottom edge that rolls through to the keeper
his line is all wrong here. This one's called a no-ball. Too short and this goes down leg.
that's a bonus! Starc was looking to bowl a yorker and ended up dragging it wide down the leg side and five wides, too much for Haddin
low full toss seeking the base of leg stump. Think that was because of some late inswing. De Kock nudged towards midwicket and rushes through for a tight single
speared in at leg stump again and De Kock is into a flick too early. Gets a leading edge into the covers.
pulled away as he starts off with a short one at the body. Doesn't have the pace to trouble De Kock
drags the length short and De Kock has pulled towards midwicket. Good placement as the man in the has to run to his left and saves a couple
skips down the track but gets too close to the flighted ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler
shortish ball down the leg side. Looks to pull but can't quite connect. Off his thigh and into the leg side
length ball, rather quick on middle and leg. Goes for the pull again and he's miscued it. Doesn't go past the inner ring, but it goes to the vacant area
down the track now, and he doesn't quite time the drive but gets it into the gap between the stumps and mid-off
back of a length on leg stump. He backed away to make room and slapped that towards point
pierces the gap to perfection. His timing is something. Sweeps this dead square and bisects the two boundary riders. Bit too straight there from Hoggy
tucks him up on middle and leg as he sees the batsman advance, but De Kock is up for the challenge. Pulls to deep midwicket rather hard
flighted just outside off, he lunges forward and steers towards the point region
clipped towards deep midwicket
clipped to short fine leg as he goes forward and fetches this flighted ball from outside off
full on off, and de Kock pushes forward to drive. Huge outside edge and this flies past the keeper's left
full and wide outside off, De Kock stays leg side of it and flat bats it down the ground. Gave himself too much room and gets it off the bottom of the bat
pitches this fuller, he comes onto the front foot and drives to the right of mid-off
full toss on leg stump, De Kock heaves looking to clear the deep square leg boundary. Didn't find the middle and this drops just short of the boundary rider
short of a length outside off, stays leg side and slices to third man
slower ball full outside off, an offcutter. Driven to cover
length ball in at leg stump. Walks down the pitch and clips it out to deep square

length ball skidding across off stump. He gets down and looks to ramp this over short fine. It comes off...something and Taylor holds on in the off side. Umpire says not out...but replays show there's glove on that.
full on off stump, looks to sweep but cops it on the boot outside off
back of a length, and the ball swings back in sharply as de Kock looks to stay leg-side of the ball and stab through the covers, beats his inside edge, and skims over the top of leg stump
back of a length, more off-stumpish this time. Jabbed into the point region
wham. Length ball on leg stump that hardly bounced, and de Kock did his stand and deliver routine, clearing his leg and whacking this over deep square leg

under edge goes past leg stump and brilliant work by Pant to hare across and stop the ball. Good ball, quick one back of a length and de Kock was backing away, but too close to cut. He plays it with a horizontal bat
oh that one's just dismissive. Too short and he opens his hips, rocks back and pulls mightily over square leg. Deflating to see that as a bowler
still back of a length and he goes back to pull once again. Doesn't quite nail it though, and deep midwicket is able to run around and field

brilliant fielding by Iyer at cover. Too short and going across, de Kock lashes it powerfully off the back foot and that seemed headed for the cover boundary but Iyer dives full length to his right and stops the ball
angles across him and ends up well wide of off stump, de Kock throws his bat at it and sends it to deep point
length on off stump, punched firmly to mid-off's right and a good early call to steal the single despite a direct hit
bowls a good surprise bouncer but de Kock is seeing them so well and able to play late so he stays still and upper cuts it, though he can't beat short third man
good length on off, spinning away, he's backing away to make room and punches, but straight to cover

loud appealbut there's no review left! That looked way closer than the one on which the review was lost. He was going across to sweep and was beaten, pitched on middle and leg and turned a mite to strike him on the pad
backing away to give himself room but Washington follows him to deny room, and de Kock jabs it away from closer to his body than he would have liked through cover
nicely struck, but there is protection at deep midwicket. Went down to sweep hard and connected well
length ball on the stumps, but de Kock backs away to square drive this through point
brings out the reverse sweep and nails it sweetly through point, but there is a man deep who cuts it off
wide, but that ball was doing things. Pitched outside leg and turning away, sharp turn and steep bounce, making it a difficult fumbling take for Pant
not that short, but de Kock goes deep in his crease and absolutely leathers this over long-on. Pure force, rather than timing and clears the boundary
given a bit more air, but drifts down leg and is tickled to backward square leg
good length angling in on middle and leg, turned to short fine leg
popped up in the air but safe. de Kock goes well across and tries to flick it, intended to go more square but the ball's stopping on occasion and he pops it into a vacant deep mid-on region
tossed up, well wide of off, he goes down on one knee to try and drive through extra cover. Gets it lower on the bat and mistimes it to long-off
flatter outside off, goes for the big heave, fetching the sweep from there, but doesn't connect cleanly. Sends it rolling through midwicket
length ball angling across, de Kock gets down low and strokes it through cover
too short, and you can't bowl those gimme balls to de Kock when he's in this touch. Sits up to be whacked and de Kock obliges, carting it to the backward square leg boundary
this time he connects! Full outside off, a lovely swing of the arms, drives up and over mid-off
length on off, flourishing drive but there's a packed off-side cordon and he can't pierce it
back of a length outside off, slapped to deep point
length ball turning in towards off stump. Shuffles across and tucks it just behind square on the leg side
full again, angling in towards off stump from slightly wide of the crease. Whipped away towards long-on
full, on middle and leg. Goes for the leg-side whip, goes too early, and the ball dribbles away into the off side off the leading edge
short, down the leg side, but he has protection at fine leg to mop up as de Kock swivels and pulls
shortish outside off, pulled with the turn to deep midwicket
lbw shout as de Kock misses the reverse-sweep, but he had shuffled across and the impact was outside off stump. The ball rolls away off the pad into the midwicket region
shortish, at the hip, and de Kock whips it over the top and finds the backward square leg boundary
fuller now, clipped away through square leg
full-toss - was it above waist height? Tucked off the hip into the leg side, not called no ball
fullish on middle and off, driven down to the left of mid-off
length ball, a little slower than usual, swiped away to long-on
short, turning down leg, and de Kock whips it away off his hip and just about manages to beat Saini diving to his right at the deep backward square leg boundary. Brings up his half-century too
backing away, and Chahar keeps it on a length outside off. The ball isn't coming on and de Kock only toe-ends it towards cover
just short of a length on off stump, opens up at the hips and pulls to long-on
full at the stumps, pushed just to the on side and they steal a quick single
length ball at off stump, 115kph, a slower one, angled to backward point
it is a driving length, but de Kock's timing and execution mean it races through cover point for a boundary
length ball, quicker on the stumps, punched to cover
fuller, angling into him, turned to midwicket, where Hardik fires in a return throw
flatter and darting in, worked off the back foot to mid-on
fuller on the stumps, punch-driven to cover, where Rohit dives to his right to pull off a good save
it's all happening - a steered edge that bounces to slip, and Kohli throws down the stumps at the striker's end seeing de Kock look for a run, but the batsman gets back in time
length ball outside off, coming in a touch, steered to the man on the point boundary
given some air, fuller on off, he stays low and chops it to backward point

if you can beat Jadeja in the field you have to have hit it well - and that's what de Kock's done. Laced through cover with exquisite timing and though Jadeja is sprinting from a widish long-off, even he can't get to it quick enough to stop it
slightly short of a length and he goes back to whip it, but misses and is hit on the pads - clearly going down leg

what. A. Catch. Kohli takes it, running to his left from mid-off and then finishing with a tumble. It's just short of a length from Saini, an offcutter angling across the stumps. De Kock clears his front leg and looks to go over midwicket, and ends up slicing it back over the bowler's head instead, a little to the off side, and Kohli had a lot of ground to cover, but he makes it up with a brilliant bit of athleticism
better length and tighter line, on the stumps, pushed to mid-off

inside out cover drive from down on one knee and what a way to raise fifty. He's done pretty much what he wanted with the bowling apart from that slightly fortuitous lbw reprieve. This was another off cutter but not as short and not as wide of the stumps, allowing him to pull off the stroke
slower ball but loses his radar. Digs it into the pitch short, but it grips and turns a long way. Was the off-cutter but got turn like a spinner and ended up wide of de Kock outside off
in the channel, draws his length back a tad, wild play-and-miss from de Kock
pitched up and crunched over point, all the way for six! De Kock lands the first proper blow of the contest, freeing up the arms and walloping Topley into the crowd
bit of width this time, reaches for the shot and thick-edges a single to third man to get off the mark
whirring in on a good length, no room for Quinny to free the arms, squired along the ground to backward point
fuller, angling in with the arm, bunted into the covers - bit of a grimace, he thinks he ought to have wellied that one
slightly back-of-a-length ball outside off, de Kock gingerly taps it square
crunches a drive off the front foot to mid-off
back of a length, taken on the pad as he again aims to leg but that pitched fairly short and must have been outisde leg
a might swing across the line as this slides across outside off
over the wicket, full at off stump, swung without much footwork through the leg side
outside off, full, he comes forward and drives between cover and point
gets the line wrong, and clears deep square with a strong flick off his pads, just has the legs to clear the man on the rope. Similar to how he fell in the ODI series in Adelaide
fuller, outside off, driven firmly to the covers and there's a superb save by McDermott
de Kock collars him again, lofted over cover for four! Flowing stroke through the line and that's a second boundary in three balls
short of a length, angled into the pads, worked backward of square
short of long-on by a safe distance. Short of a length and rising into his body as he backs into the leg side again. Wants to lift it over cover on the up but it's off the inside half
short and just outside off, this time he shuffles into the leg side. It's a slower ball but the length allows De Kock time to adjust and caress this cut between point and cover point

whack! A stunning connection and a gorgeous sound as this flies off the bat. It's a short ball across off stump. He shuffles early so he's already in position for the hook. The execution is perfect. This blazes over long leg
length ball hurrying him on the pads again. He flicks to short fine
Beaten. short and wide outside off, backs away for the cut but is beaten as it rises too much.
follows him down leg side with a length ball as De Kock looks to open up the off side. But there's enough time for the adjustment and he clips this over square leg
full on leg stump, backs away to try and drive through the covers. Ends up slicing behind square on the off
beaten. Another clumsy cross-batted shot from De Kock. It's a full ball outside off and he's stuck in a half-sweep
short and wide outside off, cut straight to backward point
short and just outside off, backs away and chops to third man
length ball into the pads. Leans into it and punches it wide of midwicket. Deep square sprints to his right and puts in a slide to stop this
full toss with a lot of width outside off. He stays put in the crease and creams it through cover point with an open face
full on off stump, punched to long-on off the front foot

taps it on to the stumps and Mavuta breaks into his celebratory jig. Length ball skids across off stump, he looks to turn it into the leg side, anticipating turn on that, but it's off the inside edge, onto his pad, and into off stump
four more, slapped through cover point with impunity! Poor from Topley, offering too much width without any protection and de Kock pierces the off side again
gets this tight to off stump, dabbed down in front of point
beaten slashing impetuously outside off again, not the length for it
quick bouncer to end after a couple of slower balls and he beats the batsman's attempted pull
finds that tough back of a length outside off that sucks the pace out of the ball, de Kock slaps it from outside off but can't go past the in-field

de Kock knows what's coming, and he just dismisses it. Another back of length ball on the stumps, he's waiting for that line and he opens his hips and swings his bat in a pleasing arc to cart this over square leg
and now he goes short and across, it grips hard but goes too far wide of off and is a wide
the bowler compensates by going outside off, back of a length and de Kock seems to have read his mind because he's in position early and flat bats a drive over extra cover
length ball closer to off stump, punched to cover
too short again and de Kock unleashes a pull but keeps it down this time so only a single to deep square
whipped off his hips to deep square leg, from slightly short of length
regal stuff by de Kock. full and wide outside off, goes down on one knee and unleashes a cover drive that goes over the in-field pings into the fence
slapped past point
slog-sweep time, and that's another one nailed to perfection. Confident step forward goes down on one knee having picked the length early and corks it over deep midwicket
pulls through midwicket and that's the second consecutive fifty-run stand
goes back and works this off his pads to short fine leg, using his wrists
quicker and flatter on off, tapped to deep midwicket
slightly short of a length and de Kock was looking to pull through midwicket but gets it a bit higher on the bat to send it rolling to long-on

smashed into the leg side... but he finds the fielder! England have the breakthrough - but have they already been broken? De Kock continued to give the bowling merry hell but this came off the toe of the bat and went straight to the man at deep midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, nurdled to the leg side for one more
tossed up and knocked short into the leg side

full on the legs, and he's picked the gap again! That's fifty, from 21 balls, equalling the SA record de Villiers set against England in that previously mentioned match... Brilliantly placed between two men in the deep
full and straight and bunted off the legs
pitched up in the slot and hammered over cover, another four ball and de Kock accepts it with a grin
pitched up on the pads from over the wicket, gets a bit of inside edge on it
some respite, tossed up and tapped away from the crease

delicate stuff, another boundary for Quinny! Moeen went over the wicket, pushed it through outside off and de Kock dabbed it late past Buttler and away - South Africa raise their 50 from just 23 balls

oh my word, that's huge! Flayed over cover, that's hit the front of the second tier of stand.... Willey screams in frustration, it was slightly overpitched and de Kock thrashed it into the crowd. Tumescent over for SA
four more! Pitched up in the channel and rasped through point, de Kock is racking them up, drilled through square from back in the crease
four more, through mid-on this time! De Kock is on fire here, no need for many sighters, stands back and larrups a shorter ball past the man no the edge of the ring
crrrrrrrrrrrrrunched! Straight back down the ground for six! He's confident in the pitch to walk down and thwack Willey back over the top, flies over the rope at long-off
angled in a touch straighter, 82mph and hitting de Kock on the pads as he got outside off and tried to club over the leg side
length ball on the stumps, clearing his leg again, hoicks it to a wide mid-on. Doesn't play it in the air
angled into him, almost a yorker, he makes room and opens the face of the bat to drive, but a good tumbling shot from Dhawan at point prevents a run
smoked. Stays in his crease and goes back to drive this powerfully through extra cover.
gives himself room to try and lash it through the offside but Chahar keeps it on a length and on the stumps, and he under-edges it down
slid through quick to hit the pad, they pinch a leg bye
Rashid unfurls the googly, Qdk goes back, he did not pick it. Edged towards point
pitched up outside off and punched along the carpet to mid-off
nails a yorker on middle, 91ks, dug out
short, slow ball outside off, which is dragged to mid-on

full and straight, de Kock plays across the line again... and this time the top edge ends up in the hands of the bowler! It was a slower ball from Coulter-Nile, cutting his fingers over it, deceived de Kock and the ball went straight up to be taken halfway down the pitch
dug in at 134kph, rising outside off as de Kock plays an angled bat, checks a pull down into the leg side
length ball, straighter line and de Kock is off the mark with a dab through backward square leg
shortish on the hips, tucked away for one more
dug in short, de Kock tries to pull and gets hit on the shoulder
consecutive sixes for Qdk. He backs away and slices this full ball deliberately over the covers. Opened the face and sent it skimming to the boundary
and Qdk welcomes him back with a stroke of authority - six. Length and outside off, he hits through the line, launching it over mid-off
back of a length and lifts outside off, cuts in the air, just eludes backward point
lashed over the covers, free-flowing stroke from de Kock, just a step out to the line and cleared the infield
short ball from Hazlewood and this is crumped through midwicket on the pull for de Kock's first boundary
Qdk steps out and across to open up the off side. He takes it on the full and crunches it in the gap at the covers
back of a length and comes in to catch the thigh pad. It was heading down leg
loose ball, too full and wide outside off, Qdk reaches out and carves it up and over backward point. Qdk is off like a fast train, again
short and just a shade outside off, Qdk has a big whoosh and does not connect
shortish and curls in, punched out to midwicket
swerves down the leg side, fine leg is up in the circle, Dawlat escapes punishment. Off the pad and rolls behind square
full and swings in at 139ks, Qdk hurriedly gets his front foot out of the way, brings his bat down, and whips it away in the gap at midwicket, fourth four for Qdk
on a length and slid across off, Qdk camps back and dabs it towards short third man
fired across off again at 92ks, Qdk uses the pace of the bowler and cracks it through the covers. Fast start for SA
darted on off, Qdk makes some room outside leg, mis-hits it back to the bowler
pushed through on middle, skidded on, QdK goes low and sweeps to the left of the square-leg ump for four
width outside off, that's a gift. Slides across off at 96ks, QdK tears up the wrapper and cuts it behind point, beats the two men there
drifts in on off, Qdk hangs back and defends it towards midwicket
Qdk leaves the crease again, he can only drag this leg-stump ball towards square leg off an inside edge
swings to leg, across the line and gets a big top edge... that sails over the slips and ends up bouncing towards the rope, third man coming across to prevent four
shortish, on the body, nudged to leg
good length, in the channel and again de Kock reaches for it, half an appeal for caught behind but nothing doing
that's how you do it JP, says de Kock. Smeared over the extra cover boundary! Dances down the track to reach the pitch and launches it. I love how he swings his bat all the way through
looked to sweep this good length ball on leg and then decides against it. Nudged towards square leg
worked away towards the covers. They need a few more of these singles right now
waits on the length ball just outside off and dabs in front of point
fuller and flatter delivery bowled down the leg side. Will have to bowl that again
slower ball, holds up on the pitch to spoil the cut shot
short ball on middle and leg, he's set up on the back foot and pulls towards deep square leg
fullish and on the pads, nudged towards deep midwicket
loopy delivery on leg stump lures De Kock to play against the turn. The flick through midwicket materialises as a leading edge to short third man
hacked to long-on as this is tossed up on leg stump
too much flight that time. Ends up a low full toss way outside off and de Kock has slashed this in front of point. Skims off the saw dust inside the circle, but the man in the deep mops up

that is a corker! de Kock can just tuck his bat in under his shoulder and walk back. Tossed up on middle and leg but once this hits the pitch it turns viciously. He was playing with a closed bat looking for midwicket. Only manages an outside edge through to the keeper's gloves. Terrific take from Haddin as well. There's another golden oldies combo
first runs. Length outside leg stump, and clipped off his hips past the gap on the leg side. Deep backward square runs around
back-to-back boundaries! Full outside off, and he bends his knee to cut this perfectly through the backward point region. Third man is too fine
a good comeback! Back of a length outside off, and coming into the batsman's body. He tried to flick towards midwicket, but the ball hits his bat and then almost rolls back onto the stumps. Almost

top edged to deep midwicket! And this is a big wicket for Zimbabwe. Quick on off, and the length ball isn't high enough for the pull. Eventually slices a grounded pull-shot over to the leg side and Chibhabha takes a smart catch running forward
back of a length, de Kock dabs his first ball down into the leg side and calls for a sharp single... would have been tight if Zampa collected cleanly running in from midwicket

Qdk has nicked behind! Hamza lobs it up in the air, it hangs there, and dips outside off. Qdk goes low for a sweep to the leg side. He only manages an under edge. Shahzad juggles but hangs on to the thigh-high take
another leg-stump ball, catches the pad and sneaks away to leg
pitched outside leg, off the pad and wanders to short fine leg as Qdk does not make contact with a sweep
faster one from Shenwari, tickled to the leg side
skids on outside off, helped to short third man with an open face
short and a bit wide outside off, cut away easily to deep cover
fired on off, dabbed towards short third man
Rashid gives this more air outside off, legbreak that foxes Qdk
full on middle and leg, goes low and sweeps it firmly through backward square leg
another short ball, this heads down leg. Instead of slamming it away, Qdk pulls it to backward square leg
excellent start, teasing line and it has de Kock fumbling like a lusty teenager outside off, beats the outside edge
fired down the leg side
full and just outside off, drilled down to long-on and that makes it just three off the over.
nicely bowled, cranking up the pace and the ball nibbles back past the inside edge
hoicked over midwicket for four more! This was a decent length ball from Hazlewood, no width on offer but de Kock manufactured an angle to hit to leg
another legbreak from Faulkner, steered through point to the sweeper

bowled him, de Kock is chopped down! Looked like he played around a full toss but Faulkner is happy either way... It was full and straight, he tried to clip to leg and got an inside edge on to his stumps
length ball pushed wide outside off, left alone
beaten. That launches steeply off a good length outside off. He's trying to drive on the up but it gets too big
length ball slanting across off. Walks down and looks to clip it to mid-on. The bowler gets across quickly enough to prevent a quick single
flatter, slides under the bottom edge as de Kock comes down the pitch, and offers a simple stumping for Carey
big appeal for lbw as de Kock misses a conventional sweep and Finch calls the review...has it struck him outside the line of off stump? No bat involved. Yes, it's outside the line
starts a touch short, de Kock again moving to the leg side, drives behind point and a slip in the deep allows a third
attempts a reverse sweep, takes the pad into the leg side
nearly drags this on as he moves outside leg, it's fired in by Maxwell, takes the bottom edge
glorious a little wide and full and he leans into a peachy looking cover drive that threads the in-field.
given room and he goes back and across to cut it, doesn't try to hit too hard, but doesn't find the gap, straight to point
fuller and closer to off stump now, patted down the ground to long-off
length ball outside off, drops back and dabs to backward point... and Marsh's throw isn't far from catching out de Kock as he scrambled back to his crease
fuller outside off, not much swing first up, stroked into the covers but not in the gap
speared through extra cover. Not much follow through to speak of, but great timing by de Kock, who drives this on the up from outside off
he's picking them all over. Too full on the stumps and he effortlessly flicks this through midwicket to the boundary. 3 in 3! all to different parts of the ground
given room outside off and he unleashes a free-flowing drive but this time it's to the fielder at cover
length ball, on the stumps, glided to third man. Stayed still in his crease and played it late
imperious. Down on one knee and square drives this through point and threads the gap again. Given room outside off and he could free his arms, but did it so pleasingly
too full on leg stump, clipped off his pads to deep square leg. This is looking like a batting beauty - or perhaps it's just de Kock who's making it look so
too full outside off, and unleashes a powerful drive, but extra cover moves to his right and intercepts
darting into the stumps, pushed towards cover and the bowler runs across to his right to field
quicker one at 97 kph on the stumps, jabs it back towards the bowler
given a bit more room outside off and he square drives it, but straight to point
came down the track but ended up yorking himself to one that was given more air
length on middle and leg, he goes back and whips it through midwicket

just clears Kohli running back from mid-on. Good ball from Chahar, who bowls a surprise short one and gets it to climb a bit higher than de Kock anticipated. He goes for the pull but ends up toe-ending it over mid-on. Kohli's quick but it falls just over him
thick edge from an attempted drive outside off, and it flies over where second slip would be into the third man boundary
slower ball, out the back of the hand and this deceives de Kock, who plays and misses
full on leg stump, de Kock gets down low to sweep, sends the ball skimming away wide of short fine leg - third four in the over
overpitched ball just outside off. Leans in nicely as he drives through the line but he can't get this past cover who is diving to his right
short ball, shovelled away through backward square leg and a good diving stop prevents four more
back of a length, de Kock knocks it back in the direction of the bowler
extra pace on this, 143kph from Hastings and it flies through past an airy swipe from de Kock
flipped around the corner, cute shot from de Kock, moving across and sending a length ball over short fine leg and away for four
misses again with a big ole yahoo down the ground
short outside off, de Kock again attempts to hit the cover off it, fails to connect. Hastings demanding respect
skips out to hit Hazelwood off his length, clears mid-on and that'll bounce away
drags it a little shorter and this is hammered on the up over midwicket, back-to-back fours for Quinny

oh my word! That's extraordinary... This time he targets the off side, opens up his body and launches an uppercut over the covers, it sails through the thin Highveld air several metres back into the crowd. Woof!
short ball at the body, nudged away to leg
round the wicket, pushed through on off stump, tapped away

and strikes! Sliced down to third man...full outside off, de Kock swinging with all his power behind it, the face opens and the ball flies in the air towards Hastings at third man who takes a smart, low catch
full and wide outside off, driven to deep cover
that's a lovely bit of cricket, he walks across his stumps and picks up a short-of-a-length delivery with a flick over short fine leg
he has a huge mow at this delivery which is fuller, aiming over the leg side but it skews off a thick outside edge over short third man
nearly chops on, a short of a length delivery which he defends quite late and the ball bounces back towards the stumps...actually goes over middle and leg
bangs this one in short around leg stump, pulled to deep square
uses his feet, comes down on a line outside leg stump and then flicks this very powerfully wide of mid-on
Hastings is a touch lucky here as he offers de Kock a hint of width, he cuts but finds short third man...there was no one behind him
full at off stump, a lovely flick by de Kock as his bottom hand comes into play and sends this zipping through midwicket
back of length on off stump line, the batsman stays on the crease and pushes it towards midwicket
adjust his line back outside off, short of a length, pushed towards point where there's a fumble by Zampa but it isn't costly
gets too straight this time and de Kock whips him away off leg stump down to fine leg
pushed across full and wide outside off, and he doesn't get away with a loosener
back of a length at off stump, defended to backward point
slightly short and de Kock crunches a pull through square leg, quickly into position to dispatch it for four
goes again, too short and straight from Maxwell, rocks back and slams it to the deep square leg boundary
floated up a bit slower, pushed into the off side
tossed up outside off, goes back to cut but finds the fielder at backward point
back of a length and hits de Kock on the body as he tries to work to leg

caught by mid off fielder at long on! Wow. de Kock went for the big shot down the ground to this fuller delivery on the off stump line, but got under it too much. That went miles in the air and Corey Anderson runs in from mid-off to slide in take that comfortably around the long-on area. Zooper catch!
short from Ajmal as de Kock has ample time to get on the back foot and power this away to the midwicket gap for a boundary

de Kock's strategy of stepping down to nearly every delivery worked well so far, but he has missed this one and is stranded a long way out, Sangakkara has loads of time to take off the bails, Senanayake ends an enterprising innings, that ball moved in towards the pads instead of spinning away
length ball outside off, clipped down the ground
flat and around the line of off, de Kock gets forward and steers one more into a gap on the off side
tossed up, on the stumps, de Kock comes down the track and jams his bat next to pad
gives this some air, de Kock comes out of his crease, cross-bats it down the ground to long-off
whipped away, de Kock wristily pulling a length ball flat and hard, it spins and pierces the gap behind deep midwicket, super stroke
flighted, worked with the turn through the leg side, finds space again - de Kock is sailing here
angled across the lefty, who goes back and chops one more through backward point
slower ball, de Kock hasn't picked this... but he's still hit it for six! He was aiming down the ground and that's where it ended up, just managing to clear the rope despite the miscue
shot, hint of width to work with, de Kock stays leg side of it and carves it backward of poin
straighter line and whipped wide of long leg but Jordan scrambles very well to save two

caught at square leg! Quinton de Kock comes down the pitch, Swart bowls this on the pads and de Kock has to play this to the on side, the bat turned, perhaps not where he intended to place the ball, square leg was pushed slightly back and an easy catch
back of a length and wide, that was there to be hit and de Kock mistimed it to cover
straighter line on a similar length, pulled hard but straight to the deep square leg
short leg side but again de Kock finds the fielder with a strong pull, this reaches long leg
got him, Cummins makes the breakthrough with a fast short ball! Banged in, little bit of cut on the ball and de Kock was hurried trying to pull, just a tickle of glove and it's safely pouched by Dunk
full on leg stump, flicked out to deep square leg
opens up his stance and steers the ball through point, they get back for two
smeared over cover, de Kock is on the charge! Using the feet again, comes out to thump a length ball to the boundary
full outside off, pushed to point
Three boundaries in the first four balls for Qdk. Floated too full and outside off, he leans into it and drives it on the up between mid-off and the covers
back of a length and skidding into Qdk, he hangs back and squirts a single to square leg
starts off with a short ball outside off, Qdk gives himself some room and slashes to backward point
Qdk steps down the track, meets a short ball on middle, and punches down the ground for one
pushed through on off, tip and run to the covers
dug in shorter, the connection on the pull isn't clean but they pick up a couple into the leg side
back of a length and skids back in from round the wicket, de Kock goes on the back foot and inside-edges it away to the leg side

slider on the pads, Qdk now ventures a slog sweep, and takes it on the pad, as the ball wanders away square on the leg side. Dananjaya appears for lbw, but this heading down leg. De Kock and Reeza chance a leg bye. But Sandakan swoops down on the ball and throws it to Dananjaya, who takes the bails off to catch Qdk short. Qdk was ball-watching and ultimately pays the price. Lazy running from him
dismissive from de Kock, pulled powerfully over mid-on and away for the third boundary of the over! The pitch is maybe holding up a touch, Bollinger not quite quick enough and de Kock batters him
shortish, goes back and deflects one to short third man
better line, in the channel outside off, de Kock heaves again, misses
down the leg side, de Kocks swings hard... wide
back of a length, at the batsman, helped round the corner and this beats short fine leg and will run away
Qdk takes this full one from the stumps and dares to reverse sweep. He paddles it away fine of short third man.
length ball at the body, dropped into square leg for an easy run
well down leg, Buttler dived to take it nicely to his right
around the wicket, full on middle and leg, worked into midwicket for an easy run
de Kock going for another wild cross-batted stroke, this time he gets closer to the ball than on the previous delivery, but only close enough to get a thin edge through to the keeper
a wild slog from de Kock as he looks to thrash a ball past point, plenty of bounce there for Mills, too much for de Kock
short of length ball slanting across, de Kock whips that towards midwicket from well outside off
starts with one well outside off, mistimed stroke from de Kock sends the ball past the bowler for a single
short of length once more, 129kph, keeping it around off, carved towards extra cover or a single, a quiet start to the game
length ball on off stump, lashed towards point where Williamson fields

down the wicket, de Kock runs straight past it and this time Buttler completes the stumping with a sharp piece of work but that was equally as straightforward as the Amla chance. Tredwell did de Kock in the flight really, who came out of his ground and got nowhere near the pitch of the ball, tried to steer it into the leg side but missed
pushed back towards the bowler
de Kock makes some room and Cummins follows with a fairly full ball, and he whips it away to deep midwicket
bouncer slanted outside off, too high for the batsman to reach
full outside off, driven to deep cover

dropped It's all going wrong for Australia. Cummins hurries de Kock with that bouncer. He goes for the pull, top-edges it, and White runs to his left from short midwicket, dives to his left to take it inches off the ground but can't wrap his fingers around it
flat and full on off stump, clears his front leg and swats it down the ground to long-off
down the track again, gets inside the line, and goes over the covers this time, to beat long-off running to his right
short of length ball on the pads, clipped towards midwicket
full length just outside off, whipped down to long-off
slower ball, de Kock meets it on the full and drives wide of deep cover who, running to his right, can't save two
around the wicket, just outside off stump, carved without timing wide of point for a single
slides on as de Kock tries to sweep and gets struck on the pad
waited for, rocked back and cut hard backward of point, lovely stroke, touch short delivery
tossed up and he comes forward and defends
paddle swept and Dernbach at short long leg rather dives over it and concedes a couple
slower, more air, forward just blocking is de Kock
short around off stump and pulled without timing to mid-on
another pull, not timed again but this is forced through midwicket for an easy single
length on the off stump, flicked through square leg
full and de Kock tries to sweep and misses
down the wicket and worked through square leg, just a single again
low full toss on off stump, punched down to long-on
full length just outside off, driven out to deep cover
low full toss just outside off, the drive finds deep cover
waited for in the crease and carved out to deep cover with the ball sliding across him
full at the off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
full and curving into leg stump, patted only as far as mid-on
quicker one outside off goes past the outside edge
short ball outside off, pushed down to long-off
short of length towards off, turned to backward square leg
he makes room again and doesn't succeed on the cut, ends up chopping it to the off side
good length on the pads and he shuffles and clips it down to short fine leg
he bowls it full on the off stump and he smashes it straight to mid-off
this was banged in short and it's too high for de Kock to chase, he makes room and withdraws
superb placement, he makes room to a full delivery moving away and he drives him wide of mid-off and cover
fires that full on the off stump and he makes room and thuds it down the ground wide of mid-off, didn't have to run, de Kock looking dangerous
he succeeds this time! Backs away, he has the width he was looking for and cuts hard wide of backward point
confident shout for an lbw! This one straightened and it hit his pads as he went forward, may have hit him outside the line of off stump
this was a touch wide outside the off stump and he fetches it and pulls to midwicket
he makes room again and this time slaps it straight to sweeper cover
this was flatter and on the pads and he works it away down to short fine leg
doesn't take long for Mendis to strike! Looked like the leg break, he was forward and it skidded through and hit the base of the pads in front of the off stump
swipes a fuller delivery on off stump to long-on

they're taking the fielders on, Mashrafe is fuming at his team's work so far. De Kock had basically given up, and a few feet away from making his ground, he watches a trigger throw racing past the stumps. Push to extra cover should have been fatal, could have been if the fielder had waited for Mash to get in position
he clips this one towards square leg
de Kock once again looks to break free by making room, pushes this one down to mid-off
after five dot balls de Kock breaks free, this was pitched up and he scoops it over cover but doesn't time it well enough
he makes room to slap this away and ends up hitting straight to mid-off
pushed to the right of the bowler, who dives and fields it
length on off stump, punched to cover

what happened there? Went for the reverse-sweep. It was outside leg, and he ended up gloving it, the keeper messes up a simple chance, snatching at it, parrying it away, and nearly falling on his stumps in a doomed effort to retrieve the ball
got him. He came down the track, making room to hit through the off side, and ended up driving straight into the hands of short cover
on line this time, de Kock hops back and defends from the crease
left-arm over the wicket, starts on a shortish length but this slides down the leg side

got him, extra pace and bounce and de Kock feathers through to Dunk! Nothing stroke from de Kock, just hung his bat out - but the ball fair zipped through off the surface, seamed a fraction, took a small but visible deflection off the edge and South Africa are one down
gallops in, pitches slightly back of a length, on middle and leg, de Kock taps gently into the on side
slides that down the leg side, there was some sound as the ball passed the bat as de Kock went for the sweep, the umpire calls it wides as both the batsman and keeper miss it
length ball, goes with the angle towards middle. Comes forward to defend, plays for the turn, rolls off inside edge towards square leg
right on target, on the middle stump and he goes right back and tucks it to mid-on
good length outside off and sort of keeps lower than expected, de Kock stabs it back to the bowler
de Kock makes room and cuts hard and Senanayake does brilliantly at backward point to fall to his right and stop it
testing inswinging yorker, quite quick too, de Kock tries to flick and hits it to the pads, nearly loses his balance
another misfield! Costs them a single. de Kock eases a shortish offcutter away to the left of point. Sabbir moves in line with it, but then lets it through
down the track now and he he launches this over the bowler's head with a full, fluid batswing
shortish and outside off, de Kock claps it away to the sweeper
advances, but Shakib pulls his length back and round-arms it outside off. Forces de Kock to block
length delivery and de Kock pulls at it, doesn't manage to connect
skips forward and manufactures a cross-batted drive wide of mid-off
fuller on middle, driven back to Irfan who does well to stop with his left hand
back of length on off and coming in, de Kock turns it towards deep square leg for two
de Kock makes room but can't get this short of length ball past cover
short outside off, not much room for de Kock who pulls and it goes to mid-on
gets hold of him and that's a Dorothy, straight down the ground! Pitched up and de Kock targets the short boundary, free swing of the arms and it thuds into the boards - lovely sight
bouncer goes past de Kock's head as he tried to pull but couldn't connect
inside-edged fine past the leg stump for four. Fortunate four for SA. Just short of a good length and angling away outside off, Qdk does not move his feet much, jabs at it and gets away
short of length on off, tucks it to midwicket
full on off, de Kock makes room and lofts it down the ground. He didn't middle it and it was just out of mid-off's reach
full outside off and de Kock crashed this one through the covers. Nobody moved an inch as it raced away to the boundary
short of length outside off, de Kock cuts to third man
much fuller and straighter, Qdk presses forward and drives it handsomely between midwicket and mid-on for an emphatic four this time
short of length and coming in, inside edge goes towards Tanvir at short fine leg and he fumbles twice but can't stop it. The deep backward square leg fielder comes to the rescue
shuffles across and steers the ball into a gap at midwicket
beaten for pace, back of a length and de Kock rolled his wrists on an attempted pull, no bat on it
goes back and opens the face, short third man does good work but can't prevent the single
carefully worked away behind square leg, two yell the two batsmen and it's well on. Another awful throw from deep square leg, Shakib can't be bothered to get behind it either. Sloppy work
flighted on the pads, swept to short fine leg
some turn back to the left-hander as Shakib goes around the wicket. de Kock stays beside the line and pushes to extra cover
good length and outside off, sliced to cover
another off cutter on middle, de Kock works it smartly to midwicket. Already it appears the pitch is quicker than on Sunday
adjusts his length. Makes it shorter, but de Kock is comfortably behind it. Rolls the wrists to send it to deep square leg
picks the gap to the left of fine leg. Seam up delivery angled in on middle and leg, de Kock clips it off his toes
flighted on middle, de Kock leans forward to defend
flighted on off, driven down to long-off for one
length on the stumps, angling in with the arm and worked into a gap at midwicket this time

flicked off the pads, de Kock using the angle and Bollinger's pace, this is neatly played because it has eluded James Faulkner running from deep square leg, diving attempt but can't prevent the ball rolling on to the ropes
fuller length, de Kock leans out and dabs one into a gap at midwicket
angled into the pads, steered to square leg for two
on the stumps, reaches out and drives to find the cover fielder on the edge of the ring
short of length outside off, de Kock cuts and doesn't get the middle of the bat
that time he doesn't adjust to the batsman racing down. De Kock surprises the wily Shakib and sends the ball soaring away to the midwicket boundary
slower bouncer outside off and he ends up defending it into the off side with a wristy whipping motion
slower ball, angling away outside off and de Kock smacks that drive straight to cover
slower ball, and he goes deep in his crease to pull that towards deep square leg
driven towards long-off for a single
de Kock swings across the line but mis-hits the ball towards square leg, he was aiming for midwicket
de Kock stays back and taps the ball off his pads behind square leg
played off the pads through square leg for one more
de Kock's smashed the ball hard and straight at Faf, who wears it on the arm at the non-striker's end, they don't run off the rebound
de Kock heaves across the line and is beaten outside off stump
makes room by moving outside leg, Hafeez pauses in his action and then delivers, de Kock plays the ball to cover
he's smashed that so hard, making room and swinging powerfully after taking two steps out of his crease, the ball skids past the fielder at long-off
Hafeez going round to de Kock, who defends this carefully back to the bowler
doesn't take him long to deposit this long-hop from Hafeez all the way to the midwicket boundary. Seems a signature shot that one from de Kock.
back of a length and de Kock defends this watchfully back to Hafeez
spears this one in on middle as de Kock tries to squirt this away to the off side
de Kock glances this length ball off his pads to run a quick single
de Kock gets forward to clip this through midwicket for a single

that's superbly caught on the long-on boundary! De Kock was aiming for the innings' first six but mis-hit the ball towards long-on. It nearly carried too! Tanvir was on the boundary and he took a few steps back and to his left to catch the ball right on the edge. He kept his balance to give Pakistan their second wicket
139 kph, the bouncer is too high, de Kock lets it go over his head
de Kock charges and moves outside leg, Bhatti counters with a short of a length slower ball, de Kock doesn't have the room and he works it off his hips on the leg side
fuller and straighter from Bhatti, de Kock flicks off the pads through square
