that's quite an amazing shot. The ball was full and outside off stump, de Kock leaned forward and across and used his wrists to whip it through midwicket, beating the fielder at deep square leg. Superb timing and he played that all along the ground

de Kock steps out of his crease and swings his bat like a golf club, he was aiming straight down the ground but ended up hitting the ball wide of the fielder at mid-on, and the timing is good enough to take it to the boundary
strays down leg side this time, a pretty horrific start from Pakistan
played from his crease towards point
played off the pads behind square
good length around off stump, de Kock drives from his crease and mis-times it on the off side
phew! De Kock has latched on to a slightly short delivery, getting into position in a flash to pull the ball between midwicket and mid-on. He hit that off the front foot. Dismissive
and now Junaid's given him a little width outside off and de Kock frees his arms and lashes it through point with a fierce cut
that's not that short and de Kock mis-times the pull to midwicket

carnage at Wanderers. De Kock charges at the bowler, Junaid bowls a full toss wide outside off, de Kock reaches for it, lunging to his left, and manages to flat-bat it past the bowler and between mid-off and mid-on
defended on the back foot
goes round the wicket to the left-hander, de Kock defends
played from the crease on the leg side
de Kock stays in his crease and cuts the ball hard towards point, he hit that from in front of his stumps
that's streaky, de Kock was aiming for the big heave over midwicket, the ball pitched outside leg and angled across the left-hander, it flew off the outside edge to the third man boundary
hesitates as he is about to deliver, and de Kock readjusts to work this away to the off side
makes room by moving towards leg and drives on the up on the off side
de Kock has got a good bat on this one as he just powers this through extra-cover for a lovely timed drive. Had to move to the leg side in order to free up his arms to execute the shot
this one comes on a bit quicker as de Kock gets this away off his pads to retain strike for the next over
that's off the meat! Rushes forward, nearly gets to the pitch and powers it away with the bottom hand against the turn. Great drive over extra
launches into a sweep, not sure he connected with the middle or the top edge because it ballooned away. No protection at the long leg boundary
brings him forward again and de Kock taps it to mid-on. Single there, single taken
leans forward and slaps a fuller delivery outside off into the covers. Good work by the fielder to his right
flighted on middle and leg, de Kock works it away to deep midwicket
hits a decent length outside off, de Kock goes back and blocks. Late decision to do so, think he was trying to hit it more powerfully with the bottom hand
moves around the wicket to target the leg stump and prevent giving the left-hander any room. Tucked to midwicket

another! Similar dismissal to AB. It's a length ball with a bit of width outside off. On a slow pitch like this, it isn't easy to control those slashes through the off side, and he ends up slicing it softly into the hands of the cover point fielder
flat, back of a length on off stump, pushed towards mid-on for a single
down the track again and this time he manages to get inside the line and lift it with the turn over the covers, just about clears the rope
down the pitch comes de Kock, drags the ball from outside off into the gap to the left of mid-on and midwicket runs around to stop it
down the track now, clips with the turn towards deep mid-on
length ball on off stump, goes on the back foot, works it to midwicket
flat, angling into the pads, tucked away quietly to mid-on
sees de Kock moving around the crease and fires it down the leg side. De Kock misses the sweep
feigns making room to upset the bowler's rhythm. Bowler follows him, so far so good for de Kock's plan as he moves across to the normal position and sweeps. Gets a top edge over the keeper
eased away to deep midwicket for a single. Lots more intent from South Africa has seemingly put Bangladesh's spinners off
full and a shade outside off, de Kock swipes it to mid-on. That's the famous Mustafizur offcutter, but it's pushed too full to grip into the pitch
with a step down the wicket de Kock is able to flay this back of a length delivery from Tanvir to the point boundary. Vital runs this for South Africa
advances down the track to this back of a length delivery, and has yet another flash, but doesn't time it as sweetly as mid-off is able to rein it in
Tanvir resumes over the wicket to the left-hander as he uses a change of pace to dupe de Kock, who is looking to get this away through midwicket
the bouncer makes an early appearance as de Kock tries to pull, but the shot seems rushed as he ends up hitting the ball into the ground through the leg side
it was almost as if it was pre-ordained as de Kock gets into position quickly to pull this short one all the way to the square leg boundary. Bounces just in front of the rope. Super shot that
Junaid answers with a back of a length ball which cramps de Kock for space on the off side
bouncer again on a leg stump line as de Kock tries to pull this again, but doesn't get a sweet connection on it. Still able to run a single though as the ball travels to the leg side
and he begins with a lovely flighted delivery which is respected by de Kock with a front foot defence
loopy delivery again and just turning away as de Kock tries to find space on the off side
slightly quicker this one as de Kock gets into position to clip this to the leg side for a single
flighted again, but on a leg stump line, as de Kock is able to get it away without much difficulty
short one from Bhatti, but going down the leg side, as de Kock glances this one behind for one
short once again as de Kock goes for the pull behind square, but doesn't get a good connection on it, as the ball rolls limply towards fine leg

how prophetic am I? as soon as I type that and de Kock foolishly gives up his start with a slog-sweep that carries all the way to Nasir Jamshed at deep fine leg, who completes a smart, rolling take. Wicket against the run of play, and Afridi has a glorious start to his spell, with the trademark "star man" celebration on show
skirts down leg, de Kock flays at it but can't connect
loopy delivery that keeps low as de Kock is able to negotiate this one without much fuss
fuller and driven this time to cover where Jordan makes a diving save
chipped in the air towards mid-on
a fuller ball angling into the left-hander's pads, de Kock flicks along the ground through midwicket
if Kusal can do it, so can I, says QdK. Thats full and outside off stump, the batsman steps out and drills that past cover and there's enough power on it to take it to the fence
ohohoh! That's almost a sweep. Kule is straight again, sends down a length ball. QdK gets low, and slams that over deep square leg for a towering 79metre six
heaved majestically over wide long on for four. Kulasekara gets too straight, doesn't move this off the pitch or in the air. It's only slightly overpitched but QdK gets under it
length ball again, moving across the batsman. QdK chops down on it and gets it to point
length ball, straightening on middle. De Kock defends back to the bowler.
tighter, length ball from Mathews. de Kock opens the face and gets it to third man
Kule pulls the length back a bit and QdK punches this straight to mid off
length delivery on off, cut to point for a quick single
comes downy the track and drives it firmly to long-on
flatter delivery around middle and leg, pushed down back to the bowler
length ball on off, defends it back to the bowler
dances down the ground and he's smoked it! It was on length but de Kock converted it to a full delivery and smacked it with the turn to the deep midwicket boundary
short of length around off, pulled to deep midwicket for one
short of length on middle, de Kock stays back and whips it to the wide long-on boundary for two
skidding in from off, pushed on the leg side
short, wide and a pretty poor misfield from sub Seekkuge Prasanna allows a four. He's fielding at cover point, and QdK's cut shot goes right through him like butter
fullish on off stump, hit back to the bowler
little bit more flight, dips nicely and QdK defends
short down the leg side and he helps it down towards long leg
slanted across and full, and de Kock swings it away over midwicket. Doesn't quite get hold of it, and the ball bounces once before crossing the boundary
back of a length on the pads, whipped away to deep backward square leg
short, angling into the body, and he pulls it down to deep midwicket
length ball just outside off, and he makes room to slap it through the off side and misses. Ball missed off stump narrowly
back of a length on off stump, and de Kock works it away with the angle towards deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, cut straight to backward point
fuller now and he drives it hard to the left of short cover. Long-off runs to his right to stop that
goes back to a fairly full ball on off stump and slaps it away to sweeper cover
makes room to flay this length ball through the off side, but it bounces a touch extra and beats his bat

bowled! Malinga special. It's a swinging yorker, of course, moving in the air away from de Kock, The batsman aims a shot towards mid on, but doesn't get anywhere near this. It hits the base of middle and off and lights up the LED bails, which are definitely in place here.
fullish on off stump, de Kock checks a drive and it goes as far as cover
on length outside off, de Kock cuts it after the turn
on length outside off, driven to deep cover
this one is floated up outside off, and driven to cover point where it is cleanly stopped, this time
he's middling them very well. This wasn't too full but de Kock went down on one knee and slog-swept it over the midwicket fielder for six more
driven on the up towards wide mid-on, the batsmen start running once the ball beats extra cover
slogs again on the leg side and this one falls short of long-on
full outside off, driven down to long-off for one
starts round the wicket and pitches on a length which is nurdled to the leg side by de Kock
127 kph, fuller length ball on middle which de Kock drives straight down the ground, beating mid-on
122 kph, pitches this full again but wide outside off as he gets this to tail away. De Kock looking for the wide, but the umpire is not interested
133 kph, this time follows de Kock who looks to make room to his towards the off side. This one rushes him onto his pads just outside a leg stump line
low, full toss outside off which was begging to be hit to the boundary. Instead, de Kock times it sweetly to short extra-cover

lenght outside off stump and cut powerfully, close to the body by de Kock. Not so bad a ball from Mathews, but he threw his hands at that one and got it behind backward point, all the way along the ground.

138 kph, fullish length from Irfan as de Kock goes for the flick down the leg side, but instead gets a leading edge which spoons up and over him and the keeper, and travels far enough to get to the fine leg boundary. Fortuitous there for the left-hander, as it looked all but out

flighted once more as de Kock goes for bait with a slog sweep outside off. Hits this higher than farther away as the fielder stationed at deep midwicket comes in to pounce on the chance. Able to hold his nerve sufficiently as Pakistan make their first strike of the match
goes short of a length, moves it off the surface, and beats QdK's prod outside the off stump. Lovely ball
pitches on middle and seams it away, QdK drives this down the ground, but without much power. Thisara dives at mid off to keep it to one
full and slightly wide outside off stump, the left-hand batsman lets it go across him
a length ball outside off stump and de Kock cracks it through covers off the front foot, the outfield is slow because of the rain but the ball still beats the pursuing fielder
cut hard off the front foot towards point, where Shehzad dives to take pace off the ball, good stop, saved three runs for Pakistan
driven uppishly towards the fielder at cover point
back of a length again, but wider. QdK guides it off the face to third man
140 kph, length ball from Irfan as de Kock clears the front leg to whack this down to deep midwicket. De Kock is definitely looking to have a good time out there
124 kph, Razzaq pitches this on a length on leg stump, with de Kock swinging cross-batted, but failing to get any bat on it as the ball deflects to the off side off the pads
Razzaq drops it short of a length as de Kock just tees off towards midwicket, with the result being another boundary. Third of the over. Razzaq under the cosh
length ball on off, pushed towards cover with soft hands
flat ball coming into the batsman who defends
flighted on off, de Kock made room and swept it from the middle of the bat to the wide long on boundary for four along the ground
short of length on leg, steered to deep midwicket
short of length outside off, de Kock goes back and cuts it late past short third man for four
slower outside off, slapped to long-on
length ball on middle which is defended solidly by de Kock. Good start from the left-armer
back of a length on middle and off and swinging in as Nasir holds strong
144 kph, fuller length ball which is heaved over midwicket without too much trouble. First boundary for South Africa as they are off the mark
134 kph, slightly slower as Irfan gets this to bounce a little higher and cut in, going over the stumps by not too much of a distance

137 kph, Irfan bangs it in short as de Kock goes for the lofted pull through midwicket. He instead hits this straight up towards mid-on, with the ball carrying far enough to beat the fielders inside the ring
125 kph, overpitched from Razzaq on middle as de Kock just hammers this back over to midwicket, with the ball hitting just before the rope. Umpire signals a four
128 kph, and starts off with the most gentle of looseners down the leg side
Razzaq shortens his length and de Kock continues where he left off, belting this down the ground for another four
126 kph, de Kock steps down to this length ball, but drives straight to mid-off
flat and full on leg, de Kock makes room but gets a bottom edge
stays in the crease this time, moves across and defends
fullish ball, wide of the stumps. QdK leans into a lovely drive, but it's straight to cover, Hint of away swing for Kule.
pulled away again, into a similar region, and Cummins runs around to do the fielding
fizzes through on middle, Qdk cuts, there is risk involved. He knows, and manages to chop it towards point
darted on middle and leg, defended in front of midwicket on the back foot
full and aimed at the base of middle, jabbing drive to cover
this wasn't pretty, but he gets the same result. Flatter and faster outside off, Qdk slashes and sends an edge flying past lone slip
skids on outside off, no turn, Qdk presses forward and lashes a drive through the covers. Lovely stride, lovely timing
oh, that's quite short and de Kock loads up an almighty pull. But his timing deserts him as the ball skews away to long-on

picks it up and deposits it to the square leg boundary. Very little wrong with the ball - on a length and outside off - but with only two fielders on the fence, de Kock indulges and the slog sweep comes out perfectly
races down the track, clearly eager to upset the spin bowler, and drives to long-on
attempts a reverse sweep, with Mehidy targeting leg stump. Good thinking from de Kock, but he finds short third man
and long-on is tested with de Kock flicking a short delivery to the left of the man
good work from Mehedy, cramping de Kock with a flatter delivery on leg stump. The batsman tries desperately to make his own room, but has to settle for a single to the right of the bowler
misses out - a short ball is cut straight to point
fires it in on off stump, de Kock drives through extra cover and by the time long-off covers the distance, South Africa have an easy two.
sees the batsman advancing and lines up a good length delivery well outside off. De Kock is able to adjust to the shift in line and slaps it to the sweeper cover
lifts it over the infield and away she goes to the cover boundary. Brilliant shot. And there's nothing agricultural about it. Just a positive stride and a straight bat
goes flat on middle, de Kock makes room and punches it to the left of short cover
length and outside off, de Kock drills it to mid-off, from where Shakib delivers a direct hit
short from Mathews, but only at 118.5kph, de Kock plants his front foot down the track and pulls that towards midwicket, he's not holding back
chops a shortish delivery on middle and off behind square with soft hands

more evidence of the kind of belter we have at Bloemfontein. De Kock premeditates by walking yards across outside off and pulls a short ball, that actually surprises him for pace, to the long leg boundary

straight to the fielder at deep square leg! There was one fielder patrolling the whole leg side boundary and de Kock picks him out. A fuller than a good length delivery on middle, de Kock picks the length early, goes back and pulls. Gets plenty on it but that's the long boundary. Straight to the fielder. Six on the Highveld. Out in New Zealand.
short and wide outside off, de Kock backs away, looking to hit the ball straight. Some extra bounce takes the ball over the bat
full ball outside off, de Kock is beaten by that one
cramping him for room. Length on middle and leg, de Kock shovels a flick to square leg. Got to watch that line, he's very strong off his hips
holds it's line again. Fantastic over from Boult. Full and straight, de Kock falls over as he misses a flick. Rapped on the pads, sliding down
long hop, but de Kock picks out deep midwicket with his pull shot
gets down the track and, with a whirl of his wrist, sends a flighted delivery to long-on. That's the first over tonight without a boundary
dug in short and outside off, 134ks, Qdk frees his arms and crashes it to the covers, where Siri makes a tumbling save
lovely bowling. Goes around the wicket, plants it full and on leg stump, de Kock can only drive through cover
moves away outside leg and scoops a catch to midwicket! Lots of bottom hand in the stroke, but it was too full to dig out with that much aggression. And once he didn't pick the gap, he was a goner
looks to take a good length ball on middle stump with a reverse sweep. Doesn't connect because it isn't as well floated up
straightens and bounces on middle, nudged to square leg
full ball hurtling in towards middle stump, defended back towards the bowler
a knee-high full toss just outside off, slapped towards sweeper cover to get three
this one is full and on the pads, punched towards mid-on by de Kock
length ball on the pads, looks to clip that towards midwicket but doesn't connect, off the pads towards square leg
looking to turn that towards square leg, a leading edge, the ball doesn't travel anywhere, rolls down the track
de Kock skips down the track and defends that one
this time he steps away towards leg and blocks it, de Kock has decided he needs to use his feet to counter the mystery spin of Senanayake
jumps down the track again, this one skids on, de Kock looks to hammer that over extra cover, gets a thick edge, Jayawardene dives to his left but that is too wide for him at slip and it runs away
again he charges down, happy to defend to the leg side though
de Kock is using his feet against the quicks as well, skips down the track and caresses the ball well wide of mid-on for four
back of a length ball on the pads, whipped away for four more, de Kock takes a small step forward and sends it to the midwicket boundary
another whip to midwicket, straight to the fielder this time though, Kulasekara proving a lot less dangerous when up against the left-hander
shifts his line to well outside off, a thick inside-edge from de Kock as he again looks to play that through the leg side
length ball just outside leg stump, defended back towards the bowler
length ball, de Kock skips down and works the ball towards mid-on
short of length ball on the pads, clipped towards square leg
another one swings in, right on off this time, but de Kock is waiting, he opens the face as he glides it wide of point, who dives and takes pace off it
this swings in, but full, low and down the pads, and is put away past short fine leg
a bouncer now, de Kock, who is standing a long way outside the crease, gets down on a knee and lets it go over
he got a lot of bat on this pitched up delivery this time, but hit it straight to mid off
bowled full and swings in at the stumps, a mistimed drive is the result
neatly done. Manufactures some runs off a yorker just outside off. Plants the open face down and picks out deep third man

full and wide outside off, de Kock slashes it away to the sweeper who hustles across to it fine. Gets his hands down fine. And then looks up to see the ball trickling to the boundary. Terrible work from Bangladesh this afternoon
good length ball with width, de Kock hammers it to a deepish mid-on
bang! Who cares about AB when QdK hits em like that. It's a sluggish length ball, with enough room to free those arms. De Kock settles into a good base and slogs it away
attempts a yorker, ends up with a low full toss which is driven to long-off
this one is well tossed up, squeezed to cover
excellent fielding at point from Saifuddin. Runs to his right, dives and stops a well timed cut from going away to the boundary
lashes it down the ground, and the drive singes the turf to the right of Shakib. I won't blame him if he doesn't reach for the catch
offcutter, pitching full on leg stump, de Kock blocks and runs. It's a risky single, but Shafiul is unable to pick the ball up after moving quickly to his right
goes around the wicket to tuck the left-hander up. And all de Kock can do against the 140 kph short delivery coming for his chest is drop it down by his feet and pinch a single
walks at the fast bowler, who then adjusts his length and bowls short. He also pulls down his pace, and the 111 kph delivery is nudged to midwicket
slanting across de Kock who throws his bat at it and sends it down towards third man
carves a shortish delivery but it goes straight to point. Good fielding from Sabbir.
pulls a short ball on middle stump to deep midwicket

walks right across to heave into the leg side - but he gets the worst ball possible. Too full, and angling across him. In the end, he seems to inside edge a ball he could well have lifted over mid-off
that's been shot out of a cannon! And should, by right, have made a hole in the advertising boards behind mid-off and gone off down the freeway. A blood-thirsty drive from de Kock
full, looking to topple the stumps, just in case de Kock walks across again. But his radar's a bit wonky. Wide down leg
bunts a short of a good length delivery outside off to mid-off
full on the stumps, firm drive to mid-off
short and pulled in controlled fashion to the square leg sweeper
length ball on off stump, patted up the wicket from the crease
de Kock back in his crease and works wide of mid-off for a single
straight line and tucked to square leg
length ball, pitches outside leg, flicked away to the right of deep fine leg for a couple
low full-toss on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
short on off stump and he pulls it away to the right of Cummins, the leg-side sweeper, and he covers a lot of ground and puts in the dive to stop that on the boundary
the captain is not happy. It's called a wide, but the batsman walked to the off side to paddle the ball fine behind square. Goes juuust past the outside of leg stump. A rough call

Fourth time lucky Rubel! Hits him almost full on his toes, just on or outside leg, and he can't get this one away. Tried to sweep, but can't connect. Rubel appeals and the umpire raises his finger after a really long time. QDK is furious at the decision, but does not review. Did he forget he could've gone up? He screams into his helmet before walking off.

oh dear, he needs two balls to strike, de Kock struck on the pad, and struck right in front, this skids on from round the stumps, hint of straightening and past de Kock's attempted waft to leg from the crease
no swing, and it starts wide outside leg again. A slightly nervous start or lack of swing?
lucky four runs. This is short, angling away, he has the room to go after it, but not enough. Gets the bottom edge, past the diving Dhoni. Slightly nervous from both the batsman and the bowler

oh he has given this. is it nervous from the umpire too or a great decision? De Kock is not happy with the call. He goes for a big drive to a length ball outside off, the fielders go up immediately for the inside edge, Ian Gould raises his finger after thinking about it. De Kock is not thrilled about the decision. Replays show there is a sound as it passes the bat, so the umpire has got it right
muscled towards cow corner, good length on middle, backs away and just pulls in front of square
this one swings the other way, down the leg side, de Kock misses, but gets two leg-byes
driven towards long on, smart cricket, deciding to rotate after the six
Dispatched! Down on one knee and slogged over midwicket for another maximum. It was darted in straight outside off stump, no real spin and de Kock really got underneath that ball. Fifty for him too.
low full toss in front of middle stump, bunted along the ground, from the top-half of the bat, down to long off. First run of the over
backs away and cuts furiously, but straight to point. Good length on off stump and QDK had made the room, but just not the placement
chipped over the bowler's head for a couple more, And that's the team hundred. Charges down the wicket and just lifts the ball through its line
good length on middle, tapped square on the leg side. Will keep the strike
good length just outside off, makes room to cut square, but straight to the fielder at point
full and wide outside off, cut straight to the fielder in the deep. Straight to him really

on the up and screams away to the extra cover boundary. This is a sensational batting pitch and Rubel bowls a lovely pace for it. The ball comes nicely onto the bat and de Kock simply flays it to the right of mid-off
taps the ball to long on this time, goes deep into his crease and caresses the ball back past the bowler's left
full on off stump, misses the slog competely. Tried to dispatched that over midwicket again, but can't get under the ball this time. Goes past his swinging bat's outside edge
full toss, and nicked one-bounce to the keeper. He backed away to make room and the bowler is lucky to get away with a dot ball
143kph, 1on the pads and de Kock whips it away to deep square leg
tapped in front of square towards a non-existent midwicket for a single, full on middle and easily maneuvered
punched down to long off, full just outside off and an easily single on offer. Charged down the ground for that
pulls his length back and cramps him for room, Rohit nudges it towards fine leg for one
this didn't come quite out of the middle, but it didn't matter, Sharma drives on the up over the covers to a cross-seam delivery that was short of a length
full around off, not overpitched, Rohit tires to blast it through the line but can't beat short cover
length, he backs away and Holder follows, quite unlike Rohit, all this movement before the ball, helps it along for one to fine leg
that's 400 sixes for Rohit! He's in the mood tonight, picks up the length early and clubs it over deep midwicket
back on a good length at off stump, pushed to mid-off...India ahead of the required rate
much fuller, at the stumps, 85mph, turned into midwicket
full and swinging away a touch, Rohit opens the face and drives straight to cover point without much timing
really full again, around middle and leg with a hint of inswing again, Rohit squeezes it away towards deep square leg
another one into the crowd! Jordan opts to go short, Sharma pulls it high over fine leg. Miles back
that's more traditional and class written all over it, full around off, just a gentle forward push from Rohit helps the ball beat mid-off
tucks a length delivery out to deep square leg

Has he taken that? It's Lewis on the fence and he nearly pulls off a stunner, it is a stunner regardless, actually. He caught this mid-air with just his right hand but showed great presence of mind to throw it back in play to save four. The batsmen take two. It was short and Rohit was ready for it, rocked back and pulled it hard and flat towards deep midwicket and couldn't quite believe his luck when Lewis got his hand on it. Neither could I!
short of a length outside off, finds backward point
short and fired outside off this time, Rohit bisects the short third-man and point with a delicate cut shot this time
full around off, pushed to long-off
this is a googly, pushed into the pads, forced out to deep midwicket
excellent placement, touch too much with Rashid, Sharma places his late cut wide of short third man
fuller, outside off, eases forward and drives to deep cover
length around off, little slower, Rohit cuts again but straight to point this time
angled in on a length, Rohit premeditates slightly and dabs it fine on the sweep for a couple
full around off, driven to deep cover for one
short outside off, stands tall and pushes it to deep cover. India seem happy to work Hayden Walsh around for ones and twos
length around middle,and it makes a cracking sound off the bat, down on one knee and swept powerfully over deep square leg

pulls his length back a little, slows it down a little, almost deceives Rohit in the air, but he he goes through the shot, it goes high into the night sky and sails deep into the stands down the ground
poor ball, pressure getting to him, it's a wide full toss, Rohit just gives it direction and gets it to the right of cover for another four
length around off, swats it down the ground to long-off for one
googly, picked, goes down on one knee and sweeps hard, but can't beat the deep fielder
full and follows Rohit who was backing away a long way, squeezes it away to deep square leg for one. Excellent ball, found the blockhole
short of a length outside off, square driven towards deep cover where Bairstow makes excellent ground to cut off the boundary
a clear tactic from Stokes here, this is very full and wide, jabbed into the pitch off the bottom edge
spin for the first time and Rohit greets him with disdain! Length around off, Rohit goes down on one knee and picks it up over long-on
length around off, it's at full pace and all Rohit has to do is give it direction, beats short third-man and that's four more
there's a noise as this goes past the bat, but it was bat hitting the ground...reaching out for a full, wide delivery. Must have been close to a wide
length, angled in, Rohit tucks it away to deep square leg for one
full outside off, driven firmly to cover, can't beat the fielder
full toss on middle, Rohit pushes it to deep midwicket for one. Not a bad over for West Indies
angles one into middle and leg, worked to long leg
scorching drive to sweeper point
slower length ball on middle and leg, punched to long-on
swept with disdain! Gets outside the line of the stumps, allows this to angle in and then sweeps him past short fine leg.
on the pads again and he flicks this towards deep square for a couple
gift of a delivery and picked away! Full toss on leg-stump and Rohit gleefully accepts that as he flicks this over deep midwicket. An attempted slower ball gone wrong
steps out, the bowler follows him and Rohit gets an inside edge onto the pad as he tries to whip it square
length outside off, pushed to mid-off
through with the pull even before the ball arrived, deflects off the thigh pad to short third
plays the short-arm jab to deep midwicket
lunges forward and dabs it to the off side
drifts in a hint from wide of the crease, length a touch fuller, pushed to mid-off
eased down to long-on
dabs this away-going length delivery into the off side

the bowler can wonder all day if he did something wrong there, but the answer is not really. Length ball, slanted across towards offstump and Rohit lifts this over mid-off. Held his pose for the cameras too. He's roaring already
flicks this dipping full toss on the pads to deep square
lofted over extra cover! This is magnificent. By no means a half-volley but he trusts his form and the surface. Glorious
runs this down to third man
scorching drive but straight to cover
dipping slower ball again, works this from outside off towards deep midwicket
eases this low full toss to long-on
rocks back and glides this to point

sliced high in the air, cover fielder Hetmyer back-pedals and takes this superbly. The ball was swirling high for a long time. Held his composure and took it well. Rohit was looking to pull in front of square off the frontfoot, had to fetch it from a long way outside off.
hit on the right elbow as he plays this whip even before the ball arrived, he's wincing in pain
makes room and pulls this length ball from outside off to deep square
short ball angling in, pulled to deep square leg
slices this full toss over point, cracking stroke! No one at point, so he opens the bat face to pick the gap.
squeezes this yorker-length delivery to point
hoicked over the ropes! Slower ball, Rohit walks across to fetch this leg-cutter and deposit that deep into the stands
flicks this full toss to deep midwicket
top-edges this sweep to deep backward square, no timing.
turned towards midwicket

tough chance put down at deep midwicket. Rohit doesn't quite get the elevation on this slog sweep and ends up hitting it flat. This travelled real fast, good work to get there but couldn't hold on. Cottrell the man
driven down to long-off to bring up a half-century! His 17th in T20Is
punched straight to cover.
pulled way back over deep midwicket! Too short, Rohit used the depth of the crease so well to pull. Rohit now has the most sixes (106) in T20Is Goes past Gayle.
driven into the gap between cover and wide long-off
drifting down, beaten as he looks to sweep
eases this down to long-on
drift and turn from around the stumps, eased as he lunges forward
works this low full toss to long-on again, easy single
gentle dab into the off side as they scamper a single, even as point swoops in
strong wrists and that nonchalant whip! Takes a step across and allows the length ball to slide in as he picks this over midwicket. Class
cramped for room as the attempted dab past slip rolls to the keeper
late inswing but from outside leg. He's struggling for rhythm
length outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
in-dipping yorker at off stump. Keeps the forward stride out of the way and gets it down to third man off the outside of the bat
full and wide outside off, looks to chop it behind square and is beaten
full outside off, looks to drive but that doesn't quite come on. Inside edge rolls into the leg side
falls short of Cottrell at third man. Another short ball, this time outside off. Wants to ramp this and nearly picks the man out. He dives forward and manages to keep it to one
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
top edge sails over the fine boundary. That bouncer hurries onto him at the helmet and he swipes from underneath. A scene Oshane has probably seen a lot in T20s
length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
full toss on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
beaten edge. Short and wide outside off, swipes away from the body and misses
length on off stump, dropped pitch side on the off side to steal a run
length on leg stump, leans in and pokes to midwicket
short of a length on off stump, inside edge onto pad as he looks to defend

gets too much underneath that ball, and Williams has broken the partnership. Hard length, on off stump, not short enough for the pull. Doesn't have enough time to get on the back foot, and ends up shovelling it in the air, towards deep midwicket, where Hayden Walsh judges it nicely
slower short ball outside off, takes ages to get to Rohit, who flat-bats it down to long-off
length around middle and off, cramping him for room, defended
flat and quick on middle and off, just short of a length, Rohit defends back to the bowler. Can't manufacture room
now he drops short, though, and even though the line is good, angling into middle and leg or thereabouts, Rohit can rock back and hoick it away, high over deep backward square leg
slower ball and down the leg side, called wide even as Rohit swings and misses
another in-diping yorker at off stump. Watchfully defended to point
length around middle and a little slice of luck for Rohit who swung across the line but got an outside edge that flew past the keeper
shot. Dropped short and just outside off. Makes some room on the back foot and chops it between point and short third
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
driven firmly but straight to mid-off, no timing as Rohit immediately looks at the bat's bottom
flicked straight to midwicket
goes shorter this time but the line is again outside leg, wide.
much better, draws him forward by angling this across, Rohit gets well forward and covers the line to defend back
full and swinging back in, Rohit walks across looking to flick this behind square but is late on the stroke. Ball rolls off the pad to the keeper
wayward as he slips a full delivery down leg, pitched outside leg and swung back in further to beat Rohit's tickle
gorgeous on-drive to a full ball that swings back into middle, hit straight to mid-on
slips this length ball down leg, past the thigh pad. Wide called and rightly so. Wayward start.
tucks this towards the man coming in from deep square
gets a leading edge as he looks to turn it square, fortunately for Rohit this one lands safe. On the bounce to short midwicket
drifts a short of length delivery down leg, Rohit hops back and whips this off his hip to the fine leg boundary.

holes out to long-on. Uncharacteristic shot from Rohit, looking to clear the ropes but didn't quite get underneath the length. This was yorker-length which he tried to belt and didn't get any power behind it, easy catch.
dabbed late to point
slower ball at a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
slower ball on off stump, defended on the front foot
crunched! Wow! That is a stunning hit on this pitch. A lofted cover drive for six. Full and wide, stride down the pitch and a full flow of the arms. Superb
length ball pushed across off stump, chopped on the bounce to point
slugged to the wide long-on boundary. Still not coming on and this too is off the inside part of the bat. Length ball on middle and he has to drag this
short of a length on middle, punched towards long-on. Midwicket dives to his left and gets close to induce some doubt. But it's not stopped cleanly
lbw appeal is turned down. Offbreak at a length on middle stump, looks for the slog sweep and is struck on the back leg in front of leg stump. Not reviewed
straighter this time, length again and gets it to jag back in, Rohit nudges it fine on the leg side

got him in the slips! Rohit was stuck on the crease, probably thinking about the ball coming in. Great bowling by Hendricks, who pulls his line a lot straighter. Rohit jabs at it, but it holds its line, going with the angle to fly off the outside edge to a waiting Reeza Hendricks.
full and swinging back into Rohit, watches it closely to squeeze it out. Encouraging start for the bowler
short of a length at leg stump, pushed through square leg off the back foot
short and wide outside off, waits for it to turn away and chops it very very late to get it to the point boundary. Expertly done by Rohit
full and flat at off stump, pushed back down the pitch
full on off stump, late on the slog sweep. Gets an inside edge to short fine
googly, sliced to short third man. Played that very late as it was skidding into the stumps
googly, pushed flat and back of a length at the stumps. Whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
slower ball at a length on leg stump, clipped through midwicket
buh bye. Rashid drops it halfway down the pitch. Rohit goes deep in the crease and wallops it over midwicket. That's all.
gets it wide of mid-off. Slower ball that he has to adjust for. But it's full and in his arc. He gets it past the fielder
short ball rising up at his chest. Miscued pull off the front foot. Lands safely in front of deep square
jams it into the pitch and gets it over point. Very full ball outside off and he's kind of yorked himself with a big stride. Adjusts nicely with the wrists though and gets the timing right
length ball on off stump, defended very late, into the pitch
another offcutter. Short of a length and follows him as he makes room. One-handed drag out to deep square
short ball just outside off, opens the face to run it down to third man
full ball just outside off, punched straight to mid-off
full and swinging down leg. Just past his ankle as he looks to flick
inside edge past the stumps. Short ball, slower ball. Sticks in the pitch and Rohit is swatting at it while losing control of his bottom hand
front of the hand quicker one, full outside off. Drilled straight to extra cover off the front foot
tossed up at middle stump, driven to long-on
length outside off, looks to hit it through covers but cannot middle it, gets a single though
a slower one, length ball down the leg side. Rohit goes for the pull but misses, the ball brushes his pads and dribbles towards the keeper
an attempted yorker but ends up as a low full-toss, Rohit squeezes it past the diving cover fielder to take India past 50
a yorker outside off, digs it out towards short third man
length ball, Rohit skips down the track and lofts it over long-off. The umpires are checking if it hit the boundary cushion on the full and yes, it did. He has moved to 43 off just 20 balls
Shafiul goes for a wide yorkers but once again ends up bowling a low full toss. Rohit gets down on one knee and taps it over midwicket, comes back for the third
full on middle, and swinging into leg stump. Rohit carefully drives it straight back to Willey. Soft hands
length ball around off, works it towards midwicket for a single
gets to his fifty in style. Fuller on the stumps, and Rohit has slog swept into the orbit over deep midwicket for another six
length ball around off, works it towards long-on for one

straight to extra cover. A good-looking shot, timed really well, but he can't get it over the fielder. Pushed through flat from Rashid, much like the rest of his spell. It lands at a good length and he goes with the turn. That's the end of another massive top-order stand for India
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
full at middle stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
full toss outside off, tapped to sweeper cover
full toss on the pads, flicked to deep square
length on middle stump, plonks the front foot across and flicks to long-on
short outside off, cut straight to sweeper
struck on the pad as he walks down to try and flick this inswinger. That's going down. He gets a run in the gully region
fuller on the stumps, uses his feet but gets too close to the ball, drives it towards long-on
too full outside off, latches on to it but can only dig it out towards long-off
fuller around off, drives it towards extra cover where Mahmudullah misfields and allows an extra run
leg stump gone! Massive wicket. Length ball on off, and he stands firm to punch straight, but the ball angles in and takes the inside edge before clattering into the stumps. Shafiul's ecstatic
length ball around off, nipping back in, defended towards the bowler
tight lines, on the fourth stump, he gently chops it to short third man
full toss outside off, threw his bat at it and connected well, but straight to extra cover
comes on the front foot and flicks it through midwicket, twirling his wrists. Lewis sprints after it and pulls it back in
pinged on the glove. Back of a length again, and he was getting into position to pull but it hurried onto him and struck his right hand. Rohit is in some pain
back of a length again on off, Rohit stays beside it this time and slashes it to third man
through everyone. Superb bouncer, on off stump, quick and rising on target. Rohit is very late on the pull but the ball sails over the keeper's head too
delicate by Rohit. Cottrell went for the bluff, bowling length outside off after a series of short ones had troubled the batsmen, but Rohit was alert to it and late cuts it very fine. Top shot
fires in a yorker, that Rohit is forced to defend

picks out the man at deep midwicket! That was superbly played by Rohit, coming down the track and taking it on the half volley, flicking it with great timing. But the placement was awry, and he sends it straight down Hetmyer's throat.
back of a length, sticks in the pitch a bit, Rohit twirls a pull from outside off through square leg
good length on leg, nipping into him. Tries to turn it but misses and is struck on the thigh pad
short and wide outside off, wafts at it with his feet off the ground. Can't connect
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full inswinger, starts at leg stump and goes further down
length ball shaped in nicely at off stump, opens the face and runs it to third man off the front foot
fullish, outside off and angling in. Takes a big stride and defends towards cover
length ball around off, taps it behind point and gets to the other end
length ball, wide outside off and Rohit attempts to clobber a cut square. Finds cover point though
fuller, and he drives with zero footwork. Nearly beats the infield, but the fielder at cover dives to his right to intercept. Stops a four for certain
fuller around off, digs it out towards extra cover but cannot beat the fielder this time
skips down too early and Aminul shortens his length to beat him in the flight. Rohit adjusts and dabs it towards cover-point
length ball, works it towards midwicket for one
starts with a short one on the leg stump, Rohit's eyes light up and he just pulls it over deep midwicket. Not even going back, just a transfer of weight
short again, quicker and flatter and Rohit pulls it over deep square leg, 84 metres this one. 100 comes up for India
short of length outside off, stays back and pulls it over long-on, three sixes in a row. Can he do a Yuvraj?
fuller outside off, looks to smash it over long-off but can only get an inside edge that rolls towards short fine leg
length outside off, cuts it past point for a couple, Mahmudullah chases and puts in a desperate slide to keep it just inside
down the track but gets too far ahead and takes it on full, works it towards deep extra cover
full, outside off, and hammered past the bowler to long on. Rohit wanted the second run, he's not particularly happy
length ball on off, and tapped down the ground to long on for a walking single
full on middle. The attempted drive is mistimed to long on
length ball on off, and he comes down the ground before using his bat like a sword to scythe a cut to deep point
full, on off stump. Flicked to deep midwicket. Rohit will keep strike
full, on off. The legbreak is defended

length ball, on middle, but the ball stays low. Rohit attempts to pull, but he drags the shot, and the skyer's been taken at deep midwicket. Rohit looks at the toe-end of the bat before walking back. An exquisite innings comes to a close
length ball, outside off, and he opens the bat's face to defend towards point
length ball, outside off, and he attempts a punch. Mistimed to the leg-side instead
length and wider of off, Rohit throws his hands at it and powers it through extra cover for the first four of the night
cheeky this time! Short of length outside off and Rohit just opens to face of the bat to dab it to the right of the short third man fielder

uses his feet to this length ball and looks to work it on the leg side without being to the pitch of the ball, gets a leading edge over covers. Rohit wants to come back for the second but Dhawan sends him back wisely
angling into him on a length, Rohit tries to cut it, but chops it down on the ground near him and the ball rolls towards slip
gets away with this one, was even wider outside off, he threw his hands into a drive but found Willey at cover
fuller on the stumps, turned to midwicket for a quick single
creamed over cover. Fullish outside off, same spot roughly that he was bowling to Dhawan, but it's the right-hander Rohit on strike and he carves it over cover with a full swing of the bat
this one is even better! Full outside off and he transfers weight forward to stroke this past extra cover with exquisite timing
finally a good ball from Rabada, back of a length and moving away. Rohit tries to flay it with static feet but doesn't connect
length outside off, and he opens the face to send it over point. Third man collects on the bounce

huge appeal for lbw but I think it was going down. De Kock seems to agree and opts against the review. Oooh, on replays it looks closer. Spun into Rohit sharply from a length and caught him on the crease, hitting his back pad. Still think it would have been not out on review, but possibly on umpire's call. We'll have to wait for the ball-tracking to confirm
angling well across Rohit, who leaves it alone outside off
full and straight, clipped out to deep midwicket
moves well outside leg stump, Ball follows him and it's clipped off the pads backward of square
fuller, at the pads, but just costs him a single as it's tucked into midwicket
short of a length outside off, he takes his bottom hand off the bat as he plays back down the pitch
gets onto off stump, back of a length, takes the splice of the bat as he defends and runs into backward point
starts with a short ball, angled in at leg stump, and he just swivels on a pull behind square. Poor start from ball
more swing, this is full at the stumps, tucked into midwicket
full, wide outside off, carved through the covers with a dismissive drive

rapped dead in front. Looked like a slower one, and he got it to swing appreciably into Rohit. He was looking to deposit this into the legside with a flick, but completely missed it and that's an easy decision for the umpire.
fuller on the stumps, wristed it to mid-on
fullish on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
pumped down the ground! Jordan goes full and it's launched into the crowd. Sharma got underneath the ball, from deep in his crease, and deposited it over long-on
castled. Rohit went down to paddle this fine, but missed it completely. Holder kept it full and straight and knocked back leg stump
length ball, angled in at the stumps, played to the on side
length on the stumps, pulls it through midwicket
down the track and manages to get the ball away off a thick inside edge. Not quite where he intended it to go, was looking to go straighter but it flies up in the midwicket region and falls safely
almighty swing of the bat to a length ball nipping in outside off and he doesn't connect. Off-cutter that grips on the pitch. Rohit is lucky it goes past off stump
rapped on the pads with an inducker that he played around. Half appeal but that was going down leg
strays down leg first ball and it's going to be a wide
fuller on the stumps, plays it with an angled bat to midwicket
fuller on off, punched to cover
down legside again, it might have just brushed pad but it's given wide again. De Kock dived to his left and got a glove to it, but couldn't prevent the batsmen from taking an extra run
fullish on the stumps, patted back to the bowler
length ball in the channel, Rohit wanted to slap it away, but it goes under his bat
imperious. That's the Rohit pull shot you can write paens about. Rocks back and slams it way over square leg, didn't even seem to try and hit it very hard.
length ball on off, blocked back
slammed again. Back of a length and angling into him, he moves inside the line opens up and pulls this waaaay over square leg. When he's hitting them like that, you can't do much
corrects his length by going fuller, driven to mid-on
full outside off, pushed wider left alone
that's more like it! Takes a step down the pitch and effortlessly flicks this over midwicket and it's comfortably into the stands
lovely delivery! Excellent start, this delivery angles across Sharma, even nips off the seam a touch, and beats the outside edge
big appeal first up! This shapes back very nicely at Sharma, on a good length, takes the front pad. Perhaps pitched outside leg. Replays showed it pitched on leg stump but as going over
fixes his line. Length ball, outside off but angling in. Fended off the back foot to mid-on for a quick single
full, wide outside off, and swinging further away. Drives well, but finds cover point
punched! Length ball, outside off, and hammered past cover's right! Becomes T20I cricket's highest run-scorer

given lbw, but Rohit reviews! Slower ball, full outside off but seaming in. Rohit's deceived by the lack of pace and is through his defensive shot early. Ball hits his back leg and the umpire raises his fingers swiftly for the lbw. Rohit discusses with Dhawan before choosing to review. Replays show that the ball is clipping middle stump, so it's "umpire's call" on the wicket and therefore Rohit must walk back. India retain their review though
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg but apparently off the pads
fuller and a touch straighter, but still not straight enough, another wide
and he begins with a big wide down the leg side. India are off the mark
length ball on the pads, and Rohit says thank you very much and pulls it behind square leg for four
length outside off, cuts it towards backward point where a partial stop allows the single
a full toss on the stumps, flicked away towards deep square leg, only a single
a yorker outside off, digs it out towards covers
length ball around off, tucked away towards deep square leg
length ball around off and Rohit hits it uppishly to the left of mid-off and once it crossed Mahmudullah, it was always going to be a four
a slower one but too full and outside off, Rohit waits and opens the face of the bat, creams it through covers for back-to-back fours
length ball angling across, looks to run it down to third man but misses
a touch fuller around off, Rohit comes forward and just lofts it way over the bowler's head, into the sightscreen. Majestic
length ball around off, angling across the batsman, Rohit looks to push but gets beaten
length ball, angling down the leg side, and guided past short fine leg's right! Easy pickings
length outside off, waits for it and steers it through point for four more
nice carry! Lands full outside off, but takes a boomerang bounce through to the keeper. Rohit got to the pitch of the ball, but his attempted punch was nowhere near the delivery

full on off, and this time it straightens after pitching! Rohit tried to whip it away to midwicket, but the ball didn't swing into him, forcing him to play down the wrong line. The ball goes past his bat's outside edge, and flies straight into Buttler's gloves
in the air! And taken by Buttler. Short once again on off, and Rohit can't resist pulling. The bat turns in his hand, and the sliced shot is comfortably gobbled by the wicketkeeper. Maiden wicket
goes short! Rohit spots the length early, and prepares to play the pull, but Ball's too quick, and the batsman is late into that shot
given room outside off and Rohit unleashes a powerful drive but straight to the fielder at point
short, and he goes for the pull, connects and sends it to the backward square leg fence
good length angling into him, tucked to midwicket
fuller outside off, stroked to cover
length outside off, gently turns it towards point with an open bat face
better ball, swinging into him late, leg-stump yorker. Hits his toe and rolls towards cover. Cottrell's appealing but it's short-lived.
short of a length, and sits up but also stuck in the pitch a bit. Rohit wanted to pull it, but the ball comes on a tad later and hits him on the box. Painful
floated up very full on the fourth stump, driven gently to long-off's left
and once again wide down the legside. Not even swing this time, just a length ball too far down
length ball on the pads again, tucked to short square leg
good length on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
beautifully done. Radar awry again for Cottrell who strays down leg again. If Rohit had left it, it would be a wide, but Rohit got his bat down and flicked it fine to get a boundary
first boundary! Sliced through the covers. Full outside off, and he muscles this through the ball's line. Not timed perfectly, but still has enough behind it to place it between cover and mid off
back of a length on middle, and angling into Rohit. He misses the flick off his hips, and the ball hits his thigh instead. It drops safely to the leg side, and Rohit calls early for a single

appeal for lbw! But the umpire isn't interested. It was full on middle, and Rohit tried to ramp it over short fine leg. He misses, and the ball hits his thigh in front of middle stump, but replays show that Rohit got an edge to it. That saves him.
full on off on this occasion, and Rohit shuffles across to cover his off-stump line. Defends it back to Willey once again
good length again outside off, tapped away towards point quietly. Good comeback
full outside off, another slower one, skews off an inside edge to the on side
back to full and wider, it's a slower ball, skews off a thick outside edge and it goes one bounce to third man
full toss - a very very wide full toss - and Rohit clatters it to the third man boundary - with only one hand! He's into the nineties!
full on off stump, taps it through the covers
near yorker, which Rohit flicks to deep midwicket. He wants a second, but Rahul says no, rightly as well because Allen is so quick across the turf out there

outside edge races away to the third man boundary! Well, that wide full toss definitely needed to be put away, but even if Rohit had timed his cut, he may not have beaten the sweeper. A little luck for the India captain

scoops it to the long leg boundary! Fourth T20I hundred, the most by any batsman! He punches the air. He looks so angry. He looks seething. He wanted this. He's loving this. And he gets there in the most un-Rohit like way, accessing the V behind him

comes down the track to hit the ball to long-off but it's cut off by Brathwaite. The batsman is outside his crease, he's not making any effort to get back, he's too tired to do so, but the throw at the stumps is wide and goes to the boundary as well
over pitched outside off and Rohit smacks him over long-off. So clearly he's not too tired
yorker on off stump, pushes it to long-off and that ends a 20-run over.
and he goes square leg. Length ball drifts into the pad and Rohit has a free hit there, really. Not a big sweeper usually, but he's nonchalant as he swats this uppishly
short of a length just outside off, caressed to cover's left off the back foot

oh boy, he's nowhere near the ball and yet it sails over the boundary! West Indies have been trying to hide the ball outside off. Rohit insists on batting at leg stump. He comes down the track this time, reaches out and lofts it over the bowlers head
length on middle stump, right behind it to defend off the back foot
length on leg stump, deflected to square leg with the angle

drilled straight to mid-off! Rohit upset with himself. This was a slower ball that he's picked and it's landing at a leg stump line and is overpitched. It's there for a pasting, but he's managed to go neither above mid-off, nor to his left. It's hit hard, but Brathwaite does well to hold a stable base and take it with the reverse cup
short ball wide outside off. A lovely looking chop away from the body, but deep point is in position
good length on off, he defends with soft hands close into the off side, and an easy one is run. Great batting
short into the hip and he pulls with the angle up and over fine leg into the crowd! What a shot. Too easy for Sharma
angled down the leg side and rightly called wide
137kph, good length, fourth stump, he defends with soft hands running into the gully

caught by Finch running back from mid on! He skips down and tries to loft over the on side, scoops a leading edge high back over the bowler's head, Finch runs back gets very close to it but hugs it to his chest! It bobbled a moment but he held on
short ball, hooked, not controlled, it just falls short of McDermott running in! The Aussies did forecast that uncontrolled hook shot and it nearly did the trick
shorter length, he ramps it, he steps inside it and flips it, but doesn't get it, fine leg is up, it just goes fine of him and they get a couple
tossed up at off stump, sliced to extra cover with the turn
142kph, good length, middle stump, he defends on the front foot
no pace on the ball and it's also wide outside off. Rohit - camped on leg stump - can't reach far enough and mistimes the shot to point
lovely balance as Rohit lets the full delivery come to him and flicks it through straight midwicket
off-stump yorker, dug out down the pitch
short and outside off, sits up to be smacked. Rohit crunnnnnnnches a pull to the midwicket boundary. Bam!
flat and sliding in on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
short and outside off, much slower through the air, Rohit swats it away to long-on
full-toss on leg stump, punched down to long-off
loopy slow full-toss on off, Rohit checks his drive and pushes down to long-off
short and wide outside off, Rohit reaches out this time, and can't connect with it
pitched up and outside off, driven aerially. Up and over the covers
"caaaatch," is the cry, but it's a wistful one as West Indies realise Rohit has placed this flick perfectly - to the right of straight midwicket, and well to the right of long-on. Insane batting
loops it up outside off, Rohit has to reach out, almost losing his shape, but he still manages to keep it down as he drives through cover
full on off stump, pushes to long-off
taps the slower delivery in between long-on and midwicket and sprints through for a couple of runs. Gorgeous work. And it also brings up fifty for Rohit
offcutter slower ball becomes a full toss and Rohit caresses it to long-off. Lucknow roars with its captain, screaming "Indiaaaaaa, Indiaaaaaa"
mis-hit as Rohit goes slogging - he rarely does that but here, the slower ball deceives him, and instead of hitting over long-on, he looks midwicket and gets a leading edge to third man
smears a full-paced, short and wide delivery out to the sweeper cover

clears the boundary again! Rohit is putting on a masterclass in six-hitting. Even these 80m boundaries aren't stopping him. Picks up the length ball, goes down on one knee and slog sweeps it to smithereens

and there she goes! Soooo high. Soooo long. Even a ball meant to cramp him on leg stump is put away as he clears the front leg and swings that big bat. The fielder at midwicket joins the 50,000 in the ground as a spectator

dropped - and that's only technically cause Rohit thundered down the pitch and hammered it back at the bowler, meant to clear him, but it is brave of Allen to reach his hands up and try and take it. Never stands a chance though
slices it away over point! It's all so easy for Rohit. He knows Thomas will give him all the pace he needs so he just offered the bat as a ramp outside the off stump.
fullish on off stump, Rohit dabs to point and gets across to the other end. Direct hit at the bowler's end would have fetched a wicket.
shortish and outside off, Rohit chops it to point
they're trying to keep the ball wide of Rohit's reach - the swing that takes the ball to long-on and midwicket - and it seems to be working. India's captain has to settle for dabs to point

picks the gap between point and short third man! That's all he needs to do. That's all he cares to do. Sees a short delivery - it's not even that wide - but he waits on it and carves it into no-man's land
slower short ball just a shade outside off, Rohit shuffles across, gets inside the line and pulls it aerially into the stands beyond backward square leg
good length, fifth stump line, defended to point
128kph, good length into leg stump, he turns neatly off the front foot to midwicket
full on leg stump. Angling across Rohit, but he steps forward to negate the angle. Defended back to Fizz
good length on middle stump. Goes across Rohit's body as he tries to play the late cut. Just past his outside edge and to the keeper. Loopy delivery this time. Rolled his fingers over this one

bowled him! This was fired in at 91kph, good length, Sharma played back and tried to work against the line through square leg, it skidded on off the surface, hurried him, inside edge onto pad and then onto the stumps!
back of a length outside leg stump. Comfortably turned off his hips to square leg. There's no one there, which means Rohit can return for the second run. He's playing the field
short, but wide outside leg stump. Rohit tries to pull anyway, and bottom edged to short fine leg. They scamper across
overpitched on off stump. Rohit pings his drive down the ground to long on. Can't get his bat completely under this delivery
sweeps the pacer! He expected the ball to be full, so Rohit shuffles across to the off side. Pitches on middle stump, and swept over short fine leg. Terrific bat speed. Moves to 49
slower ball, short outside off. Runs down the wicket and cuts to deep point. That's his 13th T20I fifty!
length on middle, flicked away towards backward square leg
fuller around off, Rohit looks to go straight down the ground, a little bit of swing away and he misses it
flipper, fired into off, he defends on the front foot
short of length on middle and leg, pulled towards backward square leg
and that's gone! A good catch running forward from deep square leg by Ferguson. It was short on the body, Rohit went for the pull but not from the middle of the bat, a big wicket for New Zealand
length ball outside off. Steps out and miscues an attempted lofted drive. Gets it between extra cover and mid-off
yorker outside off, sliced to sweeper cover

easy. Overpitched on middle stump. The front foot has gone out of the way long before the ball arrives. The hands have come under it just at the right time. Jumps into the 90s with this sightscreen crusher
full ball on the leg stump. Goes too hard at it with the slog and ends up getting a thick inside edge down to fine leg
yorker length and in at the stumps. Gets the front leg out of the way and chips it towards long-on
genius. Full toss wide outside off, but he has managed to stretch across and whip this to the square leg boundary with a sweep
yorker at leg stump, jams it to long-on
backs away and then jumps back into line to enable a thick outside edge over short third man. Too much room. Chucks himself at the wide length ball and gets lucky

a top edge lands wide of long-on, running in and to his right. Dropped catch, really. Rohit looks to sweep, is through the shot early. Thompson runs in and has to lunge to his right in the end, but that wasn't too difficult
short of length around off and middle, turned away towards square leg
141kph, back of a length, run off the open face down to third man
fired through, angled down leg, he tried to pull and slips over as it hits the pad. There's an appeal but it's not out
shorter and wider, it skids on, he tries to late cut but misses
138kph, back of a length, off stump, he defends from the crease
91 kph, some flight around middle, hit away towards long-on. but Miraz gets across to stop the ball
squeezes the ball through backward point for three. Full and wide, Rohit comes down and jams the ball away. Pulled back just inside the boundary
a thick outside edge for four. A slower ball outside off, Rohit is deceived into a stroke. Gets a thick outside edge which flies away to the third man fence
good single. Back of a length outside off, Rohit comes down and slashes the ball towards backward point.
back of a length around middle and leg, pulled away to deep square leg. On the bounce. He'd be disappointed he didn't get more.
slow outside off, pushed away to long-off. India's fifty is up.
very slow down leg, pushed away to long-on
overpitched and wide outside off, driven to deep cover for one.
strays down leg for a wide. Not that full, says Mushy
low full toss on middle stump. Flicked off his toes to deep midwicket. Early call for two, and Rohit's back with ease
full and fast outside off, pushed to cover. Tidy end from Mehidy
crunch! A front foot pull over long on! Just a fraction short at 126kph, Rohit read it and flat batted this over long on and it goes all the way
slow around middle and off, off the outside edge to short third man. Nicely bowled, nice and slow through the air.
127kph, good length on off, he turns with soft hands to square leg for a single
129kph, good length slower ball on off, he defends with soft hands into the off side for a simple one
tossed up leg break, very full, driven back to the bowler
short around middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket for one
full on leg, Rohit comes down and inside-edges the ball towards the keeper. A good run from Dhawan, asks his partner to come through
nicely bowled agai, jamming in a yorker around off, drilled away to long-on
full just outside off stump. Big stride forward and defended towards the non-striker

over long on! It's huge! Good length on middle stump but Rohit's well set now. Dances down the wicket, and converts it into a full ball. Full followthrough of the bat thereafter, and sent over the ropes
short around off, pushed to long-on from the back foot
142kph, good length, hint of swing in to off, runs off the edge along the ground to third man
146kph, inswinging yorker, he jams the bat down and squeezes it behind square, just got the bat down in time!
good start from Paterson, back of a length outside off, some away movement, dabbed towards point. A defensive start

full outside off, and Rohit tries to play the square drive. He wedges it away behind square, but the ball goes straight to backward point! He's disappointed as the bowler goes on to do a jig. Rohit makes 97 one day, falls for a duck two days later. Welcome to the uncertain world of cricket
rolls his fingers over this one. Two dots in a row for KOB. Back of a length on middle, and tapped off the back foot

bowled him! A tired shot from Rohit, who misses out on a third T20I ton. It's a length ball on leg stump. Everything you want at this stage. He slogs at it and can't get anywhere near making contact. It tonks the top of leg stump
falls short of mid-off, who Rohit will be disappointed not to clear. It's a length ball on off stump, there's room and he's looking to go inside-out. Can't get the middle of the bat on it
full ball outside off. Walks across and looks to flick. Miscues. Gets it to deep midwicket off the toe-end
full on leg stump, tapped through square leg
third man can't cut it off. Well bowled but it's four. Length on off stump. Rohit gets a thick outside edge as this straightens. Tamim doesn't put in the effort to his left
short of a length outside off, steered to third man off the outside edge
flies past the outside edge. Superb line. Climbs off a length from the corridor and it's too good for Rohit who hangs his bat out
that's short and wide outside off, plenty of width, and Rohit gets underneath the length, slashes and gets enough power behind it to clear the third man boundary
good length on leg stump. Looks to flick but the face is closed too early. Gets a leading edge down to third man
overpitched wide outside off, nice flowing drive straight to extra cover
chops it on. Too close for the late cut but Rohit goes with that option. It skids off the surface with some shape in off the surface. Inside edge and the stumps light up
skiddy length ball on middle, defended back
imperious! Short ball on off, Rohit's balance is impeccable as he pulls in front of square to effortlessly clear deep midwicket. Nothing delivery that was sitting up properly to be whacked
another short ball on middle and leg, Rohit swivels back and helps this to the fine leg fence. So easy on the eye
short of length and angling into middle and leg, helped towards fine leg
steps out as Akila shortens his length, defended. He did all the hard work in getting to the ball but couldn't stop it cleanly, single as a result
slider on middle from wide of the crease. Rohit is cramped for room and ends up defending back

steps out and whips this straight to midwicket. He looked to clear the infield but didn't get any elevation. Was hit hard, superbly taken by Kusal Mendis. He saw Rohit advancing and fired this towards the pads. Rohit didn't have room to properly get under the length and ended up chipping the catch.
short and wide, tripe to start. Rohit is a tad tentative. Cut to cover point.
short and very wide. Takes it on with the cut but that's too wide
full, seams back in exaggeratedly. But Rohit gets some bat on his flick, the ball hits the pad. Bangladesh think of reviewing, but the umpire says "15 and gone". Was that pad first?
good length and a tad wide outside off, inside-edged past the stumps for a run.
short and wide, tripe, cut away easily over backward point for four. No man there, that's terrible bowling. India are off and running, 18 off the first.

short on middle and leg, Rohit backs away, looking to cut the ball over third man. The ball goes through to the keeper, Klaasen goes up in appeal. And he is so confident that they call for the review. Big noise as bat passes ball, there is a spike on Snicko, so South Africa have their first. Junior Dala has his first international wicket!

139 kph, plumb in front this time! No review from Rohit and that's SA's first. This has been some start from the hosts. They have been bowling it full, enticing some swing, and the conditions haven't let them down. Pitched full outside off, it seams back in prodigiously to hit Rohit in front of middle and leg. A golden duck for Rohit. Not much he could do with that delivery. Has to accept the luck of the draw.
138ks low full-toss pushed wide outside off, Rohit reaches out for the ball with his hands and drives through the covers
slower, full ball, straying into the pads, picked off through backward square leg. Biiiig no-ball from Morris
back of a length and angling in at off, Morris cranks it up to 140ks, Rohit gets right behind the line and defends to cover
quick offcutter, floated in at middle, Rohit nudges it defensively to the leg side
follows the change-up with a loose half-volley on off, Rohit stretches out and drives it firmly past the right of the bowler and left of Dhawan

back of a length and veering down leg, nearly 140ks, Rohit uses the pace of Morris to his advantage, and whips it away fine past the left of the keeper to round out the first over with back-to-back boundaries
pitched up and attacking off stump, Rohit's forward defensive intervenes

Dala belts out an appeal for leg-before. And the finger goes up. Was it slanting down the leg side? Rohit chooses not to challenge the on-field out decision. The umpires check for the no-ball: Dala is all good. Pretty full and skids back into Rohit, who plays all around it, and plays late. He is pinned on the pad, but it might have headed past leg stump? Dala has dismissed Rohit for the third time this T20 series
six more. Back of a length, 138 kph, the ball keeps climbing and Rohit pulls, not quite all of it, but enough to clear the backward square leg boundary. Fantastic timing
pitched up and nibbles away outside off - hint of awayswing - Rohit presses forward and solidly pushes to the covers
back of a length and veering in at the top of off, Rohit's back-foot defence intervenes. The ball is coming onto the bat nicely in the early exchanges

Jeevan Mendis tears back from mid-off and tracks down Rohit's sliced hit. Sensational catch running back and across to his left from mid-off. He gets into an awkward side-on position, but makes the catch look a lot easier. He lands on his back but still hangs onto the ball. Sri Lanka huddle up while Rohit exits. This was fuller and outside off - in Rohit's swinging arc - he aims to hoist it over the man inside the circle but winds up skewing it off the bottom part. Rohit gone for a duck. What a lift for Sri Lanka
wild full ball down leg - so wild that it would have missed a set of stumps down the leg side. Chameera attempted a cutter and it went wrong. Leg-side wide it is
short of a length and angled across off stump. Runs it to third man with an open face
short of a length on middle stump, dropped into the square leg area with soft hands
beaten. Nicely bowled. Wobbly length ball outside off, tentative prod away from the body and it zips past the outside edge
dominant. Short ball outside off, latches onto it on the front foot and pulls it to the wide long-on boundary
full on leg stump, tapped straight to mid-on off the front foot
too much width. Short and Rohit moves his weight back before carving this on the up past point
short and wide again, can't bowl there anywhere, never mind the Highveld, slashed through point for four. SA have not adjusted
good length and attacking off stump from over the wicket, Rohit brings his bat down in line and plays it back down the pitch
excellent lines, full around off, cramping Rohit for room, hit into the off side, towards cover.
a tad too wide, and short. The ball moves away. Outside the tramline.
very full, around off, Rohit watchfully defends. No big shots just yet, Rohit giving himself a chance.
short on off, Rohit hangs back and rides a single down to deep third man
Thomas hits 150kph! But this is short and wide, Rohit makes additional room by jumping outside leg. Scythed up and over point
and Rohit welcomes the left-arm spinner with a boundary. Pushed through on middle, Roihit stays leg-side of the ball and hoists it over mid-off, who's inside the circle
fired flatter and faster on middle, Rohit taps a single down to long-off
fired on middle, drifts in, Rohit ventures down the track and tickles off the pads but can't get it past short fine leg
middle-stump yorker, Rohit jams a single through midwicket and shields Dhawan from Thomas
full-toss on middle, 143kph, rushes Rohit. He flaps it to mid-on as the bat twists in his hands
Rohit backs away outside leg, Thomas chases him with a 149kph delivery. Rohit still swings, clears mid-off, and the boundary, despite not quite middling it
short on off, 146kph, chopped to deep third man. No-ball from Thomas
tossed on middle, drifts into Rohit's swinging arc. He launches it nice and clean over mid-on for the second six of the innings. #Lucknow is big but not big enough for Rohit
back of a length and seams back in for the top of off, tapped to mid-off. Paul's front foot has strayed. Fairly big no-ball
speared on middle, tipped into the off side for one
slower ball on off, Rohit waits for it to arrive, then works to square leg
back of a length and angling down the leg side for yet another leg-side wide
Rohit rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and pulls along the ground to deep midwicket

dropped? Nope, Pierre's claiming the catch but the umpires will want to check on it. Good bowling sets up this play, the length just short of where Rohit can drive, but he goes for it anyway, and ends up almost being caught and bowled. Replays show it's bounced before reaching Pierre
another cutter, down leg, hit away towards cover for one. Clearly struggling for timing, but he'll stick around
short and quick, punched to long-on for one. 'Good stuff, Miraz,' yells Mushy
Rohit runs down and yorks himself. Full on leg, he jams it out.
