89 kph, flat on middle and leg. Rohit was waiting back this time, sees the flight, stays back and slog-sweeps the ball over midwicket. Too easy.
full outswinger outside off, pitching on the popping crease, he slices it through the gully
angled down leg, he picks this up and flicks it up and over short fine! Great shot
he holds this back and finds a bit of turn, Rohit adjusts and knocks a single down to long-off
short, wide, flayed on the up but straight to the covers. Rohit just went too hard at this one too
back of a length and veering down leg, Rohit swings... and misses. Leg-side wide
pretty full and angling in towards the stumps, Rohit aims to hoist it over midwicket, but loses his shape and hoicks over square leg off the inside half of the bat
good single there, on a length outside off, pushed towards cover point for a tight single. Makes it easily
slow outside off, 81 kph, carved away towards backward point.

lovely shot from Rohit! Back of a length, very slow, around middle. He goes back and forces the ball through wide mid-on with as straight a bat as possible with that shot. Finds the gap, wide of the fielder
short and wide, slapped to extra cover. A yes and no. No eventually
finds the fielder again. Short and wide outside off, slashed away to the same extra cover fielder.
shortish outside off, punched to long-off from the back foot
good length around middle, Rohit is right behind the line to defend that back.
shortish and a tad wide, carved behind point. But just one to third man.

a mis-timed lofted drive. Full and straight, trying to force the pace. The ball lobs right back over the bowler's head. Abu runs to his left from mid-on, but can't hold on. Goes down as a drop eventually.
on the pads this time, clipped away towards square leg. Should have been two there, but Rohit doesn't want it.
on the pads, but Rohit gets a leading edge to wide mid-on as he tries to turn it to the legside. Quick ball at 144 kph
short ball, but doesn't bounce. 144 kph again. Angling into Rohit, who tries to work it away but it flies off his pad towards the slips
keeps it on a length outside off that time, Rohit lets it go. 145kph
on the up and away. Goes too full, and there is enough room outside off for Rohit to free his arms and get into a flowing drive that goes over the in-field and into the fence
gets it to bounce uncomfortably off a length from off. Rohit reacts quickly to keep it down and take his bottom hand off the bat

through him, at 147 kph And they've gone for the review, the West Indians reckon Rohit got a touch on that and is caught behind. And replays confirm an inside edge Rohit will have to go here. Superb delivery, on a length, coming back into the batsman at high pace. It took his inside edge and flew, but Ramdin dived to his left and took a smart catch. Rohit has owned Eden Gardens most times, but not to be today
too wide outside off, outside the tram lines in fact and is called 'wide'
good length and holds its line outside off, 140kph, Rohit simply watches it through to the keeper
starts outside off and seams away further, 140kph, Rohit presses forward and lets it go again
short and hits the splice of the bat, 144kph, as Rohit hops and fends it off to the covers
just short of a good length and outside off, Thomas cranks upto 145kph, Rohit hops again, jabbing to cover
full and angling in towards off stump, 145kph, Rohit calmly covers up the line and plays it back to him

dug in short and outside off, 146kph, Thomas has Rohit hopping again. The batsman aims to punch it off the back foot, but this rushes onto him and messes with his timing. Tapped to the covers. So, Thomas begins with a maiden
yorker outside off, jammed straight to backward point
opts for the short ball, the first one he's bowler, Sharma goes for the pull and it's a top edge but runs to fine leg to take him to fifty off 28 balls
oh boy. An old-fashioned heave. Full ball on the stumps and he gets right under this, on one knee, to pick it up and over midwicket
and again. Backs away too much and reaches out. Just manages to get the bottom of the outside edge on it and slice it over backward point
wide outside off stump, Rohit's dancing down the wicket so it's a full toss eventually. Bunted down the ground to long off
full on middle stump. Angling into him. Tries to turn this towards the leg side, but misses completely. Hits his back leg and goes down to third man. That hurt!
overpitched on middle stump. Rohit tries a big heave to the leg side, but inside edged onto his boots. Appeal for lbw,  but the umpire isn't interested

yorker on off stump. Smacked back to Rubel, and he sticks his hand out. That stops the ball, but the batsmen want the single anyway. Harakiri, eventually. Rubel collects the ball, and walks across to the non-striker's end to run Rohit out. India finish on 176 for 3.
slants the fuller delivery into the right-hander, who is waiting to let the ball pitch and turn. But it doesn't and Rohit gets an inside edge as he hurries to defend his stumps
launches it to the long-on boundary, coming down the track to take on Bangladesh's best bowler. Looks a decent idea for the right-hander to play Shakib as an inswing bowler
fires it in on middle, Rohit works it through midwicket
full and fast on off stump, Rohit drives to extra cover
overpitched and Rohit mauls it over long-on! That big back lift coming through the line of the ball and then ending up  behind his shoulders... Breathtaking shot....
spears it down leg - and it's short too - Rohit says thank you very much with a pull shot that flies past square leg's left
full toss very wide outside off stump this time. Rohit knows where short third man is, and he opens the bat's face. Glanced past the keeper's right for another boundary. Caressed, really
that's pulverised! It's into the stands. It's the longest hit of the match! Rohit just jumps out of his crease, takes on a length ball and launches it over deep midwicket #LikeABoss.
turns a full delivery on leg stump to square leg
cuts a short ball over to point, Rohit looks for a single, but Suresh Raina, the new batsman screams no, and he's right to do so
full and outside off, drives to extra cover
a little bit of turn as Rohit comes down to block a good length ball on off stump. Outside edge goes to short third man
whips this full toss to deep midwicket

looks to go over cover, plays early and gets a thick edge that is snaffled by Seifert. Rohit's painful existence is over, he didn't have the timing or the touch today. One slog too many and that is sure to mount more pressure on India.
length, angled away, defended to point
length, angled away, takes a few steps forward and guides it to third-man. Very little pace on offer, by the look of it
length outside off, hint of that natural outswing that he gets, Rohit waited for it and steered it to third-man
length outside off, punched off the middle of the bat but straight to cover
full on off stump, Rohit blocks it down the pitch
length outside off, steered to third-man, there was an initial call for two but the eventually decide against it
low full toss outside off stump, Rohit keeps his bat's face open and carves this over point! Hit over the infield, and no stopping that thereafter
almost chopped on! Yorker on off stump, and the batsman tries to run this down to third man. Bottom edges it and the ball trickles down to the leg side. Excellent delivery
good length and slanting into off stump from over the stumps, Rohit camps back, tips the ball in front of cover point. Searches for a quick single but is sent back by Dhawan
slower ball, dabbed into backward point, and that's a wonderful hundred...his third century in T20Is, just the second player to make three
hammered! Full outside off, a very hittable ball, he throws his hands through the drive between deep cover and long-off
full, very wide, Sharma walks across his crease and drives one-handed out to deep cover
what a stroke! Guess it shouldn't surprise us anymore, but it's still magnificent. Moves across the crease and scoop/sweeps a full delivery over short fine leg
length ball outside off, steered down to third man
short of a length outside off, a crunching pull off the front foot and splits the men deep on the leg side
136kph, swinging into the pads and he eases this with glorious timing through square midwicket
short outside off, cut to deep cover...they don't take on Bairstow's arm (Hardik dropped his bat anyway)
nearly done in the flight here, comes down the pitch, Rashid drags his length back and it's dabbed to short third man

Twenty one off the over! Hider's been hammered this over. He hasn't bowled too well either. This is a full toss outside off stump and Rohit's got the liberty to free his arms. Pulled over deep midwicket once again! Real stand-and-deliver stuff from the India captain
chopped into the off side
full on off stump. Doesn't spin this time and Rohit's in the mood for some big shots. Tries to slog this over the bowler's head, but mistimed. Goes down the ground to long on
low full toss on middle stump, gets his front foot out of the way and crunches this check-drive to wide long on. Misfield in the deep, and Rohit gets back on strike
excellent full ball on off stump. Rohit's drive comes off the bat's toe end. Trickles down to long on
full on middle stump and going across Rohit. Cut off the back foot, but played close to his body. Sent to deep point
good length on off stump, Raina skips down the wicket and mistimes his pull to cow corner. Off the bat's top half
good length on middle stump, goes onto the back foot and cuts this in front of square. The ball dribbles down to deep extra cover
full on leg stump. Tries to flick it towards midwicket, but takes the leading edge. Lobs over Raina and lands in front of the vacant mid-off region
Taken in the stands! Good length on leg stump, and Rohit's quick to latch on to the length. Down on one knee, and smacked beyond deep midwicket. Sweet sound off the bat
full on off stump. Rohit drives down the ground to long off. Overpitched enough so that the batsman can't get under this delivery
pulled over cow corner! Short on off stump and the pace doesn't bother Rohit much. Gets on top of this delivery and smacked towards the leg side. Enough elevation to take it way beyond the boundary
full on middle stump. Big wind up from Rohit, and crunches this drive to long off. He'll keep strike
similar length and attacking middle stump, Rohit gets right behind the line in defence. Played back to Rankin
length on middle, Rohit presents a straight bat and a high elbow to loft him over mid-on and the fielder races after, dives to save two on the boundary

the short fine-leg shows great anticipation and takes a simple catch in the end!. Rohit goes for a premeditated scoop, it doesn't quite come onto the bat, he doesn't get all of it and ends up spooning it to short fine-leg, who was ready for it before the shot was even completed
scoops the full delivery from around the wicket to the right of cover
comes down the pitch and dabs the length ball, meant to cramp him, through point
punches the back of a length delivery to extra cover

taken at long-on! Rohit's gone and Bangladesh have pulled ahead in this final! India's captain has been timing them like a dream all night. But this time, going for a slog sweep at a ball that doesn't really give him enough room, he skews it high rather than long
low full toss, aiming for the yorker, clipped to deep midwicket
gives himself room outside leg stump and drives a full delivery to cover
back of a length outside off, 136 kph, Rohit is on top of the bounce to dab towards point. Generating decent pace, but not much movement
driven in the air over the covers, came a little off the toe end, but the placement is well wide of deep cover
full outside off, driven to deep cover where Bairstow does well to keep them to a single
he can't finish the over, it's a slow full toss, effortlessly flicked over deep square leg
fierce straight drive, and good on Nazmul to bend down and thrust his hands at a ball which might well have been singeing the turf as it left Rohit's bat
defeats him with a slower ball, into the pitch short of a length, he's through his cross-batted swipe far too early and it goes straight down the pitch
full, wide outside off, and another diving save from Roy at backward point
touch slower, he waits on the back foot and steers out to deep cover
out of the front of the hand, clubbed down to long-on
a low full toss, straight, chipped down to long-on...India motoring
that's a lovely delicate shot...he started moving around the crease, then angled a short-of-a-length delivery wide of the keeper
that's outta here! Short of a length outside off and pulled high and handsome over deep midwicket
starts to use his feet, but it's a touch shorter than he though so waits then steers through point with an open face
goes for the slog sweep, think he picked the googly, but doesn't make contact and it's a neat take from Buttler
full outside off, guided to backward point
back of a length outside off, driven behind square on the off side and Roy parries it with a full-length dive. He's taken a blow on the wrist
a slower ball, length outside off, dabbed down to third man
length on middle, defended
very full on middle, and Rohit digs it out from the blockhole to extra cover
gets fifty and brings Colombo to its feet! A simple flick through midwicket does the job
mid-off is up and so Rohit dances down the track, gets inside the line of the ball and consciously opens the face of the bat to get it over that fielder. Good cricket.
he gets such height on his sixes! Clears his front leg and goes after the ball with roughly the same fervour as Liam Neeson goes after the bad guys in the Taken movies. Sensational hit over long-off
full and outside off, drives to cover point
on leg stump, works it away to square leg, and then punches the air as if he's missed out

and now he shows off the other side of his game: the one where he knows the gaps on the ground with inch-perfect precision. Brings out the late cut because the ball is short and wide and places it between third man and point. There is absolutely no power in the shot, just class

this is the cutter, and there is enough in the surface to provide a little bit of extra bounce. Rohit goes for that late cut again, the ball going to the left of third man. The batsman searches for a single, he's sent back, and is safe only because of a lack of direct hit
full and outside off, drives handsomely through to the left of sweeper cover
full on off stump, smacks it to short cover
shortish on middle, turns it to deep midwicket and retains strike
shortish and outside off, Rohit short-arm pulls it to long-on
full on leg stump, works it to long-on
full and outside off, slices it to the left of deep point. That bat was a blur as he whirled it around
pats a shortish delivery to long-on
low full toss, which Rohit hits to midwicket
drives on the up and benefits from a misfield at cover by Liton Das
back of a length and outside off, Rohit wafts at it, stuck on his back foot, and is beaten
slashes it to the man at deep point, who ends up being surprised at the pace at which the ball reaches him. Rohit is hittin em close to perfect.
full on middle, Rohit blocks to cover
nudges a full delivery on off stump to long-on
sets up for a big shot, that backlift going high, but he seems content in flicking down to long-on
runs the shortish delivery to deep point
goes for the late cut, even when the ball is very very full, and barely wide of off stump. Somehow manages to get bat to it for a single to third man
squares him up with a slower delivery, angled into leg stump and the fact it is only 83 kph means it can grip the pitch and turn. With it being full as well, it troubles the batsman
fuller than a good length and straying into the pads of Rohit, 134ks, he plays around his front pad and flicks between square leg and midwicket to get off the mark
low full-toss, angling into middle and leg, patted away to the right of mid-on
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, Rohit presses forward, meets the pitch, and blocks solidly to cover
deflects this late to short third man for a quick single
length around off, punched towards deep extra cover for one more
down the track and goes aerial, over the bowler's head and clears the boundary line with utter ease, was a length ball outside off but all that doesn't matter when Rohit is in touch
length on middle and leg, gets to his fifty with a single to square leg, off 28 balls. For comparison, de Grandhomme brought up his in 27 balls
full ball on the stumps, gets a big inside edge as he looks to slug this over the leg side
length around off, wasn't that short but Rohit goes for the pull, doesn't get the power behind it and ends up hitting right down the throat of Southee at deep midwicket
full toss outside off, makes too much room and hits it straight to extra cover
length ball outside off, slapped on the up to sweeper cover
sweet! Length ball on middle stump, opens up his arms and pummels it on the rise to send it flat over midwicket
rocks back and cuts to beat point, down to the sweeper
short of length outside off, dabs it towards third man for one
length around off, shaping away from the batsman who steers it past the keeper, beats third man
fuller around off, drives it gently towards wide long-on
full on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
slower length ball, dabbed to third man again
helps it along to short fine and ambles to see the throw come at him at the bowler's end, Rohit had given up but this didn't hit the stumps so all good.
swivels around and helps this along to deep square leg
hint of width and he blasts this between cover and mid-off. Sashayed down the pitch, freed his arms and went through
delicate little glide past short third man, all class.
gets a leading edge that rolls into the gap between backward point and short third man. Rohit turned the bat face too early in trying to flick
punches this to mid-off, sent back
in the blockhole, almost a yorker around off, Rohit gets his bat down in time
chipped into the gap between cover and mid-off
short, sliding down and Rohit helps it along to the fine leg boundary. Poor from Ish, sat up nicely. Rohit now becomes the highest run-getter in T20Is
chops the cut to point, got one to skid back in
full toss wide outside off, makes too much room again, but he manages to slice it this time. Wide over point
shapes away off a length outside off, left alone
width and he's cut this behind point. Lockie at square third man can't get there. Sublime from Rohit, just stood tall and flayed this away
full from wide of the crease, this nips away late from off stump, left alone
squared up by the length but he manages to defend this into the off side
driven firmly to long-off
looks to get inside the line and whip this behind square, but is beaten for pace by this incoming length ball. Hit on the thigh.
flicks this uppishly to deep square

he's clobbered this over deep midwicket. What a welcome to the bowling crease. Length outside off at 142kph from wide of the crease, Rohit picked the length and had a free swing of the bat, timing absolutely magnificent
floats this too full, Rohit caresses this into the gap between cover and mid-off
drifting into middle and leg, nudged towards square leg
flayed on the up, superb half-stop by Santner, throwing himself to his right at point
hit on the box! Ouch, that should hurt. Rohit looks to back away and muscle this incoming length ball over midwicket, beaten for pace.
what a comeback! Stand and deliver. Picks the length and wallops this over mid-on, one bounce into the ropes.
uses the pace to whip this over short fine, carries all the way. Short boundary that side, and a lovely pick up shot to boot.
belted in front of square, one bounce to Taylor at deep midwicket
slower length ball, worked into the leg side.
leg-cutter outside off, eases this straight to point.
goes over cover, not perfectly timed as the bat face turns in his land but gets enough to clear the infield.
hoicked across the line, one bounce to long-on.
slips this down leg, Rohit looks to help it along but misses.
works this from outside off towards midwicket
slower ball angling in from wide of the crease, Rohit paddles this straight to short fine leg. Would've been out lbw had he missed that
driven sweetly to sweeper cover
skids in a length ball from around the stumps, defended back
slices this drive off a full toss to deep point
wide of the crease, angling into the leg stump, Rohit forays down the track, gets close to the pitch and swings it languidly over midwicket. Clears the bigger boundary with no fuss
back of a length and sliding in with the arm, nudged to leg for one more
short, flat dart on off stump, Rohit hangs back and nurdles it to the midwicket region
full and drifts in on off stump, Rohit bunts a single down to long-on
non-turner outside off, Rohit presses forward and eases a single to sweeper cover
very full and sliding into the pads, picked off to deep square leg
dug in short on middle, Rohit rides the bounce and works a single wide of midwicket. Fifty up for India
short, wide, Rohit shifts his balance onto the back foot again and nails a cut past point. Easy peasy for India
back of a length and homing in on off, Rohit leans back and chops straight to short third man
non-turning dart on the pads, worked along the ground to square leg
kicks up from a length on off, Rohit loosens his grip and diffuses it to point
back of a length and angling in towards off stump, Rohit gets his head over the ball and blocks it back to Rankin
full and angling into the pads from wide of the crease, Rohit falls over the flick and wears it on the pad
a bit too full and outside off, Rohit stays leg-side of the ball and lifts it inside-out over extra cover. Hit with utter nonchalance
Rohit leans back, rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and steers to backward point
leg-side wide, Rohit can't connect with a flick
short on off, cramps Rohit for room, chopped to the keeper's right for one
full and just a shade outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
full and angling in from wide of the crease, but the line from Chase is too straight, Rohit searches for an on-drive but instead inside-edges it away past short fine leg for four
back of a length and outside off, Rohit aims to pump it through the covers but the ball does not come on. Inside-edged away to the leg side
full and straying into the pads, deflected away fine past the diving keeper for four leg byes
overpitched and angling into the pads, tripe bowling, Rohit simply picks it up and whips it over square leg. So easy on the eye again
on a length and outside off, Rohit punches on the up to sweeper cover
Rohit uses his feet, the spinner goes short and outside off, stabbed to the bowler's right
short arm-ball, short-armed away through midwicket off the back foot
slips out of his hand perhaps, this is too far wide outside off as Rohit leaves
nice flight, gets to the pitch and drives to sweeper cover
punched to deep cover
eased with the spin to deep cover
tucks this flatter one towards the man coming in from deep midwicket
plays the late cut to backward point
width outside off, flayed to deep point
belted on the up into the gap at deep cover, good running. Santner in the deep slipped, possibly because of dew.
through with the pull even before the ball arrived. Had to fetch it from way outside off
slashed to deep point
dabs this into the off side for a single
wild slog, off a thick inside edge to square leg
belts this full toss straight to long-on.
cramped for room, squeezes this attempted lofted hit to long-on

an offcutter at a length on off stump, taps it on the up to extra cover and calls for a tight single. Just makes it at the non-stirker's end. It was in the air as he collided with the bowler while trying to get back in the crease. It's a fifty though. What's next?
full ball outside off. Yorks himself and drives straight to extra cover off the toe-end
full toss outside off. Leans in and caresses it to sweeper cover
mix-up but also a fumble at extra cover. Full ball at off stump. Rohit jams it out to the fielder who can't hold on as the batsmen struggle with their decision before eventually going through
short of a length ball fired in at middle stump. Stays deep in the crease and tickles it through midwicket off the back foot
slower short ball down the leg side, helped to fine leg for one
very full on middle and leg, 136ks, Rohit, having backed away outside leg, has ample room to biff it over extra cover
short and angling in, chopped from off stump to deep third man
back of a length and outside off, the ball does not come onto the bat, punched away to mid-off

dropped. Easy catch, completely fluffed. Rohit backs away and reaches out trying to lift one over extra cover off the back foot. Not enough pace for it obviously. Skews it wide of long-off, who gets under it but can't catch with the reverse cup
slower ball outside off, eased to sweeper cover for one
up there on off, defended on the front foot
a full toss down leg side, Rohit fails to connect with his swing
Sharma looks to make room and go to cover, but gets an inside edge into the leg side for a single
slow legbreak, Sharma punches it to long-off for one

Boyce gets the wicket after building the pressure going at a strike rate of 100. Sharma plays a tired chip shot off the toes, and finds midwicket with it. Sharma has done his job, though. Asking rate less than what it was when they started the chase
that's chipped in the air well wide of midwicket and down to long on for a single, McCullum bowled that on the pads and Rohit pushed forward to play it too early

Rohit gets on the front foot and lofts the ball into the gap in front of deep square leg, Elliott runs to his left on the boundary and dives to save the four, taps it to Anderson who runs to back him up
pushed off the front foot into the covers
Rohit pushes forward and outside off to open the face and steer towards third man, he can't beat the fielder in the circle
tries to run the ball to third man again but bottom edges the ball towards the empty slip cordon, Kohli urges Rohit through for the run
drifting into the right-hander from around the wicket, pushed off the front foot on the off side

stumped! Ronchi fumbles and juggles the take but Rohit was so far out of his crease that he had time to recover and break the stumps. Rohit was still barely in the frame! He had walked out of the crease to turn the ball on the leg side but Santner beat him with the length and ripped it past the outside edge. Big, big turn.

Rohit falls first ball! Hussey bowls from round the wicket, bowls it flat and quick, lands on middle, spins towards the pads, he tries to tuck it but leaves a gap, the ball deflects off his pads and onto the stumps
six and out. Barnwell bowls a very similar ball, tempting Rohit to have another go. Rohit obliges, looks to go straighter this time, but just misses a straight ball and the furniture is rearranged.
clubbed. Clouted. Clobbered. Take your pick. Length ball angling into Rohit, who gets under it and whacks the leather off it, before the ball lands in the greens behind long-on.
roobish ball as Messrs. Boycott would say. Full and a metre down the leg side. Five wides.
on a length around off stump, Rohit check-drives into the covers for one.
majestic from Rohit, skips down the pitch to West Indies' fastest bowler, converts a decent ball into a length offering, and slams it down the ground for a big six.
slower ball at 69.7 mph, Rohit awaits in earnest and eventually guides it through point for one.
slow bouncer, Rohit is completely off-colour today as he fails to spot another one and misses the pull. He is hit on the ribs as the ball pops away towards gully.
slow legcutter this time, Rohit tries his best to get some muscle into the shot but still mistimes into the off side for a single.
low full toss, driven nicely to deep cover for another fifty in Australia. Generous applause for him
picks the slower offcutter and drags this into the big leg-side boundary with a slog. Placed perfectly in front of deep midwicket for four
another full toss, but this is driven to deep cover for one
and Sharma gets the full toss to break the pressure. Down the wicket and whacks this high full toss over the short leg-side boundary. As you were...

this has clearly flicked Sharma's leg down the leg side, but both the Indian batsmen behaving ridiculously. Sharma asks why this is not called a wide, and Kohli asks him if he is kidding him. Clear sound and clear deflection on the replay. Must be wearing great protection if Sharma didn't feel this
chipped down to straight of long-on for two
this is a clear big wide down the leg side
nearly yorker, dug back into the stumps at the non-striker's end
lovely shot. Half-volley on off, and he has send this over mid-off with minimum of fuss
full, middle and leg, driven to long-off for one
a low full toss on off stump, to midwicket for a single
driven to long-off for one
short of a length, wide, Sharma loves it as he rocks back to late-cut it for four. Makes it look ridiculously easy
slow full toss, Rohit wasn't even close to picking it and ended up toe-ending a slog straight to midwicket.
short of a length, angling in, punched to long-on for one
full, middle and off, driven between long-off and deep cover for two
flatter non-turning delivery, beats the inside edge and hits the pad
down the wicket to drive it straight to the man who has just come to cover
slow in the air, cramping him up, chipped to long-on for one
good pace there, skids along at 145ks, beats the inside edge, hits the pad a touch high
Tait is still as quick, and Sharma is looking a little tired. This is a length ball, but he is late into it, and mis-hits this just short of long-on
hits him high on the bat with a length ball and it goes to long-on for a single
low full toss, driven to deep cover for one
flat, outside off, out of Sharma's reach as he charges at him. Can't take the single to extra cover
full and outside off, punched down to long-off for one
short ball, outside off, pulled to the left of deep midwicket for a couple
tight lines from Barnwell, cuts into Rohit who works it to the square leg region from one more.
this time, Rohit stays in the crease and glances with the turn for one.
top fielding at point, Shehzad dives to his right to cut off the boundary, Rohit had cut it firmly, Irfan is giving him a lot of pace on the ball to work with
high bounce from a good length angling into the right-hander, 140 kph, Rohit had come forward to play it and the ball hit really high on the bat and went on the off side
short ball with good pace, Rohit swivels and pulls behind square to the backward square leg boundary, I can't believe Pakistan's quicks are bowling this way having watched that first innings
short of a length on the hips again, tucked behind square for a single

caught at cover! Rohit tries to loft down the ground but the ball grips the pitch and was not full enough, he ends up lofting it really high in the air towards the off side. Three fielders could have caught it - cover, extra cover, and mid-off - and converged but Malik called for it from extra cover and judged it well. Tumbled to the ground as he caught it.
driven to long off for a single
South Africa have been sloppy today in the filed today, Rohit had pre-meditated the sweep shot, but it went to square leg, and right through him, and that's 50 for Rohit
ends the over with a biggie, it was tossed up and he waited for it to arrive before slamming it high over deep midwicket for a six, brings up the 100 with the shot
goes off side this time, same result, backed away and played it inside out to the deep cover boundary
this time Rohit gets the boundary, swinging the full ball to the left of the man at deep midwicket
goes for the slog sweep on one knee but the deep midwicket region is well protected
goes on the back foot and punches but straight to extra cover
driven down to Ntini on the long on boundary
goes down on a knee and looks to sweep from way outside off,and is beaten
Ntini with the diving save on the straight boundary, Rohit had thwacked it down the ground, but Makhaya saved the boundary, to loud cheers
throws everything at this short delivery that skids on, but there is a man at deep midwicket
driven to sweeper cover for a single
gets forward and turns  it in the air to midwicket
beats him in the flight, Rohit was down the track again, saw the bal lwas not there for the big shot, and tries to run it past the keeper, got a thin edge that AB clanged, missed chance
short of a length from around the wicket, but strays down leg side and concedes a wide
good length outside off, good carry to the keeper, Rohit lets it go

short and wide outside off, good pace on the ball too, Rohit stays in his crease and cuts the ball over point, top shot. Pace is not going to work on this pitch, Pakistan need to slow it up. Cutters are the way to go.
pushes forward at a good length ball angling across him and opens the face to steer behind point, Amir's pace is bringing the ball on to the bat nicely
Nurse drops him. That's not what the doctor ordered. Short ball, turning in and sitting up at Rohit who is surprised by the extra bounce and pats it tamely back. Nurse clangs a sitter.
half-stop from Bishoo, Rohit reaches across and whips to his left and Bishoo dives to parry it away. Can't stop the single.
Rohit goes inside out, languid work of the wrists to pick that up and time it so well with the spin.
Devendra Warne. That ball turned a mile and some, as Rohit leaned out and tried to defend. Not even close to getting bat on it.
and a sharp offbreak to end the over, Rohit is cramped as he defends in a hurry.
Rohit is beaten outside off, Nurse is showing some interesting variations here, this one holds its line.
stays back and plays it out towards point.,
tossed well up to Rohit who reaches the pitch and drives down the ground.
short of a length to start off, Rohit whips it through midwicket for one.
Rohit this time, reaches out and drives with the turn past the bowler.
shorter this time, Rohit forces it into the covers for another single.
Rohit is away, nudging with the spin towards square leg.

boy, did Rohit look lazy there? He dawdles past an offbreak that goes through the bat pad gap, Kieswetter is dozing away as well and doesn't collect it, but he has enough time to make amends as Rohit turns back slowly. India digging the kind of hole they found themselves in several times in the Tests.
lovely stuff, back of a length outside off and breaking in, Rohit pops it to the off side.
tossed up outside off, and the languid Rohit gets it away through midwicket for a single.

and Rohit finds Makhaya on the long on boundary, it was there to be hit in the slot, and he connected too, but the elevation was not much, and Ntini timed his leap perfectly on the boundary to take a fine high catch, the crowd love it
beaten outside off stump! Rohit was expecting the ball to swing back into him after it angled across from over the wicket, but Amir slanted it across with a scrambled seam and beat his forward push
played off the hips towards midwicket
a length ball pitching outside leg, Rohit stays in his crease and tries to flick but misses and is hit on the pad, leg bye behind square
sprays it wide outside off stump this time, Rohit lets it go
tossed well up, Rohit reaches out to the length and plays it to point.
lovely yorker, middle and off, 137ks, dug out back to Watson
big wide down the leg side. Bancroft does really well with a one-handed save to his left
length ball, into the pads, flicked away for three into the bigger side of the ground
Sharma is loving some of the Faulkner medium pace. Another length ball, he gets under it, and drives it over mid-off. He has already made up for the slow start
lovely shot. Touch to go with the earlier power. This is a perfect yorker outside off, but Sharma has steered this between slip and short third man
slower legcutter, but they steal the single. This is dabbed towards the keeper and Dhawan calls Sharma through for the single
thick inside edge as Sharma looks to drive this length ball over mid-off. It falls safely wide of mid-on
extra bounce from Tye from just short of a length. Hits Sharma on the arm as he looks to work it to leg
Sharma looks to play the big pick-up shot on a length ball, and is hit on the pads. Just early into the shot
slower ball, Sharma slogs around it, and is hit in the ribs. They still take a leg-bye
slower ball, short, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, goes for a single
it doesn't matter where the keeper stands. This is a half-volley free hit, and Sharma has smashed this over long-on for six
flat outside off, punched to deep cover for one
flat, short of a length, punched to deep midwicket for one
pushed through, short of a length, wide, punched to deep cover
full and straight, Sharma drives it for one. Good over for Australia: just the singles off it
short of a length, into the body, pushed to midwicket
slower bouncer as Sharma dances down the wicket. Hits him on the left shoulder
another slower ball, hits the inside half of the bat, but they sneak in a single to midwicket
big flat six. Maxwell bowls a flat length ball on off, Sharma makes room and sends it sailing over long-off
works this length ball from outside off for a couple into the leg side. Once again he has pushed this just past the 30-yard circle. precise power behind the shot
short of a length, on off, pushed wide of point for one
Sharma gets stuck into Faulkner first ball. Moves across the stumps and ramps a length ball to the flne leg boundary
full and straight, whipped away to long leg
Sharma finally makes a connection, and it is a sweet one. Hastings bowls a gentle length ball outside off, and Sharma crashes this over cover for four
wide length ball, Sharma can't reach it, called a wide
full toss, wide outside off, and he has sliced it for a six, the first of the innings. This ball has travelled all right. How well has he timed it. Didn't look like hitting it at all
full and wide, drilled to sweeper-cover for one
slower short ball, Sharma moves across to try to pull, but is beaten by the pace
wide full toss, would have been another wide had Sharma not edged it away for four fine of third man
Sharma moves well across, and disturbs a leg-side wide to lob it over short fine for a couple. It was a slower ball, which is why he couldn't time it
slower ball again, dips alarmingly at him to york him. Concedes just the single towards long-off
full outside off, driven to third man for one
slower ball right away, and Fin misfields at short fine to allow the second
full, outside off, pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, on off, defended by Sharma
left alone outside off
big wide down the leg side. Perhaps looking to start too straight with the outswinger
more movement. Testing conditions here. Sharma looks to drive on the up, and is beaten outside off again
too straight again from Watson. twice this over he has done this, and Sharma nicely glances this away for four to fine leg. Actually this is called leg-byes
back to the line outside off, and Sharma is back to getting beaten by the away movement. Tries the big drive outside off
short of a length, hits Sharma's bat high as he looks to punch. No run
another big swing and miss, as Boland stays outside off and just short of a length
more movement, Rohit looks to open the face and is beaten
drops this into the leg side for a single
swing from Watson, a swing and a miss from Sharma. Short of a length, outside off, Sharma goes for the drive on the up, but the movements beats his bat
low full toss, but no room for Sharma to swing his arms. Takes a single all along the ground to long-on
some seam movement from outside off and hits Sharma's thigh pad as he looks to work it to leg
short of a length, outside off, and Sharma opens the face of the bat late and places it fine of third man. That brings up his fifty too
full and straight, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, widish, punched away to deep cover
slower offcutter, Sharma mis-hits a pull, but it doesn't carry to long-on
pulled off the front foot, short at 135ks, and he gets it over midwicket even though the weight is coming forward all the time
short of a length, angling in, pushed to midwicket, and they steal a single
bouncer, 141ks, Sharma ducks under it
full, nearly a yorker, driven to long-on
flighted outside off, pushed to cover
good Tait seems to have turned. A yorker at middle and off first up. Some swing away too. 144ks only. Dug out by Sharma
flighted, slow through the air, driven back to him
another outswinging yorker, dug out to extra cover. Only 141ks. Concentrating on release more than pace?
on a length, 144ks, hit back into the stumps at the non-striker's end
and there is the bad Tait. Wide down the leg side
nicely bowled and nicely played. This is short of a length, rising towards the chest, and Sharms rises with the bounce to run it down to third man for one
nudges 150ks, but bowls a leg-side wide at 149ks
length ball, middle and leg, worked to deep square leg for one
short of a length, outside off, sort of shanks the attempted back-foot drive
what a shot. Some premeditation but a graceful shot. Makes room early, gets under a shortish ball and chips it over cover for four
goes for the short leg-side boundary this time, but can't beat deep square leg to his right. Kept down to two
short of a length, into the hip, cramping him up, tucked away off the hip for a two. Nicely played
misses the length, offers a half-volley, punched to the left of extra cover for four. Sharma in form
skips down the track to push a fuller one to Botha
even slower, and gets it to dip on him, but Sharma lets it turn, and works it around the corner

Morgan and Bairstow have made a mess of this. This is bunted into the leg side, between those two men who are converging on the ball. Neither of them collects it, though, and that gives India enough time to come back for the second
full, on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket for one
length ball, on off, slogged into the cow corner, Bairstow from long-on can't make the catch, but does well by pulling the ball back in even though it is over the rope but in the air. Saves one run
sharp bouncer, head high, Sharma is beaten on the hook
sharp low full toss, can't really get under it. Driven to long-on for one
short of a length, outside off, looking to work this to leg, is beaten and hit on the pad. He is outside the line of off
full and wide, Sharma is rooted on leg stump, and can't reach it with the drive
poor bowling. He has just brought the fine leg up, and he has bowled a short ball down leg side. Easily puled over that man
nice shot. Broad bowls the bouncer, following the backing-away Sharma, and he just opens the face to dink it over the keeper's head. Hold on, he closed his eyes as he played it
length ball, into the pads, worked away, with soft hands, comes back for two
length ball, turning in towards off, worked away to wide of Wright at deep square, Sharma wants two, but Gambhir is not turning back
slower offcutter, runs off the inside half of the bat for a single
slower ball, pushed to long-on for one
Sharma opens up the front leg and lofts this absolutely straight. He hasn't timed it, but the straightness of the shot means it doesn't land in a fielder's lap
full, on off, pushed to long-on for one
short of a length again, Sharma moves across, works this into the leg side for one
that's a bit of a peach. Kicks off from short of a length, at 133ks, and beats Sharma's rather ambitious drive
Sharma mis-hits this attempted drive down the wicket, but he has gone over extra cover and the ball lands safely
short of a length, wide, late-cut to third man for one
short of a length, just outside off, dabbed to point
shapes up to pull, but this ball stops at him, and he checks the shot to keep it down and take a single to midwicket
slower short ball, late-cut to third man
cut away to point for a single
rocks back and pulls it to long on for a single
ho hum, worked away to deep midwicket for another single
made a bit of room this time while simultaneously coming down the track, smashes it hard over wide long-off for another six
stretches forward and turns it through midwicket for a couple more
flighted on middle, came down the track and struck it inside out towards extra cover
lands on a length, comes down the track and launches him over long-off for a well-struck six
full on the off stump, steers it towards deep point for a single
yorker on the pads, gets an inside edge behind square for a single
full and wide, too wide and is called by the umpire
banged in short on middle, again mistimes a pull, lands safely and they come back for the second
slower one bowled on middle and leg, moves away and defends it to cover
short and he bisects the gap, moves away and pulls it between long-on and deep midwicket for a boundary
slower one bowled short outside off, run towards short third man
Paddle-scoop for six, bowled on a good length on middle and leg and he plays it well enough to clear the fine-leg boundary
there is no mid-on, had he been there he would have caught that with ease, slower one bowled short, another mistimed pull, just the single
defended wide of extra cover off the front foot, thinks of a single but it's not there
short on middle, turns away, moves away and cuts it wide of deep point for a single
comes down the track and pushes it wide of long-on for a single
pushed uppishly through cover into the deep for a single
bowls it on a good length outside off, guides it down to third man for a single
low full toss on middle, pushed down the ground to long-on
pushed gently through cover to bring up a hard-fought half-century
slower one, moves well across and flicks it towards short fine leg for a single
the hundred is up for India, top-edged over the keeper's head, nearly a six

that's a high full toss, and Rohit smashes it, pulling it high and far over the long leg boundary, that was a fast ball above the waist but Rohit was quick enough to pounce. A no-ball for height and a free-hit coming up.
played off the back foot towards point for a single
short ball, poor length, it sits up, and Rohit is in his element now on an absolute batting beauty of a pitch, he rocks back and pulls the ball over midwicket
driven off the front foot into the covers where Gayle dives to make the stop
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
jumps back and whips the flat ball with the angle into him from around the wicket through square leg
played off the back foot towards cover point
tries to drive on the leg side but misses one that drifts on to his pads

lbw! Rohit was looking to turn the ball on the leg side but he was caught on the crease in front of the stumps as Badree slid one on with the arm, that looked pretty good at first glance. It hit the back pad. Gone. West Indies have their first wicket ... but that means ...
That's disappeared, short on middle and Rohit is in position to dispatch it, rocks back and pulls it hard over deep midwicket
fast and wide down the leg side
a yorker on middle, punched back towards the bowler, just past Tait, single taken off a ricochet  off throw at non-striker's end
this time he connects with a similar stroke, gets t away to midwicket for a single to retain strike
shortish ball angling across the batsman, Rohit looks to swipe it to midwicket but doesn't connect
correction, this is the best shot of the over, overpitched by Nannes, Rohit clobbers it over long-on for a big six, Sharma has raced to 76
best shot of the over, backing away and carves the back of length ball between backward point and cover
another unconvincing shot, down the track and looking to slog towards long-on, but outside edge past keeper for four
full and wide, Rohit doesn't hit it as well as he would have liked, luckily for him mid-off was in the circle, ball clears him
well outside off, Rohit reaches across to tap it towards sweeper cover
much more convincing hit from Rohit this time, length ball outside off, hammered over long-off for six, fielder though he had a chance for a bit, but the ball clears the ropes
worked away towards fine leg for a single, can the No. 11 survive the two deliveries of this over?
short outside off, plays it really late, gets a thick outside edge towards third man for a single
short on middle, pulled behind square for a couple wide of fine leg
swing and a miss, fullish outside off, tries to swing him over midwicket, misses, just escapes the off stump
pitches on middle and goes straight on, eased to midwicket
tucked wide of square leg
dabbed towards third man
short ball on off, gets on top of the bounce and dabs it to third man
slower one outside off, angled down to third man
works it down to long-on
wrists it wide of midwicket
punched to long-off, too short and he was nicely behind the line
cracking delivery. Drifts back in, grips the surface and turns away sharply from middle, beats Rohit's outside edge by not much
turned wide of the bowler towards the man coming in from long-on
whipped into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
beaten as he looks to turn it, the ball was angling in and would have missed leg, the ball deflects off the pad to short third man
slow turn from middle, played back past the bowler
looks to cut, cramped for room, ends up mistiming it to the fielder, but Rahane is lightning quick, Rohit manages to get across in the nick of time too
steps out and realises it wasn't in his zone to loft, tucks it to short fine leg
backs away and squeezes it down to third man, Chandimal tries to take the throw one-handed but doesn't take it cleanly, and the batsmen are well aware as they pinch the second
on the pads, flicked straight to deep square, a metre on either side and it was four
into the blockhole, toe ends that one to mid-off but they pinch a run to bring up the 100
width on offer, crashed towards deep cover
drifting into middle and leg, worked towards long-on
played back down the pitch, once again nicely tossed up on middle, turns away
wham! The free-hit is a length ball, Rohit clears his front foot, presses forward and frees his arms, smashing the ball dead straight over the bowler's head
slower one on middle and leg, flicked towards the man running in from deep square leg
too full and boom! Hammered over mid-off, one bounce into the boundary. What difference two nights can make. Was unplayable in Pune, has been given a harsh welcome here in Ranchi
slower one bowled short outside off, cut down towards third man for a single
bangs it short outside off, Rohit moves away, tries to upper cut it over the keeper, misses
short on middle, tries to pull it hard through square leg, gets an inside edge onto his thighs
trying to probe him outside off, gets forward and defends it to extra cover
closes the face, gets across and turns it through midwicket for a single
Nannes bowls from slightly wide of the crease, pitches it on a good length, tries to drive it through extra cover, misses
Rohit is away, bowls it on a good length on middle, drags it wide of mid-on for a boundary
short of a good length outside off, defended off the back foot towards point
angling it towards middle and leg, turned towards midwicket
short and wide, shapes to cut, misses
length ball close to off stump, blocked to short extra cover
cracking start. Width on offer and Rohit crunches that one bounce into the point boundary. Couldn't have asked for a better ball first up
this one's a half-volley on the pads, picked away superbly into the gap between midwicket and mid-on
floats it full, hint of movement away from off, he gets forward and defends it to cover
opens the face of the bat slightly and runs it down to third man
squared up a touch as the ball nips away from the length area on middle, played down to third man, not entirely convincing though
back of length delivery on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
whipped away off his hip to deep square
pushed through quicker on middle, turned wide of midwicket
almost like a seamer, gets it full on middle, flicked wide of square leg, they jog for a single

fullish outside off and that's a wicket for Rajitha off his second ball in international cricket! I don't know if that stopped on Rohit a little. He checked his drive, and spooned it in the air for mid-off to catch diving to his right
slower ball, dipping on him, turning out to be a low full toss, and he has swept it between square leg and short fine leg. Sharma has reached fifty off 31. That will do him a world of good
good length angling into the right-hander, Rohit tries to turn through square but misses
a full ball outside leg stump, clipped off his toes behind square for a single

oh, it looked like the same set up. Drifting the slower ball across the right-hander to get Rohit into driving on the up through point or cover. This time though the batsman plays with softer hands, but he was reaching for it away from his body

chances of a run out at the non-stirkers' end! Rohit chopped a super slow delivery from Shakib towards short third man, who was rapid on the ball. One step down, Rohit realised there was no run there and sent Dhawan scurrying back. Dhawan had been more than halfway down but he saves himself with a dive and Shakib didn't quite collect it cleanly
tapped into the covers, and again the ball wasn't coming onto the bat when it is slowed down

oooh, almost popped a return catch! He was moving back for a push through mid-off, but the ball took ages arriving to him. And when it did, Rohit was so far into his shot that his bat face was closed when it connected. Shakib can't dive far enough forward
stays leg side of the ball and reaches with his hands because his front foot stride wasn't big enough. It's not easy playing drives on this pitch
"we want six, we want six, we want six," they scream and Rohit sends them all into delirium. Mustafiz also complies with the crowd by bowling in the slot on off stump. Sweet swing of the bat

almost had him run out again! Was it Sabbir at point? A little dink off the open face and everything seemed calm until the fielder raced in and flung the throw off balance. Dhawan barely stretched out there

jinx! Big old jinx there from our commenters as Rohit falls to Mustafiz. I believe that was the slower ball, and Rohit walks back looking quite forlorn. He must have really thought this was in the slot. Perhaps it was, for a straight bat shot. But the lack of pace forces Rohit to lose his best chance of timing this. He loses his shape, he goes across the line, he was looking to make up for being deceived by powering the ball away. All he does though is get a toe end and the skier is well held at midwicket
sweet sound off the bat as Rohit gets behind a back of a length ball on middle. Straightforward single to deep midwicket
puts it full and just outside off, very little swing or seam for Hazlewood, and Rohit drives through the line to short cover
opens the face and runs a shortish delivery on and around off stump to deep third man
he comes down the pitch and easily whacks it over midwicket for a boundary, never really looks to hit it too hard, just chips it over the infield
good length again, pitching around off and straightening a touch, Rohit stayed in his crease and defended, was squared up a bit
short of a length with width outside off stump, Rohit strides forward and lets the ball pass through to the keeper
short ball at pace, Rohit gets on tippy-toe and pulls flat and hard towards deep square leg, the ball gets to Maxwell on the first bounce
Rohit drives on the up with great timing but places it to the point fielder, that ball was length and wide enough for the batsman to free his arms
tip and run on the off side, soft hands pushing the ball towards cover
shot! Pace on the short ball and Rohit uses it, getting on the front foot and pulling flat over the infield at midwicket
this one is a bit slower and Rohit mis-times the pull off the front foot, dragging it towards square leg
rises up onto his tippy toes for a shortish delivery outside off and taps it to point
think he took the pace off there, with an offcutter, and even that gripped into the deck. Rohit, helped by a shorter length, stays on the back foot and works it off his hips
carefully tucked around the corner to pick up a single towards short fine leg
he's adapted already. Rohit had played one shot to that region, but was denied by the placement of a sweeper cover. This time he waits a tad more and opens the face further to beat that fielder
gets well forward and plays this tossed up delivery with the turn to long on
driven to long off
makes some room outside leg, and chips it in the air in the region of extra cover, there is no one there
hit away to deep midwicket
slower ball, hit down to mid on for a single
another misfield, this time at mid off, it was driven there, and van Wyk made a mess of it, letting the ball through his legs
almost takes out Virat with this straight drive, it was in the air, and powerfully struck, and Kohli just about got out of the way
gets forward and drives this length ball down to mid off
this time Rohit gets on to the act, it was fullish but on the pads, and he lifted it over square leg all the way for six, that was absolute timing, and no power. Rohit holds the pose for effect
tucked off the pads through square leg for a single
wide delivery outside off again, he waits for it this time, and steers it to a squarish third man
gets it to cut back in from outside off, Rohit wanted to cut too, but got an inside edge that went towards short fine, could have gone on to the stumps as well
full and on the stumps is Rusty, Rohit gets an inside edge through square leg as he goes for the drive
this time he gets it off the middle of the bat, but straight to the man at midwicket
starts with a length ball that angles in on leg stump, he misses out as he looks to play it through midwicket and is hit on the pads
130kph, they've got cover on the point boundary for Rohit's lovely glides.
well done, Sabbir. Threw himself headfirst as an outside edge squirted towards him at point. Better signs already. Mash is even getting the ball to straighten
goes fuller and in trying to avoid giving Rohit too much room, the ball wanders down leg.
bit more effort in trying to get that ball to rise up, Rohit has to soften his hands and adjust to the bounce as he finds a single towards midwicket

may be only 126 kph, but it comes up above Rohit's stomach and he has to play a circumspect push into the covers. India and Bangladesh just feeling each other out here, on a pitch which is looking quite palatable with the new ball. Yum!
bowls it full and wide outside off, he goes for the elegant drive on a knee, and gets a thick edge that runs down to third man for a boundary
gently worked off his pads through square leg
short of a length on off stump, blocked
gets right on top of a shortish delivery on middle and turns it to deep square leg
full and wide, too wide outside off
back of a length, pushed to cover
a full ball on the pads, hittable, Rohit leans across in his crease and flicks gently, to midwicket
that holds its line from a good length outside off, Rohit tried to defend from his crease and ended up playing inside the line and was beaten
good length and angling into the pads, Rohit misses the glance and gets hit on the thigh, he wants the leg bye but Russell moves across to field so quickly that Rahane sends him back
shoddy fielding from Badree at midwicket, Rohit turned the ball off the pads straight to him and he came running in and just let it go past
good length just outside off, defended from the crease on the off side, top start by Russell

what's happened there? Badree flights the googly into the right-hander, Rohit moves his front foot outside leg and tries to play through the leg side, gets hit on the pad and the ball goes past the keeper towards third man
there's one, short of a length around off stump, Rohit stays back and taps it towards long-on, where the fielder is on the boundary
full outside off, definitely a plan for Rohit, who drives at it without any footwork, and is beaten
and there it is! Rohit leans forward and towards the off side to launch a length ball through the line over long-on, clean strike
a length ball angling in to middle stump, Rohit presses forward and plays the ball through square leg by closing the face of the bat
a full delivery on off stump, Rohit drives off the front foot but can't beat mid-off
a hard-run single and a full-length dive to beat the throw from mid-on, though Benn missed at the bowler's end. Rohit knew he had not pushed the ball forcefully to the fielder and called immediately
Rohit opens the face as it turns a little and guides it past the diving Gayle at first slip
goes back and gently defends to the bowler, some turn and bounce for the towering Benn
the quicker and flatter ball outside off, Rohit stays in his crease and drives firmly but can't beat cover
shot! Rohit has time to go back because the length is short and space to free his arms because the line is wide, he then laces the ball through cover with a lovely drive
on the front foot this time, down on one knee, and he executes the sweep perfectly, after that previous ball Benn bowled fuller and on the pads
played with soft hands on the off side for a single
extra bounce outside off from short of a length, Rohit rises and tries to cut but is beaten
flat and full, on off and middle, nudged towards midwicket for one more, India moving along nicely now
slower ball, no feet from Rohit again as he hangs his bat out, the edge goes wide of slip and fine of third man
backing away here, Sammy stays back of a length, and follows him, played to point
goes full, and the angle into Rohit sets up the flick shot, and he is careful to keep it along the ground.

superb bowling! "Come on," screams Watson and Australia rally around him. He doesn't want this to be the last match of his career. Bowls a fine cutter, and Rohit doesn't help matters by premeditating. Came down the track too early and can't adjust. The ball sticks in the deck a little more, and with Rohit having made room, he is left reaching with a horizontal bat instead of a vertical one. Beats him, and bowls him
Game on here! Well done Taibu! Rohit gets forward to defend but the ball brushes his thigh and rolls towards Taibu, Rohit 's back foot was out of the crease and the alert Taibu whips off the bails
full on the pads and he pushes it back to the bowler
short and pulled away down to deep square leg
pushes it towards mid-on and the fielder does well to run across and intercept it
tossed up on the off stump and pushed towards long-on
pushes it straight to short midwicket
classic cut, gives him width outside off and he rolls his wrists and slashes past the packed off side field, beats backward point
back of a length, bounces at it, Rohit looks stunned - as if it is not supposed to bounce at him
he bowls the bouncer this time and Rohit swings and misses, perhaps expecting it to be called a wide
this one holds its line but Rohit doesn't offer a shot
and again, fuller this time and the late away movement has Rohit in a fix, fishes out side off
Mpofu teases him with late movement, Rohit fishes at it outside off
shuffles and he clips it towards fine leg off his hips
swings away late and he pushes it softly towards cover
lands outside off and he shoulders arms

slower ball, slower ball, and the plan has worked! And this is audacious, never seen this happen in recent memory! Rohit premeditates the paddle sweep, and the ball lobs off what he claims is his forearm, and Ramdin takes this head high. And Billy Bowden has given this out, but what is Rohit doing, he is arguing, and he is asking for a third-umpire call? Jeff Crowe is waiting for you, Rohit. And what about Billy? He has had an awful over after that poor wide call. Bowden also moves to Taufel to have a chat, and is reminded that the third umpire can intervene only if the catch is not clean
slower ball to Rohit again, definitely a plan, this time he manages to push it to sweeper-cover
slower ball after pushing him back into the crease, and no feet again, and the outside edge seems to carrying wide of Gayle, but he dives full length and saves at least a couple of runs
strays on the pads and he clips it away through the gap between mid-on and midwicket
looks to go inside-out over cover point, can't get bat to it. Missed the line of the ball
slower legcutter, Sharma can't time it, gets a single to cover

Welcome back Watto. He is celebrating again. He got a big wicket for Sydney Thunder in the BBL final not long ago, and he has got the big one. Sharma, who had nine lives, doesn't get another. The slower offcutter has been driven straight down the lap of mid-on
aaja Umar, Kamran shouts as Rohit taps the ball towards backward point, Umar Akmal stops the single
drags it short and that is powered towards sweeper cover
length ball on off stump, defended off the front foot to the off side
an lbw appeal, think there was an inside edge there, otherwise that was going on to hit middle, now there's a run-out appeal as the ball is thrown in from point, Dhawan has just about made it
down towards third man for a single, a controlled glide from Rohit
whoah! this time Rohit gets six, he skips down the track  and carves this one over point, moving away from the stumps to get the room to swing freely

paddles it away for four, risky shot but he knew fine leg was in the circle, Rohit gets his front foot well outside off and doesn't look to power the ball, good that he connected well with it, else there would have been plenty of carping
on the pads, defended towards midwicket for a quick single
length ball that goes straight on, Rohit looks to drive through cover, beaten by the bounce
beauty  from Junaid, curving away with the angle, Rohit fishes at it and luckily for him, he doesn't nibble it through to the keeper, good over this from Junaid
short of length ball outside off, guides it past the two slips towards third man
length ball on off stump, Rohit gets across and taps it to midwicket
starts with a full ball that is punched towards mid-off
short of length ball on leg stump, defended towards square leg for a single
bowls it full, swings it in, Rohit tucks it through midwicket for his first runs
he comes forward and then opens the face to steer this length delivery down to third man
targets the stumps with his dibbly-dobblies, Rohit tucks it through midwicket for an easy single
he comes forward and defends the fuller delivery to Dilshan at point
driven towards cover for another dot ball
this time Umar Akmal can't stop the single, played with soft hands by Rohit, giving time to take the run
defended towards cover off the front foot
short of a length ball is dismissed from his presence, Rohit Sharma launches this over long-on for six, Rohit rarely goes for the slog when he's aiming to clear the rope
played off the back foot to point
Narine gets one to skid through low around off stump, Rohit manages to keep it out and play it on the off side
Rohit stays back and nudges the ball towards point
punched to long on for a single

a loose full toss outside off stump, Rohit simply stands his ground and smashes it over the long off boundary. Christmas came early for Rohit with that free hit, couldn't have asked for an easier delivery
nudged off the front foot towards long on
too short this time, Rohit goes back and cuts hard, finding the gap at point for another boundary
shot! A languid stroke from Rohit, getting under the full ball and lofting inside out, with the turn over extra cover
Rohit steps out a long way and gets hit on the pad
waits a little bit extra, then opens the face of the bat very late to guide this to third man
tight line on middle stump, played off the back foot to square leg
full and straight, Rohit stays in his crease and defends on the off side
driven to long on for a single
Rohit pushes forward at a slower ball but adjusts well once he realises he is beaten by the change of pace, played the slower ball with soft hands and the outside edge falls well short of the keeper
a slower ball again, defended back to the bowler
a full toss swings into the right-hander, Rohit leans forward and across and flicks through midwicket
nudged off the front foot towards square leg for a single
tight line and length on middle stump, defended on the front foot towards midwicket

turn here for Ajmal, much more than Rohit expected, he was looking to cut the ball as it pitched well outside off, but it spins in a long way, and Rohit gets a bottom edge onto the stumps, Rohit swings his bat in frustration after the dismissal
a slower ball on middle and off, Rohit pushes forward and places it with soft hands towards cover
short of a length outside off, Rohit uses the width on offer to cut towards third man ... and West Indies continue to fall apart. Santokie over-runs the ball and allows a boundary
he tries to chop this through point but it's not short enough, beats the bat
now he sweeps this from outside off, he is not in control as there is a bit of bottom edge, but he manages to beat the short fine leg fielder
lovely shape from Watson, but this one is too wide to cause any damage. Swinging in the air then seaming away from Sharma
seaming away on a length again, Rohit's prod can't connect
how did that miss the stumps? What a ball to start with. Angled in, pitching on off, and seaming away, Rohit Sharma had no idea about that one. Straight past him to the keeper
Gul, what have you done? He's over-stepped off what should have been the final ball of the innings. It was a full toss down leg side and Rohit did not connect with the paddle
a costly error indeed. Rohit makes room and carves a full ball high over point, the ball bounces just inside the boundary

and he is cleaned up by the Guldozer's yorker, this is like the Pakistan of old, and also, like the India of old, yorker on target, Ishant's bat comes down in another time zone, and in real time, the leg stump is flattened
offbreak from round the stumps, pushed softly to the off side from the crease
Gul goes for the yorker, swinging in a bit, low full toss worked through square

New Zealand win by one run! Rohit fetches that from the off stump and clubs it down the ground, long-on calmly jogs to his left and ensures he gets behind the line of the ball, flings it to the keeper and India can pick up only two
that's not a bad shot, picks it on off and middle and he smashes it down to long-on, the fielder just manages to pick it

tossed up, this doesn't spin and Rohit is castled! The delivery drifted in with the arm, bit of action on the ball but it just skidded straight on as Rohit went to slog-sweep across the line, trying to raise the tempo again but his middle stump was lost to the cause
full and around the line of off, worked through mid-on for a single
pitched up outside off, leans into another wristy drive through the covers, this skedaddles along the ground but Bresnan hares round from long-off to prevent another boundary
full and punched back, Wright manages to snag it in his follow through
good length, angling in towards leg stump, this is a sumptuous drive over extra-cover from Rohit, stepping away and carving it for four on the up
tossed up outside off, pushed towards long-off for another one
tossed up and pushed down the ground for one to long-on
back of a length, dropped short on the leg side, Raina is running with his gloves in one hand and turns down a second
full and tailing in towards off stump, closes the face and flicks through square leg to the man on the fence
swinging out to pitch on off stump and straightening, Sharma comes forward to defend
saw the swing and got a little overexcited. Angles this way too far down the leg side, and though there was some swing, that's a good-sized wide

soft dismissal! Rohit makes room and looks to drive through cover but he neither tries to go over nor tries to keep it down, plays it straight into the hands of short cover. That's a good low catch by Sena there.  Not the first time he has been out like this..
a loud appeal for lbw as the batsman misses his slog, but this one was just going down the leg side
starts off with a length delivery outside off, Rohit uses his most profitable shot, a steer to third man, to get off strike
slower delivery, the batsman watches it carefully and nudges it to short fine leg for another single
bowls this length ball a touch slower, but the batsman defends it easily to midwicket
whack! this one is full enough and Rohit, Malinga's Mumbai captain, is not fazed. He gets under it and punches it firmly past the non-striker. That was hit hard
he comes forward and defends this to the off side
allows it to come in before nudging it behind square on the leg side
he comes down the pitch to a fuller delivery and drives it to deep midwicket
bowls that back of length line and stays accurate, Rohit works it away to deep midwicket
where has this gone! The batsman makes room to flatbat this down the ground, but gets it high on the bat and ends up lobbing it over the umpire's head

tries a quicker delivery, but he ends up dropping it too short! Rohit quickly gets on top of that and smacks it over deep square leg. He gets worried with the height for a bit, but that just drops before the boundary
slower delivery again, the batsman wrists it away to midwicket for a single
looks to move down the leg side but the bowler follows him there, it clips the pads and they take a leg bye

he's struggled with that ball today, and Clint McKay's got caught behind. Fullish outside off stump and seaming away, Sharma aims a big off drive but only gets an outside edge and that's an easy take for Haddin. No Mumbai-esque heroics today.
shortish ball outside the off stump, cut away late to third man
he looks to slog it across the line, but gets it from the bottom half of his bat, manages to hit it as far as deep midwicket for a single
lovely pick-up shot, but that was a poor ball to start. Fullish delivery on leg stump, Sharma flicks that off his pads high over backward square leg for four
this time he manages to thread the boundary on off side! He makes room and gets a fuller delivery outside off, that's perfect for him as he slices it through point powerfully
goes across the stumps to ramp it to fine leg but gets hit on the pads.. The impact was well outside off .. It was infact off the gloves
swinging away again, but this is wider and short of a length, Rohit opens the face and runs it to third man
comes down the pitch but Herath shortens his length, he has to defend
he looks to drive this to off, but gets an inside edge towards midwicket
worked off the pads towards midwicket
Rohit moves forward and across this time to drive a straight, length ball towards wide long-on
Rohit gets beaten on the cut outside off
a loose shot outside off! He does this often, tries to drive it on the up, but the ball zips past the outside edge
comes in from wide of the crease, the batsman gets cramped for room, defends it down the pitch
length delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward and drives it past point for a quick couple of runs
he looks to come down the pitch but gets beaten in the flight, so he checks it and defends towards short third man
misses out on a full toss, he drives it straight to deep cover
waits in the crease and dabs it to the vacant midwicket region for a single
comes forward and chips the fuller delivery to long on for an easy single
back of length on the stumps, Rohit whips it behind square on the leg side for a single
this is full on the leg stump, but Rohit manages to play an inside out chip over the cover fielder! he didn't try to hit that hard, but he picked it from leg stump.. smartly done
he comes forward and defends this down the pitch
this one is chipped over the infield again, but this keeps the fielder at deep cover interested for a bit.. loose shot this one
turning down the leg side, the batsman easily flicks it to deep backward square leg for a single
tossed up and slow outside off, but this turns a mile, easily tucked to short fine leg for a single that brings up Rohit's half-century - his second consecutive fifty
short and wide, he calmly steers it past the point fielder.. Doesn't hit it hard, just shows it the direction and beats the man at third man comfortably
bowls a good yorker outside off, the batsman digs it out to cover for a single
he comes down the pitch, but the bowler delivers a slower one wide outside off, Rohit has to stretch to reach it, he ends up dabbing it to cover
he punches the length ball firmly, but hits it straight to extra cover

he is given it away! A low full toss, Rohit hits it straight to the point fielder. He does this often and goes back disappointed again. Not much expression from the Bangladesh team, they know this has come too late in the day
that had 'smash me' written all over it... half tracker down the leg side, easy whip for Rohit to deep square leg
on the pads again, nudged to square leg for an easy single
takes a step down the pitch but the bowler fires it on his pads.. Rohit misses the flick and gets hit on the pads
length delivery outside off, he comes forward and then opens the face of the bat at the last moment to run it down to third man
tossed up from over the wicket, the batsman defends it to square leg
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and defends
there is no lack of timing or power in this one! He comes down the pitch and smashes the length delivery past the cover fielder.. He made no attempt to keep that down, but the fielder had no chance
the batsman defends it to point, but Al-Amin as overstepped. Tight call that one.. Looked alright to me
back of length on the pads, and the crowd has gone silent, since Rohit easily tucks it past the short fine leg fielder for a four.. Poor direction from the bowler
length delivery on off, he dabs it to backward point off the front foot, picks up a single
he looks to hoick this from outside off but gets a big top edge.. Nasir at midwicket settles under it to pouch it comfortably, but it doesn't count
angled delivery on off and middle, Rohit tucks it behind square leg for a single
slightly slower outside off, Rohit stays in the crease and steers it past point for an easy couple
bowls it slow on the stumps, the batsman dabs it to the leg side for a quick single
slower through the air and pushed to the off side
full and flighted on off, Rohit clips it to deep backward square leg for an easy single
takes a step down and punches the flatter delivery down to long on
that has disappeared! It's a short delivery that Rohit hammers over deep square leg.. 85 meters, deep into the stands..How does he get that much power behind those!
uses his feet and pushes the ball softly to long on for a single
lots of air on this one, the batsman comes forward and pushes it easily to long on for a single
back of length delivery on off, the batsman steers it to gully to pick up an easy single
flatter, turns to the pads, the batsman nudges it to backward square leg

they have dropped it! What was the midwicket fielder doing back there! Gazi runs back towards the deep and completely messes up Anamul's catch! Rohit had looked to launch this out of the ground, but only got the height.. That was an easy catch for Anamul.. They are lucky that they didn't collide.. but that is Gazi's fault..
length delivery, pushed back to the bowler
