back of length delivery, again Rohit targets that deep midwicket area with a front-foot pull.. This one is a difficult chance for Anamul as he has to run a long way to his left.. He dives, but doesn't get to it
can be said that this is a bit unnecessary! He looks to ramp a full delivery from outside off, but gets a thick edge towards third man
Hodge has the last laugh against Rohit! Very soft dismissal, tossed up outside off, Rohit aims to clear cover, he gets an outside edge that tamely lobs up to point
Rohit chips the ball inside out over extra cover
Rohit swishes at a slower ball outside off and is beaten

South Africa had a few of those early. India get one too. And this would have been swallowed by the slip. On a length, outside off, Rohit pushes at an offbreak, but this doesn't turn and takes the edge for four

the spin start hasn't quite worked. Well it might have had if the slip was in. Rohit down the wicket to this ball, reaches the pitch of it, and drives it straight of mid-off for four. high-quality shot. A mere push, really
crunched away. This is a poor delivery. A strange defensive cagey start by South Africa to bowl Albie at the top of the innings. This is short, wide, and sits up for a soft boundary
on a length, just outside off, defended back to him
good-looking drive off a length ball, on the up, but straight to cover
this is poor bowling. Short, at Albie's pace. Rohit is forward, but he can still pull it clean over midwicket
short of a length, outside off, soft hands, gets another single
that's a beauty. That's a Test ball. On a length, outside off, swinging away. Beats the bat as he pushes tentatively
Rohit takes Steyn on. This is brave batting. He makes room, gets inside a short ball, and upper-cuts it for six over the shorter boundary
on a length, middle and leg, worked away to square leg for one
outswinger this time, on a length, on off, defended from the crease
played back to the bowler from the crease
driven off the back foot to cover
punched back to the bowler, Samuels moves to his right and fields
fine leg is in the circle, so Rohit moves across his stumps to a length ball, gets inside the line, and scoops it over the fielder for a one-bounce four to fine leg
punched off the back foot towards deep cover, runs coming really easily
Kohli flicks the ball once again through square leg, milking the single
driven off the front foot towards long off
the offbreak this time, Rohit stays back and nudges off his pads towards square leg
that's the doosra, Rohit reads it off the pitch and pulls his bat inside the line to let it pass outside off

Rohit is gone. He tries to hit this on the up and straight down the ground. The ball is a touch shorter than he expects and he skies it. This has gone nowhere. Faf comes around from mid-on to complete the catch
length ball outside off, pushed back down the ground
flighted first delivery, pushed to mid-of. Nice sound off the bat
driven from the crease towards long off for a single
a slower delivery and Rohit swats the ball through square leg for a single
Rohit backs away towards leg and opens the face to steer a length ball to short third man
worked through midwicket for a single
comes forward and plays the ball to midwicket
Rohit gets on to the front foot and works the ball behind square
nudged off the pads in front of square for another single
too full on middle, Rohit moves forward and drives the ball fluently through midwicket and into the gap on the boundary
worked off the pads through square leg
a very low full toss, Rohit leans across and flicks in front of square leg
bowled slowly from round the wicket on a wicket to wicket line, Rohit defends
Rohit also gets to 50 by moving across his crease and paddle scooping towards fine leg, he and Kohli have made light work of this chase
pushed off the front foot towards point
a full ball around off stump, driven on the front foot towards long off
pitches leg and middle, Kohli clips it off his pads in front of square leg
that's a rubbish long-hop, Rohit just winds up and pulls, sending the ball soaring over deep midwicket, Samuels doesn't seem the same bowler without his quicker ball
defended on the front foot
flicked off the pads in front of square for a single
short ball, Rohit goes back and pulls, Narine runs across the deep midwicket boundary and kicks it in with his boot
steps out of his crease to reach the pitch of the ball and drives to long on
played back to the bowler
a quicker ball on off stump, Rohit punches from the crease to cover

slower ball, on the stumps, tries to punch off the back foot and gets an inside edge on to pad, it rolls short on the off side and Wright throws underarm at the stumps in his follow through, safe single there though
fuller and outside the right-handed Rohit's off stump, worked straight to midwicket
steps back and cuts to backward point, a sharp single
shortens his length a touch, gets it to come in towards off stump. Rohit, who's pressed forward early, lets it come on and drops it down with soft hands towards backward point

whoa, that's some serious pace and lift. Wasn't too far short of a good length, and Rohit's weight may have been on the front foot. Looked to play it to third man with an open face and the ball simply zipped past his edge and the keeper took it over his head
full on middle stump, clipped wide of mid-on
back of a length on off stump. Rohit uses the angle and tucks it softly into the on side
slower ball, full-toss on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
starts with a short ball that rises sharply and tucks up Rohit for room. Sways his body out of the way and helps it towards third man
a bit of extra bounce again, fifth-stump line. Rohit was looking to play it to third man again, and the ball slid quickly past his open face
length ball outside off, slapped firmly to extra cover. Ball didn't come on as well as he would have liked

back of a length outside off, lets it come on and pushes it to the right of point. Takes off for a single, takes on David Miller's arm, and he's a goner - the direct hit at the bowler's end finds him a foot short. Brilliant fielding, capitalising on the fact that Rohit was starting from deep in the crease, having played that ball off the back foot
touch full on off, he leans forward and crashes that between cover and mid-off to get off the martk
leans forward and eases it wide of cover, who is at the edge of the ring
hits the deck hard as he bangs it in on middle, Rohit gets on top of the bounce and turns it towards short midwicket and scampers across for the single
floater on middle, played back to the bowler
makes room and slaps it over backward point. Not far from the outstretched hands of the man there. It wasn't all that short, but Rohit decided he was giving it his all to play that stroke.

lofted nice and clean over cover. One bounce into the ropes. This was by no means full, but Rohit had the conviction to hit inside-out. He backed himself to clear the infield. Just pitched inside the ropes
drifting into middle and leg, worked to long-on as he jogs across for a single
gets underneath the flight and lofts him through the line over mid-off. Authoritative batting this from Rohit. Knew what he was doing and went through with it
juicy full toss on the pads, flicked into the vacant spaces at deep midwicket. Didn't look to hit it hard, just rolled his wrists over that to pick the ball into the gap

drifting down leg, Rohit uses the angle to help it into the fine leg boundary. Didn't bounce as much as he would have liked, but it didn't matter. It was short alright and Rohit took full toll of that
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
short outside off, lots of bounce, dabbed away with an open face towards third man
short, rising ball outside off, dabbed away to third man
length ball on middle stump, pushed softly towards mid-on for the quick single
full on the pads and Rohit's placement is superb, he moves to 97 with an elegant flick off the pads to the long leg boundary
a short ball, that's marginally down leg side but Rohit was standing outside leg as well, tight call

Rohit brings up his maiden T20 hundred with a tremendous six! He was into that shot a bit too early by the look of it, but he simply went through with it and punched through the line. The ball cleared long off with ease. It's a small ground and his timing was sweet
a low full toss, Rohit mis-times the shot and the fielder at midwicket moves to his left to cut it off
a length ball outside off, Rohit aims for the big swing down the ground but Abbott beats him
Rohit moved outside leg stump to make room, but Abbott fired it full and wide outside off. Rohit lunged and chopped the ball over point, Amla chases and just pulls it in

finally Rohit's mis-hit a pull, and a tremendous innings ends. He's been hitting the short ball superbly all night but he top edged this one from Abbott and Morris judges the swirling catch well at long leg
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
short and wide, and Rohit helps himself, just shows the ball a horizontal bat-face and sends it screaming to the backward point boundary

prepared to take him on with the front foot pull, but was surprised by the pace and bounce of that delivery, Rohit got it high on the bat, as it landed in front of Lendl Simmons at deep backward square leg
a bit fuller, seemed to fall away in his action a little bit, and the angle takes the ball too far down the leg side
slider first up, skids on towards middle stump. Rohit, pressing forward, tucks it cautiously to midwicket

whoa. The ball hit his elbow in the previous over. Now this one jumps up off a crack, just short of good length, maybe, and knocks the bat out of his startled hands as he looked to work it into the leg side
looks to fire this in quick and straight and hurry Rohit. Manages that, but also slides down the leg side
fuller, tucked past midwicket
back of a length, skids in towards middle stump. Rohit tucks it away into the leg side, backward of square
whoa. That was some bounce. Banged the pitch hard, got up to head height while also angling into the batsman, forcing Rohit to sway his head hurriedly out of the way
back of a length, fourth-stump line. Good bounce again, and Rohit gets on his toes, allows the ball to come to him, and dabs it with soft hands towards backward point
angled into the pads, tucked away towards Rabada, who misfields at short fine leg
on the pads once more, full, and Rohit accepts the freebie gleefully, flicks it away fine, a long way to the right of short fine leg
back of a length, a bit of width again, punched firmly and Behaardien dives left to make the stop at point
high full toss on middle, looks like he attempted for the dipping delivery, Rohit swung too early and couldn't get it beyond midwicket. The bat face turned in his hand as it made contact
overpitched outside off, Rohit eases that towards sweeper cover
driven inside-out to sweeper cover again. Elegant, but India will need more than just singles at the moment
pace is your best friend, and pace is your best enemy... picked away off the pads for four through square leg... Just using the Tait pace
short at 149kmph, just outside off, left alone to bounce away

top edged for a six. Legendary short square boundaries of Adelaide Oval. Richardson at long leg gets under it, and even though it is going over he should have at least thrown back in before going over the rope. He just stepped on the rope, which did him in there
fast outswinger, left alone
another lovely outswinger, Rohit pushes at it, and is beaten
short of a length, outside off, nicely glided away to third man for one
on a length, outside off, defended with an open face to point
mis-hit, but a safe mis-hit. Rohit knows mid-off is up, gets a ball in his swinging zone, and just lobs it over mid-off
Sgarma misses out on a leg-side offering. Similar delivery to the one he had clipped for four last over. The ball hits the pad. Sharma wants a leg-bye but is sent back
and it's 150kph right away. Short and wide, beats the cut from Rohit with the extra bounce
short of a length, wide, Sharma uses the pace of the ball and punches it through point. Between point and cover-point it goes
full and wide at 148ks, Sharma's drive is beaten by the outswing
Richardson is being tested left, right and centre at long leg. Sharma cramped on the pull, he goes ahead with it, and just manages to place it fine of Richardson at long leg
this would have been a wide down the leg side, but Rohit plays at it, and gets a leading edge towards mid-on for one
short and wide, very wide, called a wide
short of a length, slower ball, played off the hip for a single towards midwicket
legcutter, short of a length, beats Rohit's attempt to play the cut with that spongy bounce

Boyce has dropped a sitter. The casino is just a walk from the Oval. Sharma should walk straight into the casino after the match. The head falls away as he slogs, and the top edge field towards third man where Boyce gets under it, but doesn't even get a hand to it. Total misjudgement
and here Sharma rubs salt into the wound. Plays a pick-up to a full ball over midwicket
short of a length, punched away off the hip to deep square leg
beautiful outswinger. Nice dip on Sharma, he is not to the pitch of the ball is has his push beaten outside off

that's a beamer at 142kph, this ball is pretty wet so that might have slipped out. Rohit is good enough to pull it to deep square leg. Under the new rules, there's a free hit for all kinds of no-balls.
too short but is lucky to get away with that as Rohit bunts it straight to cover
eased with the spin to deep cover, Rohit was alert to the possibility of the second as Dwayne Beavo was late to get off the blocks. Superb running
sensible stuff, worked with the spin towards deep midwicket. Rohit called for two straightaway and made it quite easily in the end
slow turn from off stump, pushed to cover
swung across the line. Catch it was the call, but it was a question of who, and where? Not entirely of the middle but it still had enough to clear long-on. Narine's coming in for some tap already
this is even better. This time he picked the bones out of that one. Flighted outside off, Rohit gets down on one knee and slog sweeps him over deep midwicket
low full toss outside off, worked in front of square towards Russell, who runs around quickly from deep midwicket to cut that off
length ball angling in, turned to midwicket again, the 50-run stand has been raised off 22 deliveries

sweet timing as that half-volley is played towards deep midwicket. An ovethrow at the bowler's end results as they take the second. Then another overthrow at the bowler's end from Charles gives them one more. What should have been one is now three

Bravo was in business for a while at long-on. It was set to go over, but you couldn't quite tell until it actually did. Bravo leapt high, but saw the ball beat his outstretched hands. Half-century for Rohit. This has been a calculated knock. Time to kick-on
slower one on middle from wide of the crease, turned towards square leg
once again leans forward and punches it with the spin to sweeper cover
makes a bit of room and lofts him over the infield towards long-off
take that, he's clubbed that into the beaches, has he? Full toss on middle, Rohit muscles the pull to send that deep into the grass banks. Too easy. Make no mistake, it's match on
makes a bit of room and crunches it straight to Lewis at cover. He tired to hit that too hard. Moved a little too early to give the bowler a hint of what he was trying
Pollard slides one down leg from wide of the crease, Rohit thought about a swing but let that go in the end

he's picked out the lone man at deep midwicket. Rohit struck that well but he was forced to generate the power as it was an off-cutter, it was also hit towards the long boundary. All this meant Johnson Charles simply had to come around and hold on to a straightforward chance, which he did. Pollard has outsmarted his Mumbai Indians' captain
floats a full ball on middle first up, Rohit leans forward and eases it to cover
gets on top of the bounce and turns it to short midwicket, Rahane was keen on the single but sent back
he plays the hook so very well. Not afraid to take him on. All Rohit had to do was use the pace. Simply helped on its way over deep fine leg. Top shot
wrists it from outside off towards midwicket, quick single pinched
punchy drive off the front foot to mid-off
misfield at point gives them an extra run. Johnson Charles the culprit again. One was a given, but he dived over the ball
slower legcutter, short too, Sharma has to reach for it, and he chips it into the off side and gets a couple off the last ball
full and straight, Rohit can't get under it so just taps the ball towards the leg side
short ball, Rohit pulls off the front foot, smacking the ball to the deep square leg boundary
worked off the pads through square leg
Rohit leans forward and defends back to the bowler
that's too short and Rohit pulls along the ground to the fielder on the midwicket boundary, poor placement
bowled flat on middle stump, Rohit defends towards the bowler
pushed off the front foot to long off
played from the crease to midwicket
Rohit was in position a bit too early for the cut, the ball stopped on him. He bottomed edged it behind point
Rohit wanted to turn that on the leg side but ended up playing towards point
Kallis fires in another short one, Rohit ducks and weaves like his trying to avoid a haymaker
short of a length with some width outside off, Rohit lets it go. That was a pretty harmless delivery, if Abbott bowls a similar one again I bet Rohit will go after it
that one hit the seam just short of a length and seamed and bounced away from the right-hander, Rohit swishes and misses
good length just outside off stump, Rohit stays in his crease and plays the ball to point

a loud appeal for lbw, Abbott hit a good length just outside off and this time he nipped the ball back into the right-hander instead of moving it away, Rohit played across the line, aiming to play towards midwicket, and missed. He was hit around the knee roll, that looked close but height may have been an issue
fuller length and wide outside off, Rohit frees his arms and slashes, carving the ball over point, where Behardien leaps in vain
played from the crease into the off side, a yes and no call between the batsmen, it's no in the end
good length outside off stump, that's the first ball from Rabada that Rohit has ever faced (probably) and he lets it go
Rabada fires in the yorker on off stump, Rohit is well balanced to play it and digs it out into the off side
good length just outside off, that was quick and bounced sharply too, Rohit lets it go again
a length ball with far too much width outside off stump, Rohit has plenty of time to line it up and drive through the line, hitting the ball through cover for his second boundary
short and wide outside off, a real hit-me ball, Rohit cuts well but Faf pulls off a superb save at point
shot! Rohit sees mid-off in the circle so he backs away towards leg and lofts the ball over the in-field to the boundary
Rohit pushes the ball towards mid-off and runs the single once extra cover fails to cut off the shot
good length on off stump, nudged towards the off side for a single
plays into midwicket on the front foot
big shot down the ground, didn't get all of it but enough to evade a flying Bresnan and it just carries the rope
went to play to leg and got a bit of a leading edge, doesn't carry back to the bowler
opens the face and plays down to third man, wide enough for a couple
length outside off, punched hard to deep cover, very attractive stroke
back of a length just outside off, gets an inside edge towards backward point playing from the crease
lbw! Rohit tries to sweep one that is much too full on off stump, he misses and is absolutely plumb, he goes after failing to get out of third gear, 25 off 27 balls isn't good enough
Rohit leans forward and nudges down the ground to long on
Rohit backs away towards leg and hits through point
slightly fuller in length around off and middle stump, Rohit presses forward and turns the ball into a gap towards midwicket
Rohit stays in his crease and punches towards cover
moves forward and across to drive the ball towards long on
Rohit waits and dabs the ball late, placing it past Morne Morkel at short third man who gave up the chase pretty early
tossed up into the right-hander, nudged off the pads behind square
driven off the back foot through cover

caught, no it's been dropped! Rohit slogged at a good length ball and hit it with the toe of the bat over the bowler's head. Botha ran towards the catch from long on, Behardien went from long off. Botha got to it and caught the ball while running at full tilt but couldn't hold on once he tumbled to the ground
over-steps and delivers a length ball on the pads, Rohit flicks through midwicket, free-hit coming up ...
Rohit leans forward and drives towards long on
Faf leaps to his right to cut off a shot that was heading to long-on
tossed up on off stump, Rohit drives to cover
a full toss and Rohit leans forward and drives through midwicket
a full ball outside off stump, Rohit drives towards extra cover, the fielder from mid-off runs to his right to cut it off
short ball again but Rohit is ready and waiting on the front foot, transfers the weight on to the back foot, and pulls the ball over midwicket for his third boundary
good length just outside off stump, Rohit stays back and defends to the off side
length ball, on off, plays with an open face, gets a single between cover and point
full on off and middle, Rohit plays the ball with the angle into him towards square leg

superbly placed by Rohit to bring up his fifty! Abbott banged the ball in short and outside off, Rohit let the ball bounce off his bat, using it like a ramp, and placed it so fine that third man had no chance
played into the off side
oh my word! Rohit moves towards the off side, exposing all three stumps to a full ball, and then scoops the ball from outside off stump high over the fielder at short fine leg
played down to third man this time, quite orthodox
flat on off stump, Rohit stays in his crease and chips the ball towards long on
Rohit slogs across the line, and he hasn't timed that perfectly so he does not beat the fielder running to his right from long on towards deep midwicket
goes back and punches the ball uppishly through cover for one more
chipped towards long off for a single to end the over
steps out of his crease to take the ball on the full and hit it gently towards deep midwicket
Tahir responds with a googly, Rohit plays it towards square leg
driven down the ground for a single
that's in the first tier! Rohit moves his front leg towards leg side, and then lofts the ball with a clean, smooth swing of the arms, incredible timing to clear the long off boundary by miles
played towards third man
this is carnage now, the short ball outside off stump, Rohit moves across, presses forward and then transfers weight on to the back foot as he pulls the ball over the midwicket boundary
another short ball, this one is quick and beats Rohit for pace, Rabada has a word for Rohit who responds in kind
a bouncer to end the over, that was pretty high but I think the umpire has let it go. No last ball single for Rohit this time.
Morris fires in the yorker, Rohit digs it out

a low full toss on the pads, Rohit flicks the ball hard, the ball races towards fine leg and Duminy seems to lose his footing and ends up over-running it, there's a lot of dew on this outfield, really slick it is
he's hit that into the stands beyond deep midwicket. Rohit came forward, moved the front leg out of the way, got down on one knee and slogged the ball high and powerfully
clipped off the pads through midwicket for one more
the googly this time and Rohit dabs it off his pads
too wide outside off stump, Rohit reaches for it on the front foot and slaps the ball through cover point

that's quite a shot, Rohit backed away outside leg stump to make room and then drove a length ball from around off stump through cover, the timing is good enough to beat the chasing fielder, who dives desperately in vain
that's short and fast, rises sharply on Rohit who plays a half-hearted pull, he is beaten for pace. That was over the top of Rohit's helmet.
pushed into the covers for a single
good length just outside off, Kohli defends into the off side
banged in short again and once again Rohit dispatches it. He presses forward and pulls, rolling his wrists and lofting the ball behind square for a one bounce four
pulled in front of square this time and Tahir has to slide along the boundary to field
full and straight, Rohit drives firmly towards the bowler and the tall de Lange stoops low to field. That was measured at 149 kph

he got fingertips on that! The ball seemed to stop on Rohit, who had pushed forward, and ended up lobbing in the air towards where a short cover would have been. De Lange moved across in his follow through and lunged, using his huge reach. He only got his fingertips on it though, deflecting towards mid off
defended back to the bowler
this time Rohit comes forward and gets an inside edge on the pad
Rohit charges and whips off his pads towards deep backward square leg, Duminy runs to his right and dives, and he really should have saved that
Morris berates himself extremely harshly after conceding the first six of the game. The ball was short and around leg stump, Rohit swiveled and pulled, hoisting it high and far over long leg
tossed up into the blockhole around off stump, Rohit gets an inside edge on to his boot
bowled flat and fast around middle and off, pushed gently into the huge gap on the leg side and they race back for the second
the google, Rohit pushes forward to defend and gets an inside edge towards square leg to bring up India's 50
defended back to the bowler on the front foot
short of a length but once again the line is on leg stump, Rohit swats the ball behind square for a single
good length, bringing the ball back into Rohit from just outside, he gets a bit off an inside edge and they run a single
Tahir pitches on leg stump and Rohit leans forward and drives him through midwicket

played all around it. Wide of the crease, slightly low arm, angled in towards top of off, Sharma just misses the line completely, the bat coming down from slips, but looking to play straight. The off stump goes for a walk. Australia on a hat-trick
punched into the off side for a single
muscled over deep midwicket. 20 rows back at least. This was a release shot, one that was brewing for a while. His eyes hit up as he was that bowled halfway down the pitch, swung through cleanly
good length pitching outside off and coming into the right-hander, Rohit presses forward and defends solidly

outstanding catch, much-needed wicket that for Sri Lanka. Slower delivery that was bowled fuller on off, Rohit looks to turn it but is early into the stroke, ball lobs in the air as Chameera dives full length across the pitch to take that. The best part was the control as his elbows landed on the hard turf. Rohit goes just when he was looking to rev up the engine

straight up, and Perera takes it moving to his left from mid-on. Colombo roars as they see Rohit walk back for single-digits. The opener tries to bully a back of a length ball over the straight field, but he underestimates the bounce on offer. Hits high on the bat and ends up a simple catch
on the leg stump line, turned to deep midwicket region
outside off stump, pushed down to long-off
punched to the on side of the pitch
Wallop! Suddenly, against the run of play, Rohit backed away a touch and clubbed the short-of-length delivery into the midwicket stands. Biff!
short in length, moving towards off stump, guided to third man
slows up the pace well, Rohit has to wait and he does before swatting it past square leg
turning into the middle stump, dabbed to the on side
goes down the track and drives to long-on
Moves outside leg stump for the off spinner, waits before cutting it late past backward point
pauses prior to the release, and floats it on the off and middle, pushed back to the bolwer
on the middle, turning in, worked past square leg for couple of runs
controlled hitting from Rohit at the other end. Shorter and outside off, he gets on top of the bounce, rolls his wrists, and pulls to deep midwicket
Rohit goes down town. The long-on and the long-off fielder dive simultaneously and the long-on pushes it back in but the fielders collide in the process. Could have got really painful.
flighted full on the middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
flatter, on the middle and off line, flicked past square leg
flighted full outside off, slower through the air as well, driven to sweeper cover
seems to kick up off the pitch and the back of a length ball is defused carefully by Rohit, playing with soft hands, and yanking the bottom one off as soon as he makes contact
slower ball, so slow that even with Rohit identifying that it was the change-up, he is nowhere near close enough to play the cut shot.
a slower ball, just outside off, Rohit slices it to third man
attempts a late cut, and the ball takes the inside edge, hits the pitch which is so hard that when the ball rebounds, it sails clean over the wicketkeeper
lucky. Very lucky! A thick inside edge flies down to fine leg for four
plays and misses to a good, quickish and climbing delivery just outside the off stump
outside off and driven back to the bowler
on his legs, it's pushed to mid-on
that was fast ... but apparently too high, according to the square-leg umpire, and thus it's a wide
clipped firmly off his pads
down the leg side, and wided to the cheers of a packed Lord's, with thousands of India fans
what a delivery that is! Angled in on the right-hander before cutting away. Unplayable
Rohit leans forward to pick a full delivery and chip it high and to the left of long-on for a fine boundary

Undaunted by the pulled four, Fidel simply cranks up another short-pitched delivery from back of length.. Rohit is beaten for the pace and by the extra bounce, top edges the pull to square leg. Great start from Windies. Taylor served up a fiery first over and now, Fidel has started in a similar vein.

Taylor stays round the stumps to Rohit as well. Interesting. He slips in a slower one, that dips full on the middle stump line, Rohit lunges out to adjust to it and pushes it to wide mid-on where Chanders fields
slowly tossed around the off stump, Rohit waits and waits before late cutting it for the winning run. And the rains come down as well!
Classy inside-out lofted drive to wide long-off to bring up his fifty. He moved outside leg, waited for the flighted ball to arrive before lifting it nonchalantly to the boundary
comes down the track and pushes it to long-off
loopy flighted delivery that dipped on Rohit, who lunged out to push it to cover
back of a length and outside off, Rohit flays it through the covers, standing tall and brandishing a high elbow
nudges a shortish delivery on middle to the right of mid-on

flicks it to the right of Malinga at short fine leg, and the fast bowler tumbles over the ball. Valiant effort, but he remains one of the fielders Sri Lanka try to hide and he is placed in the firing line as Mathews strays onto Rohit's pads.
Fidel serves a short-pitched delivery to his IPL team-mate and Rohit responds with a pull through midwicket. It was quite pacy delivery, 149.4 kmph, and Rohit did well to play the horizontal shot
crashed on the back foot behind square. Mascarenhas, at third man, does well to save four
short in length outside off, hit on the up to deep cover region
floated full on the stumps, flicked through midwicket
spirits it away to the midwicket boundary. Lovely shot, especially considering this is a good ball, pitched up and swinging in. Rohit ensures he plays late, and close to the body and doesn't overhit
full and angling across the right-hander, Rohit drives to cover
good length ball on off stump, defends
back of a length and outside off, Rohit tries to cut, but is beaten by extra bounce. That rain's certainly freshened up the pitch
135kph, defends a good length ball on off stump behind point
lifts it over the long leg boundary! It's fair that he was set up for the shot with Coulter-Nile bowling length and down leg. But the ease with which Rohit dismissed it. Sheesh.
middle pole's gone! Rohit, as gorgeous as he looks when he connects, doesn't look particularly pleasing when he is done in like this. Flicks across the line of a straight ball and is cleaned up
Shakib Al Hasan, the No 1 ODI allrounder in the game, does the trick with a lovely skidding ball. Rohit went for the pull but found his middle stump missing. It skidded on quickly towards its target.
stumping chance missed by Mushfiqur. Easy chance too. Rohit Sharma was left stranded mid-way by the left-arm spinner but Mushy fluffed .. He didn't collect cleanly and couldn't recover in time
leans forward to retain the strike with a push to long-on. Good over from Mahmudullah
from round the stumps, floated full on the off stump line, Rohit moves outside leg stump and ends up slicing it off the outer edge through  backward point
the offspinner starts from round the stumps. Slow through the air, on the middle, punched to long-on
lifting delivery outside off stump, chopped to third man
shuffles across to try play the lap shot around the corner and edges it to short fine-leg region
Rubel responds with a bouncer and Rohit tries to upper cut it but doesn't connect

And there he goes again..   This time he fetched the short-of-length delivery from outside off and heaved it over the on side field ... not as cleanly struck as the previous one but he cleared the infield comfortably

a fierce thump! It was full in length and on the middle stump line, Rohit leaned forward to swing it high over midwicket .. He stood and watched the ball sail over the boundary. He played a similar shot in the warm-up game against Pakistan as well.
full in length, on the middle and off line, defended to the on side of the pitch
on a length, around the off stump, pushed back to the bowler. Wilson, the keeper, is standing up to the stumps
full pitched around off stump and Rohit uses his bottom-hand to chip it over extra cover and the ball runs to the boundary
back of length, straightening on the middle and off, pushed towards mid-on
flighted full outside off, Rohit plays ala Laxman, leans across to wrist it through wide midwicket
slows up the pace, flights it full, defended to cover
pushes it quick and well outside off, cut away to backward point
overpitches outside off, driven crisply to left of long-off
with the short fine-leg in place, Rohit lunges across towards the off side to paddle-scoop a length delivery from the off stump to fine-leg boundary
length delivery on the off stump, opens the bat-face to steer it down to third man
leans across to push another full length delivery to cover
full in length, tilting in towards middle stump, defended to the on side of the pitch
short in length, turning outside off stump, cut to deep point region
backs away a touch and runs it down to third man for a single.
no foot movement as Rohit tries to lift the full delivery over cover and gets a thickish outside edge to left of third man
slips down leg and Rohit misses to connect with the glance but it rushes off the thigh pad to the fine-leg boundary
short in length, coming into Rohit who tucks it to square leg.
lovely bouncing length delivery that holds its line outside off and beats Rohit ...
short in length again, this time Rohit drag pulls it with bit of top edge and the ball lands safely in deep midwicket
back of length, cutting in with bounce, Rohit wants to punch it on the up but the ball bounces more than he thinks and he had to take out the bottom-hand off the bat handle and pushes it to cover
length delivery outside off stump, pushed to cover point
low dipping full toss, Rohit shapes to drive but makes contact with the bottom of the bat and the ball rolls to mid-on
short in length, superbly struck off the back foot but can't beat backward point.
and a four straight away, Barsapara finds its voice. Extremely wide and a full toss, Rohit reaches out and pats it away through backward point
he's dragged him on! Got him! A little too full to be pulling and he got a thick inside edge
around the off stump, full again, square driven to cover point for a single
full and outside off, Rohit is nailed to the crease as he attempts a cover-drive. He manages an inside edge that whizzes past the off stump. Amjad has his hands on his head
top strike from Rohit. He dances out to meet a length ball. Caressed over the covers. It goes all the way
full and veering into the pads, easy peasy. Rohit picks it from there and twirls it past midwicket
off-stump ball, fuller in length, blocked back
dug in short, but not short enough to trouble Rohit. He dismisses it over midwicket with a strong pull
back of a length and extra bounce outside off, Rohit pokes an outside edge past slip
short and angled in, Rohit aims for a pull. Ends up deflecting it towards square leg
back of a length on off, the sound from the bat was delicious. Punched crisply to mid-off
yorker at the base of middle, from the top draw. Dug out
short, angled in, sticks in the pitch and stops on Rohit. He hops up and fends it in front of the bowler. Naveed has overstepped
full and comes in on middle, Rohit flicks it between midwicket and mid-on. Beau-ti-ful
short on off, blocked to cover
back of a length and straight in line, turned to midwicket
dug in outside off, picked up over midwicket with a snap of the wrists
short and wide outside off, begging on its knees to be smashed. Rohit can't put it away. He can only slash this loose ball to third man
good length outside off, Rohit stays in his crease and plays the ball calmly towards point
that ball bounced a bit more from short of a length, hitting the high part of Rohit's bat as he stayed back and ran it down to third man
full on the stumps, bunted down the ground
full and straight, Rohit stays back and flicks sweetly through midwicket
full and outside off, Rohit flows forward and creams a drive to cover, where the fielder fumbles, allowing the ball through him
this one kicks up further from a short of a length, outside off, Rohit leaps and drops it in front of point

length ball close to off stump, Rohit looks to place his front leg inside the line and drive into the covers, but the length and inward angle force him to play it back to the bowler, off the inside half of his bat
shortish, angling into the batsman, worked off the hip to long leg
fullish outside off, doesn't come on for the drive. Rohit plays a checked push to mid-off

got him! Beautiful length, and he shifted his line slightly wider to entice the drive away from the body. Goes for the drive on the up, it seams away slightly - just about straightens - and the nick is pouched nicely by Kapugedera at slip, with two hands, a couple of inches above the ground

India are sliding here! Charges down the track to deposit it over the long-on boundary, gets under it but ends up lofting it really high without getting much distance on it, Mubarak cups it well after the ball takes forever to get to him
short on middle and off, pushed into the off side
flicked away through square leg
down the track and pushes it wide of long-on for a single
a length ball with width outside off, Rohit doesn't try and force it, just opens the face and lets the ball flow off a gentle push off the front foot towards point
tries to loft that inside-out over extra cover, gets a leading edge on the off side
good length and floats outside off, left alone again
short, top-of-off line, Rohit keeps back, opens the face, and runs it towards point
back of a length and outside off, Rohit stands tall and unfurls a classy punch through cover point
back of a length, much closer to off, holds its line. No shot offered
full and wide, slashed down to third man from outside off
pretty full on off, defensively pushed to mid-on
rising short ball outside off, which is quelled towards point. Rohit got on top of the bounce and played it well
short on off, punchily blocked back to Amjad
full awayswinger outside off, Rohit watches it through to the keeper
fullish, on the middle stump line, eased to mid-off
jags into the right-hander from a good length outside off, hits Rohit high on the back thigh as he tries to defend
tossed up on the off, driven down the ground to long-off
floated around the off stump, wristed past square leg
ah, yet another slow delivery, turned past square leg for a single
the yorker but on the leg stump line, off the pad to backward square leg
Yet another slower one attempted, chipped over wide mid-off region for couple of runs.
tries the slower one this time but Rohit picks it up early and swings it high over wide midwicket for yet another boundary.
low full toss on the middle and Rohit flicks it away superbly to the midwicket boundary. Not a great delivery obviously but put away in style.
backs away to the leg side, Morne fires it short and Rohit guides it to third man region
short delivery, kicking up at the rib-cage even on this slow wicket and Rohit is in trouble; he hops to fend it away to short fine-leg region
short in length outside off stump, guided to right of Albie this time
full and outside off, goes for the big off drive and gets a thickish outside edge to third man where Albie makes a very fine diving stop.
slower one, just outside leg, ROhit checks his stroke and pushes it past square leg
rushes down the track, goes for the big hit over the on-side field but mistimes it along the ground to mid-on.
short in length, around the off stump line, defended to cover
overpitched on the legs, Rohit whips it uppishly but through the midwicket gap and it will reach the boundary. Easy pickings.
just short of the blockhole, around the off and middle line, pushed to right of mid-off for a single
short in length, on the hips, tucked to short fine-leg
length delivery just outside off stump, pushed out to point
turns in from outside off, flicked to midwicket
spins in towards the off stump, punched to the bowler
fuller, driven to long-on
from round the stumps, slips down the leg side, runs off the pad to short fine-leg
pushed it quick down the leg side
another quicker ball on middle, defended on the off side
quicker ball fired on middle, spun away to beat the outside edge
tossed up on middle and leg, driven straight to midwicket
driven down the ground to long-off
on middle and off, defended

Rohit's gone, tries to play across the line, gets a leading edge which balloons in the air, Brendon McCullum calls for the catch, he has plenty of time to position himself to take a comfortable catch near gully
Rohit gets his first six, a nonchalant flick off his pads, that brings up India's fifty, this really is a tiny ground

caught at slip! It was a length ball outside off but it did not jag into the right-hander this time, Rohit stayed in his crease and flashed away from his body, not getting close to the ball, the thick edge flew straight to Soumya
gets his first run with a punch to mid-off, Vettori return hits Southee rather painfully on the knee
length ball on off, Rohit mistimes his drive towards extra cover, he's yet to get off the mark
back of a length on off this time, Rohit gets on the backfoot and taps it towards the bowler, no run
good ball, short of a length, on middle and leg, Rohit doesn't connect as he looks to work it to the off, batsmen hare through for a leg bye

SA are doing superbly here. Rohit falls to a spinner now. Very risky shot. He shuffled outside off stump and tried to flick it from there but ended up slicing a dolly of a catch to backward point. 56 for 3 and they are wobbling here. Enter the captain.
floated full outside off stump, swept to long leg for a single
slower through the air, tossed up, full, turned to midwicket
turns in but from short of length and that allows Rohit to back away to cut it to sweeper cover
slows up the pace, gently turns in, deflected to midwicket
goes for a booming drive, doesn't make contact and it goes through to the keeper
full, a little bit of nip into the right-hander just outside off, Rohit quietly defends with a straight bat

shot. That has been put away with ease. Too full and well wide of him. Rohit swoops the bat down at some pace and drives straight down the ground. The bat turned in his hands slightly so he didn't middle it but gets four anyway

just like that, Barsapara has gone quiet. Not for long, though, as out comes the ever-popular Indian captain. Rohit pays for a lack of feet movement. Comes half-forward to this length ball that pitches around middle and off and beats him bu nipping in ever-so-slightly. Pings him plumb in front
tripe. But that is expected with wristspin occasionally. Drifts well down leg and Rohit sweeps through backward square leg. Would have been wide but Rohit will take four
six more. Flight again, outside off, Rohit gets underneath it ably and lofts the ball over mid-off. Over long-off. He picked his spot and with his timing, six everyday on this ground
flatter this time, the off break, nudged to long-on
overpitched delivery outside off, drilled through cover for a couple, the sweeper cover gets around
lovely shot. It's full and wide, similar to the second ball of the over, but he got one with a cover drive, so he improvises, changes the bat angle and slashes one through point
105 kph, another slower delivery, pushed to long-on. Wanted one all along to keep the score ticking.
flight outside off, 91 kph, Rohit powers a drive, plenty of power and over cover for another boundary, too easy
four more. Shortish outside off, Rohit cuts this time, straight to backward point who can't tackle the spin, the ball bounces off his body and ricochets away past third man for four.
short and much slower, Rohit stays back and punches to long-on.
fifty for Rohit. A slower delivery outside off, Rohit stays low, stays in his crease and thwacks a slap over midwicket for another six.
woooooow! Wheeeeee goes the ball. An offcutter on off, full from Gunaratne from around the wicket. What do you expect mate? Rohit slog-sweeps it 104 metres over midwicket. I want to bat here.
four more. 104 for 0 in the ninth over. Full and wide outside off, Rohit places the dab through backward point. No catching that. Let me bat too! It's all fun for Rohit and KL

116 kph, and then the finesse and timing of Rohit. Full again outside off, Rohit just leans on his drive and caresses the ball through the gap at cover. Looked like one, then two, then it hit the boundary rope.
good length outside off, carved down to third man for one.
shovelled away. Wanted six, but just couldn't get the timing he wanted. Full around off, a squeeze to midwicket
a low full toss down leg, 139 kph, was looking for the yorker but you can't miss your margins, because you're going for runs even when you get it right. Whipped through backward square leg
well bowled! Sees Rohit coming and fires a wide yorker that is just inside the tramline. Good improvisation
the legspinner? Not too sure. Flat, pushed through, on off, pushed to cover

the bottom-handed whip. Rohit has had enough of being cautious against Dananjaya. He charges immediately, converts flight into a full toss and clips the ball through midwicket with immense power in his bottom hand
well done. Slower ball and out goes the timing. Rohit is through an attempted sweep-scoop too early, a thick leading edge lobs to third man
fullish delivery outside off, Rohit is through his shot too early, hits it towards cover. Pace off the ball is definitely working. Comparatively at least
offbreak again, straying onto the pads, Rohit clips to square leg
looks like a googly, which Rohit looks to lash through the covers. But it peels off the inside edge to long-on, instead.
hangs back against the shortish delivery outside off and deftly guides it to deep third man
seems like the legcutter, on off stump, at a good length. Rohit covers it

that's glorious! A back foot punch through extra cover! And to a ball that isn't bad at all. Just short of a good length and only a shade outside off. But so quickly did he jump back that he makes the shot possible.
turns it behind square on the leg side
shapes to cut outside off, and oddly, he misses making connection
shimmies down, looking to hit towards long-on. But the ball skews off a bit of a leading edge through cover. A hint of seam movement for Mathews, hitting a good length spot on middle and off

it's mistimed for six. That will go down as a dropped chance, but those are never easy. A legcutter around off, Rohit swats the ball over long-on. The fielder gets under the catch, but the ball pops out and over the boundary

well taken at mid-on! This is a mistimed hoick from Rohit, the ball, which is on a length and a wicket-to-wicket line, hits him high on the bat and therefore does not allow him the power he is looking for. Chameera runs forward, dives and clings onto the low chance with both hands
full again outside off, respectfully defended towards cover point
width and slashed. Can't bowl there. Too wide and Rohit lets his hands through the line, carving a cut from down to up so that it goes over the infield, past backward point
fullish outside off, a bit of away swing, dabbed away towards short third man
a bit short this time, Rohit picks the length and says thanks mate. Slaps a pull over midwicket with so much ease. Disdain in that shot
shortish again, wide again, dabbed down to third man
good length again, a tad outside off and Rohit opens the bat face to guide that to third man. One more
a tad wide this time, punched to the sweeper cover from the back foot
not great timing but six again. Short boundaries, help yourself. Good length on middle, Rohit stays in his crease and swats a pull. Over midwicket. six more.
fullish start around off, pushed back towards mid-on. Dibbly-dobbly nothing from Mathews to start, a loosener
gently nudges it through midwicket, head over the ball and sweetly balanced as he meets the full ball on middle
that's why the wide yorker isn't a bad option. Full delivery around off, in the slot and launched over long-on. Sensational timing again
that's just awesome batting. Rohit is on 91! Full outside off, close to the wide yorker but like he did in Mohali, he intentional opens the bat face and slices a six over point
slapped away. Short and wide outside off, he doesn't get bounce like Chameera. Skids on nicely for the square drive on the up
lovely ball. Cuts in at his mid-riff and climbs over off stump from a good length outside off
back of a length at off, walks into the off side and flicks to deep square
good length outside off, leans in to the forward defence
back of a length in the corridor, transfers the weight into the off side and swats it aerially to the midwicket fence
good length at middle stump, stands tall this time and allows it to come to him. Flicks to perfection and beats fine leg by a long distance to his left
back of a length in the corridor, opens the face and guides it to third man
back of a length at leg stump, deflected into the leg side off the thigh

holes out to deep square. Short ball at off stump, cuts in a touch and maybe climbs on him too, because he's really cramped as he shapes to pull. It's one-handed slice in the end and a simple catch i the deep
crashed over the ring to deep cover, and India have avoided equalling the lowest score in a Twenty20 international
Hopes strikes with his fourth ball! The ball comes in on a good length on off, Sharma shapes to swivel a pull round, misses, and his off stump is clipped
nipped back in from outside off, the batsman walks back, exposes his stumps but connects well with a back-foot cut
on off, shortish, worked back down off the back foot
outside off, the batsman rocks onto the back foot and caresses the short ball through the gully to ease a single
short ball again, played down off the back foot
short ball, hooked off the nose through a very fine, fine leg
bangs a bouncer down off and Sharma's off the mark in streaky fashion, surprised by the lift and somehow pokes it down past first slip, through the vacant second in fact
legbreak, tossed up at middle stump, flicked into the midwicket area
gorgeous. Won't let him dictate. Length ball at off stump, steps out and meets the offbreak on the pitch and lifts it straight over mid-off
nicely bowled. Legbreak dips in towards leg stump and visibly has him in two minds. He respects it and defends in the end
tossed up at off stump, he gets down very quickly and sweeps uppishly to deep midwicket's right. Was a topspinner
best of the lot. That's so hard. Full delivery outside off, Rohit gets underneath the length and just lofts it, cleanly, waaay over cover. 97 off 34 now!
the joint-fastest T20 hundred in international cricket. Fastest by an Indian. It's full and wide and Rohit whacks it over cover. Off comes the helmet. Wow, is this innings just getting started?
flat around off, carved to point
pushed back to the bowler. Two dot balls. And the crowd goes wild.
make that three. He is bowling a decent length. A googly around off, short, hit back to the bowler
the legbreak outside off, swatted to deep midwicket from the crease. Terrific length, because it took away several six-hitting options
six more. A legcutter outside off, Rohit walks across and pulls over midwicket. Fantastic timing again
four more. Just 88 away. Full and wide outside off, sliced for four with unbelievable timing. He just made connection with it and found the gap.
might be a wide but that's good bowling. Wide yorker, just outside the tramline this time
six more. A low full toss around middle and leg, whipped over midwicket. Stunning bottom-handed power. This is the highest T20 opening stand for India
better line, starts it wider outside off, lets the ball spin back, worked away towards square leg
the offbreak spins down the leg side, an extra to begin
this one doesn't turn that much, flat outside off, defended ably enough

the googly. Rohit doesn't pick it again. He has been dismissed to that so often to this same bowler already. Gets forward, the googly finds a big gap between bat and pad, but bounces over the stumps. How?
charges down and pushes the ball to long-on
just over the bowler's head? The googly again, outside off, Rohit comes down, gets to the pitch and drives back. Clears the bowler's leaping hands, mid-off cleans up
a tad wide, might want to bring that line closer to Rohit. Wide outside off, Rohit misses a cut.
good length outside off, 138 kph, punched to cover from the crease

Rohit falls 82 short. But what a stunner that was. Friday at its best for Indian fans. Good option from Chameera, the short, slow bouncer that doesn't rise as much. Rohit sees third man up, tries to find the gap past him but can only find the short third man fielder. Terrific exhibition of stroke-making from Rohit.
seams in at the right-hander, and Rohit is unprepared for the movement off the pitch. His front foot is across on off stump, his bat has to come around it, and doesn't do so in time. Hit on the thigh
that's better! Races away through the covers, with Rohit's trademark timing. Brings down a straight bat, angles the face at the moment of impact and the half-volley screams away
that's a bit of a dozy start - bowler sends down a wide full toss, batsman bunts it down to third man off a thick outside edge. Yawn.

after turning the ball past the edge of the bat, Sodhi makes this dip on the batsman. So Rohit, attempting a drive through extra cover, is reaching too far in front of his body and has no timing to offer
strays in line and Rohit pulls it to the right of deep square leg
launches a back of a length free-hit delivery outside off seeking the boundary behind Southee at long-off, but he hasn't got enough power on it
evidence of the dew as de Grandhomme sends a full toss soaring over the batsman and the keeper. The knuckle ball goes awry - how are they even trying such things with so much moisture?
another beamer, and Rohit, trying to cut the ball, inside edges it past the keeper. This time it's a cutter, but the dew is causing problems here as well

loud shout for lbw but negated .. It skidded on from back of length, from just outside off and moved towards middle. Rohit went for the pull and was hit on the thigh. The ball would have just gone over the middle stump
cutting in from outside off, with bounce, Rohit is cramped but adjusts by taking th bottom-hand off the handle and stabs the ball to the off side

The frenetic nervous energy continues to spill over. Rohit moves down the track, Shahadat shortens the length, Rohit goes for the pull and edges it but well short of the third man fielder. Agony for Shahadat. He has created chances but nothing has gone straight to hands...
drops it short and outside off, Rohit flashes it away in style past point

Almost caught at deep square leg by Mashrafee. A fine effort. Rohit had flicked a full delivery in the air and Mash, stationed at the boundary, leaped up but couldn't quite get his palms around the ball ...
back of length, around off stump, tapped to the on side of the pitch and they scamper across for a quick single
goes for a big slog and is beaten. Rohit charged down the wicket and went for a big hit over the infield but couldn't connect
slightly slower, length delivery on the off stump, worked to mid-on
stands up tall to play a neat little punchy on-the-up drive but straight to cover
130.4 kmph length delivery that straightens on the off stump, Rohit pushes at it and edges it to third man
Rohit starts off with a confident creamy little cover drive. He moved forward to time the length delivery through extra cover
pushes through cover
shortish and slow, Rohit half sweeps and half pulls it to deep square leg
goes for the sweep towards fine leg, but the ball, pitching on leg stump, rags away from the bat looking to hurt it and into the loving embrace of Latham's gloves
flatter delivery a shade outside off, Rohit clips it towards short midwicket

dropped by Southee at long-off. Rohit looks to force the pace, but he only toe-ends the cutter. Doesn't get the distance. The fielder has to run up, dive forward, and mucks up all that effort in the end
yet another slower one, lands on a length around off stump, pushed towards wide mid-on for a single
backs away to drag it past square leg
draws the batsman forward with his flight and Rohit respects it with a simple block to cover
quicker delivery, surprises Rohit by coming on with the arm and pinning him on the thigh. He isn't even ready with a shot by the time he's struck
rocks back and flicks a shortish delivery on the pads to deep midwicket
flatter delivery on middle and leg, punches it back to the bowler
a massive effort from Boult at deep third man, waiting on the edge of the boundary, tracking the upper cut, leaping as high as he could, but the ball sails over him. Outstanding shot
nudges a back of a length delivery to the right of midwicket
googly, turning into middle and leg, but Rohit, by backing away, is able to dab the ball to short third man
steps forward to defend a fuller delivery angled across him
back of a length and outside off, Rohit dabs it to deep third man
presents the full face to a pitched-up delivery outside off
clears the front leg to try and flay the ball through the off side, but there isn't enough width to pull the shot off.
big turn as he finally decides to indulge in the orthodox left-armer's delivery, which pitches around off stump and breaks away from Rohit's reach
nudges a flatter delivery on leg stump through square leg
goes for the sweep shot, the decision made in light of the ball being outside off. But the length is not quite right. Too short, and it spins past the bat swing
lifts it over extra cover! It's only just cleared the fielder, leaping to his left
tries to cut a shortish delivery, a shade outside off. But it simply bounces a lot more than Rohit expects
mistimes the front foot pull, which is a rare thing indeed. Credit to Boult for putting in more pace and bounce than the batsman had anticipated.
drags his front leg back so he can punch a shortish delivery on leg stump to long-on

it doesn't look like the usual Rohit six. They soar away, gaining height and distance. This one goes straight up, keeps gaining distance in that direction, but somehow lands beyond the long-on boundary
steers it to short third man
back of a length and outside off, Rohit tries to upper cut it away but is unable to
outside edge trickles away to the third man boundary. It's the slower ball fairly wide outside off, Rohit wants to smack it over mid-off but he'll take this outcome anyway

big appeal for caught behind, but the keeper doesn't and now the umpires are going to confer. Third umpire is called in, soft signal is out. This is an attempted yorker from Boult, wide outside off. Rohit tries to flay it away, but it's too quick for him. The reason the two on-field umpires wanted a second opinion was because they wanted to check on the bump ball. But instead, Anil Chaudhary comes back with, "bat hit the ground" and rules not out. That prompts New Zealand to review and the same man who ruled this not out has to change his decision because Ultra-Edge shows a spike as ball passes bat.
keeps his shape nicely and nudges a fuller delivery on middle and off to mid-on.
lofts it over long-on! These front foot pulls of Rohit are really audacious and this time he takes on a proper fast bowler and deposits him back over his head
pitches it up on off stump and Rohit defends firmly, and the crowd has either gone "ooooooh" or "booooo"
lets the shortish delivery come on and clips it off his hips to deep square leg

beauty again, and he goes up in appeal for a caught behind. Umpire Nandan is unmoved. Hits the deck hard, and a length that does not allow Rohit to move forward or back. Tries to adjust with the hands, but is undone by the movement
leg-stump half-volley and Rohit whips it away disdainfully to the deep square leg

given out caught behind! It took a while for Nandan to raise his finger - so much that the wicketkeeper Phillips was desperately urging his captain to review. It eventually isn't needed - but a double-wicket over is exactly what New Zealand needed. And who else but Boult to provide it. Back of a length, pushing across Rohit, who looks to glide it to third man, while being stuck on the crease. A bit of extra bounce and a bit of nip off the pitch does him in.
yikes, that's a ripping cobra of a delivery. Good length on middle, the ball pitches, stops and rips away from the bat. An absolute jaffa
flat on off, spins away again but Rohit pulls, towards backward square leg
flat and quick, following Rohit, all he can do is half-time a stab to cover. Superb defensive bowling
flat and quick on middle and leg, Rohit backs away and slaps a pull down the ground, past Williamson at mid-on, who races back and makes it, but can't quite get to the ball
lovely pace, slowed this one up on off, Rohit fails to make contact with a slog sweep, bounce and spin takes the ball over the bat
terrific over from Santner, quick down leg, lots of spin and the ball beats Rohit's jab, hits him on the thigh pad for one leg bye to point.
the offcutter to start, superb bowling, down leg, Rohit is too early through his pull, off the arm towards the keeper

Santner takes another catch! Two in two. And this is another fine catch. Short down leg, another offcutter, Rohit is early through his pull, the ball goes in the air, flat towards Santner at deep square leg, who runs in, gets down and takes a sensational catch, with both hands low to the ground
a nice start, some swing, good length on the pads, nudged down to fine leg for a run.

ooh, nearly. This is a length ball angling into off stump, and it stops on Rohit just a touch as he looks to use his wrists and clip towards mid-on. Ends up playing way out in front of his body, and chips it in the air, but it bounces just short of the diving mid-on fielder, sneaks under him, and runs away, all the way to the boundary
length ball outside off, Rohit tries to flay it over cover, doesn't make contact, and the ball lobs off the keeper's gloves to short third man
shortish and outside off, cuts to deep point
pummels the half-volley outside off to the long-off boundary. Fielder there can just watch
pulls the shortish delivery from outside off to deep midwicket
taps a shortish delivery from outside off to long-on
opens the face against a length ball coming at his stumps and deftly steers it to third man
another short delivery, spinning away from Rohit. He still whips it to long-on
short and outside off, Rohit slices it behind point
plays with the turn and slices a back of a length delivery to sweeper cover
slower ball outside off, Rohit chops it to short third man
another top edge, another boundary behind the keeper. Rohit must have charmed his bat before walking out to the crease. Sweeps it away
knocks it down to long-on
grip, turn and bounce, all foiling Rohit's attempt to come down the track and slog
backs away, Santner follows him, but offers length that Rohit can get under and launch it straight over the top. He's clearing the boundary without middling the ball
the ball spinning away from him helps as he backs away, lets it spin, and heaves it away past the right of long-on
he has got everything behind this ball - a full toss outside off that is simply caressed to the boundary, left of long-off
tosses it up on leg stump, Rohit swings it away to deep midwicket. That brings up India's highest opening stand in T20Is
goes down on one knee and the smitten ball does Rohit's bidding. Takes a top edge and even then the scoop shot sails over the boundary behind fine leg
nails a length ball outside off to point - and he really did nail it
short arm pull to wide long-on
swings hard at a back of a length delivery, but it bounces a lot more, skews off the bat maker's label to long-on
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, tucked through backward square leg
full and flighted on the leg stump, the batsman  moves his front leg out and drives it to long off
slower legcutter well outside off, slices it to short third man for one
full on middle, it was slow enough for Rohit to go down on a knee and sweep that with some power to the midwicket boundary, between two fielders
too slow through the air, Rohit charges down and slams it to long-off. That's his ffity and such a crucial innings it has been
chipped towards mid-on but falls short! Slower delivery was pitched up, Rohit was early into the shot and chipped it down the ground but mid-on could not have done anything about it
extra bounce around the off stump, makes Rohit hop on his toes and he helps it to third man again
starts outside off and Rohit steers the ball to third man
full on off stump, flicks it with the angle to leg
makes some room and drives that nicely to long off
keeps a bit low as Shakib brings it in from round the wicket, Rohit drives into the covers
angling in a bit and it's worked away to deep midwicket
angling in again, nudges it down towards long on
comes down and across, Shakib pitches it slow and gets an inside edge to the pad before it goes to leg
angles the short ball in and Rohit knows that fine leg is in. Puts his weight on the back foot and pulls it late enough to beat the fielder in the circle

another boundary, this time with a misfield! Slightly closer to the off stump, still there was room and Rohit played it fine delicately. The third man fielder got there with a slide but it went through his legs
even more room and that's gone all the way! Lot of width outside off, short ball and Rohit times it with an upper cut to send it flying over deep backward point
four now - beautiful placement! There was room and some pace, he just waited for it and helped it between point and third man in the gap
dropped! That went straight to Shakib at point after Rohit timed it very well, cut it straight to Shakib but he put it down
almost a replay, there's room, there's a bat in Rohit's hand which he swings but misses again
length ball outside off, left alone
pulls him first ball, it's a top-edge and it goes very high but lands safely. Was coming in a bit and Rohit pulled a bit awkwardly, but deep midwicket couldn't get under it in time
shuffles down again, he pitches it shorter and Rohit works it to long on

given. Rohit has to go. Full on middle, straight. Rohit misses his flick and that is absolutely plumb. Looked like the pace of Chameera did for Rohit who was late on it. Great delivery from Chameera though. Great comeback after a poor start
short and flat towards middle stump, he makes room and slams it to long off
126kph, full and slightly wide, Rohit drives that nicely to sweeper cover and they come back for the second. Good running
short of length outside off, slices it to deep point
slower and fuller outside off, there's not much pace so the drive takes some time to reach long-off and they make it back for two
just clears long-off! He came down the track, lofted it straight down the ground and Shakib was getting ready. He jumped too but it went just over him

length ball, nips in a touch from outside off to hit Rohit's front pad. Mathews got him out this way a couple of times during the Test series in Sri Lanka last year, but Rohit got an inside edge on it as he looked to play around his front pad
back of a length, a bit of width, and Rohit puts it away, full follow-through of the bat, finishing above his left shoulder, as he slaps it away in front of point
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, tucked away to long leg
length ball outside off, a bit of seam away, and he beats the outside edge as Rohit comes forward and pushes at it, away from his body, looking for a push through cover point
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short cover
a touch fuller, a touch straighter, and Rohit punishes it. Just clears his front leg and swings through the line, one nice fluid swing, and launches it high over mid-on
too much width and Rohit cashes in by punching it off the back foot nicely for four. There was no movement to add to the width and Rohit jumped on that
towards the off stump now from length, Rohit stays back and defends it back

Amir's got him this time! Another incredible ball, slanting across Rohit at pace from over the wicket, pitching on a good length around off and bending back into the right-hander, beating the inside edge of the bat to crash into the pad. The umpire takes a while but eventually sends Rohit on his way. Two outstanding balls from Amir. That one is crashing into middle stump
more confident this time - presses forward to off and defends the length ball into the covers
shorter and wider, not much swing now and Rohit swings and misses! Just goes over the upper edge. Good bounce and carry
this ones comes in sharply too, well outside off and wide enough for Rohit to leave it
pretty wide now outside off and Rohit guides it to third man to get off the mark
what a sharp inswinger from back of length, Rohit just about got bat on ball. Had no time to react as the ball moved off the pitch too

Pakistan cannot believe that isn't lbw! Amir has bowled a scorching yorker, angling across the right-hander and then bending back to hit the toe of the front foot. That looks so good. I think Rohit is really lucky ...

superb catch by Soumya Sarkar in the deep! It was a short of length slower ball outside off, Rohit went for the heave and middled it too, but Sarkar was in the deep and ran to his left, went low and got both his hands under the ball nicely with a forward dive to take that!
short of length towards middle and leg, mistimes a pull towards midwicket
full delivery with width and it's driven into the covers in the gap for two
comes down to smack it, gets an inside edge towards mid on

that's gone high again, that's Shakib under the ball again and it's six again, just out of his reach! It was a short ball, Rohit opened up and flick-pulled it very high into the sky. Shakib fancied his chances again, got his hands too, stretching them over the boundary but it had the distance
what a classic drive! Made some room, got a full delivery and caressed it all along the ground for a beautiful drive
short ball, it's a mis-hit off a pull but it lands between long-on and deep midwicket for four more!
poor start. Good length down leg, Rohit helps it on its way to the fine leg fence, with short fine leg up. No problem, for Rohit, easy four.
good comeback from SS. Sees Rohit coming again, and drops it shorter. Rohit improvises to punch to long-on
lot of width outside off, he swings and misses
shuffles down and wrists it down to long on with the turn
bit short just outside off, Rohit mistimes the pull to midwicket
bit of a mix up but no run out! Little short and wide outside off, he helps it to third man and Raina quickly turns around for the second but is sent back in time
much fuller and wider, Rohit swishes at it and finds backward point
back of length well outside off, punches it towards deep point for one
top-tier? Wow, what timing from Rohit. Steps out, gets to the pitch and wallops the lofted heave easily over midwicket. Went way into the stands.
full ball, across the right-hander from round the stumps, and driven down the ground for one
"Wide???" asks a bemused Jayasuriya, Rohit has hit the cover of the ball while sweeping this one, but it's called wide
helped away to deep fine leg for one
plays a wristy shot, uppishly, one bounce to mid-on
bit more towards the leg side and it's tucked to deep backward square easily
angling into the batsman, Rohit waits and defends it back
nice delivery. Flat on off, skids on with the arm. Takes the outside edge, on the bounce to slip
full and wide, seam-up delivery outside off, cracked away to extra cover
full on off, played defensively towards point
slower ball on off, good change in pace. Rohit play too early and gets a thick inside edge which squirts to square leg
full on off, pushed to mid-off
shortish and wide, too close to cut but Rohit chops into the point region
nice start from Dilhara. Full and swinging away, overly full and jammed out
slow tossed up delivery on middle. Turn for SS. Rohit nudges to square leg to get off the mark
touch shorter outside off, Rohit drives off the back foot to the covers and the fielder throws that to concede two overthrows!
much fuller now, he drives it down nicely to mid-off for one

he is run out and he is hurt too, Rohit plays a nice drive to the right of Malinga at third man, and hesitates for just one moment while coming back for the second. The throw is right at the top of the stumps, and what's more he has hurt his shoulder while diving
slower on middle, worked to midwicket
fuller on middle and Rohit flicks it away easily to deep midwicket
slower outside off, Rohit stays back and turns it towards long-on for one
outside off and pushed into the covers
tossed up outside off, driven down firmly to long-on
tucks this one softly wide of midwicket for one
coming in with the angle and he chops it to point
fullish around off and drilled down the ground for one
pushed through down leg, clips the pad and rolls fine
comes down the track but doesn't appear to pick Narine's carrom ball which goes the other way, has to retreat into defence down the pitch
gets the bat in front of pad to this delivery turning into middle stump and plays to midwicket
fuller delivery, Taylor tries to dispatch that too but will have to settle for one on the leg side
big appeal for lbw, turns in sharply from outside off but Taylor manages to get just outside the line of off as he tries to work it to leg
pushes it down to long-off for a single
pushes it towards cover
another slower delivery from the back of the hand, the batsman comes forward and nearly yorks himself, pushed to the off side for a quick single
slower ball outside off and he pushes it on the full to long-off
slower ball on the pads and he works it down to short fine leg
slower ball and he drags it down to long-on
opens the stance, clobbers another wristy thump over point. Runs everywhere!
fizzes past a wild swing, Billings whips off the bails but the back foot is anchored
heave-ho! Spring-loaded wrists, and pounded into the stands over wide long-on! Everything must go!
chopped into the covers, flowing through the line
excellent shot, comes round the wicket and it's a length ball on middle, lofts through the line and clears long-on
similar shot, on his knee and driven squarer this time, the fielder at deep cover had to run across
drags it across the line down to deep midwicket

this is full and slides straight on, Taylor punches to mid-off and sets off, starts to slip into cruise control halfway through before realising he had to pick the pace up, might have been caught short had the throw hit
full around off, pushed to cover and they come through for a quick single
slower and around off this time, attempts the slog sweep again but doesn't get the desired connection
again gives plenty of room, Badree follows him and he bottom-edges it between his legs
backs away and exposes all three stumps, it's a good length ball on middle and Taylor connects with the slash and sends it away to the point fence
chops the short ball through third man, not timed particularly well but nevertheless he achieves the desired result
cracks the pads, deflects to the leg side
Taylor goes to his release shot, the slog sweep to cow corner, but misses and is hit outside off on the lack leg
full toss around off, Taylor does well to nudge it around to the leg side in the gap for two

goes down the leg side and it beats the fielder for four, 17 from the over! It was a poor delivery, going down leg and Taylor did well to tickle it so fine that it beat a diving Dickwella at short fine leg
the legbreak is too short, it's in Taylor's zone and he rocks back quickly to pull that over the deep midwicket boundary for six
slower length delivery on the stumps, he works it to leg by closing the face of the bat, cleverly using soft hands and gets two
good length on the off stump and he opens the face and steers it to third man
smacked for six more! This one was an offbreak, outside off and Taylor picks it quickly to hammer that with the turn over deep midwicket

dropped at deep midwicket by Shanaka! Taylor went for the slog sweep again, he didn't connect so well this time and Shanaka was there in the deep but the ball popped out and then he tumbled. How expensive is that?
back of a length, tucked off the ribs to the on side
gets across his stumps and works it across the line to deep midwicket
fuller delivery and he gets forward and drives him down to long-off
goes for the slog and he mistimes it, the ball rolls behind the keeper
tries to loft over long-on but doesn't time it well, safe enough
slides it down the leg side
fired well down leg past Taylor's slog sweep
crashed hard to short cover, that's travelling as Morgan tumbles well to intercept
follows it up with a better yorker, cramps him up for room and Taylor can only squirt it back to the bowler
hit down the ground, and Mahela from straight midwicket makes a diving save
slower ball and shorter and he swivels and clubs it down to deep square leg
length ball on the stumps, pushed to mid-on for a more comfortable save
foot and a half outside off, pushed out to the deep cover
full just outside off, driven off a thick inside edge that runs through square leg
