driven nicely past extra cover, long-off goes to his right to field and they two
full just outside off, dug out through point
similar delivery, Taylor drives again and gets a thick outside edge that runs past short third man for four, unlucky Luke
off stump on a length, pushed down to long off
length well outside off, Taylor slashes and misses and nearly falls out of his ground
full ball pushed wide of the cover sweep with that huge boundary, easy two
off stump on a decent length, flicked down to long-on
full ball on the stumps, dug out down to long on, just needs to give McBren the strike at the moment
full ball that tails in a little, driven out to deep cover
full on the stumps, pushed in range of mid-on who slides and saves the single
full ball on the stumps, toe-ended through cover
full toss outside off, slapped hard wide of the cover sweeper who gets down with a big right hand and saves four, super work
another full toss outside off, this a bit lower and slugged down to long-off
whoops, high full toss outside off, slapped to cow corner, once bounce four, well struck
yorker length just outside off, dug out down to third man
full and straight, dug out to deep cover
full on the stumps, driven straight mid-on who manages to get across. Taylor is away.
beauty! That's a cracker. Short of a length and it zips past Taylor's outside edge as feels away from his body
angled square through the off side behind point, to the right of third man but can't get a second out of it
too much width this time and he cashes in with a thrashing drive over the off side
back of a length, worked in front of square and deep midwicket can't cut off the second
clubbed down the ground, doesn't come out of the middle and goes in the air about half the way to long-on
that's better, full on off stump, pushed back down the pitch and Patel does well off his own bowling
full ball on middle and leg, a flick down the ground but it sails into the stands for a flat six, what timing, that flew
fuller ball on the pads and he clips it down to deep midwicket
swings against the turn with a slog sweep and misses it completely as the ball turns away
bit of flight outside off, Taylor pushes into the covers and there's no time for a run
the slower ball becomes a high full toss outside off and he miscues it over cover, close to being a no-ball for height
swings a length delivery over square leg but can't beat the fielder in the deep, will just be a single

is that a top edge? Sarfraz thinks so, and the umpire thinks so. Quickish outside off, more topspin than sidespin, and perhaps not enough room to cut. Taylor is one of the better cutters in the game, and he doesn't really need that much width, but on this occasion all he manages is a thick edge, which Sarfraz does very well to hold onto because it deviated quite sharply
tossed up on middle and off, whipped to deep midwicket

full on leg stump, clipped towards deep midwicket, and oh my word, what are New Zealand doing here! Southee comes back for the second, Taylor sends him back, and Southee slips as he turns back towards the striker's end. Tries to dive back into the crease, but he's too late to beat the throw and Sarfraz's glovework. That's five wickets in eleven balls. Wow.
length ball wide of off stump, flat-batted to the left of extra-cover
full-toss, whipped away firmly with a lot of bottom hand, leaving long-on with a lot of work to do. Malik sprints to his right and stops it with some nifty footwork at the rope
down the track to the length ball outside off, drives it to long-off
tossed up wider, driven to sweeper cover
nice flight just around off stump, presses forward and pushes into the covers, looking for one, but Shadab moves quickly in his follow-through to cut it off
and again: slower length ball around off worked to the leg side with fielders in the deep and they get two more
slower one on the pads this time and flicked for one
pulls it shorter, it keeps a bit low and Taylor guides it towards short third man
tucked fine off the pads straight to fine leg, sets off but is quickly sent back
Taylor gets beaten outside off stump as he pushes forward to defend
a good length ball angles into the right hander and hits Taylor on the pad just outside off
good length and straight, Taylor moves across his stumps and gets a single towards point
good length and straight, Taylor defends from his crease
that's a wide down leg side
good length and straight once again, Taylor moves across his crease, pushes towards midwicket and runs
dropped close on the off side for a single
short of a length outside off, Taylor cuts but doesn't beat Dilshan at point
good length on off stump, defended on the off side
caught behind! A faint edge through to Sanga after Taylor went back to cut a short ball through point. It's all quite tame from New Zealand at the moment, folding without a fight
cheeky leg byes down the leg side, unlucky for Sri Lanka. It was full and going down leg and Taylor just managed to get his pads on it while trying to tickle that fine
full toss on middle, happily tucked to leg for one
Taylor leans across his stumps and glances towards fine leg
length on middle and out comes the trademark Taylor sweep, shuffles slightly and bisects deep square leg and deep midwicket
ooh, a dot ball, the carrom ball, got across and dropped it into the leg side, thought of the single but it just wasn't there
full around off, pushed into the deep cover region and they come through for a comfortable couple
poked with a very straight blade down to long-off. Tidy line and full length
settles for the single as Brown takes the pace off once more
slow and straight, tucked to the leg side, and a single is all they can get from that flick
outside off, dabbed behind square, for a gentle tumbling stop at backward point

beauty from Jordan! Pace very much on the ball that time, tight line outside off, but it was through Taylor like a dose of salts... and Morgan has called for the review! It was a wild flashing drive, but was there bat involved? I don't think so ...probably bat on ground... inconclusive either way. On we go.
bashed firmly out to square leg, as Jordan aims very full once more
misses his mark this time, only fractionally, but Taylor finally had one he could crash through the line. Jordan almost got a hand on it to intercept, as only he can
flatter and quicker on off stump, Taylor tucks it backward of square on the leg side
ooh, another missed run out? Was tucked into the leg side and there was hesitation, but Morgan produced a poor throw to Kieswetter. Taylor would have been short
round the wicket, full on off stump, worked into the midwicket area
full on middle and leg, tucked in front of square through the leg side
nicely bowled, tight on off stump, Taylor defends back to the bowler...very neat over from Briggs
gets this one away, Taylor brings out the sweep to quite a short delivery and sends it backward of square on the leg side
full outside off, squeezed to backward point
back of a length on off stump, drops it square into the off side to rotate the strike again
good yorker to finish the over, Taylor can only dig it out to the leg side
on a length outside off, Taylor opens the face down to third man
a third for Finn. He's perhaps a touch fortunate because it was short outside off and Taylor picked out his favourite area towards deep midwicket but couldn't clear the man on the boundary
gives it some air this time, tossed up on middle, tickled towards square leg to get off the mark
Taylor paddles that really fine, fetched it from middle and off for a couple of runs
bowled quick and flat on the off stump, defended towards cover from the crease
angling in towards the off, pushes that wide of extra cover for a single
shortish on leg stump, tries to turn it fine, gets a leg-bye
nudged ever so fine! Slightly leg-sided on a very full length, and that races away
tossed up on middle this time, worked it wide of Pollard at midwicket for a single, Pollard dives to his right and releases quickly
slower ball, Taylor waits and waits on the back foot, and taps to the on side
full toss turned to midwicket to retain the strike
floated up on the stumps and worked through midwicket on the full
slower ball and a thick edge down to third man
short ball and Taylor clatters a pull shot in front of deep midwicket for the first boundary since the sixth over
erratic bowling well wide of off-stump
cut away and a great diving catch attempt at backward point but it runs away for four
he drops it to midwicket and takes a quick single
another bumper, slightly further outside off, tapped towards point and fielded
short of a length, Taylor gives himself room but steers his shot straight to point
fast and straighter ball which Taylor misses and it rips leg-stump out the ground. Good bowling but Taylor's done his damage
same ball and similar result but the keeper picks it up this time
full toss down the leg-side which clips the toe of Taylor's bat and runs away through his legs for four. Bit of fortune there
low full toss which is flicked through square leg and Ross Taylor holds on to the strike
outside off-stump and Taylor misses this time
slides too far down the leg side
full and straight and whipped off the pads to deep square leg
slower ball which Taylor picks up. Down on one knee he pulls the ball over midwicket and it ends up in a building site outside off the ground. Stunning shot!
on his toes and dug away to the bowler
pitched up and driven to mid-off on the front foot
tossed up outside off, misfield at cover from Bresnan allows New Zealand a bonus single
full toss which is given the full treatment by Ross Taylor. Pulls the ball over square leg and it's still rising over the rope and finishes well out of the ground
chipped away to long-off. Just doesn't quite carry
slower ball which Taylor misses going for the big shot
full delivery dug out back to the bowler who misfields
pumped to deep point, very full length
angling in towards middle, drives it down the ground to long-on for a single
angling in towards off, gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler
got well across did Ross, and played it well in the end though there was a big lbw risk there, he plays that shot well though, gets across and swings it fine, past short fine, for a boundary
misfield by Narine, he's been sloppy in the field today though very good with the ball, clips it towards short fine, he concedes an extra run, two in all
low full toss and it's chipped towards Pollard at long-on for two more, Taylor makes it back in time

plays the scoop and it goes all the way, it's not his favourite shot but he pulls it off superbly, full toss on the pads, bowled at 127kmph and he used the pace to scoop it over the fine-leg boundary for six, what a shot
ooh fired it quick on middle, got an inside edge onto the pads, just the single, 2 in 1 now
back on a better fuller length, settles for the single
flogged high over point, chiselling out the very full length on a fractionally wide line
bashed out to deep midwicket, this is tidy work from England. New Zealand still not quite daring to cut loose

honked across the line, line and length and variation from Curran, putting the ball in the right area but at an indeterminate pace. Midwicket in play once more as a decent set of four overs ends for TKC
flashed hard into the covers off a full length, but intercepted on the edge of the ring. A precious dot
pounded hard to deep midwicket, and Vince drops a low chance! It was travelling, but he should have snaffled that, leaning forward
too short, and cracked murderously over midwicket! You can't bowl there to Ross Taylor!
wide line, inside-edged as Taylor reaches for the ball
tidy line and length to finish his set, pumped out to extra cover, the conventional strokes aren't finding the gaps today
a yawning mow across the line, but they miss out on the second run as the ball plugs in space
pounded to cow corner, as Taylor fails to line up the cutter, and that's Brown's first international wicket! A big scalp too, as Jonny Bairstow stoops well to gather
faster ball which clips off the pads and runs to square leg. Half-appeal from Gayle and the keeper
full once more and the batsmen can only blocked back
full once more but too close to the leg-side and a cute glance beats the man at short fine leg and races away for four
flicked in to the gap at midwicket
length outside off, Taylor looks for the cut but it's not nearly short enough, chops it away to the off side
tossed up outside off, Taylor pushes with his hands and is beaten by the spin
length outside off, throws his hands at it but can't beat the diving point fielder, who gets a good chunk of it to keep them to one
length outside off, pushed to deep cover for one
fires it quick but it's down the leg side, Ramdin keeps well and takes off the bails but Taylor's in, a wide
yorker length and superbly done by Marlon., Taylor can only push it back to the bowler, applause from Gayle
Taylor opts to take the single, drops it towards point to keep strike, Narine ends a potentially match-winning spell
the carrom ball again, turned away, short outside off, Taylor moved away to cut and missed, another dot, what a superb over this
tickles that one towards short fine this time for a single
bad ball from Gayle, a full toss on middle and Taylor dispatches that over the deep square leg boundary, easy pickings there and relieves a bit of the pressure, Badree's agony grows
caught at long-off as Taylor reaches for a widish delivery and holes out in the deep, just the single though
misdirected, was a wide but he's overstepped as well, so it's a no-ball, freehit coming
turns in from outside off, worked away into the on side, in the vacant square leg region for a well-run couple
Taylor gets across and drives that through midwicket for a single
short of a good length outside off, tapped towards point and he picks a single
nicely done by Taylor, on a good length, gets to it and steers that past the diving point to beat third man to the boundary
angling in towards middle, gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler
goodish length, gets front and across and drives it down to long-on for a single
goodish length on the off, gets front and across and drives it back to the bowler
shortish on the off, pulls it through square leg into the deep for a couple more runs
yorkerish outside off and it's dug out towards point for a single
short of a good length, Taylor tries to chop it towards point, knocks it away just into the off side, no single on offer
Taylor slogs and slogs well, picked it up from a length outside off and heaved it over the deep midwicket boundary, went the distance

four more, Andre Russell was caught in two minds about what to do there, was in the air for a while and Russell initially thought of going for a catch but it wasn't on, Taylor flicked it beautifully towards deep square leg and Russell dived forward, only for the ball to bounce over him
dragged through square leg this time for just a single
bad ball, full toss on leg stump and he's lucky that's not been smacked for another boundary, flicked away through square leg for a couple more in the deep
pitched on a good length outside off, slapped towards deep point for a single
nicely driven on the up and that's been played wide of long-off for a couple of runs
pitched on a length and that's been crunched down to long-off for a single
shortish on the off, goes on straight, Taylor reaches his half-century with a whip to square leg for a single
and another, speared down the leg side, not a good start to a spell
slower one, pushed it towards Gayle at extra cover, Taylor picked a single and took another one on the overthrow as Gayle missed at the non-striker's end
poor ball down the leg side, big wide
can't beat short third man as he opens the face
angled into the legs again, goes for a sweep and it runs fine off the pads
slower ball, fullish on off stump and worked to long-on for one. Tidy from Gregory
slower ball bouncer, Taylor shuffles down the track and hoiks this through midwicket... and that's a shoddy bit of work from Banton, as it flies past his left hand for four
slapped out to long-on for one
length ball on middle-and-leg, throws his hands through it and it flies away just over the rope at backward square leg for six more!
slightly short, drops it in front of point for a single

No lapses this time, Ross Taylor goes, he pulls out his trademark slog-sweep but doesn't connect well, gets plenty of elevation and Angelo Mathews does well to clasp a tough catch with the sun in his eyes near deep midwicket
misses out on the free hit, sharp bumper... oh but it's harshly called a no-ball again on height! Turning into an expensive over
full bunger, slipped out of the hand, 136kph/84mph on leg stump and flicked very fine for four to go with the no-ball
how has that missed?! Inside edge from Taylor, looked for all money like he'd played on but it's juuust past the bottom of leg stump
nudged out into the leg side for one
slowie, very wide outside the off stump. Taylor comes down and looks to slug it through midwicket but doesn't get any bat on it
quicker ball, yorker length and squeezed down towards fine leg off the inside edge, Billings has a chance to run CdG out but the throw goes wide!
full on fourth stump, worked to long-on
length ball, strays down the leg side and that's called wide
132kph/82mph on the pads, nudged away for a single
and another one, drags his length back but the line isn't quite right
and he strikes with his last ball! Think it's caught, although Carey has completed the stumping as well. Taylor using his feet, doesn't get to the pitch, aims to play square and gets a thin top edge
yorker length, trying to fire it in at his pads but strays down leg again
slower ball, dragged cross-batted down to long-on
tries to hack this through midwicket, quicker ball and yorker-length and inside edges through his legs

big appeal, and gone! Length ball, fairly straight and Taylor doesn't get any bat on it and is struck on the back thigh pad. Mahmood goes up, and it's given. Neesham seemed to want him to review, but Taylor wasn't interested.
full and wide outside off, Taylor flashes at that and misses
again close to the body, looks to play to the leg side, off the pad
no room to work with for Taylor, pushed to cover
tucked behind square from offstump
a half-tracker first up for Taylor, clapped towards sweeper cover
length ball on the stumps, defended back towards the bowler
short of length ball wide of the stumps, driven towards sweeper cover
back of length ball driven down to long-on for a quick couple
change-up, little offcutter whipped out to midwicket for one
shortish again, on offstump, Taylor shuffles across and defends towards square leg
full on fourth stump, Taylor looks to crunch this through the covers but finds <del>Middlesex's</del> Yorkshire's Dawid Malan at short cover
fires this one down the leg side, untidy from Billings and a couple of extras
flicked to the leg side
swing and a miss, good shape from Curran, away from the right-hander on a back of a length. Close to a wide, but fair enough
chopped hard, hitting at the top of the bounce outside off, but the sweeper is set back on the point boundary
in the channel outside off, back of a length again, it's a counterintuitive line of attack, wide long-hops essentially... but it's effective to this field!
tucked off the legs to mid-on
tossed up into the toes, can't get the clip away
dipping outside off, drilled into the covers, instantly looking for two
on the toes, nurdled to the leg side, good areas once more from the probing Curran
nudged off the toes, closing the face on impact to counter the shape that Curran is still getting on the ball
very full length, outside off, clawed into the leg side with an arcing swing
lots of width, a full length, had to stretch to reach that on a square drive. Vince does well (for a change) to slide round and intercept at deep point
battered hard into the covers, they run on the shot but it's a clean pick-up at the edge of the rope as Morgan gathered and shied... and that would have been out with a direct hit!
very full, that's a fine delivery, tailing in on middle and off, and punched with lots of bottom hand to cover
huge appeal and gone! A low full toss, tailing into the stumps, a wild hack from Taylor, who had walked across his stumps to open up his options, but ended up giving the umpire a very easy decision
played straight towards extra cover
cracking shot, Anderson serves up a slower ball, and Taylor responds with a bullet-like slog-sweep that pierces the leg-side field, all along the ground as well
New Zealand's chances are fading now, Taylor is gone to a super Gibbs catch, on middle stump, looks to flick it to midwicket, Gibbs is across to his left to take another low catch
back of a length and outside off, jabbed towards point
length ball heading for off, Taylor powers it to midwicket, couple of bounces ot the fielder
drive along the ground towards long-off fr two more, fine over for NZ this
Taylor move across and plays his favourite stroke, the powerful sweep, the only one with a chance of catching that was lounging in the stands behind square leg, he drops it
the power of Taylor on display, an overpitched ball is flatbatted down the ground for four to long-on, not much of a back lift in Taylor shot
back of a length, on middle and leg, defended by the batsman
full on leg stump, and nurdled out to the man sweeping at cow corner for one
slower ball on a length, tucked off the hip into the leg side
fullish, angling across him, and blocked to mid-on with a straight bat. Textbook stuff
good over this from Curran, tight to the stumps and offers no width. Taylor can only block this back
strays onto the pads this time, but it only costs a leg bye as it squirts out to square leg off the pad
tossed up above the eyeline, and pushed out to deep extra cover for one
nudged out square of the wicket for one
another short ball, this time Taylor hops across and short-arm pulls it towards backward square leg
again Albie bowls it far outside off, probably a wide if that was left alone, Taylor slaps it towards point
there's the Taylor swipe to midwicket, takes it from outside off and powers it for four
turned off the hips with a closed face
full and just outside off, Taylor can't get bat on that
full toss, but Taylor can't cash in. Midwicket picks up a scything pull
Morne sees Taylor moving across the stumps and fires it wide, that would have been a Test match wide, Morkel complains to the umpire saying Taylor had walked across the stumps
keeps it full and wide, once more Taylor can't get bat on it, two dots from Morkel
good-length inswinger, worked square with a clip off the toes

Taylor finds the gap, there's was hardly any space between cover point and backward point, but Taylor sends that wide full toss to the point boundary, Morne can't believe it, the New Zealand dressing room are on their feet cheering that vital boundary, Morne finishes with 50

Steyn has done it! what a champion, this is sensational stuff, the final ball is well outside off, pitched up, Taylor can only bunt it back towards Steyn, who coolly collects it and runs towards the non-striker's end to complete the run-out, after that he is not cool any more, sprinting around in celebration before being surrounded by his team-mates, five dot balls in the final over, that is incredible stuff,wow, I could use a breather
wild down the leg-side

the umpire took an age, but that was plumb! Pitched on middle, nipped back off the seam. Taylor was shuffling across and Gary Baxter was searching for a reason not to give it out. He couldn't find one
outside off, left alone
bowled him! Great delivery to remove Taylor, nipping back in from outside off to clean up the batsman whose middle stump rocks back and he's on his way
good reply from Wright, hustling it past the outside edge
hey now, shot and a half, Taylor tees off with a straight drive that travels flat and barely got up off the ground at all. Coo-ee, that was a good hit, very golf-like
slower delivery in line with middle and off, defended on the front foot
plenty of width outside off, draws Taylor into the shot and it goes past the outside edge
pushed out on the front foot
nips back in off the seam and Taylor looks to cut it out to point but doesn't quite get hold of it
defended on the front foot
pure timing and that is boomed off the front foot through the covers. Extraordinary power and timing combination
more respect for Andrson this time, a defence right back down the line in front of off
six this time! Down on one knee and gives it the kneel-and-deliver treatment launched over deep backward square leg. It wasn't too bad a ball, either
picked up off the toes and driven out in front of midwicket, well timed up and over
Broad's running in as if his life depending on it, and it's worked out to the covers
full delivery, driven on the up to mid off now
a crashing drive through the covers hit hard, Taylor really launching himself on his front foot and into the shot
overpitched a touch in line with off, a forceful drive out to mid-on but it's snapped up easily
defended hard down the track on the front foot
outside off and driven hard off the back foot but straight to the man at cover
full toss well outside off, scythed past point for four by Taylor, the game slipping away from SA
pitched up and that is sent away towards deep backward point for two more
another dot ball, Taylor again can't get bat on ball to a quick one outside off, no footwork at all as Taylor fishes at that one, what a bowler Steyn is!
average cricket all round there. A wild full toss, an ugly edged smear, and a loss of concentration from Collingwood at slip who fumbles his take
length ball spinning away, eased towards cover for a single
fires it in a quick one down the leg side
shot! powerfully struck by Taylor, a length ball outside off is clobbered over long-on, Steyn leaps acrobatically, but can't prevent the six
Twnety20 captured in two balls, the first was a powerful hit over long-on, this one a top-edge over the keeper for six more, Morkel won't want to take a look at his figures

three sixes in a  row! Taylor moves across and slams this behind square leg for another biggie, can't believe this was the bowler who was terrifying Australia with short-pitch stuff in the recent Tests
length ball down the leg side, clipped behind square leg for two more, surely Steyn should have bowled this one
full toss on the pads, tapped to midwicket for a single
googly, tapped towards midwicket, played gently enough to have time to take two
a ripping googly from Tahir, who thought he had Taylor bowled, he was halfway through his celebrations after that snuck through between bat and pad, over the stumps though
patted towards cover for a single
low full from Steyn, on off stump, tucked to the leg side for a single
short and wide, Taylor steers it towards deep backward point for a single
pushed to cover, another single to the cause
short of length ball on off stump, 138kph, defended towards point
short ball just outside off, not enough room to get power behind the cut which Taylor attempts
short of length ball from round the wicket, guided towards point

nearly a run-out, Taylor drives his first ball towards the bowler, who moves quickly across to his right to field, Ryder was way outside the crease and a direct hit from Botha would have ended his stay
Taylor shuffles across and paddles it towards fine leg for two more
too wide from Duminy, Taylor has galloped to 47 off 23 with that four past backward point, a controlled shot this one, nicely done
full ball on the pads, guided down to fine leg

Tsostsobe starts with a short of length ball, slapped towards Morne Morkel at cover, he tries to get the non-striker run-out, he misses, there's no one to back up, an overthrow, would have been a dot ball otherwise
just outside off, dropped in front of point for the single that brings up Taylor's 50, just 26 balls too, he's having a great season
full and wide, slapped towards sweeper cover for a single, the batsmen might regret not letting that go, the umpire would have deemed it a wide
almost carried back to Tahir, that would have totally changed the game, a checked drive from Taylor lands short of Tahir
full ball on the pads, Taylor can't get bat on it, and that ends a superb over from Tahir, just two off it, an over that has dragged SA back in the game?
short of length ball curling away, 143kph, Taylor swishes at it and misses
exaggerated forward defensive
that's travelled many a mile! Right in the slot for Taylor, who swings effortlessly over cow corner and all the way into the stands
length ball on the pads, eased towards long-on
rocks back and fillets the gap at third man, beautifully cocked wrists imparting supreme power and placement
better finish, zipping through this time as Taylor can't line up the extra pace
gets front and across, turns it wide of midwicket for a quick single, a direct hit at the bowler's end would have made things interesting
waits in the crease and taps one outside off on the head down to third man, Devcich calls through an initially hesitant Taylor and Devcich's dive beats the good throw to the striker's stumps
too short and Taylor gets underneath it and the balls flies straight over midwicket and a great one handed grab in the fourth row in the second tier of the stands
played off one knee and he drags it through midwicket and the ball races away for four
thick edged to third man on the circle's edge
leading edge down to long-off as he looks to work it towards wide mid-on
flicked through the leg-side and picked up by the fielder at deep midwicket
punched firmly to long-off
defended back to the bowler
pushed to long-on as Razzak is finally introduced
straight drive picked up at long-off
quicker ball turned away to the gap at midwicket
worked off the pads to leg
defended back to the bowler but a clumsy effort to stop by Benn and he kicks the ball away from him
prodded away past a diving point and good running between the wickets for two
worked to deep midwicket as the bowling changes works in terms of both penetration and economy for the home side
drove away to point
defends one which sharply turns back into off

FOUR IN FOUR! Is this the 2007 World Cup all over again?! Ross Taylor this time, and he gets the same treament - an unplayable yorker. He looked more still than de Grandhomme at the crease but it didn't matter. This one is headed right for the foot, it swings late from around leg to middle stump and it sneaks under Taylor's bat to get him plumb
pushes through a flat one on leg as Taylor shuffles across and flicks it to the fielder on the 45
another one flicks the pad going down leg and it skids past Mushfiqur's gloves too
down leg and he swipes a sweep away backward of square as Mahmudullah pays for going around the wicket to the right-hander
outside edge runs towards fine leg
drop and run to midwicket and Taylor makes his ground in time
firmly punched down to long-off
attempts a cut towards point but hit in to ground from Taylor
down leg and beats the slog sweep and the keeper
well-timed cut but a good stop in the field at point
good length outside off stump and a swing and a miss
blocked in to the ground
dropped in to the gap at midwicket
eased past the infield into the covers and they rush back for a second
Taylor defends his first delivery with a leading edge back down the track
well bowled by Patel, fired in full outside off, gets squeezed off an edge past the keeper but Wright chases it down even with the short boundary
resume short of a length and beats the cut shot on the top edge with his extra pace
full on middle, driven down the ground...not quite the flow of boundaries we saw in England's innings
chopped to backward point where Morgan pulls off another good piece of work to keep it as a precious dot ball
finds the fielder! That's another crucial blow. Aiming one of his trademark midwicket blows off the front foot but doesn't get the distance. Came from low down on the bat. England safe in the field.
flatter, spinning in a touch from outside off, tapped respectfully back down the track
length, on the stumps, worked back past Wright, who goes haring after it
worked into the leg side from in front of the stumps
shorter as carved on the up through backward point as Taylor comes dancing out
dug in, wide of the stumps and slashed high, off the edge but short of third man

scooped high out towards the deep midwicket rope but that won't get there, even with the short boundary, Bairstow takes the catch! Wright has his second wicket, it was a length ball on the stumps, an ugly smear across the line by Taylor, who's still searching for form after his NZ return
quite flat from Root, on off stump, driven down the off side and he gets across
indisciplined bowling outside off-stump
that's more like the Ross Taylor the world stage knows, goes for the slog sweep and comfortably clears deep midwicket
Taylor is happy to rotate the strike as he dabs into the covers

gone! Tries to repeat the short and picks out deep midwicket where Bairstow is lurking again. Superb bowling from Root, he held this one back, it was about 15ks slower, and he did Taylor in the flight. Impressive nerve
more towards the stumps this time and flicked to leg for one
low full toss, Taylor goes across a bit and flicks it away with his wrists to use the pace of the ball and place it right in between long on and deep midwicket. That's another 17 from the over!
too full outside off and driven straight to cover but there's a fumble and they scamper across for one
full around off, driven softly and straight to cover

swipes completely across the line, he's been given lbw, Taylor reviews! The ball turned after pitching for sure and struck him right in front of the stumps. The question is if it pitched in line because there's no edge. Here's ball-tracking: pitches in line, hitting in line and rattling middle stump
full again and a leading edge along the ground back to the bowler
flatter and fuller ball hacked away to short fine leg
driven in to the ground
down the leg-side
fuller ball chipped away to long-on
too short and pulled away through square leg but a great stop on the boundary
blocked away to the covers and they run one
fuller ball dug off the toes and a misfield at cover
arm ball bouncing up outside off and play and a miss with the cut shot

full toss, top edge, skier, and Taylor just escapes. Taylor didn't quite hammer the ball there, it went really high on the leg side towards square and Shanaka had a tough job - to run backwards and dive. He did all that but couldn't make it
worked into midwicket off the back foot...the second run is made very safe by an awful throw
full ball again and turns the ball away through square leg and it scampers away for four more
shuffles across to a length ball on middle and leg and helps it on its way with a flick past fine leg on the circle's edge
outside off, and a thumping cut bobbles down into the crease, as Mustard rushes up to field
gave him a bit of a charge but that wasn't at the right length, defended to extra cover
full toss, he's hit this for four but that isn't enough. Pakistan win by two runs but New Zealand have given them a bigger fight than Australia did.
full toss, low full toss, which he swings into the gap at deep midwicket to pinch two. That means New Zealand need a six off the final delivery to force a tie and Super Over.
excellent yorker, right into the blockhole, Taylor can only squeeze this as far as the midwicket fielder.
drills this full delivery to mid-off, only a single.
yorker-length, squeezed to mid-off. 17 off seven now.
another muscular hit into the leg side, the throw from deep midwicket is week and Seifert makes it back. They would've gone for the second anyway.
mowed into the gap at deep midwicket, they'll scamper a second. He picked the slower ball and belted it away. Excellent work in the deep too

top-edges this wide of the keeper, crucial crucial boundary it could be. Not a bad delivery, beat him nearly with a slower bouncer, Taylor swung hard to get some bat. Raced away. Is there life in the game still?
big inside edge as he attempts a mow over the leg side, they scamper a run off a deflection towards point.

pulled away and this is quite ferociously done as well, no chance for deep midwicket for Taylor picked the bones out of it. This will ease some pressure. The drought has been broken, Ross's favourite area

makes room and belts this full toss into the gap at sweeper cover. This was a slowish throw to Shaheen who breaks the stumps, but I suspect the non-striker was comfortably in. Yes, very easy. No issues there.
slips this full delivery way down leg, the captain was ready with a full length dive to his left to stop this.
he's swung this across the line, but doesn't get hold. One bounce to deep square
mistimes a slog to mid-off, takes on the fielder for a single but had given up. A direct hit and Taylor would've been involved in a second run out.
drills this length ball to mid-off for a quick single.

cleverly done, was looking to slog across the line but ended up opening the bat face to glide this short ball over point in the end. Farhan comes around from square third man to put in a slide to stop that to save two runs. Nicely done in the end.
backs away and squeezes this drive into the gap at point, the fielder got some hand on that to take the pace off.
swats this length delivery back past the bowler, long-on hares in to keep it down to a single.
mistimes a cut but gets it into the gap at point. Didn't have too much room to play it
chipped into the gap, towards mid-on for a single.
gentle dab behind the wicket for a quick single.
works this length delivery down to long-on
skiddy length ball on the stumps, tucked towards deep square. The boundary rider had to come in a long way, mind you, it's a huge boundary that side. Excellent from Taylor.
taking on Shadab again as he drops this into the off side, this time they complete the single.

a direct hit from point and CDG is gone. Shadab Khan, you beauty! One stump to aim at and boom! There was never a run, this was the pressure of a string of dots speaking. Taylor looked to dab it for a quick single but the run was never on. Super pick up, super release and Shadab hit bulls eye. Pakistan nearly have this in the bag.

lifter from round the stumps, Taylor hit on the thigh pad as he looks to fend this. The non-striker tried to pinch a bye and was halfway down when he was sent back. Shaheen hared across to pick up the ball, but didn't throw at the bowler's end.
leading edge that rolls down to long-off.
massive! That's the biggest six of the night by a distance, and sails into the advertising hoardings below the top tier of the grandstand. Lovely strike
that's the way to respond. A slower ball, wider as well, Taylor is looking to hit leg-side again, but instead scoops a simple chance to Ian Bell, running back in the covers
pitched up and Ross Taylor defends it high off the bat to square leg

communication break down in the middle as Taylor defends to point. Ryder comes half way up the track to be sent back by Taylor. The fielder takes a shy and he would have been miles out with the direct hit
moves around again and tries to play a bent knee slog sweep, mistimed out to deep midwicket
beaten outside off by a wide ball trying to cut, the keeper can't collect cleanly either
nips back in and inside edged into his pad flap; Mushfiqur pulls it out of the flap. The ball is deemed dead once it lodges in the batsman's equipment
cut to third man
worked down to fine leg in the deep
Taylor waits deep in his crease for Al-Amin, replacing Mashrafe, and slugs it over the bowler's head to the fence
top edges a cross batted slog down to third man
aggressive full-toss above the waist of Taylor and signalled as a no-ball
through the pull early as a slower ball hits the toe of the bat and rolls into the third man area
full toss outside off which Taylor top edges high in the air as he tries to slog, Naeem settles under it at cover
cut away but picked up on the cover boundary
flicks it away through square leg again
full ball swinging away from off-stump and an uncomfortable block out to point
he starts to come down the track which puts Baker of and he bowls wide of off-stump
full toss drove to extra cover
makes solid contact and the ball is lifted high over midwicket and in to the middle of the crowd.
cuts the ball looking to take off stump. Top work from Babar at point, covering ground to his left and stopping the single. The captain will be pleased.
shimmies down to drive the shortish delivery on the up to cover. Shadab is prowling there, moving quickly to his right
moves well across and nudges it wide of Jayasuriya at short fine, he dives and keeps them to just a single

another trip down the pitch, and this time Imad trumps Taylor by making the ball drift into the pads. The batsman tries another flick but makes no contact with the bat. Williamson pulls him through for the leg bye
that went on straight, got across and defended it towards extra cover
steps out, but he still can't get under the ball and so Taylor has to settle for a flick, all along the ground, through midwicket. Good work from Imad, adjusting the length
plays it with soft hands in front of point for a quick single
picks the gap in front of point as he lunges forward, reaching out to a wide delivery outside off
targeting middle, defended back to the bowler
pushed towards backward point for a single
nudges it in front of extra cover to steal one more
pushed back to the bowler. From 50 for 0 in the Powerplay, NZ slump to 68 for 3 in 10
swing and a miss from Taylor which drops down of his pads
that's good work. He delays the cut shot just that little extra second so he can beat point

Taylor takes a step down the track and makes good contact to lift the ball flat through square leg and it looks like six all the way but Xavier Marshall pulls off an absolute blinder of a catch right on the rope to the amazement of the crowd and Ross Taylor. Stunning!
full and wide, just inside the tramline, as Taylor shuffles across, swishes, and collects fresh air
tossed up on the stumps, nudged short on the leg side
another single, down to long-off, to end the over, sensible stuff from New Zealand, with plenty of batting to come they have this match under control
driven firmly down the ground towards long-on

a brilliant stop at deep backward square leg, it was fuller on the pads, Taylor sweeps it away, was in the air, the fielder came in for the catch but it landed short, he puts his body behind, gets his hand to it to make a stop
fuller on the pads this time, was looking to work it towards long-on along the ground, misses and gets hit on the pads
fuller on the stumps and Taylor goes aerial, clears his front leg and clears the long-on boundary
full on legstump, turned to fine leg for a single
dug out towards midwicket for a single
a touch fuller around off, pushes it towards covers
length ball, nipping in after landing to hit the batsman high on the thigh, a leg-bye towards backward point
fuller on the stumps, turned away towards long-on, with the spin
length on the pads, flicked towards midwicket, they were a looking for a second but realised in time there was none
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards cover-point
short of length once again, but down the leg side as well, turns it towards short fine leg
short of length and pulled away towards deep midwicket, the fielder dives in front in an attempt to catch, well short
length ball on middle and leg, defends it on the leg side, Santner was looking for a single but Taylor sends him back
that's drilled down the ground, fuller and wider outside off, Taylor clears his front leg and smashes it past the non-striker
short of length and angling in at the batman, Taylor was moving towards the leg side, looks to hit it through covers, gets beaten
Taylor was looking to give himself some room there but the bowler follows him, pushed on the leg side for one in the end
length outside off, doesn't get the timing right on the pull, drags it towards short midwicket
another short one, Taylor gets on the top of it and pulls it down, more like a tennis forehand, in front of square
back of length on the stumps, pulled towards deep square leg
length around off, taps it towards short midwicket for one more
a low full toss on the stumps, pushed towards long-on
short again, but at 141kph, Taylor once again fails to get bat on that attempted cut
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but gets beaten by the extra bounce
fuller around off, driven back past the bowler but mid-off cuts it off
length around middle this time, worked towards square leg for one
good ball to start, back of a length on leg, tapped back to the bowler
fuller on middle and leg, Taylor moves across, takes it on the full and scoops it over short fine leg
Taylor's bowled, he had walked across the stumps giving Zaheer a sight of the legstump, the bowler targets it and hits the base of legstump
beautiful straight drive from Taylor, similar delivery to the previous one, Taylor doesn't go inside out, he aims straight, drills it past the bowler
opens the face and steers it behind point, a tight single is taken
full ball outside off, hit straight to straight extra cover
Taylor pushes a middle stump ball towards mid-on for an easy single
Taylor misses the slog sweep to a delivery well outside off
worked away from outside off towards square leg for one
swipes from outside off, misses by a long way, and is lucky that it misses the off stump
another yorker - length is right, but it is down the leg side
back of a length, straightening outside off, edged, and Sanga takes it one-handed, and immediately says it is not a catch, and has come to him on a half-volley
back of a length, around off, pushed back to the bowler
another yorker, middle and off, dug out back to the bowler
yorker outside off, hit to mid-off
Taylor plays across the line, is beaten, but the ball is headed down the leg side. The real opportunity, though, is at the other end where Nicol is backing up too far, but Malinga misses the stumps

slower ball again, drops and runs, Malinga is quick at mid-on, swoops on it, and flicks it onto the stumps, Jonty Rhodes-style. The third umpire finally gets the correct angle after various replays from unhelpful angles, and it shows he is in by a frame
falls just short of the diving short third man, was a short of length outside off, Taylor goes for a cut but the extra bounce induces an outside edge
nice juicy full toss on the hips, and glanced away for four runs, fine of fine leg
quick legbreak from Mendis, close to offstump, Taylor manages to flash that behind backward point
fullish ball on off stump, Taylor pushes it back to the bowler
another legbreak, Taylor waits on the backfoot and drives it towards extra cover
Bandara starts his new spell, with a ball fired into legstump, defended towards the off side
very full delivery, Taylor dries that to long-on to take an easy single
swinging in, full on middle, pushed down to long-on for a single
in the slot for Taylor, it's pitched up and it's absolutely creamed through extra cover for four more
low full toss, pushed towards midwicket who's a little deep and they come back for the second
full toss and Taylor's eyes light up, but he can't get it away, just a single to deep square leg
good stuff, almost in the blockhole outside off, can only strike it to long-off, Taylor attempts an impossible second but Coventry returns a good throw and Mutizwa does the rest
full and on leg stump, Taylor skips outside leg, and muscles it towards wide long-off
a wild swing from Taylor, was a length ball outside off and he was looking to hoick it towards midwicket, a bug appeal for caught behind, the umpire takes his time, but looks like Taylor walked there
length outside off, opens the face of the bat for a single to short third man
comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
back of length around off, Taylor was looking to work it on the leg side, almost another leading edge, down the wicket and well short of the bowler though
wants another big hit, but gets it on the bottom of the bat and the ball dribbles back to the bowler
slower one, short of length on middle and leg, worked behind square leg

Jayasuriya has struck, this is a big blow, New Zealand lose Taylor's big hitting, he was looking to slog it to midwicket, it was a straight delivery, Taylor misses and is hit in front of middle and off, the umpire has his finger up instantly
crunches this drive into the gap at sweeper cover
that's a solid shot, full and wide outside off and he reaches out and spanks it past backward point
full ball on the pads, Taylor misses the glance but gets hit on the pad for a leg bye behind square

that's a classic delivery and Irfan has done it for his captain, he bowls a searing inswinging yorker angling in on the off stump, Taylor makes a bit of room to forces it through the off side but the speed and movement beats him and clips the off stump
Taylor tries to work the ball through the leg side but gets a little leading edge
Taylor moves across and nudges the ball towards long-on for a single
cut off the back foot towards point
Mortaza dives to his right at short third man and cuts off Taylor's cut off the back foot
Taylor has width and he cuts hard, but can't beat the fielder at point
Taylor swings across the line and hits the ball towards deep square leg. Shakib's had a shocker today
the intention was right but the bouncer was just a little too high for Taylor, it's signalled a wide
bowls a superb inswinging yorker, he manages to dig it out on the full to long-off
squeezes this behind point as they scamper a run
mows it to midwicket and there's a fumble
Zaheer comes over the wicket and jams it on the blockhole outside leg, he makes room and digs it out to deep square-leg
you cannot bowl full tosses to Taylor, he moves towards the off side and lofts it into the gap at cow corner, he'll hit those balls for four in his sleep
and you can't allow Taylor to hit across the line either, Shakib gets smashed to the square leg boundary
Taylor misses the slog-sweep and gets hit on the pad, Shakib finishes a horrendous spell, 4-0-40-0 from Bangladesh's key player
jams out a yorker to mid-on
It's a mishit over mid-on but it's safe from Irfan's grasp, too much to expect anyone to take that
nudged from his crease towards mid-on for a single, the bowler runs after the ball
Taylor gives the strike back by driving past the bowler for a single
sweeps it to deep square-leg
goes for a wild slog and he clears midwicket but not timed well enough
gets forward and works it wide of point
angles it on  the pads and he nudges it to fine leg
fires it on the blockhole, he digs it out and it's a dot ball, superb delivery
short, outside off, punched to sweeper-cover - doesn't have the pace on it to cut it
Taylor goes for the slog sweep, doesn't get hold of it, and it flies towards long-on, lands well short of the fielder
gets walloped for six first ball! Too short, Taylor picks his spot, walks across and powers the pull that sails flat over deep square
a wild swat from Taylor this time, not where he intended it to go but it races away to the square leg boundary
Massive! another poor ball from Yusuf, full toss at a nice, hittable height, Taylor murders that one, swung over midwicket
back of length, in the rib cage this time, dabs it down for a quick single
back of length outside off, stays along the line of the ball and defends with an angled bat
sixes are easy at this ground, Yusuf slides it down leg, Taylor helps it along over the fine-leg boundary
swung towards extra cover, along the ground this time
length ball around middle, looked like this too came slower off the wicket, defended from the back foot, was bowled at 131 kph
back of length outside off, drops it on the off side and hares to the other end
Shot! slower ball from Irfan, wide outside off, Taylor walks into it and carves that over extra cover for a huge six
Taylor was looking to dispatch that to cow corner, but doesn't get bat on ball
defended towards cover, first dot ball of the over, only five runs off it
length ball this time, around off and middle, defended with a straight bat

slower, full ball from Ishant, squeezed towards Suresh Raina at point, there was a chance of a run-out as Taylor had charged down the ground though McCullum wasn't interested, Raina's throw is wide though
squeezed towards point this time, Taylor was charging back for the second, Guptill yells 'Nooooo', that would have been suicide if they went for the second
steered wide of the cover fielder this time for a single
fuller on the pads, flicked towards deep square leg
overpitched on middle and leg, dug out to short midwicket for a single
driven towards mid-on for a single
length ball, on middle and leg, worked in front of square to get off the mark. 2 for 18 for Malinga in two overs, and looks like he's done with his spell

baseball strike! Too short, spongy bounce as he takes pace off, but Taylor lines him up and flat-bats it to the deep midwicket boundary. Superb total, but it will take some chasing even if on a smallish ground. Be back for the chase shortly.
excellent first over from Harbhajan, only two runs from it, finishes off by holding the length a bit, on middle and leg, Taylor taps it back to the bowler off the backfoot
length ball on off, turned to midwicket, straight to the fielder, no run
goes for an almighty heave, misses and is hit on the pads outside legstump, the ball rolls towards square leg
inside egded towards backward square leg for a single
pulled but not in control, down to deep midwicket
steps out to blast this through cover, misses out on a juicy full toss
quick carrom ball from Mendis, a bit short, Taylor was foxed by that one, he can only push it back to the bowler
looks to belt this over cover, but is deceived by the slower one as he gets a thin nick, doesn't carry to MS Dhoni
another leading edge, length around middle and leg, Taylor was looking to turn it on the leg side, luckily it falls just short of the diving point fielder
full and outside off, Taylor gets forward and taps it towards cover
floater outside off, is beaten on the cut shot, goes under his bat
pushed for four! Lovely timing towards extra cover, and sweeper-cover, Mendis dives too early on it
slashes hard at a wide delivery, and at Shoaib's pace, it carries over a diving third man all the way for a six, would you believe it?
Taylor leans into the drive, and gets it right out of the middle of the bat, the ball bounces over extra cover, and long off ends up escorting it past the ropes
leaves this one outside off stump alone
gets forward and opens the blade to steer a length ball past backward point
fires it down the leg side, and Umar had no chance to collect that one
superb shot, considering the slow and pitch, driven on the up, through extra cover, gets a rare boundary
good yorker, no room either, played back to the bowler
slower ball, worked away towards midwicket for one
fuller, outside off, pushed to short cover
a bit of width from Mendis this time, the batsman looks to cut, a thick bottom edge sends the ball back onto the pitch
very full on offstump, the batsman can only push it back to the bowler
again Taylor moves across the stump and looks to heave it to midwicket, bottom edge towards short fine leg
legbreak, stays low again, gets an outside edge towards short third man
gets it down to long on this time for a single
another shooter, Taylor does well to cover the line of it, and also manages to get a single to cover
shovelled towards long-on, Oram was haring back for a tight second, the throw wasn't very good so Oram is safe
another yorker, Taylor manages to dig it out towards point for a single, can't do more than that with a pinpoint yorker
full, fast, inswinging yorker, Taylor blocks it with the full face of the bat, 138kmh that one
lovely shot from Taylor for just a single, drives a length ball towards sweeper cover
even better this time, the heave over midwicket continues to fetch Taylor plenty of runs, it smashes into one of the pillars in the stands behind the midwicket boundary
Taylor reverts to his favourite slog-sweep, picks the gap between midwicket and long-on, brings up the hundred with that stroke
Taylor tries to shows us he can reverse-sweep as well, but top -edges and it lobs just over Sangakkara
the Taylor slog sweeps arrives finally, gets one in the slot, he goes down on a knee and swings it over deep midwicket, good clean hit
another one is fired flat and quick down the leg side, poor bowling this
worked away square on the leg side
gets another one in the slot, this one is a touch fuller, and Tayor takes a step down the track and lifts it over wide long on, New Zealand are almost home
doosra again, closed the face on that one expecting it to turn in, missed, beaten rather
went on straight this time, knocked in front of square leg for a single
Taylor mows it towards midwicket, doesn't strike it very well, and it bounces a couple of times before reaching deep square leg
shortish outside off, cuts it hard down to point
tucks him up for room again, and runs past the non-striker to field the ball as it is punched down the track
better line from Umar, length ball on the stump, but New Zealand are well in control, and a push wide of mid on brings another single
pushed into the on side with soft hands, and he comes back for a couple

yorker outside off, and Taylor has run himself out. He knows the boundaries aren't coming and he takes the risky second, having dug this straight to third man. Kulasekara's throw is accurate, and he is caught way short
leans forward to defend to the off side
gets forward to push it to left of backward point where Dilshan makes a diving stop
Four overthrows! It was punched to point where Dilshan fields and fires the throw at the non-striker's end. The throw misses the stumps and Malinga fails to back-up cleanly
leans forward to squeeze it to the off side

Dead duck! Right in front! As Fred Trueman would have said, "what is going off out there?! " It was full and it shaped in late. Taylor had pressed the front leg too far across and had to try playing around the front pad. Too late. The ball thuds into the pad. GOne!
143 kph length delivery outside the off stump, comes in a tad after pitching, Taylor wisely leaves it alone, this is still one of the best sights in cricket, watching Shoaib steaming in
taps this one on off stump towards extra cover, and gets off the mark with a single
played off the back foot towards extra cover
steers a length delivery going across him down to squarish third man
floats one up on the stumps, he comes forward and gets an inside edge square on the leg side
on the money, and played back to the bowler
flat on the stumps, played out to midwicket
looks to break free, but cannot beat the offside field
gets an inside edge wide of midwicket as he gets forward and looks to drive past cover
worked towards square leg
drives past point on one knee and the fielder at sweeper cover runs across but they have enough time to take two
plays it in front of cover for another single
gets one to straighten on leg stump, and he works it to short fine for a single
tosses one up, and Taylor works it on the bounce to midwicket, there were shouts of 'catch it' but he was safe
leaves this flighted delivery outside off stump alone
hit away to sweeper cover for a single
gets across and gets into a tangle as this ball skids on to him and hits him high on the oads
again he gets across and looks to work it past midwicket, but Afridi there is alert and Taylor has to hurry back in the end as the throw is fired in
finds Afridi in the way yet again, and is sent back by Franklin
three in three, he just cannot get it past Afridi at midwicket
misses out on a wide delivery, cuts fiercely but straight to backward point
this time he manages to beat the field, it was short, a long hop really, and he pulled it past midwicket and beat the two men in the deep as well
that will release the pressure, he gets on his knee and sweeps him on the up down to deep square leg
pitched up on the off, pushed down past midwicket for a single
shortish on the off, slower one, drops it in front of cover for a single
full again, the batsman makes room and digs the ball out towards sweeper cover
overpitched on midde and leg, clipped towards wide long-on for a couple
tossed up from Bandara, ends up as a full toss on offstump, Taylor hits it form;ly back to the bowler
pitched up on the legstump, driven inside out towards sweeper cover
Taylor brings out his favourite slog-sweep, connects nicely with the ball and gets it wide of the square leg fielder to get another boundary
decides to sweep this one, gets it away to deep backward square leg
wrong 'un from Mendis, batsman is fooled by that one and is hit on the pads, just outside off though
slightly fuller, and shifts his line towards offstump, pushed towards mid-off for a single
legcutter this time, pushed towards long-off for a single
and again, this time he gets down the track and crunches it to the right of cover for another boundary, ten runs off the over
this time he gives some width, and Taylor pounces on it, gets up on his toes and flashes it past backward point, a lot of power behind that shot
short of a length, pushed towards cover, Kapugedera fields and shies at the stumps, Taylor would have just made his ground
he nearly strikes first ball, a harmlessly length ball on legstump, Taylor goes for the sweep, top edges it but lands safely away from Mendis at short fine leg
back of a length, tight around off, flashes it uppishly towards backward point, lands only a few yards short of Tillakaratne Dilshan there, who gets his fingers on it but can't stop it
punched to cover, there was no run available, but Sri Lanka help Taylor get off the mark with an overthrow
length ball, heading towards middle, Taylor moves across and clips it towards midwicket
starts off with a carrom ball, stays low outside off, pushed to cover
hit back at the bowler, Perera misfields, lets them go through for a single
full outside off, pushed to long-on for one
back of a length, pushed down the ground, and Kapugedera from straight extra cover dives full length to stop the single
he slugs this one down to long-on, Broom sprints back for the second

angling across Taylor, well outside off stump, Taylor was looking to flash itthr4ough the cover, gets a top edge towards third man, Kulasekara was charging in from the boundary but it lands short of him
great shot from Taylor, length ball outside off, Taylor hammers it over point for a boundary
this was a lot fuller, Taylor goes for the same shot but gets it on the toe end of the bat, Kulasekara is waiting at the third man boundary for that one, and he gobbles it up
solid front foot defence from Taylor
into the pads, worked away for one
shooter this time, cuts this short delivery inches off the ground, and comes back for two after hitting it square enough of third man to come back for two
short and wide, clubbed towards extra cover, a bit of an underedge on that shot from Taylor
short and wide, struck hard but straight to deep cover for a single
another slog sweep from Taylor, shuffles across and gets it behind deep square leg
Taylor plays it with soft hands towards long-on, Jacob Oram sprints back for the second
shortish on the off, gets on the back foot and defends it to extra cover, good over thus far
slower one on the off, knocks it down in front of cover for another single
superb yorker from Gul, on middle and he does well to dig it out, past midwicket, an attempt at a direct hit at the non-striker's end, was out if that had hit
slower one bowled full on middle, worked away towards midwicket for a quick single, Shehzad concedes an overthrow as he misses the stumps
back of a length on middle, gets back and knocks it down wide of midwicket for a single
loops it full on middle and leg, tries to clip that over midwicket, can't connect, is struck on the pads
repeats the shot and connects and connects well, picks it up from middle and leg and sends it over wide long-on
what a shot, short ball outside off, fetches it from there and swats it over midwicket, wide of long-on for a boundary
short and pulled away again but straight to deep midwicket this time, just the single
full outside off, reached for it, was a touch too wide, sliced it to third man for a single
full on the off, played it in front of point for a quick single
is dispatched first up, drops it short on middle and gets the treatment, pulled away over deep midwicket for a powerful six
on the pads, turned away towards fine leg, deep square has to  runs across to cut that one off
fires it short outside off, makes room to cart it over the bowler's head, misses
defended by Taylor this time
length ball homing in on offstump, defended towards extra cover, 'No,' is the loud call from Taylor

the bad old New Zealand is back, Taylor is the man who is gone, Razzaq gets the breakthrough with a ball short of length that strikes Taylor just above the knee roll in front of off, massive appeal and the umpire lifts the finger, New Zealand struggling to keep their number of runs ahead of the number of wickets
Taylor shuffles across even before Jayasuriya bowls, a full ball is drilled towards long-on
almost yorker length on middle stump, dug out back towards the bowler, superb delivery to end a great spell from Bandara, only 25 runs off it
a bit of width, Taylor tries to dab it but can't beat short third man
googly, plays it inside out towards long-off for another single
big legspinner from Mendis, pitching on offstump, Taylor opts against playing a stroke
a bit of width for Taylor, who chops it towards point
Mendis starts with a legbreak, pushed towards cover for a single
driven down to long-off this time, Taylor walks the single
clipped wide of midwicket this time, the fielder has to run across to his left to pick that up, enough time to get a couple
Bandara pitches well outside leg, and can't get it to turn enough, that's a wide
long hop and he'll be disappointed he missed out there, pulls it straight to deep square leg
Harbhajan fires that quick and the batsman's beaten on the pull as he seizes on the shot a little too early
the doosra nearly squares him up as the ball clips his thigh and rolls to the off side
short and pitching outside off, he nudges it towards point
good line and length, he works it away comfortably though onto the leg side
and he's gone right through Taylor, clattering the stumps with a full and straight delivery, he's been struggling to time the ball with the hamstring and swings and misses
big heave across the line but no connection with bat
lovely bowling from Steyn, just persists with that yorker length just outside off stump and it draws an inside edge from Taylor, and they cross for a single
good bowling, lovely yorker on middle and off and somehow Taylor manages to squeeze it off the edge of his bat and down to third man for a single
good stuff, straight outside off stump, Taylor chases and misses
slower ball, slides down Taylor's pads and he nudges a single
very full and straight, driven back and he stops with one hand then it spills out and the batsmen cross for a quick single

slow ball on the pads, Taylor turns it wide of square leg, runs one and turns for the second, Kallis swoops in and lets go of the ball in a hurry and its right over the stumps, Boucher collects and breaks them and after a referral its ruled in favor of Taylor, who hurried and stretched his bat out ... now it looks like he's pulled a hamstring
straighter ball, pitches middle and leg and Taylor drives it back
again it drifts down the pads so Taylor gets a single to the deep
well bowled, a good yorker that gets Taylor a single to mid-off
better line and length, worked away on the on side
full toss but Taylor cant dispatch it, instead picking out point
tossed up again and he pushes the ball away for one
slower and fuller and he drives of the toe end of the bat past cover
full and quick delivery which Taylor pushes back to the bowler
full again, aiming for the yorker, Taylor again clears his leg and heaves, looking midwicket but settling for an inside edge to fine leg
slower ball, nearly a yorker but a bit too full, Taylor clears his leg and goes for the big shot but mistimes it and Gibbs intercepts at short cover
now he errs with a drivable length outside off stump and in a flash Taylor latches on to it, driving on the rise through extra cover, the best way to deal with those
back of a length, Taylor gets up on the toes and punches to cover
flights it this time, and slows the pace and gets some good dip, Taylor squeezes it to backward point
good ball, fired in and Taylor jams it back to Botha
shorter ball spins down the pads and he works it to square leg
nudged off the pads towards mid-on, the fielder had to run in from the deep so there was time for the second, 24 runs off that over
hits a length and cuts back and Taylor gets in line to turn it fine
another full toss outside off, Nicol leans towards the off side and paddles towards fine leg
bad ball, full toss down leg stump and he puts it away with a pull well over square leg and it beats the man in the deep
Nicol moves towards the off to slog sweep but misses and is hit on the pad, that pitched outside leg stump
full and going wide down leg
that's landed right where Taylor wanted it, he drops to one knee and heaves it square ... all the way!
plays into the off side for a change, hitting it straight to cover
works this across the line towards deep midwicket
shortish on the off, gets across and drops it down back to the bowler
short of a good length outside off, cracks it wide of extra cover for a single to get off the mark
hurled it short on middle, played down gently from the crease behind square, ample time for them to run back for the second
stifled appeal, clips his pads outside the line of leg I would imagine, and rolls away
reads the googly as it's a touch short, works this down to deep square.
the doosra, pushes it down to mid-on
works this against the turn to long-on
eased back with the spin to the bowler.
that's the offbreak and Taylor leans across and nudges behind square
flat delivery on middle and off, played towards long on for a single
defended back to the bowler on the front foot
doesn't get it as Taylor turns that one square
Taylor pushes the ball off the front foot towards wide long on and has enough time to turn for the second
effortless! Flighted on the pads and he uses the bottom hand to good effect to send that rows over wide long-on, there was hardly a follow through on that shot
sweeps him forcefully to deep square leg
pushed away wide of point and rushes through for a quick single and they get another one on the overthrow
spun away sharply and had some extra bounce on it, leaving Taylor surprised and earning a dot ball
pushed off the front foot to extra cover and Gul fails to collect running forward, lets it through his fingers to allow them a single
hurled it quick and flat on the off and it's angling in, Taylor bends low and tries to execute his most favoured slog-sweep, misses and is caught plumb in front of middle and off
gets across to that tossed up delivery and works it behind square for a single
got him! Good line and length there, Taylor sends that one sailing towards deep midwicket. Tom Banton takes it low, down by his knees, but he takes it.
he's pulled that one away and they canter through for one
fuller delivery, whipped away on the on side.
worked to the leg side. It's cut off by the fielder, Morgan, diving to his right. Would have been pretty spectacular if he could have got a full hand on that one.
slow and tricky, he can't do much with that
short ball outside off stump, cut off the back foot past point
driven with the spin to long-off, sensible from Taylor
Taylor moves forward and towards the off side to work the ball through midwicket, they attempt a risky second
full and straight, played to the fielder at deep square leg, hit all along the ground
round the wicket, into the legs, nudged off the pads and finds enough angle to bring on the two
round the wicket once more, hits the splice hard from just back of a length
short outside off, cut away for a single
front-of-the-hand flipper/slider, does not bounce much, Taylor goes low with it and shovels it away to deep midwicket
closes the face on impact to tuck a leg glance to backward square, Curran cramping for room on the round-the-wicket angle
well bowled again, shaping into the off stump from round the wicket, nurdled off the legs, but Taylor has placed that well, with a lack of pace forcing a long chase in from the rope
biting legbreak, prodded to cover
closes the face, another single behind square on the leg side. Scurran is bowled out, and that's a handy spell... one damaging over aside
flogged into the covers, the throw could have been interesting, but it was off balance and they return safely for two
slog-swept, and brilliantly so! Fired down the leg side, at pace, but it needed a good contact to make the most of it. Taylor didn't miss out
better line from Rashid, faster and flatter but outside off and turning in. Drilled for the single to cover
biffed to the off side, not a lot of width
pushed through outside off, driven through the line to long-off
back of a length, another wrong'un, repelled on the back foot as Taylor shuffles across his stumps. Fine over
slower ball, outside off, dabbed to the off side
low full toss on the off, struck down the ground to long-off
That almost seals it, they haven't learnt from New Zealand's mistakes these Scot bowlers, full outside off, drags it and connects it powerfully to clear deep midwicket with ease
what a costly lapse, length ball on the off, Taylor stays his ground, gets under it and dispatches it over long-on for a big six
droppped by Smith, short and wide, went for the cut, got a thick edge that the keeper failed to latch onto, excellent over

appeal for a stumping, coming round the wicket, quick and wide outside off, goes for the cut as he steps out, misses, the keeper takes off the bails but has he dragged his foot back in? Yes, just in. Smith took it way to his right, and took some time to take off the bails
a swing and a miss, shortish outside off, has a massive heave at it, misses
was in the slot but he didn't strike it well enough, hit down to long-on, one more
pitched up, slightly full, on middle and leg, Taylor prods it back down the pitch
oversteps, its freehit time, short on middle, gets the top edge as he goes for the pull, lands safely wide of fine leg
length delivery on the stumps, worked through square leg with a turn of the wrists
bumper, well-directed around the line of off, Taylor can only drop it short on to the wicket and Broad fields
moves across and works a length ball behind square, it's into a gap and they come back for two

there's only one way you can get out off a freehit and that's by way of a run out, fullish outside off, tries to clear extra cover who runs back and spills it but returns an accurate throw to the keeper who takes off the bails to find McCullum well short as he attempts to go for the second, only to receive a delayed response from Taylor
slower ball, skids under the bat and past the off stump. England have bowled well today
a full toss and Taylor delicately paddles it past Ajantha Mendis at short fine leg, he's probably saving his big hits for the later overs
on a length and outside off, Taylor hoicks across the line and ends up skying it to the right of DK at long-on
short and outside off, Taylor swats it away like a fly down to long-on
too full and too much on leg stump, Taylor glances the ball off the pads with almost no backlift, using the pace to find the fine leg boundary

there's an awful mix-up and the fielding is poor too. Taylor played the ball straight to Mahela at midwicket and ran. Mahela threw the ball too high to Malinga, who failed to catch the ball to run out the batsman. Mahela should have gone for the direct hit, Malinga wasn't in the best position
the yorker outside off stump, Taylor jams his bat down on it and squeezes it to the third man boundary
straighter delivery, sits up and Taylor, trying to shuffle across and dab the ball to the on side, cannot time it and the ball drops near his feet
fuller length, off stumps or thereabouts, and Taylor plays it back to Parnell
sharp pace and movement back in after the ball pitches on a good length, Taylor is waiting on the back foot and gets surprised by the bite, taking the ball on the glove
lands just outside leg, Taylor gets up and tucks the ball to midwicket
another errant short-pitched ball, too wide down the leg stump
turns the face, keeps a little low that one, turned through square leg for one more
shuffles across, works this from off-stump line to deep square leg
gets across the line, and helps it into the on side from outside off
starts off with a bunt to midwicket for one
short of a length, slants in, Taylor gets cramped and punches to point
full and wide, Taylor reaches out for the ball, his fast hands come into play. Scythed flat and hard over point for six. Bam!
holds back the length, Taylor gets tall and forces it to cover-point
fuller in length, pitches outside off stump and shapes back in sharply, Taylor opts to shoulder arms and the ball cuts back close to the top of off stump
the slower ball but it is down leg side, too far away to for Taylor to connect with the slog sweep

bowled him with the slower ball! Taylor had finished swinging across the line by the time the ball reached him. He was on the front foot and played much too early, Kulasekara hit leg stump. That slower ball was out of the back of the hand
off-side wide
Khaleel gets under a skier at short fine leg. He bobbles but clings onto it. Bhuvneshwar hits a hard length and outside off, legcutter it is, Taylor top-edges in the air and falls
short, wide, flayed away to deep point
full-toss, angling into middle and leg, whipped away to deep square leg
DK drops another sitter at deep midwicket. He's furious with himself. Full-toss on middle, tugged away in the air, DK drops a regulation catch
yorker and outside off, jabbed back towards the bowler
Pandya goes too full and outside off, Taylor shuffles across off and hoicks it over the midwicket boundary
full and wide outside off, Taylor searches for a sweep, winds up dragging the ball away in front of square on the leg side
tossed up, into the toes, eludes a bottom-handed clip across the line
bottom-handed drill once more, down to long on
short ball strays down leg stump, Taylor ducks and wide is called
poor length, full on middle and leg, clips it into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket for a one-bounce four
driven straight to cover
worked down to long-on for an easy single
full on off stump and driven to deep point
back of a length and Taylor works it into the leg side and they take a sharp single
Taylor pushes to point and set off for the run, Guptill makes a late 'no' call and Clarke trhows at the strikers end but misses. Taylor was long gone!
148 kph, good length and Taylor goes back and works it to mid wicket for a single
149 kph, shorter from Johnson angled into Taylor's ribs and he works it fine off his glove for four. Haddin was close to catching that as he stuck out his left mit.
149 kph, good length from Johnson and Taylor hangs the bat out to dry. Almost looks as if he didn't pick that one up.
146 kph, full and wide and Taylor looks to play a square drive but misses
