gone this time! Taylor was looking for another maximum - both for the team and for his own half century - and this time he was looking to hit a fuller ball over long off. But he couldn't get the requisite elevation on the shot, and the long off fielder held a regulation chance.
short again, and slogged mightily over the midwicket boundary for a 79-metre six! All strength and timing in that shot
short and pulled out into the deep
ooh, not that time! That one's slipped out, hitting the bat above waist height, no-ball for the height.
flat-batted out into the covers, but straight to Swann. They steal a run all the same
short and pulled to leg, Collingwood - out of character - makes a complete hash of the stop though, running right over the ball and they collect an extra run
short and pulled from high on the bat forwrad of square for a couple to the sweeper on the leg side
smeared through the leg side. Length from Broad, and Taylor was waiting for it. Straight out to the fielder though
Taylor swings wildly to leg, but meets fresh air. Sidebottom lets him know what he thinks of the shot.

Mendis strikes, he bowled that one from well behind the crease, pushed it flat and wide, Taylor had moved down the track to swipe it to midwicket, misses the ball and Sangakkara whips off the bails, Taylor's gone
tossed up and on the pads, swept towards square-leg for a single
Taylor doesn't pick the doosra, was looking to turn it to the leg side, gets a leading edge towards third man, the batsmen saunter through for a couple
flatter one from Murali, on the pads, turned towards midwicket
slower ball, back of a length on off, draws Taylor forward and he defends awkwardly towards the bowler
overpitched on legstump, crunched to long-on for a single
on the pads, Taylor glances it to fine leg
another slow full toss, again 118kmh, very high and on the pads, Ross Taylor flicks it to the square leg boundary
drilled down to long off

short, and much slower from Yardy. Taylor's eyes lit up, and he set himself to pull that all the way back to Wellington. But he was too quick on the shot, beaten by the lack of pace and the ball strikes him in the belly
Taylor walks across his stumps, Yardy fires it in full and straight and it's driven down to long off. Sharp running gets them two, and thats the fifty partnership!
speared at the pads, and nudged out onto the leg side
well, that ball seemed to swing a touch! Perhaps some reverse... Whatever, it was full and speared at the pads, and a pad was all the batsman could get on it.
length, just outside off stump, and Taylor chops hard down on the ball into the off side

Taylor walks across to the off side and looks to heave it over mid wicket but he misses and it takes him on his back foot outside the line of off stump and he's given out LBW. The hosts certainly didn't need that and Australia are rampant!
driven to cover
pushes it quicker and he mistimes the punch to the off side
pushes it down to long-on
shuffles and clips it down to square leg
gets forward and pushes it down to mid-off
leg stump and full flicked into the leg side, Taylor wants two, oh dear Oram is struggling but the throw was poor and he gets back
back of a length, played to backward point, they run through
taken from outside off, swung towards midwicket, finds the fielder on the bounce
full ball around off stump, dug out towards long off, just a single
shot. Down on one knee and slog swept into the stands, big hit
around the wicket, fired in full again, slapped down to long on
another slower ball, well bowled, chopped to point
full outside off, goes to drive and gets an outside edge to the third man fence
Taylor walks across to off and tries to slay it into the leg side but misses
four more! What a shot. Crashed from just outside off past deep cover, great strike this is, where has Taylor been all innings

slapped down to long off, they have to come back for two and do but it's a great throw from the boundary and Taylor is run out good work from Akmal to gather the throw and get the bails off, end of game surely now, he was never in the frame, run out by miles
gets well forward and defends
full marks for placement, harbhajan drops it a little too wide outside off, he makes room and cuts wide of the vacant backward point region and beats the sweeper
opens the face of the bat and takes the risk of dabbing it wide of slip
gets forward and clips it to the on side
lands outside off, he lets it go
Taylor cuts to White again and he calls yes but McCullum sends him back and he's found short by a good throw
tossed up this time and pushed to cover
short and cut to White at backward point who does well to save the single
full outside off and Taylor plays late through square third man for four
shapes up for the sweep again and it's too quick for him
full outside off and Taylor drives square to the off side sweeper
really quick and he plays and misses
and again! Leg side this time, taken off a length and slapped behind square on the leg side, races to the fence again
throws this full but too far wide outside off, left alone
edged! But it was a slower ball, and so the edge dropped well short of Kieswetter. It was a slow legcutter, and a good one too
slightly fuller, but Taylor picks the gap between deep midwicket and long on this time, and it's two more easy runs for New Zealand. Totally risk free
a low full toss on the pads, flicked away towards deep backward square leg for a couple
full and wide, reaches out to work it towards covers
slower one outside off, smashed but Dhawan at mid-off comes in the way
fuller outside off, steers it towards sweeper cover
optimistic appeal for lbw, there is a big inside edge onto the pad, and it's outside off anyway
fuller on the stumps and Taylor picks it up between deep midwicket and deep square leg, it flew off the bat
fuller on the stumps, flicked away towards deep backward square leg
fuller outside off this time, hits it into the ground towards covers
a similar delivery once again, pushed in the direction of midwicket this time, Krunal charges towards the ball and keeps it to one
a low full toss on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg and scampers back for the second
short of length outside off, cuts it towards deep point, Krunal there
fuller but once again down the leg side, another wide
short of length on the stumps, Taylor gives himself some room and cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller outside off, Taylor was looking to paddle it fine but the ball goes underneath the bat
short of length outside off, pulls it towards deep midwicket, not the best of the timings
a slower length ball outside off, Taylor goes for the pull but ends up slicing it towards long-on, for one
flatter around off, on a length, Taylor goes back and forces it towards long-on
fuller outside off, and Taylor shows there is more than one way to skin a cat, paddles it gently and beats the man at short fine leg
flatter outside off, cuts it towards deep extra cover
length on middle and leg, plays it gently on the leg side
length on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg for one
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards midwicket, the fielder is near the boundary and the batsmen scamper back for the second
flatter on the stumps, 90kph, chops it on the leg side
flighted outside off, comes forward and drives it towards the right of sweeper cover
skids one through on middle and leg, works this to the man coming in from deep midwicket again
steps out and tucks this towards Vijay Shankar at deep midwicket
lunges forward and blocks
drops it into the off side looking for a single, sent back
fuller outside off and Taylor goes down and across and paddles it past short fine leg for four

close! That was quicker and Taylor tried to drop it on the off side, but was surprised by the space, the ball did bounce at his feet but went back and just bounced over the stumps. Styris called him through for a sprinted single all the same
comes back strongly, a yorker around off stumps, Taylor works it out towards long-off
fuller again but way too wide outside off this time
another slow cutter, again Taylor picks the gap to leg, and again they take an easy two
on the hips, Taylor tucks to leg and finds good placement - right between the men at fine leg and square leg, and good running gets New Zealand two more
Swann targets the stumps, and Taylor flicks to leg for another
and he has the sense to calmly pick up one from the next ball and keep rotating the strike after the big shot
Taylor goes big! A lot of bottom hand in the shot, and he middled it with a flick of his meaty wrists to pick up a valuable six runs!
tickled down leg, and though short fine sprints round the batsmen steal a cheeky single
nurdled to leg, wide of midwicket and they scramble through for another
much quicker from Yardy, and Taylor guides it off the face of the blade very fine, but a sprinting fielder cuts it off before the third man boundary
too far down leg, and the batsman gets a touch on it to collect a single wide of the man at short fine
straight again from Swann, and Taylor turns his wrists over the shot to find the gap at midwicket
too much width, and chopped into the off side for a single
slower from Swann - flighty, loopy delivery which turned in a touch and Taylor was too soon into the shot, hitting uppishly to leg but wide of any fielders
Taylor walks across his stumps this time to change the angle, working the ball out to long on
and again, way too outside off and all of sudden Bhuvi looks like he has lost his line
speared in at the legs, and clipped to the midwicket fielder again
slapped straight to the close midwicket fielder
nice away movement, keeps the right-hander guessing as he reaches out to drive
just a touch wider outside off and Taylor chases it and misses it
gets forward and drives firmly down to point
fires in the yorker, 133kph and whipped through backward square... they are going to push for two but Billings collects and back-hands on to the stumps to finish things off!
ooh, not sure about that, Ross... goes for a cute reverse dab, actually using the back of the bat, but fails to connect!
goes full and straight again, Taylor gets out and clips through midwicket for a couple
shapes to drive straight but he ends up getting a leading edge down to point

lousy cricket from both teams and Pakistan will regret this, Taylor taps it to cover and sets off and there's lot of uncertainty in the running, Styris took a pace out of his crease but wasn't interested in the single, Taylor was already half way  down and and he was sent back, Malik wasn't sure whether to thrown directly at the stumps or relay it to a fielder, there was nobody at the stumps and in the end it was a feeble throw to the keeper's end, the batsman dived and he was home
thick edge! well that run-out chance didnt cost anything, he reaches out to a pitched up delivery outside off gets a thick edge on the drive to Akmal

don't let Afridi touch you today, you might turn to gold! After a horrible opening spell, Sami comes back and strikes second ball. It's back of a length, gives him width, Taylor goes hard at it, and is not close to it, and gets a fine outside edge
flat and fast, defended back to the bowler
fired down the leg side
full again from Yardy, and driven down to long on this time
almost a yorker on the off stump, Taylor takes it on the full and pushes it towards long-off
gives himself to the leg side, gets no timing as he drives down the ground to long-on
Taylor's forward, then back, pushing out to cover
beats him immediately as Taylor pushes inside the line of this one
shortish ball outside off, and he chops down on it and sends it speeding away wide of Narine at short third man, but he gives chase and cuts it off easily enough
full ball outside off, and he shuffles forward to play a checked drive towards deep cover
back of a length, angling in towards off, and he shuffles across and tucks it off his hip to deep midwicket
that's a shocking delivery. He lost his action there, and it slipped out of his hand, with no pace at all, and way down the leg side
onto middle stump now, length ball, and he tucks it gently into the midwicket area with a roll of his wrists
full, on off, and he walks across his stumps and works it behind square on the leg side
full ball, angling in towards off, and he defends back to the bowler
thickish outside edge as he tries to drive towards cover, slices it down to short third man
fullish ball on off stump, and he comes forward to play a checked drive to long-on
shorter still, and he doesn't get too clean a slice of this, but gets enough bat on it for the ball to go one bounce over the deep square leg boundary

dropped, was  he? Short ball outside off and he pulled that extremely hard and straight to Badree at midwicket, who wrings his hands after the ball bounces off them. I'm not sure if it went to him on the full or on the bounce
full and wide once more, and Taylor is nicely in line this time to help that over the wide long-off boundary with just a little wave of his bat
tossed up outside off, a thick outside edge finds short third man
full and wide outside off this time, and Taylor chases it but is beaten by extra bounce
back of a length, tight line just outside off, and he guides it down to third man off the back foot
angled down the leg side, and it goes off his pad down to fine leg as he misses the flick
short, outside off, and he gets a lot of tennis-ball bounce. It's well over head-high and the umpire calls a wide
closes his bat face too early as he tries to flick this, and gets a leading edge that runs away towards point
back of a length, and he tucks it down off his hips towards midwicket
slower ball outside off, and he pushes forward to drive to deep cover
back of a length, outside off, and he goes back and across to push that down to long-on
133 kph, good length outside off, pushed away towards extra cover. The field has been brought up to stop the run
fullish delivery outside off, 87 kph, tapped in front of point for a run
135 kph, shortish and wide, dabbed towards point. The fielder leaps to his right to stop the ball
131 kph, on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
runs down and works the ball to deep square leg for a single.
length ball on off, and he didn't seem to connect too cleanly with that lofted hit, but it just kept going and sailed way over the long-on boundary
another one defended to cover. Taylor doesn't know much about the spin on these ones
Taylor's area, on off and middle, slogged away over midwicket
132 kph, another boundary. Short around off, Taylor stands tall and pulls over midwicket for another boundary. Too easy, just five required, Munro needs one
quicker and fuller on middle, Taylor pushes to long-on

this is a procession! Irfan's bounce is too hot to handle for Taylor here. It rises from just back of length and catches the shoulder of the bat as the batsman looks to turn it to the leg side.. big leading edge just lobs on the off side and the fielder from point jogs in a few steps to gobble this up
gets good bounce from just short of length, the batsman hops on the crease to defends this
he stands in the crease and punches the back of length delivery towards mid-off
gets some width this time and whacks it through point to pick up his first boundary
this one flies past the outside edge at 143 kph.. Two slips were waiting there. A lazy waft from Taylor as he hardly moved forward to that

that has castled him! Taylor has been shuffling to the off side to deal with the turn - in and out, but he had no answers to this ripper.. Flat and quick outside off, it changes direction on pitching and sneaks through the defences to knock back the off stump..it actually takes the glove on its way
looks to play a premeditated sweep, picks it up from outside off and manages to paddle it very fine
full and spinning away, the batsman dabs it to backward point off the back foot
fuller delivery on off, Taylor whips it to deep midwicket for a single
flatter and turning down the leg side, Taylor misses as he was moving across, but this is called a wide
on the pads again, this is flicked very fine on the leg side for a couple
some more turn for Narine in his doosras, Taylor chops it on to point
doosra again, the batsman cuts it to the right of short third man for another easy run
this is the doosra, but it;s too full, easily dealt with as Taylor pushes it to long on
fuller and wider outside off, now they have protection at deep point and it's only a single
back of length and straight on the stumps, the batsman defends it back down the pitch
fuller and wider outside off, easy come easy go for Taylor, he slices it calmly over point for a boundary
starts off with a low full toss on off, the batsman pushes it straight to midwicket
looks to slog this from outside off but misses, gets an inside edge actually, it ricochets off Ramdin's pads to the leg side
shuffles across the crease, gets a full delivery outside off and drives it crisply through extra cover, but is not able to find the boundary
short and wide, Taylor is a touch too slow in his cut shot, gets beaten
sweeps this one fine to pick up another easy single
shortish delivery, Taylor plays a controlled pull to deep midwicket, along the ground
he pushes this softly to cover point for a quick single..
back of length on off, the batsman pushes it straight to mid-off
and it's a wicket-maiden now as Taylor defends again
dug in and called wide, too high. Munro fails to get to four successive fifties, ends up on 49 not out. But New Zealand take away a 1-0 lead in the T20 series.
136 kph, full delivery outside off, Taylor leans into a drive and caresses it away through cover for four. One to win, Munro needs one for the record. A block coming up?
flat on middle and off, 84 kph, pushed to long-on. No dots from Taylor, terrific batting
tossed up on middle, Taylor sweeps to deep fine leg to take refuge at the other end
133 kph, Sarfraz not happy again, worked to deep square leg for one
129 kph, short delivery outside off, just tapped to cover for a quick single.
moves across his stumps to play this to midwicket for a brace
negotiates this one carefully to the off side
Taylor looking for a run with a push to the leg side, but is sent back immediately by McCullum
off cutter on leg stump which is helped off the pads to fine leg
Taylor plays this with soft hands to the off side and goes for the run, but when he sees Walton converging on it, decides to turn back, and would have been gone by miles if the direct hit was made
moves across his stumps to flick this leg stump bound delivery to the fine leg rope
pulls this back of a length ball straight to mid-on
pushed off the back foot towards point, but hit a bit too well by Taylor
good length just outside off as Taylor has a go
shortish length which rises on Taylor as he seems befuddled after playing this off the back foot, with the ball popping up to the off side, but falling safe away from any fielders
length ball on middle which gets a leading edge as this bobbles straight to Bravo at short cover, who won't make a hash of this one. New Zealand now three down
looks for two with a flick to the leg side, and is able to make it back in time before the throw is fired in at the striker's end
driven straight back to the bowler by Taylor
works this to the leg side for a quick single, and to retain the strike
looks to get this one away to the leg side, but the bowler is quick on it
tries to squirt this length ball spinning in behind square on the off side
reaches out to drive this down to sweeper cover
steps out and eases this down to long-on to get off the mark
slower and fuller outside off, worked to long-on
turns this full delivery from outside off towards long-on
fetches this pull from outside off, does well to keep this all along the ground though
swept past short fine. Have to say that was lazy from Badree. This was in the air for a bit but drifting away, he tried to go for the catch but stopped and then saw this ball bounce away from him.
turns this full delivery towards the man coming in from deep midwicket
touch short, he makes room and steers this wide of Gayle, who does well at short third man by using his boot.
shapes to cut but is cramped for room, chopped wide of the keeper on the off side this time
drilled over the bowler's head, smashes this into the sightscreen. Stayed inside the crease, got underneath the length and used his raw hitting power to muscle this over. Terrific
slips in a yorker-length delivery on middle and leg, this is squeezed into the leg side as they hare back for the second
slower and fuller on off, driven to long-off, sensible from Taylor to hog strike by taking a single off the last ball
this time is able to carve this through the gap at cover for a single
cuts this length ball away straight to point
goes down the leg side as the umpire calls a wide
played off the back foot towards the fielder at extra-cover
good length on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket, who picks up and fires a throw towards the stumps. The point fielder can't back up and concedes an overthrow

goes for the big slog-sweep over midwicket but ends up mistiming it as Walton, stationed at deep midwicket, is able to run in to take the catch. Will this wicket help tilt the scales somewhat, or is the match already a foregone conclusion?
defends this one back to the bowler
cuts this one off the back foot, but can't get it past a diving backward point
drives this one straight to mid-off for a single
finishes it off with a knuckleball which misses the outside edge
able to steer this one down to mid-off for a single
pushes this low full toss down to long-off
drives this one down to long-off once more
this time hoicks this away to the leg side for one
fuller one which is driven straight to the extra-cover boundary by Taylor
drives this straight to short cover to bring the over to an end
defends this one right back to the bowler
defended back to the bowler as Miller lets this through the gap in his legs to the fielder at long-off
happy to nudge this to the leg side for a quick-run two
driven straight to silly mid-off
low full toss on the pads which is eased down to long-on to bring an end another successful over for Russell
slower ball on off stump which is played straight to short cover

fullish length driven straight back to the bowler as Russell has a roll to stop the ball. The non-striker follows the call from Taylor as he books it to the other end, with Taylor able to make his ground again
short one which rises on Taylor as he fends this away to the off side
played off the back foot to long-on for a single
flatter delivery on the leg stump which is whisked away to the square leg fielder
prods forward to tuck this away to the leg side for one
this time reverts to a cut shot off the back foot which does get past backward point, but not all the way to the rope
drills this one straight to the extra-cover boundary, with the timing so sublime that it reaches the rope without much issue
plays this one away to the fielder at backward point, but can't get it past him
leans over to drive this straight to deep extra-cover
played to the man at sweeper cover for one
hits him on the pads as this is worked away to the leg side. The fielder was too deep on the leg side as the pair are able to return for a second
on a length on middle and leg, 132 kph, worked into the gap behind square for a couple. "Aage kar," says Sarfraz (bowl fuller)
cramps him up on middle and Taylor seems to be stuck between defending and flicking through midwicket
dropped, but it was a difficult chance for the keeper. Thick edge as Hasan lures Taylor to push at the ball away from his body. Sarfraz gets a glove on it, but can't get it to stick
flighted on off stump, pushed down to mid-off
swipes across the line and hits the ball to deep midwicket
Taylor stays back and tucks the short of a length ball through midwicket
Taylor moves back and towards the off to try and paddle the ball behind square, he misses and the bounce takes the ball over the stumps
he's gone for it again but straight to Marsh at midwicket! Clever bowling from Watson there, actually, as he held it back just a touch

Al-Amin drops a sitter, ridiculous catching. Taylor finally connects, lunging forward and slogging across the line to loft the ball towards deep square leg. Al-Amin was right there, he barely had to move, and for a moment he seemed to have caught it. And then it popped out.

short ball with width outside off, after many failed swipes Taylor decides to cut, and cut late, and he succeeds! The fielder at short third man is beaten to his right and has no chance with the chase
he's nailed it! The Taylor of old. Gets down on one knee to one that is outside off stump and frees his arms to smash the ball flat and far, deep into the stands beyond deep midwicket
a slow one outside off - it hasn't turned at all today for Bangladesh - Taylor goes back and plays through point
defended back to the bowler, Shakib's not had a good day on a pitch that is tough to bat on
shame from Watto - slower ball off-cutter but it's down the leg side
oh hello - that is, at last, a true monster from Taylor as he steps to off and clatters it over midwicket for six! What a hit. What a sound off the bat
an ugly cross-batted flog to leg and only for a single
pitches outside leg and cuts towards Taylor, springing off the pitch with awkward bounce, Taylor gets squared up as he drops the ball on the off side and runs

Taylor is all at sea here, just can't connect with anything, once again the ball grips the pitch on a good length and he pulls too early, but Mushfiqur makes a real mess of collecting that and concedes four byes
pitches well outside leg and cuts towards Taylor's pads, a slower one, Taylor stays back and dabs the ball behind square leg
Al-Amin is not having a good day. His next touch on the ball after that drop is to bowl a full and wide ball outside off, Taylor smashes it to the wide long off boundary
he's lucky to get away with this one! It was a full toss and I think Taylor swung a bit too early, lofting it towards deep midwicket, Mithun came running in from the boundary to take the catch
on his legs but a clip finds mid-on
sharp, sharp single by Taylor, dropping out to short-extra and he's out of the blocks quick enough to nick one
crashed out to deep extra cover
what a ball! An absolute corker from Marsh. Shaped in to the right-hander before straightening, beating his forward defensive. Beautifully bowled
fast, full, straight and Taylor steals a single to mid-off
turned off his pads for a single
nicely bowled, fired in on middle and he's defending this to mid-on
on the stumps, no width now, Taylor drives down the ground to get off the mark
pushed through with a flatter trajectory, Taylor dinks one back down the ground
tossed up down the leg side, poor ball to start with
floated up out the back of the hand, spinning back in, Taylor blocks it toward his toes
in the blockhole around off stump, played towards mid off for a single
good length and faster outside off, Taylor wafts at it from his crease and is beaten
the slower bouncer wide outside off stump, Taylor lets it go

what is going on, that previous ball sprung up at Taylor from short of a length outside off, this one has scooted along really low from a similar length, Taylor swipes across the line and is beaten outside off, he looks quite confused
whoa, laced to point. Short and wide, Taylor gets on top of the bounce and smashes the cut
back of a length outside off, patted down to point. Dot
fullish and wide, some tail back in. Pushed to mid-off
tip and run, good from Taylor. Pats a decent delivery to point for a quick single
what execution. Superb. Premeditated the paddle and did it easily. Amir fires it full and wide outside off but Taylor gets far enough and drags it over short fine leg.
good yorker outside off, squeezed to deep point and Taylor hurries back for the second as a late decision. A good throw would have had Taylor
short delivery on middle, good change in length. Taylor takes his eyes off it but gets some bat on his pull, two to a labouring Irfan at fine leg
full and straight, Taylor shuffles across and drills to long-on
good delivery to end.  A low full toss on off is very hard to hit, pushed to cover. An efficient over for NZ
lobs back agonizingly past Irfan. Slower offcutter on middle, Taylor beaten for pace is through the shot too early. Just wide, and long-on has to clean up
miles in the air, but plonks in no-man's land at deep square leg. Taylor shuffles across and scoops the ball more than hit it. No one manning the boundary.
full and wide, scythed past point for a couple. Some good fielding from Anwar saves the boundary. Another productive over
in the slot for a Taylor trademark. Full on off, Taylor inside-edges onto his boot and then back to the bowler
low full toss outside off, driven to Afridi at cover who makes a sloppy fumble. Gives the extra run
exceptional yorker that. Speared in outside off and getting some inward movement too. Taylor is beaten
low full toss on middle, good bowling this. Just one to long-on, shovelled away
six. Full on off, Taylor gets under it sufficiently and sends it soaring over long-on. Flat hit. Timely runs these.
low full toss outside off, clubbed down to long-off, just the one this time.
another low full toss outside off, a scooped drive finds its way to a wide long-off for a couple
superb delivery but with third man up, it wasn't the wises option from Amir. Taylor gets a thick outside edge and flies away down to third man. Four more and NZ taking momentum into the break
another low full toss outside off, bunted down to long-off. Elliott loses his bat but not his will to come back for the second. Does it easily.
goes back and nudges the ball off the pads through square leg
dabbed from the crease in front of point for a single
defended with soft hands close on the off side and they run a quick single
deft from Taylor, stays in his crease and waits to dab the ball late to third man
dabbed off the back foot behind point for a single
Taylor moves right across his stumps and turns the ball off his pads to short fine leg, Taylor sets off, Munro sends him back. Taylor has to hurry and dive and makes it in the end
dabbed off the front foot to square leg for a single
short of a length outside off, the ball doesn't come on to the bat, Taylor stays in his crease and drops it with soft hands close on the off side
pushed through on middle and leg, Taylor works it away through midwicket... He's hobbling at the other end, not sure if he rolled his ankle, or what
Plunkett hammers in, on the hips and Taylor miscues to midiwicket
brilliant work on the boundary from Willey! Taylor nailed a pull out towards deep square leg but Willey motored around the rope and threw himself full length to pull it in and save a run
superb yorker from Jordan, right up at the toes, Taylor has to slam the bat down
low full toss on middle stump, slogged once again but not hit well enough. Goes to deep midwicket
heaved towards the leg side! Such beautiful connection. Full ball on his pads, and it's flicked with ease over the boundary. Great use of the wrists

full outside off, tries to heave this over cover, but it takes the thick edge. In the air, and looks like third man is getting under it, but falls just short despite the fielder's dive. Gets his body behind the ball though
full outside off, attempts the drive but takes the outside edge. Races down to third man
another one! Full and wide outside off, but such is Taylor's bat speed that he swings and it's connected well. Slogged over the leg side, and soars over the deep midwicket boundary
full outside off, big wind up from Taylor to slog this, but misses. Will feel bad to have missed out on it
thumped! And taken in the crowd! Short outside off, and it's smacked over cow corner. Walks forward slightly and sends this into the stands
full on off stump, driven past the non-striker to long on. They walk across for the single

gives it some air, dips as Taylor comes after him... and he skies a slog to mid-off! Safely pouched by Willey, so Taylor's extra life is a short one. Nicely done by Rashid, gets Taylor after causing him problems with little success during the ODIs

got him dropped him, clear edge from Taylor trying to run the ball to third man and it clangs off Bairstow's fingers and straight to earth! Bairstow immediately signals for some attention on his finger... it's unwanted attention on his glovework that he'll get
slightly back of a length, Taylor shows it a straight bat on off stump
good length on off stump, pushed down to long-on
short of a length, Taylor rolls the wrists and nudges one more through midwicket
drops back and tucks one into the leg side, Morgan hits the stumps.... but it deflects away and they get a second
short outside off, 84mph and swatted away over midwicket, forehand smash from Taylor and it's into a gap for another boundary
good length on middle and off, closes the face and nudges one through midwicket

attacks the stumps, holds up a touch and Taylor gets a leading edge, it drops short of mid-on running in and the throw misses, too - still, a single-figure over for England, their first of the innings
full and worked back wide of mid-on
short of a length over the top of off stump, punched through the covers off the back foot
little bit short and chopped in front of square - expensive opener from Rashid
floated up on middle and off, cute little paddle to leg from Taylor and he gets it past a rather lumbering dive from Hales on the 45, runs all the way
sweep goes wrong and Hasan is overjoyed as he traps Taylor in front! It was fuller and quicker on middle, the batsman sought to hit across the line and pays for his mistake
just a shade short and Taylor was back and waiting for it. He's quite prolific on the cut, but this time he's missed it
struck on the pads Pakistan think as he was looking to a scoop, but I think he got glove on it. Actually, all it hit was the glove
stays back to a good length ball, waits on it to turn and then clips it to deep midwicket
punched through the covers as he stands up tall behind a short delivery on and around off stump
back of a length on off stump, Taylor nudges into the covers and runs
tossed up outside off and Taylor laces it through the covers
fuller ball on middle, kept out
waist-high full toss outside off, muscled over mid on, and falls short of the outfielder. They scamper across for the second run
yorker-length outside off, Taylor walks across to squeeze this behind point but is beaten
full on middle stump, dug away back to the bowler. Terrific yorker. Can't put those away
Malik has lost the plot. He spears it short and way down leg

full on off, tries to heave it over the off side... Brilliant from Morgan, takes the catch diving to his right! There'll be no Rosco special, forced to try and get going straight away, it was too full to hit over the infield but was still travelling pretty quickly, dipping on Morgan as he leapt forward to take it a couple of inches from the ground
big turn from outside off into the right-hander, Taylor goes back and plays the ball into the covers
defended on the front foot
big turn from Jadeja, pitching in line with the stumps and spinning away from the right-hander, Tylor waits in his crease and hits through cover point
a leading edge goes towards long off for a single
a huge appeal from Jadeja, he pitches outside leg from around the wicket and spins the ball sharply across the right-hander, Taylor is beaten and hit on the pad
the offbreak flighted outside off stump this time, spins into the right-hander, Taylor dabs it to short third man
that's the doosra and Taylor picks it beautifully! He stays back and waits, opening the face late and steering the ball past short third man and to the boundary
bowled flatter and on to the pads, Taylor moves forward and across to glance but misses and is hit on the pad, missing leg
tossed up outside off, Taylor leans forward and drives the ball to the bowler
bowled flat and short, Taylor stays in his crease and hits the ball through square leg
moves forward and punches the good length ball towards long on for a single
good length angling into off and middle stump, defended on the off side on the front foot
beaten outside the off stump! Taylor tries to cut off the back foot but Bumrah
moves forward and outside the line of off stump to paddle the ball, he misses and gets hit on the pad, prompting an appeal from the bowler
Taylor brings out his trademark cut, moving back and cutting late despite the lack of room, the ball races to the backward point boundary
this time he gets a boundary off the outside edge! Taylor was squared up by the legbreak and he prodded, the ball took a thick enough edge to beat the keeper and go to third man
flicked to deep midwicket for a single
Taylor's third boundary in four balls! Moves forward and across to lap-paddle the length ball between the keeper and short fine leg
full and straight, driven to long off for a single
another slower one on off stump, Taylor leans forward and dabs towards point
Taylor hasn't had much of the strike of late, but he's launched this length ball cleanly over long on with a full swing of the arms on the front foot
in the blockhole outside off stump, Taylor reaches for it and hits it through point
in the blockhole to finish, Taylor can only squeeze it back to the bowler
that's too wide outside off stump, that's the first extra of the innings!
sliding across off from over the stumps, cut through backward point
short, skiddy ball again. Played back to the bowler
picked away off the pads through square leg
slid across off at 91ks, ample width, Taylor goes back and cracks a cut behind point

what's going on? Confusion all around. Full outside leg and it's a terrific yorker that he can't put away. The ball goes between both legs and through to the keeper. Sarfraz throws at the stumps at the non-striker's because the batsmen were contemplating running across. Amir thinks he's got his man: not with the run out, but with the caught behind. They've taken the review. And yes, Amir is right. The ball hit the bat before going through his legs. Brings an end to the cameo. Taylor tells his partner, "I didn't hit it, I promise", before walking out. Interesting, but the replays showed a spike on the snicko
this is a full toss and he walks across and mows this straight to deep midwicket. Cramped for room, didn't get the timing either. Easy catch.
the slider now, the batsman is not shy of defending, pushes it back to the bowler
pushed down to short third man again. Taylor labours through and a direct hit would have been interesting

and again, but this is a leading edge! It's a skier, it's going to be difficult. Especially with two men chasing it. But Ben Cooper allows the man with the gloves to take it and so he does. Fullish and outside off, Taylor goes for the same stroke but his timing is nowhere near as good
slower delivery, wide of the stumps, another swing and miss
full and wide, 136kph and Taylor can only squeeze it to backward point as he advanced down the pitch

banged in, 135kph and Taylor pulls like a lusty stevedore, takes it on the helmet, just a single to backward point! It's not much more than a hill of beans but Taylor has at least given NZ something to bowl at
tossed up on middle and he gets forward and defends
this one spun and Taylor did well to just get his bat behind to defend
there's a forward short leg  and the ball lobs to him and there's an appeal, that went off the pad
close shout for an lbw! This one spun and hit the back leg in front of the stumps, he was playing against the turn, Taylor very lucky to survive

and a ball later Herath strikes and the umpire is convinced! This was bowled flatter and quicker, Taylor was forward to defend, didn't cover the line and the ball didn't exactly turn and went through with the angle, struck on the pads in front of middle
full toss, 136kph on the pads, glanced fine for one
slower ball, scooped into the off side, taken safely just beyond the ring! Taylor swinging hard and done by the lack of pace, Morgan snaffles it - England still a chance?
flighted, Taylor comes out and turns it into a full toss, clipped square for one
short outside off, cut firmly to the sweeper
gets a touch too straight and Taylor glides it off his pads, gets it very fine and it runs away to the rope for four
pushed through on leg stump, blocked
pushed down to long-on for an easy single. Netherlands are tempting them to hit out, but Taylor and Baz know better
full on middle, Taylor's clipped to deep midwicket. Single off each ball of the over so far
back of a length just outside off, tapped away to long-on
good length ball on middle, turned away through midwicket
change in pace again, but Taylor plays with the straight bat and pushes down to mid-off
floated up, worked down the ground
shuffles across and punches the back of a length delivery to the sweeper on the off side
slung wide of the stumps as Taylor steps down
again Tye loses his line, into the tramlines and he'll have to bowl it again
full toss to finish and Taylor slugs it over the deep midwicket rope! The 18th six of the innings and it takes NZ up to a mighty 243-6 from their 20 overs!

length ball, heaved into the leg side, beyond the rope... and it's been snagged by an orange-clad fella in the crowd! A brilliant one-handed catch, and he goes bananas, because it's worth NZ$50,000, I believe! The Aussies should get him in the team

dropped! Full toss, muscled towards deep square leg, but Short puts down a straightforward catch! There's then a run-out chance as he fires in the throw but Taylor dives for the line and makes it safely
short ball, swung away to square leg on the pull
well bowled again, swatted for one by Taylor
and he's been smashed out of the ground. Offers up a length ball outside off and Taylor pulls out that trademark slap over deep midwicket. Way into the crowd
pitched up and heaved into the leg side, they think better of coming for two
darts in a shorter one on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
short ball outside off, Taylor creams a pull wide of long-on, Agar dives to cut it off but they come back for two
full on the stumps, nudged into the gap at midwicket
full on the toes and Taylor nurdles into the leg side, they scamper hard for two
full, taking the pace off hits the pad and runs square
length outside off, Taylor cuts into the ground behind point for one
pitched up and driven for one to the edge of the ring
goes for the yorker again, 130kph cross-seam, Taylor chops down on it
length ball, sits up nicely as Taylor steps across and then sways back to belt it through square leg for four
slower ball, beats the bat as Taylor swings, clears the stumps for a dot
tossed up and clipped down the ground through mid-off as Taylor charges out
floated up and dinked down the ground to long-on
angled in and worked to leg again, this time long-on comes in to prevent a second
back of a length and worked from off stump to midwicket, Richardson has to give chase and they hurry back for two
short ball, at the body, Taylor pulls but doesn't get hold of it
pitched up straight and worked into the leg side
full, maybe a slower ball, skids through under the bat outside off
fired in and flicked to midwicket, just the one this time, brings up the NZ 100. Terrific figures for Agar, his best in T20Is
smacked through square leg. This was full and outside off, but Taylor shuffles across and swipes it away. Waited for the slower ball to reach him and dismissed it
walks across again and looks for the slog over midwicket. Too full for it and gets an inside edge onto his pads
slower ball, cut into the ground behind point, Richardson throws himself after it to keep them to one
short, wide and slashed past backward point! Travis Head, on as a sub fielder, nearly gets fingertips on it but the ball zips by and away to the rope for a first boundary in a while
this comes back in and hits the gloves as Taylor goes to cut again
full outside off, 134kph and Taylor goes for the cow-corner mow, ends up toeing it back to the bowler
another dot, slow floater outside off and this induces a big swing and miss
fullish, pace off again, Taylor heaves across the line and fails to connect
pitched up and clubbed to leg, just one to the man on the boundary square
in the slot, pounded down the ground for six! Hello, my old friend... Taylor picks this and blooters it over long-on, NZ will take a couple more of those!
short, slower delivery and Taylor is hit on the body, Sodhi then has to throw himself back in as Stoinis fields and throws for the stumps
full, taking the pace off, again Taylor doesn't connect with a big mow across the line
pitched up and squirted into the leg side, Taylor is struggling to get back here... but Tye's throw is poor and Carey can't collect properly!
banged in as Taylor steps out, that's in a different post code on height
fired into the toes, clipped through midwicket for one
full and straight and whipped off the toes, Chris Lynn moves across from midwicket and dives to try and cut it off... and he's hurt here, going to need some treatment
a bottom-handed shovel into the leg side, Agar chases it himself and can't prevent the second
down the pitch again, on the line of off stump, takes this through the leg side to deep midwicket. Good running
tucked off the pads to deep midwicket
width outside off, a slower ball, chopped to deep cover
back of a length outside off, tapped towards point and there's some hesitation in the single but he's okay in the end
some turn there, from off stump, pushed to the covers
short, down the leg side, another wide
full outside off, driven to cover
touch short outside off, cut to backward point
fired down the leg side, Taylor misses his pull but gets the wide call
straighter, pushed into midwicket
nicely bowled, held this back as Taylor uses his feet, nudged back down the pitch
slipped down the leg side, a strangled appeal for a catch, clipped the pad
full on the stumps, worked back down the ground to long-on
good length, nudged into the leg side

big appeal for lbw! Warner calls the review. Nice bit of bowling, a googly that defeated the inside edge, he's using his feet so a long way down the pitch. Third umpire rules no inside edge...but it's hit outside off stump
worked off the pads through midwicket...almost a mix-up over a second up
extra bounce, a slower one out of the back of the hand jumps at Taylor and loops over the top edge...a surprised look on Taylor's face
uses his feet, drives into the pitch and it bounces back to the bowler
plays a standing sweep, wide of short fine leg
gets across outside off, tries to fetch a short ball through the leg side but can only pick out mid-on
that's a wild swing across the line, a good-length ball, and it's not far from taking off stump
gives it some air, nudged into a gap at midwicket and they scamper the two
big appeal for lbw as Taylor slog sweeps, looked pretty good, given not out and it's a leg bye to the on side. That was three reds!
short of a length outside off, tapped into the covers
short outside off, stays back in the crease and taps to the off side
finds the outside edge, this was a touch fuller, but Taylor does well to keep it down, slip, who is wide, makes a good save
fine of slip! Could they have had two slips? Touch of width outside off, Taylor plays a slashing cut, takes a top edge and goes through the gap
floated up full and clipped back to the bowler
a short ball outside off, goes for the pull and he's through his shot, takes the cue end and loops towards backward point
wheels away on middle and leg, clipped in front of square and Agar chases after it
full and straight, gets forward and flicks through midwicket
big full toss, straight at 147kph, worked out to deep square...below waist height so not a no-ball
tight line just outside off, Taylor attempts to cut quite a full delivery and finds backward point
opens the face and places out to deep cover
a shorter ball, pulled to deep square
an attempted yorker at 145kph, it's a low full toss dug out towards mid-on
full outside off, Taylor's feet don't move as he drives through the line, skews off the inside half of the bat behind square on the leg side
full outside off, driven back to the bowler
width outside off, slashed down to third man
full outside off, and Kohli takes a big stride forward to meet the ball. Fended back to Rashid
tossed up, but wide outside off. Kohli has all the time in the world to drive this through the covers
full on off, and spinning away. Pushed back to Rashid off the front foot

he's finally mis-timed one and Simmons has dropped the catch on the deep midwicket boundary! Kohli lunged at the dipping slower ball and swung across the line, lofting it in the air towards deep midwicket, Simmons ran to his right and dived but could not hold on
stays back in the crease time, it's a flatter, shorter delivery, pulled to deep midwicket
full at the stumps, he stays leg side of the delivery, opens up the off side and drives wide of long-off
that's a fierce square cut, a fraction short from Rashid, he waits for it to turn and places it perfectly
gets well across his crease and flicks this from around off stump to deep midwicket
in he blockhole outside off, Kohli square drives but can't beat point, great final over so far for West Indies, only four runs off the first three balls
short and wide outside off. Kohli has to reach at it, but he still chooses to cut it over point. Played wide enough of the fielder at third man
back of a length on off, and Kohli swivels to pull! Played past the square-leg umpire for one
back of a length outside off, opens the face off the back foot down to third man where Hales misfields and Kohli is alert to the chance of the second run
full on off, and whipped off his pads to midwicket. Root intercepts and has a shy at the non-striker's stumps. Misses
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Flicked to fine leg off the back foot
another mistimed drive. Length ball outside off, off the toe-end as he looks to drive on the up
slower ball at a length outside off, steps out and finds extra cover with the drive on the up
full ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
short of a length at off stump, pulled firmly to long-on
short ball outside off, pulled to deep square's left
back of a length, angled into the pads, swung down to fine leg...Kohli probably feels he missed out
full outside off stump, allows it to come on and jabs it past point
bam. That's the end. Kohli jumps down to cut out the turn and uses his wrists to slog this wide of long-on, flat. A thumping win sealed with disdain

full just outside off, and Kohli plays with soft hands to the off side. Tries to pinch a single, but Jordan goes chasing behind it. Picks the ball up fast, and aims at the striker's stumps, but Raina was in anyway
length ball outside off. Kohli walks across to the off side, and then taps it back to Plunkett
short and wide outside off! Kohli tries to slap this past point, but the extra bounce deceives the Indian captain. Through to the keeper
full and wide outside off. Kohli checks this drive, as he punches to cover instead. Finds Morgan though
slower ball, and short outside off. Kohli sticks his bat out and cuts to Bairstow at third man
length ball, but wide outside off. Kohli stands tall and punches it to the sweeper fielder on the off side
a full ball on middle stump, Kohli stays on middle stump, stays balanced and smashes it flat and hard towards the wide long on boundary, just bounces inside the rope
length ball outside off, and Kohli backs away to make some extra room. Still it's too close to his body for the cut, and the ball soars over his bat to Buttler
very full, outside off, steered to third man
back of a length on leg stump, and Kohli backs away to make some extra room. Tries to ramp it over short third man, but Willey follows him, and the ball goes through to Buttler
back of a length on leg, cramping Kohli for space. But he still manages to tap it to wide mid on, and that's enough for these two to scamper across for two
cramps him once more! Terrific bowling by Willey. Back of a length on leg once more, and all Kohli can do is muscle it to the leg side

half-volley on leg stump, which Kohli punishes with a pristine shot over long-on. That's the fifty partnership. Kohli has been getting leg side of Santner's deliveries so easily and is then targeting the straight and extra cover boundaries which are his strengths
full on middle, and Kohli flicks this off his pads to deep backward square leg. Work for the man there, and that means Kohli can jog back for the second run
full just outside off, and Kohli drives inside out to the sweeper-cover fielder. Played with the bat's open face on purpose to place it between point and cover
full toss on his pads, and Kohli nonchalantly whips it off his legs to the square-leg boundary! Effortless from King Kohli. Jordan misses the yorker, and Kohli has no trouble in putting it away
overpitched, wide outside off. Kohli gets to pitch of the ball and drives to cover

goes for the revers sweep, weathers an lbw appeal, and with New Zealand wondering about a review, Kohli pinches a single. Kane Wiliamson goes for it in the end and replays suggest the ball - quick and angled into leg - strikes Kohli low on the front foot. Ball-tracking says it will be missing the stumps. Kohli gets a fistpump going. He wants to do this.
length ball wide outside off, throws his hands at it, gets it to mid-off off the toe-end
length ball on middle, and he rocks back onto the back foot to get that extra second. Works it to square leg thereafter, and collects a comfortable double

Straight down Root's throat! Length ball on middle, and Kohli goes for the swivel-pull. Not off the bat's sweet spot, and the shot goes straight to fine leg. Root has to dive forward, but he judges the catch well. Kohli has to go
hangs back and flicks a flatter delivery on middle to midwicket
drives a full delivery on leg stump to long-off. Only three runs off the over, as is expected of a fingerspinner defying the odds
shifts his weight back and punches a short delivery on leg stump with a vertical bat to deep midwicket
drills a quick straight delivery to long-on
whips a flatter delivery on middle and leg between midwicket and long-on. Kohli wants two, but Iyer says its hit too hard and they settle for one

spears a full toss between point and short third man! Beautiful cricket, he steps out to Santner, turns a delivery meant to cramp him on middle into a boundary ball by opening the face at the last second
onto the front foot and drives to deep cover
full, wide outside off, and that's a brilliant stop by Roy at backward to intercept the square drive that was timed so sweetly that it would have run to the boundary

advances again, and this time, he goes through with a lofted shot despite Santner adjusting his length and pulling it back. Power. Sheer power to make sure it clears cover because there's no one behind him
back outside off, steered down to third man
makes room to drive a full delivery pitching outside leg stump to cover point
this time he goes across to a good length ball on off stump and nudges it to long-on
full outside off. Slapped off the back foot to cover
good length ball angled in at the stumps, tucked to midwicket. Good comeback over from Stokes
better length, brings the batsman forward and it's driven to deep cover
drives to long-off
flays a drive all along the ground to the sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, and this time it's the googly! Kohli seemed to have picked that up, and works it to square leg for a couple
length ball on off, and Kohli rocks back to whip this to the sweeper fielder on the leg side. Enough time for Kohli to return for the second
tossed up on middle, but Kohli comes skipping down the wicket before whipping this to the fielder at cow corner. He'll keep strike
full on off, and defended off the front foot on this occasion
that's a lovely piece of timing and placement, Hales' misfield proves costly, Kohli walks across the crease and clips this from outside off through midwicket
back of a length on middle, and Kohli pulls this fine down the leg side. Played along the ground for a single
firmly punched straight down the ground! Length ball on off, but Kohli times this beautifully over the non-striker's stumps. Long on cleans up

full on leg stump, and Kohli comes skipping down the wicket before whipping it over midwicket. Placed well, but not timed well enough, and that allows Bairstow to cut it off in the deep. An excellent diving effort from the fielder
short of a length, straight, good uses of the crease as he plays back then drives with an open face to beat cover
back of a length and outside off, Kohli slaps it to deep cover
full outside off, and Kohli plays this late to short third man. Opens his bat's face at the last moment
beats wide long on! Full on leg, and Kohli swipes this past midwicket. Roy tried to cut it off, but it was always a losing battle. Releases the pressure

dropped at long on! Roy the man, but he may have parried it over for six. Full on middle, and Kohli check-drives over Raina's head. Roy ran to his left, and dived to his left to complete the catch, but the ball hit his palm and then popped out
in the air, but well short of Hales at third man! Back of a length outside off, and Kohli tried to slap it over point. But he top-edges it behind square instead
short on middle, but looping over Kohli's head. Too short, says the square-leg umpire
too short! Lands on middle, and loops over the batsman's head
length ball on off, and spinning into Kohli. Punched to mid on off the back foot
good length on off stump, Kohli hits through the line over extra cover
full outside off, and spinning away from Kohli. He gets onto the back foot, and cuts it late to short third man
good length on off, and Kohli has all the time to flick this fine down the leg side. Not timed well, though, so that means they'll have to jog back for two

driven to long on for just the single this time, it is over, India have made 192. Kohli has made nearly half of those runs. He has run like a beast in warm and humid conditions. He is spent, drenched in sweat, huffing and puffing as he walks off, he has given it everything
short ball into the body. Steps out, gets cramped, and is forced to drop it into the point region. Two thousand T20I runs for Kohli
chips a good length ball towards mid on where Wahab misfields to allow the second run, Pakistan cannot afford such shoddiness in the field
full and down leg side as he walks down leg side. Flicks to fine leg
short of a length with width outside off, Kohli moves forward and towards the off side to play a cracking square drive to deep point
good length outside off, Kohli mis-times the drive towards cover
stays back to a length ball and opens the face late to steer to third man
good length angling into the right-hander, Kohli steers it off the front foot to third man, it's a no-ball and Kohli has once again given the free-hit to yuvraj
good length around off stump, Kohli stays back and defends on the off side
banged in short, Kohli lets the bouncer pass
short of a length and at the body, Kohli moves across in his crease and tucks the ball through midwicket
Kohli moves forward and towards the off side to counter the angle across him and defends with a straight bat
short ball, Kohli moves across his crease and swivels to pull the ball down through square leg
such class from Kohli, moving across his crease with smoothness and flicking the ball crisply off his pads to the midwicket boundary
good length on a line just outside off, Kohli defends on the off side
short of a length and wide outside off, Kohli tries to hit the ball through cover off the back foot but is beaten by the extra bounce
the slower ball outside off, Kohli stays back and steers it to third man to raise the 50 partnership
Wahab is having a terrible day, Kohli tucks the no-ball off his pads through midwicket, free-hit coming up
a length ball outside off, Kohli has room to play his cover drive on the front foot and times it so well, there's a fielder in the deep though
good length on off, Kohli has the luxury of being able to defend with a straight bat, back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, Kohli lets it go
a full and fast ball, nearly in the blockhole, Kohli is almost squared up but manages to defend on the off side, 145 kph that was
Kohli strides forward to drive a good length ball on a tight line through cover but gets an inside edge towards backward square leg
stays back and dabs the length ball to third man
Kohli is timing it like a dream, batting as good as Amir was bowling. He leans forward to another full one and drives through cover, perfection. That was 146 kph
too straight this time, Kohli moves forward and across and clips it neatly through midwicket
Wahab begins with a full ball with width outside off delivered from over the wicket, Kohli meets it on the front foot and dispatches the 150kph delivery with a flowing cover drive
another one of those sublime cover drives, Kohli presses forward and drives a length ball through the line, tremendous timing
drops the ball towards point for a single

Kohli's been given lbw and he does not like the decision! Was there an inside edge? He walks off with a wry smile and that's because there was an inside edge. He moved back and across to turn a good length ball through the leg side but was beaten by the nip into him and hit on the front pad. He's played a marvellous innings today, against high quality swing bowling at serious pace.
fullish outside off, gets forward for a punchy drive to mid-off. Looked like this one also stopped on the batsman a little, and he had to check his shot at the last moment
good ball first up, gets it to straighten after swinging in. Kohli wants to clip it to square leg but gets a thick leading edge as the ball rolls towards point
length ball on middle stump, goes deep in his crease and punches to midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, steps inside the line to drive to long-off
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length close to off stump, punched to the left of mid-off
short outside off, and he punches that hard into the ground, and it bounces up over the leaping point fielder
shortish on off stump, lets it come on and rides the bounce to work it away to deep square leg
back of a length, whipped from just outside off stump, into the gap to the right of midwicket
short on middle stump, steps across it and plays a controlled swat-pull down to long leg
shortish, close to off stump, lets it come on, meets it under his eyes, dabs to third man
fullish outside off, and wow, what a sound the bat made as it punched that ball between short cover and mid-off. Just showed it the full face, barely any follow-through, just punched through the line
nudged off the pads behind square leg for a single
back of a length outside off, rolls his wrists over at the top of the bounce to steer down to third man
length ball, straightens on an off-stump line, opens Kohli up as he shapes to whip through midwicket. Has to check himself and defend into the covers instead
length ball wide of off, and that is vintage Kohli, bringing his wrists into that whippy drive of his to drill it to the right of point
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Steps across to work it wide of midwicket
length ball outside off, presses a long way forward to punch to mid-off
length ball wide of off, Kohli reaches out to drive and slices it squarer than he wanted, in the air over the leaping point fielder
back of a length, shifts his line slightly wide of off. Kohli opens his bat face and guides it down to third man
length ball on off stump, gets a big stride out to drive to mid-on

length ball angling into off stump, and this time Kohli's flick is inch-perfect, into the gap to the right of midwicket, and timed so well that long leg has no way of running around and cutting it off
back of a length, angling into off stump, whipped to midwicket
length ball close to off stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg
short ball just outside off, chopped down to third man
short of the man at first slip! Kohli pushed forward and opened the face, steering the ball just wide of the diving slip fielder and beating third man too
Kohli jumps back and opens the face to steer the ball to backward point where Anwar Ali dives to his left to save runs

mistimes it to mid-off, the captain has struck and the ground as erupted like a volcano! It was pitched up, Kohli looked to clear mid-off with less than two overs left for Powerplay but didn't get the middle at all. Easy catch!
little bit of room, not much, and Kohli steers it to point
125kph, dances down and drives big but misses again as the ball moves away with some swing and the angle too
short and towards the ribs, he manages to tuck it away behind square on the leg side for two. Made him a little uncomfortable there, the bounce
that's the cutter - slightly slower outside off from back of length, has the extra bounce and Kohli stays deep to defend it
another swing and a miss! Kohli charged down this time and swung wildly, doesn't connect
angles it across a long way, Kohli doesn't move but chases it wildly and misses. That's called a wide, harsh call
closer to the batsman now and shorter, Kohli hops back and defends it to point
angles it in a bit too much towards the pads and Kohli gets one towards midwicket
inside edge for four! It came in sharply after pitching on back of length, Kohli didn't move his feet at all and swung outside off, got an inner edge and that just missed the stumps to beat fine leg
room for Kohli this time and he punches it nicely too, but finds cover point
waits for the ball to come towards off and blocks it back
some movement outside off from back of length, Kohli jabs it past point for one
full outside off, drives to long-off off the front foot
length ball on middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
short ball wide outside off, runs it down to third man with an open face
short ball outside off, checks the pull and gets it to midwicket
short at the chest, pulled to fine leg off the under-edge
googly, full outside off. Leans in and flicks to midwicket
short ball at middle stump, onto the back foot to whip it to deep square's left
good length outside off, driven back on the up to Rashid
front of the hand, length and wide outside off. Left alone.
full outside off, whippy drive to sweeper on the front foot
a fuller and wider ball outside off, Kohli tries to drive but gets a thick outside edge to third man
good length outside off stump, Kohli stays back and opens the face, the man at backward point dives to his right to field
good bounce from a good length outside off, Kohli stays back and defends on the off side
strays on to middle and leg, flicked off the pads behind square for a single
he checks the shot - and the ball goes off the bottom, and inside half of the bat, and yet it absolutely sails over mid-on.

pushes on a good length delivery, looking to force a good length ball outside off through the cover field. But though it beats Nicholls at extra, Williamson is there as back up, and if his throw at the stumps hit target at the non-strikers', Iyer might have been in trouble
surprises the batsman with an excellent bouncer! It's sharp as well, coming up to the badge and Kohli is fairly late in going for the hook. There is no square leg though to take the catch
pummels the ball down the ground! Steps down to it, not caring it is delivered at 141 kph, and thwack! Umpire runs for cover. Boult ducks lest he be hit
fierce hit to cover point! Lifts himself to his full height and bullies a fairly short ball with a perfectly vertical (if angled) bat to the fielder
runs the short ball on off stump down to third man
Kohli has seen off the Amir threat, he strides forward and opens the face to play the last ball to backward point, 141 kph
that ball kept low on a good length outside off, Kohli stays in his crease and defends, couching after he does so, he looks at the bottom of his bat after the delivery, 146 kph
pushed off the front foot towards point
sensational shot from Kohli, moving forward to a length ball outside off and driving it so smoothly through covers, smack out of the middle, can watch that all day
that's chipped off the hips in the air but wide of the fielder at square leg and once it beats the infield the ball races to the boundary, Kohli jumped back and across to hit that ball sweetly
Kohli stays back again and opens the face to steer it to gully
good length and the ball bounces a bit more on Kohli as he pushes forward to play the ball to point
good length angling across the right-hander, Kohli stays in his crease and plays into the covers, that was nearly 147 kph
a full ball outside off, Kohli reaches for it instead of moving closer to it and mis-times the ball into the off side

the ring of fielders is close on the off side, Kohli punches the ball off the front foot to point, the fielder throws the ball at the bowler's end and hits the umpire just above the knee! He's hopping in pain. Umar Akmal raises his arm in apology. 146 kph
Kohli has a wry smile as an Amir bouncer sails over the top of his head and also over the top of the keeper's head, that was so high, a wasted delivery
edged between slip and gully to third man! Amir slanted the short of a length ball across the right-hander, Kohli was on the front foot and poked at it
good length outside off, Kohli pushes forward and defends towards cover. Amir has been a joy to watch today

another massive appeal for lbw, the umpire signals leg byes too so there was no inside edge! Kohli moved forward and across to turn the ball through square leg but missed. The ball swung into him and hit him on the thigh. That might have clipped the top of the stumps, really, really close
good length angling across the right-hander, Kohli stays back and blocks
good length outside off, seams away a touch, Kohli shoulders arms

this one is easier to hit, a full toss, and Kohli drives with perfect timing and power past the bowler, long off and long on have no chance, this is another blinder from this quite unbelievable batsman
Kohli meets a good length ball on off stump with a perfectly straight bat, solid defence
Amir goes around the wicket and gets the ball to hold its line from a good length outside off, Kohli prods and is beaten
and Kohli after a few deep breaths to recover still has the energy to smash the full ball hard and flat over cover, the fielder in the circle got finger tips on it but that was driven so, so hard
slower ball, that sticks in the pitch, and forces Kohli to lose his shape as he flicks it through midwicket
just short of Bairstow at deep square as the short ball nearly works, takes the top edge as he pulls but Bairstow can't reach it and the ball rebounds off him for a second run
driven to long on to make it 12 runs off the over
played on the off side for a single
pushed into the huge gap at midwicket and this time they are charging back for the second, Maxwell does the fielding himself and fires the throw towards the non-striker's stumps but Yuvraj is safe

that's it, yells an Australian player, as Kohli seems to have mis-timed the loft to long-off. He was off balance and the bat turned as he made contact, but the timing was still good enough to clear the fielder on the boundary. Just. Incredible.
hits the drive hard and straight towards the bowler, Zampa does well to get his body behind the shot
Kohli cuts off the back foot but can't beat point
pushed down the ground for a single
driven to wide long-on and will they run a second this time? Warner fumbles and so it's an easy second but Kohli now wants a third but Yuvraj says no
tossed up on middle and leg, the ball brushes his pad and rolls away
drives it to long-off
turns it to midwicket for a single
he drops it short and Kohli goes right back and clubs it over midwicket
gets forward and drives straight to cover
tossed up on middle and leg and clipped to midwicket
turns it to midwicket
pushes it down to long-on
glances it towards short fine leg
stays back and slaps it towards cover
makes room and he scoops it high over wide long-off, lovely shot
nudged off the front foot through midwicket, Yuvraj says no to the second again
pushes it towards mid-on
cut hard off the back foot but to the fielder at point
Kohli steps out and towards leg to turn a length ball off the pads through square leg
wanted to hit that over mid-off, but the pace and bounce carried the ball to the top half of the bat, spliced away to the sweeper cover
Behardien drops a sitter at long-on. Kohli has been given a reprieve, how much will that cost SA? Full on middle, Kohli bottom-hands it away to long-on, who just dropped it. They don't even run.
the next ball is put away for four. Short and wide, carved away through backward point for four. Too easy
shortish on middle and leg, worked away in the gap at square leg for a couple

what a shot! All the way for six. Some flight around off, Kohli just strides forward and extends his drive, extends it so high that the ball races away over long-off. Sublime timing. Picture-perfect T20 stroke!
the googly on middle and leg, nudged away to square leg
flat outside off, 85 kph, pushed to long-on. India's 100 is up in the 9th over
89 kph, flat around off, worked to deep midwicket. A boundary an over means these two don't need to take risks
flat around off, Kohli opens the bat face and carves the ball to short third man for one

and given! Shamsi is absolutely thrilled, but Kohli reviews! Kohli is quite confident. Flat outside off, the ball pitches and spins back in, beats Kohli on the inside edge and hits him in front of middle and leg. Hit him on the back pad. Three reds on HawkEye, so the decision stays. And he finds consolation for the drop in the previous over. Some respite for SA.
incredible placement! Kohli steps out to a short of a length ball and whips it with lovely use of his wrists, generating lots of power and piercing the gap between long on and deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, some drift, Kohli looked to hit that through long-on, but the angle of the ball took it to mid-off
lots of flight on middle and leg, drilled to long-on
excellent line, full around off, defended back with the head over the ball, and eyes on it.
a 140 kph, length delivery around off. Fuller than that. Kohli sits in his crease and defends.

gloved and gone! KOHLI FAILS! It's a snorter of a delivery, back of a length, some extra bounce and climb as the ball moves away too ever so slightly. That's all you need for a man in form (not too much movement to beat the bat). It bounces, takes the glove and carries low to Klaasen. It's another jaffa. Two of them today for two wickets.
another fumble in the field, Finch at deep cover this time, Kohli is able to convert his cracking cover drive for a single into two runs
short of a length and straight, Kohli pulls to deep midwicket and takes on Maxwell's arm! He dives desperately to make his crease but the throw from Maxwell was wide of the stumps
Hazlewood returns and bowls a slower ball on a good length just outside off, a cutter, Kohli charged and tried to hit through cover but missed
a full ball on off stump, Kohli plays a punchy drive to long off
played towards mid-on and they run the first one urgently but Warner rushes in from the deep and prevents the second
Kohli steps out again and hits the ball towards long off for a single
not often that you see such a shot from Kohli these days, charges out to a short ball and hacks at it across the line, gets a bottom edge close to leg stump
bowled wide outside leg stump, Kohli reaches for it and plays through square leg
good length delivery outside off, punched to cover. Three dots from Morris. Can he finish well?
heaves it towards deep midwicket and Chibhabha had actually fielded it one handed at the boundary falling to his left, he falls and touches the rope, fab attempt though
gets forward and pushes it down to long-on
delicious full toss from around the wicket and Kohli gets under it for a thwack over deep midwicket.
again! Shakib senses Kohli's urgency and yorks him again as he tries to come down the track. Dug out to long-on
one ups the advancing batsman. Kohli yorks himself on leg stump
darted into the pads and Kohli flicks it to long-on
shortish and outside off, flayed towards long-off
his slower balls have been good tonight, Mash. As have been his field settings. Three men are on the deep on the leg side and deep midwicket is called into play as Kohli pulls
whipped away wide of long-on and Kohli scampers across for the second run. Good work from India, pinching all these runs
cuts a slower, shortish ball from middle stump to point.

dropped! Oh, you can't do that with Kohli! Certainly not after you've deceived him. Kohli was jumping down the track, and is surprised by the bounce on it. Panics and tries to power the ball away. The ball hits the splice and comes back at Al-Amin, it was looping back so he had enough time. Sticks out a right hand during his followthrough and shells it
comes down the track to a back of a length ball and pierces the gap at cover. Didn't do too much, simply punched it. Nearly went for four if not for Mahmudullah's efforts.
width offered and Kohli's flashing blade makes enough contact with the ball to scurry away to deep point. Not perfectly timed
takes a ball on off stump and works it into the leg side again. They key is in waiting for the ball when Kohli does this.
worked to midwicket again
races down the track, but the slower pace and the loopy flight deceives Kohli. Inside edge to Shakib, a better fielder, at midwicket now.

and even when its tossed up, Kohli goes back and works a ball well outside off through midwicket. Kohli and Raina have picked out that Mash was the fielder and they pinch a second. The fielder does well to throw the ball to the bowler's end, because Raina seems the slower of the two and he would have been out
goes back and whips it to short midwicket. The trajectory to Kohli's gotten quite flat
steps forward to a fuller ball and presents the straight bat to long-on
strays down leg to Kohli and the flick off the hips skims away to the man at deep square leg
stays back, waits on the ball and pats it to long-on
that's more of a slider and Kohli leaps back in his crease to smear it through the covers. Confident shot
goes back to a relatively full ball and blocks
oooh, he's stepped away too far. That was there for the cut, except he underestimated the turn and ends up too far down leg to connect
the stumps light up behind him, which means out for Kohli. Goes for a sweep to a quicker ball from Shuvagata and with him playing with only half a bat, the percetanges aren't with him. Math wins
drops it short outside off and he makes room and cuts past backward point

taken at deep midwicket. Silence befalls Thiruvananthapuram. It's quick, it's short and Kohli sees an opportunity for six more. He goes back and pulls to deep midwicket, hits in the air, all along looking to clear the boundary, but he doesn't get enough power behind that. Straight to the fielder, reverse-cupped catch. Not a bad innings at all.
over long-on. Sodhi makes the mistake of bowling this one full on leg. Kohli can just get forward and lift the ball over long-on, close enough to the pitch to go through with the shot
