tossed up on middle and leg, he turns it to fine leg
makes room and forces it down to long-on
leans forward and drives the ball towards wide long-on, Virat wants the second but Yuvraj says no, his leg may not be good enough for hard-run runs yet
played back to the bowler
Kohli goes right back into his crease and hits the ball smoothly through midwicket
flicked off the pads to deep square leg for a single
good length but the line is down leg side, that's a wide
there's that cover drive from Kohli, gets forward and punches the ball through the line, timing it superbly, they could have run two but Yuvraj's leg isn't in good shape
defended on the front foot, outstanding spell so far from Watto
Kohli leans forward and across with superb balance in his crease and flicks the fuller ball deftly through square leg
another slow one outside off, Kohli stays back and steers to third man for a single
a full and slower ball on middle and off, Kohli leans across and taps it to midwicket
that's only his second dot ball, and it pinged off the middle off a front foot punch to cover
shortish on leg stump, Kohli has no trouble whipping it off his hips
keeps back in his crease against a back of a length ball and secures a single to third man. Didn't reach too far from his body there like Australia want him to
a little hesitation - you remember what happens when Kohli runs Rohit out right? - but not this time. Soft hands, back of a length ball slotted into the covers, easy single
they made him reach, but that time Kohli made enough of a connection to find back-to-back boundaries, this one at third man. Mohali preps a war cry "Kohli, Kohli, Kohli!"

that was on off stump, but a handy little shuffle across puts him right over the ball, and with such balance, all that was needed was a flick of the wrists. Outrageous strokeplay, and yet it looked so smooth
and that area outside off is where Australia pitch the first one. Kohli is forward with an angled bat

caught behind! Kohli is the only man going for this total and with his loss, India might be done. Again, he is forced to take a risk, haring down the pitch and looking for a lofted shot down the ground. Santner bowls it quick, cramps him up and gets a thick edge which Phillips takes very well, close to his chest.
yet another cutter outside off, the ball spinning in, 114 kph, cut down to short third man
another cutter, full outside off, clipped to long-on for one. Just four off the over
lovely shot. It's short on middle, Kohli rocks back, picks the length and pummels a pull through midwicket, finds the gap with ease
quick outside off, defended into the point region for a run
strays down leg this time, another wide
full delivery around off, pushed back towards cover. Tidy bowling
full and wide outside off, some away shape, Kohli skews a drive towards point. Miller dives to his right and saves a run
he's grabbed another! It was straight to him, but it was hit with some power. A full ball at off stump, Kohli drives and it's right back at Jordan in his followthrough
defends a tossed up delivery on off stump, opening the face
pulls the short ball on off stump to long-on, and with it being a quicker delivery, he isn't able to get his timing going. Kohli slams his bat down on his pad in frustration
fuller delivery on middle, Kohli taps it through midwicket, looking for two, but the man races in from the deep quickly enough to deny that
offcutter outside off, Kohli stays beside it and cuts to the right of backward point. Good work from the fielder, putting in a dive and keeping it to a single
hammers the ball to the straight boundary! A whirl of the wrists as he meets it on the half-volley, head right over it, weight coming forward, timing top class.
pushes it through on middle and leg, Kohli looks to work it through midwicket, but misses
waits on the back of a length delivery on leg stump, adjusts to the turn and bounce and defuses the ball to midwicket
one-bounce and into the sightscreen! Beautiful batting, using his feet to get to the good length ball on leg stump on the half-volley and lifting it back over Santner's head

drives inside out through cover to get his fifty. Celebrates it with an almost casual raise of his bat, his head bowed, his mind full of the desire to play through the innings. He's in one of his moods. LIke he was against Australia in Mohali in the last World T20
waits on the good length ball on off stump and slices it to short third man
that's the strength he draws from those wrists! He digs out a ball that is very nearly a yorker and deposits it to the midwicket boundary
length ball, but Kohli goes deep in his crease to tuck this to midwicket's right
looks for the slog upon seeing a short and wide delivery - but with Munro taking the pace off the ball, it is enough to make even Kohli, in this form, mistime his shot through midwicket

comes down the pitch, making room, but Milne foxes him with a slower ball bouncer. Kohli sees it coming up to his head and he evades it, looking for a wide. But he has advanced and so can't expect such liberties
a full toss, Kohli was out of his crease and managed to pull towards the leg side

that is amazing, what has Kohli done here? The ball was full just outside off, there are two fielders at backward point and Kohli square drives the ball hard into the ground, opening the face to slice it and it bounces over the fielder and screams to the boundary
steps out again but Brathwaite counters by firing the ball full and fast outside off, Kohli reaches for it but is beaten
steps out of his crease to take the ball almost on the full and drives to long off
pushed off the front foot behind point and Kohli sprints to keep the strike
a full ball outside off, Charles has to rev through the gears to run to his right and slide to intercept that Kohli cover drive
dabbed on the leg side for a single
a scorching square drive, just a little wide outside off and Kohli flays the ball through point with his wrists, that raced away
in the blockhole, Kohli tries to drive on the leg side but gets an inside edge on to his boot and towards the bowler
a full ball on middle and leg, Kohli plays a whippy drive to long on but timed it too well to get more than a single
nearly in the blockhole again and Kohli drives through cover, giving Charles more work to do on the boundary, he's earned his dinner tonight, has Charles
full, wide outside off, left alone and he gets the wide call...looked to be just inside the marker, but that's only a guide
another short one, pace off this time at 69mph, pulled to deep square

the yorker, Kohli digs it out in front of square and they race through for a single, and then they race back for the second, I have not seen better running in cricket than Kohli and Dhoni in these last two games
the length ball has disappeared! Kohli gets on the front foot and uses the wide outside off to free his arms and smash the ball cleanly over long on
nearly in the blockhole outside off, Kohli is good enough to open the face as he drives and place the ball through backward point

that is a sensational drive and the timing is so good that even the rapid Russell can't cut it off from long-off ! Kohli came forward and moved slightly outside leg and drove a length ball on the up through extra cover, Russell was tearing across the turf and dived but the ball beat him comfortably
a shorter delivery, rocks back and drives to cover
this time it's out of the middle...lovely footwork then launches it over long-on. Stand and admire.
shorter, pulled into midwicket
tucked off the pads, a googly, worked through square leg
mis-timed back to the bowler, Bravo does not turn around and try and run out Dhoni

that's swatted flat in the air, Brathwaite comes running in from the long-on boundary and dives forward to try and catch it, the ball bounces just in front of him and goes past for four. Kohli dragged that with a flat bat from wide outside off
on the pads, pushed through midwicket and Bairstow keeps them to a single
a length ball outside off, Kohli's bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives to deep cover
a low full toss is drilled down the ground, skims to Stokes at long-on who just manages to keep his feet away from the boundary marker

off the toe of the bat and wide of the keeper to the third man boundary! Kohli keeps whipping those wrists of his and somehow manages to place his mis-hits too, that ball was full outside off, he was aiming for cover point by making room and driving

a mis-hit has resulted in a hard-run two and Kohli has another fifty! He played a checked-pull and the ball lobbed in the air towards mid-on, the fielder had to come in from the long on boundary and there was enough time for Dhoni to race back to the danger end
comes down the pitch then drives and misses, couldn't quite hold his shape against a wider delivery
stunning! This time he stays in the crease and drills a scorching, skimming, drive over extra cover. Even Kohli smiled at that one. The power in those wrists and arms, wow
short outside off, he fetches it and pulls to deep midwicket
short of a length and Kohli pulls it behind square for four, he knows where the field is so he uses his wrists to place it away from the fielder in the deep
flicks a very full delivery from outside off to long-on
a high full toss outside off, driven off the front foot - he was out of his crease - through cover
a slower ball, short of a length, picks out deep midwicket with a short-arm pull
there you go, Kohli plays it towards midwicket gently and they thunder between the wickets for the second run
Kohli steps out of his crease and waits a bit for the slower one to reach him before driving to the right to deep cover, Samuels the fielder and he can't prevent the second

a full toss, Kohli meets it on the front foot and whips it powerfully to deep square leg, Russell comes hurtling to his right and dives at top speed, but he was touching the rope as he made contact with the ball
the slower ball on a good length, Kohli pushes gently towards wide mid-on, Charles has to come in from the deep and cannot prevent the second. Bravo is frustrated, Kohli gives Rahane the thumbs up
mistimed slap on the up flies off the inside half of the bat and bounces wide of mid-on. Stepped out and wanted to lift this straight over the bowler
top edge as he closes the face early this time. Short of a length ball rises up at his chest and he's not in control of this. Lands short of cover
pushed uppishly into the off side. Tries to lean into a length ball on the up, but this rises and he has to open the face in the end
length ball on leg stump, steps out and clips it to deep square

taken at deep square! Move over Ashes, we have a new contest - Peter Chase has Kohli caught in the deep again. Gets a short ball to climb nicely up at his ribs to curb the full-blooded pull. It's a half-minded loft from under the ball in the end as he steps out. Made him very awkward with that one. The fielder has some distance to cover to his right before waiting a long time. Does so and takes it low to his right.
a half volley outside off stump, Kohli stays so balanced, so still in his crease, uses his wrists to open the face of the bat and square drive through point, superb knowledge of where the field is
the slower ball short of a length outside off, Kohli pulls too early and is beaten
goes wide of the crease and angles the ball into the pads, Kohli tries to play a whippy drive but inside edges into the pad. No inside edge. Leg bye.
Warner runs to his right from long on but can't prevent the second, Kohli's wrists are too good, they drive the ball just wide of fielders to convert ones into twos

they go berserk as the ball sails over the wide long-off boundary! Kohli steps out of his crease and lofts the short of a length ball through the line, it didn't look like he timed that perfectly but the ball carries over the boundary rider

this is mind-boggling batting, that ball is nearly in the blockhole outside off, there was a bit of width and that;s all Kohli needs, he opens the face of the bat and plays an incredible square drive that beats the diving fielder in the deep
short ball and Kohli meets it on the front foot and pulls in front of deep backward square leg, sensational timing and India are four runs closer
another one in the blockhole, Kohli tries to flick but can't make proper contact, the ball goes to short third man off the pad, Watson appeals but that is missing leg
another 50 for Kohli, he gets there by swatting a short ball to deep midwicket, he barely celebrates, did not even raise his bat, he looks super determined and knows the job is far from done

two more, this is incredible running, Kohli steps out and flicks the ball off his toes, he and Dhoni are absolutely steaming between the wickets, #mohalisobig that the Aussies are struggling to keep these to ones
driven to deep cover and there's no problem with the running between the wickets anymore, Dhoni and Kohli race through for two, they are turning it on now
back of a length outside off, 133 kph, some away swing, Kohli cuts with his feet rooted to the crease, towards point
the Kohli cover drive, full and wide outside off, the ball moving away, caressed towards cover.
out comes that Kohli drive for runs. Full and wide, the ball moving away, drilled through cover for a couple. The sweeper cover gets around
good single, around off, tapped towards point for a quick run. He often gets his innings going with runs like this
full and wide, in the slot and carved through cover, the Kohli trademark. His feet aren't right, but his timing is.
another good single, back of a length outside off, pushed away towards point for a quick single.
good length, on middle and leg, worked away to deep square leg
length ball on middle stump, flicked neatly to deep square's left. Waited a long time before turning the wrists on that
length ball outside off, firmly punched on the up to cover
tossed up on middle stump, nicely forward to drive to long-on
another at deep midwicket! Length ball on leg stump, clears the front foot and slogs, finds the fielder. As easy as that. Four wickets for Chase.
slower ball short of a length outside off, steered from the crease to short third man for a quick single
clipped off the pads through midwicket for another single
driven to long off, Russell is the fielder and there's no two on offer
cut off the back foot to deep point for a single
steps out and towards leg to flick a full ball through midwicket, just the single this time
pushed towards long on for a single

stays back and dabs the ball with soft hands into the gap at midwicket, Russell steams in from the deep but even he can't prevent the second, I doubt anyone would have been able to if Russell couldn't. A batsman was one short!
cut off the back foot to deep point
turned through midwicket with those sublime wrists and this time the double is easier to complete
slashes and four! The thick edge flies between the keeper and short third man, Kohli marks the occasion with a fist pump. Adrenalin is not in short supply out there.
another run out chance! Kohli races back for the second and has to dive full length but he would not have made it had Ramdin collected the throw cleanly from deep square leg
full and straight, he's down the pitch and it takes a thick inside edge behind square

another bouncer, Kohli misses the pull and then looks expectantly at the umpire, there's no call of no-ball at first but Kohli insists and eventually the arm goes up. West Indies are not happy. Free hit coming up
the faster bouncer, outside off, Kohli drops his wrists and lets it go
slides down leg side and Kohli tucks it off his pads behind square
b-e-autiful! Kohli eases down the pitch lashes a good length ball outside off to the left of long-off and Williamson's dive isn't enough
yorker on middle and leg, Kohli squeezes it to third man to retain strike
advances again and chips a good length ball to long-off - he wants more than that, but Kohli has to check his shot because he doesn't get the length to get under
shortish and outside off, Kohli eases it to cover

in the slot for the cover drive, full and outside off, that's food and drink for Kohli, he unfurls his favourite shot, that drive and it is too good for every man on the field, he has bossed this chase and how
Kohli steps out and swings across the line, beaten by a slower short of a length ball

Kohli is toying with the bowling and the field, he steps out, to a length ball and lofts on the up flat over extra cover, this is batting of the highest calibre, this game is all but done, or is it? India need a run a ball
short ball on leg stump, Kohli is too good to miss out, fine leg is in the circle, Kohli pulls, and beats the fielder in the circle
past the glove as he looks to play the hook. And not called wide. This bouncer looked to be well down leg side.

Kohli has been reprieved and how! Bravo beat him with a dipping slower ball and for some unearthly reason, at this stage of the game, Kohli wanted to steal a bye to the keeper. He charged out of his crease for a crazy bye and Rahane sent him back. Ramdin under-armed at the stumps and just missed off stump. Kohli was so far out that Bravo collected the throw in the middle of the pitch and threw at the stumps, but he missed leg stump by a whisker. Kohli survives. West Indies have their hands on their heads. What on earth has happened.
length ball on off, plays it late, tapping it on the legside
chops this cut to deep point
worked to deep square leg from his front foot from outside off

oh well bowled. Kohli makes room and is looking to hit another rising ball on the up, but Kesrick has rolled his fingers on that one. Gets a bit of grip in the pitch and Kohli's bat turns. Lobs a simple one to Narine at mid-on
short and wide now, easy peasy, sways back and deposits this slice to the wide third man boundary
what. How did he do that. He has whipped a short ball off the front foot, from off stump, over the long-on boundary. Boycott has just parcelled this guy the text book
back of a length on middle stump, plays it from under his eyes, drops it into the midwicket region with soft hands
stays put this time, doesn't look to make room, and so this is a wide down leg side
and again. Full and slanted down leg
loses his shape. Charges at this length ball and looks to lift it over mid-off. Gets contorted and the head is out of the path of the ball, which climbs over the stumps

speechless! And that's his highest T20I score as well. India win, and he pumps his fists in delight. But what a classy way to end the match. Full, outside off, and he checks a glorious drive over long off to hit the final nail in the coffin. Proceeds to remove his helmet, stands in the middle of the pitch, and then raises his arms so that the crowd can enjoy the moment too. India win by six wickets
full, outside off, and he comes down the wicket before driving to wide long off for another couple
magnifique! Full, outside off, and he goes inside-out over cover for six! Kohli is pumped. Mutters something to himself before punching his own bat in aggression. Team 200 too
full, on middle, and bunted to wide long on. They scamper back for two
plays this controlled pull all along the ground to deep square
works this to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, and Kohli drills a shot to wide long off. Wanted two, but Iyer didn't see the captain's call
good length on middle. Flicked to the leg side for a single. Kohli runs across to the other side with wobbly legs like Mr Bean
length ball on middle, but going down the leg side
creamed! Full, angling in, and whipped with beautiful wrists over deep midwicket. Gives the bowler a stare too...
length ball, angling across, and he plays a late cut to third man for a single
full on middle, and driven with the bat's open face to extra cover
attempted yorker on middle, and guided to wide long on
oye, hoye, hoye! Full, in the slot, and he breaks his wrists to whip this beautifully over wide long on. The crowd goes ballistic
Kesrick takes cover! And he gives Kohli the stare after getting hit for four. Full on off, and Kohli drills a flat shot straight over the bowler to the long-on boundary
attempted yorker, on leg stump, but dug away well to wide long on. Enough time to jog back for the second
very short, outside off, and all Kohli can do is slap this down to long on for one
flayed over short third man! Back of a length, outside off, and Kohli opens the bat's face before playing a cut over the infield

ripper! See if you can hit that, best batsman in the world! Malinga runs in and hits the deck with a ball that bites into the pitch and produces legcut so substantial that it squares Kohli up and beats his leading edge by a mile. Malinga smiles...
beaten twice in a row. Kohli knows he is in a contest now as a back of a length delivery, angled across him, ignores his best efforts to reach it
swivels on the back foot to swat a short ball to deep midwicket

gets another short ball to rise up towards Kohli's chest, but he lines up right behind it and taps it to point. Sees the opportunity for a single, and with a direct hit from Prasanna and the ball ricocheting to no-man's land, the Indian captain secures an overthrow
stays legside of the length ball and lashes it out to the sweeper

soft dismissal! But not before going past Rohit Sharma as the world's most prolific T20I run scorer. This was slow, short, and Kohli mistimes a cut. Lobbed in the air, and taken by short third man. Big move by Kesrick to not celebrate. Simply puts a finger to his mouth... and silences the crowd
flighted too much but Kohli can't put it away. Driven to the fielder at cover
punched off the back foot to wide long on
full, but wide outside off. No problem says Kohli, as he goes beyond the stumps and drags a sweep to the cow-corner boundary
good length, outside off, and cut behind square. Finds the infielder
full outside off, and turning away. Tries to fend at it, and goes past his outside edge
edged! Full on middle, and he backs away to go inside-out over cover. Finds an outside edge and goes over the vacant slip-cordon for four
low full toss on his pads, and whipped away to deep midwicket. Quick single, and then Kohli calls his partner for the second
length ball, angling in, and he muscles a cut to deep point
overpitched on off, and driven straight back to the bowler. Gets a fingertip to it...slowing the ball's pace down
length ball, outside off, and bunted away to the off side
what. a. shot! Full, in the slot outside off, and he simply checks a lofted shot into the second tier! Long off a mere spectator this time. Fifty for VK
full, outside off, and the googly is nudged to the leg side. They scamper across for one, but the throw from the fielder hits the stumps at the non-striker's end. TV umpire says not out
back of a length outside off, has the room to cut but chops it down into the ground. No run
down the track, he spotted him and banged it in short, but Kohli adjust well to paddle this square

length outside off, Kohli moves across and uses his wrists to gently twirl it to midwicket. The man is very deep and Kohli absolutely sprints between the wickets to take two. Dube manages to keep up with his skipper too
length ball on the stumps, punched to long-on
hangs back, expecting the change in length, but this is a really quick ball. 87 kph. Kohli only just about manages to cut to third man
races down the track and dismisses a length ball into the sightscreen. Gets close enough to the ball, if not right to the pitch, and swings his arms through the line
full and outside off, pushes it to the sweeper
late cuts from off stump, but with there being no pace on the ball, and him not adding any to it, short third man can mop up

turns a shortish delivery to midwicket, he has mistimed the ball so he thinks there is the chance for a single, it's risky, but the throw isn't on target and Kohli sprints through. This is good from Sri Lanka. They're making Kohli work so very hard for mere singles.

that is very tight and had Prasanna hit the stumps direct with his underarm, things would have been interesting. Kohli blocks to point and wants the quick single, Rahul obliges despite the risk and gets through safely enough
length ball wanders tamely down leg

only just clears the three men chasing it from the circle on the off side. Kohli, like Rohit before him, drives on the up at a ball that is far too short for the shot. Gets struck high on the bat and manages to evade point, cover and mid-off
nice surprise quicker bouncer outside off, but Kohli rises up on his toes and guides it down to short third man with a horizontal bat
fires in the googly, and Kohli, rocking back, pulls it hard to deep midwicket.
breaks back in sharpy, Kohli plays off the backfoot when he may have been better off going forward. Rolls back to the bowler
makes a hint of room and punches past the diving cover fielder
fired in quicker. Kohli was giving himself room manages to cut it to point
too short, and cracks a cover drive but a diving stop to his right from the man stationed there keeps the runs down to one
fired into him, worked to midwicket
stretches his front foot out and works this to mid-on's right
good short ball outside off, Kohli moves across and defends it softly into the offside to take a quick single
slower ball, pushed back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
was there an inside edge on that. Looks like, West Indies not reviewing. That swung in late and hit Kohli in front of the stumps. There were two sounds, and replays confirm an inside edge.
another good short ball outside off and Kohli goes for the pull and can only connect with air.
too short but not enough room, keeping it on the stumps, Kohli punches to cover
full toss down the leg side, too much for the keeper standing up to gather also
regal. Backs away and stays so, so still. This is a good length ball at middle stump, but he's punched it on the up through extra cover
back of a length, angled into the corridor. Looks to stab it to third man, beaten on the outside edge
back of a length, angled into the waist, watches it closely and opens the face to get it to third man
shot. Now he knows what's coming. Stays put in the crease, cuts down his shuffle a tad and slaps this bouncer to the midwicket boundary

miscues the pull but gets four! Dreadful shot. Kesrick goes wide of the crease, bowls a bouncer in the corridor. They're sticking to their plans against Kohli. He's late on the pull but it floats over mid-off and into the boundary
back of a length, angled into the corridor, gets on his toes and taps this to cover point
short and wide outside off stump. That one was climbing sharply. Past his attempted upper cut
good length at middle stump, gets a big stride in and turns this into the leg side
good length outside off stump, driven on the up to extra cover
full and down the leg side, looks to flay this with a sweep, can't connect
back of a length outside off stump, zips off the pitch and beats the outside edge on the cut shot
back of a length in the corridor, opens the face and runs it to third man
good length, in the the corridor. Defended into the off side on the up
back of a length and nips back in towards off stump, cramps him up, forces him to defend off the back foot
fine leg goes back, but Kohli has hit it the other side of square leg this time. Length on the pads again and he stands tall to whip this
fuller and Kohli goes hard and straight, clearing his front leg and sending it bullet straight back past the bowler
shorter, and he goes back to cut, but backward point flings himself to his right to stop the ball going through
given room and width again, which he increases by going back and clearing his leg, cuts it hard to deep point
strays down leg and he'll have to rebowl that
slaps straight to cover
driven with the spin to deep cover
full, outside off, and he drags another slogged shot to deep midwicket. No real timing
full, on off, and he mistimes a slog-sweep to the sweeper fielder on the leg side. Enough time to jog back for the second
length ball, outside off, and he hammers a flat-batted shot to long on
yorker, but beyond leg stump. Kohli skips out of the ball's way. Kesrick gives Kohli a stare but the batsman asks the bowler to go back to his run-up. Sparks flying!

slower ball, length on off, and angling in. Tries to pull, but under-edged onto his body. He rushes across for one but complains to umpire Menon that Kesrick Williams was getting in his way. Not the first time today. It's all happening!
low full toss on middle, and flicked off his toes to deep midwicket. Gotta settle for one
back of a length, outside off,  but it's the slower ball. Slapped down the ground to long off
full, and very wide outside off stump. Wide called
back of a length, outside off, and he rides the bounce before mistiming a flourished shot to mid off

waist-high full toss, angling into his body, and whipped past the fielder running at deep backward square leg. Kohli is not happy that the umpire has called it a legal ball. The square umpire is Mr Menon, and Kohli suggests that he played it from near his chest, but the reality is that he played the shot way in front of his body. A fifty-fifty call
rocks back and pulls to long-on
top edged over fine leg! Short ball on off, and he swivels with a fast bat swing. Gets enough to clear the fielder on the boundary line. Team hundred too
slower ball, wide outside off, and he shuffles across - exposing all three stumps - to whip a shot behind square. Hits his pads, and lobs away to the keeper. Uncharacteristic from VK
googly beginning from outside off, but turning in. Too close for the cut, but flayed to short third man nonethelss. They scamper across for one
nearly chopped on! Back of a length, outside off, and he makes room before trying to pull. Ball stays low, takes an under-edge and whizzes past the leg stump for four. So unlucky!
full on middle, and swept behind square. Wants two, but has to settle for one
superb yorker, which he clips through midwicket while off balance
flays this over cover, but there is protection in the deep
length outside off, Kohli stays beside it and cuts it to third man. One bounce to the fielder
short outside off and Kohli pulls hard to wide long-on.
length outside off, steered to short third man
that's all brute force and no timing - very unlike Kohli - but he'll get a boundary. Gave himself room and slapped it off the toe end over extra cover
wants to go over the top and lofts his straight drive but can't time it well, it bounces to long-on
saw him come down the track and threw it wide of off, but Kohli managed to get bat on ball, flays it over extra cover
good length ball, outside off stump, but just inside the tram-lines. Kohli wants the wide, but the umpire is firm
poor. Has fine leg and square leg in the circle -  a field for the full balls. Drifts it into the pads on a good length. Tucked off the pads past square leg
straying on his pads and Kohli, by pulling his front leg back has all the room he needs to whip it to deep midwicket
full and outside off, Kohli yanks it out to deep midwicket
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length and outside off, Kohli tries to upper cut it, but can't reach. Demands a wide, but is denied

take a half-volley outside off and instead of doing the most logical thing - slamming it over the covers - Kohli whips it to the midwicket boundary with a whirl of his wrists powerful enough to create a tornado and then punches the air in triumph. Or he's showing off.
full toss, swings down leg as Kohli tries to pull. He doesn't make contact, the swing takes it too far from Dickwella. Called no-ball for overstepping and we will have a free hit next ball

full and outside off, drills it to extra cover, but only for a single and Kohli is fiercely upset. Yells at himself, then smashes his bat down on his pads. Lesson in batting. Lesson in self-immolation
full toss outside off, Kohli steers it to the sweeper. He wants two, but Pandey yells "wait, wait, wait, wait" and holds his ground. Good call. Right call.
shortish and outside off, dabs it to short third man
whips a full delivery outside leg to the right of long-on
tosses it up outside off, drives through extra cover
nudges it calmly to long-on to retain strike
is that a wide? Seemed to finish inside the tramline outside off, but he has to factor in the left-arm-over angle. Full, angling away a long way, and Kohli reaches for the slash and misses

and India will finish on 240. Slower ball, full, angling away from off stump, and Kohli has to reach for it, but he manages to connect well, dropping onto his back knee to slog-sweep back over the bowler's head
off-stump yorker, and Kohli's attempted flick rolls gently back towards the bowler. He nailed the length, and the angle was to difficult to hit against

slower length ball angling away from off stump. It's a good angle to bowl with Kohli in such murderous leg-side-targeting mode. Gets down on his back knee for a flick/sweep along the ground through midwicket

what a ball. Out of nowhere, a full-pace bouncer whistles past Kohli's left ear as he looks to hook. There's an appeal for caught behind, and umpire Nitin Menon gives it out. Kohli's reviewed immediately, and there's an ultra-edge spike, but is that glove, or is that helmet? I think it's grazed the top of his helmet... Yup, no glove

shot. Full outside off, not wide enough to make him reach for it, and not close enough to cramp him for room. He doesn't even need that much swinging room, because of the power he can generate with his wrists, and he whips it away over the midwicket boundary with another bottom-handed whip
back of a length outside off, steps forward and swipes to long-on
slower ball outside off, clears his front leg and whips it down the ground, to the left of long-on. And oh, Pollard has overstepped here. Not by a long way, but it's long enough

length ball outside off, and Kohli drives powerfully, on the up, to the right of sweeper cover. Incredible generation of power through that flat-bat hit, and Hetmyer, moving to his right, seemed to have it under control, but he's deceived by bad bounce, and the ball turns like a legbreak past his hands and into the boundary

six more, and he brings up a 21-ball fifty. I don't know why he plays within himself so often in T20s. Length ball angling into the stumps, and he dismisses it over wide long-on with a powerful whip of his wrists
back of a length, angling into off stump, and Kohli is in stunning form. Clears his front leg and launches a baseball hit high over long-on
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed towards short third man

bang. Williams has bowled brilliantly through his first three overs, but he's missed his lengths marginally, twice, in this over, and both those balls have disappeared for six. Full, but not full enough to be a yorker, angling into off stump, and Kohli clears his front leg and bottom-hand whips it high over wide long-on
fullish, angling into the pads. Misses the flick and the ball rolls to the left of Pooran off the pad, slow enough for the batsmen to steal a leg bye
another slower ball, fuller this time, whipped away to deep midwicket
length on middle, defended into the leg side

taken at deep midwicket and Kohli falls. Those wrists, for once, fail him because the slower ball means the length ball doesn't come onto the bad as much as he had hoped. Flick carries all the way out to the boundary though so that should show you the power he can generate with a mis-hit. Walks off with a scowl thudding the face of his bat onto a fist. Apparently 82 off 54 is not enough for him.

he's top-edged the pull straight to midwicket. Is this an opening for the West Indies? Absolute lack of pace does Kohli in as he looks to pull from way outside off. Perhaps not the best shot but well, the surface can play tricks. The bowler rolled his fingers across the seam, gave Kohli absolutely no pace to work with. He's bitterly disappointed with himself. Match on!
tossed up a bit more, comes forward and gets across to flick this to long-on
slices the drive to point, Kohli struggling to force the pace. Slow surface and all that
excellent diving stop at midwicket by Hetmyer, moving swiftly to his left to stop the flick
flicks, uppish but straight to midwicket again
turns this to midwicket with the spin
full on the pads, eased to long-on
slower ball down leg, rolls to the keeper
incoming length ball, pushed to midwicket
hit on the pad as this breaks back in sharply, Kohli was looking to work this square on the leg side
good length ball on off stump, Kohli taps it behind point for a quick single. A risky one too, considering if the throw hit the stumps direct, Dhawan would have been long gone
good length ball outside off, Kohli drives on the up to cover. This pitch, which offered low bounce, is kicking up a bit now after the rain
tucked wide of midwicket
walks across to defend this incoming length ball back

lucky. Slower ball, back of a length, angling across the batsman. Looks to clear his front leg and hoick it over the leg side, and extra bounce takes the top edge and beats Pooran leaping to his right behind the stumps
rises with the bounce and angles this down to third man again
whips this full toss down to long-on
incoming slower ball, which Kohli dabs wide of the keeper and scampers a quick single
full at middle stump, plants the front leg across and tries to whip this into the leg side. Thick inside edge out to deep square
short of a length on middle, punched to long-on
punched on the up, one bounce to cover
whipped one bounce to long-on. Went full again, looking to attack the stumps
works this full ball to long-on
fuller, tossed up on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
full outside off, gets forward and flicks to long-on
moves across to cover the stumps and punch this from off to midwicket
fuller, doesn't get the timing right on the drive to cover
full on middle stump, looks to flick, leading edge out to deep point
welcome, Mr Brathwaite. Kohli steps out and flays this length ball over point! Opened the bat face a hint to pick the gap
spots the quicker ball outside off and Kohli slices it fine enough that short third man becomes little more than an usher. Puts pace on it as well to make sure it flies
length ball on the pads, whipped away to the left of a sprawling short fine leg, but deep backward square leg runs across to his right to cut it off
slower ball, shortish, wide outside off, jabbed to the right of backward point
clips a full ball on middle to deep backward square leg, where Head nearly slips as he races across an outfield that took a lot of rain
fuller delivery outside off, drives to long-off
whips a shortish delivery on leg stump past fine leg's left. Placement gets him the boundary
backs away to try and whip a slider through midwicket, but it keeps low and takes a bottom edge, then a bit of the pad to fine leg's right this time
drives to extra cover. Now its six off six for India to win. Good come back after conceding a boundary first ball
excellent work by Coulter-Nile at deep backward square leg, racing to his right and stopping a certain boundary. Kohli's flick, powered by those incredible wrists, still fetches two

goes over extra cover to seal the win! he plays the field so well - four men on the leg side boundary - he predicts the line would be on leg stump, so he makes room and since it is full as well he just gets under it and lifts it over the four men saving singles on the off side
fullish length, a very tight line on middle and leg, Kohli respectfully defends back

in the air and Behrendorff has run forward to catch it. He is claiming the catch, or is that an appeal for lbw? Seems like caught it is. Otherwise, height may have been a factor in the lbw. Back of a length, pushed across but zero room. Pitches around middle and comes into Kohli who tries to flick across the line. Gets a feather of an inside edge on to the high part of the bat. The ball lobs in the air and Behrendorff sprints forward to claim the catch. Excellent comeback after a first-ball four
nudges it to deep midwicket and has hits it soft enough to find a couple. But he still has to motor - he does and even beats a direct hit. The stamina he has is unbelievable
comes down the track and hammers a flighted delivery outside off to the long-off boundary
pulls out the inside out cover drive to bring up fifty. Outstanding innings. Paced perfectly. Sprinkled with outrageous shots
has to reach out with the legbreak placed well wide outside off. Kohli slaps it to cover, who misfields
walks at a length ball and works it to deep midwicket
good length ball outside off, steers it to third man
that's outstanding timing! The backlift is high, the bat comes down a blur, the wrists give it power and long-on is just being picked on. How is he meant to stop this?
shortish and outside off, punches it to cover, and with Prasanna misfielding, Kohli runs across and retains strike
shortish and outside off, punches it to deep point
presses forward to a loopy delivery outside off and pushes it through cover

skips down the track, but in doing so he is too close to the ball on leg stump. No matter, Kohli's wrists generate the power anyway and it needs a desperate dive from Perera at long-on to stop the boundary
drives a full delivery outside off to the left of long-off. Kohli wants two, but his partner disagrees
legcutter outside off, Kohli looms over it and turns it to long-on

back of a length and outside off, drills it to the extra cover boundary. But he has to beat the man inside the circle, does so to his left, he has to bisect the sweeper and the long-off, does so. Precision mark

short-armed pull to the backward square leg boundary. It's the length that helps him pull this off - short - but it is right over middle stump so despite the lack of room, Kohli manages to power it away. Such strong wrists
tossed up, drifts in and Kohli sends it scurrying to deep midwicket
wallops a short ball outside off to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, dabs it behind point
yorker outside off, Kohli steers it to point
shortish and outside off, dabs to third man
wide of the crease, angles this back-of-a-length ball in towards off stump, at full pace. Kohli ends up cramping himself for room with his step across the stumps. Can only block it back to the bowler
shortish slower ball, wide outside off, the width is an adjustment when he sees Kohli stepping across his stumps. Chops at it but can't beat backward point
slower bouncer outside off, pulled along the ground to deep square leg. 22 off the over
length ball close to off stump, angling in, and Kohli clears his front leg and puts away another nonchalant hit. Another bottom-hand whip, this time up and over midwicket and to the right of long-on
whack. That's the Ross Taylor hockey swat. Full-toss on the stumps, maybe an attempted slower one, and Kohli whips it away with a lot of bottom hand, over square leg
shot. India are getting a crucial move on here. Fullish, angling into leg stump, and those Kohli wrists generate enough power through an uppish flick to beat deep midwicket to his right

this one gives Kohli too much swinging room, and he takes full toll. Flighted ball, just outside off, not wide enough to make him reach for it, and Kohli slog-sweeps with good use of his bottom wrist to hit it hard over long-on
tossed up on middle stump, and Kohli's firm sweep goes straight to midwicket
loopy yorker-length ball outside off. Looks to make room and carve it away through point, ends up missing it, and the unsighted keeper fumbles too
shortish outside off, nice use of the wrists through the back-foot punch to deep point
slower ball, back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man

umpire killer! And Palliyaguruge does extremely well to drop to the floor! Boy, that was sooo ruddy close. They need helmets. They certainly need helmets when bludgeons like this come straight at them. Kohli sees a half-volley, sees red and sends it racing to the long-on boundary. Phew, that could have gone so ugly.

another slower short ball, wide outside off. Excellent bowling to his field, and Kohli chops it away, without much power, towards sweeper cover. Brilliant control from Williams right through - not easy to bowl that line and not concede wides
looks to hit the blockhole outside off, Kohli, standing on leg stump, wanting room to free up the off side, throws his hands at the ball and gets a thick edge to third man
tries to slice a yorker through point, but the ball sneaks under his bat outside off
short ball, doesn't quite rise on leg stump, so Kohli uses a straight bat to maximise contact, hammering it to deep midwicket
beaten as he pokes at a legbreak without moving his feet appropriately
good length ball, doesn't turn on off stump, so Kohli dabs it to short third man
shortish and outside off, Kohli works it through midwicket
wanders out of his crease again, adjusts his momentum seeing the change-up ball, and slides it to backward point
steps out, and Udana digs it in near his own half of the wicket and the ball soars over the batsman, and the wicketkeeper.
races down to the left-armer, having figured out 80% of his balls is slow and pastes it to long-off. Kohli is panting. He looks tired. But he's still running at full tilt
full toss, outside off, and it peels away to deep cover off a one-handed drive
they try to hide the ball, but doing so means they stray too wide outside off
spears it into leg stump, Kohli stands tall and crunches it to the right of long-on
extends his defence, after stepping out of his crease. And so a knuckle ball, which should ideally mess with a batsman's timing, sails over the infield. One-bounce four for minimum effort
walks at the full delivery outside off and pushes it to extra cover
regal. Effortless flick off his toes through midwicket. Not the best ball, there to be picked off, but there's few who can pick them off better than Kohli
back of a length on middle stump, punched confidently to long-on off the back foot

my, oh my. Kohli's run out. Length ball, angling towards, or maybe past leg stump. Provokes a big lbw appeal as Kohli shuffles across and tries to work it into the leg side. Hares out of the crease, looking to steal a leg-bye, and Jordan races through, picks up, and underarms a flick into the stumps to catch Kohli short. He had to turn around because Rahul didn't respond to his call, but there was definitely no single there. Hawkeye says the ball would have gone on to clip leg stump, but that's all academic now
slower ball outside off, gets on the front foot and pushes gently towards point
down the track and Perera shortens his length outside off, Kohli slaps it away to deep point
length ball close to off stump, stabbed to backward point

gone, Kohli departs, going for the aggressive option again - a clear sign of India looking to add more urgency to their T20 game. It's fairly full, angling into middle and leg, and Kohli whips it high in the air, to the left of deep square leg, and Bavuma, running to his left on the edge of the boundary, does very well to keep his feet inside the rope as he completes his catch, despite his momentum threatening to take him over. Didn't time it as well as he'd have liked, Kohli
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across and tucks it to deep backward square leg
flighted and full on off stump, whipped with the turn to deep midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, worked away through square leg
down the track and Shamsi fires it flat at his feet to deny him swinging room. Driven firmly to long-off, all along the ground
on the shorter side of a good length, angling into the stumps, punched down to long-on

down the track, and is that a drop? Kohli drills this flighted ball straight back at the bowler, at around shin height. Gets down quickly, and gets both hands to it, but the ball is hit so hard it just bounces off his palm before he can close his fingers around it
fuller on the stumps, takes a step forward and clips it but straight back to the bowler
fuller on the stumps, driven to mid-off
slightly short and Kohli goes on the back foot to pull to deep square leg
good length on a tight line outside off, possibly came off the pitch a bit quicker than Kohli expected as he was late on his attempted flick, ends up dropping it near his feet
thick edge falls short of third man. Kohli had a good old heave-ho at it, was targetting downtown Bangalore. Full and wide outside off, he threw his hands at it. The hand came off the bat
and Hendricks goes across the right hander again but Kohli plays it close to his body, moving across and pushes it into the offside
straighter line and Kohli deals with it by moving across and tucking it to square leg
fullish on the stumps, driven confidently to mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed gently towards backward point
slower ball outside off, gets his head over it and dabs to third man
fullish on middle stump, this is the slower ball. Kohli has to adjust to the lack of pace before he can clip to long-on
tossed up full on leg stump, and Kohli keeps his front pad out of the way to drive inside-out to long-off
back of a length close to off, punched to sweeper cover

goes back to a fairly full ball on middle stump, quicker than normal, and looks to whip through the leg side. The ball pitches just a touch shorter than he thinks and he pokes it back to the bowler, off the outside part of his bat, nearly the leading edge
full outside off, Kohli steps out to it and drives to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
back of a length outside off, punched towards sweeper cover
shortish outside off, and Kohli loses his 100% control. Not sure if it kept a little low, but he inside-edged his pull down past his off stump to the fine leg boundary
jumps down the track, making room to hit inside-out. The ball isn't quite full enough, on off stump, and he drags it to mid-on off the inside half of his bat
full, just outside off, and that's some elite whippage from Kohli. Places it to the right of long on, and that shot is greeted with applause from both sides
slower ball, wide outside off, and cut square to deep point
length, on off, and he rocks back deep into his crease before flicking off his pads past deep midwicket. Important boundary to get to his 21st T20I half-century
nudged off his pads to square leg for a single
length ball outside off, and Kohli's front-foot punch finds mid-off
full, on off. Driven to long on for a single
guided to deep point for a single
slower ball, full on off, and he drags a shot to deep midwicket
hits the stumps but with no power, and therefore Kohli survives. Looks to dig this away, but the ball trickled onto his stumps
length ball, outside off, and he pulls this square to deep midwicket
dug away, but straight to point! Looks to guide this yorker over the infield, but finds Evin Lewis. A terrific innings comes to a close
picks the offcutter and launches it into the stands over long-on! Among the cleanest hits of the night, in front of his hometown fans. His own eyes bug out at the distance the ball travels
very full outside off, meets it with the full face, angled just so, to push to sweeper cover
width outside off and Kohli tries to beat the hide off the ball, ends up mis-timing it a touch through cover point
driven towards deep cover and they run swiftly to come back for the second

Taskin leaps to his right in his follow through, changing direction and fielding the ball with his arm outstretched above his head, Kohli had driven that hard into the pitch and the ball was bouncing over the bowler before it was intercepted
played with soft hands close on the off side for a single, that was risky

shot! Kohli stands tall and moves towards the short of a length ball outside off - unlike Rohit who played away from his body - and slaps it hard through covers, Mahmudullah runs to his right on the boundary and fumbles, but recovers in time to save the four
down the track again, and this time the line is straighter. Kohli just whips it away over midwicket one bounce and over the rope, and he's piloted India home with a supremely controlled innings
down the track, and he can't force this whippy drive past the packed cover field
down the track and this time Siriwardana fires it in full and straight, clipped to long-on
down the track, and Kohli gets to fifty with a super shot. Flat-bats this wide-ish length ball cleanly over the covers
length ball angling into middle stump, clipped away through midwicket
tossed up on leg stump, steps down the track, gets inside the line, and drives with a straight bat to long-off
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full and wide, slapped to deep point
good length outside off, Kohli stays back and defends on the off side, Dhawan begins to run but gets sent back
full, just outside off, and he skips down the ground to drive. Finds the fielder at long off though
comes down the track again and pushes it to long-on
fired into the pads, and he goes back and clips through midwicket
length ball outside off, steered to third man
fuller outside off, driven to cover but off the toe end
length ball on leg stump, Kohli goes back and across to punch to long-on
fuller on the stumps, clipped to long-on from the front foot
walks across and whips this to deep square
fuller and quicker, Kohli jabs his bat down in time to punch it to mid-off
given some air, on a length and turning slightly away, Kohli stays in his crease and square drives it
tossed up full and wide of off stump, Kohli was giving himself room ends up slapping it to long-off from the toe end
length on off, comes on the front foot and pushes it gently to long-off for an easy single
a bit short and he rocks back to whack this through midwicket, but the bowler has protection in the deep there
full on off, uses his wrists to whip to deep square
fuller outside off and Kohli gets that front foot moving to get to the pitch of the ball and punch sweetly through extra cover
steers it towards point for a quick single
dismissed. Down the track and a flowing drive over extra cover, giving himself room and allowing the arms to swing freely through the line
takes a big lunge forward to get to the pitch of the ball and clips it to long-on
fuller outside off, Kohli doesn't play the shot often but he brings out a modified slog-sweep to midwicket. Wanted two, but Dhawan wants to play safe
goes well across the right-hander, who has room to slap it through the offside

run out opportunity missed by the bowler. That was a suicidal single. Kohli was coming down the track and the ball rolls down off his pad, and the batsmen decided to go through. Pretorius ran down in his follow through and picked up the ball but his under-arm throw from almost at the crease misses the stumps! Don't think Dhawan would have made it.
full on middle, goes across again and flicks it off his front foot to deep square
length on the fourth stump, walks across to flick, but can't go past square leg
fuller, tapped past the bowler
flicked off his hips behind square, hung in the air a while

review for a caught behind. There was definitely a noise as it went between Kohli's bat and body, it could have been inside edge, or it could have been pad. replays show it's the pad. But that was a very close shout on lbw too! No caught behind but that ball was hitting the top of the stumps having flicked his back pad, and it's umpire's call by the narrowest of margins on the lbw! South Africa were looking fro a caught behind, with de Kock having dived to his left to hold it.
length ball outside off, steered to short third man
on the up drive to extra cover's left off a good length ball. amazing shot, and shape
short ball outside off, pulled from his chest down to deep midwicket. Loud call by Pant of 'NO' to stick to a single. Kohli wanted two
yorker on the fifth stumps, he gets low and gets his bat horizontal to guide it towards point for a quick single
fuller on off, driven crisply but straight to cover
strays on the pads and is flicked to short fine leg's left
flat on the stumps, down the track, bunted back to the bowler
takes on the bouncer, going back and pulling it from in front of his helmet to deep midwicket. That was an impressive short one on target, but Kohli dealt with it expertly
driven to cover
pats this back of a length ball down with a horizontal bat outside off and is looking for a single but there isn't one

What. A. Shot. This is Kohli just toying with the bowling. Length ball from Rabada at pace on leg stump, and he goes back and nonchalantly flicks it off his pads. It's such great timing that it carries all the way past the boundary. Without even trying to hit it hard
slower ball on the stumps, he read it and tapped it around the corner with soft hands. Wanted two but Iyer is hesitant about it and that moment is enough to stamp out thoughts of a second run
attempted yorker outside off, driven to extra cover
punched down to long-on
bowler compensates for Kohli's saunter down the track by bowling too short but Kohli stays put this time and flays a cut through point

down the track and that's just unbelievable timing! Gets to fifty too. Looked for all the world like it was a shot for two runs. He had stroked it, gently not with punch, through extra cover, but the timing was so good it just kept going till it reached the boundary
skips down the track again but the bowler sees him and denies him the room, and Kohli ends up punching it to extra cover from close to his body
big stride out and he shows the full face of the bat to drive it straight past the bowler
down the track and his timing has been surreal all through. Picks it up and carts him over long-on without even a big flourish of the bat
fuller on the stumps, uses his wrists to whip this past the bowler.
whips a fuller delivery on leg stump out to deep square leg

dropped at deep midwicket! Guptill is the man, another excellent fielder, but he hasn't picked up that he needs to run in, that Kohli has mistimed his swipe. By the time he compensates, putting in the big dive, he can't get under the ball
back of a length and outside off, smacks it to mid-off
sails over midwicket. Stands still in the crease, somehow gets on top of short ball and whips it away over the boundary. Sensational
low full toss outside off, Kohli drives to extra cover. A few yards either side and it could have been another boundary

he's come out with the express purpose of treating his hometown! Steps out of his crease and even though it is a delivery meant to cramp the swing of his arms, he is able to send the ball soaring over long-on
back of a length, heaves it out to deep midwicket
falls between mid-off and deep cover! Williamson chases after it to his left, eyes up, but might he have done better to leave it to Bruce coming up from the boundary
a slower ball, outside off, which is perfect with Kohli running at him, making room down leg. Somehow the batsman is able to reach across and slap it down to long-off
walks down the pitch and looks to flick a shortish delivery over midwicket but makes no contact
rises with the attempted bouncer outside off and defuses it down to third man
another crisp shot through the covers, this time a back foot punch by Kohli. But it's more square than the one hit by Iyer earlier so the fielder doesn't have to move too much
short ball on the stumps, he moves into the line and pulls it to deep square leg
slides into the pads on a length...and Kohli merely touches this with a glance. Gets it a few yards wide of short fine and it races away
hits the boundary on the full! Kohli makes amends and how. Full outside off, and it's another exquisite drive over the infield. The TV umpire is now deciding whether it's a four or a six
length ball, on middle, and he's deceived by the slower ball. Tried to ride the bounce and defend but couldn't get any connection
slotted, that's a gorgeous shot! Length outside off from Plunkett and Kohli steps out to spank a lofted drive for four more
launched over the off side, not the cleanest of strikes but it skips away. Roy gives chase from point but can't quite pull it in
wide of the stumps, possibly a slower ball, Kohli comes across and dabs it through gully. Yep, that one was out of the back of the hand
back of a length on the stumps, Kohli nudges one more off his body
leg stump, following Kohli as he tries to make room, ends up coming down and tucking one through midwicket
dupes him with the cutter this time, taking the pace off and it slides past the inside edge as Kohli looks to work to leg
slightly straight, Kohl brings the bottom hand into play and slogs over mid-on, not as pretty but much more effective, bounces away for another boundary
fired down the leg side, this one will be wide
length in the channel, beats the bat again, Kohli chasing the expansive shot on the up and fails to connect
wide ball, maybe cross-seam and Kohli swings away from his body, fails to connect. England enquired but umpire Nitin Menon not interested in the edge or calling wide
fullish outside off, drilled to point coming forwards... and Jordan had overstepped. Oh dear
good length outside off, goes for the booming drive - and misses
length on the stumps, Kohli shuffles across and tucks this away behind square on the leg side one

angled across, back of a length, plenty of pace (146kph) on the ball - and cracked through backward point for four! Slightly aerial, maybe off the toe of the bat, Kohli squints at his blade and frowns, but he is up and running
shortish, hits the thigh pad as Kohli pushes to leg, Mills touching 144kph/89mph
over the wicket, back of a length, 145kph/90mph and rising to judder the bat as Kohli hangs in the crease and blocks

a full toss, driven hard past the bowler, who skips out of the way, Mahmudullah dives to his right from long off to save the boundary, the man at long on backs up his team-mate but the direct hit at the bowler's end concedes an overthrow
nearly in the blockhole, Kohli stays balanced in his crease and drives to long on, he hit it with the bottom of the bat
mis-times the ball through midwicket this time for a single
a full toss and there's no risk involved here, Kohli stays balanced in his crease and thumps the loose ball to the wide long on boundary
looks to run this past short third man but can't, good effort there
Kohli slogs across the line, hitting the ball in the air towards deep midwicket, Al-Amin runs to his left and dives but the ball falls just short of him and bounces over the rope
driven all along the ground to deep point
steps out and pushes the ball into the off side for a single
a huge appeal for lbw! Kohli tried to play the reverse sweep but it did not come off. If he did not get bat on it, it looked close. the umpire seemed to say bat
beats the bat this time, shorter and flying through as Kohli swipes at it
fullish, maybe a cutter, tapped into the off side and they take one
steps away to leg, Plunkett follows him, closes the face for one more through square
pitched up, shuffles into line on off stump, flicked through square leg to the boundary rider

ooh. Back of a length, a little wider outside off. Kohli looks to dab that into the point region, and the ball doesn't quite come on. Ends up inside-edging into the leg side, and they hurry through for a quick single
back of a length again, this time the angle takes the ball down the leg side

the change of pace has done the trick. This is slower and just a fraction wider, Kohli steps out to go over the top but had to reach out for it, and simply ended up dragging it to long-on. Big, big wicket. Stunned silence.
back-of-the-hand slower delivery outside off, Kohli looks to play a flat-batted pull but can only toe-end it wide of the bowler towards mid-on
flays that over cover, didn't time it well but still managed to hit it over the infield, Root does well to hare across and pull it back in
he's on his way, and how. This is a poor ball. Short and sliding into middle and leg, clipped away behind square. No chance for fine leg. Too easy for him

stunning shot. Off the back foot and it sails over the ropes. Mid-off was just a mere spectator. Back of length delivery on off, Kohli stays inside the crease and punches this through the line. Those fore arms can fetch a million or more at an auction!
gets this back of length delivery to lift off the deck on off stump, punched to mid-off
whipped wide of midwicket for an easy single, brings those powerful wrists into play

big appeal for lbw. Kohli looks to play a short-arm jab but the ball kept low and hit him on the pad. The keeper didn't look all that convinced. Really, really tight. I tell you what, Kohli is lucky to hang around That would have crashed into middle stump
steps out and slightly towards leg and drives smoothly towards long off
steps out and slaps the length ball straight to mid-on

the top edge flies wide of the keeper. Third man was fine and running towards the ball. It was dying on Billings. Excellent effort but it just eluded him. Just bounced before hitting the advertising triangle too. The key there was Kohli was beaten for pace.
not much room this time. This is another short of length delivery coming back in from wide of the crease, tapped to the man coming in from point
starts off with a back of length delivery outside off, punched to extra cover
whipped between midwicket and mid-on this time. Tidy start from Dawson
tossed up outside off, driven firmly to sweeper cover. Kohli and India off the mark

Kohli attacks, whips the wrists... and picks out midwicket! The crowd noise drops as the captain heads off, golden-arm Moeen does the trick. That was struck very firmly but Morgan was alert and plucked the catch nonchalantly
full on the stumps, worked across the line to deeps square leg - India ticking along
fuller length, 143kph/88mph in the channel, comes forward to stroke one through cover point
pitched up around off stump, pushed back down the ground
good length outside off, Kohli happy to angle the bat and run one behind square
length ball, angled in at 140kph/87mph and clipped off the pads to deep square leg
slower ball from Jordan, Kohli waits for it on middle and leg, flicks around the corner for another single - decent over for England
shows the full face of the bat to ease it back past the bowler, to mid-on, for a quick single
falls in no man's land! Pollard from long on can't get to it. Slower ball again, and Kohli tried to muscle it. Flew off his edge, but couldn't find the fielder
good length on off and middle, played back to the bowler
played to midwicket and they take on the fielder for a risky single! No direct hit at the bowler's end but Kohli would have made it anyway, phew he is fast!
full, on off, and flicked off his toes to deep midwicket for a single
another ball driven past cover to the sweeper-fielder on the off side
that's been driven flat and hard, and just high enough to clear the leaping fielder at mid-off, Kohli made room by moving outside leg and drove the full ball fluently, Hider has his face in his hands
moves back and across to a short of a length ball and tucks it behind square leg for a single
hammered! Length ball outside off, and he slices a cut late to beat both fielders on the off side
full outside off, and he skips down the ground. Drives to deep extra cover
length ball, on middle, and nudged off his pads to the leg side
full, on middle, and he whips this off his pads to deep midwicket
length ball, outside off, and he walks down the ground before mistimes a shot down to long off
defended to the off side with soft hands for a single
angling into his body, and Kohli backs away before mis-hitting to long on
length ball, wide outside off, and Kohli drops his knees before punching to mid-off
that was played so late! Length ball on middle, and Kohli makes room before guiding it past short third man for a couple
length ball, wide outside off, and he hits this leg-side flat-batted shot straight to the infielder
length ball outside off, and turning inwards. Looks to cut, but mistimes to cover point
shottttttt! Even the WI fans are admiring this. Full, just outside off, and he leans forward to crunch a supreme drive through the off side
length ball, on off, and flicked to the leg side for a single
full, just outside off, and the cover drive takes an inside-edge to the leg side
length ball, just outside off, and flat-batted down the ground to long
leading edge over the non-striker! Tries to nudge it towards the leg side, but it takes the edge of the bat. If only there was a short mid-on....
fullish, on off, and he walks across the stumps before flicking it off his pads to deep midwicket. Fifty stand
length ball outside off, and he drags this to wide long on. Protection there
length ball, on middle. He opens the bat's face and drives to extra cover
fullish, on middle, and he opens the bat's face. Drives to backward point, and they manage to pinch a single
full outside off, and driven away from his body to cover
full and wide outside off, and driven away from his body to extra cover
tossed up, full toss outside off, driven forcefully through extra cover but without timing
back of a length outside off, he stays on the back foot and punches pleasingly through cover. Crisp shot
driven hard to short cover where Mahmudullah makes a great stop
pushed off the front foot, the ball grips the wicket and goes off the outside edge behind point
steps out, gets underneath the flight and goes straight, clears the ropes effortlessly.
tucked off the pads behind square to bring up the 50 stand off 32 balls
Kohli seems to have a mental map of this field, he glances the length ball off his pads, placing it in front of the fielder running to his left from fine leg and diving in vain, the timing is perfect
the bounce gets a bit big outside off and Kohli swats it awkwardly towards third man
eased down to long-on
driven to long off for a single
terrific placement! Kohli rocks back to one that isn't too short and pulls the ball into the gap between deep midwicket and long on
driven to mid off where the fielder is deep in the circle, Kohli sets off right-away and beats the direct hit, the batsman was past the stumps when the ball hit them
shortish delivery drifting in, tucked into the leg side
works this full delivery into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
jumps back to a good length ball and opens the face so late to run the ball swiftly to third man
steps out and punches this to cover
whipped to wide long-on
dug in short, pulled to deep midwicket
steps out and uses his bottom-handed power to whip this over midwicket. Bullet hit that beats wide long-on
dabs to short third man for a quick single
eased to long-on
persists with the short ball strategy, and it's paying dividends too. Kohli unable to get a hold of that trademark forearm-power pull, mistimes to deep square leg
and back to the short ball, Kohli connects well with the pull, pleasing sound off the bat. Didn't try to hit too hard though and there is protection at deep midwicket
expansive extra cover drive, but Cottrell had taken the pace off a bit so Kohli had to manufacture his own. The placement was good though, so they pick up two. Quick running

it's time for the Cottrell salute. Perfectly executed yorker on middle stump, Kohli wanted to whip that through the on side, but the ball snakes under and sends the stump cartwheeling. And Cottrell's doing his thing of course
back of a length and on the fourth stump channel, punched to cover
back of a length again, but on leg stump this time, Kohli shuffles across and tucks it to fine leg off his lower ribcage
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot to the bowler's left
shortish delivery on off stump and clips it to deep square leg
flatter on leg stumps, he goes back and whips it to square leg. Bavuma sprints from deep midwicket and tumbles to save the ball from going into the fence
he plays an across the line swipe to deep midwicket!
short and wide outside off, Kohli waits in his crease and unleashes a fierce square cut, the ball rockets to the backward point boundary
tossed up on off and middle and driven down the ground to long-off
Vettori's getting caned here! Tossed up on the off stump and he chips down the track and lofts flat over wide long-off
gives it too much air and it's a full toss drilled down the ground to long-on
Southee times his dive well! Looked like the slower one from Franklin, Kohli made room and tried to loft it over long-off, it was flat and Southee ran forward and took it well on the dive
leading edge to point, Hafeez tosses it up slowly, Kohli pushes late from the crease
goes back to punch a quick offbreak past the non-striker
wants to punch off the back foot through the off side, finds midwicket instead
full delivery clipped through midwicket
worked backward of square leg
another boundary, Virat this time, lunges forward, picks it from off, and slog-sweeps it between deep midwicket and deep square leg
down the track, not to the pitch, but drives neatly down to long on
whoa, he tries a wild slog to one going across him, is beaten by the carry, from a good length, he is a changed bowler, Irfan, from the one that debuted two years ago
still more bounce, this time Virat tries the cut, but he is not getting on top of the lift
appeal for caught behind, and he is given, Kohli falls to his third successive wild swing, given for an underedge through to the keeper off the short of a length ball
Kohli moves forward and pushes away from his body at a good length ball that angles into him, he gets an inside edge on to his back leg
played off the back foot towards square
punched off the back foot, and once Ahmed Shehzad fails to make a clean stop running forward from midwicket, the batsmen run the single
Kohli punches the length ball through cover, 137 kph that was, the batsmen try and put pressure on the fielder running in from the deep but can't take a second
136 kph, Kohli flicks the ball off his pads towards deep midwicket
Kohli stays back to a 137 kph ball on a good length and defends on the off side
a fuller ball with width outside off, driven along the ground to the fielder on the cover boundary

shot! Kohli stayed in his crease, watched the full ball all the way on to the middle of his bat and played a superb straight drive. Not much flourish but he didn't need it. A minimalistic punch past mid-off.
the legbreak just outside off stump, Kohli goes back and defends to the bowler
a fuller ball outside off, Kohli drives off the front foot through cover, Umar Akmal covers lots of ground in little time in the deep and keeps the batsmen to a single
pulled off the back foot through midwicket
just a bit too short and Kohli is on to the back foot in a flash, pulling the ball flat over the in-field for a one-bounce four to the cow corner boundary
worked off the pads through midwicket
Kohli steps out of his crease and drives the ball through wide mid-on
opens the face of the bat and dabs it down to third man
Kohli really takes to Milne here, comes down the track to a fuller delivery, makes a bit of room and drives him in the air and wide of mid-off's dive
good length outside off and he opens the face and steers it to third man
swings and mistimes it to the leg side, quite a few fielders converging to the ball
bowls it straighter and he gets behind the line and defends
a bit too straight on the pads and he works it with his wrists down to deep square leg
Milne starts off poorly, too wide and short outside off, reaches out and bludgeons it wide of cover
tucks it off the body to the leg side and takes the single, Kohli thinks of the second
once again Kohli uses the extra pace of Milne, too full on the stumps and forced down the ground, Oram dives in vain at mid-on
fullish delivery outside off and he steers it wide of point
comes down the track and he adjusts and flicks it behind square on the leg side
Kohli decides to use his feet, comes down the track and lofts crisply down the ground and through the line, clears mid-off
neatly tucked away down to midwicket for a single
slower ball and he pushes it softly down the pitch
tucks it away wide of short fine leg for a single
nice timing there from Kohli, comes well forward to the pitch of the ball and pushes it just wide of mid-off who dives and can't stop it
he's in imperious touch! Tossed up outside off and he waited at the crease for it to turn and cut it away wide of point
comes forward and defends
Kohli skips out and makes room to loft the full ball straight back over the bowler's head
manages to bisect a narrow gap between point and short third man, played it late and cut it past them, the fielder does well to run after it and pull it back
comes forward and punches it back to the bowler
short outside off and he reaches out and punches it wide of backward point, timing again
gets across and clips it softly towards midwicket
streaky! It was short and Kohli was aiming to hook that, took the top edge and cleared a leaping McCullum
comes down the track and adjusts by pushing it softly towards cover
chips down the track and works it to mid-off
down the track and he pushes a full delivery to long-off
makes a bit of room and he pushes a full delivery down to long-off
goes back at the crease and he rocks back and cuts to sweeper cover
comes down the track and pushes a full delivery to long-off

gets to his fifty with a four! Kohli chips down the track and lofts him inside out with the turn, in the air but Williamson did not time his run and dive well from deep extra cover, bounced in front of him and rolled to the rope
punches it down to long-off
flatter delivery and he comes down the track and gets an inside edge to the on side, its the 50 stand
down the track and works it to long-on
tucked to the leg side but straight to short fine leg
sweetly timed punch off the front foot square on the off side, third man does well to run across and cut it off
nudged towards point for a single
short ball and Kohli once again mis-timed the cut, the ball was a bit quicker so it hurried on to him
he slows the pace down this time and the batsman can only push it to cover
he is finding his timing now! He is so quick on his feet, comes down the pitch and hammers it flat down the ground for a six.. no chance for any fielder there
flexes his arms and drives it powerfully to deep cover for a single
stays in the crease and defends this to midwicket
this is beautifully timed! After all those deliveries he finds this one fly off the middle of the bat. He comes down the pitch and creams this over extra cover
comes down the pitch and chips it over the non-striker's head, still poor timing from Kohli and long on comes around and cuts it off
the batsman pushes this flatter delivery straight to midwicket
smartly bowled from Herath! He fires it in as he sees the batsman move down the pitch, Kohli can only push it back at him
he punches this straight to midwicket again

slower ball, but this one is full enough and now Kohli goes for a big slog! He hasn't got all hit bat behind it but he manages to beat the fielder at deep midwicket. For a moment, he would have been interested, but it clears him in the end
he comes down the pitch and pushes the slower delivery down to long on
bowls an offcutter on the stumps, the batsman turns it to midwicket for a single
fuller and a touch quicker, the batsman has no space to get under it, he punches it to long on
shortish ball on the stumps, Kohli defends that to the leg side
shortish ball outside the off side, slower one I think, Kohli pulls that well in front of square and the leg side sweeper runs around to stop it
